review_body: Alright, so sorry but this one might be pretty long and winded-- but hopefully it's worth it for those of you are looking at where to stay in Waikiki!For starters when we arrived there were some problems with the check in process. This is was not the staffs fault what so ever though! My card was being declined because of the purchase being too great, and there wasn't much I could do because my bank was already closed at this point (I live in SC, it was like Midnight there by the time we arrived for check in). I have major anxiety and after the 15 hour flight day, I was exhausted and an a panic attack was bound to happen at the smallest inconvenience. The staff there was extremely patient with me through my breathing exercises and though I felt like the worst kind of guest to have they never once treated me as such (and I know just how "fun" it is to work with a crying customer lol). Once all of that was done and we were finally checked in the room itself was very nice! It was a pretty standard hotel room. Two Queen beds, mini fridge, bathroom ect. But the VIEW was amazing! From our room we would see both the Diamond Head AND Waikiki Beach! Since our clocks were way off we were awake to see the sunrise almost every single day we were there. It was honestly breathtaking. Every day the beds were made, towels replaced, and some goodies left of us on the counter. The house keepers even went as far as to fold some of the cloths we'd left laying around! A bit unusual, but appreciated none the less as I'd never had a place fold our clothes before!We got breakfast vouchers with our room for each morning. The breakfast buffet was a favorite of ours! Each morning we'd go down and be seated with a fresh cup of coffee ready for us. There was just something really nice about sitting in the fresh air with a nice cup of joe to start the day. The buffet had a wide variety of fruits, soups (Yes, SOUP), rice, fish, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, juice bar, and even an omelet and waffle OR pancake station. Really it had all the works.The Splash Bar was a good place to relax after our days. The drinks they served were *chefs kiss* (this is internet slang for amazing). The Lava Flow was my go to. It was basically just a sugar slushie with some coconut rum in it but dang it was good. They also served food at the Splash Bar too, my favorite of which was the coconut shrimp. I must have had that shrimp at least 4 times while we were staying there. It was so tasty it stopped me from wanting to to other restaurants!Our check out was at 10am but we weren't going to be picked up to leave the island until around 3pm. The front desk let us check our bags for free so we didn't have to carry them around. Since we didn't have our bags we were able to roam the shopping centers and beach for a while longer before saying goodbye. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the island for the first time.

We have just spent 6 nights here in a standard room. We were offered to change to balcony room when we arrived but as it cost a lot more we decided to stay as is. Glad that we did. Our room was a reasonable size overlooking car parking but nice and quiet. Bed very comfortable with good linens and soft pillows. Looks to have been updated in last few years. All neat and tidy. Did not look worn at all. Great location. 5 minutes walk to Cheesecake Factory. Beach 2 minutes walk. Parking not cheap $35Usd per night. Be aware that there is an extra amenities charge even if you don’t use them.$33USD per room per day.

We love this Sheraton,while not maybe the most glamorous it has a ton of charm. The original part of the building was built in 1955 and it as charming now as it ever was, we love the open area at the check in and nice old-school funky pool area ,great service from the splash bar All ways nice Hawaiian music playing throughout the public spacesService from everyone was goodHigher floors for great views are very niceThe location is perfect for being in the midst of WaikikiThe Moana Surfrider across the street is handy dandyLots of shops and restaurants within minutes walkVery convenient and good valueComfortable beds and robesRooms on the smaller sideLook forward to another stay soon

The Sheraton PK is a good value for money hotel option in central Waikiki. Not on the beach, but easy stroll across the street to Waikiki Beach, Kuhio Beach (the same stretch of beach) or Fort Derussy Beach Park (personal favorite). It's not flashy, it's pretty standard Sheraton, but that's all you really need. It's comfortable, clean, very Hawaiian in decor of the open-air reception and public areas, friendly reception staff. Bathrooms are on the smaller side, but do the job. They have proper dresser drawers, which I like, as it's a pet peeve when some of the modern properties don't have enough proper storage space. Pool is nothing special, but I don't hang at the pool when in Waikiki (unless it's the amazing infinity pool at the Sheraton Waikiki!). Room types on the website are pretty clear about which room types have the best views. If in the Tower Ocean King (as I'm in now), request an odd number room, as you can just lazily lay in bed and watch the ocean...it is vacation, after all. That said, I've stayed many times at this property, and even a partial ocean is good.For a hotel not specifically on the beach, and having stayed at so many Waikiki properties over the years, I definitely have no issue recommending the property.

I spent the last week of January at the "PK" as it is commonly known. It was my 5th or 6th stay there and it was excellent as always. Perhaps due to my Marriott Bonvoy silver elite status, even though silver is not a high tier, I was upgraded to a "Premier Oceanview King" room in the Ainahau Tower, which had been renovated and had a great lanai with an absolutely stunning view of the ocean. You could sit on the lanai and watch surfers, catamarans and outrigger canoes all day. I find the service at the Princess Kailuani is always exemplary. From the General Manager to the front desk to the room attendants and breakfast buffet staff, they are all hospitality professionals, many of who have worked there for decades, and they provide a friendly and welcoming environment and courteous service. The hotel has a lot of history and has a nice Hawaiian vibe. I know some reviews are not great because of the age of the hotel, and I think the hotel acknowledges that it can be a challenge to keep everything up to standards when they are anticipating closing the hotel in a couple of years for a full makeover.... but they certainly try. Other notes: -The gym is decent and well used and has a nice outlook over the pool.-You get 15% off food bills with Bonvoy membership (any level)Overall, Hawaii hotels are expensive and I find this one to be great value. It's right in the heart of Waikiki and although it's not on the beach, on average you save at least $100US per night compared to even the least expensive beachfront hotel. And the pool desk will lend you beach chairs as well as towels for when you head across to the beach, and they bring bottled water to a designated spot on the beach three times a day. I would recommend the place for sure.

I loved my stay at this property. So close to everything. There is an ABC store across the road. You can also take a shortcut to the Main Street where all the shops are. Walking distance to most things including the beach, which is very close. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had great ocean views from our balcony. We were also lucky to have never ending happy hour at the ‘Splash Bar’ which is part of this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel.

We stayed 8 nights at SPK and you cannot fault the location, it is central to shopping, the beach, restaurants and transport options. We were on the 15th Floor with a balcony and ocean view. The rooms are a little tired looking but for the amount of time we spent in the room, it was fine. Because we stayed 8 nights, a complimentary plate of fruit, snacks and drinks was in our room. There was no note it was complimentary but we confirmed it was complimentary when we asked staff. We also had to ask staff for the daily activities available, there was no info on this in the room. We are used to staying in a hotel room that supplies body wash (only had soap), ceramic cups (only had takeaway paper cups), spoons (only had plastic straw stirrers), wine glasses and bottle opener. These little extras make life easier when staying in a hotel. The staff were polite and helpful. I feel communication could be improved either when checking in or in the room to explain the activities/amenities available (no info in room), as well as how the resort charge is applied to your credit card (new charge every day for a different amount). This would have meant us spending less time checking with staff. Overall we enjoyed our stay at SPK.

I've stayed at this hotel multiple times. It's in a GREAT location and everyone is very friendly. The rooms and property are well maintained. The food and drinks at the Splash Bar are really good and I enjoy the evening entertainment.

Whilst we were happy with our stay, location and room, the breakfast room is unhealthy. Pigeons constantly flying in, sitting on tables , chairs and serving areas. These disease carrying birds often ate food from plates, while quests were attempting to eat their food. We witnessed some quests walking out without finishing their meal and others who were visibly frightened.

Spent 9 Nights Very Good Rooms Excellent Service Great Location The Splash Bar Had Not Only Good Food But Also Very Good Drink Prices And The Wait Staff Were Absolutely Fantastic The Gym Was Also Very Well Appointed Highly Recommend

End of an 8 night stay I could honestly say was glad to be going home.The Good...They provide a wi-fi device that you can take anywhere and the calls made from your room phone are free. They also paid attention to my constant complaint about the noise next door and upgraded us to the tower which was beautiful.The Bad.. The walls are paper thin and any conversations in the room can be heard including when someone zips their bag. The breakfast buffet not worth paying for unless included in the package ours was but we ate out the last 3 days of our stay, too many birds flying and flapping around and landing on table plates etc, also their egg station doesn't do poached eggs you need to ask and took 1/2 hour to be brought to table. If you love coffee forget it we had to go and buy our coffee to bring to the breakfast hence our decision in the end to skip it. Guys buy a decent coffee machine and offer your guests good quality coffee not the drip filter crap.The concierge was also unhelpful we went and booked activities externally.The Ugly ...After 3 days at the hotel we complained to housekeeping about the foyer on level 4 being dirty only then did they clean the mess see pic.Noise Noise Noise....Get some proper sound proofing cheaply built/renovated hotel

This hotel is centrally located near the International Marketplace, Waikiki Beach and lots of eating places.Its an older hotel that seems to always have a line in the elevators.We stayed in the tower and was given a room that has a partial ocean view and the Royal Hawaiian Hotel. It was beautiful to look at everyday.We forgot something in the room when we checked out and was happily helped to get our stuff.Overall nice stay.

We stayed for a week that begun with a very late arrival, due to flight delaysThus the room type that we had asked for was not available. We were given a lousy room for first night, but moved over to decent room next day. We thank the Manager and staff for making the rest of our stay comfortable. They offer a device for free WIFI and Gopro rental discount, but these things were again not explained (or understood) due to our Late arrival. Also we have to carry our chairs to beach that is 6 min walk across street. Ask me questions and I will provide info

Thank you Sheraton Princess, we had the most amazing time at your hotel. Every single staff memeber we encountered went out of their way to accomodate and provided high level customer service. They were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were lovely and very comfortable. The Splash Bar was a favourite. From the food to the cocktails it was a favourite haunt. We cannot wait to come back!

After reading the reviews here, I had my expectation level at knowing you get what you pay for. My expectations were exceeded and I really enjoyed my stay here. Parking was easy. The pool area is relaxed and beautiful. I appreciated having waitstaff at the pool. There are chairs and towels available for the beach. Staff also come a few times a day to the beach with bottled waters and fruit. The breakfast buffet food was great and also had a nice ambiance along with the Splash Bar. Both are fairly priced for Waikiki. I would definitely return. This was in a prime location just across the street from the beach but was much more affordable than the beachfront hotels. It was a great value with location and some typical resort amenities, but a little easier on the budget.

Just a short stay here overnight on the way to our cruise. Great reception. rooms very well appointed. The only problem we had was, our room overlooked the outdoor evening entertainment. a little noisy after two flights lasting 23 hours.

Friendly staff especially restaurant , excellent location, clean but small room, bathroom is very small but did the job. lovely resort, can't complain got at a good rate . Enjoyed the stay. Probably just think the resort fees was over priced.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is an older building, but nice, clean, and its location is superb. Right across from the beach and you can check out lounge chairs and towels at the hotel to take to the beach. Also, every two-hours, hotel staff bring cold water and fresh fruit to guests on the beach.The staff at the registration desk and the restaurant/bar were very helpful and friendly. We bought a package throught Costco which included flight and hotel. We weren't disappointed.

We would sincerely like to thank the Guest Service Manager Isaac and his super friendly and helpful hotel staff. Their aim was to make us feel as comfortable as possible. We felt genuinely welcomed, and all in all, the service, amenities and accomodation facilities were second to none. Wow! Thank you heaps Isaac and your crew.

I am currently staying at the princess kaiulani, and I am so disappointed! We are a family of 6, we have 2 rooms with 2 double beds each room. The beds are so small that our feet stick out of the bed and not comfortable to sleep in. None of us have had a decent night sleep since we got here. From day 1, we got here at 9.30 asked for early check in and got told to go sleep on a banana chair by the pool, till the rooms were ready. I asked if they could please contact me when our rooms are ready as my children were asleep on the banana chairs. We hadn't slept for over 30 hrs as we had an evening flight from australia and had been awake since the day before. They said they could not guarentee it would be ready before 3.00. However I kept going back to fromt desk and at 1.45 1 room was ready. The other not until just after 3. Since then we get woken up most mornings cause housekeeping want to clean our rooms. Why not clean the rooms that want early check in, I don't understand? The toilet has been blocked, they took the shower screen and didn't return it, we had to ask for it back. We have plastic glasses in our bathroom no soaps ect on arrival,the coffee cups are paper cups, what happened to glass? I plugged in the hotel hairdryer and smoke was coming out it's so old, it went red but there was no air coming out. I had to take it outside. What happen to 3.5 star and customer service. I did go down to concierge and ask for queen beds, apparently this hotel only have double or king. $80 extra per room per night for a rollaway. After paying a fortune to stay here and resort fees, I am questioning for what? I don't see anything special about the "resort" Nothing is included for the bonvoy marriott members, no breakfast, only a discounted price which is still $23.00 from $28.us dollar $35 Aud, due to the current exchange. I did ask what is the point of being a member when i joined in Fiji 3 years ago and they said breakfast included for adults children 12 yrs under pay child prices. I stayed at the Fiji resort and they were amazing. I have stayed at the sheraton on the park in Sydney a gift to my husband, from friends for his 50th birthday. They were both fantastic service and inclusions, here in waikiki however, I'm finding that their member get no benifits. I would have booked else where had i read the reviews. They take advantage of being under the sheraton umbrella, but they don't seem to have the quality the sheraton is known for. We are here till Tuesday morning, the rest of our trip has been amazing, very expensive for food and activities, but a beautiful place. Friendly people everywhere.

We spent 2 nights here, one of which was Halloween, before we boarded NCL/POA cruise from Honolulu port. We were located in the Tower. The room view, the cleanliness and comfort were all very good. I'd rate this hotel average, as I think most, if not all of them, are woefully overpriced. This stay was part of an airfare/hotel package our agent booked through Apple. The location of this hotel was very good - we were able to see the Halloween revelers within a short walking distance from hotel, on Kalakaua Ave. The location is also very good for walking to take in the various sights. The historic Moana Hotel, built in the 19th Century, was nearby and we had a view of this spectacular Hotel from our balcony.The outside pool area had a bar and cafe service area that was very nice. One complaint I had was that we spent a long time waiting to get on elevators at certain times. Even though I rate this as average, I don't really have negative things to say about our specific room or the hotel itself. Again, I think the tourist hotels are NOT value priced. Also, I thought a continental breakfast would have been a nice addition.

stayed at the Sheraton princess for new years. we had a room in the princess tower room was clean and looks like it had been just remodeled. The room was small but then again we weren't in Hawaii to spend all our time in the room, so it worked okay for us. The hotel has a pool, bar and a restaurant. we ate at the bar and had a few drinks,was pretty standard bar food. There is also a restaurant on site but only saw it open for a breakfast buffet Staff was friendly and willing to help.

Read some negative reviews prior to choosing this Hotel but since this property is listed as part of Marriott Bonvoy Hotels I thought it can’t be that bad! Well at check in I presented my Marriott Bonvoy credit card. I asked the front desk how late can we check out for a later flight although my previous experience with Marriott Hotels allows 2:00 pm late checkout for elite members. She asked me if I have a SPG acct number for late checkout. I had to look for my SPG acct number from my old emails just to checkout at 1:00 pm instead of 11:00 am. Walked up in the room, as soon as we opened the door, the strong smell of paint hit us, the carpet is so filthy from the hallway to the room. I called the front desk and told her we can’t stay in this room to transfer us to another room. The front desk sent a new room key to transfer to another floor, same old bldg. The smell of new paint is not as strong but the dirty worn out carpet is staring at me. There’s just no way I can stay here for nights, Motel 6 is probably in better condition.Finally I went back to the front desk and told her I am willing to pay for an upgrade if another room in a different wing is available. This employee actually said she’ll upgrade the room at no charge, not the same employee who checked us in. The room we transferred to is on a different wing/building with a balcony too! She also called to apologize after she realized the room she transferred us to has 3 twin beds but my husband is too tired and said it’s okay we’ll just sleep on separate beds for 4 nights!I don’t see how Marriott’s rating for this hotel is category 6, not even category 3 in my opinion! Do not waste your Bonvoy points or your money, choose another Bonvoy Hotel if you don’t want to ruin your vacation.

Pros: Fantastic location, walkable to many dining choices, the beach (Waikiki) and shopping, souvineers. Wifi worked good, Beach view, high floor room and comfortable sleep.Cons: outdated old hotel. Disgusting $33/night resort fee, confusing numbering of the parking system Garage (and $35/night for parking .. wow). Definitely not a category 5 hotel as per the bonvoy ratings (more like a Cat 3 hotel in any other city). Food/breakfast buffet: as Platinum elite members we enjoyed a free breakfast each of our two mornings there but as a vegan famliy (wife, son and I) we had no hot breakfast items (which typically are hot bacon, hot sausage and ommeltte station) unfortunately so if you're vegan, you may want to choose a different option than the breakfast buffet unless you'er in the mood to eat bread and fruit (only).There is no lounge or other special feature for Platinum elite guests btw.The pool looked a bit small but cozy and up front by the dining. I think it's only open daylight hours (closed at dinner time?)Anyways; I don't think we'll be back to his hotel next year when we return to Hawaii for more exploring. Thanks anyways.Final note on staff/service: excellent, friendly and professional.

We keep coming back here for two reasons... location and affordability. If you’re looking for brand new, luxury, posh rooms...this is not for you. They have redone areas like rooms, elevators... but it is an older hotel. Pros - right across street from Waikiki beach, chair rental with fruit/water delivery to beach, pool that’s never too busy and great staff. It’s in the middle of the “strip” so it’s great for shopping, eating beach-going. Cons - in room safe is huge but not bolted down. They say it’s being torn down for years now but I hope not.

Grungy , and dated property, 1995 was the last times rooms were updated. Imagine the scent of 25 year old carpet, this is the aroma here. Boyfriend and I were in Hawaii for a total of 2 weeks, but decided we were going to adventure around different parts of the island and not stay in one place so we had tried out a handful of resorts each for a few nights. These included: Hyatt Regency Waikiki, Ritz Carlton Residences Waikiki, Marriott Ko’Olina, Turtle Bay North Shore, some were certainly better value / service then others, all of these properties were within range of what I had initially imagined/expected. After searching availability in Waikiki across the Marriott website, for the next 2 nights and finding that most standard rooms in any of the beach front hotels (westin Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton Waikiki) were a 1 queen bed 274 sf ft room facing the back of the building.I am Marriott Platinum, but in the event an upgrade at checkin wasn’t offered to us we really did not wish to be stuck in any of those rooms. Instead we opt to book a slightly larger King room with a balcony in what stated was the newer tower at the Sheraton Princess Kaulani (Marriott category 6). Sheraton is a trusted brand under the Marriott chain that sets high standards for properties representing their brand and holding their name. Marriott category 6 properties for example are the W Hollywood or Lexington NYC to give you an idea for comparison as to what I was expecting this hotel to be like. Booked a KING bed for a 2 night stay as we were in Hawaii on a romantic getaway not teenage backpackers trying to squeeze into the same room and each sleep on our own Twin bed. As a Platinum Elite member , I go to elite checkin desk and she’s claiming she can’t find my reservation , so she’ll go ahead and make a new one. I pulled up the confirmation for her on My phone and she said oh sometimes our systems take awhile (I had booked this Atleast 1.5h prior). Oh well , I let her do her thing and all of w sudden I get a notification on my phone that a new reso has been added which is when I open up the app and realize I now have 2 reservations for the same nights. She says no worries I’m gonna delete one of them and then let’s me know she has us in a 2 twin bed room instead of the king I had actually Booked and on top of that no platinum upgrade to a suite. At this point had the presidential suite been available they should’ve rather put us in that VS this front desk agent sneaking around trying to rebook my reservation into a different bed number because they messed up. While all of this was happening another associate was laying out room keys in envelopes with names on them at least 20 ready to hand out , as a ANA flight had just landed on which they had a handful of guests who were gonna be arriving right away. So hold on, there’s guests that are not even present that you are holding rooms for ? And I am a platinum member , booked an upgraded room and am here present right not But you’re not gonna give me the guaranteed bed options / upgrade I’m entitled to? Tired and realizing it wasn’t going anywhere I just took the 2 twins and we proceeded to go up to our room thinking we were would just push them together or something. My boyfriend laid down on his bed for a total of 5 minutes prior to telling me we were leaving because this place was just not what we expected or had agreed to pay for. So he takes our bags back to the car and tells me he doesn’t even care if we don’t get refunded he’s not staying it’s that bad lol so I go back to the front desk politely let her know we won’t be staying as the 2 twin bed option simply won’t work for us. Instead of apologizing or looking in the system and trying to sort out something or even looking the least bit like she cared would’ve been better then her shoulder shrug and cheerful ok no problem I’ll uncheck you in and not charge, bye now LOL. WTFAs per Marriott’s guaranteed reservation program Platinum members that can’t be accommodated are entitled to a $200usd compensation AND 90000 points and the hotel is supposed to pay for your accommodations that night at a nearby property. She didn’t offer any of that and we were left to search for places ourselves drove around for an hour prior to finally finding the Laylow autograph collection, another Marriott. As soon as we arrived the agent was so cheerful and pleasant and just genuinely thankful for our business and welcoming. Such nice staff at Laylow , all marriotts actually. This whole Sheraton behaviour really shocked me. Which is why I do not believe this property deserves to be a Sheraton or be a part of Marriott’s chain. I hope someone from head office sees this and can address the issues with them personally / send in a site audit.

The hotel was really comfortable and relaxing.Was in close proximity to everything and the staff were really friendly.We stayed there for a week and ate there occasionally - the meals were good portions and everything was fresh and delicious.couldn’t complain about anything.

Visited Hawaii to celebrate my mother’s 60th birthday/ early retirement. Check in was fast and easy. They provide you with a handheld wifi device that basically gives you access to free wifi all over the downtown strip. Check in staff had arranged to surprise my mother with sweets and a bottle of champagne the day of her birthday. Parking was $25 US a day, which you paid at the end once you’ve checked out of the hotel. Beautifully located on the Waikiki strip. Everything was within walking distance (beach, malls, restaurants). It was very busy with lots of tourists during the day and was safe to walk alone at night. Room- we stayed in a city view double room. The furniture seemed a little dated but the room itself was very clean. Bathroom was simple, a little small but clean. The balcony over looked the strip with a partial view of the ocean. Pool was a little small and would be quite busy with lots of families/little kids, very limited seating/lounge chairs were available. The pool closed a little earlier than I had hoped for, around 6pm. There’s a cocktail bar/restaurant by the pool. They had drink specials for the day and would provide seaweed dusted popcorn with each drink purchase. Overall the hotel itself was nothing special. But I would definitely recommend and come back and visit again solely based on the hotel’s location.

We had a great time in Waikiki at the PK. We originally booked a tower view room, upon arrival asked for an upgrade (we are Bonvoy members) and scored a pool/ocean view! Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, we spent most of our time enjoying the warm weather from the balcony!

The hotel is in the perfect place , next to the beach , restaurants , shops and pick up place for activities.The hotel is starting to be little bit dated but still is ok.It would be good to have the poll close later as closing at 7:00 pm

This is the perfect Marriott for Waikiki / Honolulu. DUI assessment few times over if you are a loyalty member they are not afraid to upgrade you. I got upgraded to the top floor. And instead of getting bonus points if you are a loyalty member you can choose to get breakfast which is a $28 Buffet. The good deal. Let's start with the buffet it is a good mix of your normal hot breakfast items as well as some of the local items. They do have an omelet bar. All of this is included in the price or free if you chose to get the breakfast instead of the points. They do have waitresses that will serve you drinks. Is a very nice little restaurant in area 2 that opens up to the pool it is kind of indoor outdoor. The service here is second to none. Whether it's the front desk the cleaning crew or the people in the bars and restaurants they are all very professional but also very friendly. Did you have a nice pull probably one of the nicest ones on the Strip. It has easy access to the main strip in Waikiki. And it's right across the street from the beach. The upper floors have great views of the ocean. They do have on-site parking garage about $35 a day. Not a bad deal for Waikiki. The rims have great Linens and are very modern and up-to-date. They are very spacious and they also have balconies. The upper floors have some great views of downtown Waikiki. They also have high-end toiletries. Egg location of this as perfect as I said it's on the strip and right across from the beach. All of the restaurants you could want to do or shopping you want to do is all within walking distance of the hotel some just feet away. I highly recommend this place and would go back here on future visits.

The lobby and location is perfect - updated and excitement to get to your room builds. That all changed upon exiting the lift to what appears to be a dungeon or a jail. Upon entering the room there was a musky smell. The double beds are more king single and do not fit 2 people. There is an old air-conditioner system right next to one of the beds - with some wooden slates in front of it but you can still see this giant silver foll pipe and the noise this makes through out the night- don't expect to get any sleep at all, I am a deep sleeper and my partner snores it was louder then his snoring. I had to sleep the opposite way on the bed and this still didn't help.The room itself needs to be renovated or torn down it is not suitable for a hotel, I am surprised Sheraton put their name to it. The bathroom is missing handles, rusted and a build up of soap scum. There is cracks in the wall, popcorn ceiling - there is nothing nice to say about the rooms. The carpet is also all stained.Resort fee - yet no hot tub and pool closes at 7pm - so limited time to utilise this.Stay anywhere but here.

I really enjoyed my stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rate for my stay was very reasonable for my 2 night stay (12.5-7.19) at $175/night not including the resort fee of $37/night. I received an amazing room upgrade (note: I have Marriott Bonvoy Elite Gold status) from queen room with no view to Ainahau Tower with 2 queens and (partial?) ocean view! The room itself was comfortable with nice amenities (including robe and slippers and change ports by both night stands). Good location in the heart of Waikiki and super easy to get around towns on The Bus which is just about a block away on Kūhiō. Didn’t rent a car this time but I do like that they have a self-parking lot over valet only (although it’s shared with the Moana Surfrider). I would definitely stay here again in the future.

We have stayed here before so looked forward to returning. Check in was awesome, Ziggy on the front desk was awesome and our room was ready early. Everyone on the service desk were so helpful and accommodating that it was a pleasure to deal with them. I used one card for the deposit but paid on another when we departed and there were no issues. Rooms are big enough in size although the bathrooms are a bit dated, they were well serviced. Lifts were a little hit and miss although any hotel at peak times will have this issue. Dining options were limited so we never ate there but there are plenty of options nearby. Location cannot be beaten in downtown Honolulu although be aware of the sirens you will most nights.We were in a room on level 5 in the partial ocean view room and it was not the hotels fault (blame our travel agent) ut in reality it is the bottme floor in this wing so views are limited

Beautiful hotel , great location, but after I booked a family of 4 in a package for 4 adults, it wasn't until they received the travel documents that a paragraph disclosed that an extra person charge applies to those over 18 years and older occupying a room with two adults. They wanted an additional $581 for the couples 18 & 20 year old to stay in the room with them for 3 nights. Beware. We did not receive this fine print until after booked and didn't realize it pertained to them since we had booked 4 adults in 1 room.

We stayed at this hotel for my 60th bday for a week and got a room with no view at all and no balcony. Requested for an upgrade but could not get it till later the end of our stay. Location wise it’s perfect because you’re close to everything. We only had breakfast once and it was good. We ate outside because there’s a lot of eating joints to choose from. There’s one staff named Maricel who serviced our room that I highly would recommend and gave her a thumbs up. She looked after us so well and made us welcome living away from home. A big credit to her. Get a room with a view and a balcony.

this hotel is located very conveniently cross from the beach...they even give you chairs and towels to carry across the street...they at certain times they come with cold water and fresh fruit....nice amenity...especially since you pay a resort fee...others you pay but don't get anything for it...pool was a bit disappointing....a bit on cool side...breakfast was very nice except for the pigeons that continually wanted to join us...staff tried to keep them away but really difficult ...some people may find it difficult to return to your table after leaving it to get something and see a pigeon helping himself to your toast! staff is very helpful and the two gentlemen who have a table for selling jewelry and another for free leis making, ukulele lessons and bead a very warm and helpful.......added to the niceties of the hotel...upon check in we were given cold water and a leis to wear......water was also present gratis in our room each day...

The lobby is up to date but the rooms are yet to be done. We had a pool view room on the small size, didn't have a table with chairs which we really did miss. Bed comfortable room clean bathroom good size. Pool small but nice for a quick cool down after along day walking round. Good location handy to restaurant, shopping and very short walk to beach. Waikiki trolleys pick up and drop off across the road. Staff friendly and helpful.

This Sheraton in Waikiki has a beautiful lobby and outdoor pool area! The employees are friendly and well trained. The rooms in the hotel need major renovations. Carpets are old, bedding seems old, and the furniture is oversized for such small rooms. The layout of the rooms definitely needs to be revisited and the rooms in the hotel should be gutted from top to bottom! Shanna at the poolside bar is very friendly and an excellent addition to the Sheraton family!

This is the 4th time I've stayed at the Sheraton Princess. THE ONLY reason I come back is the location. It's very handy to everything. Was very close to the Food Pantry which has been demolished since our visit last October. It's across the road from the beach and a close walk to shops, Lewers St, Int'l Market Place etc.News of this hotel being demolished have been circulating since 2012 - it cannot keep functioning the way it is at the moment - the bathrooms are so inadequate in terms of space for toiletries, makeup etc. The hotel is iconic and could be renovated to its former glory days of the 60's - think TWA hotel in New York. I did read, however, that it's Japanese owners will demolish it 'one day' soon.The staff were all lovely - a lot better than last year when we were here during the Industrial Strikes! The Splash Bar staff need to be more proactive and do more walks through pool area - had to get dressed and go to bar to order - and then pay 18% tip for the privilege?!

Night manager ‘Isaac’ made our holiday very special. He looked after our every need from a fantastic upper room with beach views to a special treat (cupcake and nibbles) for my birthday. Very comfortable hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Will Definitely be back. Thanks heaps Isaac, your smile every time we passed reception was infectious. Mary C

Love the location, the hotel, the staff and the openness of the area around the pool, which gives it a resort feel. Was a little disappointed this latest trip ( having stayed here 20 stays) they've moved the evening entertainment indoors week nights and gotten rid of the hula girl completely. My grandchildren have always loved watching them and being invited on stage to try hula. It seems like a penny pinching idea.Put the evening entertainment back on the stage and bring back the hula girls. It should be part of our daily $37-00 resort fee.

We spent a week at this hotel as part of a WestJet vacation package. The staff was very pleasant and the pool area and outside bar/restaurant was also very nice but our accommodation was less than we expected. The room in the shorter of two buildings facing the pool was really old and not renovated in probably 30 years and was far less than I would expected for a Sheraton hotel. the soundproofing was terrible and I was kept up late by people in the next room as you could hear absolutely everything. The carpets in the hall were warn and dirty and the bathroom had no room for toiletries as often old style bathrooms do. The tub was very old and needed to be replaced badly. The furniture was very “well used”. On a positive one the king size bed was very comfortable and nice clean linens. We did have a ocean view and small balcony but of course Waikiki being the “metropolis” it is now, it was too noisy to sit outside. Good location for shopping and across from the beach was great but I would not stay again on the Main Street that runs along the Waikiki beach area.If you’re going to stay in this hotel ask for a renovated room which I believe would have been in the high tower.

Our room was clean even though old.Several nearby eateries, trolley stops, shopping and beach within walking distance. Reception desk was efficient with checking in and out. Easy to arrange tours and evening shows at the hotel.Breakfast was good with friendly and pleasant staff Ellen. A nice swimming pool to relax and koi fish pond. At the bar there’s live music in the evening. Will return to hotel when we next visit Waikiki.

We are staying at this hotel and the last 2 nights between 11.45-12 midnight the fire alarm has gone off. My husband is a safety professional, and believes that they have not maintained or upgraded the system. It is an “old hotel” pending restoration/rebuild.

On our first day in the hotel we left to see Pearl Harbor and while there, all our money was stolen from our room safe.After an investigation the Hotel has refused to accept responsibility. We are out the money and they have chosen to continue to employ a thief and shun their guests.I'd stay somewhere else if I were you.

Overall very happy with our first stay in Hawaii. Shame they have stopped the Lu'au when we arrived. The Pigeons in the resterant was disgusting. On one occasion, a pigeon swooped in on a diners plate when he left table for a short time to top up his drink. His wife had to shoo away the bird. Rooms on the new tower block were a little old, but otherwise all in all, apart for breakfast dining, was not to bad.

Hotel is located well in the heart of Waikiki, and reasonably clean. But guests are treated like a hindrance, especially if you are not Japanese! Staff do not line questions, even simple ones such locations or using the beach chairs for a day. They have no local knowledge or none they care to share such as public transport etc. the restaurant says seat yourself but don’t expect any service if you sit on the wrong spot - don’t sit in the restaurant area under the umbrellas on a nice day - I was told they only want people undercover near the bar so they don’t have to walk when not busy - it’s 3 tables from the bar.  Noise is insane, you can hear everything from hallways and neighboring rooms. But the biggest issue is the noise from the street performers if you have a pool room. This noise carries up in the courtyard from the pool and is louder in your room than on the street. Would not recommend. There are many hotels in the area, find one that’s helpful for your stay.

Our family history of the hotel goes back to 1984. With outstanding service, Princess Kaiulani always welcomed us back. In 1991, we celebrated our honeymoon at the hotel. Over the years, friendly and professional service never changed. It was truly outstanding. In November 2019, we were once again welcomed by staff that went the extra mile to accommodate us. We love the history of Princess Kaiulani and enjoy looking over the photos and memorabilia of this special princess. We had the great pleasure of spending time with staff member Celeste Pagan. She was so knowledgeable of the history of Princess Kaiulani and she shared her passion for the Princess's life. We can only hope that the hotel values this special employee.We hope that in the future, the life story of Princess Kaiulani will remain a focal point of the hotel. Her story MUST be honoured and preserved for future generations.

My husband and I just returned from a weeklong stay in Honolulu. We stayed at the Princess Kaiulani Sheraton. This was our second time to stay at the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We received an upgraded room with an ocean view (partial) instead of a city view. My only complaint is that the carpet from the hallway to the room was very stained and dirty. The dresser in the room had drawers that were hard to open and close, but other than that, everything was great. The hotel is a block from the beach and there are two ABC stores outside the hotel, which is very convenient.We also had a bonus at the end of our stay. We got an extended check out time of noon, but our flight didn’t depart until 8:30 pm. The hotel gave us access for an hour to a hospitality room to shower and clean up after spending the day at the beach. We truly appreciated this!The location is great, conveniently located to the beach, souvenir shopping, restaurants and retail stores. We would definitely stay here again.

Living in Australia, but having had family in the USA Stateside, we were fortuitous to book into Princess Kailulani Hotel (PK) at Waikiki back in 1914. Since then it has become our transit home away from home as we traveled back-and-forth to North Carolina then Las Vegas. Facilities have been very pleasing but it is the staff professional competence, approachability and friendliness that has seen us keep returning. Our most recent visit had a problem due to our Australian booking agency but ERIN, in Reception, worked wonders in resolving our issues. Thanks again Erin and thanks PK

On a package deal with Flight Centre from Brisbane, got a room that was dirty,shabby and very noisy .Been there once before and it was great this time treated like second class guest.. Pool closed at 7p.m.

Our third visit to Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and the excellent service is constant. Arrived way too early to check in our front desk angel, Sharon, couldn't be more helpful, taking our details, organising baggage storage and upgraded our bed.Eventually in our room much earlier than expected.Large comfortable and clean rooms and very friendly staff.We will certainly return.

Old, noisy hotel. Stay anywhere else! The location and breakfast buffet are great and that’s it. Do yourself and family a favor and pick somewhere else to stay at in Honolulu. Not up to Sheraton standards!

I was charged twice for resort fees.......credit card was overdrawn 500 Australian dollars. After fees were taken twice........every day during stay..........then as a lump sum once I got home.......not sure how I am going to address this with resort from Australia......

This hotel is just across the beach and is well situated in the heart of Waikiki, within close proximity to restaurants, shops, and public transport The room looks outdated but very clean and well maintained. Our housekeeper, Joy, rendered us an excellent service.

was only a short stay in a wonderful place. the hotel was nearly on the beach, but with a pool, splash bar, great service a good time was had. location was great as well, 10 minutes walking distance to malls, great shopping, beach, and many restruants.

We did enjoy our 8 night stay here. This hotel is old and the rooms need updating but it is clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. The best attraction about this hotel is the location, it is fantastic, short walking distance to all the good restaurants, shops and the beach. If breakfast isn't included it was $30 per person a day which is incredibly expensive but there are many places to get a good cheap breakfast just a few minutes walk away. The Splash Bar located in between the lobby and the pool is awesome and so easy to grab good quality, not too expensive meals and drinks especially in their happy hours. There is nearly always some form of music or live entertainment going on around the Spash Bar and pool which can be nice but can also be annoying if you are trying to rest in your room as the sound travels up and is quite loud but it does add to the Hawaiian atmosphere so you tolerate it. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere with walking distance to everything and aren't worried about it being modern and luxurious.

The hotel itself is on the older side, but it is well maintained. My company worked directly with the Account Director, Chrissy on a fair rate for our team due to a long-term project on O'ahu. Chrissy has far exceeded any expectations on level of service, which is greatly appreciated when you are traveling for business. The check-in process via mobile is very convenient. The front desk team have been friendly and professional. The itemized e-receipt portfolio via email has made expense reporting simple.Another great thing about this property is its location centrally in Waikiki with lots of shopping and dining options within easy walking distance. The beach is just a block away and taking a quick run around Diamond Head is not too far out of reach.There are a few other Marriott options in the same price range, however my team and I have been very satisfied choosing the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for our stays.

Hotel itself is old but well maintained. Clean, neat and tidy. Just hardware is outdated. The staff was friendly and quite details minded. They response emails quick and accommodate all we needs. As Marriot Bonvoy elite members I think their staff doing their job well. At least they show they try your best!Elite members can either choose welcome points or breakfast. I picked the breakfast, was good enough is buffet style, not bad! Besides, they offer Welcome drinks in the bar for elite as well! Pool is small, don’t expect you can swim. But come on, the hotel is located in the Main Street. So I can accept how it is, just head to the Waikīkī beach In one block away! Overall I am happy for what I pay!! For the resort fee it sounds awkward, but I stayed in others hotel at Waikīkī, they charge the same too. Not a fault of this Sheraton!!!

Have spent 6 nights here. Hotel modern and clean. Meals a bit pricey for what you get. Staff make this place. Happy and helpful the whole time I was here. The staff are a credit. Only disappointment was No smoking area. Understand that the hotel has a policy but in the middle of the night you need a safe area to have a smoke and this was not the case. Had to go out to the roadside for a smoke.

Nice lobby, great location however rooms are in desperation for upgrades!!. Dirty and old carpet in hallways and rooms. Old shower heads with calcium residue, rust around all metals, old tub,dirty walls.

We enjoyed staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as it was centrally located in the heart of Waikiki, we were close to tour pick up shopping restaurants.The staff at the check in counter were very professional and resolved any problems if you encountered one. The checkin and check out was done very professionally.Good Location food is good service is good I would definitely return back to this hotel

Got to the hotel, had to pay about 37 per day for parking and plus resort fees with tax. Wanted an ocean view, they said it would be 160 a night to upgrade. Okay, it’s our wedding anniversary and first time in Hawaii, so why not. We get up to the room, the room was definitely not upgraded and completely outdated. We were seriously pissed that this was what they considered an upgrade. I wish we would have book somewhere else. We could have gotten way more bang for the buck, especially how much we paid. Definitely upsetting. Thank god, we’re checking out today and going home.

After seeing some poor reviews just prior to leaving for Honolulu we were so pleasantly surprised to find such good service. After arriving around 6.39 AM we were given a hospitality room to rest and freshen up. Around 11AM we were given our lovely ocean view room. Settled in well and found the hotel’s cafe was excellent and well priced.We could not fault the hotel and we have stayed thousands of nights with different hotel groups around the world.Value for money, absolutely.

I stayed there for a weekend because of business trip.I found the staff on high level of professionalism and ready to satisfy any request particular for someone who was first time in Hawaii.The breakfast was good quality and adequate in variety.The only problem I have had is a terrible noise from two huge zircon units which were on top of a building and highly affects those rooms looking to the sea.

I would like to point out I have never written a review before, but I don't know want anyone to receive the same treatment I did so I am finally writing one.My girlfriend and I booked a room at this hotel for our anniversary. When we arrived to check in at roughly 630 pm there was no line at the desk. Two staff members were working with two customers though. We wait for roughly 15 minutes. At this point there were roughly 8 people waiting in line behind me. A third staff member came out from behind the counter asked if we were trying to check in then apologized for the long wait and said we would be helped shortly. At this point one customer was finishing up. A new customer walked up in the important person line. As the first customer finished I walked up to the counter. I was told she could not help me she had to help the person that just walked up. I pointed out how long I had been waiting and one staff member had apologized. I was told I would not be helped and I had to wait in line. I returned to line and was finally checked in after roughly 45 minutes total wait time.Upon check in I asked for two wine glasses could be sent to my room. I was told they could not help me with that and I needed to call from my room to the operator and request them. Getting to the room everything was clean from what we could see however the AC was not turned on and the room must have been close to 80 degrees. Before leaving for dinner I called like I was directed and asked for wine glasses to be sent up. I informed them we were going out to dinner. They asked permission to leave them in my room which I gave them. When we return from dinner the room had cooled off but there were no wine glasses left in the room. We were gone for roughly two hours. I called again and was told the staff is busy and they would be up as soon as they could. We planned to sit on the balcony, which we paid to have a nice view from, and enjoy a very nice $100 bottle of wine for our anniversary. We were forced to drink the wine out of either the bottle or the cheap paper coffee cups they leave in the rooms. Needless to say neither was a good choice and we choose to save the bottle. Over all my point is the customer service of the hotel is extremely lacking and needs to be fixed. There are dozens of hotels in the same price range in Waikiki. We clearly chose the wrong one. Please don't make the same mistake.

I stayed for four nights in September. The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to the beach, already on the main strip, and next to the International Market Place which has great dining options. The hotel itself is getting old but the staff make up for it, very friendly and helpful. The General Manager, Frederick Orr, was very professional and helpful when we had a small issue. Nice view from the balcony.

I booked a room with partial ocean view and honestly, you could barely see the ocean among other hotels that were blocking the view. The room was ok , it could have been better , maybe a little renovation will help . The area by the pool is not that big , but it does not surprise me since all the hotels are next to each other and there is not too much room. They also charge $35 per day resort fee which honestly, it does not look like a resort , also $35 per day for parking . This is extremely expensive. There is a garage parking with many levels and many time you don’t even find a place to park easy. If I go back I most likely would stay at another hotel.

My husband and I stayed here 4 nights. Rooms could use some updating, but aren’t bad. Was very busy, lots of people!We enjoyed the buffet for breakfast, as it was free due to being Marriott Titanium Elite members...otherwise it would have been too expensive! The staff in the buffet were very nice and helpful also.We prefer a smaller, quieter hotel, but they did have some nice amenities such as a book room, fun activities each day, and live music each evening.

What a beautiful place to stay, 20th floor looking out to the beach!Great location, very short walk to the beach. Handy to the Dukes Market, a variety of shops, everything really.Beautiful people.Have stayed here many years ago and it is still just as great now as it was then.Very relaxing sitting by the pool for a drink, lunch or dinner.However, it would be nice to see the pool open a bit longer as it shuts at 7pm.Would definitely stay again if I get the chance to come back again.

We stayed one night in room 2747. The hotel is in a great location right next to the international marketplace, lots of restaurants and a quick walk to the beach. While it is an older property, everything was very clean and our room was nicely appointed. We received very good guest service at the front desk and at the pool (we didn't eat at any of the restaurants) so I'm not sure what happened with some of the other reviews here. There is no valet parking but they do have their own garage you can self park in after you drop off your luggage. We would definitely stay again.

After regular stays at the Moana Surfrider we tried this Sheraton. As a Lifetime Platinum Elite we expected better. Five days before our stay the Sheraton Concierge reached out by email. We advised we would like to check in early (1-2pm). No guarantees but they promised to see what they could do. We arrived early at 1pm and not surprisingly the room was not ready. The receptionist requested a early clean, which could take 30-45 minutes. At 2pm we checked with a different receptionist, who was disinterested and we were toldthe room would not be ready until 3pm. At 2.35 we checked again to be told that the hotel was full, and no rooms were available until 3pm. That no rooms are available for check in until 3pm is a blatant lie. I had never experience this approach in 40 years of staying at these properties. We come to Honolulu annually and would not stay at this hotel again.

The room was large and beds comfortable, service to the room was good and clean. Small balcony overlooking city. We stayed on the 15th floor for 4 nights after a cruise. Waikiki Beach was an easy walk through an opposite hotel. The water was very rough and very rocky not at all I expected. We had one buffet meal there and found the food to be well prepared. Great location write in the middle of the strip with lots of choices in restaurants. There was a roped of section further along the beach which was safer for swimming. All the resorts now charge $37.93 which is a daily resort charge to take advantage of daily guest benefits (water, wifi, beach chair, unlimited local, toll free long distance and international telephone calls) We found it hard at times to get the staffs attention (too busy talking to each other and did not seem to worry that people were waiting) Tipping was expected. Our fire alarm went off in the middle of the night as the battery was flat and we had to get them to come and fix it, not happy could not go back to sleep then.

a five min walk to all the main places. Good beach across the road or walk for 5 min the get the walled off section for kids or just bobbing. Nice pool and live music every night. Staff most helpfull and free wifi and good in room entertaiment

We stayed at this hotel as part of a Travel Package. The rooms are very tired with rusty pipework showing in the Wardrobes. The chairs in the room are badly worn not the best hotel I have ever stayed in

We found this hotel to be in a great location and well priced The room was very clean bed large and comfortable and everything worked Very good staff and tour booking was no trouble Breakfast was a smorgasbord and reasonable price. Free WiFi and good speed

Firstly the check is at 3:00 pm which is ridiculous when you land and 9:00 am The staff are very rude The keys are constantly demagnetised which is so annoying because you have to go to the desk to get it fixed The staff especially pool staff are incredibly rude ! I asked for 2 cups of water I said excuse me to one of the pool waiters he looked at me from a distance and said “what” I said could I please have 2 cups of ice water and he said ok and never brought them :( and another horrible waitress who we said hi how are you and she also said what do you want Not happy the aircon is set on a temperature you can’t make cooler You also have to request with a card to have your sheets changed very poor resort Also to top my holiday off a fire alarm went off one night we went down to front desk despite them 5-10 mins later saying it’s false alarm the women at the desk said “yeh some kid pulled it down “ no apologies for the inconvenience (the alarm went off at around 10:00 pm)

I really enjoyed staying here again. The desk staff that serve me she was polite and very helpful. Our room did not have a balcony however we had a king bed and a renovated bathroom. For the price we paid the room was great. Very comfortable. The Location is always good. Was able to hire a go pro which was included for one day in our resort fees. Looking forward to staying again.

This hotel completely ruined our holiday in Hawaii. We have travelled to Hawaii several times. Previously staying at the Outrigger Beach. What a downgrade this place was.On arrival we are checked into a room that is the size of a shoe box facing a huge construction site with a massive dirt hole.I proceed to advise the staff I will not be staying in that shoe box of a room with that view. They then “upgrade” me to a room that’s view is overlooking the general waste compactor that smells like a landfill. I proceed to advise I will not be paying to stay in that room.Finally the transfer us to a room not much better that overlooks a parking area of the hotel.On check in I am charged the total amount for the stay onto my credit card... in excess of 2k.... thereafter I begin to notice this hotel are going to town on my credit card daily charging the stay again. According to them this is normal procedure and the first pending amount charged at check in is released after your stay. So virtually you are paying twice for your stay and those funds initially held are not released till much later. In other words expect your money to be tied up in this place.Staff are rude, the manager has no empathy and behaves like his done you a favour. Further more on booking I was not advised about their hidden fees “resort fee” for what “the pond” they call for a pool or the closet of a so called “gym”Do yourself a favour and do not I say do not book your stay here at the Sheraton Princess unless you want your holiday destroyed.

In stinking hot room and has no aircon. Worst hotel ever. Dont stay here. Hotel refused to provide a room with air conditioning in the hot weather here at hawaii. Cant get comfortable. Pullows are too soft. No spare pillows in room. No other pillows offered. Bot a good hotel and disappointing for a supposed Sheraton hotel chain.

Second stay hereDont accept a room around 57we got 857 - you are directly beside the huge air conditioners that pop out of the roof next door at the International Market. They are so loud you cannot not sleep! The noise is always there day and night - forget going out on to the balcony - you never get any rest from the noise! I feel sorry for the hotel as when this wing of the hotel was built there were no loud air conditioners next door! Now it must be a big problem for the hotel as I wont be going back and subject myself to this noise! We asked to be shifted but get the usual (we are full) they managed to shift us on the 5th night (after asking 3 times!) moved us up to the 16th floor - it was a bit better but still noise noise noise.To make matters worse on the last night we had dinner at the Splash Bar - my daughter had a chicken dish that she did not finish then about 40 mins late projection vomiting!!!! She was sick as a dog and taking into account she had not eaten since 1pm that day I am pretty sure to say that the chicken was off - I did tell the manager of the splash bar and he was very nice and asked if he could help in any way So many places to stay I will try somewhere else next time

House keeping avarage ,skipped toiletries safe faulty ,poor advice for the trips by the activity tour desk room avarage and vendor drink machine does not have all items listed all my stay front desk ok , buffet dinner ok

Great location, great food, across street from hop on hop off bus, near all hotels and restaurants, good city and ocean views. Staff is very accommodating. Access to drops offs and cab service is easy at the valet.

I haven’t stayed here since I was a kid. I know the hotel is older and probably ready for some renovations, so I was a little nervous when I booked my room. I’m a Titanium Bonvoy member and used my rewards for an upgrade and started in the larger suite room. It looked exactly like the pictures online- only the view and the size were better than expected. It was so spacious. The customer service was really great. The staff send a bday cupcake up to my 16yr old on our second day. The breakfast by the pool was amazing. It’s the best breakfast perk I’ve had at a Marriott chain. The resort fee is better than most in Waikiki. Last time I was there I paid the same resort fee at a different hotel- all it had was a tiny pool, a couple of beach toys and a redbox machine. I’ve read other comments on here complaining about the resort fee. Pretty much every hotel charges a resort fee in Hawaii & it’s known before booking. Honestly, the water, beach chairs and gorgeous pool area with entertainment was worth it. I was disappointed they couldn’t honor the 4pm check-out time, especially since I’m a titanium but it wasn’t a big deal. They held my luggage and we had a great last day walking around Waikiki. All of the hotel staff was very kind. Thank you!!

My wife and I paid for a king bed for our honeymoon 4 months in advance. We arrived and were told all the kings are taken and we would have to settle for 2 double beds. Are you kidding me?? They said check with them the next morning to see if a king might become avaialble. NOPE! They offered a king in the newer tower for $80/night extra. WOW! Sneaky way to get guests to come to your hotel. We lost the arguments and got stuck with the upsell. However, we did receive a comped dinner buffet (how nice). We will never stay at Marriott or Sheraton again (world wide). They should have given us the king in the new tower at no extra fees. BAD BUSINESS!!!

I have stayed here a number of times It’s located centrally in Waikiki and has the old world Waikiki feelIt’s getting a bit tired unfortunately but apparently it’s going to be demolished and rebuild in 2021It definitely needs a make over But I have a soft spot for this place so hopefully the new version will retain its family friendly feel

This review is long overdue! My husband and I stayed here for a week last month. We normally stay at the other (“nicer”) Sheraton near the Royal Hawaiian and were disappointed when they were booked and we had to “settle” for this one. Can I just tell you that the staff completely and utterly went above and beyond my expectations by providing the utmost in extraordinary service?? It’s been some time so I’m hoping to remember some of the staff by name. Here goes..The two front desk ladies are spectacular! Love love love these two! Their customer service is completely outstanding and they made such a wonderful impression on us. They were kind, funny, accommodating and patient even though my husband made it a point to bug them several times per day (thanks for hydrating us!). Hahah. I believe their names are Erin and Sharen. I should have written this down. Both of these wonderful women have such a good vibe about them and truly stood out!! They made sure to it that our stay was amazing and it sure did work. And a shout out to Gingerlee, at the egg station, who accommodated my strange request of cheese with a little bit of egg. Lol. She’s awesome and she knows egg-xactly how to prep your eggs/omelettes just the way you like them! The hotel itself isn’t as pretty or fancy as the other ones. It’s pretty basic and tucked away off a side street. It’s still within walking distance to everything so that wasn’t a problem. The view wasn’t great and the rooms were a bit outdated. I felt like I was in the Brady Bunch episode where they went to Hawaii. But I hear they’re going to upgrade the rooms so that should be nice. If you’re okay with a decent room, come here. The customer service from beginning to end is great and they know how to make you feel like royalty.

Just checked in to this hotel today from a Courtyard Marriott. Expected the service and rooms to be a notch or 2 higher. I was so WRONG! 1) Room - extremely dated, AC hardly working and much more smaller than Courtyard!2) Elevator - Sardined pack, occasionally you'll have to wait in line to hitch a ride in an antique elevator3) Resort Charge - Outrage fees with a bunch of BS items such as beach service which you have no idea how to use, GoPro can only rent free for 1 day eventhough I'm staying 2, oh and if you have 2 rooms book, tough luck, you can only rent one, what a RIPOFF! Many more ridiculous items but I'll save it for another day.4) Service - This is the icing on the cake! fyi, I'm a so-called Bonvoy Platinum Elite, but they did a good job making me feel like a Bonvoy Nobody. Way to go, Bonvoy. Check in person was rude, one of my room was only going to be ready 15 minutes later and I requested for them to send the key up to my room when it's ready, he rolled his eyes and said no sir, they don't do that. I asked for a late check out at 2pm, normally as a Platinum Elite, I get 4pm easily, the lady at the front desk insisted that they can do nothing for me. My advise STAY AWAY! I come here expecting a decent vacation, felt ripped off, belittled and for the value is not worth the price you're paying. Can't wait to check out of this hell hole...

We had a lovely time at this hotel from Aug 6th - 12th. We had stayed here on our honeymoon 21 years ago and always said we'd like to go back (with our 17 year old son this time). We weren't disappointed. The location is perfect. The room was spacious and clean with comfortable beds. We were in the tower with a balcony and a beautiful ocean view. We ate at the restaurant one night only as we were out and about but the food was great. We loved the pool area. Checking in and out was quick and efficient. We personally can't fault it. It's unlikely that we'll be back again due to how far Hawaii is from the UK but I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Guy at the concierge desk was also great and very helpful. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Great resort in a perfect location. The Pool area was lovely and inviting, plenty of lounges available, I love the Hawaiian music they had playing. An added bonus was the lockable surfboard storage they provided free of charge near the pool. Although the room we stayed in was below average, if you get allocated room 811 don’t take it! The room was clean but backed onto the maintenance/ cleaners room, it was very noisy and I could hear the sound of the elevator going up and down all night. The bed was also tiny with no balcony. We asked for an upgrade and was told NO. The resort fee is charged daily and they will hold it pending on your credit card even after you check out and finalised the bill. It’s been over a week since we’ve been back and they are still holding our money. I would definitely stay here again but next time insist in getting a balcony room and king bed.

We stayed here for sentimental reasons and because it is still a great location, but wow the extra costs like parking add up. We were only here three nights so took a deep breath and enjoyed ourselves. Liked being able to drive up to parking in our own tower (you could skip the lobby trek). We had a room with partial ocean view, but it really was a full view out over the beach and was part of what made the added expense worth it. The other bonus was really special. We arrived from Ontario on July 3 and were still fighting jetlag on the 4th. We wanted to see the fireworks, but as evening approached and they were calling for 10s of thousands of people, our interest was diminishing. Earlier in the day, I had noticed daylight at the end of the hall through the fire doors. Would you believe, each floor had an open air balcony and from the 20 something floor, we looked out over the beach and fireworks like a front row seat and we were back in our room 30 seconds after it was over. One of those unexpected surprises that again, made the hotel well worth it.We did not eat any meals on site. We were out and about, but it looked busy.We also did not use the pool. We went to the beach.We had a small issue with the hotel safe and something else and our room attendant had it dealt with immediately. Check in was fast and friendly. Not sure we would return a fourth time, but we would recommend for the location.

We booked in showed our prepaid voucher and was asked for a credit card normal procedure. We ask that card be only used to cover the resort fee. 2 days later I checked my card it had been debited with $3,650 so I went to the service counter to complain was informed by the operator who served me it was a back office error and the debits were being reversed. I asked to speak to the manager was apologised to and he reinforced the service person answer he offered me a complimentary breakfast which I didn’t except. Called Marriott they took the call took details and hung up. Went back to manager he offered me a refund of the first weeks resort fee. This is on going I need that money released but this could take a week. Princess Kaiulani hang your head in shame why did I come back still no resolution.

This is a pleasant fabulous location but many kids & families plus airline staff stay here. Check in was long wait but pleasant staff. No aircon in lobby, pool too small with kiddies in it as well.. Buffet was adequate & reasonably priced. A terrific cafe is situated right near the pool , for coffee drinks & light snacks at good prices.. shopping so close was easy peasy! The gorgeous Moama Surfrider is opposite & you can cross the street to walk through to the beaches & bars as heritage sister to Princess. A nightly small trio sing & hula. Pool closes 8 pm & the setting although small is brightly lit with flame laterns.. towels are provided by the pool attend& deck chair for the beach in your package.. cold fruit water is free at pool attendant.. room was tiny clean but like a studio claustrylooking at a wall. Called obstructive view. Sure was! However the other rooms opposite had balconies & were larger with views.. ..A nice family hotel for couples & many singles felt safe there too!

I enjoyed my week at this facility, the hotel has a Polynesian show that is really nice. The rooms are a little small but are nice. Fantastic location and I really like the pool although it is small. I definitely recommend this hotel because it is in the perfect location. I hope to be able to return soon!

This hotel is in a wonderful location, just a block from the beach. The downstairs lobby, bar and pool area is very pretty. Unfortunately, the room was a bit of a let down. Basic smallish room, at least the bed was comfortable and the aircon worked. Two of the 3 lamps in the room didn't work, and the other one was dodgy. Watch the bathroom door - they have the worst locks which in my room couldn't be opened again. Yep, locked in the bathroom for some time until I managed to get it open. Not impressed!And you'd expect a room at this price point to have more than a bath/shower combo with poor water pressure.

My friend and I stayed eight nights at the PK. We had the best room on the 29th floor with a balcony and Ocean View. Everything was beautiful from the moment we walked into the open-air lobby. The breakfast buffet was amazing, eggs benedict every morning! I'd like to give a shout out to Charmaine our server for several days around the pool and her supervisor Chloe, the bar manager. Mike was our bartender several nights at the outside pool bar. Great conversations and lots of laughs. And the best Mai Tais! It was my friend's birthday and to our surprise when we return to the room one evening there was a bottle of champagne cookies fruit and Hawaiian sodas. I would definitely recommend staying here you are right in the middle of all the action and the beach is directly across the street. Thank you to all for the hospitality sincerely Julie and Arlene

We just spent a week in this hotel, we have been to Honolulu approx 25 times over the years and this is our first stay in this hotel. The location is great, virtually across the road to the beach and next to the International Marketplace. We did have a city view room that had no balcony which was pretty average, quite small with just a queen bed which was pretty uncomfortabe....the mattress could do with an update! The pool itself is fine but you need to wear shoes from your sun lounge to the pool edge as the slate is BURNING HOT! My husband made the mistake of walking barefoot across on his first dip and actually ended up with a blister on the bottom of his foot! The staff were all lovely. The resort fee is a bit steep at USD36 per day but that did include water bottles daily, fruit poolside, a GoPro to use for 1 day, Wifi throughout the premises and Tommy Bahamabeach chairs (the Rolls Royce of beach chairs) that you could borrow to take to the beach for the day. I would probably stay again but would definitely get a room with a pool view balcony. We loved the nightly entertainment as well, each night in the pool area until 830pm.

Very disappointed when you see the hotels surrounding this one and compare. Arrived late at night to be kept waiting in the reception for 20 minutes offered an upgrade to a room with a pool view, given the keys to find the room hadn’t even been cleaned when we walked in. Given the keys to the another room with a pool view which definitely wasn’t up to Marriott standards as you can see from the pictures staff around the pool only interested in themselves and found it a chore to be serving you. Able to borrow chairs and towels to take down to the beach which was a nice touch.

This was our second stay at the Sheraton PK. Happy to say that this stay was as enjoyable as the first 6 years ago. The hotel has a great location on Waikiki - close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Beach service that was available to guests, consisting of towels, beach chairs, fruit and water, was greatly appreciated. We enjoyed the nightly entertainment at the Splash Bar which is not offered at all of the hotels on Waikiki. The staff is very friendly and made our stay very enjoyable. Overall, we had a great visit and would stay again should we return to Honolulu.

The staff at the hotel are very friendly. At check in we were greeted with what seemed like genuine enthusiasm. She was knowledgeable and helpful. But the check in was slow and we were told we'd receive breakfast coupons that never arrived.We were "upgraded" to a room in the tower with a balcony and a partial ocean view, which was where I spent a lot of time. There was a wonderful welcome gift of cookies, macadamia nuts, Hawaiian soda, and fruit. However, the room and bathroom were small and didn't feel like an upgrade. One of the elevators was out of order and another was being used to repair the broken elevator. So getting to and from the room was quite the hassle. The hotel is located across the street from the beach, about a block walk. The hotel provides chairs and towels for use at the beach. They also have a little pool. The outdoor area is nice and well maintained but like most of the hotel, small. Breakfast is available for purchase in the Pikake Terrace restaurant. I found this the highlight of our stay. While not a huge buffet, it has a nice selection of American and Japanese breakfast favorites and you can get a table looking at the pool. With so many hotels to choose from in Waikiki, I probably wouldn't choose this one again. But it wasn't terrible, just not great.
