First time here and regret not finding it before. Ideally situated in heart of Waikiki across from Moana Surfrider and near main activity and attractions. The expansive lobby features a restaurant with amazing buffet and a Splashbar overlooking the pool. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet and took full advantage of it all 3 days. We were expertly served by Tinmas who was an exemplary example of the friendly and professional Marriott standard which he exceeds with grace and ease. He should be recognized and flagged to teach others!!

My wife and I were there for our 8th wedding anniversary.Upon check in we were kindly met by the bellman Cameron who gave us great advice on where to park our rental car.At the desk we met Bryce who was very kind and got us acquainted with the property and gave us the keys to our room. Upon getting to the room it was of decent size for what we paid. The furniture definitely needs a retouch of sanding and paint or needs to be replaced. The cabinet containing the mini fridge was too difficult to open. It got stuck every time I tried to open it and then open the fridge.One of my main concerns came when I sat on the bed and the mattress popped up (rm 811). I am a man of size, 6'2" 300 lbs to be exact but I have never had a bed mattress pop in the air to my recollection (It certainly did not at the Westin LAX where we stayed the night before coming to you. The beds were amazing. I chose them because of the great stay I had at the Westin ATL Airport a few months back). After I assessed, the bed frame is actually a double or a full and the queen mattress hangs over the bed on both sides. I did not make a big deal because we were only there for 2 days but we had to make sure not even to lean on the bed’s edge while sleeping or we would have slid off and I am not exaggerating. I ask that you really take care of that issue because someone could get hurt.Moreover, the bathroom in the room was the nicest/newest thing. As for how to turn on the shower, I had to call the front desk to receive instructions on how turn on the shower. I travel extensively. Not a great design choice. The lady that serviced our room was so nice. Shout out to Miss Helen! Thank you.The second concern I had was with the amenity fee. I have no problem paying a resort/amenity fee if what is listed is provided. There were no activities listed for Saturday and Sunday which makes people who book for the weekend feel less appreciated. There was no time listed for ukele and Lai making lessons. When I asked the agent said it happens at the other Sheraton property down the road. I should not have to walk to another hotel unless I have a room to recline in at that hotel in addition to my room at your property. I asked about the fruit at the pool and at the beach. I was told that they bring fruit out at 11, 1 and 2, that was also not on the paper. I looked for fruit at the pool when we went out for the day on Saturday at 11am, none was present, only fruit infused water (not the same as fruit). I was at Waikiki beach and nobody from the hotel was out there with towels, fruit or water asking for Sheraton guests in the section where they said they are supposed to be. It just does not happen and the hotel knows that. The pool concierge were friendly though.Upon check in I was not offered a go pro or the wireless device but I saw them in the display case. What is the stipulation to use them, must a card be swiped for that as a deposit? Never got an answer from management.I want to emphasize that I DID NOT ask for a room move, an upgrade, dinner or breakfast, I am not that kind of person. I just want to get what I am paying for. I EMAILED THE this same statement to a Brian Hashimoto 4 days ago as a courtesy, but he has not responded. Perhaps he was on vacation. I give this property a 2.9 star rating because the carpet in public areas and in the room needs to be replaced. The staff members are all friendly and they outshine the sketchy amenity fee.

This hotel, while not directly on the beach, is ideally located for beach access, as well as many many restaurants all within walking distance. The GoPro rental was a nice bonus when snorkeling with the sea turtles. Breakfast here was excellent, and I only wish my work schedule allowed me to be around for the show they have on site.

I stayed for 6 days on the 10th floor. From the time we checked in, they couldn't find our reservation in the system. We had booked to separate adjoining rooms with the ocean view and were guaranteed that. This is what we had payed for. Unfortunately they were all booked out. Then they put us in a room facing away from the beach view, but we had to wait 1 hour before we could check in. This was at 2pm, after a long 9 hour horrible flight still in pants and a sweater carrying heavy bags in the heat of summer, this was quite disgusting and the last thing we wanted to do. It was our first impression of Hawaii!! Then we were told there would be a daily resort charge of $37.on top of that. Most of the amenities we didn't even use. Wifi played up, elevators stopped working. One staff told us to go and get a key to unlock the staircase to walk 10 floors up! My friend and I were talking and laughing in our room, (not extremely loud) somebody complained and they sent up two very big intimidating men who knocked on the door like the police at 10pm to scare us to shut us up?! I mean, a phone call would have been suffice that was overboard!! I can say, the house keeping staff were very nice and are great! After checking out, we discovered those daily resort fees had tax added to them individually rather then taxed for the total. Such a rip off for such an old hotel and poor customer service. I would NOT recommend staying with them.

The hotel is just a street off the beach and the staff is great. There is a small pool with a large area to sit around and lounge. The Splash Bar is located next to the pool so you can eat and drink right there. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki and close to anything you would want to do. Traffic in the area and parking at the hotel is a bit of a pain. I had a room over the parking garage and had no real view.

Our room location was facing the pool and the main street. On several night the poolside entertainment (music) was so loud no one in our family could sleep.This hotel has no quiet locations. There is no location where you can relax and read or be in quiet. There are lounge areas however the hotel continuously plays music throughout the hotel.Hotel is a perfect location downtown, close to the beach and stores. The elevators were not functioning properly which caused large ques to return back to our rooms. Some waits just to return to our room were 30+ minutes.

Once again I am dumbfounded at how great this hotel and its staff are! I stayed last month for my first time, and I honestly didn’t think it could get any better, but it did! From the time I checked in, everybody at the front desk was exceptionally helpful, special mentions to Erin, ziggy, and Cathy, but all the people I talked to were great!Now on to the bar staff, my favorite person, Shanna, the one who brought me over to the PK, is fantastic! Always has a smile and ready to make whatever drink you like! Mike and Kayla also took very good care of me, and Richard and Herbie are also fun! Great food and fun atmosphere!I’d also like to thank my housekeepers that kept my room clean, and wrote me special notes every day! I keep all of them! Marissa, Leonida, and Carol!All in all, I enjoyed my stay at the Princess, so much so, I’m booked for August 4th!

It was okay. Room was tiny. The bathroom looked more updated then the room. Our view wasn’t the greatest. GSA needs some Aloha spirt. But everything was walking distant. Restaurants and the beach was close by.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a nice hotel in the heart of Waikiki.! Reasonably priced with decent amenities and perfectly situated across the street from Waikiki beach. Hotel centered around Hawaiian history. Nice spot!!

I loved staying at the Sheraton, it makes your stay just that extra little bit more special. Husband and I stayed here and we were lucky enough to get an early check in alongside our very own freshly made lei's (I've been to Waikiki 3 times and this was the first and only time I have received one). The hotel was nicely kept and so close to everything, I loved relaxing by the pool and taking advantage of the happy hour/day specials. I definitely would not hesitate to stay here again, it was a pleasure.

My wife and I spent 10 nights at this hotel while I was working in Honolulu, so I became well acquainted with the location. Let’s start with the positives... The hotel is very close to the beach, and is a short walk from probably over 100 restaurants. The view from our room on the 20th floor was wonderful (we were fortunate enough to have the corner room). The hotel offers a large continental breakfast which is free if you have a high enough status with Marriott. The check in process was terrific, as was the entire staff during our 10-day stay. The room was plenty spacious and the bed was comfortable. There is a pool and a poolside bar/restaurant on site which many people seem to like. Pretty much everything is clean. The WiFi has been reliable throughout our stay. And now for the neutral facts... The hotel has a parking garage connected to it, which is $35/day. The hotel also charges a daily resort fee of over $30/day as well, which includes several amenities (including the ability to check out towels to take to the beach), though is not quite worth the cost. They also offer a dinner buffet every night for $35/adult. They have a Polynesian-themed dinner show onsite for $100+, which is a pretty standard rate, it seems. And now the negatives... the four elevators were slow. I often had to wait more than a minute for an elevator, and a couple times I waited for five minutes. Maybe I’m spoiled, but I’m used to getting elevators in seconds, not minutes. The hotel itself could use some renovation; it clearly shows some wear and tear from the years of business.

From the moment we arrived, we were impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the beauty of the hotel. Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking Waikiki Beach and the view was breathtaking. Our room was clean and up-to-date and Julie kept it immaculate throughout our stay. We were pleasantly greeted by Liz each morning for breakfast and the buffet had something for everyone. Our favorite experience was meeting Chloe, Splash Bar manager, and her brilliant staff. Mike behind the bar makes the best Mai Tai's on Wakiki but Shanna does give him a run for his money. Sharmaine and Kaihoku provided us with excellent poolside service and always with a smile. And Chole and her staff went above and beyond to make our vacation a memorable one - OhannaAll in all a very excellent experience and I know you will enjoy your stay. Mahalo and Aloha

Hotel in a great location but very noisy because of this. Rooms are suitable although furniture on lanai was extremely uncomfortable, I did report this but nothing happened.Good service around the poolI do wish we were advised of the beach service upon check inOne point I am annoyed about is that we had 2 unknown charges on credit card, I have been home for 4 weeks now and after 5 phone calls to hotel, from Australia, this has still not been rectified so I say be careful with your credit card that you have on file. I would consider staying there again but would ask for a more forward ocean view room as we were put 2nd from back of the tower and the view was not the best

From check-in to check-out the experience was amazing. The hotel staff were so polite and accommodating and stopped at nothing to ensure my dad and I had nothing but excellent and professional service. As our flight arrived early in the morning and check-in wasn't for at least 5 hours, the gentlemen at the front desk arranged our bags to be taken and provided us with a temporary key to access hotel amenities while we waited. Not only did he ensure we were notified every step of the way, but he placed us on a priority list to arrange my dad and I a room ASAP. As a result, we got a room at 12:30 pm instead of 3pm, which made the start of the trip so much easier, especially after 10 hours of flying. The Pool staff and staff at Splash bar were such a treat, my dad and I looked forward to going to splash bar every day of our trip for a happy hour drink and meal. It was such a nice place to hide from the sun and refresh ourselves. What made it even better was the professionalism and service of the staff. They were so friendly and loved to chat. A special mention to Herbert, and his awesome bartending skills. The boys and girls running the pool desk were so friendly and helpful during our staff and offered us amazing tips and places to visit while on Waikiki beach.The housekeeping staff did an amazing job every day, making sure coffee and bottled water were replenished as well as making sure we came back to a cleanroom. A major feature we loved about staying at the Sheraton is the Bonvoy discounts and ability to room charge at other Marriot hotel chains nearby. It saved me bringing credit cards and cash to the beach when I could instead go straight to Moana Surfrider and charge to my room. The only criticism I have is the $35 a day parking rate. As my dad and I stayed in a room each and was both paying a $33 a day resort charge, the added cost of parking did manage to eat into our travel budget and prevent us from partaking in some activities. We were wondering why parking wouldn't be included in the resort charge or at least a little cheaper, as renting a car in itself is already a significant investment.Other than the parking charges, the stay was really amazing and a huge thank you to all the staff for their excellent service and friendliness.

Spend 8 days here. Very clean and comfortable. Pool was comfortable and open from 9-7pm. Chairs and towels are available for the beach.Gym was functional but the space wasn’t very nice.Location is great, close to beach and main strip.$38 resort fee pre night.Overall very good!!

This is one of the older hotels in central Waikiki and is perfectly situated to see every part of Waikiki! The room we had was huge! The staff is excellent and the entire place has the old Waikiki charm about it! We will stay again!

I had the opportunity to travel for work to your hotel. I am a Titanium member of Bonvoy so I travel every week to a different city all over the United States and I have to say, the customer service that I received from your front desk person Kalei was the best that I have ever encountered. She exceeded my expectations by miles. She is truly an asset to your staff. If I needed another sales person in Hawaii right now, I would do anything to get her on my staff. She made my wife and I feel very welcomed. She went over each and everything I needed to know from parking to local attractions and where to eat. But more impressively, She Listened. I told her several things about my personal life while checking in and she remembered each and everyone one of them and sent a card to my room that night and mentioned them all in her card. I was floored. My wife and I both have lived in Hawaii and she is the poster person of what Aloha is all about. My room was awesome, Perfect view of the beach and city in one. The food at the Splash Bar was very good and even the Bell men out front were super Friendly. I cant wait to get back to your hotel

We booked this hotel because we just got off the crew ship and our flight was at 11:30 at night. This hotel has lots of amenities and entertainment and is in the heart of Waikiki. Very well kept hotel. The room was a little smaller than usual but nice. There is a nice pool with the live band and restaurant. There was always some entertainment going on downstairs. One block away from the beach all the shops and restaurants are in walking distance no car needed. I just wish we had more time to spend there had to check out at 9:30 PM to catch our flight

Great view from both comping and going rooms. Took a few hours to book in but otherwise our stay was comfortable. Bathrooms need a bit of a makeover. The food provided generous helpings. The location was excellent.

Our travel agent recommended this hotel because it was reasonably priced and close to Waikiki beach. She was certainly right about that. When we arrived our room wasn’t ready but it was only about 2pm, so a bit early. We went to the bar and had a couple of drinks and some food. Back to reception but before we could get there a manager, Robert, spotted us and asked if he could help. He found our room wasn’t ready so he upgraded us, sent my wife a bottle of wine for her birthday and got us complimentary tickets to a show. It didn’t matter whether it was bar staff, cleaning or concierge, they were all great.

Excellent location - easily accessible to anywhere that we wish to go. Wonderful smiling and attentive staffs from all over the hotels. Upgraded rooms with ocean view on higher floors saves us from a little loud music from poolside. Inviting large saltwater pool but it was too cold for a dip during the time we were there. Will definitely return to SPK if it isstill standing!

Well worth the money. Pool is great, check in counter staff are great and can't help you enough. Rooms are nice. We will definitely be returning. Great central location. The only thing I didn't like is the fact that anybody can just wander in from the street so I found myself constantly checking our belongings on the chairs by the pool when some dodgy looking people came in and sat down next to our belongings. Apart from that I can't recommend enough.

Stayed here four nights on a recent trip to Honolulu (my first) and chose this hotel because my Bonvoy points stretched the furthest here. I have to say, the Princess Kaiulani really won me over! Are the rooms tired? Yes, absolutely. And I don't see that improving in the next couple of years, because while I was there, Marriott had posted a sign indicating they intend to apply for a permit to tear down the Princess Kaiulani in the next couple of years to build a huge tower hotel complex on the site. (An employee there said they had been told it would be closing in two years for that project.) But if that happens, I for one will miss the old-school, mid-century vibe of the SPK as it is! The location is unbeatable, right on Kalakaua Ave, a half block from the public park where the Duke Kahanamoku statue stands on Waikiki beach. The pool is fantastic -- one of the bigger pools we saw in Waikiki, and saltwater too! Lots of seating around the pool, and live music and entertainment during happy hour. We loved it! The Splash bar was great for post-dinner drinks: more live music, good bar lighting (some of the Waikiki bars seemed TOO brightly lit!) and a great vibe.The service was spectacular. All the employees I interacted with were friendly, attentive to detail and helpful. I so appreciated the upgrade to a partial ocean view room, the birthday cheesecake they left in the room, and the lei I was given upon check-in! Pros: *Great location*Large saltwater pool with lots of seating*Friendly, attentive service*Live music and entertainment at happy hour and post-dinner*Great value for Waikiki*Comfy bedsCons:*Dated rooms*Poolside rooms can be a little loud (pool closes at 7, but live music near the pool happens until 11)

My husband and I recently returned from an 7 day at this property. Prior to our stay, I had spoken with several of the hotel staff about a specific room type as we were celebrating our 19 year anniversary. After checking in, we were informed that our request could not be honored because the hotel was sold out. The manager Brian, was very dismissive and curtly stated that: " I should have booked directly with the hotel and that we can move you to another room but it will be in the same booking category." The toilet in the room (525) was dirty and malfunctioning. To their credit, housekeeping did come up to clean the toilet, but we were exhausted and declined their gesture. The manager Robert, was very helpful in submitting a work order the next morning to have our toilet repaired. I was very disappointed that a member of their guest services team did not proactively contact us to improve our experience. My perception was that; because I used a thirty party booking system (Priceline) that my request was not a priority. I literally had to go down to the front desk the first 4 days of our vacation to inquire if a room with a view/balcony had become available. On Thursday, I managed to speak with the general manager Fred Orr to discuss our experience. He graciously offered his apologies and arranged for us to change rooms.

Have stayed here before this recent trip. Would return. Room was a great size. An extremely comfortable bed with great linens. Stayed at three different properties on this trip and the bed was the best. Even better than Sheraton Moana Surfrider! (Princess K uses a Sheraton Signature Sleep Experience bed with premium linens.) Plenty of room for luggage and clothing. Same in the bathroom for toiletries. Stayed on the eighth floor with a great pool view. Pool was a great size with plenty of umbrellas and shade. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Large range of tasty food items. All staff – reception, luggage, pool, restaurant – were friendly and helpful. Great location. Recommend.

Traveling couple of times a week to Hawaii for work project. This hotel has been a blessing due to their courteous and pleasant management and the staff. On business, cannot use all the various amenities due to time constraints BUT it is nice to know it is there. Across the road to the beach and surrounded by great shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are comfortable and most of them have great views or ocean, mountains and city. Plan on staying here for the duration of the 18 month project. Highly recommend it! Definitely great for people on vacation if it is great for a business traveler :)

Have now stayed at this particular hotel on a number of occasions and it is consistently good – it is in a great location and it has a wonderful large foyer from which you can access the pool and outdoor/indoor dining – the checkin experience was amazing and literally it only took a few minutes from me arriving at the counter and getting into my room– The rooms are clean and the staff are just lovely– The hotel is centrally located at the Waikiki end of Honolulu – easy flat walks to many other locations or a more challenging walk up the hill to Diamondhead for those who are keen – I have stayed at most of the hotels at this end of Honolulu and this one is – for me – the best experience for the money

Sheraton PK you've done it yet again! What more can I say?...A lot!! For starters, I had called about 2 months prior to find out what room we were in n was told we would know when we arrived. I told Susan one of your lovely reservation agents that it was our 25th Anniversary and we were pulling out all the stops n celebrating over the top, VIP style, But what would b the icing on the cake is if we could get a full ocean view room. She noted it in our reservation. Not knowing what to expect, when we finally arrived, Bryce, your GSA obliged us with exactly what I had asked. (Room 1662... 6/5 - 6/12) We were then surprised with Champagne and snack tray in our room as a welcome anniversary gift. WOW!! After that, everyday after we were treated so well by all, and we even ran into a few of your Hotel Associates who we met on our first trip 5 yrs prior! (*) So lovely to see old friends again! Nothing but the BEST service was given n would like to personally shout out to: Bryce (GSA Front desk)Eric (Splash Bar)*Dana (Splash Bar)Vanessa (Splash Bar) Angie (Splash Bar)*Guy (Tour Coordinator)Floyd (Bell/Concierge) Imelda & The HousekeepersAlso ur entertainment in the evening! THANK U ALL SO MUCH for making our Anniversary the BEST EVER!Looking forward to our next stay, perhaps before ur reconstruction project! Mahalo nui loa a hui hou!! UR THE BEST! ❤

This was our first visit to Hawaii and we were so well looked after. Christina made sure our stay was special to celebrate both our birthdays and our wedding anniversary. Gorgeous view and everything we needed. Not sure of the value in the daily mandatory charge on top of the accommodation, but the customer service is certainly enough to make you feel at home. If you are expecting an ocean view room, the tower is where you need to be as the hotel in front obscures most of the view if your room is in the smaller building.

We got a package deal for this hotel and our partial ocean view room was amazing! The furniture might be a little dated however the room itself was wonderful, the service perfect, they gave us a wonderful fruit and treat tray on arrival, provided us with everything we needed on a daily basis. The room was quiet, the sliding doors are soundproof and the sunny aspect was wonderful. We adored waking up to the Waikiki views every day! I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights in between our other 2 island stays. It was a perfect location for us right in heart of Waikiki as we were not hiring a car. Check in was easy and staff were very friendly. I was a little taken back when we came out of the elevator at the dated corridors but the room although being quite small and dated was clean. Being an Aussie not used to Resort Fees it does get to you paying $30-35 a night to get wifi and use of a small pool Oh and the only having 2 small creamers (milk) supplied daily isn’t enough, not even for one coffee, we kept having to ask house keeping for more all the time, lol! But on the whole like our stay here.

Great Hotel, over the road from the Beach but easy access, great pool, staff amazing so helpful. Free wifi, smart TVs in the rooms so could access our Netflix account. They provide in the guests lounge two computers and printers to allow logging on and printing our information of events and boarding passes. Just a Great place to stay. Only problem we saw was the checkin queues long and slow.

We love staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. Location is perfect. Enjoy the evening entertainment from the balcony of our pool view room. Beds are super comfy. Housekeeping staff are very friendly. Pool area is great. We will be back.

This was our 3rd stay at SPK, and the services and convenience to the Beach are always wonderful. The rooms have a great Ocean view. Conveniently located to Restaurants and activities, and for boarding the buses for excursions.

We booked a room with double beds on a higher floor. When we got there we were told that they only had king beds, and got a room on the second floor. I was not very happy about that. Also, why do you charge a resort fee? The hotel is in the worst shape I’ve ever seen it. There was a bad smell in the lobby area and a cat in the parking garage that was crying the whole five days I was there. Pitiful. I will not be back.

I came to Hawaii with my family and partner, we stayed at this hotel for a week. We booked a king room and a twin bed room but they had booked us under 2 king rooms (which we had paperwork that said we had a twin room) so we had to wait around for the new room to be available which was a bit annoying after a long flight. The rooms and hotel overall seems a bit dated. The rooms were pretty average, the shower is in a bath with no water pressure. But there are also some plusses, the views are amazing of the beach and everything is in walking distance including all the shops and buses to get to activities and malls. There are lots of things to do including cheap cocktails, buffet breakfasts (highly recommend), staff to help you book your activities, pool was great with free towels, the wifi was INCREDIBLE with being able to steam videos and you can even hook YouTube and Netflix up to your TV. The hotel also had great extras including access to a wifi dongle that you can take outside the hotel, and go pro sticks to book for free.

Great location with a nice pool, bar and restaurant. However the room was dated with poorly functioning amenities, plumbing in bathroom wasn’t great as it kept blocking for no reason ( had to get repairmen to help after calling guest services multiple times) and did not get any sort of offer for a room with working amenities.

hotel is across the road from the beach and in a very central location. Rooms are on the older side but staff said they are slowly upgrading the rooms. Free WiFi including a mobile WiFi device, also offer one day use of a gopro free (you need to take or buy a high speed memory card). Beach chairs also provided free of charge.

This was once a really nice hotel but the rooms are a trip back to the 1980’s. We got a pool view and partial ocean view, but the room was awful. The fixtures in the very small bathroom were rusty and stained like they hadn’t been wiped down in a long time. I noticed splatters of something on the wall by the sink. The wallpaper was cracked and peeling in the bathroom and there was some sort of damage on the ceiling that appears to have been hastily repaired. We also noticed a used wash cloth that was gross looking that had been left by the previous guest. Appears in general the maids are not burdened with attention to detail. The furniture appears VERY used. As you can clearly see from the photo the broken door on the TV cabinet was very dirty and grimy. Also, beware that on top of your room rate you will be charged a $34 per day “Resort Fee” and you will also pay more to park your car than it cost to rent your car. Don’t stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

Lobby & outside looks great but when you get past that the lifts were a nightmare with at least 1 out of 3 not working & 2 out of 3 on some days so huge queues for themHall carpets in the Princess wing are stained & very old even though we saw someone steam cleaning them by the lifts it did not make any difference!Rooms are large with nice balconies however very hard to open the glass doors, cupboards & drawers have warped as very old solid wood & humidity affects that. Bathroom toilet seat wonky & shower heads not good. Aircon incredibly noisy & not very effective. We moved rooms from 904 as so noisy with 2 interconnecting doors & walls so thin you could hear the conversations from next door & we had very loud, very noisy & up very late ie 2.30am!! Neighbours.Moved to 1012 with no interconnecting doors which was much better but you can still hear TV from the next room, again shower head not good they need replacing.Bed in that room very old & very creaky with big lump in the middle - needs replacingFood & Beverage expensive & the Beach service is a joke. You do not have access to private beach area so you can take chairs, walk along to the Duke statue with your towels which is a 10 minute walk in the humidity & hot sun. There is no shade & no umbrellas provided so you are better off around the pool where if you are lucky you can get a sunbed in the shade.Pool closes at 7pm why??Our friends were staying close by & their pool does not close till 10pmVery disappointed would not stay here again much prefer to stay in the Royal Hawaiian or the Sheraton Waikiki or the Westin which is directly opposite & on the beach which this hotel isn't!

We're Marriott loyalists, so have not stayed in Sheraton's in a while...but post merger, we gave it a try. Was a business trip, not vacation. We've also stayed at other Honolulu properties in the Marriott family and reviewed those on this site. We had a very good stay, based upon what we paid. For context, our rate included the breakfast buffet each morning and waived the resort fee.Pro's: - Friendly staff. All staff we encountered were very friendly and positive. Front desk as especially welcoming, including a complementary lei. - Room was nicely clean and orderly. Everything worked just fine. - Was part of our room rate...the breakfast buffet was quite impressive. A very large variety of foods, well-prepared. Omelet station, eggs, bacon, sausage, waffle, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, Asian breakfast items...and I'm sure we missed things. Quite a large spread. Our guess is it would retail at about $25 a head on Waikiki. - WiFi worked fine too. - Location is great. Across the street from Mona Surf Rider, diagonally across the street from Waikiki Beach. Nicely, not on Kaulakau Ave, so there is some buffer from all the street noise. Other notes, which some may find a bit of a detractor: - For us, the $35/night resort fee would have been a deal breaker. The photos tell the story about the pool. Frankly, we didn't see anything we'd term "resort". It's a nice Waikiki Beach hotel.  - The rooms are about due for a refresh. Everything was clean and functional, yet if one seeks bright and sparkling, marble countertops, new furniture, etc, that's not SPK. For us, it was fine. - We read the comments on noise. We were in the original/shorter tower (building that contains the front desk). We found the sliding door to the lanai did a good job minimizing noise from the pool area, including the live music in the evening. Yet, the walls are a bit thin; we could hear the guys next door pretty clearly. We usually have business in Honolulu about once a year. We'll certainly consider SPK for our return business, and the decision will hinge upon the value. If it's what we experienced this year, sure, we'll be back. If that resort fee sneaks back in, probably will pass for the Marriott property that doesn't have one.

This Hotel is in a great location, the room was very clean and the beds and pillows were great. It,s just a pity the staff were rude and not helpful. I don't know what we did but right from check-in from reception to the bar and restaurant staff it seemed a big effort to do their job. The bar man practically threw our cocktail together and slid them across the bar. We only had one each day and the same thing happened for 5 days. We decided to have dinner at the pool bar on the last night and my friend got told by the waitress with her hand on her hip that Aussies are difficult and we got a lecture about ordering things from menu's and this was all because she wanted the whole wheat bread option that was on a different sandwich on the menu. She did get the bread but the waitress made out she was doing some very big special request to the chef. And then after being offended and feeling like you want to cry they expect a tip. No Hawaiian welcome at this place. We didn't expect anything and got nothing. We had plenty of money and were happy to tip so they lost out with us. The other restaurants around were happy for our custom.

Stayed 12 nights in this Sheraton hotel.Very good location and friendly staffLiked they had activities like lei making in the lobby for no extra feeThe room was average and does need updatingNoise in the room from the room next door was terrible. You could hear word for word the conversations The price was good for the location and service provided by staff

Great location to everything. Across the road from Waikiki beach. Had room 625. Clean and tidy and in good condition. Coffee shop at front of motel.Easy access to shops, beach, ABC shops, and transport.Walking distance to all Areas. All Staff are very friendly and helpful, Like to acknowledge Maricel M our room attendant and Bobby who made checkin a breeze . Pool area nice to settle in after the Beach. Get a Beach Chair /towel for the beach.Also Pool staff also come down to beach during certain times of the day and offer water/fruit. Hotel breakfast buffet and Good daily cocktails . Public Bus stop behind hotel near Food Pantry get the 5.50 all day ticket and take a trip around the island. Go to International Market Place next door. 2/3 USD Beer in small bar. Get your souvenirs and Hawaiian shirts from the Market stalls, they are in International Market Place. They carry same items as ABC stores but cheaper and will negotiate . Do some areas of the Hotel need revamping -yes- You are on Holidays get out of your room and and see the sightsWould be nice if there was a bottle/can opener and maybe 2 stem type glasses.Would I would come back and stay again in this Hotel - Yes

This is to add photos to “False advertising” review as I couldn’t edit the review. Still would not recommend this hotel. After sleeping all night in room the AC has only been able to cool the room 3 degrees.

What was advertised and pictured is not what we got. We checked in today and to say our room is rundown is an understatement. There is mold/mildew/staining all over the bathroom, there is no microwave, half the numbers on the in room safe don’t work, and the AC doesn’t work properly (my 11 month old has been red, overheated and crying pretty much nonstop). When we asked that they check our AC they neglected to do it, then when we called back no one answered the phone for 3 minutes, when they did they asked If guy hadn’t gone to our room yet, and we told them that we didn't know because we had been out after we had asked them to send someone to check the room while we were out, they put me on hold for 5 minutes and said that even though it had been 3 hours the guy hadn’t come. He finally showed up as we were attempting to put my son to bed and said that all he could do was change the filter and bring a fan to the room. It is unacceptable that we are sweating in our hotel room and that the bathroom is so disgusting. I could over look the fact that there was supposed to be a microwave and even the safe not working, that the bathroom door makes an awful noise and only 3 drawers, but put together this has already managed to ruin our family vacation for my parents to finally meet their grandson (we are military living in Korea and Hawaii was half way). I wish we had never stepped foot in this hotel, but we have 10 more days!

Great location to everything. Across the road from Waikaki beach. Rooms over pool area is spacious. City rooms are smaller but very comfortable. Coffee shop at front of motel.Easy access to shops, beach, ABC shops, and transport. Porters are very friendly and helpful. Taxi service to airport/cruise terminal is available and set price.

I wish this site offered half stars as I would rate this 3.5 ( higher side) hence my 4. I stayed here two different stays, 4 nights apart. The good on both stays. Very clean rooms, excellent wi-fi and a great location. The bathrooms were ok during both stays. A great member of staff during both my visits was Floyd, a bellman. Does the hotel proud.The bad on both stays. The exorbitant resort fee. Honestly giving me 2 bottles of water a day and the promise of maybe getting some service at the beach does not come to +$30. A big rip-off in my view. The lack of “greenness” of this property. Plastic cups everywhere, toiletries still in small individual containers ( and new containers provided every day despite me still having plenty in the open ones). I would honestly prefer toiletries in dispensers and only paper cups if. They cannot provide glass/ceramic.My first stay I had a partial ocean facing room in the second wing. The room was large with two “king” beds and a lovely balcony. The issue I had with this stay was the staff. My checkin and checkout were awful ( checkin probably a lot worse).On my second stay I was allocated a city view room in the Princess tower. Elevators were slow ( appears only 2 of the 3 were working) and the room was TINY! This time I only had a single “king” bed ( two people cannot comfortably fit into this bed so am glad I was travelling on my own). The TV blocked my access to the window and honestly was not worth the money charged ( cost me more than the first room!). This time again had an awful checkin with the young man telling me “ you are lucky we are letting you have the room early”, 1.5 hours before the official checkin. However my checkout this time was superb.This is a hotel of contradictions, but given its excellent location, for the right price I would recommend it.

We had an issue at check in which was handled superbly by Christina who welcomed us and gave us a room before the check in time. The hotel is perfectly situated for shopping and the beach. It looks better than the photos and our room was absolutely fine for the price we paid. I would certainly stay again. The only issue was the terrible meal we had one evening which was tasteless, plain and unimaginative. We made a mistake by not dining in one of the restaurants nearby. We didn’t have the hotel breakfast. All in all though we would return.

Family holiday to Waikiki, Hawaii May 2019. 2 adults & 2 children 14 & 11. Hotel is in a great location 1 street from the beach. Walking distance to everything central.Shopping, cafes & restaurants. ABC shop next door for all supplies ie milk, bread, souvenirs, alcohol & all things a convenience store offers.Hotel entrance/foyer has been tastefully updated/renovated but the hotel rooms are very old & out dated. Rooms look very tired. Good size rooms. Bed reasonably comfortable. Shower over bath. Rooms have air conditioning, bar fridge, hairdryer, toiletries supplied. No family rooms, we were all in one room. We didn't eat at the Hote5as there was so many cafes and restaurants to choose from close by.Nice pool. Daily water bottles & fruit supplied to guess by the pool. Complimentary towels also supplied for the pool & the beach. Would probably stay again due to the location

In a fantastic location but rooms very tired. Resort fees a rip off $35 per day for basically 2 bottles of water compulsory fee!!! Plastic cups and paper coffee cups in room no wine glasses had to request!

We stayed for 6 nights and really enjoyed this hotel. It's close to everything and the staff - especially pool & bar staff were lovely! The rooms (we stayed city view) were pretty tired and not spotless as old (especially the bathroom and cupboards), however we weren't in our room much so didn't care - the sheets and linen were clean so that's our main thing.

My go-to when visiting Hawaii. Perfect location at a more affordable price than beachfront hotels. It has all the amenities you could want. Book the high tower room - views are sensational, bed is so comfortable and decor is modern. I’ve stayed here 9 times over the years and I’ve never been disappointed.

We stayed here one night before moving over to the Moana Surfrider right on the beach and directly across the street. This hotel is a favorite of ours because many of the staff have been here for a long time. The bar and pool area are great. Towels and beach chairs are provided so that guests can cross the street and enjoy the beach. The pool area is welcoming with lots of chairs and great poolside service.Rooms in the tower have been upgraded. Older side will be renovated in 2021-2022. Hotel has great location right in the center of the Waikiki strip. Marriott Elite members receive complimentary buffet breakfast. We were celebrating our anniversary and management sent a bottle of champagne. That was a nice surprise and we really appreciated it. Over the years we have stayed in most of the beachfront properties in Waikiki but this particular hotel remains one of our favorites. The staff here is outstanding! Mahalo.

We've stayed at SPK many times and luckily met Celeste Pagan on the front desk a few years ago after my wife was recovering from open heart surgery - she made us feel very special and ensured we had a lovely ocean room view for a stress free holiday. Because of these great memories we've been back a couple more times and always contacted Celeste directly where she's befriended us and arranged similar rooms in the Tower with magnificent views - to die for ! ( our last room was 2062 ).The location of the hotel and its Aloha character are unbeatable, being so close to the beach front with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. My favourite daily walk along the palm -tree lined Ala Wai Canal is only a block away.The staff are all very helpful and friendly - but Celeste is our guardian angel and prepare to be pampered if you choose to stay there.

We stayed here to finish our honeymoon after our Sydney - Honolulu cruise. It was the perfect place to stay in Waikiki. We stayed in a partial ocean view room on the 27th floor and the view was spectacular. The staff were very friendly and we appreciated the free wifi dongle we could use as guests. The pool area was lovely with entertainment every night.

Stay here with our young kids and had a very nice stay. You can tell the building is an older building but they have renovated the rooms (which are a touch on the small side). Rooms have everything you would need so no major complaints (other than size and the fact you can still tell it's old despite the renos). We got a room with a wonderful ocean view. I found everyone on the property to be super friendly and service was good. Great pool, filled with salt water. I was worried it was on the small side and would get super busy but it never got super packed which was nice. There is bottled water and fruit by the pool which was wonderful. You could also grab the fruit and water plus towels and beach chairs to bring to the beach which is a really great perk. The hotel is in a great location, across the street from the beach and right on the main drag of waikiki so super convenient to shopping and restuarants. They also have a bunch of daily cultural activities such as lei making, hula lessons, ukelele lessons etc, including ones for kids. The gentleman who does the kid activities is awesome, super nice guy. All in all, a really lovely stay and I would recommend this location to others.

I’ve stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani several times but this is the first time since the official Marriot/ Starwood merger. We use to get meal coupons that we could use for breakfast or dinner and now they only give breakfast coupons. We also use to get free drink coupons but the checkin person said he never heard of Starwood giving out the free drink coupons and that he had been there for ten years. At least we were able to get a nice high floor Tower ocean view room as we had before. Perhaps since Marriot will be knocking the hotel down in a few years, they don’t care as much to keep their Platinum members returning. The pool service still is not good. They only have one server and she did not come around very often. We had to go to the bar to get our drinks.  Even with the reduction of benefits, if the price is still much lower than most comparable hotels, I might stay here again but it’s not for sure anymore.

Ive stayed here several times now and they have the "new" tower and the "old school" tower.... I like the old school tower! The reason i stay here is simple: its not all crazy like the Sheraton Waikiki, its not expensive and you're still in the action of the energy and vibes of Waikiki.... also the staff crushes it! and if youre a Marriott/SPG type , the free breakfast buffet is great. Also dont forget your free drink coupons upon check-in.Jesse Suderman (F&B Manager) and Bob Johnson (FOH Manager) do a fantastic job along with all the rest of the staff..... Cant wait to get back!

The hotel looks like it was built a really long time ago and never updated. The room I was in was the worst I've ever been in my life. Tiny, old and smelly. I couldn't believe this was a Sheraton. Common areas were alright but far from great.

Could not make a better choice to stay if you want to visit Waikiki. This hotel is ideal for both location and price. Now some of the fixtures are a little dated but not bad at all. The rooms are clean and the hotel staff are very courteous. The location is magnificent for visiting the beach and also very close to shopping and restaurants.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton princess for three nights in March. We were so happy we booked there as it was the perfect hotel - right close to the beach (one block away) but stilll offered a quiet and relaxing ambience. It was our first trip with our baby and the staff was so accommodating - got us a crib for the room, extra towels etc. The rooms had amazing bedding, great toiletries and the view we had was incredible! You cannot beat this place especially for the price

I could not take another 14 hour flight between Auckland and Vancouver so we decided to stay two nights in Hawaii during our trip home.We have stayed several times at the Princess Kaiulani during visits to Honolulu; and it was again re-assuring to be greeted with a smile, an "Aloha" and some much appreciated bottled water.The hotel has a great location, within walking distance of all places Waikiki.The Sheraton chain has been bought our by the Marriott; and you can start to se the changes. The most notable being the application of a $35.00/day "Resort charge"Staff suggested that a Marriott rebuild is planned for the site, but that it is several years away. While this makes sense as the hotel needs some updating; I hope it is a long way off, because we again really enjoyed our stay there.

The beach is across the street. Just walk past the Moana Surfrider. The hotel has a nice pool which is pretty big given that it's along a main street. Nice pool, nice lobby. Hotel rooms weren't anything special but that wasn't something I was looking for.

I absolutely love this hotel. This was my 3rd time staying there. The rooms are clean and spacious. I have always stayed in the partial ocean view room. I have never been disappointed with my view. The lobby is open and I love the fresh air. Most days they have a little booth set up in the morning for jewelry, making leis, etc. The staff are just wonderful, helpful and just exude the aloha spirit. Every night they have live music entertainment. I love the Hawaiian music. It's a great location to get to and from Waikiki Beach and super close, a less than 5 min walk depending on how busy Kalakaua Avenue is. You can get towels and chairs from the pool to also take to the beach. The trolley and bus stops are super close as well, making it easy to get anywhere you want to go. The restaurant's bar The Splash Bar is a hidden gem to enjoy the fresh air, music, sun and delicious food. I hope to stay here again!

Great location, clean room, inviting lobby, friendly staff, but rooms need updating. The rooms need additional outlets to charge electronic devices. There was only one open outlet close to the desk and none anywhere near the bed. I had to use the outlet in the bathroom to charge up the cell phone. Shower fixture also needs to be updated. Who has seperate valves for hot and cold water? No valet service so it is self parking which could be a good thing or a bad thing depending on where you park and the elevators and if it is raining or not. I was only there for one night but would not stayed another night if I had booked multiple days. Rooms feels like stepping back into the 70's only without the shag carpeting. Too bad since this hotel has great potential.

Definitely enjoyed my stay here! My boyfriend and I arrived a little early before check in time and they were still able to check us in. The room itself once we got there was very clean. The hotel also gives 2 free water bottles per day and a water station where you can refill your water so that definitely saved us some money! By the pool you can find more water bottles and some fruits as well! The hotel also offered free beach towels and beach chairs which really came in handy! Right next to the pool was a small little coffee shop that was nice to go to in the morning. Every worker was always smiling and so welcoming at the hotel! Another great thing about this hotel was the amazing buffet! We ate at the dinner buffet on a Saturday night and who can say no to all you can eat crab and prime rib!? Amazing! One main reason I’m giving this place 4 stars is because of the time the pool closes. I’m not sure how late other pools are open until around the area, but I just personally feel that 7:00pm is a little early to be closing the pool especially since the sun is barely setting at that time during Spring. I would’ve loved to end my nights by the pool like I did in past hotels on other islands, but I missed that experience here. Unfortunately, I didn’t step in the pool once in my week long stay since my boyfriend and I were constantly exploring the island and shopping outlets until it was dark. And although the beach chairs are free, returning by 6pm is super early since sunset is around 6:30-7pm during spring time. Keep in mind that parking can also be a bit pricey at $35/day, and sometimes the lot can get full. Fortunately my boyfriend and I got lucky with parking every night but there were some nights where we only saw a couple spots left!Other than that, I had a wonderful stay! Thank you!

We used Marriott rewards points to stay here. That gave us one of the cheapest rooms with no view of the beach. The hotel is obviously old but is being updated. We enjoyed the pool area, the short walk to Waikiki beach and the numerous restaurants nearby. We thought the hotel restaurant was extremely overpriced, especially for breakfast, and never ate there as a result. The hotel bar was OK for drinks and snacks but nothing special.

I really enjoyed Sheraton Princess Kaiulani! The lobby was grand and went through a fresh remodel. The pool area was so relaxing and we enjoyed having lunch there. They have a walk way that leads straight to the beach, about a 5 minute walk. The staff was so friendly and made us feel welcome. Special shout out to the following employees. Bryce at the front desk is a super star. Wonderful technique in anticipation of needs. I shared that it was our last night in Hawaii and he delighted us by upgrading our room with the most beautiful view I've ever seen. I was so touched and grateful for his wonderful hospitality. He truly amplified our stay and made it a memorable one. Michael at the pool bar made just as much of an impression. He was so kind and made our departure day a fun one. He took great care of us and exemplified true Aloha spirit. Thank you Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for the wonderful stay. We will definitely be back!

Staff are friendly. Water, fruit, beach towels, and beach chairs are available to take to the beach. Hotel is older with renovated rooms and I'd say it is a lower end Sheraton. Rooms are not soundproof.The place has a pool and right in the centre of Waikiki. I'd stay here again.

Arrived in on a late flight. Got there just in time to wait on the University of Indiana Tennis team to check in in front of me, so the speed of the process was understandably a little slow. What I did not appreciate was the bathroom door being completely broken and the dust/dirt in the rooms, see light pic. Front desk person acted like having a broken bathroom door was no big deal. I also asked and was denied a late checkout, which again I understand if no rooms but don't make rules for status then decide not to follow them. On a positive note the grounds and the pool looked like they make up for the lacking service. There were some nice restaurants close. On the negative side; the furniture was basic and dated, and they do charge a resort fee so if you are getting in later and leaving early you get nothing for the up charge. I couldn't recommend the place over others in the area, and would definitely not stay there again. There is much better value to be found elsewhere.

Luxury hotel close to everything. Rooms are perfect for a family and are equip with all you need. A perfect addition is the pool that is great for sunbathing during the day and enjoying the live music at night. The photos below show what you find a 10 Minute walk from your room. FREE fruit, water and towels at pool area and at beach. All staff are very friendly and helpful. Definitely 5/5 would stay again.

At the front desk Celeste went above and beyond to help us. The first face we saw treated us like royalty and it’s been great ever sense during our stay! She knows how to treat people! Hope to be back soon for sure!

Location is great- very close to Waikiki and the nearby supermarket was reasonable. We had two stays here in under two weeks, two rooms each time. We were allowed early access to both rooms on our first stay and one room the second time. This was an enormous help, especially when you are flying in from Australia. A late check was available when we needed it too.

We’ve been coming to Waikiki for 30 years and always stayed oceanfront...this time we decided to stay at this hotel because we always liked the pool area and evening entertainment...they gave us the most delightful room on the 9th floor and we had almost a full ocean view and enjoyed sunning on our own lanai as well as the evening entertainment right below our lanai. Nice pace, pool not crowded...they offer free beach chairs and free fruit and bottles of water at the pool. Nicest staff ever. We know the hotel is to be demolished and a 33 story replacement will appear...a real tragedy in our opinion because Waikiki is so much concrete and high rises...and higher prices will come with the new structure. Other hotels we’ve stayed at still charge for beach chairs etc in addition to resort fees. After staying here, we would choose this again as opposed to the beachfront hotels!

We stayed here for one night in January. This has a great location. No question. It looks a little run down from the outside, but has nice and clean rooms. The staff were helpful. Free water and fruit by the pool. Nice pictures of the last princess around the hotel. I would recommend this hotel. Questions, message me.

As first timers in Hawaii ( from Australia) this hotel definitely made the transition easy!. We were very jet lagged and thankful for the wonderful service. A fantastic location central to everything in just walking distance. This is perfect for older people, young families and older families with teens. The rooms are clean and the view is stunning. We loved it.

If you wanna stay in Marriortt property like me in Christmas period, that's may be the best deal you could find in town. Let's talk about the location first, it's close to the main road, loads of resturtant and bars around, beach is by walking distance, airport is like 20-30 mintues around, depends on the traffic. And if you been to Guam, this Sheraton is exactly the same, there's big balcony in every room. As a platimum member, you may expect a room upgrade to suite, but during Christmas period, I think it's impossible. So I got a basic room with a partly ocean view, not exactly the corner room though. So for the room itself, I won't say it speciaous unless you count the balcony as well. The decoration is very old-fanshioned and basic, nothing fancy, so if you are here for a honeymoon, you better pick another Sheraton that located at the beach, surly the time is two times higher during holiday. And there's not much amienty in toliet, you may ask them though. And I'd say the breakfast is the highlight for first few days, but the last day totally ruin our impression. We still here til boxing day and everybody looks so upset and grumpy that morning, we try to ask for coffee, but all the staff just keep ignoring us or pretend they didnt notice us. After 20 mintues we finally get the coffee. For the breakfast, it's baisc western choices, bacon, egg and sausage. And like every corner in Hawaii, you would find rice and soup as well.In short, if you coming here in the peak season like Christmas, don't expect quick service and don't expect much. The only best thing here is the location. So if you just want a hotel close to everything and your budget is tight, here you go.

My first impression visiting the Princess Sheraton in honolulu has been a memorial experience since I arrived here when I was 18 years old with my friends. I knew that moment I will be back . Im now 51 years old and am bonvoy spg lifetime gold member and a platinum at present.This hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki . Its central walking distance to the shops , restaurants, and beach. The staff are wonderful, helpful and friendly. A staff member "Sharen" has been there since i was 18 years old, and currently still there to this day. Uyen, is amazing working at the front desk , always approachable and very kind hearted. Randi the manager maintains a positive outlook on all guest and always goes out her way to comfort them with their enquires. Its very family orientated and thats why i always go back.

We arrived at this iconic hotel and our bags were promptly taken away and whisked to the front desk where we were greeted by Bryce and Paris ( Paris was in training). They had great smiles and checked us in quickly all while asking the appropriate questions about our stay. We told them that my 11 year old niece and I were celebrating our birthdays. After quickly getting us checked in they went into the back and came back with flower lei's for us all. Special treat for my nieces, as this was their first time to Hawaii. Later that evening after we went out to explore and grab some dinner we came back to a mini chocolate cake with chocolate covered strawberries that said Happy Birthday, box of chocolates and iced tea. How delightful was this for my niece who felt so special !! Our stay for 6 nights was wonderful, beds were very comfortable, everyone including the housekeepers met us with a smile and warm greeting. I feel that the hotel on a whole contributed to make our stay as best as possible. The men at the concierge desk helped us plan our day excursion to the North Shore and mapped out places of interest as well as lunch options. They did a great job in doing so. We stayed a few days poolside and Kelsey the server for the Splash Bar was very kind and friendly. Everyday she kept us well hydrated with our favorite drinks and snacks. The hotel overall was very intimate and has one of the best locations that you almost feel right on Waikiki beach. Everyday bright and early they cleaned and maintained the grounds so that everything was pristine. I really recommend giving this hotel a try, the price was so affordable that we are already planning another stay and will definitely stay here.

It was my husband & I first trip to Hawaii & the Sheraton Princess was a great location & great service hotel. Beeautiful view of the ovean from our room & the Splash Bar had great food, drinks & live music. We will definitely stay here again. Only complaint is, the rooms could us a little updating & comfort of bed was average. We had an amazing trip & cant wait till we come back.

My husband and I did a quick weekend get away. we stayed here before, but during the strike we stayed else where. We had the sweetest lady, Erin, front desk to help us.She noticed my husband could not speak and needed bathroom, she pointed and when he returned confused, she told me she would watch my luggage while I assisted him. I asked if there was a room up high cause my disabled husband does not travel far from hotel anymore..She found us a room high up and street view..when my husband saw the balcony ..he cryed with joy..even got up 4 am to sit on balcony remembering his many visits to Hawaii before his stroke. Erin even looked up theatre times for us.. It is employee like Erin that brings us back to this hotel..She is a gem!!!

I stayed here for only one night. The rooms reminded me of something straight out of the 1980s. At least that was probably the last time they were updated. The bathroom was the worst part of the room. Not only was the shower the cheapest shower I have ever seen but it was filthy. It had black hairs all over the walls and floor. A few hairs I can forgive but this was bad. The toilet was worse. Covered with hairs and dried yellow gunk. I took a picture to send to Marriott. I have contacted them twice about the stay but have not received any response. I travel a lot and am a lifetime Marriott Titanium member (over +600 stays) and they still won’t email me back. Good luck if you stay here.

Great location !Staff is friendly and welcoming.Rooms were clean with perfect view.If you have any questions just ask Chance,he greets you outside the hotel.Patricia is wonderful at the breakfast buffet where you can get the best omelettes and croissants. The only unfortunate thing was that we had a late flight and there was no hospitality room available to freshen up before we went to the airport.

Had the opportunity to stay here for one night in Waikiki. Beautiful, clean hotel with location that can’t be beat. Easy walking distance to the beach and shops, nice pool and bar service was good! Friendly staff and great breakfast in the morning!!

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, and I have to say that I was shocked. The property is clearly aged (aging would have been 15 years ago). Elevators, corridors and bedrooms looked great 30 years ago...but in 2019, It is a disgrace from Starwood now Marriott! (Please check the two pictures I am attaching). The location of the hotel is great, and the people working there are doing their best to make their customer feel special. The owner is probably making so much money (the room was not cheap), that he has not reason to tear down the property and build a new one (I am afraid that given the state of the hotel, this is all they can do). So the location is good, and the staff is up to par. But they are many other hotels in the area, the other Sheraton is not far, and there is a Westin managed property accross the street...so if you are a fan of Starwood or Marriott hotels, treat yourself to an experience you deserve. (I have not visited nor checked any other property in the area, so you might want to do some homework before hand). Last but not least, the breakfast 'buffet' is a total riff off! Over $30 for this? I understand this is Hawaii and that all the food is imported, but $30 for an omelette, a disgusting coffee, some fruits and yogurts...But the staff is nice.

This hotel is kept nice on the outside, but the rooms are in SERIOUS need of a makeover. Painted wallpaper, gross rusty bathroom, worn out dirty carpet (just to name some highlights). As a Platinum “Elite” it makes me wonder if THIS is the room they picked for me, what do other rooms look like? I called the front desk and told them the room was disgusting, but could they send me a robe? No questions asked! Can’t wait to get out of here! Salt in the wound, they charged me 35.00 for a free night point stay for a resort fee!

Very reasonably priced and an old school atmosphere that is part of the charm  This is not a new or five-star resort but it has a great vibe Staff over all Are as good as they get Very nice pool area with music playing all day and then live music at night and very good bar service and snacks  The location really works you arein the heart of everything and a few blocks from the beach  Room sizes on the smaller size as is the bathroom but you can’t beat those Sheraton beds The value is there for the location  Towels, water ,fruit available at the pool as well as chairs to take to the beach

The location in Waikiki is great. You are close to the beach, close to shopping, close to restaurants, close to bars and music. The rooms are on the small side, and if you get a room next to the elevators you will hear a lot of noise. The bathrooms are dated with the shower/tub small. They have updated the electrical outlets giving you a number of outlets that also have USB's which was very nice. The breakfast buffet was good, very good fruit and omelettes. The service of everyone we encountered in the hotel was excellent. Getting towels and seatbacks for use on the Waikiki beach was very nice. Really nice perks was a pocket wifi that came free with the room so you can stay connected as you wandered the island.

This area has really changed in the past few years. It has so much more to see and do. The hotel has a very friendly staff who can help with any situation and concern. I really like the pool area but the ocean is just a few blocks away. Ocean view rooms are available.

The hotel staff was great. The rooms are outdated and not very big when compared to other 1 King rooms outside of Hawaii. The room was cramped and did not include the typical amenities (i.e. microwave, pull out bed). The staff made a big difference regarding our attitude on this property but, again, it is Hawaii.

I loved this hotel for location but also their restaurants. The breakfast buffet was awesome and the bar/restaurant with some of the best pork we had over the 2 weeks in Hawaii. There was a problem with the room when we first checked in but they more than made it right. Parking is expensive but seems normal for the area

We stayed for 16 days in January/February 2019. We found the location to be fine, the facilities beautiful, amenities nice, and the staff excellent. About the staff, we found them to be very people and service oriented.

Stayed one night before our cruise. Was practically on the beach. Walking distance to everything. Staff were friendly and greeted us with leis. We stayed on the back tower and had no view but the room served it’s purpose as all we required was clean room to shower and sleep as we prepared for our cruise.

Good hotel. Excellent ambience. Beautiful view. In close proximity to beach and shopping centre. Great facilities. Good wifi connectivity. Got an upgrade on checking in. Well maintained rooms. Staff courteous

Had great room on fourteenth floor, service to room was fantastic. Robert on reception made sure we were kept comfortable and sorted a couple of glitches for us he is a top guy. Bar, Gym and pool were easy to get to. Parking was too expensive at $35 dollars per night so we parked elsewhere within a 10 minute walk for free. 2 mins to beach. Also had a surprise on my 60th bithday with a Lovely cheesecake and a letter wishing me happy birthday from Kiana(Thanks). Plenty of places to eat in and around the hotel. We toured the island and had a great time. Thankyou

As a regular traveler to Honolulu I have stayed at most of the hotels at the Waikiki end of town – I’ve now stayed at this particular hotel on two occasions – like the other hotels in that area its location is just wonderful but the hotel also has some unique qualities as well – it has a great open entrance foyer with a cafe, bar and a pool – there is a coffee shop immediately outside the pool area which is operated separately – The drive-through entrance makes it easy on arrival and departure and there are always staff to help you from the moment you get out of your taxi – checkin was a breeze – I get a room with an oceanview and the closer your room is to the oceanfront the less obstruction there is – the rooms are quite large and very user friendly – I did have some difficulty late one night getting my door key card to work but the hotel night manager Robert was an amazing help on that occasion – Not that I have ever needed to use it but there is a separately operated medical service attached to the rear of the hotel – The hotel provides free coffee in the morning but there are multiple other lovely coffee shops with in a short walking distance – I travel to Honolulu to relax and this hotel is a great place to start

We only stayed one night. But it is a nice hotel in a very central position with everything within a short walk including the beach. The staff are great. Very helpful. The pool is ok but gets busy. Rooms are clean.

As a Marriott Platinum member, I had high expectations for this hotel, but unfortunately, my overall stay was a big letdown.Let's start with the check-in experience:There is a dedicated area for elite members, and fortunately when I arrived there was not a line so I didn't have to wait to check-in. I was also incredibly relieved to hear that I could get a room at 11:00 AM, which is a bit earlier than the normal check-in time. However, I did make this request known to the hotel several days in advance via e-mail, and also via the Marriott web-check-in service. As usual, the front desk has no record of this communication.The room:I booked an ocean view king room, and received exactly the same thing. I was expecting something better as a Platinum elite, but didn't receive any upgrades. Perhaps I should be happy because I was allowed to check-in early? I don't know... would have been nice to be given the choice.Parking:I had parking charged to the room, and the front desk issued a parking permit to show upon exiting the parking garage. Nobody told me I was supposed to have kept the original parking ticket issued by the machine, and I was royally chewed out by the ridiculous parking staff lady upon my first exit from the garage. She demanded my drivers license and recorded down all of my information. I wonder where all of that went?The Bill:The rate that I reserved included a $25 credit that could be used for anything at the hotel (with the exception of the resort fee, which of course, is absolutely ridiculous and should be waived for elite members, but that's another story...)Upon check-out, I was told that the $25.06 charge I had at the bar had not posted to my account, but not to worry, once it did, they would automatically waive the $25.00 leaving me with a $0.06 balance charged to my card.No surprise, the next day I see a revised bill with the ENTIRE $25.06 charged to my room, and also this charge posted to my credit card account.Post Service:My bad, I left a cell phone charger in the room. Let my mistake be notice to anyone staying at this hotel: it is a HUGE hassle to get anything back, so please be careful and do not leave anything behind.This hotel has a lost and found department that has banker's hours, e.g. they are only available during weekdays, during bank hours. You will not get your stuff back during the weekend.I reported my loss in person at the hotel the next day, and was told to simply pick up the "house phone" and ask for lost and found. Seriously.. I went physically back to the hotel during business hours and had to pick up a phone! How ridiculous is that!The guy took my info. and said he would call me back if they found anything. Guess what, no dice, Friday afternoon rolls around and now they're closed for the weekend.Overall not a good stay. I do not recommend this hotel.

This was an absolutely beautiful hotel with a great ocean view! The beds were comfortable and we had a balcony to sit and enjoy the views. Downstairs there is a bar and restaurant right next to the pool that is open late night. The location is prime, right in the middle of Waikiki with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby in walking distance!

SPK is located in the center of Waikiki, close to beach, shopping and restaurants.We got a city-view room at the 11th floor of the Ainahau Tower. Room is clean but quite outdated. The noise from AC Units of surrounding buildings are quite loud especially in the evening. Tip: If you stay at Ainahau Tower and need to park your vehicle, you can drive way up to the top floor of the parking garage, where you can easily access the elevator of the Ainahau Tower at 4th floor.

Based on the property, I rate this is a solid 3.5-star hotel. Yes, it’s dated and could benefit from a modernization, but the rooms and grounds are clean and well maintained. And it has a certain classic Hawaiian charm. Very often, this hotel is available at a lower rate than other Waikiki hotels, so it offers an excellent value. If you have reasonable expectations, this an excellent choice.What really sets this hotel apart is the staff. They were uniformly friendly, welcoming and helpful. Every interaction was polite and included a smile and a thank you. That is a sign that the hotel is well managed.The location is great, right on the beach and near the shopping, restaurants and nightlife of Waikiki. The rooms are a normal size and very clean, and the bathroom includes upscale toiletries. The bed was very comfortable, and the A/C worked well. As a Marriott elite member, I was upgraded to an ocean view.Internet was fast and the fitness facility, although small, was clean with a wide choice of aerobic and strength machines.I enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning. Lots of hot choices, including an omelet station, choice of proteins and fresh juices.During my stay, there were several Japanese tours in-house, as well as airline crews from United and American.The beach is across the street. The hotel pool was very relaxing and not crowded during my stay. It was a quiet oasis and Splash Bar serves some very tasty tropical cocktails.I would stay here again, and I certainly recommend the hotel, especially if you want to stay near the beach and the big resorts on Waikiki.

Some of you may or may not know Hawaii is incredibly expensive, so when looking for a hotel that is close to the beach and a good price was a must. We stayed at Sheraton Princess in Waikiki and although it’s not ocean front it is approximately a 3 minute walk across the street to the Waikiki public beach access! The hotel itself is okay, nothing too spectacular but for the price it’s all we needed. The pool is underwhelming so if you are looking for a pool I’d look elsewhere. Overall the location is prime! In the heart of downtown Waikiki, shopping galor and bars and restaurants as far as the eye can see. Also, we rented a car so paying for parking was anticipated so when I found out we could come and go as we pleased in our lot for $25 a Day was a major bonus! All in all, this hotel is perfect for the money!

Arrived late evening into the hotel just before christmas, checking in was easy everyone very helpful. The hotel is central in Waikiki with easy access to the beach, restaurants and other amenities. Room clean tidy and room for our family of 4, the pool and bar were clean and served local drinks.Would definitely stay again

I have stayed at many hotels in Waikiki but can honestly say that the Princess Kaiulani is now my favorite. The location is superb, directly across the street from the Westin Moana Surfrider and Outrigger on the Beach. Yes, it is an older property and many of the rooms are in need of renovation but the rooms are spotless and well maintained. Being Marriott Platinum did get me upgraded to an oceanview room and what a view that was! The pool area is lovely with live music every night. Of all the places that I have stayed, this felt the most like I was in Hawaii. If you are looking for a sleek, modern hotel, this place is probably not for you but if what you want is something that is clean, in the most perfect location and feels like a throwback to old Hawaii, then give this place a try. The staff is fabulous. From the gentleman at the check in counter, to the Bell Desk to Colleen at Pikake Terrace and Shanna, Rick and Eric in the bar, I was treated like a valued customer. I will be coming back soon!

Love the location of this hotel. I wish they would update it though. The hotel itself is very old and run down but the location is good. The breakfast buffet is pretty decent. It is very convenient to just walk down and you are in the middle of Waikiki. Lots of shopping and restaurants near by.

Check in could of had more hospitality knowing I was a local. Rooms were okay, the bathroom was renovated and the city view that I had asked for was the view of the parking structure.
