I feel sorry for the maintenance guy who had to fix it and look us in the eye knowing it wasn’t the first time by his explanation of “must be a clogged pipe......again!!!” The pool area is small and definitely doesn’t accommodate all of the hotel guests. We got to the pool early on Monday and got some good seats while waiting for our kids. As the sun shifted, we moved our chairs to capture some sun after two rainy days. We were not blocking access to the pool, walkways or anything, just giving our kids some sunshine to lay out in. The pool “staff” quickly came over and said we couldn’t even move our chairs or, let the umbrella (which by the way was shading ONLY our chairs) down. We asked him how can we get sun and his response showed a complete and utter lack of customer service when he said “go to the beach, there is sun their”. A beach with 3,000 people and waves that will knock you over. There are reasons people lay by the pool versus going to the beach....completely oblivious and quite frankly and obnoxious answer. The check in was with an individual who wasn’t interested in being someone who would make the stay pleasant, but rather someone who seemed bothered by the fact that he had to do his job. Between not being able to move chairs and dodging the little red fire ants along the pool sitting area the day was uneventful...One bright spot was a young man who was working at the desk the next day, who worked with us and provided some info and some good answers to questions. Understanding this was spring break, there seemed to be very few people from the US here, and it was mainly some wonderful people from South Korea and a Japan, many who I had some fantastic conversations with. Great people who tell me they love coming to Honolulu for a vacation and getting away from the hustle and bustle of their lives..Not sure how our check out will be but I am going to assume interesting to say the least. No call from the front desk with an apology but hoping for the best.Do not recommend this hotel if you are looking for relaxing or quiet...noisy main road, terrible views, loud people, parking garage with no space (and a $35.00 per day parking fee added to your bill)....

I really enjoy staying here. It was my 4th stay. The hotel is very central - handy to everything. The International Market Place is next door, Kings Village is opposite with a few take-aways attached (KFC, Subway etc) and also a large ABC store next to that. It's a short walk to the beach and handy to bus stops. The hotel itself has a good atmosphere. The Splash Bar by the pool is great with good happy hour prices. We stayed in the older tower which we found still good. Large room with refrigerator. I think though when booking a room you need to get at least a pool view room as some of the rooms would just overlook the car park which wouldn't be as nice. We did have one evening meal in the buffet restaurant which was just OK, otherwise I would definitely recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay again.

Stayed here with a group tour as our starting point for a cruise. Easy check in and out. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast buffet was very good with a great selection catering to all tastes. Room was spacious and clean. Very close to the beach. There several small fast food places about a block away where you can eat for less money-Subway, KFC, Burger King for a quick meal. Good food and service at the Splash Bar. Would definitely stay here again.

Have stayed here twice now - and i am returning for the 3rd time within the next couple of weeks. No doubt the service will be as good, staff as friendly and facilities as expected on my other stays. Having a view of pool and beach is fabulous, even though it is across the road from the sea, its an extremely short walking distance to the sand and surf:-) The pool is lovely - plenty of space in that area and I have never felt 'crowded in'. Was a little disapointed with the dinner buffet on my last visit - maybe it was just a bad day as this was my first time. Felt it was a little bland, but I shall be checking it out again shortly to see if things are any different.

We have been visiting Hawaii every 18 months or so for the past decade and this was our "Go to" for a place to stay right in the heart of Waikiki, but I'm afraid it's lost it's lustre. The lobby and pool bar etc are unchanged and welcoming, and the staff friendly, but the rest of the hotel is pretty tired, and service is lacking. Our room in the tower over looked the beach and the small balcony is fantastic, but the rooms are tiny - and I mean tiny. The outdoor furniture on the balcony was old and stained, the bathroom barely big enough to swing a cat, and three nights there was no hot water! The beds are comfortable but there isn't enough room for more than one tired old cane chair (the same one as our first visit 12 years ago!) in the corner of the room so one of us was forced to sit on the bed to watch TV in the evening. Add to this the fact our room didn't get made up on three occasions and when it did they still missed things like replacing the coffee, or the cups, or the creamer (It was hit and miss and never once done right) and the fact that they now slug you $35 per day for parking (that used to be included the 33 dollar a day resort fee) and the place isn't the value it once was. On previous visits we had things like complimentary drinks on arrival and a free photo by the fish pond. This visit we were supposed to get access to a GoPro camera and a portable wifi device but no-one seemed to know anything about it at check in and the "service desk" staff didn't either so we gave up on it. While you can't beat the location, the extra $35 for the parking really is disgraceful and this will be our last visit to the Princess Kaiulani - Sorry Sheraton - You've lost us.

Fantastic. Lovely Hotel, a quick and very friendly check in process, room was plenty big enough, an upgraded room (free) to the 8th floor meant our pool view also became an ocean view room, which was very nice. Nice pool area, with poolside bar and restaurant, we used both. The beach is literally across the street. Staff on the whole site were very friendly always smiling. If in Honolulu again would definitely stay here

A block from the beach, direct access to the Strip and its shopping and food, walkable to the zoo, aquarium and Art on a Fence, there are plenty of reasons to sing this property’s praises. But it is not just the location - the open air lobby opens up to the small pool (with great pool chairs), pool bar and the buffet; area artisans set up shop near the lobby. Rooms from the tower showcase beautiful views of the bay and the mountainside.Rooms are well kept and clean. The bed is comfy. Air-conditioning worked just fine. The balconies make the room! The only problem we had was the shower... the water flow was practically non existent. It took me a long time to wash my long hair. The bathroom is in desperate need of updating. And they need better towels.Front Desk staff provided a quick check in and out experience. They offered insights to area sights and greetings everyday. The breakfast buffet was delicious. They presented so many options... an omlette station, pasteries, fruits, salads, country cooking, and Japanese fare. You can’t leave here hungry. In fact, if you are waking up at the crack of dawn, this buffet will keep you growling stomach in check until lunch time easily. Everyone working at the buffet was friendly and we never had an issue being seated instantly. Easily a highlight.We were happy with everything (minus the shower), unless you consider the parking. Parking was another matter entirely. It is pricey - $35/day! That was obscene and the people that run the garage could be impatient and inflexible... do NOT forget your pink ticket or they will make you think the world is ending. The garage is not well marked. Our first trip into the winding monster meant we parked floors away from the hotel access point because there is virtually no signage. Turns are tight. Not everyone that parks there parks smartly meaning that tight spaces are even tighter. Since we sandwiched out Hawaii trip with Oahu, we only rented a car for 1 of our 2 stays this trip. You honestly don’t need a car in Waikiki... rent your car when you need it only. Save yourself this tacked on expense that is not included in the resort fee! Parking fees were a money sink on the final bill... $35/day adds up fast!

My best friend and I stayed here for a week and had a lovely stay. The Kaiulani Room was clean and renovated, bedding was very comfortable, only downside was that at times you could hear your neighbours movements and noises. Location was perfect, the beach literally across the road and in the heart of Waikiki. Another perk was the inclusion of an internet modem that we could take around the island with us, so handy and so convenient! Shoutout to I believe his name was Bo working at the towel station by the pool! Such a warm and friendly staff member! Made us feel so welcomed and comfortable! Mahalo! :)

Location was excellent, close to eateries, shopping, beach, zoo. Parking was $35/day which my work thankfully paid for. Parking structure often appeared full, but i was always able to find roof deck spots available. The $16 per person shuttle to and from the airport is actually not a bad deal, since we paid $38 for a taxi for 2 ppl, before tip. At times there were long waits for the elevators, while they were very fast, inexplicably a few would go out of service during peak hours. As SPG gold members, we got a priority line for check-in/check-out, we received breakfast buffet tickets for not 1 but 2 breakfasts ($30 value each) on two separate occasions. I got a room on the 21st floor, some things in the room seemed much more recently updated than the bathroom tiles which seemed very old. Bedding was comfortable. Lanai was a nice feature, but i got freaked out looking down. The city noise/construction site next door is quite loud at night. Fitness center was located in a ballroom with chandelier lighting, but i loved that it was very spacious for free weights, HITT, floor exercise purposes. View of the pool is included. Splash bar will give you free nori flavored popcorn with drink order. Splash bar service was very good at noon on a Monday, but otherwise i did not get to enjoy. Free live music or hula dancing most nights around the pool area. We barely took advantage of any of the resort fee ($30/night) inclusions.Staying this far into the heart of Waikiki, I will say it took 20-25 minutes every morning, leaving at 7am to get on the H1. It took 10-15 mintues to get on the H1 when i left at 6am. Also returning in the evening, the total commute took 1 hour, when theoretically the drive should have been 35 mintues (from East Side/Kailua). Map quest gave me bad directions from Kuhio Ave, as Kauilani is a one way street and Kanekapolei is 2 way for enough of the way to get you to parking garage.

We have stayed here each time We have visited Hawaii and we love it. Perfect position for everything. Across the road from the beach, central to shopping and restaurants. Beautiful view from the Tower accommodation. Lovely big rooms. Love to listen to the nightly entertainment from the balcony. They provide beach towels and chairs for the beach. They even provide ice blocks free of charge to have around the Pool. The pool rooms are good too if you don't want to pay extra for the tower with Beach view.

My wife and I just spent the last 9 nights at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani we stay here at least twice a year and the staff and service are fantastic, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.Looking forward to staying there again in October 2018.

Woke up to a great view of the beach. Hotel is across from the beach so less costly than those properties directly on the beach. Nice pool area. Pool chairs are very uncomfortable. Our room was comfortable however very dated furniture. We asked to be moved but hotel could not accommodate our request. Perhaps unwilling to move us as we used travel points to pay for the room. Bed comfortable. Staff very pleasant and friendly

First, the positives: The hotel is very clean in public areas and in the guest rooms. The staff is extremely friendly. It is not on the beachfront, but it is in an excellent location with easy access to the beach and the International Market Place.The negatives: The bathrooms are tiny. Parking costs $35 per 24 hours. There is the ever more popular "Resort Fee", which is always a rip-off. I asked what that included, and I was advised it was for free WiFi and make-your-own coffee and tea in the room. Wow! Also, when we checked-in, we walked into the assigned room, and someone else's luggage was in the room. We had to traipse back down to the front desk to get reassigned. They apologized, but comps were not offered.

I'll let the photos speak for themselves.... I own a hotel, and I really pay attention to how things should be for guest... so I was shocked at how bad Sheraton is! nearly $300/nt with rusty, moldy showers, bare drywall crumbling, clogged plumbing, and antique stuck faucets that are impossible to turn unless you use a towel. this hotel is a disgrace. the sad thing is they make a ton of money, they could easily fix it...but they choose not to. GO ANYWHERE ELSE... there is a lot to choose from in Waikiki that is cheaper and better.

The hotel is located one block off the beach. You’ll be on Waikiki beach within five minutes, by taking the poolside exit to Kalakaua Avenue, crossing the street and taking the small alleyway lined with surfboards (great photo op), next to the Cheese Cake Factory.The staff is friendly and service oriented. There is nightly Hawaiian dancing on an open stage for everybody’s enjoyment. The rooms come with refrigerator, safe, coffee machine, fast WiFi, and two bottles of water. The usual resort tax (approx.$33.00) is added to the room price. Parking is 35.00/ day however, no valet service is offered. All in all, good value and close proximity to the beach.

The hotel’s location is in the heart of Waikiki and right across the street from the beach. The spot also makes it more affordable than beachfront hotels. Still there is a luxurious and welcoming quality to Sheraton Princess. Beach towels and chairs are readily available from the morning through the evening and bottled water is stocked daily in the room. On the final night of our stay, we did have an issue with our room, but Andy from he front desk was quick to help us out and resolve the situation. Bob, the evening manager, also understood the issue and made sure we felt at ease. We were appreciative of their efforts and commend the excellent service they provided.

This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki and is 1 block from the beach. The hotel itself is aging and shows some wear, but the staff does a good job in keeping it clean and functional. The beds are Sheraton quality and the staff is excellent. As an SPG member I enjoy the fact there is a less expensive option when staying in Waikiki. I will continue to return here each time I return to Honolulu. Thanks for a great stay!

We got an upgrade to ocean view suite, the room is incredibly big with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a kitchen, also equipped with washing machine and dryer machine. However, this is an elegant, welcome hotel with stuff.

First time staying at this hotel. The location is perfect. It is centrally located on the Waikiki strip just across the street from the beach which is not really any longer of a walk then the hotels on the beach. When we checked in our room wasn't ready so they took our email and emailed us when it was. As a matter of fact housekeeping emailed us everyday when our room was finished being serviced. The hotel itself was very clean and staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was right as you walk out of the elevator and we thought it was going to be a noisy but it was not an issue at all. From our lanai we were able to watch the daily show they put on by the pool from our pool facing room. The room was plenty big with plenty of draw and closet space. There is an oversize safe in the room for convenience. There is a fridge in the room which comes in very handy on extended stays. They also rent microwaves for $10 a day. There is also a coffeemaker with tea and coffee which they replenish everyday. You can also request robes and slippers. I think the resort fee is a little high but they do give a few perks for it i.e. WiFi, free long distance calls, go pro rental, pool/beach towels, beach chairs and they come to beach and hand out fruit and cold water 3 times a day. The last was a really welcome perk. We did not use the hotel restaurants for we thought they were a little high priced. The bottom line is we had no complaints and would definitely stay again.

stayed for 10 days in January 2018. You are a 3 minute walk to the beach. Clean hotel with great staff all around. Pool Bar good with cheap food and good drink selection. If you like shopping it all close by. Only thing I will say is the $26 breakfast person is not worth the money. All guest get free Wi-Fi that works across the island.

Third time in a row staying here. Location is what makes it perfect. Beautiful little pool and very nice lobby. We made the most out of what you get for resort fee (go pro free rental for a day, free long distance calls, excellent wifi, unlimited beach towels, comfy and lightweight beach chairs, free fruit and water). If you really plan ahead the Alamo car rental place is literally across the street. All staff I encountered were very pleasant. Bit of a labour dispute happening on the morning we left (but that effected all hotels the same) with minimal annoyance. The room was great. A lot of complaints about the decor and the carpets but that doesn’t bother me in the least bit. Sure the bathroom tiles could be newer and a fresh coat of paint but for the price, it is very minor. The only part I didn’t like is that the rooms facing west towards the international market place are subject to hearing the constant groans of the big fans used next door. The pool facing rooms would be my preference. View from my room was pretty nice. We will come back and stay here again.

My husband and I just spent three nights at this property. The price, location, and service make this an excellent choice! Check-In: We originally booked a partial ocean view room but were upgraded at check-in to an ocean view room in the tower. Check-in was busy, but the SPG line moved quickly. Even though we arrived around noon, the room was ready. Room: The room was as expected - clean but dated (there's a reason this place is way cheaper than the other SPG hotels nearby). However, the large balcony and breathtaking view more than made up for an older room. The room has a fridge for personal use, a coffeemaker with tea and coffee, and one of the best hotel hairdryers I've come across. Housekeeping was great. They replenished everything consistently, and even provided us extra coffee, water, and cups without us asking. Our room was adjacent to the housekeeping area and service elevators. Surprisingly, this location was really quiet. We never heard the elevator or staff. And when we did see staff in the hallways, they always gave us a big smile and answered any questions we had.Bar: The bartenders were incredibly nice and accommodating, and the drinks are reasonably priced for a Waikiki resort. The bar offers complimentary popcorn with seaweed/furikake that is delicious.Pool/Beach: The pool felt cold to us, so we didn't go in. We either went in the ocean or sat by the pool. That being said, many kids and adults were in the pool everyday. There was plenty of seating, too. The drink/food service at the pool was fast! We rented towels and complimentary beach chairs to take to the beach every day. The chairs were a big plus. The pool station also offers ice pops and fruit..Location: You are right in the middle of everything, and directly across from the beach. Location can't be beat!Check-out: The hotel extended our check-out until noon, and then allowed us to stay until 2 pm for $30. We normally get late check-out as SPG Gold members, but we booked a hotel and flight package through Hawaiian this time. No problem! We checked out at 2 pm, hit the beach and happy hour, and came back to shower. The hotel offers a room for an hour so you can freshen up before your flight. This service was fantastic, and gave us a lot of flexibility on our last day before our red eye.

rooms:3/5 location:5/5bathroom:2/3lobby:2/3pool and gym:3/3service:3/3exterior design:1/2extra:4/16 (beach hotel, large hotel, view, balcony)total:26/40-price:750-1500/rooms:1152/stars:3my rating (experience): Good

My wife and I stayed here for a quick vacation in Honolulu. We stayed here because our in laws stay here every year. We can see why. The Princess is a beautiful facility from the lobby to the pool area to the rooms themselves. Check in was a little slow, but that was to get an upgrade. We stayed in a king in the tower. We had a view of the pool. Our room was very nice with a comfortable bed and an adequate bathroom. The decor was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We liked to eat at the Splash by the pool. The location could not be better, right in the heart of Waikiki and close to the beach. We will come again.

Our family of 5 thoroughly enjoyed our 7 night stay at the princess. We had connecting rooms, high floor overlooking Waikiki which were great. We knew in advance the rooms would be a little tired, but that became irrelevant as the rest of the hotel and location was excellent. One staff member was particularly good , Nathan, greeted us each morning and did some great activities with the kids (and grown ups!) - hula dancing, ukulele, bracelet making. Small pool, but with Waikiki across the road, we hardly used it. Liz in the restaurant was also outstanding. Would stay there again on our next visit.

My family booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 6 nights. We are SPG members and had stayed at this hotel many years ago. The 1st night in my room #569, we reported a big puddle of water next to the bed. Hotel Engineering did not know why and placed some towels on the puddle. The next morning, my spouse found and killed a live cockroach in the bathroom, and found out that the bathtub was somewhat clogged up. We reported issues to the Manager who could not change our rooms or accommodate our needs for a pleasant stay at this hotel. We are so disappointed with our stay and customer service at this hotel, and swear that we will never come back. Besides the issue encountered, the elevators are so slow even though the hotel is at a good location. After 1 night, we all moved to Alohilani Hotel which we like very much for the remaining 5 nights.

We were due to arrive late on the first night of our Hawaii vacation so I booked a room at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as a cheaper place to crash for one night before heading to our actual hotel for the duration of our stay. The property was pretty average across the board.A couple of specifics that did stand out: (1) The gentleman that checked us in was competent but couldn't have been more disinterested in his job. (2) Our room was recently updated, but with somewhat tone deaf design choices. For example, there was very limited counter space in the room so you really had to pick and choose what you could bring out of your bag and the narrow ledge above the toilet was positioned such that the toilet seat couldn't stay up without being held in position.Overall, since we only showed up, slept, and left in exchange for saving a few dollars, I am not sure I would retrospectively change my plan. If this is a real vacation day for you, however, I would recommend staying at one of the much nicer properties within blocks of this one. The price difference wasn't large enough to warrant spending vacation time here over other hotels.

Staff were friendly and welcoming upon arrival. Arrived early so had to wait to check in but did manage to check in a little earlier which was good as we were all exhausted from the flight.Partial ocean view room which was on the 9th floor and the views were great. Great view down to diamond head and the ocean.The room was clean and comfortable although a little on the small side when we were all in the room (2 adults, 2 teenagers) but that was mainly at night getting ready to go out. After 12 days it felt like the walls were closing in. Would definitely look to get a larger room next time. The room itself was ok, bathroom seemed dated but otherwise comfortable sleep. To be honest when you are in Honolulu you aren't spending time in your hotel room...Had breakfast at the buffet once and while the food was ok, it was very expensive and as we are not big eaters was not worth the money. Sometimes the smell of breakfast/dinner goes through the elevators, should have some air freshness in the elevator as the smell can be off putting sometimes.Splash bar is great to enjoy a few drinks by the pool or after a day out, staff are friendly and service is pretty good. If you don't want a fancy cocktail they will make normal cocktails if you ask. Had snacks a few times and they are pretty good also.Location is ideal. 5 minutes to the beach, restaurants, cafes and shops and ABC right across the road and another 5 within 5 minutes if that one doesn't have anything you need.Overall had no real complaints, just wish I booked a larger room.

We stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days. Our room is on the highest floor and partial ocean view. Our room is at SPG floor since we are gold member the room is nice and big for the 3 of us. We arrived at 11 am and they let us check in early and allowed us for late check out. Very convenient to Waikiki beach just across the street. They will let you borrow chair and beach towels. International market is just a few mins walk and there are a lot of restaurants and shop along the area. The buffet breakfast is just ok! They have laundry in the basement. Payment is 4$ for washer and 4$ for dryer. Soap is 3$ and you can change coins here as well. Take note that they also have the old building and it’s out dated but still ok a lot of airline crew use it so if the rooms for SPG is full or you’re not a member I think you stay here. My only disappointment with them is I left my Philip chariol bangle bracelet and when I reported it the front desk I talked to is not friendly so I went online for lost and found but they said they couldn’t find it at all even though I know I left it by the tv stand and I realize it when we left already.

Very comfortable hotel with a pool. Our room was spacious and reasonably decorated with a partial view of ocean and kalakaua Avenue. Or main street of Honolulu. We found the location great and central to activities. The resturant at hotel was expensive. We ate there once and then chose to dine elsewhere. But service was good. They gave us a complimentry fruit basket and chocolates for staying more than a week. Great position opposite beach. And night time shopping also easy to access. Highly recommend.

Spent the first 4 or 5 nights here of my tour of Hawaii and its islands (not Molokai) room was relatively spacious and clean with good views from the balcony where more than one (or ten) glasses of champagne were supped, I liked that the palm trees were lit up around the pool in the evening. The location of this hotel might be the best thing about it, your near enough directly opposite Waikiki Beach which of course is beautiful and really busy, even though its probably bigger I would say Palm Beach in Aruba is as nice.There are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars in the vicinity although I utterly detest the tipping culture in America, you cant just go out for a few beers as everyone one they bring you multiplies the tip and you even think about not tipping (I'm too self conscious not to) you will definitely know about it, all in all it was alright.

First time staying at this hotel and it wont be my last (already planning a trip back for Easter) From the moment we stepped out of our taxi at 7am the staff were welcoming and went out of their way to find us a room even though we arrived hours before check in. The hotel itself is perfect for families, couples, friends or solo travellers.The rooms are spacious and clean, we had a pool view room which i highly recommend, at night we could sit on our balcony and watch the live entertainment.A Drink/Meal at Spalsh bar is a must, service is second to none.

We love live music so we often try to find out of the ordinary venues to see and hear local musicians share their talents. We ended up at the Splash Bar near the pool. The local band Ke Akua Mele was playing and we enjoyed appetizers while they played. What a great time. The restaurant wait staff was very attentive and friendly. The hotel is beautiful and located (very conveniently) adjacent to Kalakaua Avenue (the main strip) in Waikiki. We’ll be returning every chance we get.

I have stayed at the Sheraton Princess before, and found the staff to be very helpful an polite and the service was good.On my recent visit,($400.00 per night) the staff were happy to lie about the wifi on arrival. The staff beside the pool do not want to serve customers and the breakfast was the worse I have ever had, if it was available at all. The service was non existent, and the cleaners for our room came knocking on our door to clean the room at 8.30am most mornings. Im on holidays, I don't want to leave my room that early.Breakfast was a joke, they had No bacon, No hash browns, No cereal bowls, No scrambled eggs, No pastries, No Bread, and what was available had been sitting in the hot box for up to 5 hours. The best of all was there is only 1 toaster available for the entire restaurant, and it was dodgy.The place is dated and the staff were taking down the Christmas decorations the morning after Christmas and stopping people from walking through the lobby safely. The staff on Check in and Check out had no idea about our bill and took ages to be given the wrong information.Overall I found it to be very expensive with little service and the rooms are dusty and only just cleaned.

The location of this hotel is great. A walking distance to good beaches, restaurants and a lot of other hotels in downtown Honolulu. The price is good for what you get. Yes, the hotel may need a touch up in a few years but for now, it is clean with very good service from the hotel staff. My TV remote was not working properly and I had someone sent up within 10 minutes to replace it. I shared the room with my sister. There were two full comfortable beds in it and we managed to get around. There was a small balcony where we could see the swimming pool and the beach. The hotel lobby has a nice aura/architecture! There is breakfast, decent but not fancy. Then again, you can not expect fancy if you are not paying for it. The swimming pool is not big but the beach is across the street. I had a lovely stay here after staying at another hotel away from the city center. If I visit Honolulu again, I will stay here again.

Totally delightful at the front desk Justin welcomed us. Splash bar in the lobby and super buffet. Clean and fast elevators. Friendly staff and close to the beach and shopping. 35 restaurants in 3 blocks

We stayed for 7 nights the week before Christmas and really enjoyed our experience at this hotel. Their Christmas decorations were so beautiful in the foyer. We were in a Tower Premium ocean view room on 29th floor and the view was amazing!Room was comfortable with 2 double beds and a good sized balcony.We had read that there we long waits for the lifts however we never had to wait for the lift during our stay.The staff are great and very accommodating.The location of the hotel is great - right in the middle of all the action in Waikiki.We paid $AU300 per night (including resort fee) which I thought was good value for money. We would stay again.

I only spent one night in this hotel before flying home to Sydney but it was central to everything in Waikiki right across the road from the beach and the higher you go the better the view . I stayed in the princess Taylor which overlooks the pool I am sore a beautiful sunset - I let the staff know that it was my birthday and a birthday cake was delivered to the room and much appreciated - Thoroughly recommend to anyone who needs a place to stay in Waikiki

This is the second time we have stayed here in 18 months. The hotel is across from Waikiki Beach, about 40m. The rooms are dated, however in saying this, they are spotlessly clean and the bedding very comfortable.What makes Princess Kaiulani stand out, are there staff. The wonderful Michelle from the Splash Bar remembered us and provided excellent service like the last time. I can't speak more highly of the other staff, genuinely interested and willing to have a chat and really make you feel welcome. Kapena, the guest services manager was very accommodating and genuine. We will be back, possibly in 12 months again!

We have been visiting the PK almost every year since 2012. It’s gone through some renovations and the international marketplace next door has been completely “replaced.” The location isn’t right on the beach but pretty much across the street from Waikiki beach. The resort fee no longer includes parking which is a shame. Parking was probably one of its most notable differences amongst its sister hotels (Moana Surfrider, Sheraton Waikiki...all located on the beach). Free parking kind of made up for the unheated pool, dated units, non beach location... Because the pool isn’t heated, it’s never too busy either. Still a great place to stay - friendly staff, good food and great location.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is NOT cheap. Yet, the rooms were small, smelly, very unclean. Our bathtub was clogged. Overall it just felt gross. And, they slap you with a charge of $28 USD/room if you want wi-fi (and a bunch of perks with external vendors that were totally irrelevant to us and I most guests, I would argue). That said, the lobby area/pool is decent, the travel desk staff and front desk staff were awesome. The location is perfect - you can get everywhere on foot from there.

We recently stayed for 7 days at this property.The location is nice and central to Waikiki and the top end shops that have now taken over this once tourist friendly area.Unfortunately the area has now lost its original Island charm and is really aimed at the affluent traveller, although lots of ordinary tourists still visit.The accommodation was comfortable although dated and in need of refurbishment.We were updated to a room with two double beds which while we appreciated, found were simply much smaller than we expected. Either a queen bed or king size would have been more appropriate.While the beds were comfortable they were very hot to sleep in indicatingerhaps each had a hot latex top.A daily resort fee of US$28 was added to the room rate as well as US$35 per night for parking which is quite high but probably in keeping with the high pricing of the area.A nice touch was the option of an AAT device to give us unlimited mobile data coverage while on the island which was included in the resort fee.A nice pool, bar and restaurant was also appreciated, although drinks and restaurant prices were not that cheap. Fortunately we had opted for a bed and breakfast package. The breakfasts were self serve, comprehensive and the food great.Over all, a recommended hotel that is centrally located to the busy Waikiki area.

We had a brief one-night stay at Princess Kaiulani and were treated very well as SPG Platinum guests. The property is worn and our room on the ninth floor was dated, but we had a good view of Waikiki Beach in the distance and enjoyed a good night's sleep. The staff was friendly, and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast buffet the following morning. Compared to other nearby properties, this one is a real value. We were told renovations were to begin soon. Hopefully, the reno will include more outlets in the guest rooms. With that, we would not hesitate to return.

From the time we arrived at hotel to time we left and all the bits in between.....fantastic. Arrived early in morning (8.30am) and room wasn't ready so we given the use of a short stay room for a couple of hours. Having flown through the night, we were tired and needed a shower to freshen up. This room was perfect. A little nap and we returned to reception around 10 am. Our room was ready. Our room was fantastic. Clean, great outlook, spacious....just perfect. our stay here was for 10 nights, wish it was more. Every staff member we had dealings with were friendly and so helpful (thanks). We were recommended this hotel by our travel agent, and would definitely stay here again. Position was the best, close to Waikiki beach, shops, restaurants and bars. Had several meals at Splash Bar and they were great. the history of hotel is very interesting as well. Just so much to rave about. Great, great, great

I recently made my annual trip to Hawaii and stayed at the Sheraton PK, as it's known. I can't say enough about the staff there, starting with the Customer Service manager, Mr. Robert Johnson. His staff (especially front-desk staff Tammy and Erin) are exceptional and all went out of there way when there was a huge mix-up in my reservations. I was on the verge of tears, but they handled my issue graciously and professionally. The entire staff at this hotel is exceptional. At the Splash Bar where I had several lunches and happy hours, the bartender (Shanna, and I hope I spelled it correctly) and wait staff (Angie, Debbie, Michelle) were efficient, friendly and some remembered me from previous years. I will continue to visit the PK and tell my friends about it. Thank you all so much for your attention, caring attitude and aloha spirit..

Let's just be candid. The hotel is old. They are starting to remodel parts of it but it definitely shows its age. But, if you want to stay in Waikiki it is a great location. They also go above and beyond to make up for their lack of amenities and age of property for the SPG Platinum guests in particular. I stay here almost every time when I'm in Honolulu because of the service and perks they give Platinum guests. The hotel itself would be a 3 star, the service and Platinum recognition are a 5, so I averaged the two for a solid 4 star and I would stay here again.

Our room doesn't come with view of the infamous beach. But, it has a view of the pool and it is spectacular day and night.Room size is good with two double beds and very helpful reception at check in. Compare to several years ago, they have implemented resort fee for guests using points. Hotel is old but it is well maintained and the market next door is totally rebuild.

I have been staying here for years and you can’t find better bang for your buck in my opinion. The hotel has been tastefully updated since my last visit. The location is perfect - you have the beach right across the street and you’re right in the heart of the best shopping and restaurants. The staff make you feel like family and this is the main reason we keep coming back!Mahalo for another amazing stay PK! Looking forward to the next visit already.

We stayed 5 nights at the Princess Kailuani and we loved it. Are the rooms a little old.... yes but I loved being in the heart of things. A quick stroll to the beach, shops, transport. Everything at your doorstep. We had a room overlooking the pool and at night we would sit out on the balcony and listen to the music from down stairs.We ate in the hotel on two separate occasions.... wow the serving sizes were really big so beware but the food tasted great. The staff were lovely and couldn't be more helpful. The pool was spectacular with its changing colors at night.I think it cost us just over $300 a night but for where it was... it was worth every penny. If you want something really fancy, then maybe this place isn't for you. It suited our needs down to the ground.Oh and don't forget about resort tax if you're working on a budget. You'll have to check how much this is with the hotel or travel agent and its payable at the end of your stay. I allows you to have free internet access and national and international phone calls up to an hour a day. There were a couple of other things included as well. There are two sections to the motel. One with about 6 floors and the other around 20 floors. We had no trouble in getting a lift when leaving on the 6 floors but there were many people booking out on the same day, all staying in the 20 floor section as they were all joining a cruise back to Australia. Our friends were staying in the 20 floor section and couldn't get a lift down. They were jam packed for quite a long time as people were checking out.

Stayed here for the second time. Wasn't disappointed. Rooms are comfy and clean beds really good. Service good. Staff very helpful. Large pool. Great bar that you can get food as well. Close to beach. About in the middle of everything right next door to the new international market place which is awesome. It does have a resort fee daily as most do. But I like this for location for me

Aloha!! i was very lucky to stay at this hotel!! i was there two times for a medical procedure and was greatful to get the same awesome room!! the view was perfect..the staff..especially the front desk was amazing..i highly recommend this hotel..the location is perfect as well..near eveything you want to go to..will be there again!!!

Just had a great 10 days at this hotel. Checked in at 8.00am, room wasn't ready but we were given a room to freshen up in and take a rest. We were very grateful for this as we had flown through the night. In less than 2 hours our room was ready. Great service. As it had been my birthday, a basket of fruit, nuts and drinks with a hand written card was delivered to our room. Nice touch. Stayed in the tower on 9th floor. Room and bathroom was nice and clean. The bed was so comfortable. Room service was excellent and any guest services requested were delivered within 5 minutes. The view from our room was amazing, looking out to Waikiki Beach and down to the pool. It was great having towels and deck chairs for the beach. We looked forward every day to the fruit and water that was offered to us on the beach by the hotel staff. The hotel is so central to everything. We ate at the Splash Bar regularly at night. Meals were really nice and well priced. Staff were friendly, particularly Leilani. We booked all our tours from the tour desk. Good service. We loved the history of the hotel. Good nightly music, however the music at 6.00am every morning through the speakers was fairly loud. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

If you’re looking for something in a good location this is an ok hotel. But that’s where the good vibes stop.The hotel is old, out dated and needs a revamp. The staff could be more accommodating- especially the front desk. The breakfast - only saving grace was the omelette station.If you’re expecting this hotel to live up to the Sheraton name - don’t. I would have very low expectations.

Celeste from the front desk started our anniversary trip off on the right foot. She was very welcoming and gracious. Make sure you get on the tenth floor or higher in the tower for great views. We really liked being able to head east on the beach and not feel cramped in.

This hotel is great. Centrally located. Very open about what resort fees are for. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms older but clean. Views fantastic. Splash bar meals value for money. They are happy for u to share meals.

yes, it's not completely renovated, which only means you will have a real midcentury modern tropical chair to sit in. Bathrooms were fine and super clean (the real test). Very respectful and well focused historical exhibits about Hawaiian culture and tradition. You save $100+ per night by being literally across the street from the beach instead of on it. The breakfast buffet was the only low point-- not servers' fault-- they were wonderful, but it is the nature of buffets-- eggs turn runny, fruit is meh, better to order off the breakfast menu.

Last year we stayed at the SPK after my wife was recovering from open heart surgery - and met Celeste Pagan on the SPG desk who made us feel very special and ensured we had a lovely ocean view room for a stress free holiday.Because of those great memories we contacted Celeste again and have just returned from another week of being pampered after she arranged a room on the 25th floor with a magnificent panoramic view of the ocean on one side and the mountains on the other .We also received lots of personal attention and felt part of the SPK family - with God's help we'll definitely be back again - our second home !Celeste is our guardian angel and we treasure our time there under her care.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 4 nights at the beginning of our three week trip to Hawaii to celebrate our wedding anniversary.The GOOD – check in and out was quick and easy. Our room was a decent size for a short stay, we had a poolview room and from the balcony also had a glimpse of the ocean. The hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shopping, bus and tram stops are also close by. Although we did not eat at the restaurant we did enjoy a few light meals at the Splash Bar. Service in this area was efficient and the wait staff were particularly friendly and polite. We tried a few menu items and sampled the daily cocktails, our favourite meals were the Coconut Shrimp and Buffalo Wings. The NOT SO GOOD – we went to bed early on the first night after a long flight from Australia and were woken a few hours later by an emergency evacuation alarm (twice), which turned out to be a false alarm, thankfully. The pool is not huge and there was a shortage of sun lounges at times. There is a guest laundry available but it does cost to use the washers and dryers. The hotel is quite dated and could definitely use a bit of a revamp but our room was clean so we were satisfied. As others have stated the elevators can be slow but we found it to only be a minor inconvenience at peak times.The DEAL BREAKER – we did not unpack our bags as we were only staying a short time before heading off on a cruise but while we were in Waikiki I purchased 2 new dresses to wear on the ship. One was just a beach/pool cover up but the other was a nice evening dress which I intended to wear to our anniversary dinner. I hung both dresses in the wardrobe to prevent them being creased and unfortunately I forgot to pack them when we left. Once onboard the ship I realised that I had left them behind but did not have any phone service at that time to be able to contact the hotel. I called Guest Services when I was able and advised the staff member what had happened, assuming that housekeeping would have noticed the garments when they were cleaning the room and put them aside. Guest Services tried to direct my call to the relevant area but they were not answering and eventually she took my name and number and said they would investigate and call me back. Nobody returned my call that day or the next so I called again and was told that I needed to complete an online form for lost items. I explained that I had already called and left my details and was still waiting on someone calling me back and I was not able to complete the online form.When we returned to Waikiki I followed up with the hotel again and advised that I would be making my way down to collect the dresses. This time someone from hotel security called me back and stated that nothing had been ‘handed in’ from our room but he would double check with housekeeping and get back to me – I’m still waiting. I accept responsibility for the loss as it was my error in leaving the dresses behind but can’t help feeling disappointed that I had to call three times before the hotel investigated (or not) and although the garments were not hugely expensive one in particular certainly had sentimental value to me.Would we stay here again? NO - holiday makers are spoilt for choice around this area and if we return to Honolulu I would not choose to stay here again.

We were traveling with friends on a budget so we made reservations at this hotel.The location is excellent and the staff was nice, however the "renovated rooms" still looked tired and the pool was very dated.on the plus side towels are offered and folding chairs for those hanging out across the street at the beach.

Updated to review below:The management has been very responsive to my concerns. The fixable items have all been resolved. The staff has been very accommodating. Thank you! We also since had the dinner buffet at the Pikake Terrace. The salad bar, with it's yummy poke & sushi, was extra special. I would not hesitate to return to the Sheraton.************* Original Review: *************My mom and I are on day 3 of a 10 day stay in Waikiki at this hotel. Here are my observations thus far:The good:Location - you can walk to just about anyplace in Waikiki.Pool - you can find sunshine all day long, and shade too if you prefer.Friendly staff. The bad:Room - tired decor. No new shampoo bottles after we used the original bottle from checkin.Termites - in our door which leave us little piles of gnawed wood every day. See pictures! But, better termites than the other, unmentionable bugs! :) We have reported these critters each day to the hotel. But we still have our new "pets."While the staff is friendly, upon checkin, there's very little instruction on how the resort works - other than you'll be paying a big resort fee. Are there activities? Where do you get the "refreshments" by the beach? And, I requested a daily newspaper, but have never seen one. The good news is, at the end of the day, I'm in Hawaii!

This was our second time staying at the Princess. I have to say the first time was good, this time was better. The hotel is clean and the rooms are a decent size. The staff are very friendly. The bar staff are exceptional. We ordered from the bar menu most nights and the amount of food was huge and tasted amazing. Highly recommend the Princess. Will stay again.

What a lovely space as soon as we stepped foot in this hotel it was nothing but good vibes. Justin at the front desk make sure we had a warmest welcomes was so nice and super friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel to couples, families or solo travellers. This space was beautiful, the breakfast that was included was absolutely amazing, pool was clean rooms were clean and just steps away from Waikiki Beach and tons of shopping and restaurants. I️ LOVED everything about this hotel and I’ll definitely return.

My wife and I travel to Hawaii twice a year and stay here, the staff are friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a great vacation.We recently stayed there for Halloween and again the staff and meals were fantastic looking forward to staying there again on our next trip

Good hotel well decorated with lots of nice seating areas. It is right in the main area of all the shops & restaurants. The pool is not large but adequate & well serviced & maintained, even noticed it had a mobility hoist to help people into the water. The food on offer around the pool was limited but tasty. We never ate in the main restaurant as too many other options available close by. Our room & bathroom were a good size, very clean with beautiful shell trim on the furniture. We were lucky enough to have a balcony at the side which overlooked the beach & main road. If you are a light sleeper like me take ear plugs as even on the 27 th floor you can hear the bin wagons doing their necessary job very early in the am.

Firstly the location is spot on, basically walk out the pool entrance, cross the street and you are in the ocean! Perfect.Our room was tidy, bed was comfortable, bathroom small but definately did the trick. Free WIFI - although its a big enough resort fee so that probably covers it.A welcome basket for us with some fresh fruit, drinks and snacks was a lovely surprise.The hotel is older but still glorious. All staff that we dealt with were very helpful and super polite.Splash bar - we spent a lot of time here and I had read some great reviews, they werent wrong, but one thing I would suggest is some background music, there could be better atmosphere there and Im not talking about the live music each night, have some music all the time there, the pool area and outdoor dining area is big enough that if people prefer quiet there is space for that.Tours were organised well altho we were overcharged for the outlet tour, were charged an extra $7 each, doesnt sound much but all adds up, however when we realised and bought it to the attention of the tour desk they apologised and refunded us.Overall a good place to stay, would we stay there again, yes!

We stayed here for the last two nights of our stay on Hawaii. Being SPG platinum members, we had hoped for an upgrade. Instead, we were given a second floor room that honestly looked like a dorm room. All it had was a bed, tiny desk, and old television. No chest of drawers or anything else in which to put your clothes. Walls were bare and full of scratches and discolorations. NOT up to Sheraton quality in any way. The website and room photos are deceiving and not representative of the hotel.That being said- location is central and staff were very courteous. We will not be returning, and would encourage management to up their rooming and quality standards.

We were here for anniversaries and a 50th birthday on a package and were very happy with the room, could do with refurbishing but clean and very comfortable bed. Cleaning staff were always helpful and friendly.Would have been good if there was a list of hotel activities in the room.Within walking distance to everything

To preface this review, my husband and I travelled first to Kauai for a week for our anniversary and decided to stay in Honolulu for one night on the way home. We chose this hotel for location and price. Neither of us are big city/big hotel people but we had a good experience at this hotel despite it being both! Parking is around the corner from the hotel and costs 35 dollars per night. The hotel allows you to park until midnight of the day of your checkout, so if you are planning to walk around Waikiki just leave the car in the garage. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a room with an amazing view on one of the top floors of the tower. Simply gorgeous. The room was basic but was very clean and did the job. Elevators, as others have mentioned, were not as frequent as they could have been but this is not the fault of the hotel - its an older building and only so many elevators were built.I must give a shout out to one amazing employee - Ziggy on the front desk. He took the time on our check in to answer questions about the island and even made recommendations on where to drive and what to do all with a smile. This young man is a shining example of what a welcome to a hotel should consist of. Thanks, Ziggy - you made our visit.The resort fee of 28 gives you beach towels, beach chairs, and internet access among other things. If you are only staying for one night, really it's just you paying for internet but I imagine if staying and going to the beach, having the chairs/towels/etc provided would be amazing and well worth it.The reason for the 4 instead of 5 rating is that on the morning of our checkout we went out to eat and returned to our room at 10 am (checkout is 11). After waiting for elevators for quite a while, we arrive at our room to find out that keys don't work. Housekeeping was there but would not let us in, nor would they radio down to the front desk. We had to wait again for elevators and go back down. We were then told that the timers on the door locks were not in sync with the real time so we were locked out because the doors thought it was after checkout time. We were also told it was a known problem and they had been trying to solve it for some time. Here's a simple solution. Program the keys with a later checkout to reflect the time the doors think it is. That way, guests will not leave with the last memory of an otherwise great stay as one of extreme annoyance. I truly hope the hotel has now solved this issue.We did not eat at the buffet (as we don't enjoy that style of eating) but did eat twice at the pool bar and it was great!!Overall, I would stay here again. Thanks again to Ziggy for making our stay memorable.

This was our fifth time staying at the Sheraton and I just realized that I have never reviewed it.It is centrally located in the Waikiki area and within walking distance of all the great restaurants, the Zoo and the beach.While the newer tower is nicer, we stayed in the original section overlooking the pool.All rooms are large and comfortable. Hotel staff are accommodating and friendly. The premise is well maintained and clean. Pricing is moderate and a good value for the area.We have stayed at a couple of other hotels, but have found the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani offers the best value.

I love staying at the Princess whenever I visit Honolulu, it's my favorite island. And I visit every year!! And I always stay a few days at the princess!! But this time was extra special, while checking in a lovely lady, Celeste helped us with all our needs, besides being beautiful and gracious, she gave us an excellent view and I sat outside all evening enjoying the sights and live music. It was just wonderful!!! The location is superb for Waikiki!! So while I was making my reservations for Afternoon tea at the Moana today, I was pleasantly surprised with a puffy envelope!!! Hmmm... and the sweetest note!!! To my surprise she made me her lovely plumeria hair flower for me and delivered to me!!!! OMG!!! I so admired it on her hair and she made me one!!! No one has ever been so special!!! I will forever remember her sweet Aloha!!!

Very comfy hotel, in a great location in Waikiki - only a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach. The room presented well, clean and well appointed. Just one thing, I felt the bathroom fixtures looked a bit "tired". There was nothing wrong - everything worked, it just looked like they hadn't been updated in a long time. The Splash Bar and pool area is a great way to relax after being out all day. The breakfast, while a little pricey, was delicious each day. Lots of variety.Overall a great place to stay in the centre of Waikiki.

Good smallish pool and a relaxed atmosphere among the staff. we were only there for four days but found the rooms spacious, clean and airy. The restaurant was very good with a nice variety of food and the snack bar near the poolside was equally accomodating.

Havent stayed at the PK yet but i always make sure to visit the splash bar daily. The food is great. Especially the popcorn. The mai tai was perfect and given i cant have pineapple juice i asked for orange instead and our waitress lei was all to happy to arrange it and really made us feel valued. My husband swears by the pussers grog coktail which comes in a custom made tiki pot glass and you get a souvenier tiki glass which is amazing and is now the only glass he uses for any alcohol. We cant praise lei enough for making sure everything we needed was sorted and was full of information and jokes and always recognises us no matter how long between trips. Thanks lei

Our waitress Leilani (on the few occasions that we have been to the bar) has been awesome. She is friendly, polite and full of wit. She makes coming to the bar a lot of fun. Leilani is very patient and tolerant with customers of different nationalities and non English speaking backgrounds. On a scale of 1-5 we would definitely give her a 7! The staff and food at this in hotel bar is great and we would definitely recommend and visit again.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a smaller Hotel located on Kaiulani Avenue across the street from the big hotels on the beach. There are two Sheraton’s in Waikiki so don't be confused as we originally were. This review is not about the Sheraton Waikiki which is much larger and more expensive. The PK lacks some amenities of the higher priced hotels but offers a pleasant stay at a reasonable price. While walking around we saw some other hotels in the area that we knew were even cheaper but when we visited them we knew that we definitely would not want to stay there.Here are some notes about the Princess Kaiulani.The entire staff was very helpful and friendly offering more service than I expected and made our stay very comfortable.The pool is small and the shallow area for the kids is even smaller. If you have a big family they will probably be bumping into each other.The pool side restaurant bar offered very tasty treats at a decent price for a mid-afternoon drink and snack.Breakfast at the hotel was limited. The main restaurant only served full breakfast buffet which cost about $26. They did not offer an a la carte menu for a simple coffee and a sweet roll or fruit which we would have liked.Although it's not right on the beach it's only a very short walk. You can check out a beach chair and towel in the pool area and take it to the beach. The public restrooms for the beach, snack bar and surfboard rentals are very close. The PK beach crew patrols the area regularly and will offer you cold bottled water and fresh fruit. Not as good as a cold beer or Maitai but it's a nice touch :-)We had a room on the 12th floor with a partial Ocean View. Our room was facing East toward Diamond Head, not directly South toward the water, but we still had a decent view of some of the beach (picture attached). When checking in, make sure you get something on the 12th floor or above or the building across the street will block all of your view.The room was not large but adequate for a week for two people. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. There was a refrigerator and single cup coffee pot in the room but no microwave. The bathroom vanity top was a little on the small side.This is a smaller hotel so there aren't any shops or chain restaurants on the premises. You will have to go outside for those.There are four elevators serving the tower and they were uncomfortably warm and always crowded. I have no suggestions for that. We just had to wait and squeeze in.If you rent a car you will need to pay $34 a day for parking at the hotel. I wouldn't think about trying to park on the street because it's very crowded in that area. Drive your car all the way up to the top level P5 to park it because that's where the elevator stops and it will be easy to get into the hotel from there.We enjoyed our stay at the Princess Kaiulani and found it very comfortable to come back to after a day of wandering through the bustle of Waikiki. Hope you found this review helpful and have a nice trip to Waikiki Beach.

This is our second time at the Princess Kaiulani, and I was not as pleased with this stay as the last, but this hotel is in a perfect location and offers great amenities. I'll start with the Cons. We booked three rooms for six guests 9 months in advance and paid for them upon booking. I reserved three KING Ocean View Rooms, and we were given three rooms with two queens/doubles (small beds) with ocean view. Upon check-in, I notified the gentleman that we wanted kings, and I even called to ensure we were getting kings. His reply was that I also requested high floors, and they just couldn't accommodate all of my wishes. Had I been given a free upgrade, I would not complain, but I paid for these rooms. Upon entering the rooms, I was saddened to see the same decor that we saw in 2010 when we stayed there. The carpets were tired as was the furniture. I know the hotel is undergoing room renovations, but when I paid for the upgraded room, I guess I assumed I'd get at least a king bed I wanted, but not two negatives so quickly. The room was clean except for the edges of the carpets, on light stain on the comforter, and the dust on the vent. I'll post pictures of that. The bathroom and furniture were all dust-free and well mopped. The positives far outweigh the negatives. The location is unbeatable, unless you're oceanfront, but this hotel is directly in front of the Moana and offers beautiful views. We like to stay at the Moana, but since we brought our parents on this trip, we opted to book the three rooms here and spend the difference on activities. This was a more cost-efficient option without sacrificing location. The hotel lobby is fun, and our parents all really enjoyed the energy with all the people and entertainment. There are plenty of sitting areas where you can relax and enjoy each other’s company in the lobby area. Another positive is the nightly entertainment. You can sit poolside and in the bar and enjoy live cultural performances as well as casual singing. We definitely enjoyed it. The bar drinks were yummy, and service was great! The buffet in the hotel seemed a little pricey for me, because I can't eat crab legs, but for the rest of our group, it was a bargain! :) The food was all fresh, and our dinner buffet included a variety of seafood and local options. Please note that sodas are not included in the buffet price.The pool is one of our favorite thing about this hotel. Compared to hotels in other cities, the pool might seem small, but it's actually larger than it looks in the pictures and large in comparison to other Waikiki hotels. It is a salt water pool (wonderful on the skin) and has a deep end. There are always lounge chairs available, as well, so there is no rush in reserving any. Our housekeepers were so nice and helpful. There is a desk in the hotel where you can book excursions if you'd like.Our parking fee was $35/day, but our resort fee was less than what we usually pay at hotels like Moana, so it was okay. There was also available parking each day for us. We had a large GMC Yukon XL, which is not the easiest to park in cramped quarters, but we managed to find parking every day. The hotel lends chairs and beach towels, which was awesome for beach time. :) There are also stores all around the hotel where you can buy anything you need like sunblock, umbrellas, etc. There is also a show in the hotel now. There is a gym, which we didn't use on this vacation, but it's nice to know it was there.On some days, there are craft vendors in the breezeway, and they have such beautiful handmade crafts. There were also places where the kids could learn how to make leis.I am not going to say I won't be back, because this hotel has far too many pros to push it aside. I will, however, request that my booking be matched as made without any petty excuses as to why I'm less important than any other guest. When I pay for a King upgrade with an ocean view, that's what I get anywhere else we go. Also, the carpet edges should be vacuumed, and the vents should be dusted/vacuumed, as well. My suggestion would be to definitely stay at the Princess K if you are going to Waikiki and it fits in your budget. Just ask for an renovated room. Other than that, I'm sure you will be pleased with the hotel. The location cannot be praised enough, and aside from my small gripes, I was quite pleased with our stay. With a renovated king room, I would have given this 5 stars.

I recently had a 1 night stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and I really wanted to love the facility, but I cant say it was great. I was booked into a recently renovated room and really had a great view, but the room still felt dated and old. The same could be said of the elevator and also the hallways. It really feel like you are walking into a time machine of Waikiki in the 1960's.The staff on the other hand were all great and very accommodating. They really seemed to care for the guest and were efficient with check in. Every interaction I had from the front desk staff to housekeeping to the restaurant were all great. Even with the tired looking facility, the staff was pretty amazing.While this is branded a Sheraton, it really feels more like a Four Points. I think having the Sheraton name allows for higher prices to be charged, but if you go in with the thought it is going to be more like a Four Points, you will be fine. As an SPG Platinum, normally I would have access to the Club Lounge. This location did not seem to have a club lounge but they did offer a coupon for both a small plate item in the evening and the breakfast buffet in the morning. Both coupons said that gratuity was included so that was nice also for it to be truly free. Overall, I felt treated very well in a facility that has seen better days. If looking for the true Sheraton experience, then go for the other one in Waikiki. If you have the right expectations going in, then you will have a good experience here.

My wife and I decided to have a honeymoon 4 years late. When we arrived to the hotel we found a bottle of red wine in our room with a welcome note from the staff. This was a great way to start off our 7 day stay. Our room was facing the pool and it was great after a long day out to relax with our patio door open listening to live music. Throughout the week of our stay the housekeeping staff occasionally put some flowers in our room with a little note for our honeymoon. This was a great personal touch.The concierge was very helpful in giving us directions to get to various local attractions. This hotel was good value for the price.

We've stayed at this hotel many years ago and stayed at this hotel again this month, both times our stay was enjoyable. Hotel is centrally located, rooms are kept clean, amenities excellent. The restaurant chef is very creative and innovative serving October fest styled menu this month. Enjoyed the bratwurst with sautéed red cabbage with recommended beer to accompany. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. We have a late flight in the evening and staff checking us out suggested using the hospitality room if we need to freshen up later. We took advantage of this offer and room itself was in a spic and span condition. There is a show by the outdoor pool in the evening and another show to entertain customers of the splash bar.The bell staff are very helpful and friendly. Will stay again at this hotel on our next visit in Honolulu.

Stayed here for 10 days. had a great time the rooms where serviced to a high standard every day. The hotel is close to the beach and numerous dining places. We spent alot of time at the hotels "SPLASH BAR" it was fantastic you can sit by the pool and order food and drinks with nightly entertainment on offer. A nice quiet place to relax after a big day. A special mention must go to HEIDI who is a waitress at the splash bar she should be made the head trainer for new wait staff, her happy friendly nature was second to none. I would go back to the Princess Kaiulani because of HEIDI and the central location and ease of getting to and from the beach.

Very happy with PK. Rooms a little outdated, but very comfortable. Great view over the top of Moana Surfrider. Good Breakfast, although not included only ate there once. Very central to everything. Very helpful staff in all areas. Would definitely stay there again. Thank you will be back!

I’ve combined 2 reviews for 2 stays here because TripAdvisor doesn’t allow 2 reviews of the same place within a 3 month period…Recently returned back to Australia from the Caribbean, I once again stayed here at PK “twice”, on the way there and also on the way back .. This time I decided to stay in the lower Princess block with a pool view room, I was on the 6th floor, once again I have nothing but praise for this hotel from the cleaning staff up, everyone always friendly. I surprised myself with how much I also enjoyed being at a lower level rather than way up high in the tower, I will say the lanai (balcony) is a bit tighter than the tower but nothing to worry about, you can still sit there and have your balcony doors wide open… a few of my favourite staff (Kathy on the desk, Heidi, Angie and Lei at the pool bar)were actually off on leave this time, however I did get to meet the most beautiful and helpful Gabriella from behind the scenes in HR while she was selling shirts to raise money for the children’s hospital, what a credit she is to this hotel! (hope she still has the kangaroo on her desk) .. also Linda on the desk to help you with go pro’s, portable wifi’s, sim cards etc was so friendly and helpful, as I’ve stated before, I don’t bother comparing other hotels for prices etc anymore, I just book here, so simple. My stay here on my return from the Caribbean was all I’d been looking forward to and hoping for after I had survived being trapped on the island of St Maarten when hurricane Irma hit, I was trapped there for 5 days without power or running water then evacuated to the Dominican Republic for 5 days til I could get back to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, to make my connection back to Honolulu via Las Vegas. I had been travelling for 21hrs including layovers, I was totally exhausted and quite sick when I arrived at SPK a little too early for my room to be ready, thank god Kathy was on the desk when I arrived, she organized a temporary room for me, so I could clean up and refresh and sleep til my room was ready, this time on the 5th floor.. I was sooo thankful for that, she went to the trouble of organizing a basket of goodies with a card attached to be sent to my room for me as well. This time I was on the 5th floor Princess Pool View room, which I enjoyed, it was clean and comfortable as is always the case, and it’s nice to have the afternoon/evening music drifting up. As the days passed, Kalei at the pool, after hearing my story also surprised me and had a nice little basket sent to my room .. (I wasn’t telling my story for baskets) what a great guy he is, I also want to mention Gregg and Erin at the front desk, always friendly and helpful, and beautiful little Leonora the cleaner on the 5th floor, always looking out for me and ready to chat. I Got to catch up with Heidi and Angie at the Splash bar who both gave me a great big hug too lol .. Another PC has been added to the business center which is a lot better than lining up for just the single one which was there. I wonder if Gabriella had something to do with that?? .. No wonder I love staying here! … I’ll be back in April/May.

We know it's expensive and the rooms are a little dated, but it is in a great location, staff are outstanding and they have a few features worth the extra: beach towels, chairs, go pros and other craft for guests. Excellent choice in Waikiki

The property is open and airy and in excellent condition. All the staff were extremely helpful, and just want to make sure your visit is stellar. Located just one block from the beach and near plenty of restaurants and retail, this is a gem.

We stayed here for 7 nights and wished we could have stayed elsewhere but were locked in with a travel agents package unfortunately. If we werent locked in we would have checked out after the first night and stayed elsewhere.Pro's:Self Parking is free however is included in the hefty US$27 daily resort feeGreat Location - straight across the road from Waiheke beachShower Room - we got in early and our room wasnt ready so they gave us a room to use for 1 hour to shower and freshen upCon's:The rooms are in desperate need of refurbishment, wallpaper had mold between joins, furniture old and battered, carpet smelly, old and worn. We were on the 17th floor and it was very noisy, street noise plus air conditioning unitsI would not classify this as a resort, it has a regular size pool and sun lounges, thats about it Restaurant - only had breakfast which was poor, with birds flying around, landing on tables, buffet and serving plates. In addition to this it was extremely expensive for a buffet breakfast. When walking past the restaurant at anytime there was an unpleasant smellLifts - very very slow & always full, you had to wait for multiple lifts to come and go Service - average, what turned us off was being repeatedly told about the checkout time of 11am when we were checking inFor the cost there are alot better places to stay

Definitely would not recommend several things at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. We had 4 rooms for our party and stayed here for 10 days with an average cost of $220. We moved rooms 4 times due to poor room conditions. There are several rooms where the AC does not work. The rooms had a minimum temperature of 78 degrees. One room had mold in it and another room had ants. We finally were moved to a newer remodeled room that the temperature would get down to 72 degrees. I could not believe that the rooms we were placed in were allowed to be utilized.When I asked about compensation for our troubles, we were given 2 adult tickets to buffet only. This was extremely disappointing because the buffet was limited in their food selection especially for those with food allergies. In addition, we would have had to pay for our kids to eat (which kids free was supposed to be included). As far as kids eat free, we were still charged at the splash bar restaurant for our kids' meals. The hotel stated that the splash bar was not considered a restaurant. It had a full menu and over 20 tables to sit at. Definitely would consider that a restaurant.Pool is not kid friendly. The staff restrict any toys and the less that 6 foot deep end is about 1/4 of pool. The majority of splash bar wait staff, with exception to Romeo only serve you when you flag them down. Positives are they offer seats for the beach and free icee poles for everyone. Definitely utilize somewhere else than the hotel's excursion desk. They are over priced and do not provide all details. For example, we reserved for Pearl Harbor. The tour was rushed and did not allow for time to do audio tour plus Arizona memorial. The hotel staff did not tell us that we would have to check bags at gate for a $4 charge per bag. Our tour guide provided misleading information regarding how much effort she had to put into obtaining our tickets. She often had a passive aggressive attitude and was extremely strict. 2nd example was we reserved the luau at the hotel. They told us to be a half 1/2 hour early. They failed to tell us there were kids activities before the event and our kids missed it. We then had very disappointed kids once they could not participate in the activities.I received a survey from the hotel and provided the above information with the disappointment. They provided a template response stating they would discuss with the hotel. I never received any follow up. Based on the amount of money spent at this hotel and their failure to provide adequate service, we will not be staying at a Sheraton or Marriott in the future.

Hotel is in a great location. Staff are always friendly & helpful. Rooms are on the large side. Amazing views from our room. Thank you to management & staff for another great stay. We will be back to enjoy your hospitality.

We recently stayed 4 nights can't complain about the room Only complaint would be from the kids not being aloud to have fun in the pool. Very strict rules which I feel are way over the top. Excellent location Breakfast is very over priced Great coffee shop by the pool Thanks
