My credit card showed unauthorized charges by SPK. I got no response for my messages when i tried to seek justification. Number of polite reminders were ignored. Even though the stay was good, house keeping staff was real nice.I was planning to return next year with my family but will not be staying with SPK. Will not recommend it to any of my friends and family. Disappointed.

This is our 3rd stay at the SPK, our family had a wonderful time at our stay here.We reserved the Skyline Partial Ocean View rooms which is newly refurbished.Clean rooms and nice comfortable beds. We enjoyed the daily buffet that was included in our reservation; we had fun at the pool and enjoyed the Splash bar menu.Looking forward to another Dayrit family vacation next year!

Hotel is a little tired in places, room had air con but was lacking in public areas . Splash bar is excellent. We had a room overlooking the pool and it was very noisy between 6 & 9 pm when live music is played.All staff were friendly, my thanks to Kathy at check in who just superb. If rooms were more modern and the hotel had air con throughout I would have rated a 5 star.

We had an amazing time at the Sheraton , the staff could not do enough for us and we were over the moon with our view from the room. The hotel had a buffet dinner option available which we used twice , the food was lovely and they prepared dishes to order like omelletes and kebabs. The poolside bar was also lovely and we had the biggest bowl of nachos ive ever seen. Rooms were immaculate and had a good sized fridge as well as complimentary water throughout the stay.

My 3rd time staying at the Princess Kaiulani and wont be my last. Rooms are spacious (2 adults) we had a Tower Ocean View room and that is what we got. It was lovely to walk out first thing in the morning and see the ocean glistening right up to Diamond Head. Staff were wonderful and very friendly, always greeted with a good morning or Aloha! Pool area was lovely, not noisy, could do with a few more umbrellas to share. Pool bar and snack bar was great. Try the chicken wings!! Entertainment every evening by the pool was a lovely way to end a relaxing day by the pool or beach or shopping. All in all we loved the Princess Kaiulani for its great location,staff and lovely rooms.

We visited in May of this year and it was a great place to stay. The location was great, and close to everything, ocean and restaurants. Pool area was fun, with a nice bar and great popcorn. Staff was fantastic, Helpful and professional in all areas.

Lovely hotel. Very welcoming staff. Loved the bar/pool area which had entertainment in the evenings. Pool is small but with Waikiki beach on your doorstep the pool is an extra luxury rather a necessity. They have 4 lifts but it only seemed one would work at any given time which meant that you either had to queue for one or you were jammed in one where people were to impatient to wait.The rooms were clean and serviced everyday, however could do with a facelift. The furniture is very dated and scruffy and the bathroom was limescale stained and rusty.However, this did not effect my stay and had a pool view room which was high enough to also have a view of the nearby beach.Lovely comfortable stay.

Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel is one of the four SPG properties on Oahu Island.This hotel offers best value with choices of great breakfast and dinner buffets. Saturday night is Lobster and Steak dinner, and rest of the week is crab legs and prime ribs.Morning breakfast includes live omelette chefs with beautiful fruits and wonderful Asian choices of dishes.Room staff and front desk staff are wonderful! It is right across from the Waikiki Beach.

A lot of people at this hotel - have to squeeze into the lift - luckily everyone else was tiny ha haClean - tidy - great location - good service The tour people were awesome we did a pearl Harbour tour and the Atlantis submarine which was awesome Would probably stay again

This hotel was booked as part of a cruise package for around 300 passengers whereby after a 11hr flight from Australia and a 6hr wait to get into our room without any sleep, we were in no mood to have problems getting into our room, but we did. Staff instructions on how and when to collect rooms keys was poor, instructions on where our room was actually located resulted in three visits back to the lobby for better information and when finally entering the room there was a maintenance person fixing a bathroom door for 2 hour and the double bed we ordered was two singles. That afternoon we were advised that the water was to be cut off between 2300-0300 over the next 2 days due to faulty pipe work, so no water to use toilet. Spoke to guest services twice about bed configuration, but nothing changed. Room service failed to replace sugar on tea/coffee tray for entire 4 days and had to pay a surcharge of $26 a day to get internet and bottled water that comes free in most hotels. Was never able to get a seat around the pool due to its small size and the number of guests the hotel has. The only upside was the view and the location. This hotel is a Sheraton in name only. It requires a major overhaul to meet the prices it charges and the number of people staying in it. Too many rooms and not enough quiet areas just too relax. Would only recommend for as a short stay only.

This is the 3rd time Staying at PK we love it here. The Princess room with pool view is awesome. Nice clean comfortable rooms. ABC store, and Eateries just across the road.We did miss Lei who used to work in the splash bar, her sevice was great and she was always very friendly. We will definately be back again. thank you PK

Enjoyed this hotel. Clean,comfortable and friendly.Would stay here again. Quiet as it is just off the main street.Great coffee stand just out the entrance by the pool.Should eat at The Cheesecake factory but if you go at night (5.30) onwards be prepared for an hours wait to get in but well worth the wait.

Yes it is a Sheraton by name, but it is ageing . They charge a $25 per day amenity fee, you get wifi ( free in most hotels ) two bottles of water per day & free parking. If you don't have a car then I'm not sure what the fee is really for ???The rooms are nice, the complimentary tea , coffee & toiletries replenished daily, nice clean rooms but the bathrooms are small.Most people complain about the waiting time at reception , we had to wait 15 to get to the counter to check in. Then to get my parking validated, I had to wait another 10 minutes.We wanted a make of the island, for the privalge I had to wait at the concierge counter for 15 minutes which sat two people but only 1 there to serve. I needed to book a transfer to the airport to pick up a hire car, another 10 minute wait, cost $16, when our friends turned up for drinks he showed me 3 adverts in the local brochure $8.95 each ???If you stay in the tall tower be aware the lifts are poorly programmed , there is generally a queue, we came down one day & a costumer walking the other way commented "what no queue".The hotel is well positioned just off the main dr with a very short walk toWaikiki beach.The beds are comfortable but we were on level 7 and paid for a city view, well at least we got a short view of some buildings & a glimpse of the water & not a car park view. The reason we put the sleep quality as average is because we could here the air conditioning fans on the roof top below & next to us.

During my extended stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, I was treated to extremely friendly and professional service by the front desk staff. On numerous occasions, I found myself going to the front desk with questions regarding my SPG membership, room rates, accounting, etc. and each time a staff member or manager was able to accommodate my request courteously and efficiently. I would like to specifically identify and highlight the great service of front desk staff members Ms. Uyen (sp.) and Ms. Erin and also the manager, Mr. Bob. Staff members like those mentioned above really put this property a cut above others. If you're planning a trip to Waikiki, I would highly recommend the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani because you'll rest assured that you're being taken care of by true hospitality professionals!

Only 1 night at Sheraton Princess. Location is perfect, just across Waikiki beach, shops & restaurants. In the resort fees, you can have a beach chair. Room need to be upgrade. We had a pool view but it was more a garage view.... Bed & room clean. For our next stop to Honolulu, for the same price, I'll try another hotel.

I have stayed at PK every year those last 10 years and it still maintain that cosy atmosphere.The staff is always doing its best to help despite the size of the property more than a thousand rooms it never feels crowded .....(there is a lot of Japanese guests and those are usually very discreet!)the food could be improved but there is the Moana Surfrider opposite.I complained some years ago when they introduce the resort fee for I do not use most of the benefits offered,29,50 usd per day for Internet,water in the room,towels on the beach and some other thingsThat does not prevent me to return there every year.It is a good place to be in Waikiki I regret however the constant increase of the rates ....thy are very good in yields management!!

This was the last hotel of our Elvis tour and it didn't disappoint. We had a fridge to keep cold drinks and fruit in and a much needed coffee making machine. The beds were clean and comfortable and the pillow cases seemed to be changed every day which was nice. Toiletries were replenished every day as was coffee, milk etc. We had a lovely balcony with a fantastic sea view and overlooking the pool where there was nightly entertainment. I couldn't fault it. It was fabulous. Well done to them. We were also just across the road from the beach and in the middle of the shopping areas.

We arrived at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani tired from over 20 hours of traveling but we were so excited to finally be there. Upon arrival we were checked in and given our room key. As soon as we entered the room we were so underwhelmed and disappointed. This was the first night of our honeymoon and we were expecting so much more. We had booked a room with a partial Ocean View. The furnishings in the room were extremely dated and the space was very small. The bathroom was basic, certainly not luxurious as had been sold to us by Kuoni our travel agent. When we opened the balcony door to have a look out to the ocean, I didn't know which way to look it was non existent. To top it off there was a bug on the bed so the room didn't even look clean. We called down to reception and told them about the view and that we weren't happy with the room. They moved us to a full ocean View. I would argue that this was actually partial but at this point it was probably as good as we were going to get. There was no acknowledgement of our honeymoon by the hotel in way of even a congratulations, it was a very disappointing start to the holiday. We didn't spend much time in the hotel as we booked lots of tours during our short stay in Oahu. Would definitely go back to Oahu but wouldn't recommend this hotel, pictures of rooms on website are not true representations.

This hotel was excellent. We had a Tower partial ocean view room. The view was great the room spacious and s lovely sit out balcony with pool view. Entertainment every night and really helpful staff especially Tommy at the concierge desk. Would certainly recommend this hotel. Stayed for six night with my daughter for her 50TH birthday present.

If it was not for some of the truly amazing people who work at PK I would rate this place a 2 however it does not seem fair to them. Speaking of which, there is not even an appropriate or easy way to give compliments to staff, no card to fill out etc, I was told I had to go on line...I tried, I could not figure out their system.The location is short walk away to the beach and they are in a convenient locations for restaurants/shopping.I enjoy the live music starting at 6pm daily.The Splash Bar has some good snacks like their lettuce wraps and quesadillas, well priced for quality. There are daily drink specials.- The staff at the front desk is rude, not helpful.- There is no concierge desk as there used to be, there is only a travel/trip desk and a desk to sell you property, seems they only care about making more money even though you are nickle and dimed here enough.-In the lobby area there is a water station to get water for your bottles, one half of it is broken and looks very unsanitary to say the least.-I have stayed here 3 times. Once the room had a horrible mold smell, once the room had horrible sound proofing, you could hear everything from the rooms next to you. Another time there were lots of black bugs, horrible AC and the AC was very loud. Two of those examples were very outdated rooms.-The breakfast is literally almost the exact same thing every day. The omelet makers are ornery and prefer to make omelets the easiest way for them which means a ridiculous amount of oil that you will be consuming so the omelet flips easily for them...there is a salad of quinoa or pasta or rice however it is usually drenched in oil, drenched! The dressing renders the salads useless to me. They seem to cater to one specific demographic.-The electronic equipment in the gym does not work well at all...I spend far too much time trying to get the control panels to work, I end up annoyed and wasting time.- The pool is too small for the property size.-The beds and bedding are not the standard Sheraton quality of the past. They are not comfortable.-The lobby needs more than one computer, it is difficult to find it free to be able to print your boarding passes etc.-There is an on site laundry if you would like to do your own laundry however the machines are front loaders and the plastic rims are always disgusting...I can not believe it is sanitary to do your laundry in those machines.

We were in Hawaii last week for my birthday started out at another hotel but with the Hurricane happening in Houston we were unable to get back. We were able to get a room at the Princess and were treated like royalty! Uyen at the front desk was so helpful and shared our problem with not being able to leave. When she heard it was my birthday that evening she sent a wonderful dessert to the room, gave us a late check out (which is like gold). We have stayed there before and have always been treated special but this trip was even better. Thank ya'll so much

Its like coming home (7th stay) and the PK never disappoints ....the hotel is close to everything ...shopping, dining, transport and of course the beach. the staff are always friendly and helpful from Darlette in the Office,who always looks after my bookings to Sharen at the desk with her smile .. no wonder the PK has a great name with these two here....then there is May-Rose from Housekeeping who was friendly and kept our room clean and fresh, and the 2 from the pool, Chase and Norman were always smiling and up for a chat when you went to get the towels, great place to stay, and yes i will be back.

One of the better 3 star hotels not exactly on the beach. Great location, 5 min walk to the beach. Booked it with Delta Vacations. I suspect I was upgraded to high floor room in the tower. Views from the balcony were very good. Service was great, AC was a little noisy, had to use ear plugs. The restroom looked outdated (but looked like I got an accessible room, so who knows how real bathroom looks like). The resort fee is excessive (but it was clearly disclosed to me). Overall would recommend,.

While not on the sand, this Sheraton has quick access to everything Waikiki has to offer in terms of shopping, dining, site seeing, etc. It offers a nice breakfast buffet and has two ABC stores within 100 feet for anything you might have forgot to pack.

We stayed here recently for 10 days. The room was very comfortable, especially the bed and the pillows. We had a beach view room, so that it was lovely just to sit on our balcony to have meals without the crowds, and everything you could need is close by. The room maid was lovely and always restocked tea, coffee, shampoo etc.We did find the pool quite small and crowded, and mostly could not find a seat to relax in, and most of the time all of the seats were in the sun, which was a bit disappointing as the beach was also crowded. We also thought it would be good to have a more extended menu in the splash bar, particularly for people who don't eat meat. This is the first time we have been to Hawaii and we had a fun, interesting and relaxing holiday.

Visited the Sheraton Princess in 2016, the staff were very friendly and we were welcomed at the front desk and offered a room to have a shower, change clothes and relax for an hour or so until our actual room was ready. Room was tidy and large enough for 2 adults to move around in. Location to the beach, shops and restaurants was great. if possible try and book an ocean view room, it definitely is worth the extra cash for the view.

We stayed for 10 nights August 2017, 2 adults and a 13 year old,The staff were very friendly , from check in, out and tour desk .Absolutely no complaints , our room was great , 534 pool view , always clean .Location perfect for us and we would stay here again .

There are some obvious good and bad characteristics of this place. They skimp out on a lot of things and compensate with others. Comfort - 2 The hotel is old and amenities are even older. The bathroom and amenities of this hotel is stuck in the 80's. not comforting when the bathroom tiles and the toilet is old and pastel in color. Cleanliness - 2Hairs were still left in the sink and bath. Also walked around the room barefoot and the were black. Location - 4On the edge of the strip instead of the center but every thing is around a 10 min walk. One of the good is the free towels and the usage of a GoPro. Will not return, there are many other options in the area that are that much better.

Booked with the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as the location is perfect and it didn't destroy the budget as we were also paying for our two adult children.In a nutshell, the Hotel is terrific! I could 'nit pick' and find faults if I wanted to, but my objective was to relax and spend quality time with my family, so small complaints pale into insignificance!The rooms (2154 & 2156) were amazing!! The views were to die for! The airconditioning was cool and the bathrooms (whilst a little bit dated) were very adequate! We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment, but did spend a bit of time by the pool and found it fairly small and very public, as all the rooms seem to look down on you and people were using the pool area as a thouroughfare to the elevators.All told, we were very happy with the Hotel and the services they provided and would probably come back on our return.Thank you Sheraton Princess Kailulani.

We stayed at the sheraton princess for 9 nights in August 2017 and find the staff friendly, hotel clean and it is close to many local shops and restaurants which is handy indeed. There are nice crafts stands in the foyer where you can buy beautiful local paintings and jewellery as well as other crafts each night. We particularly love the paintings by Heather who paints and sells her paintings in the hotel foyer 3 days a week. We have been staying at this hotel during our Hawaii holidays for the past 4 years. My criticisms are the beds are double size and would like to have had queens size beds which we have at home, and the rediculous compulsory resort fee (which is a common hotel fee in most Hawaiian hotels) and it's inclusions which hits the hip pocket. Last year the resort fee included free parking where it does not include any more, so now to pay $70USD for parking and the resort fee each day on top of your accommodation fees is very expensive. There is a nearby parking station at $20 per day which is half the price for parking at the Sheraton Princess, so we ended up parking at the $20 parking station.We love Hawaii and enjoy our stay at the Sheraton Princess each time. Unfortunately each time we visit everything becomes more expensive.

stayed in hotel for 2 nights. from check in/out to pool side/beach service, everybody is helpful and friendly. especially free beach chair/beach towels and free cold water/apples/oranges delivered to beach 3 times a day, music/singer/dancer at night.great value and will be back

This hotel is well located a half block from the beach. You don't really need to be located on the beach in this area, it's a very easy walk. Access to the hotel is difficult at first, the entrance is tiny compared to most grand hotel entrances. The hustle and bustle makes it even more difficult. Valet was full show is was a cluster to drive up and get sent over to the parking garage which was difficult to find also. The hotel itself is pretty average but clean. The staff were excellent, friendly, helpful. My room was on the 25th floor, awesome view but not if you're afraid of heights.Shops, eateries and beach are just a few steps away. The pool is nothing to rave about. Don't stay here if you're wanting to relax poolside by a beautifully landscaped meandering pool. This is a round concrete hole in the ground with water in it and lounges around it. It's basic. I'd stay here again though, no problem.

I stayed at this Sheraton specifically because it offered a business rate for a work trip. The room: mine was a city view overlooking the International Market Place. The room is probably the most basic and oldest I've stayed in for a SPG hotel. The AC, TV, wireless internet and shower all worked well and was sufficient for a business traveler who does not spend time in the room. The hotel lobby is a mix of modern and very dated design - not sure why the whole thing hasn't been renovated. The pool area is decent and gets plenty of sun even until 5pm. Parking is steep at $35 a day. What are the positives? First of all, I would have normally given this a 3 rating, but the staff were above and beyond professional, very friendly, and helped me recover a passport I left in my room safe. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel in Waikiki, close to restaurants, shops, and beach, at a decent price for the area, this is it. The fact that you could walk out the door and safely walk in any direction with so much to see along Waikiki's main strip is probably the biggest seller. Of course, this is not your parents' Waikiki and there are way better areas to stay than Honolulu if this is your first time to Hawaii. Negatives? If you are a room and view snob, this is not for you. The rooms, elevator and some lobby areas are very dated. That said, it's all surprisingly functional.

Though we only stayed for 3 days between our cruise program, we found the staff,the atmosphere & so handy to everything on the main drag of Honolulu. Rooms very comfortable, view was spectacular & service first class. Throughly recommend.

This property can be 5 stars with a remodel. It is perfectly located across from the beach, next to the International Marketplace, across from Westin Moana Surfrider, and next to lots of shopping! No need for a car unless you are going out of Waikiki area. Where the Sheraton PK falls short is the room quality. The overall size is ok but the rooms are very tired. We heard they are going to completely change this hotel in the near future. It certainly needs it. The vibe of the restaurant, bar, and pool area reflect the type of hotel this has become. It is not a happening place. There are people but certainly not a lively bunch (at least during the 4 times I've been in the property or stayed there). Comparatively, go over to the Sheraton Waikiki and it has a completely different vibe...lively, happening, young. Bottom line is this - if you like the beach and want a great location, this place is worth it. If you got to have a happening hotel with fantastic rooms, wait until they remodel.

Decided to book 10 days here for my wife's birthday. Just like you probably did, I searched and found that this hotel was cheaper than many of the others. If you are ok not being in a fancy 5 star, go for it! Room was nice and clean and we were upgraded to a full ocean view room. Celeste at the front desk treated us with so much aloha from the moment we walked in. Shower was nice and hot and the in room coffee and water are free. As you probably seen already, there is a pool. It was full of kids every day that we were there and they seemed to be having fun. I personally don't understand going to Hawaii and swimming in a pool. GO TO THE BEACH!Never the less, the pool was cleaned every morning and was ready to go daily. We tried the hotel's breakfast buffet and I do not recommend it. You can find far better selection for the same price just minutes away.I do recommend the splash bar! Bartender Shawna (I know I spelled that wrong, sorry) was awesome! She greated us by name everyday and introduced us to the other staff members like we were long time friends. We shared lots of laughs with the splash bar crew and enjoyed the daily specials. They are also great for tips on what to do, where to go and things to see.Waikiki is all about location and the Sheraton princess kaiulani is located central to everything. If you plan on taking any tours, the pick up point for everything is right out the front door. Shopping and good eats are all around you, everything is walking distance. Parking is $35 per day so we didn't pick up a car for the first few days in order to save money.All in all this is a great place to stay. Staff was great, room was clean, close to everything. No one goes to Hawaii to sit in Their room, why not save a little and use it elsewhere on your trip? That's what we did and will do again. We recommend this hotel and will book again.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani was our home while in Honolulu and we loved it. Well p[resented rooms, great service and everything just a few steps away. Waikiki Beach across the road, and restaurants galore along the beach strip. We attended the Tales Of the Pacific show which was amazing and there are nightly live music sessions and Hula Dancing. The pool is very inviting and the service is second to none. Thanks to all that made our stay so great.

Although this hotel is a wee bit dated, it is so charming and very beautiful. We found our room very clean and tidy and bed very comfy. The hotel is only one block from the beach and very close to the International Market and also there are a lot of eateries around too. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and we loved the Splash bar and did spend a wee bit of time there. Also just across from an ABC store which has everything you might need from food to clothes to even wine and beer.

4th time we have stayed at this hotel, was surprised and disappointed to see how much the place has been allowed to go...carpets need replacing, curtains in our room had holes, shower in desperate need of an upgrade...the pool area has not changed any..the parking charges are outrageous, all i can figure is that like many other places they have figured out they have a captive audience and charge $35 per day to park...the first time we stayed parking and resort fees did not exist....then resort fees, and now both...sadly it will be our last stay here...Caution, if making reservations directly with them be careful, we paid all fees upfront only to be told "we did not and were forced into forking out another $400 in fees"...not happy...

We arrived about 3 hours too early for check-in, that was just the way the flights went. So the room wasn't ready till then and we had flown through the night. Upgraded us to a Ocean view, extra $600US for 10 days + $32 a day hotel fee on top of our original rate. We took it, it was expensive, but we don't regret the view. Room 1850, beautiful view!decor: needs upgrading, still a bit 70's, scratched used lamps and the bathroom tiles are all very dated. They have updated some fixtures for charging via usb, these need to be integrated better. needs international sockets also 2.5/5Room size: Small for the price 2/5Beds: two standard double beds for a family of four. 2.5/5Service: reception, housekeeping, wait staff, pool attendants 4.5/5Facilities: overall daily entertainment, grounds, restaurant $$/$$$$ , 4/5Bar prices- ouch $7US a beer. Mai tai and a beer$18US goto an ABC.It has some perks, like getting beach chairs at the pool desk to take to the beach, and checking in and out you towels, as many as u like. buy. beach umbrella cheap somewhere, you won't regret it. It is a centrally located hotel in the heart of waikiki, safe day and night, top spot. Go another street back from the beach for groceries and supplies. Have fun!

Really enjoyable trip to this pearl in the Pacific. Awesome staff, cuisine and amenities, and a nice view of the ocean. We stayed at 3 x different hotels during our stay in Hawaii and actually the service, food and amenities were wonderful at all.

My brother and his girlfriend have stayed here a few times so I was going in with positive expectations. The room size was good, the bathroom was okay. Not much counter space but whatever. The balcony was useless, it was so small I didn't even bother sitting out there. One of the beds had a brown stain on the sheet skirt. It was so gross. The fridge had mold. And the bathroom sink faucet smelled disgusting every time we turned it on. Made me want to use bottled water when brushing.My immediate impression was not good. The staff I encountered with was pretty nice, but when we called the front desk and asked to find out where out tour bus would be picking us up, no one knew nor did they offer to help find out. How does no one know? Guests go on tours all the time. Luckily there was one guy that ended up to be helpful and guided us in the right direction.The elevator was slow and stuffy. It would stop and take awhile before actually opening. Parking was $35/day yet the parking lot was a disaster. I can't even explain how to get there and where to find the elevator because it was beyond confusing! Everyone we met was also confused. This wasn't a low quality hotel but it sure fit the description. I've stayed at old hotel before and have never seen mold or stains until this one.The pool was disappointing. It closed at 7pm and was nothing but a regular old pool that had a ton of sand and rocks at the bottom. I did appreciate the free towel and beach chair rentals that we were able to leave the property with.I'm not a high maintenance traveler but I also don't appreciate stains, mold, and weak customer service. I know this hotel has been around for a long time, I highly encourage them to step it up and provided a better experience for their guests. They are in a great location, they should do more to make this place desirable to stay at. Needless to say, I would not go back.

We had one of the older rooms on the 7th floor. The room was fine and we could see the ocean. We had a poolside room. Had a appetizer and drinks everyday at the splash bar for lunch which was very nice and everyone that worked there are very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Location was awesome! Walking distance to lots of shopping and restaurants. Also beach across the street and loved that they supplied beach towels and chairs.

My SPG Platinum status was recognized, and I received an upgrade to a high level Tower Room. It was a wonderful room, with a good size Balcony facing the South, looking over the Westin and the Waikiki beach. The room was a fair size, with good size LCD TV and a decent bathroom.  The bed was quite comfortable, and as a Platinum member, I received free Wifi, and FREE international phone calls. Isn't that a special treat !!! Despite the common facility is a bit of outdated, it is a super popular hotel. Lots of tourists and visitors stay here. I can see why, the location is fantastic, it is right in the heart of Waikiki beach. You can walk across the street, to get to the beach, and you turn left, or right, there is all the restaurants and the shopping to keep all ages happy. Yes, the first floor buffet dining area is definitely very outdated, and badly in need of new face lift. But, other than the breakfast, we are always out of the hotel, either at the beach, walking up and down the strip, or enjoy the beautiful scenery from our Balcony. So, the lobby area does not really bother us at all.

Me and my new husband just stayed here on our honeymoon. We enjoyed this hotel very much. They gave us complimentary champagne when they heard that we were on our honeymoon. We had an ocean view room, the balcony had a beautiful view. We often just sat out there to relax. Probably the only thing that we can complain about was that the pool closes early. While we were there the majority of the time the pool closed at 7pm, and sometimes at 6pm. We usually travel once a year, and have never seen a pool close so early.

We recently stayed here for the 5th time and as always we had a great stay.The staff are very professional , friendly and willing to assist where ever they can. Rooms have just been refurbished and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is across the road from the main Waikiki beach and in a perfect location for shopping, restaurents and is next door to the new International Market Place. A big shout out to Terry one of the concierges who always has a smile and hello for you when you walk pass.

We have stayed at this hotel many times over the last few years.We always pay the bit extra and get a pool view room so we can take in the sights and sounds of the main "strip". We don't mind the hustle and bustle of the tourist area. The hotel is surrounded by a choice of restaurants, fast food outlets and convenience stores. The beach is just up the road and is a short, flat walk.Checking in and out is relatively seamless with never more than a few people waiting.There are often activities in the foyer, such as lei making, which the kids love.We had WIFI in our room, which worked ok.While the rooms are a little dated, they are kept clean and tidy and the staff servicing them are friendly and any issues are seen to in a timely manner.We didn't eat at the restaurant this time and whilst the food is very good it tends to be a little expensive for a family budget. The prices for cocktails and snacks around the pool aren't too bad.There is resort charge of $29 US Dollars, this used to include parking.However, a new additional parking charge of $35 per night has just been added. So i'm not sure what you get for the resort charge now????Talking to other tourists, a common talking point was that they wish the pool was open later than 7pm. Overall, I would stay here again but we will consider our options if extra charges continue to creep in.

The staff was very friendly and made the stay enjoyable. The breakfast is delicious. However, the rooms are exceptionally dated, with faded dusty carpets and furniture. I had an ant problem (the very tiny ones) on the desks and bathroom. I told the staff and they said they would address it but I'm not sure house keeping was able to do much. This room is not worth the price.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani (henceforth referred to in this review as 'SPK') and every other hotel in Hawaii has this going for it: it's really hard to be unhappy in Hawaii. Still, I will offer a balanced look at my three day business stay last month at SPK. As I live in a city, I was happy when work was over and we moved on to more beautiful and remote settings in Oahu. But, here is a look at the GREAT, GOOD, BAD, and UGLY in my stay at the SPK as I saw them. Then, I will offer some Bottom Line-type comments . . .GREAT* Vibe: The SPK strikes a perfect balance of being a great setting for either a business or vacation traveler (or both as was my case). One would feel just as comfortable strolling through the spacious and modern lobby in either a suit or bathing suit (I did both). It has a 'beach' feel and yet would serve a business traveler who must be able to entertain, etc. * Location - If you must be in the city, this is the location. This might be my first time ever that I have wrapped-up work at 6pm, traveled back to my hotel, and still have had abundant time to go to a beach. Crowded yet beautiful Waikiki Beach awaits two blocks away. From the SPK's front door you have about a minute walk before you are in water. Also, there are a ton of conveniences available in shops just next to the hotel. GOOD* Splash: the on-site Splash bar is terrific and relaxing. They offer a variety of mixed drinks and a competent menu. There is almost always a live music act and a festive feel. * Staff: In limited interactions, I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. They were happy to help with searching tickets and offering information.* View: there are an abundance of pics here that prove you are going to have a great view almost wherever you are placed. And, it's not just a view from a window - your room will have a nice balcony to enjoy it from. BAD (Room for Improvement)* A Tale of Two Hotels: we felt the SPK was almost like staying at two hotels at times. I mentioned the spacious and modern lobby. It will have you feeling like you are staying at a much more expensive hotel at times. From there though, I had to step onto a cramped and outdated elevator that took me to my cramped and outdated hallway and then room, which was also a bit cramped and outdated.* A/C Unit: my room's a/c unit was huge, loud, and old. The temp control box was digital and modern but . . . the unit ran loud and was very weak, meaning it had to be on most of the time. UGLY* Nothing ugly to report in beautiful Hawaii. BOTTOM LINE* If you are coming to Waikiki for work or vacation (I don't know why someone would come to the only city in Hawaii for vacation), the SPK will make an excellent base. All that Waikiki has to offer will be at your fingertips at a price that compares nicely to other properties. I am already dreaming of the day I return to beautiful Hawaii.

The princess Kaiulani was a great central location to stay in Waikiki. The location is literally across from Waikiki beach. The hotel has a nice relaxed environment. The check in process was easy and not too long. The restaurant has great daily happy hour cocktails and a good menu. The hotel lobby is modern and so was the room we stayed in. Great WIFI in the hotel and also in our room. The beds were super comfy along with the pillows. My one and only downfall to this hotel would be with one of the concierge staff members a lady called Terry. Terry was very rude and disrespectful. Terry greeted us whilst picking boiled lollies from jar and eating them whilst talking to us with her mouth basically full swirling these lollies around. Terry clearly did not want to help and assist us to book 3-4 tours that we wanted some information on and to book. Terry instead slid the brochures across the table and sent us on our way with not even explaining or going over anything. Guy, the other staff member who was also at the desk on the other hand was LOVLEY. Guy is your man to book tours and get helpful information from. STAY clear of Terry chewing her boiled lollies and scrolling through personal Internet sites not wanting to offer any assistance. Overall great location and very clean. Very friendly kind staff apart from Terry at the concierge desk.

This was my first time in Hawaii and I really had nothing to compare it with. I read various Trip Advisor reviews and selected this hotel. Some people complain about the smallest things... and there's no making them happy. I ignore them. The price was right since we got it on air miles, but their prices were more reasonable than other Waikiki hotels. The only added cost that I didn't see value in was the daily resort fee. There is also a daily parking fee if you have a car. The location of this hotel is great. It's centrally located across the road from the beach right in the center of all the action and night life. It's easy access from the street is also a plus. The pool area is well maintained with plenty of deck chairs and side tables. This hotel has everything you need for a short stay in Waikiki.

We booked this hotel at a conference rate (pretty good deal, but about a 20 minute walk from the convention center). They couldn't give us the requested king size bed so they gave us a "renovated" room. The room was pretty typical of a hotel room, but they really should have renovated the bathroom as well; the tiles were quite grimy looking. I did, however, love the balcony. Great views of the beach and the mountains! Extremely windy, though!Despite not being directly on the beach (just across the street), I appreciated the beach service the hotel provided. Towels and beach chairs were available by the pool and a few times a day someone from the hotel walked the beach with cold water, apples, and oranges.Side note because I thought it was interesting: The TVs in the lobby were advertising a Zumba class on Mondays and Wednesday at 4pm in the hotel. Wish I had gotten a chance to go!

I have been a spg gold member for over 15 years and I have to say this is by far the worst room I have stayed in. The hotel is in a nice location(not on the beach but right across the street), The parking is $35 a night and the resort fee is $29 a night, so if you rent a car you are in for $65 plus tax before you even pay for the room. I get that price because its Waikiki beach but I also think that my room would have looked like something else then from the 1970s. Mismatched furniture that looked like it was from a garage sale from somewhere in Honolulu and the a/c was horrible. Not what I expected for a starwood property. The lobby area and the pool have been updated so that is fine. One nice thing is that in your resort fee you can get a tommy Bahama beach chair to walk to the beach and 3 times a day they bring cold water and apples and oranges for resort guests.

Waited 1 hour in line for elevator. See picture.Booked double bed room, walked in and saw single bed. Front desk did not even apologize. Asked me to stand in line to check in again.Door lock to balcony was broken. Staff was rude.Definitely not Sheraton quality. More like Super 8.

Twenty years ago I stayed at this property while doing a program at UHI. In all of my trips back to Hawaii I have only stayed at this property, and feel a nostalgic connection to it. This trip, I was wrongly told that I could check in early. I actually didn't get a room until after 3pm. Nevertheless, our housekeeper (Madelyn) was great as was "Uncle Nate" (who does lei making, hula and ukelele lessons) became a part of my kids daily activity routine. This property is like going home for me, and the location, live entertainment, room cleanliness and customer care makes it such an important part of my investment in getting back to Hawaii.

We had 10 very relaxing and enjoyable nights recently. The location is second to none right in the heart of shopping, the beach, cafes and restaurants. The staff are incredibly friendly and professional. The rooms were in all honesty....disappointing. Very tired in a lot of areas and in need of some serious cosmetic especially the bathroom, paintwork, fittings and furnishings. I must say thou the bed and pillows were amazing! The pool area is "ok" again tired but acceptable. What did annoy me and other guests we met was the $28 a day fee for something??? A towel, a bottle of water? I am not sure... have stayed in many places all over the world and never had this daily add on.... the price is the price. Period. With so many amazing places to stay in the area i would be reluctant to return under the current conditions, sorry!

The hotel was nice. However pool was very small and the rooms where not up to date. The hotel is in a great location. Happy hour was expensive. Resort fees where applied when we got there we where not told about that. After we walked around we wish we would have stayed at a more upscale hotel..

The hotel is really nice, the staff is friendly. Morning buffet breakfast is amazing. Very close to the beach and the shopping area. Obviously smaller than the Sheraton Waikiki but its low price is the best catch.

Aloha.....been staying at this hotel when I visit Oahu. Always a pleasure to work with Erin. :) She is very accommodating and always looking to make your stay a "memorable" one. Mahalo ;) ERIN YOU ROCK!!!!

A great place to stay with the best staff you could wish for very helpful.one of the best location in waikiki close to everthing shops , food, beach ,and transport The hotel's pool is the best looking poolin town.

Very dissappointed after arriving today. Parking is no longer included in resort fee. $35 a night. Check in is strictly at 3. Came in at 12:30pm after tiring red eye flight feom new zealand and room was not available until 3. Check out is 11 am, instead of 12 am. I dont know what else is getting cut down.Wont book here no more. Aston circle did let me check in at 12 noon just a week ago!

Hi Everyone,We've just booked another stay this coming October but stayed at this hotel a few years back for our first family Hawaii trip. The location is awesome as it is literally right across from the beach! The room was spacious and lightly updated, but with a very few things wrong with the room and staff on our previous stay. The room was beautiful but had a burnt out bulb (which we didn't mind). The bathroom sink was not cleaned by Housecleaning and still had stains from the previous guests and a few other quirks here and there but nothing too big there where we needed staff involved.This upcoming October, we are staying for 7 nights as we are getting married in Waimanalo and hope the room is just as good as the last stay.Thanks again Staff, for the hard work you guys do everyday -- it is definitely appreciated by us Guests!Mahalo,Jake

My granddaughters and I stayed in a room with a view of the pool and had a partial ocean view. The room was clean and comfortable. This hotel is close to Burger King and the ABC Store. There are other shops nearby. It's about a couple blocks away from the beach.

This hotel is right across from the beach. The pool hands will also give you towels and chairs to be returned by 6 pm to be used at the beach.. This was wonderful. Rooms a little outdated ; but the people at the front desk were wonderful. (Although they could of used more of them at the time of check in. ) Unfortunately this made for long lines while checking in.

It's my first time in Waikiki and we couldn't describe enough how we enjoyed pretty much everything including our wonderful stay here. Everyday was like paradise for me and my husband. The service crew are very nice and accomodating. We had an event here and the party by the pool was really nice, the food was great and i love the cocktails and drinks! They also offered many day trips around Oahu where you can simply inquire in the travel office located at the reception and they will assist you to whatever questions you have regarding the trip. Overall, I well recommend this hotel because of ease, great location and fantastic staffs!

It is an older hotel and is in need of a bit of an overhaul. The room seemed small with 2 beds in it - with little room between the wall and the bed. There was a very noisy air conditioner next to one bed. Our room was not serviced one day and we had to call reception late in the day to get this done. We ate at the Buffet one night but it was very ordinary for the $45-00 each we paid plus taxes and tips. There was also a $29 per day tax we had to pay to cover things like the internet, which seems excessive as you have already paid enough for the room. It is in a good location and the staff were very friendly. I would not stay there again, however.

What can I say, From day 1 they have looked after us very well, the bell attendant was very funny and Kathy was very helpful and somehow got upgraded twice which was great, I forgot the concierge name but she was also very helpful and gave us a present to one of my friend when she was sick which was surprised for us and she was grateful for it. The deluxe room was very good and best was very comfortable with a very beautiful view, of course the room is a little outdated but we didn't mind because we hardly spend our time in the hotel room. Food is great at the splash bar and the pool was very great to swim on and also having many deck chairs around the pool area. Overall the costumer service we been treated was great and it's good to know that most of the staff knows us from Day 1. I was surprised that it's not really noisy especially having our room in front of the main street with many people passing by. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone, great location and it's literally walkable to anywhere such as shops and also having the beach 1 minute away from your hotel. Thank you so much Sheraton for looking after us and will be back soon in the future.

Perhaps the best located hotel right across from down-town Waikiki and next to the Polynesian Market Place the Princess Kaiulani is the place to stay if you want to be near the action of the beach and all the dining and entertainment venues. Our room (1020) provided a great view of the ocean, was totally quiet, and meticulously maintained by housekeeping. Free wi-fi, great food and drink at the Splash Bar, and an ambiance that can't be beat make this a premier location for the Oahu visitor. Pros - Location, Views, Price, Proximity to malls, restaurants, and touring Cons - charges $35/day for parking and check-in can be time-consuming.

We had a fantastic two week holiday! Twelve of us attended the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in ages ranging from Grandparents in our early 60's, our children and partners and 5 Grandchildren including a 19 month old Granddaughter. The hotel rooms were comfortable but the Splashbar and pool area was of great value. Location is excellent for a true Hawaiian holiday. The staff were always friendly and efficient. This is our third stay at this hotel and will no doubt visit here again.

It's a really convenient hotel and has all the added features for a comfortable stay, please note the Hawaii is about outdoors so don't stay indoors! It gives a balcony in every room so you can watch sunset n sunrise and the waves from your room itself!!!!

This hotel is great value. It appears to have been renovated to a lovely standardThe rooms are well appointed with everything that you could want( and of a good size )The staff - all were very helpful and friendlyFor the price this hotel exceeds my expectation Thank you for everything

Stayed here last year - received a free upgrade to pool view. Great location, great staff, great pool. Enjoyed our stay so much we are staying again this October but this time we paid for a partial ocean view. Cant go wrong - reasonable priced hotel that is so close to the shops, restaurants and beach.

Recently stayed at the Princess Kaiulani and was very pleased we did. It is a lovely hotel with easy access to the beach and a fantastic pool area. Of the three hotels we have stayed in at Waikiki the pool area at Princess K is easily the best. Staff at the hotel are friendly and very helpful and the outdoor dining area is pleasant. An added bonus with Princess K is the provision of free beach chairs for use at the beach as well as towels.Ask for an ocean view room and you will be get a great view as you sit on your balcony sipping a cold drink. The minor extra cost is well worth it.

My husband had told the reservation agent that we would be celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We were given a "special room" on the 27th floor with a gorgeous view. Flowers, fruit, cookies, and champagne were waiting for us. It was a lovely surprise. The breakfast buffet in the morning was delicious, as well. This hotel is across the street from Waikiki Beach, and has a lovely mid-century modern aesthetic. It did not feel crowded or "touristy" at all!

Our agent booked us into this hotel and boy were we pleased. We had an upgrade for 425 additional per night for a front sea view on the 19th floor. the views of waikike were simply mind blowing. The room was average in size but adequate and beautifully furnished. It was a great experience

Stayed here again in May, what more can I say, we just love this place, so much so, I'm booked to stay here again, end of August for a few days then again mid September for 5 days, Once again we were made to feel welcome back when "Kathy", always friendly and helpful, had a basket of goodies sent to our room, As I've reported previously, I don't even bother looking to book anywhere else, always feels like our second home, look at the view we had from the 25th floor, just beautiful...we always enjoy the supply of cold water and fruit whilst lazing on the beach as well, ... Looking forward to August / September !

Arrived from Vegas around 2pm, book in was swift and included an upgrade to a room with seaview. Room was on 31st floor with fantastic view of Waikiki beach.Room and bathroom were lovely and was one of the best hotels we have stopped in on this visit. Safe included in room along with iron & board and hairdryer and complimentary soap, shampoo, conditioner bottled water and coffee making facilities.Didn't have enough time to fully explore hotel but the pool and bar area were relaxing, with towel and chairs available to take to the beach.Breakfast was buffet style and I would recommend that also. Staff were friendly and helpful. Concierge even trying to help me arrange a visit to Pearl Harbor, even before we left the U.K.Would recommend the beach but also there's a grass park area with plenty of tree shade.Would definitely stay here again

I stayed at the Sheraton Princess on my Honeymoon. The guest experience is world class. Upon walking up to the front desk I received a friendly greeting and the start of an amazing interaction. CHRISTINA at the front desk was amazing. She got me check in then proceeded to walk me through all the amazing things The island had to offer. Restaurants, beaches, hiking, different foods and fruit to try, and waterfalls to see. This helped make my honeymoon so memorable from the very beginning. She was great and her knowledge of the local area was a real sign of someone who loves what they do. I frequent many hotels and I can say I have never had that kind of outstanding service anywhere I've stayed. If customers are what matter to your business than all companies should hire people like Christina.

Stayed here for one week following an Archers/Cosmos trip to the Rockies.Was a little sceptical after reading some reviews but need not have been.We had comfortable ocean view rooms, clean, spacious, linen changed regularly (daily if we wanted).We were staying for our wedding anniversary and had surprise champagne and fruit left in our room, a lovely gesture. Pool small but do you really want to spend hours round a pool in Waikiki?Location ideal, staff helpful.Only downside - breakfast overpriced at $26 and evening buffet $45.

Position is Excellent.....Breakfast good....room good size....Tv etc...Catch the Shuttle bus a lot cheaper than taxi...follow signs at airport $7 each...each way. Going back phone the day before....and bookMight have to pick up / drop off or wait a while but traffic is bad and Taxi $40 + then 10% tipGirl was on the street with board....no deposit required so if they did not turn up at least I could catch a cab....turned up 10 min late due to traffic....quicker way than cab when arriving, funney that !! (808) 692 3343 Waikiki Trans ( No conections )

Only stayed two nights before boarding the Pride of America. Could have stayed 3 weeks there. Perfect location meters away from waikiki beach and the duke statue. Rooms were very neat and tidy. Coffee shop right at front pool entrance. Very deep pool with crystal clear waters and Tiki statues carved out of wood around pool gives a fantastic nightly ambiance. Our room had full views of waikiki beach and the bronze duke statue on one side and the mountains on the other with a good size verandah. Check in and out was a breeze. Great resort.

My husband and I had a great stay at this hotel for our honeymoon last week. We spent 9 nights there. The room was lovely and clean and kept well by the cleaner each day. We had a view of the city from.our room and spent a lot of time on the balcony having some food and drink watching the world go buy. Pool is great and always a lounge chair free. Towels you can get from the pool side area. Daily happy hours on great cocktails too. We didn't eat at the hotel as was a little exspensive and we wanted to try all the resturants in waikiki, but walkibg past people who were eating I did think it all looked lovely. Staff very helpful and friendly. Great location, less than 5 min walk and you hit waikiki beach. Other direction and you hit all tbe trendy shops, bars and resturant. Seems very family friendly, although we didn't have kids with us, so not exactly sure.For a 3 star hotel, we had a 5 star experience. Thanks everyone at the hotel for making our stay special.

This hotel has everything you need for a short stay in Waikiki. It's centrally located across the road from the beach right in the centre of all the action and night life. It's easy access from the street is also a plus. The pool area is well maintained with plenty of deck chairs and side tables. Check in was fast and efficient and they did their best to make our rooms available ahead of check in time. Be aware that resort fees are not included in your booking fee. The staff at splash bar were friendly and the snacks were good but I suggest you eat out for dinner. The mains were only average at best. We had rooms overlooking the pool with a great view and they were clean and the beds comfortable although the bathroom was small and a little dated. We would definately stay there again.

Friendly competent staff, clean spacious room, wonderful views from our balcony. Nice pool area and bar, with a happy hour on selected drinks.Disabled friendlyTe Moana Nui - Tales of the Pacific shown at the hotel is a must. Show only price offered to hotel guests at a discount. A fantastic performance.

I took an Uber from the airport to the hotel and it took approximately 21 minutes and cost $42. The hotel is appeared nice and welcoming. The hotel is across the street from the beach and you can walk there in under a minute.Upon arrival at the hotel, check-in was very slow around 1:00 PM. There was a line of people and not enough employees. I waited about 10-12 minutes. Once I was checking in, I was told there were no rooms available, but they would notify me as soon as my room was ready (check-in is 3 PM). At 2:15, I had not heard anything so I followed up with another employee who checked and said my room was in fact ready. There was already a lack of communication as I never received a phone call as I was told.Being Platinum with Starwood, my room was upgraded. Also, as a Platinum member I received vouchers for free breakfast buffet and a free appetizer at the Splash Bar/Restaurant by the pool. Also, by staying at the hotel and being a member of Starwood, regardless of status, you receive 15% off at the same restaurant and discounted rates and two of the other Starwood properties (Sheraton Waikiki and The Moana Surfrider (a Westin property)).I was extremely surprised to find out that this Sheraton does not have a Club Lounge (I have stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki and they do as do most Sheratons).ROOM (2956)I was upgraded due to my Platinum status. The room was in the updated tower (I'm told one tower has been updated and the other has not). The room was nice, but smaller than expected. By no means was it tiny. The room had a partial city view and partial ocean view.The room had a king bed, 2 night stands, clock, dresser, TV, small desk and chair, coffee maker, mini fridge, closet with hangers, iron and board, and a safe for valuables. The room had a patio with 2 chairs and a table. The thermostat worked well and kept the room cold. There were 6 outlets and 4 USB outlets available for electronics.BATHROOMThe bathroom did not seem to be very updated. If it was updated, it was done cheaply. The shower-head appeared outdated and small. There was a shower/bathtub combination, a sink, and a toilet. There was also a hairdryer, but it only blew cool air so I'm assuming it's broken. There were 2 additional outlets available for electronics.Splash Bar/RestaurantI ate two times at the Splash Bar. The first time was simply for the appetizer that I received as a welcome amenity. The service was good and quick. The beef lettuce wraps were very tasty.My second experience, for dinner, was not as good. I arrived and was told to sit anywhere. The restaurant was only about 2/3 full. It was almost 10 minutes before I was asked what I wanted to drink. After I ordered water, it was another 8 minutes before she came back to take my order, only after I was making eye contact. Even then, I still had no water. After I placed my order, my water came a couple minutes later. The food took about 20 minutes, which was fine. I ordered a burger and fries which were tasty. I asked for my check when the food came because I was extremely tired and wanted to go to bed as soon as I finished. I had showed the coupon for 15% off food upon ordering as stated on the paper. The discount was not applied. I called her back to the table and told her and she said just put your name and room number on the slip and I will make the adjustments to your bill (I billed the food to my room). I did so, handed it to her and left. 10 minutes later as I'm literally getting into bed, the phone rings and it's the same waitress telling me that I in fact have to come back downstairs and fill out the new slip now. Clearly there was a mistake on her end. I had to get dressed just to go back downstairs and put my name on and sign the new slip. It was not my error. She should have had someone else bring it to my room to complete the new slip due to her mistake.BREAKFASTThe breakfast buffet was very good. They had made to order omelets (or other eggs upon request. They also had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, rice, salad, French toast, pastries and breads, cereals, and fresh juice. They had no water sitting out. You have to request water if you want it. I'm unsure of the cost because I received it for free being a Platinum member, but if the price is reasonable, I would buy it.OVERALLOverall, I would rate the hotel 3.5 but you can't rate half points. Mainly, the points are being take off due to customer service. Upon check-in I was told I would receive a call when my room was ready. I was sitting in the lobby for an hour and fifteen minutes and I only found out it was ready because I checked myself.The updated room was nice, but parts seemed like they were done only partially.I was disappointed there was no Club Lounge. However, the appetizer at the Splash Bar was good and the breakfast buffet was tasty.Also, the customer service, for dinner, at the Splash Bar was poor at best.I have stayed at The Moana Surfrider (Westin), Sheraton Waikiki, and Sheraton Princess. The Westin property and Sheraton Waikiki are both beach front. The Sheraton Princess is across the street. The Westin property gives Platinum members a cooked breakfast and so does the Sheraton Princess. The Sheraton Waikiki gives Club Lounge access and breakfast is lower grade. The rooms are nicer at the Westin property and the Sheraton Waikiki than the Sheraton Princess.I would recommend the hotel if the price was much cheaper than the other two. Otherwise, based on this experience, I would opt for one of the other two if the price was comparable.

First time in Hawaii and not much to compare with. At the end of a week though we thought we had a "handle" on it. Loved the location a very short stroll to Waikiki beach and straight out the front to the major retail centre (Hawaii's Rodeo Drive??) with handy trolley stops and convenience stores. Not sure if the resort charge is value but the reduction in tariff from other hotels marginally closer to the beach felt right. Loved lounging in the Splash Bar by the pool, thgough pool did close at 7pm. Happy hour at the bar from 11am to 6pm and very good quality bar snacks food. Staff were excellent generally. Hotel itself showing its age a little but still comfortable. Our double King room was spacious though bathroom needed a good renovation. Special mention for Guy at the travel desk who set up some wonderful day activity options for us. Would stay again at the right price and probably get an ocean side room next time. Noise from mall next door on western side was extreme at times (massed air conditioning plants on roof?) and necessitated balcony door being closed at all times.

Best location, great bed, wonderful pool view thanks to Celeste who gave us a warm greeting. Lots of help from great concierge staff - Terry and Ursula, lovely cleaning lady, but most of all thank you so much to the greatest waitress in the Splash Bar HEIDI. We were a bit down with medical problems but were soon cheered up and looked after by Heidi who we can't thank enough. Thank you Sheraton Princess K we recommend your hotel for everything to make staying in Hawaii great

We stayed here 4 nights. Parking is $35 a night plus a $28 daily resort fee. It's just ok. The hotel is outdated. It's just so blah... the wallpaper, carpet, furniture, elevators etc. Anyway, housekeeping ladies are very helpful. The front desk was quick. The parking garage is so weird. The location is great. I can't recommend any other hotel because this is the first time we visit Oahu. I can't comment on hotel restaurants or the hotel pool. We ate out and went to the beaches around the island. Also, you can walk down to prince Edward street and find a laundromat to do laundry. The abc stores are good place for quick drinks and snacks.

As an SPG members, we are entitled to free wifi.Now with a compulsary resort fee of $30 per night, we receive no compensation.although the SPG Terms & Conditions clearly state otherwise under section7.3d as shown below.7.3.d SPG Participating Hotels that have mandatory resort charges that include Internet access will provide a replacement benefit, to be determined at each SPG Participating Hotel's discretion.I would envisage this to be the equivalent refund of the normal daily Internet charges charged prior to the implementation of his resort rip off, err fee. That was at a minimum $10 per day.At check in, no one appeared to address this issue. Must we lodge a complaint now?

We arrived late at night and had to wait several minutes to check in. It was hard to manage large suitcases in the limited area. We had a room on the 11th floor near the end of the corridor. Had a view of the ocean from the balcony. Room was clean and showed signs of some recent maintenance but everything looked worn. It was a Sunday night and from midnight til early morning all we heard were garbage trucks. It was a little better the next few nights, but we also got noise from the shopping centre beside the hotel. The pool is very deep and not good for non-swimmers. The pool was closed every night so an evening swim was out of the question. At times the elevators were very busy and you had to wait several minutes and even then you could not always get on. The location is good, but we found the beach area to be a shared location with only some water and fruit brought and specified times. The resort fee was a surprise add on and we did not feel we got value for the fee paid.

Great place and well located. Customer service was great, which make the check in smooth. We arrive early and front desk was very accommodating and try to find us a room and check us in early. All I can say is that this hotel is great. Close to all you want, beach, shopping and eating. Highly recommend it

Another amazing stay. This is a hidden treasure in Waikiki. It is right across the street from the beach. Step out of the hotel cross the street and you are on the beach. Our room was also amazing and the view from the lani was gorgeous. This hotel also has the only traditional luau in Waikiki, no need to drive an hour to the west side. The restaurant is top notch they have a grab buffet that is one of the best deals in Waikiki. The outdoor bar features live entertainment. The staff make this an exceptional experience. When we checked in Jason remembered us and took great care of us, he truly understands the meaning of customer service. We are lucky because we live in Hawaii and make it a point to visit Waikiki, and this is by far one of our favorite hotels, so much so we have already made reservation for our next stay. Thank you Princess Kaiulani. This next visit, I will take pictures.

Central location across the street from the beach.Reception, pool and dining areas very nice but rooms arevery dated and our room was very noisy from their air conditioning towers. Evening entertainment we found a bit dull. Not happy about paying extra 'resort fee' which offered services(except for wi fi) we did not need

Came to Hawaii for both business and pleasure. I wanted a hotel that was convenient to the beach and reasonable for my family pleasure part of the trip. I booked through a third party and so the Sheraton wasn't as accommodating regarding my SPG membership. It wasn't much of a price difference so I regretted doing that, lesson learned. This is a noticeable difference between my Marriott Rewards membership and treatment. I liked this location and it was a short walk to the beach. The supposed reserved area on the beach isn't great and is too crowded. The pool stinks because they won't let your child use any flotation device so definitely not family friendly. The restaurant near the pool was very nice and the breakfast service and food was excellent.

The beds were very comfortable. We requested a room with oceanview, however, in order to see the ocean you had to go to the end of the lania. Food at the restaurant is very expensive for a buffet. The food at the bar was less expensive. Be prepared to go out for breakfast. PK does not offer a continental breakfast. Front desk is not very responsive waited for an hour and a half for someone to fix the smoke detector. It took two calls and a walk to the front desk before it was taken care of.

Place was nice, clean and friendly staff. Room was an ok size if u have alot of luggage however it's not spacious to have 4 ppl in a 2 double bed. Love the fact that you get to borrow chairs for the beach, lots of perks and offers in this hotel. Pool was nice too locations is perfect! Would definitely book here again and highly recommend.

From the moment we walked into the foyer of this hotel we were impressed. The pool, the bar, the café - everything looked lovely. Our room was spacious and the beds were so comfortable. The view from the balcony was gorgeous. We had a bath as well as a shower. We were able to charge our phones without extra connections. There were areas of privacy you could sit and read, chat or just relax.

Stayed at the Sheraton P.K. last week for our 28th wedding anniversary. Erin at the front desk made this an outstanding stay. She took personal interest in us and giving us the best possible experience she could from start to finish, even taking the time to personally call us to let us know everything was ready for our stay. We stayed in one of the newly refreshed tower ocean view rooms, and it was FANTASTIC. Pool areas were very enjoyable with live music some evenings. Could not beat the location for being in the heart of Waikiki shopping and restaurants, and very close to the beach. I will definitely stay there again and FOR SURE seek out Erin to help us with our stay, SHE WAS OUTSTANDING, best customer service ever! Also they have a couple of rooms that you can use if you have a late flight and want to stay around the hotel after checkout to shower, etc before heading to the airport. VERY much appreciated that amenity, it helped extend our vacation by allowing us to go do things all day with somewhere to freshen up afterwards. Oh did I mention, Erin helped set us up with that amenity also, Erin, Erin,Erin was the best, seek her out when you stay there, you won't be disappointed.

Stayed here with my best friend for a 21st birthday trip! The service is excellent we were able to check in straight away after a long flight and got upgraded to the top floor!!! We had an amazing view with a very clean room with 2 double beds which was perfect for us!We had room service one night as it had been storming and the roads were flooded so couldn't leave the apartment and the service was excellent the waiter brought the food right out to us on the balcony and we had to leave some as the servings were large.The customer service is great every time you saw someone they would say Aloha and ask how we were or how our day was. The bell boys and porters were very helpful in getting us a taxi and giving us directions. Even the house keepers were very friendly and had high attention to detail!We organised a tour through the tour director and he was able to get us an even better deal!Can't wait to go back!!!

We stayed here for 7 nights the last week of April with our 8.5 month old baby. We got a great deal on the hotel given other properties in the area and price so giving this a 5 star rating. However, if we paid more, this would only be a 4 star rating.Room: We had 2 double beds. When we booked it said the rooms were queen size but they were double. The room was a bit tight with the 2 double beds but expected. The bathroom was dated and I could use an update. The floors were small blue 1980's tiles. Dated but functional. Pool: Given the size of the hotel, the pool was small but warm. It was good for us as our baby did not enjoy the waves or crowds at Waikiki beach.Resort Fee: the resort fee included beach towels, chairs, water and fruit at certain times throughout the day. The designated area at the beach was 100 yards from the hotel. Staff from the hotel would go to the area with water coolers filled with water and fruit and look for people with the hotel's beach towels. And odd system.... We only went to the beach once given that there was so much to do / see so felt that this resort fee was not worth it. There was also a $5 relief fund fee per day that was mandatory.....i don't understand this fee but it is on their website that they charge it.Overall, we had a great stay. Solid 4 stars.

It was my first time had an awesome stay food was great staff was excellent . Bartenders very attentive can't wait to visit again The shops amazing and the choice of restaurants endless the beaches breathtaking and the view from are room was Great

Super customer service. Justin really set us up in a great room! 26th floor! Room was clean and quiet. Some road noise but nothing we couldn't sleep through. Motel is kept clean and everyone is very nice and helpful.

Beautiful room, overlooking the pool from the 6th floor, with balcony, well equipped , large for Hawaii, closeby to new International market, Kalakaua ave and Kuhio street.Beach is 3 min walk from Hotel. Evening beefeater buffet is a must, lovely lobby restaurant, always returning to Princess Kaiulani

The staff at this hotel is exceptional. My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights here and every employee we came across with were genuinely very happy and accommodating. the girls at the Splash Bar were fantastic, as with the concierge I had dealt with. The hotel itself is beautiful, we had a pool view and I loved waking up and opening the balcony doors and hearing the music being played in the morning. Everything about our trip was excellent!!! I would definitely recommend!

We recently stayed three nights and had the most wonderful time. Our ocean-view room was terrific with great beds, wide-screen TV and free wifi. Without exception the service was excellent from reception to the bar service. Would stay there again.

The hotel was beautiful and had everything our family needed. The rooms were adequate and clean each with lovely ocean views. Bar service was awesome we especially enjoyed the free popcorn both at the bar and the pool. There was entertainment every night. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is great, right across the road from the beach and you were given water and fruit to take with you and even a beach chair. All shopping is in walking distance to the hotel with plenty of places to eat as well.

The hotel overall feels tired and in need of a refurbishment. The accommodation rooms are quite run down (although the bed was very comfortable), no minibar, disengaged staff and overall quite a depressing place to stay in such a lovely location. We paid for a balcony and ocean view but the balcony door didn't work and we only had a partial ocean view. Would not return.

The location is excellent and was the main reason we chose this hotel. We stayed for three nights. However, the room was dingy and in need of renovations and the daily cleaning was marginal at best. We were very disappointed with our experience. The hotel charges a "resort fee" of $28 per night without providing any additional amenities that you would not find at any other hotel. I have stayed in many Sheraton branded hotels, and this hotel simply does not represent the brand well. There are other nearby choices along Waikiki that would provide better value.

We thought the room was a little small and could have been cleaner. We noticed some hairs and other things in bathroom. However, when you need something from guest services they are always quick to respond. They are very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the pool area closes at different times in the evening to accommodate parties. The early morning pool staff was somewhat rude and unprofessional. Would we recommend? The price and location are enticing. So, maybe.......

We heard mixed reviews about the hotel but our experience was amazing staff were superb, beds were super comfortable, tv had all channels (not that we watched much), location was great close to the beach, restaurants and shops. We had a pool view room which gave us a view of the ocean anyway, beautiful view to wake up to.

This was our 5th visit to Waikiki and our 1st stay here. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews ; however, this place proved to be a fabulous choice. It is in a very central location and the staff were most obliging. We had a fantastic view for our first 5 days ( paid for high tower) however the view was also pretty good when we returned for the day before we flew out later that night.

I had a nice size room with a king size bed, not much of a view, but that's why you go outside! My room didn't have any washcloths or hand towels but that was quickly resolved. The room was pretty clean other than a couple of items I found on the carpet but the carpet itself was very clean. The location really sells this hotel and the staff was very friendly

I was there for business in November and again in April. This hotel has a great location and across the street is the beach. The hotel does provide towels and beach chairs free of charge. The gym at the hotel is very nice as are the restaurants and lounge areas. My biggest complaint are the rooms.
