I stayed in rooms that were very old and in need of updates and renovations...not at all of good quality.

We had a fabulous room with a large Ocean View. Beautiful room that was mostly updated. Think the bathroom is next. Very clean and spacious. They offer a Hospitality room for a shower and clean up after a day at the pool. This was needed as we checked out in the morning but our flight was not until 9:30 pm. Thanks for the great 3 Day stay.

We just checked into the hotel only to be told that our Spg gold is not valid as we didn't book with the hotel directly and used an agent instead. The hotel is in a great location, many shopsaround and very close to the beach. The hotel does actually provide shuttles form the airport, which I only found out after reading the information in our room. I emailed the hotel to ask for this information and never got a reply! I would suggest trying to get in touch as it could work out cheaper - $28 round trip depending on the number in your group. Our taxi cost is 46 one way due to traffic and an exit been closed. The room is small and better than I expected. We have a pool view room which does give a small ocean view which is nice. The bathrooms is really small. In the room there are wires which are lying around close to the tv and an extensions cord on the floor for more power points, I have never seen and am actually a bit concerning as we have a toddler with us who we need to keep away from the wires. The pool area looks nice and it seems that there is an allocated area if one wishes to go to the beach which is another nice touch. Overall I only booked this hotel as I was a Spg gold and decide to be loyal to SPG. Even though my agent suggested other properties such as the Hyatt or Hilton. Really annoyed I didn't listen as the other properties look more modern. Would not return or recommend the property. Can get better for the price.

It is the small details that could take this hotel to five star rating. The staff are absolutely wonderful with no issue being too much. The rooms on the other hand need some TLC with some aspects of wear and tear showing in the rooms. The location and the views [in either the partial or full beach view rooms] are superb. The food in the restaurants however is too expensive and consequently we ate elsewhere for every meal.

There are many good qualities at this hotel. The location is perfect and accessible by city bus. The food at the breakfast buffet was great. The pool was well maintained and relaxing. The best thing though is the staff. Everyone went out of their way to make our visit perfect. Special thanks to Margaret, Mr. Orr, and the girl who checked us in. I think her name was Yin. Everyone was kind and we will definitely return. Mahalo plenty!

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 3 nights. The hotel was nice, well decorated and conveniently located close to the beach and shopping areas. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and excellent service.

This hotel is located at the heart of Waikiki. Next to the international market place and the beach is just across the street. I stayed in the pool view double room, and it was perfect. It's easy to get fresh food and beverage from Food pantry just one block from the hotel.

Pros:+ Rooms and bed were comfortable+ Excellent location, close to many amenities and attractions.+ Very close to the beach.+ Nice (but limited) ocean view.+ Large pool and lounges.+ Nice restaurant and decent food.+ Well-equipped and large gym.+ Great personnel.+ Decent laundry facilities.+ Good value for money.Cons:+ Rooms are bit small.+ Some fixtures are worn out and needs repair or replacement.+ Bathroom door did not have a working lock.+ You have to pay a daily resort fee, which provides some extra services.

This hotel is at the centre of everything in Waikiki! We had a 12 night stay and barely had a problem, the only sticking point was the resort fee but this is just simply a part of staying here. The pool area is nice and the lobby looked refreshed. We had great service from the concierge as well. Would totally recommend.

Stayed here for a week while we renewed our wedding vows. I was skeptical on this property, but once we arrived - LOVED the location! it is right off Kalakaua Ave so you have access to all the eating and shopping you could want! the cheese cake factory is just up the road and we found a great pizza place as well :). There is plenty to see and do, and the buses are right out front, or just up the road. The pool area is small, but most people head to the beach (just across the road). The hotel has chairs and towels you can take to the beach (they have pockets in them as well to make for easy storage), and there are laundry facilities on site as well. There is one restaurant, and limited room service, but it will be cheaper for you to eat out. The rooms where comfortable, but a little small, and the bath room as well. WE had one of the renovated rooms (a friend stayed in the renovated ones and was appalled), but in saying that the room we where in could still do with a small face lift (esp. the bathroom.) Ask for the renovated one on check in. We also had a partial ocean view - and would do that again as well. balcony was a decent size, but there is a lot of street noise.Would happily return on my next trip!

My family and I stayed at the Princess Kaiulani to attend a wedding that was held close by. The person at the front desk was very nice, the rooms we had (adjoining) were clean and comfortable. The hotel was at a great location for us and we got around easily.And there's local entertainment at night by the pool!

location is perfect. Staff are probably better. Room comfort is good, bathroom amenities are OK. What lets this down is it is very 70's, old wood furniture, wallpaper etc. It really is time for a makeover.This is our second stay but may look for a more modern hotel on our next trip

Lovely reception and pool area with free towels and beach chairs avail.They also bring bottled water and fruit across the road to the beach for guests 3 times a day! Stayed 7 nights in a city view but got free upgrade to poolview room which was lovely.Great location, walking distance to all the shops or $2.50 bus to Alamoana.

We booked to this hotel after Christmas and new year eve , expecting having great time worth spending the highest prices for the air lines and hotel due to the season, but unfortunately we does not got the room that we paid for and found cockroaches in the room which spoiled our total trip.Very bad management who never care about different clients needs.

Lovely reception and pool area. Room comfortable but slightly dated. Couldn't enjoy balcony as air conditioning towers were overwhelmingly deafening. Very disappointing. It is in a great location and close to the beach and other activities.

We were placed in an a room with adjoining room, at wee hours of Saturday morning 1:00-2:00 am we called hotel front desk 3-times regarding screaming and yelling neighbors in adjacent adjoining room, each time assured security would be up to handle nothing ever happened as smoke continued to billow in under and around adjoining door frame, I was forced to knock on their door to get noise to stop but smoking continued.Miserable night no sleep hoarse from smoke inhalation and no follow up from anyone next morning had to demand room change.

Even though the hotel is nice and the service is good ,we booked a room for three adults 11 months before going ,when arriving at the hotel we were told they had upgraded us to a king size bed which we thought was OK not realising they expected myself and wife to share the same bed with our 21 year old daughter after explaining that was not acceptable they then made out they where doing us a favour by letting us have a roll away bed in the room and said we should charge 75 dollars a night for this ,but said but we will wave the charge,on the booking form from the hotel said that i should off had a double double room. So be careful when booking and possible double check you will be getting the room you pay for.

I've been staying at this hotel since 25 years ago. It was my favorite Waikiki Hotel and I'd stay here 3 out of every 4 times I visited Waikiki.  Then I was shocked when I stayed here 6 years ago. It was a hotel in despair and falling apart. Was not even a 1 star, and in very bad need of repairs (I guess have had to do with loss of Japanese Tourist and the 2008 recession). So, I stopped staying here. I was disappointed as I paid for a 3-star hotel and got a half-star hotel. (Service was good even though the hotel building was falling apart).  And then I noticed there have been renovations. So, I stayed here the last time and it is once again the Princess Kaiulani of the old days. Yes, the rooms are not that so large, but it is a nice and clean hotel, with good service, good location, and many of the rooms offer good or partial ocean view. I love the Friday night entertainments.

I just stayed at the hotel for four nights. Overall, I thought it was a good value for $127.06 + the $28 resort fee per night.All of the hotel staff was pretty friendly. They offered me both free breakfast + 500 points as a Platinum welcome bonus, instead of a choice between the two, which was nice. Because the resort fee includes free WiFi, and that is a Platinum amenity, they will also give me 250 SPG points, per night as an alternate benefit. They also offered me a voucher for a free appetizer at the bar, which was nice.They did upgrade me from a city view room to an ocean view room, that had a furnished terrace, and the views were pretty good. The walls were very thin, and I could hear people in the other rooms on both sides. The hotel does not provide in room glassware in the bathroom, but rather provides plastic cups, which I didn't really like. There were also not any bathrobes in the room, I'm not sure whether or not I could have asked for one...but I would have used it if it was there.The breakfast buffet included omelets which was great because that's not always included in Platinum breakfast.The hotel is about a 45-second walk to the beach and is well located; unfortunately, beach chairs are not provided, which is particularly disappointing given the high resort fee.Overall, I kind of felt like I was staying at a Four Points, and I'm not really sure how Starwood is defining the differences between the full-service Sheraton and mid-service Four Points brands.I might return if I got a rate of $127.06 per night again, but I probably wouldn't pay much more than that. I think I would be willing to pay 20-30% more to stay at a more upscale hotel next time, and I'll do a more diligent job looking for potential BRGs at other SPG properties.

This was out fourth trip to Hawaii and after staying at two other hotels we decided to try the Sheraton, Princess Kaiulani. We arrived about 09.00 as we had an early flight into HNL from Australia but we could leave our cases in a secure area. When we were finally checked in we were given a free upgrade to an ocean view! We got to our room and was not disappointed, the room and décor was a little outdated but no way near as bad as some of the reviews I had read. Daily room service was prompt and the staff were fantastic. Bar area and pool were great with staff continually making sure you had food and drink while lazing around. We will be defiantly be staying here for our next holiday.

Wheelchair accessable even the showe. Or room has great view of the ocean. One block to Waikiki beach. Chairs and towels provided. Staff is VERY helpful. Great pool area. Loving it.im with daughter and grandchildren 8 and 10. There is a chair to lower people into the pool. Close to shopping and restaurants.

My family and I have stayed here 3 times in the past year. Our most recent stay was 3/6/17-3/9/17. Erin who works at the check in counter was amazing!!! She was so sweet and made sure our stay was enjoyable (which it was). The entire staff makes you feel like family. Erik tending the Splash Bar was also very nice. We won't stay anywhere else. Very relaxing hotel.

Stayed here again after the property underwent a slight renovation. Service is still 5 stars!Was upgraded to the 11th floor, had a nice anniversary basket waiting for us and hotel even sent up a bottle of Champagne for our celebration! Room was refurbished, enormous, and had a fridge and mini wet bar. Lanai was as long and big as the room and we had a great view of the ocean, pool and music/hula downstairs. We even saw some spouts of whales in the distance! Although there wasn't an ice machine on that floor there was on the 10th. Check in was great and easy- the same for check out. They even offered a coloring book for my 12 year old which wasn't expected. Bar crew were even nice enough to give me some drink umbrellas and orchid flowers for a surprise I was trying to do for my wife in the room. Even the towel crew at the pool were super nice about letting us have towels! And here is a secret, park you car on the top level so that you are near the elevator! I don't think many people knew that so we tried and it so much easier to get out luggage in and out from the car with an elevator!!! A BIG THANK YOU to Kathy V. at the Starwood desk, she was a huge help with great customer service in helping us book a room and went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful and the little amenities made it even more special. She deserves a big raise for her excellent customer service skills that shows the Aloha spirit of Hawaii! We won't ever use another hotel in Waikiki! Mahalo Nui Loa Kathy!

Room was ready early which was a welcome bonus. Large room with comfortable bed. Location was perfect close to shops restaurants beach. Sheraton team are fabulous and couldn't do enough for us. Erin at reception answered all our queries and went so far as to arrange an anniversary cocktail for us. Thank you Erin for making our holiday extra special. Can highly recommend the tour desk for that no hassle tour. Food and drinks were great at the pool bar. Would love to come back one day. Well done Sheraton princess Kaiulani

If you are after a 3 star hotel in the heart of Waikiki and don't mind worn out decor, a fair bit of noise and some variable staff then this place works just fine. It's real strength is its location with some great restaurants and shopping in the vacinity.

The hotels location is the highlight. The rooms have been updated: carpet, bathroom fixtures. Lobby is warm and spacious but rooms are average at best. The pool is a bit shabby. No ocean view and it has several paint patches on the bottom. The coffee bar located by side of bar is excellent. Hotel staff is extremely helpful and courteous. They helped us with car rental for 50 dollars per day - right across street.

We stayed here for 3 weeks,although she is a little old and needs some revamping, it was an excellent place to stay, the facilities were ok, but the staff more than made up for the lack of 1st class facilities. very close to the beach, Ethan and Norman and Bo were fantastic pool boys and Heidi and terri-anne and Daniel took care of our cocktail needs, in the splash bar. This is a family friendly hotel and the staff were wonderful.

The hotel is in good location for shops, restaurants and Waikiki beach.Most tour operators pick up from Sheraton PK.The rooms are good size, comfortable beds and bathroom has shower over bath .Room safe, iron and itoning board are provided as well as small refrigerator.We had city view room overlooking the pool area

Great central location, clean rooms, wonderful bed; quiet. This hotel is older but provides all the facilities one would need. Very happy with our stay.The pool could use some upgrades as it looked a little dingy. Nice area for sunbathing with poolside food and beverage service.

For the most part we were satisfied with this hotel. It is right across the street from Waikiki Beach and if you are in the tower you have a great view. The staff was nice, everything was very clean, the workout facility was very nice for a hotel, and the pool area is great. The bathrooms were incredibly small and outdated in the rooms and the air conditioning stopped working twice while we were there. I do not recommend the breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant. It leaves a lot to be desired especially at $26 per person. There is a smoothie stand right outside the hotel that is a better option.All in all its a good hotel if you get a good price but I would never pay full price for it.

Great location for a hotel. The rooms are reasonably sized and have all the comforts of a hotel of this size you would expect (ironing board, safe, fridge). Nearly all rooms have balconies with some form of view of the beach. Walking distance to Waikiki beach (aka absolute tourist trap) is literally the time it takes to cross the road. The hotel has its own pool, entertainment and a travel guide that can book ventures beyond the madness (i.e. anywhere outside of Waikiki) you require. Buses to and from the airport are easily access, as is the public bus to/from anyway (including buses). There is a very easily accessed car park for those staying at the hotel. Thankfully the resort fee covers this and it's perfect given that parking anywhere in Waikiki is either difficult, expensive or both. The hotel also has very close proximity to the tourist trolley buses - particularly useful if you're a Japanese traveller, as almost all the buses only cater to Japanese. We travelled using the Japanese company HIS, so this wasn't an issue.

We had a city view on the 18th floor and one door back from ocean view, overlooking the International Marketplace. This unfortunately meant we could hear everything happening in the marketplace and much of the traffic and activities on the main drag. Even with the lanai doors and curtains closed. The room was clean and all the staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't once use the bar or restaurants in the hotel as they seemed pretty pricey. There are plenty of good restaurants for reasonable prices nearby. The elevators are painfully slow when you're waiting, but somehow fast when you're on. The pool is best used on a hot day with sun directly on it. Pretty sure there's no heating. If you're doing any excursions and they tell you the pick up point is at the Hyatt Regency, just head straight out from the guest drop-off area across Kaiulani Ave and down Koa Ave past the ABC store to the green awning.

Hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. Hotel rooms and pool are ok but unspectacular. It can be long wait for elevators of hotel towers. Hotel provides towels and beach chairs and hotel employees provide water and fruit at Waikiki. Hotel provides 30 minute day rooms which allows guests who check out at noon to spend day at beach then shower and change before late night flight

My husband and I stayed here last October and could not find fault, we were kindly upgraded when we arrived and got a great view of the beach. Our room was lovely and we were lucky enough to have two double beds so made it feel very luxurious, the bathroom was small but had everything you needed and I loved all the thoughtful little toiletries, the housekeeping staff were great and our room was cleaned to a high standard.We didn't use the main restaurant as we wanted to explore outside the hotel but we did have lunch and snacks at the pool bar and the food, drinks and cocktails were spot on. What made made it perfect was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff throughout the hotel, we couldn't ask for more

Beautiful interior and decorations. The staff was awesome. My boyfriend and I celebrated our 1st anniversary and front desk sent us champagne and wonderful snacks. This hotel is close to everything. One block from waikiki beach.

The hotel is at the very heart of waikiki, very nice lobby, love the pictures of the princess hanged all over the place and I absolutely love the wall on the reception area, its a collage of pictures of the princess. The staff were lovely and polite. The room though is okay, just regular. The bathroom is kinda small. Enjoyed our stay overall.

My teenage daughters and I have stayed in this hotel 3 times out of our 4 visits to Oahu. The one year we didn't stay there we all wished we had. For one thing, the price is very reasonable compared to others hotels in Waikiki. The rooms are clean and spacious and most of all the staff is very friendly and helpful in every way. The beach is just across the street and everything Waikiki has to offer is a short walk away. The Princess may not be the fanciest hotel in Waikiki, but if you are looking for value, convenience and quality customer service, this is the place to stay,

Before check-in, I was worried that a hotel a block away from the beach would keep us from the action -- and views. I couldn't have been more wrong: the views were incredible -- on the 17th floor of new wing, we saw Diamond Head, the beach, and mountain/ skyline in one sweep from our balcony. Charming environment -- and it had a soul, unlike many of the mega-chains in the area. Breakfast buffet and evening entertainment rocked! Thank you to Uyen. Maholo!

I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in July 2015 (a delayed review). It was my first trip to Hawaii and I traveled with my family. The location of the hotel could not have been better. All of the staff that we interacted with were informative, hospitable and attentive. The pool and pool staff were great and so were the complimentary ice pops. The waitstaff was great as well-always on point with the ice water and drinks. The food was good, although a bit pricey. We had the breakfast buffet daily because it was convenient and had lots of variety. The rooms were in need of updating. We were placed in a handicap room which was not user friendly for me nor my family nor was it needed. The safe in our room did not work properly, but the onsite team came quickly and replaced for us, which was great. We had our pictures taken with the hotel photographer, all which came out great! There were lots of activities each day for the kids to participate in, which was great! Overall, the hotel satisfied all of our needs and I would definitely stay there again-if I ever get the chance to go back to Hawaii.

This Sheraton is old, and it shows. A few buttons for the elevators don't light up, and carpets are stained and frayed. This didn't bother us though. We were happy with the location, and it was clean. Staff was pleasant, and we had no trouble getting towels or beach chairs. The water and fruit service that is supposedly offered every day did not happen, or we missed it. Be sure to be in the designated area as they are supposed to find you. We took advantage of the go pro rental from the Westin across the street. That property seemed very well maintained and nice.

We have just returned from a week at the Princess. We last stayed there in 1984 and it looks like the rooms have not been upgraded since. The bed(a King size) was great and the cleaning staff went out of their way to make sure our needs were met. All is not doom and gloom however as the friendly, helpful desk staff, concierge and bell hops are always able to help no matter how minute the problem. The big thing going for the Princess is its position in Waikiki offering easy accessibilty to shops, restaurants and attractions such as a catamaran cruise and the Aquarium. Spend some money and restore a proud old lady.

This is not the fanciest hotel on the strip but it was clean, had good service and was in an excellent location. They had a decent pool where you could order good drinks, live music poolside some nights and also lent out beach chairs and towels to take to the beach across the street. You are in the middle of the shopping district. Good people watching and the coffee shop across the street has good coffee, pastries and POG (Honolulu coffee). Lots of places in the lobby to hang out. Parking is included with resort fee. They are also very helpful with planning any day trips.

This was the hotel has very nice facilities. The rooms were OK very dated. Great restaurants and bar. When you're having a drink in the bar ask for their popcorn has a very good seasoning on it. The hotel is walking distance to the beach in many activities

Had two rooms for a family of 6 here last week, was booked via travel agent (to be reviewed elsewhere - never again), all breakfasts, rooms etc were paid in advance HOWEVER when we arrived our rooms were not ready, we were charged an additional fee PER ROOM of US$26.78 PER NIGHT we were staying - even on the free nights accommodation (pay 4 get 1 free) this was to cover the wifi, car parking (we had no car) and phone calls - SO useful, its a MUST PAY - even if you don't want these services.Beds were lumpy and small (doubles only) foldaway for child was extra charge - waived that fee per night - woo hoo, The building is old and it shows, staff were friendly but we needed to ask for towels for each of our children, the pool was ok could do with more chairs/lounges, we could not find the Select area on the beach so did not use the services there.Avoid the special taxi's that wait at the front door, they pay to be there and we had to tell the driver to drive to the speed limit - not at 15mph, and get off his Phone.Overall it was a comfortable stay, but the additional room charges really did put a bad start on our stay, for the price paid we could have stayed somewhere nicer further from the main street.

The Coin laundry in the basement was broken, But the staffs in entrance counter was so nice to fix this problem, so, I felt no stress from this. I have stayed PK twice. I always feels very fine when I look at beautiful staffs.

As I enter the well decorated front door of Sheraton, the front desk service was absolutely wonderful. You can tell they care about every single one of their customers, I had many questions about the island and a lot of the employees could give you places to eat and places to go hike at.When I arrived in my room my bags were all nicely placed inside my room already with complimentary waters and some snacks. Overall the room was very clean, perfectly fit my family of 4. Overall my stay in Sheraton was very enjoyable nothing to complain out, there were also many events going on when I went to the hotel. I went during the holidays and I really got to witnessed how Hawaiians do Christmas it is a lot different from the mainland which was a great eye opener for me.

Congratulations on your employee Uyen. She was totally amazing, she went beyond and looked after us 100%. I cant thank her enough for listening to our plight and ensuring we were well look after while staying at your hotel. We had booked into another hotel, as you were fully booked, however, they had mucked up our booking and after travelling for 12 hours were extremely disappointed. We have stayed at your hotel before and really enjoyed our experience. So went straight to your front desk, on the off chance you had had a cancellation to be greeted by Uyen... who was totally amazing as was our stay for the five nights. We will be back ..... and thank you again this 'Angel' needs to be congratulation for her professionalism, expertise in handling our reservation... along with following up once we had settled in.Thank you so much... look forward to being welcomed back into this fabulous hotel. Sincerely

From making a reservation to receiving us at the desk was nothing short of excellent. The front desk staff provided uninterrupted service and they answered all our questions plus provided some worthwhile tips about Oahu and Waikiki. These days all of Waikiki charges the nasty 'Resort-Fee' but the Sheraton goes out of its way to give the client value for that cash grab. That is something Las Vegas should take page from and give back something to the their loyal clients. No matter, the staff, such as Justin made our stay very pleasant indeed.They offer plenty of amenities, fine dining and entertainment. The hotel is old but compared to many of its competitors the old girl is very up to standard.

We can stay this hotel at a reasonable price. I'm SPG Gold member, so I use SPG website, it would be best price. Location is good, room is clean and neat, the sunset view from lanai was very beautiful.

Awesome hotel in a fantastic location. Staff were very friendly and helpful and offered great service.Rooms were nothing fancy but clean and comfortable - bedding was lovely and luxurious pillows, sheets and duvets. My only criticism is the chairs on the balcony were too large for the compact balcony and not comfortable.Pool area was lovely and the hotel offered great Tommy Bahama beach chairs which were fantastic to take to Waikiki beach.

The Sheraton PK is in a fantastic location for a non-beachfront property. It's only a couple minutes walk to the beach and the staff come down at certain times to offer apples, oranges and cold bottles of water. Make sure you have your hotel beach towel and they'll find you if you're in the vicinity of the statue.We were on Level 24. The rooms are quiet although you can hear the emergency service vehicle sirens from the street every now and then. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was ok, just a bit outdated. Bottles of water are replaced each day. Really nice housekeeping staff too.Good facilities at the Sheraton PK. Used the gym a few times - good equipment. Pool was nice, although it closes far too early; good bar with great staff and live music every night; parking is included in the resort fee. All staff we encountered were great.I would definitely stay here again.

Friendly and helpful staff make this hotel even better. Travelling with 20 months and 6 months is tough at the best of times but with great staff providing accomodating and fantastic service throughout our stay made our first overseas trip a memorable one. The greeting and service provided by the check in staff, to the bar staff, tour desk, room attendants, concierge fantastic- thank you! Hotel facilities are always clean and up to the high standards associated with the shereton brand, location is central to everything.

The rooms are definitely due for an update.....standard double room with a dresser, TV, older two faucet shower and a single sink....somewhat challenging with 4 in a room! That said, it was clean and well maintained. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful on checkin and checkout. Although a little complicated, parking was free and on site. Directly across the road is the Moana Surfrider, a heritage hotel that we visited in the morning for coffee on their rocking chairs (right on waikiki beach). 24 hour Burger King across the street as well as Subway, and dozens of 5 star restaurants a short walk away for the insane night life. ~5 minute drive to Diamond Head, ~20 minutes to Pearl Harbour.

I have visited the PK before and given her a good review. The location is fantastic so I was keen to take my daughter there on our recent overnighter as we headed back home to Brisbane.The hotel itself has been renovated and updated since my last visit. The reception area has been massively updated and looks great. However thats where my excitement ended. Our room was on the 24th floor and we had an ocean view. The room was TINY in comparison to the room we stayed in at another hotel on the way to LA. The room as dusty, most of the power points didn't work and when we went to have a shower, there was hair all over the back of the bathroom door. Disgusting!We had a drink at the bar that night and the buffet breakfast. It is clear that the hotel is now focused on an entirely different demographic and I was as much disappointed for them as I was for ourselves. If this is how the rooms are for all guests then they would not be seeing Honolulu at its best. We stayed at another 5 star hotel in Honolulu on our way to LA and it was hands down 100 times better than the PK - for the same price.I told reception about the power points and the disgusting state of the bathroom. We won't be back. There are other much nicer hotels in the area now. It's a shame because the location is fabulous.

Excellent location of the hotel, it is walking distance to the shops especially to the beach. Bryce from front desk was very helpfull. Cleanlinees of our room is very poor, eventhough they clean our room everyday it's still dusty. I'm an SPG member but they put me on lower floor. My brother and sister are with me and they put them on higher floors (level 21 & 26) and i was on 8th floor??!! NOT SO GOOD!!! But i still recommend this hotel to my friends for the good location though.

We have stayed at the Princes to celebrate Christmas or New Years during the last few years. The hotel is older and is not as fancy as some of the other hotels on the main strip. The rooms have been recently renovated and the lobby has been refreshed. Its strength is in its long term staff and their commitment to the hotel and to the guest. We have met long term servers (20+ years) and young staff and it looks like their management team treats them well and they treat the guests well.This hotel is the best value of the SPG hotels in Honolulu. You can borrow chairs and towels and go to Waikiki beach across the street. There is water and fresh fruit service at designated times of the day.If you are a Platinum SPG member, you will get breakfast coupons for their well stocked buffet breakfast which includes made-to-order omelets. One perk is to use 2 coupons for their buffet dinner which includes all you can eat prime rib and snow crabs! Evenings are enjoyable with live music from the bar from 8:30 to 10:30 pm.

Huge credit to the staff here. We checked in at the end of our 3 week holiday/wedding/honeymoon and when the staff found out, they upgraded our room, had a lovely card and rose in the room and delivered champagne to us. Completely unexpected and amazing customer service.The hotel itself is in a prime location and close to everything. We enjoyed the music by the pool each night.The rooms are starting to age a bit, just an FYI.

The room was nice, the views were breathtaking, I loved the patio. The front desk staff was super accommodating, helped me with any and everything I had questions about. I will be back next time I come to Honolulu.

Centrally located on Waikiki beach, this property being a little older than others, is well maintained. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. We all enjoyed our trip. Would go back if Waikiki was our destination.

Only one block from Waikiki Beach, just cross the street. Pool is deep and pretty. Live entertainment by the pool that you can enjoy from your balcony. Amenities in case you forget something. The robes and slippers are so comfy!

Booked this hotel over a month in advance. 2 adults 2 Children. When we arrived New Year's Eve, we were informed we were upgraded to a king bed.....as nice as an upgrade us, not convenient for 4 people or allowed by hotels due to safety regulations. We were told we booked wrong and they didn't see the kids. Then they saw the kids. Everett, the manager , while smirking, said he couldn't comp us a nights stay, nor could he guarantee that 4 people in 1 room had never happened before. Completely ridiculous and obnoxious and condescending response. We are from Kailua, Hawaii and enjoy staycations on a regular basis. NEVER, have I ever been treated so poorly and like I was an idiot. Stay anywhere but a Sheridan if you visit Hawaii or if you're taking a staycation! Outrigger Reef knows how to treat their kamaaina!

A little context - we are a grown family of four spending 2 weeks in Hawaii - and this was our first stop - in Oahu. We are frequent Starwood customers and usually like their hotels, and we stayed here on points - for two nights -our first two in Hawaii.The room was smallish for the four of us - but we weren't in it very often. We were upgraded to a pool / ocean view which was very nice as we could hear the hawaiian musicians at night. Hotel was very full but they allowed us a late checkout.For sure it is an older hotel - but everything is clean and the location is excellent. It is not the Four Seasons, and the rates reflect that too. C'mon people - cut them a break - this is a wonderful legendary hotel that delivers superb value for money.Thanks especially to Uyen who was helpful at checkout, and also to Kris (maybe that's his name - from Pennsylvania) who was very helpful at check-in.Happy New Year!

The hotel has the charme of the seventies as well as the wallpapers with the same age. Altough it's clean, it's all a little greyish and worn out. The fridge made noise, you could not sleep, so I pulled the plug. Would not go there twice.

This time visit l was basically satisfied.But l thought that l could spend more comfortably with the following items in a room.1 Shower toilet2 Slipper3 Toothpaste and Toothbrush4 Swab for earpickPlease consider.

Upgraded to a tower high ocean view before leaving Australia. Arrived to be given my previous booking of partial ocean view. Desk clerk completely indifferent and said I should be happy as the hotel had honored my conjoined rooms request. I am traveling with children so didn't realize this was something that needed to be "honored". Rooms were very clean but so run down. Wallpaper peeling off, carpet coming away from walls, balcony door impossible to slide open as it's so old. Would not even rate it 3 star.Wifi is good.So disappointed with this hotel. Spent months researching and only decided to stay here as I upgraded ( hundreds more dollars spent) to get a new refurbished room on one of the top 10 floors, which has not been honored.Not sure how the hotel gets away with testing people so badly.

Within the last seven years I have been to Oahu 11 times and 9 of them I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.When I began stayed there I had no status with Starwood hotels, but it's location was attractive- right across from the Waikiki Beach and next to the International Market. The hotel is aged comparing to other ones, like the TV, drawers and bathroom counter were old.As years went by I improved to a Gold and now Platinum member, and I get to stay at the upgraded rooms. The hotel also grew with me- they renovated the rooms (I was in 2952) that have newer furniture and paint. The staff is very friendly - front desk try to get you check in asap, the housekeeping staff always have a smile on and is willing to bring you extra bottle of water if needed. The bell desk staff quickly helps you with the luggage. The con is their parking structure does not have elevators, so if you are unable to walk up/down the stairs handling suitcases, unload at the front entrance first and then go park.If you're a Platinum member, they will give you daily breakfast coupons for the days you're staying there. The breakfast buffet has a variety of hot and cold dishes, which is very filling. Last year when I was there I could combine two coupons for one dinner buffet, and the selections were good too. I do not know if this promotion is still going on this year because I used the coupons on breakfast. I'd recommend the hotel if you are on a budget and but want to stay at a centralized location.

My Husband and I stayed here for 7 days during the Christmas Holiday. The staff was very friendly. The hotel was a bit run down and the guest rooms are in need of a serious renovation. This was a surprise because the lobby area was beautiful. Our room over looked yhe pool area. We were very lucky with the view. We were here with 5 other couples and their rooms over looked the garage or parking lot entrance. We made the most of our stay by being out of the room as much as possible. I called the front desk to see if there was a microwave we could use to heat up soup. We were told we vould rent one for a fee. The restaurant breakfast buffet was a bit expensive, therefore we took advantage on the area restaurants. Some good things about this hotel, they loan out beach towels and chairs for no additional fee. The property is directly across the street from Waikiki Beach and down the street from the Honolulu Zoo. I don't see us staying at the property again.

This was our 6th visit to this Hotel. Its no 5 star, but it s hard to match for location and value. There is nothing fancy about it but they do look after their SPG members. Their 35% food discount to SPG members was a plus. Hard to fault this place as what you see is what you get. Special thanks to your Housekeeping Team and young manger Bob. Our faulty fridge was fixed immediately

We stayed in this hotel 5 1/2 years ago and loved it so when coming back again now, we didn't even consider trying another. Their service is outstanding. The staff is friendly and will accommodate as quickly as they can. It's clean and just a really nice place to stay. It's close to all connections for tours and shops of every kind. We'd stay here again in a heart beat.

My 'new' wife and I had six days at the Sheraton on the 7th floor, great view over the pool and ocean. Clean, quiet, we slept well. We've stayed here previously and were once again very happy with our choice and stay. It's a great location for access to the beach and Food Pantry is very close. Complimentary parking (part of the resort fee). It's a great value hotel. One of the better swimming pools also. We confidently recommend.

At first we were a little disappointed that their wonderful Christmas train was discontinued, but the extra effort they put into holiday decorations made up for that. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is well maintained and super comfortable.

Very good experience, excellent location very close to the beach and restaurants. Breakfast is very diverse and good quality. The staff is very nice and polite and ready to help with ones needs. I'll book here again.

We've stayed here before but it has been a while. The public areas (and our room) all look refreshed and better than on our last visit. They've added a great beach service too, with free sand chairs you can check out, and fruit and water delivered to the beach 3 times/day. This is a great value hotel, across the street from Waikiki beach and hotels that can cost 50% more, plus it is much nicer than the other hotels in the comparable category that we've checked out. Can't wait to come back for another visit!

Front desk service was very kind and helpful. Though we arrived in the morning, we could use shower before checking in. We enjoyed Honolulu a lot between arrival and checking in. It is very convenient system for visitors who use early flight.

Hotel accommodation is very good and rooms adequate for spacing. Beds are comfortable and room carpet, blinds and bathroom are clean. Some room facilities are showing signs of aging and bathroom may need updating to be competitive with other modern facilities offered by competing hotels and apartments. Sheraton staff are friendly and very accommodating, I would rate the staff level as excellent. The Hotel has all the features it should to be as competitive with other hotel chains. Hotel restaurant was pricey and did not eat there as there were so many restaurants around the area that were cheaper.

The hotel was central to transport and shops. Close to the beach. We had a great view of the pool and the beach. Our room was clean and spacious. The only thing we didn't like was breakfast. For a buffet, it wasn't that great. Overall it was nice, we would stay there again.

The facilities were very nice and the view from our room was incredible. We also got upgraded to a king bed which was great. The location of the resort was great. Just a short walk away from many shops and restaurants

From the moment we walked into the hotel we felt like we were in Paradise. The staff was so friendly, our room was HUGE with great views of the pool and the ocean from a distance, and the location was perfect! Waking up to Hawaiian music was so peaceful. Our hotel was so central to Waikiki with wonderful restaurants to choose from for evening dining. Thank you for a wonderful vacation! XOXO

Enjoyed our stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, close to the beach and right on shopping strip. Lots close by, helpful staff. Only down side was hotel is a little dated and the door onto the verandah was hard to open and close. Best pillows we have ever had in a hotel and very comfy beds.

About a 3 minute walk to beach. Across street from KFC. What more can you want? Staff was great from check in to house keeping. Enjoyed eating breakfast at the buffet in lobby every day. Make sure to bring your big boy pants. They do not mess around. Yum yum!

Aloha, My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a total of six nights. These visits were broken up into a two night, before proceeding on a cruise and then for a further four nights on conclusion of the cruise. While we were guests I can truthfully say that the Princess is a real member of Hawaiian Royalty. being an avid reader of hotels Emergency Procedures I was extremely impressed of how detailed a Plan and Policy had been developed. To me, this speaks volumes of the operational aspect of the Hotel. The Staff, well what can be said other than superb! Always helpful, professional, cheery and knowledgeable. Whomever we spoke to with a question regarding, well, anything, the member we had spoken to was able to give accurate and fast answers. We found the staff very cheery, and even in the face of a mad "Aussie" managed to try and understand the lingo. The furnishings and fittings were well maintained and when a slow draining sink was reported a maintenance engineer soon put it right. The ambience of the poolside area was beautiful and calming. The pool itself, was well maintained and evidence that hygiene takes precedence over convenience for guests was exhibited when the pool was closed because of a contamination issue. To me, I would rather not swim, than have a hygiene issue be overlooked. Access to shops, transport and beaches could not have been better. The travel/information desk provided some excellent service and certainly was able to use his prodigious knowledge of whats going on and how to get there. Well done for a truly great job.Hotel Management and all staff can be extremely proud of the outstanding performance that they demonstrated while we were residing there. We are blessed that the Princess Kaiulani was our HOME for the time that we visited our friends in Hawaii.We have made a commitment to ourselves that this Royal House will once again be visited when we once again visit the beautiful people and land of Hawaii.

Our stay at the Sheraton was great. Its in a fantastic location that was very convenient for us being we couldnt hire a car. The service and quality of the staff was great and they were efficient in solving any problems we had.

Great stay at Sheraton Princess Kiaulani. Can't beat the location. Everything you need within a short distance. Loved the beach service. All staff we dealt with during our stay were very friendly and professional. Would definitely recommend this property.

We enjoyed our honeymoon and relaxed staying princess kaiulani.The location is good to go anywhere in Hawaii.When we saw the hawaiien dancers and hawaiien musicians played a showcase at the poolside,We felt happy.

I have sojourned at the PK every year in npovember the last 6 or 7 years ,I must say that the value for money of this property has declined! ( rooms needs a serious updating)On the positive side the lobby is pleasant ,WIFI has improved and meets my modest requirements! Main advantage is the location and the ohana atmosphere ...well at least for us for they are used to see us regularly.another advantage is to be able to use all the other Starwood hotel facilities of Waikiki ( restaurants,spa..) which are put on our hotel bill.

This hotel was amazing we had a blast the resort was beautiful and everyone that worked there was great especially shauna lady that worked at the bar she was very nice and always welcoming and the popcorn there was great thank you for the memories;)

We stayed at Princes Kaiulani for 5 nights and we had very good service. The stay was pleasant and enjoyable. Breakfast Pikake Terrace was very nice although a bit pricey. The clerks at the front desk were very friendly and pleasant. Very good.

The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The front desk staff were polite and professional. Room service was quick I was impressed. All of the staff which served us from the cleaning lady to the restaurant servers and concierge desk were great. The food was fresh and tasty. Overall we had a pleasant stay.

Nice hotel in a great location.Close to beach,shops,trolley line and buses. Supermarket one block away. Great beach services. Hotel staff and service excellent when our mini frig stopped working. The frig was replaced and we received a gift for our inconvenience. The meals and bar service we had here were good and there was nightly entertainment that varied each night. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani had amazing service, helpful staff and just made our first trip to Hawaii so worth while, thank you so much! They made it easy to book any day trips as well and the friendly staff made it such a nice environment to stay in.

We had four nights at this hotel and could not fault it. Lovely room with a fabulous view of the beach and at night the lights of the street below were lovely - when the balcony doors were closed there was no noise to keep us awake at night. We were able to arrange show tickets and shuttle buses from the tourism desk in the lobby - very convenient. Walk outside and within minutes you are on Waikki Beach, shops and restaraunts are also right there. The pink line bus to Ala Moana is a two minute stroll away. Great hotel with very reasonable prices.

Two thumbs UP!!! Great service and property. We enjoyed our stay and the customer service was tremendous. We had great service at the bar and the dining room. My daughter was requesting hot chocolate and they went out of their way to get it for her. Will stay here again definitely!!!Thank you.

This hotel is right in the heart of all the action. Excellent shopping facilities are in walking distance. It is also convenient to Public transportation. The facility itself is nice, but nothing fabulous. The room was clean and quiet.I also ate at the onsite restaurant for the buffet. The food was enjoyable, but you might want to visit many of the fine restaurants that are within walking distance for diversity and flair.There was a Hawaiian show at this location. It is very exciting and quite entertaining.

We stayed on our honeymoon and the resort was awesome and upgraded our room to an ocean view room. Great view, clean suite and comfy bed! Short walk across the road to get too the beach! Would stay again

After finding the hotel we had first selected was unavailable, I began researching nearby hotels. Photos of this hotel looked great, but I read contradicting reviews. The majority of medium to low ratings seemed related to hotel hosting oriental guests. So what? My wife and I were greeted with Aloha, and we were treated throughout our 9 day stay with utmost caring and personal attention. We found the hotel clean and our room was kept up and cleaned daily by the hotel personnel. Parking was the best we had ever had at any Waikiki hotel. No, our room was not huge, but by no means cramped. We were greeted with a bottle of champaigne as we celebrating our 44th wedding anniversary. All our requests for assistance was always filled immediately and with a smiling face. We fave been coming to Hawaii yearly since 1974. I can assure you this will now be our "place to stay" whenever we will be in Oahu.

My wife and I were there ten days, the overall experience was very good, our room was over priced but all resort rooms in this area are . Our room was cleaned daily. the second day we were there we left the room for the day leaving the safe open with $900.00 in it. When my wife and I returned the room had been cleaned and the money was still there, The Sheraton Princess is in a great location for all local activities. The staff was very helpful. If you want an ocean view this is not the hotel for you. However, the Sheraton Princess has everything else you need to for a great stay in Hawaii. If my wife and I were to return to Hawaii we would stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

The place is located very close to all things and places that I love to doHiking,shopping,swimming, and of course eating and drinking Walk to the canal,Ala Moana Shopping Center, the new International Market is your neighbor and uou can even walk to St Augustihe church

We had 9 amazing nights at The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. A friendly relaxed atmosphere combined with a great central location made this the place to stay. Staff were friendly and very helpful.We loved every minute of our stay here !!!!!!!

Excellent position for shopping,restaurants, and public transport around the Island. Tip try and book a room overlooking the pool, that way you get to watch the Hula dancing and singing in the evenings from you balcony.

Just returned from Honolulu. Stayed at the PK like I usually do. This is just a great, close to everything hotel. Comfortable rooms, great employees, and really good food at their pool bar and their buffet. It was so busy because of the Pearl Harbor visitors but the employees never missed a beat and maybe were even nicer...although they always do a great job. Just a great place to stay!

The complimentary water in the room was a real pleasure. We enjoyed our "room with a view". Felt very much at home with complete privacy and respect from the housekeeping staff. We were able to enjoy the nightly entertainment. Was a pleasure to have our car so close at hand and conviently parked for next day touring.

Upon checking in I was treated like the prince of the hotel Princess. The hotel in nothing special but us location and value make up for it. Don't waste money on an expensive hotel. Get to the beach during the day and come back to sleep in a nice clean room.

Checked in yesterday & today we woke up to BROWN water coming out of the sink. Called guest services & they said they are fixing the pipes & should be back to normal in 20 min. Left for the day & came back at 9pm tonight with BROWN water still!!!!! Mind you I have a 2 month old baby that needs her bottles washed & needs to take a bathe. This is UNHEALTHY! Called AGAIN & was told the same thing & to run the water. Don't know what to do. Wish I booked somewhere else! Oh & please give yourself time when using the elevators... if you're lucky, the 8th times a charm!

I have never stayed there before, but I am happy to say the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a friendly, comfortable place to stay. For anyone on a budget and wants good service, plus being handy to Waikiki Beach, buses & just a walk to shopping ( go to Ross first , but don't fill your suitcase straight away ). Budget meals all around. Have fun exploring and don't be shy asking for help.

This is my second time staying here and we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is centrally located near all of the shopping and many restaurants. It is right across the street from Duke's restaurant and near the Royal Hawaiian Center. We were greeted by a friendly person at check in and were upgraded to a pool view room. This is an older hotel and the room showed some age but it was clean and we were hardly in the room. We had the included breakfast buffet which was fabulous. There was an omelet station and many various breakfast items to choose from. The guava juice was the best I have ever tasted. The service was exceptional in the restaurant. As soon as your plate was finished, they picked it up. We had Kimmy as our server for three days and she was great. We did have a car so we used the parking garage which is conveniently located next to the hotel. We also used the beach service, picking up chairs, towels and heading to Waikiki Beach, a short distance away. While on the beach, the hotel staff comes 3 times to offer you bottles of cold water and a piece of fruit.We did not use the pool as we came for the beaches but it looked clean and inviting. If you want a nice hotel in a great location and be treated royally by the staff, this is the place to stay.

We stayed here eight years ago after our wedding on Kauai. Great room, teriffic view of ocean and Diamond Head. Stay in a tower room toward the ocean for a better view. Slept for the whole week with balcony window wide open and great breeze. Will do again.

I've stayed at the PK for a number of years, mostly in the Nov-Dec. time. While the PK is needing an update of the facilities, the staff is wonderful. From the time I get to the desk for registration until I leave, the staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. My favorites are their staff at the Splash Bar, particularly bartender Shonna and wait staff, Angie and Debbie. They remember me from previous years, give great service and are very accommodating. I can't recommend them and the PK more enthusiastically.

Great hotel, all the staff were very friendly, perfect location being straight across from Waikiki Beach and on the main shopping strip, we chose the Sheraton Princess because of location and price and we definitely would stay here again

I have stayed at several other Waikiki hotels over the years, but have found the PK to be the best value overall. The hotel is dated as the other reviewers have reported, but recent upgrades have improved it. It was to close, and be part of a complete renovation/demolition a few years ago, but then the developers lost approval connected with a larger project. Thus, I think that until that project did not move forward, the owner did not want to put any money into it. However, the recent renovations have improved the rooms, lobby and pool area. The hotel is located across the street form the beach, and if you pay for a high ocean room, which I recommend, you can see the ocean, part of Diamond Head, the pool, and the main street below. The money you save by staying across the street with an ocean view vs. on the beach with an ocean view is worth it. You can visit the other Sheraton properties on the beach and enjoy their bars and restaurants with room charges. The PK has all types of cultural activities, and nightly entertainment. The people who work there are all fantastic. If you want to go to Hawaii for fancy hotel room go somewhere else. If you want a nice room with a view for a moderate price, a good location, and wonderful staff, come here. Use the money you save and enjoy the reason you came to Hawaii-to see the Islands and experience the Aloha.

Pay a little extra for a room on a higher floor it you want wonderful views. We were on level 9 and view was nice but we will ask for a room on a higher level next time. Best views are from side of hotel overlooking swimming pool.

Updated carpet, bathroom, tv and paint. Activities daily for a nominal fee. Lei and bracelet making, Hula lessons.Walking distance to everything only steps away from the beach, market and shopping. Live Hawaiian music nightly.

Good hotel that was close to shops, restaurants and beach. Happy hour was availed of on a regular basis as we were a large group ( 11 people) and we used it to recover from days activities and plan the nights.

We've stayed in several Waikiki hotels, but keep coming back to the PK. The people are so friendly and willing to assist in anything. The location is incredible, across the street from the Moana, Dukes and the Royal Hawaiian. The new International Marketplace is next door, great shopping and several unique restaurants with more set to open. The hotel itself is a little dated, but who would come to Waikiki just to experience the hotel room. We had several maintenance issues, a refrigerator that didn't work, a broken tv, a toilet seat that wouldn't stay up, but upon reporting these to the front desk three workman were at the room within minutes with a new tv, new refrigerator and fixed toilet. To me the best part of the PK is saving money on the room stay, but being able to experience the beach side hotels across the street, the Moana Surfrider and Royal Hawaiian, and since they are also Hilton properties having the convenience of room chargers in their bars and restaurants. We flew out from Chicago on United and got to know our friendly flight attendants a little, then were pleased to reach the PK and see our crew sitting in the bar area and enjoying the experience with us. Overall, a great experience and we will keep coming back.

This hotel exceeds all expectations. This was my 7th stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and I will go back again and again. It is affordable, and better than a 3 star hotel in my opinion, and in the best location in the heart of Waikiki. I have stayed many times with my husband and 2 daughters, it is a fantastic hotel for families, but this trip was just myself and my sister and I enjoyed it as much as I have every other time. The rooms are great, always spotlessly clean and well maintained, and the housekeeping staff are always smiling and always greet us with 'Aloha'. We had an ocean view room and the view was spectacular. I honestly can't fault the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel and look forward to going back again next year.

Loved this hotel, great location! Cheap (compared to most places in HNL)Am a travel agent and will recommend this hotel to everyone who goes. We were lucky enough to get a beach view off our balcony which was lovely.

The staff (Erin especially) was very accommodating in helping my sister and I surprise our mother, who was a guest there. Erin provided exactly what was needed for the surprise and allowed us to have a fabulous time. The hotel is great! Perfectly located in Waikiki.

Location was right on, service from staff was very good, and food on the menu was also excellent . However, the food at the buffet was extremely greasy and the pools floor needs to be retouched. Overall, we would still stay there again and recommend it to friends as well.

Travel back to a more genteel time. The circular driveway (Porte cochere) draws you in. Staff greet you like family repeatedly as you enter the resort. The open airy welcoming reception area and main hotel concourse is filled with smaller seating areas like a series of family rooms to gather before meals, strolls to the beach, or an excursion. The center jewel is a refreshing pool, surrounded by chaises, cabanas, and seating. A stage offers nightly entertainments. Across the street is the best part of Waikiki Beach, and shops of all types surround the property. Views include Diamond Head and Waikiki cityscapes. Parking is attached.

for what you pay, it's an amaizing value! amazing location next to the imp, amazing staff like Erin, from Kailua, I think that's her name, who makes me feel like family at registration, almost every room has the refreshing sea breeze... what's not to like?

loved our stay again very clean and in the best location. The staff go over and beyond to help.we got up graded and absolutely loved our room 1152 in the A tower. it is very central to everything dining, shopping the beach. We will be back again very soon

Stayed here for 8 nights for our honeymoon and was super impressed! Perfect location & all of the staff are so friendly and all go out of their way to help where they can. You literally step out the front of the hotel onto the main strip, cross a set a lights and you can walk through Moana Surfrider hotel to get to the good part of the beach. I had a few people comment to me prior to leaving that you need to stay at a hotel that is right on the beach, I disagree! With how close the hotel was to the beach it didn't matter to us that we just had to cross the road. Thanks Princess Kaiulani, we will certainly be back!!

We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights prior to boarding the NCL Pride of America for a cruise around the islands.We arrived well after midnight and in spite of the hour we were made very welcome and this seemed to be a feature of our short stay, with friendly and helpful service from all those we spoke to, even down to the concierge helping to pack 6 adults and numerous cases into a single taxi for our short transfer to the ship.The location of the hotel, right in the heart of Waikiki, one block back from the beach was perfect with plenty eateries on the doorstep and shops open until 11.00 pm.However, our room was in desperate need of some updating and was somewhat tired at best. As we left they seemed to be closing off several rooms on our floor (6), so perhaps this is happening right now.Recommended for a couple of nights, but probably not for a whole holiday.

The hotel is spacious and look appealing. There is a very nice gym and laundry facilities available. Unfortunately we found that being a destination for people from all over the world meant that jet lag and sleep schedules were a problem for us as. We were kept awake for several nights before being moved down the hall. On the plus side the concierge was good, location was amazing and I'd go back again and request if a room away from others is an option.

Not super fancy but certainly nice enough. The mega value here is the location. We've been coming to the PK for 8 years in a row now and will be returning for a very long time to come as it is our annual Thanksgiving tradition. We also love that the staff is mature and does not seem to have a high turnover rate. We've become friends with the poolside bartender and waitstaff and will be super sad when they retire.

We have stayed here about 8 times. The best of it is the location. While not on the beach front, its only across the road, and you also have access to the other main places, like Moana Surfrider, and the Sheraton Waikiki.

Great location with access to the tourist locations and not a long walk to the non-tourist (and less expensive/more authentic) locations. Rooms were well kept, quiet, with balcony, and comfortable. Wifi worked great and accommodated my business needs well.

I was so looked after when my wife suffered a major injury (off-site) that required hospitalization. All the front desk staff (particularly Erin, Kathy & Celine) couldn't do enough to help with all facets of the enforced extra stay at the hotel. Not only did Erin find a room in a full hotel, but it had the handicapped facilities my wife needed. And the room staff made a special effort to cope with our needing to spend long periods in the room

Excellent location , stayed 4 nights pre cruise & 1 night post cruise however the room post cruise was fantastic the room we had for 4 nights was clean but dated , very friendly staff & lady at concierge very helpful when we had a problem with speedi shuttle , drinks & food good value

I chose a bundled Expedia deal. I decided to go because the deal included the Princess Kaiulani. I think I confused it with the "Pink Princess." I upgrade to pool view and I was upgraded once I arrived to sea view, though you could see the lovely oval pool from the small but sufficient terrace and the bustle of the palm surrounded space below. You could swim while listening to live Hawaiian music and watching a hula show. Even if you are up in your room, the music reminds you, you are in HAWAII and it matches so beautifully with the Pacific, the swaying palms, the surfers who would be out there as early as 6:00 am. I liked the hotel. It has a great open lobby space that leads to the street and to the pool. I have no complaints. I felt comfortable in the hotel and thought the staff was just fine and the ambiance of the lovely princess was honored in a wonderful traditional shrine and many photos of Princess Kaiulani. It was also just a few steps to Waikiki Beach. Wish I were there right now.

The staff are much more friendlier and welcoming compare to the other Sheraton in the area.The hotel is old and rooms need upgrading.The pool is really disappointing, small and looks old.Good entertainment, different everyday.

Lovely location, pool area very pretty with lots of available lounges. Friendly bar staff and reasonable cocktails . Our room was upgraded to a tower room with ocean view. Roomy and comfortable . Own balcony and great view. Breakfast was a little pricey but very generous . Lots to chose from . Staff at breakfast were particularly helpful. Wish we could have stayed longer

Close to everything! Staff is out of this world helpful. Breakfast Buffett is great! Rooms are a little old but the price is right and bed is comfy. Shower pressure is crazy good! All the local stuff is just outside the door! Dukes is across the street 100 yes from the ocean! Can't beat this!

Stayed at Sheraton princess kuala ni at Honolulu. Pretty average rooms, average service from front desk. Ordered daily paper and didn't receive any for the week. Pool average. Breakfast average . Got an earlier than expected wake up call on the last morning thanks to the room smoke detector sounding low battery warning at about 5.30! Not great, on checking out the guy said sorry to any complaints ,wow. No effort to maybe reduce or drop the service fees, next time won't be there! That's for certain!!

When I go Hawaii I stayed this hotel. Always welcome n really nice place. I will be back next April. And I'm happy to hear that hotel will continue... already miss Hawaii neime ke aloha pumehana e kakou

This was our 3rd stay at this hotel and even though the hotel has seen its years they have done a great job renovation some wings. The staff is very friendly but can be rigid especially when they are busy. I am SPG and they always try to work with me with special requests. My family enjoyed the stay and are looking forward to going back next year. You must do their breakfast buffet even if you don't eat lunch and dinner on property. The resort fee is worth it as it covers parking and wifi which to me I a great deal at $26.

The hotel interior is nice, felt the Hawaiian/Polynesian style. The staff there are always happy to help and always keep a smile. The bed is comfortable and the WI-Fi was easy to connect all around the facility. I used their pool and I enjoyed some of their nights where they have live Hawaiian music and dancers beside the pool area. Walking distance to Waikiki beach is only 3 minutes. We just need to cross the street and walk one block. In the room, you could sometimes hear one of the room beside due to the emergency door, but other than that, the room is well soundproof. We had a nice bedroom with an open view facing tall buildings that are far away and hills. Definitely try to get a room to one of the highest floors + far away from elevator and you wont regret it.

We got mixed up and came one day before our reservation that was prepaid with Starwood points. The clerk checked us in, transferred our points, and gave us a very nice room with great ocean and mountain views.

This Hotel was excellent, very central to everything in Waikiki. Spend a bit extra and get a ocean view room. Wow!. Pool small but area around very comfy, you can sip cocktails and nibble all day with great service from the staff. They give you comfy chairs to take to beach. Water every day in your room. Coffee/tea replaced every day in you room and coffee machine boils water for tea. Only wish they had a lar carte brekkie menu.

Paradise, close to the beach, beautiful views of the ocean and city, staff absolutely friendly and close to amazing shopping, pool was lovely beautiful location and easy walking distance to shops restaurants and beach Mahalo

Gracious and friendly staff. In providing information on tours and local hot spots the staffs property knowledge is appreciated. Hotel exceeds expectations in providing Hawaiian music, crafts, and exhibits in the lobby. Great daily entertainment

Great location in the center of Waikiki and across the street from the beach. Within walking distance for shopping at all the stores and restaurants located on and off the main road. We had a room that overlooked the pool area which held nightly entertainment that we could enjoy from our lanai (balcony). The lanai is not very spacious, just enough room for 2 people. Our room was average, I would equate it to a mid-level hotel with an upscale price, but that's Hawai'i. It could have used some updating but we don't travel to spend time in the room so that's not a big concern to us. Most importantly it was clean, the beds were very comfy and it was quiet. The staff, (front desk, housekeeping, parking attendants) were all very friendly, helpful and courteous. We didn't encounter anyone who didn't act professionally. Parking is available if you have a car and public transportation is close if you don't. There is a restaurant on site with a decent menu and a small coffee stand just outside the pool entrance from the street that serves pastries and sandwiches. Hotels across the street obstruct the ocean view unless you're on the top floors. We enjoyed our stay and would consider this hotel again on a future visit.

Located across Kalakaua Avenue from big-bucks properties like the Westin Moana Surfrider, the Royal Hawaiian, the Sheraton Waikiki, and the Halekulani, the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani with its more reasonable rates has been a favorite of mine for years. The rooms and their views have always been tropically attractive, and the staff is long on aloha and short on attitude. The restaurants, which are arranged around the lobby-floor pool area, serve scrumptious Hawaiian-style food in a casual atmosphere.

This hotel is I a good location, one street back from Waikiki beach, close to shops and restaurants. Pool good size. Room clean well presented. Most rooms offer ocean views at reasonable price. Coffee/ tea making in room plus fridge and safe.

We recently stayed four nights at this hotel and found it conveniently located and very much a tourist hotel.The rooms were clean and equipped with all the facilities needed. However, it is a well used hotel and will soon need and refurbishing to bring it back up to the standard one would expect for the cost of the room. We were told that were up graded to the tower and when looking down from the balcony was surprised to see that large sections of the building suffered from cement cancer which is not a good look for guests..The continental breakfast was certainly not up to the standard that one gets in Australian hotels.The staff went out of their way to make one feel welcomed.

Let's be frank, the hotel is old and is need of renovation. They have started renovation in some areas that are easy like floors and some furniture. But the bathrooms are still very dated. That said, what they lack in a physical building, I feel they make up for in Platinum Recognition and relative price. The morning breakfast buffet is awesome. You can even combine two of you breakfast coupons for a free dinner which is a great option. They give you a free small plate at the bar as well when you check in. Perhaps the best benefit is if you have a red eye out of HNL they have a section of the hotel where they will give you a room till 11PM! Now, you have to move rooms, but it is an extremely nice benefit to have a room to 11PM to work, watch TV or relax. It's just on the older side of the hotel on a low level. Combine that with the price, this hotel is a great option for business travelers who have SPG Status. The location is also central which is good/bad depending if you need to leave Waikiki opten.

An older hotel which provides easy access to local busses, Waikiki beach, Diamond Head, shopping and more - away from the hustle and bustle of Honolulu - also provides east access to tours of the island and Pearl Harbour.

This hotel is in a great spot across the road from waikiki beach. Very handy to local transport if you want to go to Diamond Head or the shopping mall. Friendly staff. Ine slight negative is the rooms would be better if the balcony doors were double glazed. However, we had a great view over the beach so cant really complain.

We were very pleased with this hotel. Great location and lovely helpful staff. We were on the 22nd floor of the tower in a newly refurbished room with a balcony, with views over Waikiki beach. It was the first American hotel we'd been in that had enough sockets to charge all our electronic gadgets in one go!! Not a big room but very clean, well decorated and good bathroom. The only bit that didn't look right among all this 'newness' was the light switches and wall sockets which hadn't been renewed and were a grubby yellow color!! That's a minor niggle, because everything else was excellent. The pool area was super with plenty of loungers, and some lovely half-price cocktails in the afternoons. We went for the buffet breakfasts which were lovely and with good choices. We didn't eat dinner in the restaurant, as there were so may places to eat in Honolulu. The twice we went to the beach we collected towels and chairs from the pool area, which worked just great. A great place to be based to enjoy O'ahu.

good position near the beach, close to bars & restaurants. Hotel well maintained, staff excellent. Breakfast expensive, ate out nearby. Excellent view from high in tower (premium rate though), lift only up tower (busy at peak times).

Hotel is fairly basic and is probably due for a serious renovation but the location was fantastic. The room and bed were comfortable, although the decor was very tired, and the buffet breakfast was good. Surprisingly for such an old building the acoustics were good also. We had great views of the surf beach from our balcony.Staff were friendly and helpful.

This hotel was everything that I wished for - great location in the middle of Waikiki Beach and a short walk to great shops and restaurants. The bed was super comfortable and all amenities clean and fresh. My husband and I had a room on the 21st floor with a lanai and it was great to sit out there with our morning coffee (freshly brewed in the percolater) and enjoy the ocean view. I would definitely stay again as some of the other hotels we looked at were either too big and crowded or old and tired looking.

An eight day break at the Sheraton was a delight, although we arrived way too early to check in the bell staff were on the ball and stowed our bags.The front desk did a pre check-in to save us time and we spent a few hours exploring the hotel and surrounds.Then, even earlier than expected, the front desk got us up to our room as early as possible.The staff here are all very professional and friendly.The rooms are clean and spacious and we'll appointed.A special vote of thanks to both Julian and Cathy on the front desk for their thoughtful consideration and to our chamber maid for an excellent job.

This hotel is not on the beach but if you get a floor above about 10 you will see the sea and a glimpse of the beach. The staff I have found are very friendly and competent. The hotel overall is a little tired. However I like this area of Waikiki, perhaps because I know it. I have stayed here before and would do so again unless I wanted to spend more on a beachfront hotel.
