I have stayed at the PK many times and am always satisfied with the room and service. While it is not 5-star, it is certainly a very good value and lives up to the Starwood standards. Always friendly service and recognize frequent visitors. I feel at home here.

We found nearly all accommodation in Waikiki to be so overpriced it's not funny. This hotel was one of the few at a reasonable price for our budget. However, for how much we paid, the hotel was very old and only ok. Staff were great and very kind to us, so commend them on that.The hotel is in a great location and very close to everything. But still no ocean views at all really in a 'partial ocean view'. I wasn't expecting the world, but we were quite low and had very limited views, if at all, from our balcony.Also, we didn't even eat or drink at the bar in the hotel as all the prices were quite expensive. You could find cheaper food and drink across the road at Duke's and you get a beach front view!

this is my 7th trip to Waikiki and the PK didn't disappoint, location is the best, we had a room overlooking the pool, its great for an afternoon drink and just to chill and people watch..... from the time of checking in Darlette made sure all our needs were met, she is a great asset to the PK, even delivering a welcoming basket to our room.Belinda from housekeeping is awesome, so is Sheryn at reception.... the beds are comfy, the rooms are clean and all services are second to none.... if your looking for a great stay in Waikiki you cant go past the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani....

First time stay here and had a partial ocean view room which was on the 26th floor and had views of the beach. Hotel is an older hotel room which was very spacious and had a balcony with a small table and chairs to sit on. Although others had said that the side we were on could be noisy as it was on the side overlooking the construction of the International markets with the balcony door closed it was never a problem and even during the day we didn't notice the noise.Hotel is centrally located near beach and restaurants. There is a good pool with lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas and the bar staff will come to you for your order and you can also order snacks.You can also get a beach chair from the pool desk to take to the beach which are easy to carry and as the beach is so close I would advise anyone to take advantage of this and also the beach towels. Staff at the beach desk are very friendly and will offer you advise on places to go etc.All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.Each room has access to free wifi although not as good as wifi at home and also phone calls home (Australia).I would stay here again.

I only had the opportunity to stay 1 night at the Princess Kaiulani. You cannot beat the location for proximity of what's happening in Waikiki. I arrived from a private home in Honolulu by Uber at 7 am in the morning of my one night stay. No rooms were available yet for my price reservation(which I made the day before online). I was upgraded almost immediately to a partial Ocean view on a very high floor. I was able to see Diamond Head from my balcony and see the beautiful Moana Surfrider in full splendor right on Waikiki Beach. I had my suitcases delivered and rested for about an hour. I headed down to the lobby and low and behold, an old acquaintance from 20 years prior was still making and selling his jewelry in the lobby. I had just purchasde a ukulele and had it with me, I asked if he played and play he did!! He is 82 years old now, but 20 years prior had taken my friends and I on a tour of the highlights of Oahu, including a great Chinese lunch. Boy we laughed hard all those years ago. Even though he had no memory of us, I enjoyed his sharp mind and awesome ukulele playing. Since I was temporarily alone, I made reservations for the last seating of High Tea at the Moana Surfrider which is also a Sheraton property that I have stayed at several times. Now I was treated like a Queen, seriously. Not sure why. It was a highlight of my stay in Oahu for 3 days. I left at 4 am the next morning to get to the airport and fly to Kauai where my daughter lives and works. Everyone was extremely hospitable towards me and I really enjoyed my stay there. I shopped most of the day and was at Duke's on Sunday, ate at Yard House and walked my butt off up and down the main street. Always a great place to stay in Waikiki.

Good location, if Waikiki is your thing. But I fear the PK has been getting by on location alone for far too long. Room interiors are circa 1980, so greatly in need of a makeover. Service is more than adequate, but just can't make up for the tired-looking decor.

We rented a car for the last 3 days of our 7 day stay and wanted to add the resort fee to our room because it included parking. (It also includes water which we already got daily, and internet which is free in the lobby, and phone calls which we had no need for). The resort fee is $25.00 per day; the same price as daily parking, so the only other benefit would have been to use internet in our room instead of the lobby. Unreal that the policy is to add it to the whole stay...all or nothing. How absolutely ridiculous is that? So we went with the parking fee for the 3 days. They would have charged us and extra $100.00 for nothing!!! The front desk staff have little to no latitude to adjust issues; and have to check with management. When we arrived, our room overlooked a giant noisy air conditioning unit. To move us, a manager was called at 4 in the morning! We were with a group of executives on a special rate, and I could not believe the poor room we got. No foresight for future business with such a group. Our view was a construction site next door and they start work at 5 in the mornning, even on weekends. Aside from the hotel (and this is a review of the hotel), I loved Hawaii. I would never stay here when there are so many views to be had; and so many nice pools with sun. The resort fee policy is simply a cash grab.

Positives would have to be the great location, it's right in the middle of everything. Walking distance to shops, restaurants and the pink line trolley stop is not far away, this will take you to the Ala Moana shopping mall for $2 (they only take correct change). Staff were excellent, room was clean and bed was very comfortable, it had a small balcony overlooking the pool. Ate breakfast one morning at the restaurant and it was good, small buffet selection but filling. They do happy hour and even though we didn't use the pool it looked very inviting but not a lot of shade. You can also have use of chairs etc to take across the road to sit on the beach which was close and gorgeous. Negatives would have to be-the rooms need updating and even though it did not affect us there is construction going on next door, maybe ask for a room with a pool view in the older building. We would stay here again and recommend it to others.

We stayed in 3 hotels in Hawaii. This was simply the best of them all. The hotel is in a great location for shopping for our teens,an added bonus.The staff were exemplary, going above and beyond.I was touched by their kindness and thoughtfulness. Highly recommend itThank you

From the moment I arrived this hotel provided the ultimate service . I was given a 2 double bed room and preferred a king bed , the hotel accommodated my request and also with a special gift basket ?The hotel provides the only beach service that I know of , fresh water and fruit ...hows that for going the extra mile !Would totally recommend this hotel as the position is brilliant and the hotel is super great .Rooms are very comfortable -yes furniture could be updated but it did not deter my love for the hotel /Currently there is construction happening next door - cant be helped - they do start early ....only downside .Up and early

This hotel might not look the most modern or have the best location but for the price it was much better than expected. It is very hard to find and we drove past it several times before finding it. The signage is not very good. However, the employees are friendly, the rooms clean and it sits right across the street from the Moana Surfrider and the beach. Breakfast was a buffet and it was fabulous- omelet station, fruits, pastries, bacon, eggs and even grilled salmon. Can't be beat! Dinner was enjoyable and the Maui chips and dip are homemade. Parking is free and included in the resort charge. Nice open courtyard and great value. Would recommend.

Stayed for 13 Nights over Christmas/NY with Family Group in 3 Tower High Ocean View RoomsProsPrior to choosing our Hotel choice, Compared to other 3-3.5* properties over the time we stayed SPK represented the best value in terms of $$$ & locationGreat Location, across road to beach & right in the midst of shopping.Friendly Staff from Front Desk, Bell Desk, Concierge & our housekeeper Madeleine, Pool Staff who also visited the beach area by police station area & asked if we wanted a bottle of cold water & fruit one day we were sitting on the beachNice Modern Check In, Bar, Café, Pool Area to spend part of your dayComfy Bed & great pillows.Good entertainment each night with a nice line up of singers listening to easy sounding songsThere is a self service laundry with 5-6 washers & dryers reasonably priced.ConsOur Tower High (Floor 28) Ocean View Rooms were facing International Market Place, & extremely noisy from construction from about 7am until 5pm on the days they worked. Building is supposed to be completed by Aug 2016, so over the next few months noise levels should start to improve, as internal construction of the building will start. Reception did tell me that these rooms are allocated to rooms booked through an alternative source ie: Travel Agent, other booking agent & the Eastern Side Rooms facing away from International Market Place are allocated to bookings made direct with the hotel. However you can call up & ask for a Supervisor once your booking is made & ask for a East facing room. It wasn't always pleasant sitting on our balcony when construction was happening, but we didnt go to Hawaii to sit on our balcony from 7am-5pm & in reality we were away from our room from 10am-4pm most days. Room was fine but felt Bathroom was dated, & in need of updating, along with general mantienance of the room ie -our iron board was broken & fridge shelf broken.My biggest gripe would be the poor ventilation as you neared the lefts located by the Restaurant Area as we were coming & going from our room. It was very overpowering, & a couple of times made me feel queezy.Even though I have said Cons, in the big scheme of things they arnt major. Overall we had a great stay & considering what we paid in comparison to other properties we would return to SPK. If you are looking for a good value 3 star property this is the place to stay. If you are looking for a Traditional 4-5* Sheraton then No.

This hotel is a gem to stay at. Located on the main road strip & very short walk to the beach. Excellent service. Rooms were clean & big. Big balcony, which we used to sit and watch the traffic, lights & beach. Our room was on the side, so we got a bit of a view from all sides. Hotel is in the middle of all the action, so we went shopping & would drop off our bags, before going out again. We heard from others that were staying on the other side of the hotel, near the construction & they were not happy. We were lucky on our side, we didn't hear anything, except people closing their rooms doors. Not sure why hotels don't install quiet closing doors. I am on holidays, I want to sleep in a bit.

Worst ever. Huge construction project next door, and they deliver their supplies noisily at 3:30am, every second day. Rooms substandard, not renovated for years. $350- US per night. Management not helpful. Bee in Waikiki more than 100 times, never treated like this.

Stayed at the Princess Kaiulani a few years back. Loved everything about the hotel including its location, food service at breakfast ,front desk and dining staff, and the rooms. First room we booked was a nice non-smoking room with a pool view. It had been recently renovated. I was still a smoker back then so wanted room changed to a smoking room. New room was located a few floors up and although it hadn't been renovated like the first room and looked a little worn, it had a great view of the pool area and famous Waikiki [?] Beach . All rooms at the Princess have great little balconies with glass sliders. If other high rise buildings didn't block it, we could have seen down the whole beach area to Diamond Head ! The breakfast buffet was impressive with the usual expected foods plus a lot of Asian specialties ! Dining was either out in the open near the pool or inside under a covered area with view. Perfect location to sight see from. The beach was just across the street. Glad the condo market there softened as we heard the Princess was to be torn down for high end condos . Now we have a chance to stay at the Princess Kaiulani again if we ever make it back to Hawaii !

We recently stayed at The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We were on a family holiday and booked 2 rooms next to each other. The location is ideal and rooms were clean and very comfortable. The pool was very well maintained and the use of beach towels was great. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

I have stayed at Sheraton Waikiki and Sheraton Princess and prefer SP. Sheraton Waikiki charges you slightly more because it's closer to the beach but it's not worth the money. That said, it's not like SW has their own private area on the beach. You would have to pay a lot more and stay at the Royal Hawaiian for that. SP is close enough to the beach where it is easy walk across the street. Service is not great but that's Hawaii. Only issue is the Int'l Mkt has been under construction for years so ask for room away from that side.

Not the newest hotel, but the rooms are nice, the service great and you can't beat the location. We have stayed at the PK many times and always enjoy it. Debbie, Kayla and Leticia give wonderful service at the Splash Bar. The bartenders..especially Herbie, Mike and Shanna are friendly and make our visit seem like a visit to old friends. It's close to everything and when you check in at the front desk they will answer all your questions....thanks Katie! You can't go wrong staying here.

Great place to stay. Staff are very warm and friendly. Rooms were clean and kept well. Beds were really comfortable. The pool is very small and not very inviting and the Restaurant was over priced but great location right in the middle of Waikiki. Had a lovely time there over Christmas with the family.

Recently, we stayed at The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel in Honolulu. This was our second stay at this location. The rooms, hallways & elevators are a little "tired" looking & could use some updating. That being said the pool & patio area is quite nice & well maintained. The hotel offers free beach towels & chairs that can be taken to the beach. The hotel's location is outstanding. Minutes to Waikiki Beach, restaurants, bars & shopping. The staff is very friendly & very helpful. On this visit we opted for a package that included the breakfast buffet. Lots of selection & the food was tasty. We definitely will stay @ the Princess Kaiulani on our next visit.

This hotel is in a great location, very central to everything I needed and wanted to do. Across the road is the beach, plus the shuttle to Ala Moana shopping Centre. It was also the pick up and drop off points for some on the tours I booked. I had a high floor with partial beach views, great to wake up and have stunning views of Diamond head, beach and the suburbs. I hardly spent any time in the room, but when I did, I found the bed comfortable, room was clean and it had the basic necessities. The hotel staff were very friendly and the facilities (beach service and hotel service were excellent). The only downside was the buffet breakfast, it was ordinary, I could have easily skipped the breakfast and eaten at the many variety of restaurants and eating places within Waikiki. I felt safe within the hotel and walking to and from it, even late at night. Would definitely stay there again.

This was our fourth stay at the Princess Kaiulani. We love the resort style of the hotel with the pool area and surrounds, especially at night, and the location near plenty of restaurants and shops is great. The open feel of the hotel is friendly and relaxing. We had a pool view room, and it's lovely to sit on the balcony and look at the view and listen to the nightly music. The room had two double beds and was a good size, with fridge and tea and coffee making. The bathroom is fine, showing its age but still in good condition and large enough with lots of hot water. Overall this is a great value place to stay with a lovely feel and unbeatable location in the thick of things.

We spent 13 days in a hot and muggy room as the air conditioning did not work properly. It did no good to call the front desk or to have the engineer come check out the unit to tell us there was nothing he could do. The hotel did not move us to another room so we just wasted our money paying for a room that the air conditioning did not work properly. Next year we will not be staying at this hotel.

This was a good hotel for our winter family vacation. It's not a new hotel, the rooms are small and worn, but the staff was hard working. We stayed overlooking the pool and nightly music. It was great! The music was mostly traditional Hawaiian and with hula dancers, and sometimes light family pop music. (The music wasn't loud, it was really wonderful, and closing the patio door blocked all of the music). Most importantly, we really loved the hotel location (1 block from main beach, 1 block from main downtown street with restaurants, shops and stores).

We had a wonderful few days in Hawaii on a stop over to the South Pacific. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, which made our stay more enjoyable. The hotel is across the street from the beach and the hotel supplied beach chairs and towels and brought us fresh fruit. The room was spacious with a great view of the ocean and the City. The hotel was in great shape and close to lots of restaurants and shops.

We booked this hotel while attending the Hawai'i Bowl. The facility was nice and reasonable priced. Even though it was across the street from the beach, there was easy access to enjoy the beach area. The rooms were a decent size and the bathroom was somewhat on the small size. You can tell it is an older property but our stay was enjoyable. We had a room on the 12th floor with a partial view of the ocean. The only down side was the construction next door but we did not let this bother our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant had very good food and the bar area was very relaxing. This is not a luxury hotel but it is a very friendly and affordable hotel. We would stay here again.

We arrived off a long haul flight only to be told that because we did not note that we pre registered our room, our booking had been cancelled. Front desk advised that they were at high occupancy and they would see if they had a room available. We had a four night, pre paid booking, so a room should have still been available. Lobby has been renovated from previous stays but the rooms have not. T could be time for a freshen up. Rooms spacious and even though hotel at full occupancy not noisy. Great location for eating, shopping and local buses to Ala Moana and other areas of Waikiki and Honolulu.

We only stayed 1 night, as the other nights we were at the Moana Surfrider. During our stay there was 1 night the Moana was completely booked up, so we were booked into their sister property right across the street. I now wish we would have been booked into the other Sheraton (Waikiki) property as it looked like a better quality hotel. My husband is a SPG Platinum member, he always receives a suite upgrade. If this room was an upgrade, I'm so afraid to know what the other rooms must be like.For those of you who know my reviewing style; I'm detailed- so if you like skip to the info you need.Parking: No valet. Is self-park and you retrieve from a large garage yourself. If you are on a budget, may be a plus for you. Upon check-in they do bring bags up to your room, so you don't completely get around tipping.Received no flower Lei greeting upon check-in.Pool- is small. It seems most pools in the area are small. (For big pools go to Maui, I guess). The pool is very public, right next to the lobby, the walkway from the luggage stand leads to the pool. Sidewalks with people selling paintings & hocking wares are right in front of the pool. Behind a scrubby hedge is the main drag of Honolulu, Kalakaua Ave. with all the traffic and pedestrians whizzing by. This is not going to be a sit by the pool quietly, relax with the island breezes blowing through the palm tree's while you peacefully read your book. Think loud, crowded & "Seen". Maybe you like that?The Beach: Put on your bathing suit & drag your beach stuff across the street, through the hotel, down around. Come back wet & cold. Get the idea. Staying at the beach is better, then across the street if you can. The Lobby: Not sure what the style is suppose to be. Contemporary, retro, tropical. It's just strange & no working. They have lots of posters for cheesy, magic shows & Elvis tribute shows that no one would attend unless they were part of a prepackaged tour group. The elevators were hot & stuffy.Room: The hallways were so hot, obviously did not have A/C. The hallways smelled badly. The room/suite was straight out of 1950. Maybe they thought it was the Hawai'i 5-0 suite. We were greeted by a harvest gold love seat, avocado green bath fixtures, and formica counters. The kitchenette had a Scotsman mini-fridge. I didn't actually check to see if it was still running. It had really low ceilings, old draperies & old furniture.The a/c unit rattled loudly.We were on the 28th floor. It was super loud, with traffic & construction noise from the International Marketplace, directly next door. There was a large balcony, with double sliders across the room. The huge balcony could be a big plus, except the balcony furniture was rusted & broken. Then someone had apparently tried to repair it with some duct tape. The balcony had a side ways view of ocean.Bathroom: The mirror was so old that the shine had rubbed off it in many places, it was also missing part of the metal. The avocado green bathtub montrostry/shower had a see through window with a retro frosted fern window looking out over the bed.Sleep: Earlier in the day, I took a nap. I awoke to something crawling on me. It was a small ant. There were several ants in the bed & on the floor. I then pulled out the bed and sure enough there appeared to be some kind of insect trap behind the bed. After that there was no sleeping later that night.I would recommend staying else where.

I stayed for a couple of days over thanksgiving and then another 5 days in December and enjoyed it. The tower high ocean view rooms were great very spacious and had fabulous views of the ocean and the mountains. Was very reasonable priced, the staff were nice and helpful. Positioned well just across the road from Waikiki beach, close to all the shops and restaurants.

There is a door shared between rooms which is poorly soundproofed - you can hear pretty much EVERYTHING. Guys next door were talking and laughing out loud till after midnight and I had to complain twice to the front desk for them to send security up for the noise complaint. Even after the security stopped by i could hear the talking voices. Asked for change of room but the staff kept on saying all rooms are occupied. If you are looking for a relaxing, quiet night, you might want to seek for other options.

Arrived at the hotel only to find the room we had booked wasn't avaible..we booked 3 months before.we were offered a room with 2 beds and we said no as we had booked a king,no upgrade was offered,finally they came up with a king room for us in the tower,we had to wait a few hours.The room was ok and the bed comfortable,Bathroom tired looking and had shower over bath,safe wasn't working and security fixed it for us,good view of the ocean from the balcony . Question mark if we would stay there again

We had the best time, hotel is on the older side but it was great. Clean/ service was amazing. The Bar restaurant is where we ate almost all meals and it was awesome. the Kalbi beef tacos were to die for. :) I ate them for every lunch sitting by the pool. the pool was good also, but in November a little to cold for me, but it was a good size and clean.

First time in Honolulu. Not that long a drive from airport. They have porters to look after your luggage.Across the road to Waikiki Beach & heaps of beautiful restaurants. Rooms that overlook the pool & beach are the best. ABC shop across the road which sells everything you need including Alcohol. Bus stop is also across the road which takes you everywhere for $2. Great value. Just be prepared to not get into your room until after 1pm. We arrived at the hotel at 9am & didn't get into room until 2pm. So we just sat in the foyer for the whole time. Not a great experience after we had flown from Sydney all night. But we should have known that would happen so just come prepared with swimmers so you can go for a swim instead of waiting in the foyer, They have towels at the pool. They have a resort charge everyday $25 US which covers Wifi, Beach Chairs to take to the beach, water everyday.

I have been to the "PK" numerous times and it has changed or should i say changing... some kind of keeping up with the times and trying to keep the Polynesian feel hybrid. (not working) ... still like the ground floor pool and location its major asset. Troubles from the get go, booked a vacation package from wesjet and room was not what i booked. Long story short they said i booked through a 3rd party and becsuse someone was willing to pay more they got the room. 40 minutes later after arguing i got to settle in. Some days it looked like they started cleaning room but didnt quite finish (pillow left on floor - no biggy) also bird crap on lanai did not get cleaned whole stay, not going to get into everything but certainly did expect more. Tip: when you book a room add 25 dollars a day to it (resort fee) also if you want good view even numbers 48 to 60 (21 floors up) this view will get you beach facing diamond head. really dont know if i will be back there, too bad was a favorite :-(Dont know if airlines care if there packages are being changed or not but will find out. Also recorded it just in case.Anyhoo, Hawaii is still paradise!

We have stayed here before and like the location. We stayed in ocean view tower and loved it, We could also see mountains and car rental just across street and a half a block down. The hotel has a parking garage as well. We found a lot of other hotel restaurants were to noisy so always came back to ours and watched the Hawaiian dancing . Room was newly renovated and we had a wonderful maid who took great care of us for 12 days. We will return in a couple of years. They some more upgrading by pool and with pool service.

Stayed here because of the location and affordability.Certainly a great location only minutes from Waikiki beach and a multitude of restaurants and shopping arcades but a bit of a disappointment in terms of the quality of the rooms. We had an 11th floor room with good ocean views but the room itself was very tired.Service all round was excellent but the happy hour by the pool bar was very disappointing in that the range of drinks available was very limited.Definitely time for a major makeover in my opinion.

Just finished a week in the Princess. The location is perfect, right across the road from the beach and in the middle of all of the action. Easy to walk to many breakfast choices (as the hotel is buffet only).Staff are very efficient, friendly and helpful.Rooms are old, very 70's and in need of renovating. That said they are basic, clean, tidy.Bedding is comfortable, pillows not so.Pool area is old and in desperate need of maintenance.Pool service, towel service, beach chair service all good, but it is costing some $26 per day (pool service, phone, wi fi, water), which is well over the top.Overall a nice resort, a little old. But if you plan on seeing Waikiki then you really only sleep here.

We had stayed here on our first visit to Honolulu and had loved having our evening meal out by the pool as they had nightly Hawaiin entertainment. The menu of course had changed immensely but we soon found something appetising to enjoy. The food was delicious and the entertainment most enjoyable. A truly wonderful hotel across the road from the other Sheratons but just as nice. Next best thing if you can't afford the beach.

We have been here on business for five days. This was not our choice of hotel but part of the business arrangement.If you must be in Waikiki this is a good location. You are across the street from the beach and right in the heart of Waikiki. That for me, is a negative as well as a positive. I prefer a quieter hotel.There is nothing special about this hotel. The pool is just okay, the hotel lobby hosts cheap, old furniture.there was construction going on all week and the trash is picked up at five am five days a week.This is a middle of the road hotel. Across the street, ocean front is the Moana Surfrider, the sister hotel. There you can eat your meals and charge to your hotel.no one will bother you if you sit at their pool or on their verandah.Coming from New Jersey, I found the food prices to be ridiculous. A sausage and bacon egg wrap with coffee, at the Moana Surfrider was $28.00 including tip. A bagel and coffee at the equivalent of Starbucks was $16.00. Although you can do nothing about the cost of food, I would investigate other hotels. Aloha.

We had a great time and enjoyed the lobby area and pool. Great atmosphere. Tiki lanterns arena great touch around the pool. Happy hour drinks are great value. We lived the chairs that were provided for the beach. High quality Backpack style chairs that had pockets and were easy to carry across the road to the beach. Overall a good hotel and we would certainly stay again.

Great hotel to stay in , if you can't afford to stay on the beach. Location is wonderful. Your across the road from the beach, opposite the Westin Moana Surfrider, which is the sister hotel. Staff are very generous, polite and down to earth. The only thing is annoying , the pool is closed at 1800. Also, the rooms a fairly small, just right for a family with 2 small children , under the age of 10 years old. I do recommend to singles,couples, and families with children.

We had 3 rooms for our party of 6 family members booked here and when checking in were told we had been upgraded which bought smiles to all the faces. My husband and I had the room at the end of the corridor and on entry I was appalled at the size and how old and smelly it was. It had a balcony that overlooked a construction site and the outdoor furniture so filthy I couldn't even sit on it. The room was barely big enough to accomodate both our suitcases and the smell immediately started playing havoc with my sinus. We had when booking asked for a refurbished room as a lot of the TripAdvisor comments had said that parts of the hotel were old and smelly. We had made our booking as part of a package through a holiday group and we emailed them to request it was really important that we didn't get dank smelly old carpeted rooms. My husband planned this trip for our adult kids and their partners as a family holiday and we had been to Hawaii twice before and been so happy with everything. First time staying at a VBRO property on the Northshore and then the Westin Surfrider at Waikiki and the 2nd visit staying at the Hyatt (our favourite). The children's rooms were slightly better in that their furniture appeared newer. My husband asked us all to stay put and not to unpack and he would be back. He came back 45 mins later and said he had managed to get rooms for us all at the Hyatt across the road. I will write a review on that experience but will say it will be much more positive than this one. The Sheraton call themselves 3 star but I would say it is more 1.5 star.

The grand lady of Waikiki doesn't disappoint. With a beautiful appointments and lovely landscaping this hotel is located right on Waikiki Beach. Located centrally on King Kamehameha Boulevard, it's walking distance to restaurants and shops. The Banyan tree bar and icon of the hotel is located outside on a wonderful patio overlooking the Pacific ocean. Entertainment on the weekends and the piña colada's are awesome. The princess is comprised of three hotels, one is the original hotel built in the 1800s the rooms are small, then you have the tower that was built in the 50s and then the larger tower built in 80's. Rooms in the large tower are bigger and more family oriented. You might want to check it out on your next trip to Waikiki. You can walk to a famous Dukes restaurant or just stroll the beach. Water sports are located right in front of the hotel.

The location of this hotel is awesome -- within walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shops and all the bustle of Waikiki. In truth, that's about the only saving quality of this hotel. That and maybe the convenience of the parking garage I suppose.The main lobby is definitely outdated, with odd smells wafting in the air. Staff and service are average. The clean up crew was friendly, very pleasant to deal with, but calling down to the front desk was a hassle every time, consuming five minutes of hold time, even just for quick queries.We had originally booked ourselves for three two queen size bed -rooms, and one king size bed-room. Upon arrival, we came to learn that we had been placed in three king size bed-rooms. When we called the front desk, they stated that when they were booked, the request for said rooms was just something for consideration and not necessarily a reservation. Disappointing, and the front desk person said they would contact us as soon as the rooms opened up. There were other hurdles in just trying to get situated but I'd rather not elaborate. More importantly, inevitably they were able to get us one more room that had the two beds. Now the rooms. they were just subpar, lackluster isn't even a fitting word. The bathrooms smelled, and each room had a differently tiled bathroom, some older than others, definitely not what you'd expect from a place that specializes in accommodations. Rooms were tight as well and the amenities were just old. Having said all that, the company we were with, and the convenience of everyone being on the same floor and the hotel's location made for somewhat of a positive experience. Just OK, leaning towards, we've experienced better. Thank god for the good company we had with us.

I got to stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 5 nights for a friend's wedding, so I was fortunate to get a group block rate, which for me means I got a great value.The first thing I noticed was the wonderful staff at SPK... the warm, friendly greeting and helpfulness upon my arrival, to the on-going "hellos" and brief conversations as I walked to and from the hotel each day. (I was traveling alone and walked everywhere.) I was very surprised by the open air lobby, but this was my first time to Hawaii. I didn't know what to expect from these big name hotels on the Waikiki strip. I guess the open air setting is common. But the lobby at SPK must have been recently renovated.I would have given this property the highest rating was it not for the outdated room that I had, which also seemed partially ready upon my entering. (Clues such as a chair in the wrong place and the trash & recycle bin were on top of the desk.) IMO - some minor renovations could do these rooms wonders! The other issue was that I had a slow draining tub. My 16th floor room had a balcony that faced the city view. Directly below me was the construction of the new Marketplace shopping center. I could see a tiny sliver of the beach/ocean. Although they did warn me about my city view (versus the beach), they did not mention the construction, which is happening all over Honolulu. I know the noise bothered some other reviewers, but I'm a heavy sleeper, and it really didn't bother me. The construction pretty much starts up at 7 am, but will stop immediately around 5 pm. Besides - you're not supposed to be in your room much... you're supposed to be outside enjoying Hawaii!Overall, I had a great time at the SPK. You can't beat the convenient location and hospitable staff.

Love this location central to everything. Across from beach. Family friendly. Pool and bar area great for kids and adults. Room a little small but clean. Staff helpful and restaurant in hotel delicious. Night entertainment was nice and relaxing after a busy day of swimming and shopping. Highly recommend

At first sight, the lobby was very nice, it had a indoor/outdoor feel.The hotel has three towers, one of which faced very loud construction. The rooms were absolutely horrible! We switched rooms twice. They first placed us in the tower that faced the construction and the construction started at 6am in the morning. The sliding door rattled very loudly with the hard wind blowing. The carpet was disgusting. the wall paper in the room was coming off. The bathroom had cracked vanity and tiles as well as MOLD. They had a daily resort fee that included parking and freewifi, etc, but the signal was so weak. On site parking was a plus, but there was no elevator to the parking lot, so you must drop off your luggage at the lobby. Overall, the hotel was extremely dated, and it felt like nothing has been changed, it was unwelcoming. We honestly would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

A great way to spend our wedding anniversary. The staff were very friendly. Ideally located for the beach, shops. Even with the construction going (level 29) on next door, it was a great vacation. Look forward to our next booking

My husband and I spent two nights here on arrival in Honolulu. I had stayed here in 1988 and I don't think anything has been done since, apart from the new tower blocks.We had an ocean view room in the main original block with a fantastic view however the balcony was so small you couldn't even stretch your legs. The only positive was the room was a good size and the bed comfy. Other than that it was very tired, shabby and repairs/maintenance were shoddy and looked like a child had done them. The lift lobby on our floor and the hallways were filthy and run down. The main lobby/reception area was much better.We had breakfast included in our rate but it was so disappointing. Overcooked and uninspiring food. Even the fresh fruit was tasteless. The poor waitresses walked around in dresses that were old fashioned, shapeless and quite honestly looked terrible. I felt really sorry for them. Apart from this, the staff were friendly and welcoming but I felt it was very expensive for what the hotel offered.Two nights was enough and we spent the remainder of our holiday across the road at the Moana Surfrider which was worth every penny!

First stop on my honeymoon and experience was fantastic. Happy, friendly and helpful staff who go above and beyond to satisfy all your needs. Great clean hotel. Close to beach, shops, restaurants and public transport.

This hotel is very dated. The rooms felt drabby and the air conditioner in the room wasn't working during our stay, which made it pretty miserable. We slept with the lanai door open, which helped, but the noise outside made it a less than restful stay. The mattress was okay, but the sheets were scratchy. The floors felt kind of dirty. The pool wasn't great. The access to the beach was good - right across the street. Warning to travelers - there were hookers right in front of the hotel at night. One of them even approached one of the men in our group. I was really surprised at how obvious and blatant they were. For that reason alone, I won't stay here again. The best thing about this hotel was the staff - they were pretty helpful and friendly, even if they weren't able to solve our problems with the AC.

We went to hawaii for a family holiday and stayed at a hotel that was a little cheaper. Then we went to Vgas and our 2 girls flew home. When we came back to Hawaii for a few more days, we decided to spoil ourselves and stay in a hotel that was moire central to the shops and restuarants. This hotel is right in the middle of the main street of Waikiki. All the main restaurants and shops are only a short stroll away, but I found this hotel to be very old and in need of upgrades. The room was clean, the staff are wondeful, there night time entertainment was great for patrons 35+ and the pool is a decent size, but considering the price we payed per night, I was expecting a hotel that was a bit more modern.

This was our first visit to Hawaii and of course to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. We were excited by the presentation of the entrance foyer, it was grand, modern and very impressive. It was from here that the dissapointment began. After an 11 hour flight, 1 hour to get through customs and a 45 minute shuttle service to the Sheraton, we were greeted at reception with "we don't have a reservation in our system for you". Shock horror, despite having documentation showing our reservation it took nearly an hour for the young guy to find us a room which was supposed to be equal to what we had paid for. We were put on the 29th Floor in a room that looked like it had not been renovated since the 80's and the bathroom was well in need of some work. The room had a view of the city but the promised ocean view was only visible if you leant forward or looked around the corner. Surprised and DissapointedFor our inconvenience??????, we were offered a free breakfast for two and two free cocktails. The breakfast was dissapointing in that the bacon was rock hard, the juice watered down to the max and birds flying/landing in the uncovered fruit platters on display. I'm glad it was free because it saved the staff further complaints. When we reported the birds in the fruit platters, they were moved but we did receive a smug look from the lady who we pointed this out too. Also during breakfast, we observed and heard two female staff members arguing over who was responsible for doing what at a certain time. This occurred in front of all the customers seated ( about 6) at the time. Very unprofessional. Surprised and DissapointedWhilst looking to confirm a tour the following day with the Concierge, we were advised that this was not her job and we should do it from our own room where it was free. Surprised and Dissapointed.On the positive side the two ladies who looked after the both of us at the Splash Pool Bar were amazing. Lea and Angie (I think) were there to do anything they could to make our stay enjoyable. Great Service ladies.The bed in the room (King Size) was brilliant. With an upgrade to facilities the Sheraton could be a great place to stay whilst in Hawaii. Close to just about everything in Honolulu.With the Surprise and Dissapointment with our stay, the best I can rate is an Average but things could be so much better.As can be seen from my previous posts, it is rare that I provide negative feedback but I'm sorry Sheraton, it had to be done on this occasion. Mahalo

Great location and everything you need in a hotel at an affordable price.The staff are very friendly, the amenities are good and the wi-fi is reliable and fast.Good entertainment every night beside the pool, good cocktails at the bar.The room was clean and comfortable and the view of the beach from the 15th floor was great.We got a free upgrade to a better room without even asking for it.

This was my first visit to Hawaii. I wanted to plan a very special "girls trip" for my daughter and I, as she was celebrating her 16th Birthday. I stumbled on the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani through a travel website and got a pretty descent deal including Airfare from Las Vegas. I found the hotel to be slightly older, very clean and easy access to everything. Parking was free. The smell from the food in the Hotel Restaurant was at time very overwhelming as I was walking back and forth to my room. Not a huge deal. I found the hotel staff to be very accommodating to our needs. The housekeeping staff were very pleasant and did a great job every day keeping our room clean and sand free. Nightly entertainment provided. Pool a little small (but we are more beach people anyways) I loved that they provided me beach chairs free of charge (Nice ones too!) to use during my stay. I would definitely stay here again as I found the location to be convenient to everything.. Beach, Shopping and Dining. ~Aloha

Another fantastic holiday at the Princess, the quality of the staff, courteous and pleasant from the front desk to the house maids,and the whole crew that operate the pool center nothing is a problem towels, beach chairs,cold refresh towels,and icy pops.great food, and the drinks are cold.The location is one of the best and so is its pool.The ocean view rooms are the best We .will be back

This is a great hotel right in downtown Honolulu. Nice pool, lobby with live entertainment, lots going on. Funny, we never did sample the hotel's dining. We ate malasadas and pupus in other places. There are so many other choices within a 5-10 minute walk. The pool staff will give you beach chair backpacks, plus water and fruit when you stroll over to the nice, sandy beach a block away. Waikiki beach is busy but gorgeous, soft sand, clear warm calm water, although you can also surf, outrigger canoe (just like Hawaii 50!) and catamaran ride to your heart's content. Loved it. So many cool things to do and see on Oahu. Rainbows, tropical beauty, luaus, hike up Diamond Head, endless beaches, drive to the North Shore, go gliding at Dillingham Field, Pearl Harbour. It is a paradise with all the amenities of the USA. As you walk out of the hotel lobby, the first place you see is the ABC store. As a Canadian, you might say it is Tim Hortons, touristy Canadian Tire, adult beverages and food all in one package. Great. Sounds cliche, but I have to say Mahalo (thank you) to 3 of the hotel staff. Erin, Arthur and Tommy helped make our stay special. Shaka to you guys.If I was to say anything negative (sorry), it would be that the hotel is in the middle of a bustling modern city with all that sometimes goes with that. Sirens, traffic, homeless down and out types etc. However, the positives tsunami over the negs, easy. We were there for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and were sad to say goodbye to a wonderful place. I'd guess you could get more economical lodging a block or two inland. We did a "beach crawl" from one end of Waikiki to the other and stopped off at many beautiful hotels. Plenty of choice, but in this wanderer's opinion, you can't go wrong with the SPK.

fantastic location....stayed in room 536 excellent room.....fantastic staff.......loved everything about it......beds and pillows are heavenly slept really well.....pool area fantastic.......its amazing that they bring you water and fruit to the beach.......will stay again

This will definitely be a holiday we will never forget. So happy with the service at the hotel. We were in a pool view room and when we were not out exploring we were relaxing by the pool, swimming and listening to the bands play from our balcony at dinner time. The hotel had wi-fi included in our package which was great. We were always greeted with a smile from Elvie when we were leaving our room. The room that we stayed in had a fridge and a safe. The only thing which I think would have been great would be to have a kettle in the rooms, but there is a coffee place at one of the hotel entrances so it wasn't that big a deal. The hotel is close to the beach shops and places to eat so if you are there just to relax you don't need to go far for a meal etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Just returned from our stay at this hotel.Great Spot literally only across the road from the beach.Hotel itself is great.Nice pool area.Nice feel in general felt like a nice resort.Only problem rooms are terribly small,we were a family of 4 and we had a room with 2 doubles beds had to sleep with one child each there no way my husband & I can share a double bed together.Not much room for anything in the room even struggled to store our luggage.Other than that it's a great place to stay.

Location is awesome. Pretty much on the beach and main road. Quick check in. Very Friendly and helpful staff. Upgraded us for free for 3 nights. Definitely recommend this motel. Very clean. Will be back to stay in future for sure.

We stayed in the lovely hotel for a week and had a great time.Check in was really quick, the room was a lovely size if a bit dated, aircon was great. We had a pool/sea view which was lovely so we never incurred any building noise.Splash bar was great after a day on the beach and the service was brilliant and the food was lovely aswell.We used the concierge Terry a couple of time and she was so nice, really helpful she gave us loads of advice and some coupons a really lovely lady.The guys on the towel stand were great and the beach chairs were really good better than lying on the beach.All in all we enjoyed our stay and would be back to stay again.

I was staying at this hotel for a conference which was being held in the hotel. I really enjoyed the uniqueness of the space. It was very convenient to be able to have our event and stay in the same location. This hotel has a restaurant and a really good coffee cart near the pool. All of the staff was always super helpful! Nearby are lots of restaurants, grocery store, walking distance to everything in Waikiki and the beach. We had a really great view as well!!! Very peaceful and affordable. Rather than being right on the beach this hotel is across the street from the beach, so you still have great views but at a much lower price point.

This hotel is in a prime location. The lobby is open and nicely decorated. Once you move above the lobby to the guest rooms,a different face of the hotel appears. It is dated, in need of repair and a paint job and more importantly updated to the 21st century. I would not select this sheraton for vacation. I consider it a sheraton stepchild. So to clarify... It is lipstick on a pig not on a princess, and definitely a 2 star in my book.

Always clean, air con worked well. On floor level 11. Great beach view.Awesome pool area with a eating and drink bar available till 11pm.Music every night near bar area. Lots of lounge chairs and areas to chill out.

As far as Waikiki hotels go, this place is fantastic value for money. Location is key and if you can't afford to be directly on Waikiki beach, this is definately where you want to be next. In the midst of all the shops and restaurants and right across the road from the beach, trolley stops and luxe hotels. The rooms have been renovated so they are very presentable, the lobby is large and the staff were great. Only thing not so amazing is the pool, but when you have Waikiki beach right across the road, who wants to swim in a pool anyway.

This hotel was so close to everything, Waikiki Beach, all shopping and restaurants , I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel,except the breakfast buffet a bit pricey and so was dinner buffet to which I did not try due to the price ,although my hotel room had a view of the back where you could see construction going on and hearing the constructing was kind of annoying at times but wasn't really there during the daytime hours.

Stayed here from October 13-19. This was our third visit to the Princess Kaiulani. It is very convenient to everything. We never rent a car, as we like to walk. It has a wonderful history and many pictures of the Princess. There is nightly entertainment that is always enjoyable. Though it is somewhat dated for some, we like this aspect because it gives one the feel of the true Hawaii, as does the Moana across the street. We prefer this to the new, hotels that all look alike and don't have the character and history. Our room was comfortable and very clean, overlooking the pool and ocean. We will come back again soon.

A group of 6 of us had 3 double double rooms near to each other which was kindly accommodated by the friendly and always smiling and helpful staff.Rooms were always clean and tidy and nicely appointed. Except for the lack of tea making facilities. Coming from Australia we kind of expect a jug and tea and coffee making facilities, maybe a packet of cookies, a little carton of milk in the fridge? Not so here. Just a small coffee percolator and terrible creamer - those tiny little pots of UHT milk/cream. So just a tip...brink your own milk and tea bags and ask at the front desk for a jug. They may have one. There was one in the room where you get ice which we purloined for our stay.Beds were comfy - amazing pillows, crisp white sheets as you would expect. We had nice views over the pool area. Balconies are very tiny. Air-con is very cold. Bathrooms nice.Concierge staff were sometimes helpful, sometimes seemed to speak limited English (LOTS of Japanese tourists in Honolulu and so it seems concierge staff are hired accordingly). Don't make the mistake of asking the tour organiser guy questions instead of the concierge. Their desks are near each other. The tour guy just wants to sell you tours obviously so his 'knowledge' is about tours, most of which you could do by catching a bus or even a taxi for less. Ask the concierge about those :)Restaurants and bars are good. Cocktails delicious and food tasty and reasonably priced. Good value 'resort fee' too including wifi, towels around the pool, water bottles in your room and a few other things.Location is perfect for exploring Waikiki and shops and restaurants.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and would definitely consider a return visit.

Stayed here for 2 weeks and have to say is a older hotel in need of modernization but is still comfortable and in a great location. The real plus here is the staff Tommy on the activities desk was beyond fantastic booked all my trips with no issues helped do all I wanted in my stay. Bar staff also get big thumbs up really good fast service even gave advice on late opening bar's. Only down side I had ocean. View room with view of mountains great but was also over a building site so had noise during day but not real issue as was out all the time it if you like to sleep in could be a problem. But you are over the road from the beach and all the shops and restaurants are on the main road a d while this wasn't cheap is less than the more modern hotels I'm sure

Before I tell you about the normal stuff when rating a hotel, I need to share with you the incident we had on our first full day at the hotel. We were sitting by the front door, waiting for a bus to take us to a breakfast orientation at another hotel and have breakfast while there. Near the time for the bus to arrive, I had a "medical issue" that worried me to the extent that I told my wife I needed medical attention NOW! She alerted the doorman, Melvin, that i was indistress and he immediately alerted the hotel security staff. Within 5 minutes, three security staff were at my side and giving me first aid and gathering information on my condition. They called for an ambulance and EMT's at once and I was in the bus, hooked up to an EKG, and feeling much better within no more than 10 minutes more. They suggested I go to Docs On Call, a walk-in clinic, at another hotel for further tests. I was taken there by one of their cars and got to see a Doctor within 30 minutes. If I had experienced a cardiac event, had it not been for the quick action of the hotel staff, I would have most likely expired. I later found out that the Sheriton hires off-duty fire/rescue people to take care of any medical issues that may come up at their hotels. I am forever grateful for their quick attention and quality care. Whatever emergency plans the hotel has, they were followed to the letter.  Now, to the revue, the only thing we were even mildly concerned about was the "resort fee" that we had to pay and had no choice in. We were charged a daily fee for all 7 days for things we would never use, such as, parking on the property, a photograph that they chose the pose to give us for "free", and in-room wi-fi. At check-in we were given an upgrade to a corner room for no additional charge, but that room faced the construction going on right next door. This was a mildly annoying thing since they started work around 5:00 or 6:00 AM and worked until around the same time at night. The room was quiet enought hat we slept through most of the noise, but light sleepers would probably benefit from a room on the other side of the hotel. The housekeeping staff was EXCELLENT! Our room was cleaned and made up every day and was always neat and clean despite the fact that we left swim suits and other clothes and items strung all over the room as typical hotel guests do. We received a bottle of Champagne since we were staying over our anniversary and got two bottles of water every day. We had two refrigerators in the room and a nice flat screen TV. The food on the buffet was VERY good with lots of fresh fruit every day and a large selection. The prices were high, but so was every other eatery in the area, so no surprises. The hotel staff was always very polite, very efficient, and catered to our every whim. The beach was right across the street and access was very easy. I would never pay for a beach front hotel when the short walk gets you to the same place. This hotel was worth every penny we spent on it and we will stay there again if we decide to go back to Hawaii. The bad revues others have given this hotel only prove that some people just can't be pleased no matter what you do for them. I witnessed a guest getting VERY ugly with a check-in staff member for a problem that the "guest" created, but still wanted them to fix it. Some people are just idiots.

My sister and I came to Honolulu for a memorial service, so rather a last minute scramble to make arrangements. The Sheraton Princess K was one of the more affordable options with good reviews. Location was TERRIFIC. From our pool-view room we could see one of the colonial towers of the Moana Surfrider, just a block from the beach, close enough to feel we weren't stranded in the cheap seats. The lobby sets the aloha tone with its open doors, lanai-style, leading to pool, lush fan palms, pretty pocket grotto garden and street side access. Our room was ready for our 3PM check in and the front desk clerk was efficient and friendly. When we first drove into the parking garage the self-parking sign was posted at $40/night. Ugh. The extra charges of travel started piling up in my mind. I gave my credit card to the clerk at check in and he stressed the benefits of paying for the Resort Fee. Sigh. More charges. However, this sounded *optional*. (We've stayed at a Sheraton in Newport Beach, CA and the resort fee is not optional there.) Do tell! For $26 we get free 24 hour parking, premium internet access ($14 value), 2 complimentary bottles of water, free beach chair rental and towel service on their section of the beach (which we didn't have time to visit) and a room upgrade from city view to pool view with a very nice balcony. Sign me up!Our room was quiet, clean, with comfortable beds, extra pillows, coffee maker, good water pressure in the shower. I withhold one star for grimy smudges on the wallpaper in the bathroom (it is an older hotel) and no elevator in the 5 story parking garage. We had to park on the top level and thump, thump, thumped our way down 5 stories with luggage. Even though we travel light our bags are bulky. I'm fit but also 59. So, yeah. The handicapped access ramp in the hotel lobby doesn't lead anywhere so you can't roll luggage down that into the garage. Next time one of us waits downstairs with the bags while the other person parks & walks down. Live and learn. Overall, I would definitely stay here again! Mahalo, Sheraton Princess Kauilani!

Just arrived back in australia from a wonderful week in waikiki. While this isn't the newest of hotels it is central to trolleys, shops galore and heaps do restaurants. Cannot fault the service, our aircon broke and we were immediately upgraded to higher floor. Have nothing negative to say about our stay.

Stayed here for a one night layover on our way from Kauai to the Big island so that we could stop at Pearl Harbor. Lisa Zwissler with beach bum vacation booked this for us and it was just what we needed for one night - place to crash and clean up. Great value and very helpful staff. Rooms are outdated but we were given access to a hospitality suite after we had checked out which was super convienent and helpful before heading to the airport.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 2015. Loved everything about this hotel. Our room was large overlooking the pool. Everyone was so friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed the Fab 4 Beatles show in the upstairs showroom. Waikiki beach just down the road was a dream come true. Many restaurants and fast food places near by.

We stayed here in September 2015 and we were very happy with our choice. The hotel is lovely and staff are very helpful and friendly. They certainly will be a very pleasant memory for us. It's so close to everything just outside the gate is the Main Street but you wouldn't know it as you don't hear any noise. The pool area is great with the bar close by for drinks and snacks. Rooms were comfy and spacious and very clean, the bathrooms are a bit dated, but in saying that they are also very clean. We would definitely stay here again if staying in Waikiki

My partner, his family and I all stayed here for 10 days whilst we were in O'ahu. The hotel itself is so close to everything, there is an ABC shop directly across the road, Burger King, Subway and a diner and also nightly farmers markets a literal 50 second walk away. We stayed in a high ocean tower view room. The room was kept nicely, was big enough to store most of our things and featured a balcony which had views of the ocean. The bathroom was a but outdated, however it met our basic needs of showering etc. so it did not bother us at all.The room features a Tv which had most American channels on it, however we didn't use much of it. Hotel staff are wonderful, the cleaners are spot on and welcoming and always left our room in a clean state. The concierge was incredible and helped us out with places to eat and things to check out, I cannot thank them enough for the effort they put in. Pool area is lovely, the bar is well attended and pool staff are always happy. This hotel is so good for value and it's location, the staff are awesome and it feels like a home away from home. I will always stay here when I visit O'ahu again. Mahalo, Sheraton staff :)

We stayed here in September 2015 and were pleasantly surprised after reading a lot of very negative reviews. The hotel is lovely and staff are very helpful and friendly. It's so close to everything just outside the gate is the Main Street area but you wouldn't know it as you don't hear all the noise. And there's a fantastic little coffee shack just outside the gate for anyone who wants a real coffee or fruit smoothie! The pool area is great with the bar close by for drinks and snacks. Rooms were comfy and spacious and very clean, bathrooms are a bit dated, but who cares I don't know about anyone else but I don't spend my holiday in the bathroom!!! The only negative is the very early noise from the adjacent building site. We would definitely stay here again if staying in Waikiki

Arrived at this hotel after fly from LA, on arrival in the reception area which all open plan looking towards the pool and bar you get the impression that the hotel is going to be quite subrious, the check went quite smooth. Then went to our allocated room and started to go down hill from there the room was unclean and and overlooking a building site and suffered a water leak so room was damp smelling. I decided to go sleep and would speak to reception the next morning, the first person I spoke to was quite unhelpful ,but the second one was most helpful and arranged for room change overlooking the pool the room was a lot cleaner and quieter than previous room. The hotel is in need of updating as furniture was old and dated in rooms. On a plus point the majority of staff were excellent ,

My Family & I traveled to Honolulu on behalf of my daughters 6th birthday. Upon arrival everyone was so sweet & greeted us w/warm smiles. I loved the atmosphere, the great vibes & the enthusiastic personalites of each employee. Everyone was accomodating & welcoming. Our 1st night at the hotel we were so exhausted so we decided to have dinner downstairs at the buffet & can i just say AMAZING & worth every $dollar. Our room was cleaned & restocked daily, which was really nice to come home to after a long day of playing tourist. The room was neatly replenished & tidy. The icing on the cake LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION this hotel is convenient & near so many stores, restauraunts. we found it easy to find our way around & was glad that most of the street life entertainment we a few steps away. Its family friendly, very inviting. We plan to keep princess kaiulani our 1st choice of stay on each visist to honolulu. Try it out, you will not be disappointed :)

We stayed here September 2015 great place very central to shops and beach.Nice clean rooms and lovely swimming pool.Quick book in and no trouble at all.ABC store KFC Subway and Burger king right across the road.We are coming back again next year

Stayed between 22 September and 29 September on arrival I spoke to Sharon at reception and she was very helpful and fully explained what was included in the hotel resort fee, where to book our photo and the hospitality room, my sister spoke to a different receptionist and none of this was explained to her. After a 9 hour flight it was great to use the hospitality room to freshen up, this room has a shower, toilet, and lounge and you have the use of it for 1 hour.As we arrived early in the morning I did not expect our room to be ready, but when I went down to return the key from the hospitality room, Sharon informed me that our room was ready. Had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the pool and to the left we could see the ocean. On arrival to the room it was great to find that the air con had been left on, left this on all night and was never noisy. I work in the hospitality industry and I gave the room a thorough inspection and found the room to be spotless. The only downside was that you could hear the shower/toilet in the adjoining room but this is the norm in most hotels.Daily housekeeping was always great, always had the garbage empty and fresh towels. Included in the resort fee was 60 minutes of long distance calls per day, which I used to call back home and two bottles of water daily, don't know what the car parking was like as we didn't use a car. Didn't eat at the onsite restaurant or order room service either so can't comment on these.The resort is in close proximity to everything, only a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki Beach and there is a Subway, Burger King and KFC across the road as well as a convenience store. Is also in walking distance to heaps of shops, markets and restaurants. We got the local bus to Walmart and the Ala Mona Shopping Centre. for $2.50 per adult each way, and $125 per child, but used a taxi to get home which was only $20 including tip.Spent the whole day at Ala Mona Shopping Centre, which they are extending and had Bubba Gumps for dinner. We also went to the Premium Outlets, which was a waste of time, mainly high end stores and not many of them.Went to Pearl Harbour with Roberts Hawaii bus company for $86 per person which included the bus and entry to Pearl Harbour, the Arizona Memorial and tour of the Mighty Moe, Only downside was that it didn't include time to visit the Aviation Museum, so I would pay extra and do that. Also It is a working naval base and you have to take your photograph ID or Passport with you and you have to put all bags in a locker, except for what you can fit in your pockets.Did an Island Tour with Hawaii Turtle Tours, they take you to Diamond Head, Blow Hole, Makcapu, Secret Beach, Chinaman's Hat, Lale Point, Sunset Beach, Turtle Beach and the Dole Pineapple Plantation. If your lucky you can swim with the turtles but unfortunately we only saw 3 and they were in the shallows on the rocks and due to the sharpness of these we were unable to swim with them. But it was still a great tour in a mini van, so is a bit more personal than being on a big coach.Had a fantastic stay, all the staff were very friendly and helpful and room was always clean and tidy and only have positive memories.

I checked in Cleaned the room Put my stuff away and yes I said cleaned the room wipes and Lysol. put My stuff in drawers. Things appeared to be OK checked headboard for bed bugs and base of Bed all clear. Now ready to Vacation. sitting on Balcony relaxing decided I needed a boost Have some Lovely Kona Coffee. well Not so Lovely little bugs scurried out of Coffee maker. Called Guest services they sent me a new coffee maker, The one they took out of my room remained the entire stay in the maids area should have told me something.Needless to Say That night I opened my drawer with Hair ties and jewelry Found BUGs Crawling everywhere. I smashed them on a white card took to front Desk where I was told They were full could not change rooms and it was to be expected Cockroaches in the tropics The Lady was less Than Helpful I figured I would come Back the next Day and try again. Nothing Changed. the next Night I went to Bathroom and the roaches were having a party in My bathroom over 5 scurried away. welcome to My nightmare. they Basically told me they were at full occupancy I could not have late check out either because the room was already sold. Good Luck I will never stay there again. I have stayed all over Waikiki Never Had roaches.

Aloha! This was our second stay at the hotel in 18 months and the location for us was still perfect. Short walk to Waikiki Beach and pick up point for the many trolley tours you can take. My husband and I were there to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and must say it couldn't have been more perfect. We were greeted with a bottle of champagne and basket of fruit, drinks and nuts. The housekeeping ladies also gave us a card and chocolates. Breakfast variety was amazing and the ladies and cooks very friendly. Tommy was great helping us with all our tour questions and asking if we enjoyed them afterwards. Must say tour guides for Waikiki Trolleys were very friendly, professional and could answer any of our questions. Mahalo

Location is great and the hotel makes it easy to come and go via car and or walking. The hotel staff made us feel like we owned the place and constantly went out of their way to make sure all of our needs were exceeded. Their restaurant recommendation was arguably the best Italian food I have ever had - Arincino di Mare. And the food and ambiance at the hotel itself is great. Sitting on our balcony over looking the ocean and watching the sunset each evening was magnificent!

The service we experienced at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani was phenomenal. Our room was a bit outdated in terms of style, but was comfortable and suited our needs. We appreciated the bottled water supplied daily that was included in the resort fee. The nightly performances at the pool were a fun addition. We did not have time to take advantage of the beach towel service while we were there, but it looked like it would have been nice despite the hotel being across the street from the beach. Hotel concierge was great!

First I will say that the location is perfect! If you want to stay smack down right in Waikiki, by the main street Kalakaua Ave, and just need to cross two streets to be on Waikiki Beach, close to the little pier, this is the place to stay. Walking distance to just about everything in Waikiki. And the rooms are ok, nothing more, nothing less. I arrived a day late for my pre-paid room, Tower high floor ocean view, and missed one of my three nights due to delayed long-haul flight from Europe. Knowing the money was lost (hotel gained) I asked if there was anything they could do to maybe comp me a little, as a small token of appreciation for having -given- them my money and not even stayed there. Well, I couldn't get a better room, cause I already booked one of the better one they could offer, nor could they do anything else… So no, they could not do anything… Really?? For the price I paid, and thinking the Sheraton name had a certain standard to it, I have to say I was a little disappointed. The hotel was old and dated, and the friendliest people were the mades and the concierge, not impressed by the hotel it self or the front desk. The day I was leaving I had a knock on my door, and there was an employee with a gift from the manager delivered to me. I was quite baffled about this, I accepted and closed the door. In the gift basket there was a card, and my suspicions were confirmed; this was not for me! So I quickly ran out in the hall and found the guy who brought it to me, and said this was a mistake - this was not for me. Of course he was very happy that I was so honest, but that is just me. Now, my concern is how the hotel did not know that I was still in the room, and not the new guest? I had not checked out, and obviously the new guest had not checked in… Another point off for the front desk who should really keep track on things like that. I had a whole day to spend in Waikiki the day I was leaving, so I asked for a wi-fi connection - cause the one I used got disconnected when I checked out. (It was heavy rain that day so didn't feel like walking around). They tried to give me several codes, that did not work, but they could not give me any other connection, like the one I had. But I could use their computer. I needed wi-fi to get in touch with my friends through iMessage (not having a US cell). So that didn't help me at all. And they were not willing to help me in any other way, and I could not pay for a connection either. Luckily I know Starbucks and Jamba Juice are very wi-fi friendly =) The pool area is a lot smaller than it looks from the photos, and its also right by the lobby, so I felt a bit on display from more people than necessary. I feel in a pool area, there should be mostly pool people, not every single person passing through the lobby…Oh, and just one more thing: right next to the hotel, they are doing construction on a huge area, so if you stay at that side, it might get noisy very early in the morning.

My mom and I spent 11 days at this hotel and our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Like others have stated the rooms are dated, especially the bathrooms but nothing bad. Face it you are in Hawaii - how much time are you really spending in the room? The resort fee was a little crazy but it seems everyone has it now. We did appreciate being able to get towels and chairs to take to the beach across the street. All staff were friendly and welcoming and attentive to our concerns (had to call the front desk twice; once regarding the shower head in tub - it fell from the wall when support broke and once when the toilet tank wouldn't fill after flushing). Both times I called someone was there within 5 minutes and fixed the problems. Also got to use a hospitality room for showering the evening of our flight home since we checked out at the normal time. It was nice to freshen up before heading home. The location of this hotel cannot be beat - right in the middle of everything and I would have no problems staying here again.

As SPG members, we have stayed at every Sheraton property in Waikiki and enjoy the Princess Kaiulani the most. 4 years ago was our first stay here; it was not very pleasant and opted to stay somewhere else when we came back in 2013. However, we decided to give it another try on our visit in September 2015. We were pleasantly surprised. They updated the entire lobby/public areas. As SPG gold members, we were upgraded to an ocean view tower room (Ainahau). It was a beautiful room, great view, clean, and perfectly met our needs. The maids took very good care of us during our stay. We ate in the restaurant and the bar and enjoyed good service. The parking structure was easy to get in and out of. Rooms in Waikiki are typically small and parking can be a problem. The Princess Kaiulani is no exception; however, in all of the hotels/properties we have stayed at over the last 30 years, the Princess does a good job at trying to make it easier/better for it's guests.

This was our second time at the Sheraton Princess, and loved it just as much as the first time. We stayed in the tower complex again, on the 21st floor, and had a beautiful Waikiki ocean view. Our room was modern and clean with a huge bed and a clean modern bathroom. I think a lot of the negative reviews here relate to the other section of the hotel overlooking the pool.I'm glad we stayed here again, and we probably will the next time in Waikiki.

I was there with my son and 13yr old granddaughter The first room we stayed in was old and smelt like vomit after complaining Than we packed up everything and moved to another room to find it had one King size bed Than finally getting a comfortable room which was acceptable For our troubles the manager gave us 1 free breakfast for two when there is 3 paying adults. Than after settling into this room a couple of nights later around 11:30 pm we discovered the ceiling was leaking quite a lot near lights. After being moved once again late at night. We were not given any apology no compensation for the way we were inconvenienced The Manager did not contact us or attempted to contact us The way we were treated was disgustingWe will not be returning to this hotel Also wifi is dreadful

I had little expectations arriving here in waikiki as I havnt been back to Hawaii in 25 yrs ... From the moment I arrived I was greeted with genuine smiles and efficient service ! We were able to get into our room early big benefit after a big flight . Great room the Best beds ever !!!!! Can I just say the cleaning staff are very friendly and have lots of local knowledge so big thanks to you . Great nightly entertainment around the pool awesome coctaiks .All in all a very pleasant relaxed atmosphere great for all types of travellers a real gem !! I'll be back maholo !!

Nice lobby and pool area. Great location. But very rundown and presently being re done. Our floor filled with construction workers by 7:00 AM. Lots of dust and noise so not up to Sheraton standards. Was amazed at the condition of the balconies that were being re finished - crumbling edges. Can't see how a hotel can let it get to this state.They also have the audacity to charge a resort fee which is basically a surcharge. Very disappointing for a Sheraton Hotel. Best thing was the friendly staff.
