My husband and myself have been holidaying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for the past 10 yesrs.We have taken our children, parents, nieces, nephews abd cousins and also introduced it to our friends. They have all been delighted and over whelmed with the hospitality they had received. We have recently just got back from another wonderful holiday and I almost feel homesick after we've left. On our recent stay our house keeper put lovely flowers in our room and she had left me little pineapple shortbread biscuits and again made us feel at home.i didn't know her name but I left her a little card. We stayed in 1462. And again we would like to thank her for her hospitality.The Sheraton PK has everything you need to fulfil a perfect holiday. It is in the perfect location, close to shops,restaurants and right across the road from the beach. Sheraton PK have a great dining area which we have had numerous breakfasts and dinners. They also have a chef down stairs in the dining area who cuts up pineapple and has it plated free of charge on alternating days. A nice little touch to the day. We also got a free complimentary photo to remind us of our stay. This place is perfect. The staff go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. I am proud to say that I have made many friends at the SPK . But I have found a special friend in Caro.i would like to thank Caro for always accomodating us. I adore this lady. Caro is like family now. And that's how all of the staff make you feel. Happy 4th of July my friends See you all next yearFrom Orial all the way from Australia, down under :)

Stayed at this hotel for 9 days recently. Beds were comfy and the pool and restaurant staff were lovely. The bathrooms were very old and tired. Housekeeping staff did half a job of cleaning the room but it was adequate. Front desk staff could not care less if you needed help or not and tried to palm you off onto someone else. They didn't even ask if we had a nice stay when we checked out. I would think twice before staying here again.

Princess Kaiulani is well located, across the road from the main beach, restaurants and right near major shops. We started each day with a workout in the fully equipped gym, followed by an ocean swim and I was surprised, but there are turtles in Waikiki Beach! We loved sitting poolside in the afternoon as we relaxed ahead of dinner. Hotel restaurant served best prime beef and crab legs. Great location and not crowded even though the hotel was full.

great hotel, central location. Great facilities, we were the other side of the hotel way from the building work so this was not a issue.Staff very friendly and helpful, special thanks to Anne and Kitty

I came off a long international flight and arrived early so my room was not ready. I was given a room to borrow to freshen up and my luggage was looked after until my room was ready. Great service! The location was only steps away from the beach and towels and chairs are offered. I chose to lay by the lovely relaxing pool area where complimentary fruit is served poolside. The food was absolutely delicious and very fresh. The cocktails are a great price and high quality. There is also a happy hour which is excellent value. In the evening, a band and hula girl performed poolside and were great to watch. There is a beautiful waterfall and drinking water fountain for guests. I enjoyed the talented pineapple carver and the lovely local man who was selling his own home made jewellery in the lobby. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful and seemed happy. I felt very comfortable here, so much that I slept so well and over 12 hours! And I could have kept going. A good vibe all round and I will be delighted to stay here again. Thank you. Rachael from Australia.

We stayed here 21 years ago and chose it for its great location, we arrived too early to check in to our room but were given a courtesy room so we could change and go to the pool area, very welcome after the 10 hour flight from OZ.Even though it is due for a make over we found the room lovely and all the common areas were very pleasant. A great stay !

The rooms are average. The staff is the best. The waitress Lei was exceptional. I went down to the pool to listen to the live music and she greeted me with a smile. I had no plans to eat at the hotel but after her spunky attitude My husband made lei everyday and I even took some hula leasons. Thank you for a great time.

This hotel is directly across from one of the nicest hotels on the main strip of Waikiki (the Moana Surfrider). The rooms are decent, bathrooms could definitely stand to get a makeover, but for the price compared to that of those hotels closest by (the Moana, Outrigger Waikiki, and Royal Hawaiian) it is is good company for 1/3 the price. The rooms are bare bones, but has a safe and a fridge, which are always nice to have when on vacation. The complimentary beach towels and self-parking included in the resort fee makes this hotel an even greater value than it already is just on room price alone. If you're not looking for major luxury accommodations and a clean, safe place to stay that's maybe a bit past is glory days, this is a great hotel.

Surprisingly big rooms (by North American standards), close to both Waikiki beach (though not on the waterfront) and the town centre. Great 24-hour fitness room. Very helpful and friendly staff. Free beach towels. Hotel in good shape, but looks a bit dated (built in the late 1950s). Perhaps not the right place to go with your new flame, but great for family hols.

Not the fanciest hotel but great price for the location! I would definitely stay here again. Steps away from the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Perfect for families with children. I did not have a chance to try the food, but the place was always crowded so the food must be good.

Even though we just stayed here 6 months ago we had another visit in early June 2015. It's still a wonderful hotel although I pity the guests in the tower block as the building noise from the International Marketplace constructions must be annoying. Stay in the Princess wing or the Kaiulani wing.Everything clean and tidy and those amazing Sheraton 'Sweet Sleeper' beds. Also excellent service.Tried the Pikake Terrace for dinner, and wow has it improved! The freshest, tastiest food you'll find on the Waikiki strip. We ended up having dinner there twice and both times it was equally good.Yes, it's expensive, but compare it to top knot restaurants along the Waikiki strip and for what you get it's value for money. Everything is fresh and delicious.

We are regular visitors and this trip was about our eight. We have always enjoyed our stay here, but with all the renovations and refurbishments that have been done, this time was just the best. From Kathy at the check in desk to the staff in the restaurant and splash bar, they were all friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Yes there is building going on near by, but that had no impact on our stay. We enjoyed the nightly entertainment and the choice of food both in the splash bar and the restaurant. Our room had also had a new coat of paint and was fresh and comfortable. Many thanks to Mr. Orr and all the staff for yet another fabulous stay!

We have thoroughly enjoyed our week here. The rooms are comfortable, especially the bed! best nights sleep i have had in a long time, and the air-conditioning works well. The glass is double glazed, so the rooms are very quiet at night. The food down at Splash Bar and Pikake is very good with generous sized meals. The staff here are terrific and made us feel very welcomed here, even though there are a lot of people coming and going from here. The nightly entertainment is 1st Class and the cocktails are good!! Having read some of the less favourable reviews of this place I'm of the opinion that some people expect more than they are worth. The wifi is excellent! and i have no problems sharing a lot of my vacation photos with friends back home. We are coming back here again after a week in Maui, and I look forward to returning here. Thank you Princess Kaiulani for making our week enjoyable. See you in a week.

This is a very nice hotel for most visitors. The ADA room we had was small and crowded. I had to move a chair to in front of the balcony so we had space for the electric wheelchair just inside the room.The parent company Starwood Hotels has instituted a "Resort Service Fee" for all of its hotels. This fee is mandatory whether you use these or not.All the common areas were pleasant with pictures and stories of Princess Kaiulani on the walls.The hotel had an excellent buffet style restaurant but the price was a little excessive.

Since Waikiki is a popular destination, I wasn’t expecting any upgrades or special service a Starwood Gold member. I was pleasantly surprised. I got upgraded to an ocean view room which was spectacular. On top of that, the breakfast buffet was comped and it was a nice treat. The hotel is in the perfect spot in Waikiki being centrally located to the action. There was live music in the evening consisting of a guy playing acoustic rock and roll music Hawaiian style. He was awesome. As others have mentioned, the rooms are dated an in need of renovation. The hotel will be closed next year for a full renovation so stay here now while the rates are still affordable.

As a mediocre tourist class hotel this place fits the bill - but - as a resort, this is not.Charging a "resort fee" for this property should be an embarrassment for management - it is certainly a rip off for customers.The property is old but adequately maintained and the staff are generally helpful and attentive.We won't go back simply because for what the property is it is grossly overpriced - even without the disgusting resort fee.

This hotel is a feel good place as you walk in to book in you get a WOW feeling, good service the rooms are dated but clean and the bed is to die for,it is the best looking pool area bar none and the pool staff.are fantastic food is great and location none better

After laying over in lax I had stayed in a rundown hotel. This was a nice hotel after staying there. It is a little dated but still nice. When we arrived the checkin goofed up the SPG account. The rooms were also not ready yet. So when they were ready I discovered a resort charge for "great amenities". It became $200 a night! I would stay here again because hotels in Honolulu are generally expensive.

Spent one night at the Sheraton Waikiki on the way to Kauai earlier this month. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and the views from the 23rd? 26th? floor (can't remember, too jet lagged) were gorgeous. But as is the case with many Sheratons, the place needs updating and our room was next to the noisiest elevator I've ever encountered. Plus, all the birds flying into the open concept restaurant are less than enchanting. That said, it's clean, convenient to the beach, and perfectly adequate for a one night stop-over between flights.

Our booking was for two beds , pool view , on arrival they stated we booked 1 king bed, they kindly "up graded " us to a partial ocean view (hang over the balcony) view the ocean between two hotels!! as a bonus we were on the side of the next door construction which commenced at 7am daily fortunately I went to the beach early Then the resort fee Hmmmmm ok for some - not for us as we only used the WIFI - Expensive WIFI However the beds were comfortable - a blessing

Have stayed here several types before. Get better treatment here that any other place I frequently stay. Open air lobby offers bright theme. Pool area great place place to relax.Casual or buffet dining offers great foods. Hotel located right across the street from beach.

We booked our vacation on American Airline Vacations. I have stayed at other properties but decided to try Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for its location as we were traveling with 2 other families and did not want to drive when not necessary. I had read several reviews and was somewhat nervous after booking. Well that all changed from the moment of check in. We were celebrating an anniversary and were upgraded to the 26th floor with a great ocean view. Later in the evening we were surprised with a bottle of champagne. Our bartenders at the Splash bar, Shawna from Colorado and Mike from Chicago were great and made us feel like we were at our local watering hole. The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable. Parking and wifi as well as daily bottles of water included in the resort fee. This place rocked! My friends were also impressed. We will return......

We have stayed at the Princess Kaiulani before and now after the renovation. Staff are very pleasant and accommodating. Rooms and public areas have been nicely updated. "New" pool loungers look nice but are terribly uncomfortable (a horizontal bar goes right across where you sit). The beach service is a really good service that is not advertised very well. It is currently part of the resort fee that few patrons take advantage of - hopefully the beach service continues. Overall, the hotel is highly recommended because of its regard for guests, great location to the beach, shopping, restaurants, and trolley/transit services.

For the most part I really like this hotel. It's been the only place I stay when in Waikiki over the last few years but a change is looming. The reception makeover looks great and they have tweeked the pool area along with moving the in-house restaurant slightly to the right. The gym has excellent Life fitness equipment and the pool area is pretty good........BUT....the biggest problem with this hotel is the noise between rooms. There doesn't appear to be any amount insulation between them and you can hear everything going on in the rooms around you. I don't mind a bit of noise until say 11pm or even midnight but as I write this review its 1am and i don't think i'll be getting too much sleep tonight. It took 2 visits from hotel security to quiet them down with the second visit being 2am. There is a lot of construction going on around the hotel and a few of the bigger hotels on Kuhio Ave (behind the hotel) have closed for renovation so rooms are short in this part of Waikiki it seems. The hotel staff I encountered on this trip were very friendly and always there to help.

The location of this property is great. Close to beach, shops and restaurants. Nice rooms and nice pool areas. We arrived very early in the morning on an international flight. Upon asking at check in if we could be given a room earlier than 3pm as we had a tour booked at 3pm and needed to change, we were advised that we were on an express check in list. After spending the whole day waiting around and checking on the progress of our room where we kept getting told there was no room available, we finally got a room at 10 minutes to 3pm. So it took them 7 hours to get a room ready for us that day, but every morning after that we had housekeeping barging in on to service our room at 8am.We had paid extra to get the partial ocean view room. There is a huge construction project right next door and our room was overlooking it. Each morning we were woken to the sounds of explosions and banging coming from next door at around 6 am. Which I guess on the bright side was good because at least we were awake in time for housekeeping.These issues and little things like the restaurant always running out of things made our stay less than comfortable. In hindsight, I wish I'd paid a little bit extra and stayed at the Moana Surfrider across the road.

This is the second time I have stayed at this property and I think it will be the last. During my last trip the maid left a half eaten packet of biscuits in my bed after servicing my room. The housekeeping managers response was so professional and apologetic that I decided to give the hotel another try. This trip I have found the hotel dated, the staff very hit and miss and the cleanliness not up to standard. I must say that most of the staff have been very helpful and polite but a few have been quite inept. The nightly entertainment creates a relaxing vibe and the pool bar is amazing. The Beatles tribute show is a must for any beatles fan.I think next time I will be spending the extra money and staying at one of the other Starwood properties on the island.

Many reviews of this property, mixed comments...we only spent one night in the hotel and found it to be rather charming. Reception was excellent, personable and friendly, no time wasted and our room was located on the 9th floor with views across to the beach and ocean, obstructed yes but no drama...The room was old and plain, but immaculate and clean, the bed very comfy, the lanai was spacious and we enjoyed a Mai Tai there in the evening. Now the room was not glamorous, but it was really nice and not glitzy.Happy Hour was nice in the bar area and all the staff very attentive and friendly, heaps of dining options close by and the beach just seconds away. this hotel is very comfortable and location superb...Hopefully we won't see it being demolished for more high rise buildings...Self parking is easy and adjacent to the main wing, please stay and enjoy the Aloha Spirit...

We recently had a lovely ten day stay in this Hotel in a Pool View Room on the 7th floor which also had a partial view of the ocean which was a lovely unexpected surprise we also had adjoining rooms with our older children.Location is fantastic, right in the heart of Waikiki. the hotel itself had a wonderful resort style feel about it . Nightly entertainment which was very enjoyable and very pleasant staff. Very tasteful renovations in the foyer area.Yes the rooms are older but very very clean and very comfortable beds and pillows. We also received a lovely welcome basket of goodies which was a lovely touch.I would have liked the pool to stay open a little longer rather than closing at 7pm and I feel the resort fee was quite expensive especially considering we had 2 rooms and did not use a car space or have young children to take advantage of what was on offer. The beach towels and chairs were great as was the fruit and water delivered to us on the beach but it certainly wasn't worth $25 USD x 2 a day (the resort fee is my only negative complaint )I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my friends .

I initially reviewed this hotel very negatively based on my first night stay. I had booked the first and last night of my holiday with them. After reporting my thorough dissatisfaction to the hotel, they responded quickly both in writing and over the phone and encouraged me to keep my booking for my final nights stay, which I did. The staff member Robert was genuine in his attempt to show my sister and I true Sheraton hospitality. He personally checked our room before we arrived. He left a small welcome pack for us and went above and beyond to make sure that we felt the same way about the hotel that he did.The hotel is dated, the resort fee is high for what you get, however, I couldn't fault the service on our second stay. The rooms are quite small and the walls are paper thin, so ask for a corner room if you can to avoid hearing everything the rooms on both sides are doing, but the staff are far better and more accommodating than at other resorts in Hawaii.The hotel has a great location, just across from the beach and an easy walk to restaurants and shopping. We will be back.

Pros:The location is the selling point of this hotel. It sits directly across from Waikiki beach and is on the ever entertaining Kalakaua Avenue. We really enjoyed the pool and bar area which was great for both the adults and older children(ours was 11). All of the staff that we encountered were all very friendly and went out of there way to greet us. Cons:The resort fee was a little hefty at 25USD per day. This provided us with 2 free bottled water/day, beach chairs/towels, and fruit(apples/oranges) and water service on the beach 3xdaily. Yes these things are nice... but at a cost of 200$ for the week. The rooms are just average. A little dated but not terrible and how much are you really in the room anyway. Overall we really enjoyed the stay and would most definitely return.

Only had 3 nights however this hotel is just a lovely little oasis in the bustling centre of Waikiki. The pool area is lovely as is the pool bar/ restaurant. The rooms were clean and well maintained by housekeeping. We had a great time and wouldn't hesitate staying again .

As indicated in so many other reviews, the Sheraton PK has a great location but is quite dated with small rooms and a hit-and-miss staff. I wouldn't call them poor but certainly below average. For our family with toddlers, the facility was adequate. The pool is adult friendly but not non-swimmer friendly.WiFi was great as other reviewers noted; this is probably because the thin walls do not obstruct either sound or radio waves. I'd call out Art and Connie as exemplary representatives of the brand. On the other hand, the concierge was simply not competent and half the front desk staff have mastered the delicate art of ignoring a patron standing at the front of the line -- with no other customers present. The resort fee at the time of my stay included parking and internet. Also of note, the gym is not air conditioned. I've stayed a several different properties at Waikiki and this wasn't my favorite. If I have to return to Oahu, I will not return to this property.

This well located Sheraton in the heart of Waikiki Beach has nice clean rooms many having great views. Not to be overlooked is their Mai Tai at the bar overlooking the pool followed by their buffet dinner which has revolving daily specials. I stay at this hotel several times a year for over a decade and the staff is wonderful making me feel at home. It is great hotel if you have just a few days to visit Waikiki or wish an extended stay.

The hotel is located in the eastern (older) part of Waikiki on the former grounds of the Princess Kaiulani mansion. The location is perfect: right at the main thoroughfare of Waikiki - Kalakaua blvd. in the middle of all the life and action.We stayed in the older part of the property which while is showing its age is still maintained in impeccable state of cleanliness.Upon check-in we were pleasantly surprised by management's decision to upgrade our room to the oceanview. And even more were we surprised to receive a gift basket from the Manager. Such a lovely touch! Thank you, Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.The hotel has all the amenities you might think of.Maid service was attentive and well done.We left very happy.Recommended.

I could not find one thing wrong with this hotel. The hotel is in a great location,it is very quiet at night, and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel has a restaurantand a bar by the pool. It is located across the street from a Subway, Burger King, andKFC (cheap eats!!) The beach is across the street. I have stayed in just about every hotel in Honolulu.... this hotel is one of the best!!!!

We've stayed in several hotels right in the heart of Waikiki and this years experience was outstanding. I applause the staff. The front desk went out of their way to upgrade our room at no extra charge due to an unforseen wait for a room. The pool staff accommodated our grandchildren while they visited us for the day with extra amenities as well as the gentleman who took care of the beautiful koi fish ponds invited them to join in the daily fish feeding. For the morning buffet in the restaurant the omelet chef took very good care of supplying my husband with the best omelettes in town. Absolutely every staff person we encountered during our stay was nice and friendly. We stayed on the 8th floor and it was very quiet and the oven view was breathtaking from our private balcony. We spent several evenings out there enjoying the gorgeous sunsets.The only item that was a bit disappointing was the $28 a day extra room charge. It seemed a bit high but it had been over Five years since we had stayed in Waikiki last.I would give the hotel an overall rating as way above average and would definitely use their hotel accommodations again when we travel there next year plus advise friends and family about this hotel.

I've stayed in about 10 different hotels in Waikiki and I'm actually surprised that I haven't stayed at the Princess Kaiulani sooner. The hotel is in a great location, it is extremely quiet at night, and the beds are very comfortable. We ate at the buffet one night and enjoyed the food and entertainment as well. The pool is well kept and there are lots of lounge chairs. Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is well located, had good views, nice pool area and friendly. Unfortunately the hotel is tied and needs major upgrade to support the Sheraton brand. There were obvious signs of concrete cancer on balconies of main tower and was weary about leaning on balcony handrail. Did not eat breakfast at Hotel due to cost, would have liked this included in rate.

Our room is lovely. 10th floor, slightly obstructed, but great view, nice little balcony.Crisp white linen and soft generous towels.Breakfast a bit pricey, should have paid in advance. Snack type food around pool with generous serves, but only ordinary quality.Very central location.Happy with our choice.

The rooms are very old and in need of renovation. I overheard one of the employees say that renovation was scheduled for 2016.The lobby area is nice. The pool is very basic.Resort charge is quite high but everyone in Waikiki seems to be doing it.Location is great, just across the street from the beach.Decent place to stay if you get a good price on the room. Certainly a Sheraton only in name.

Through Sheraton, we had arranged an airport pick-up and shuttle to the hotel. It was great, reasonable - cheaper than a cab and both my wife and I received a Lei. The hotel and location were great even though we were across the street from the beach. The views from our room on the 24th floor were outstanding. The room was a good size, small balcony - everything was clean and fresh.

Hotel accommodation was great, views were great, but teh best part was the location, right in the middle of everything, within walking distance of Diamond Head, wonderful restaurants all around the hotel, and the pool snack bar was friendly with delicious food.

We checked into this hotel yesterday and were advised that we had been upgraded from a city view to a partial ocean view, how lovely!Wrong, unfortunately the upgraded room overlooks the construction of the new International Market Place. Construction starts at 6.00 am and finishes at 6.00 pm, no one bothered to mention that point. Despite being on the 17th floor the notice at 6.00 am is intolerable. What is really annoying is that no one disclosed the fact that heavy construction was taking place next to the hotel, neither the hotel or the internet booking company.

Overall - great location, updated, redecorated, front desk area nicely done. Rooms still need some work, but word is property will be doing this. Changed rooms due to proximity of ocean/pool view room (to close to street) to live entertainment. Music, though OK was loud and reverberated, was distracting after long day and desire to just want to relax on deck.

Pounding could be heard from the building of the new International Market Place next door. The room was very average but very clean. Advertised as high floor ocean view is misleading. A view of the ocean is over the roof of the hotel across the street. No real view at all except the view of other hotels. Go stay at a hotel on the beach and get a real ocean view.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in room 1645 to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We booked a king standard room with city view, but we were given a complimentary upgrade for a partial ocean view room with double beds. Our room was on the 16th floor, the hallway was a little dim and had a musty old smell. When we got to our room it was clean, but when we stepped out to the balcony our view was of construction that was going on, which the check in staff did not mention. The construction would start at 7:30 am and end at 5:30 pm it was very noisy, we were never able to have the glass door open to let breeze come in. The only partial ocean view we saw was when we stuck out our heads over the balcony to see the ocean, good thing we didnt have to pay for that partial ocean view because that would be a rip off. We tried changing our room, but they kept telling us that nothing was available. The lobby to the tower elevator would always smell like fried fish because the buffet was right next to it, which was not pleasant to smell as soon as I came down stairs, they need to put air fresheners around the lobby. Our lock to our baggage was also tampered with. We left in morning to North Shore and locked one of our bags and when we came back to the room it seemed like someone had tried to open the lock because the key hole was pushed in and jammed and we couldn't get the lock to open, so my husband called the front desk and security came to our room and told us that he didn't think anyone was trying to get into our bag as "if someone was then they would have" and just brushed it off as if nothing happened. He fiddled with the lock for a bit and opened it, luckily everything was in our bag, so be careful with your valuables. Other than this hotel we had a great time in Hawaii, would not recommend staying at this hotel it is outdated and needs a major renovation. The lobby is the nicest part of this hotel. Initially after reading all of the other reviews we wanted to cancel the reservation and book with another hotel, but they had a no cancellation policy and now I see why because then everyone would cancel their reservations.

We stayed here a few years ago only because we had enough starwoods points for a few free nights. We had never stayed in Waikiki and always stay at the Turtle Bay when we come to Oahu. Let me say what makes this hotel worth it is it's location for the money. The rooms are sad and dated, the hotel itself has an old vibe and it's a "I need to be renovated" vibe not "wow, this is old hawaii" vibe. That being said we had the best view from our room, amazing. We looked out and saw the surf, diamond head and the ocean over the top of the Moana Surfrider. You get privilages at all the Sheratons in the waikiki beach area so really, this place is a deal, You aren't ever in your room anyway. Just be sure to get a high floor room facing diamond head and you'll be glad you stayed here.

This hotel is minutes from the beach. At about 11 and 2, staff bring water and fruit to the beach area. Check where you need to sit, to get it offered to you. Our check-in was quick. Our room had a partial ocean view, could watch the surfers in the early morning from our bed. A bit noisy from the construction but Waikiki is noisy anyway. Pool staff were knowledgeable about some good local restaurants. Had the most enjoyable month.

We were very happy with our stay here. As has been mentioned in earlier reviews the hotel is looking a little old & tired but the rooms were clean & well maintained, the beds & pillows soooo comfy, the live music nightly in the pool/bar area was wonderful and the staff were extremely helpful & very friendly (special mention goes out to Arthur on the front door - what a character!). The only negative issue we had was with our bar tabs for the first couple of days, which until we were made aware of what was happening (courtesy of another establishment that notified us when presenting our check) we were double tipping the wait staff. When we did enquire why our bill for 2 people was incurring an automatic gratuity charge we were told that since we were sitting at a table with 6 or more other people, an 18% tip was already factored into our account. We wondered why our drinks seemed to be a little more expensive than we thought they would be. Would of been nice to know that up front however it did teach us to look over our checks a bit more carefully before leaving a tip! Other than that minor hiccup which was easy fixed, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Princess Kaiulani and would recommend it to our friends.

The staff at Princes Kaiulani was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again. The check-in area and main area is very nice and lovely. We really enjoyed our stay there. The concierge Terry was great!!! Check-in and check-out was real easy and no issues.The pool area is very lovely. Nice having live music there.Right near the beach, shopping, and the King's Court shopping center.

This hotel is outdated, rooms are very 80's or 90's defenetly an Old Hotel. However their people and staff are nice and pleasant very frendly and accomodating, I will probably give them a 4. But.... I make my reservation though "EXPEDIA" and I requested a king size bed and they didn't have one apparently they were over booked so they didn't have a king size bed. So automaticly give me Doble full size and said that they upgrade me to a 16 floor. Whatever that means. Of curse that wasn't acceptable to me due that we were celebrating our anniversary and my birthday. Their excuse was that because I didn't make the reservation though them is not guarantee the bed that I request. So of course I conplaint with "EXPEDIA" But i took the hotels manager "Bob" word that they will give me the last 2 nights in a king size bed. And they will find out. However that never happen no a phone call or at least apology of not finding anything... So I will defenetly NOT RECOMEND this hotel. At least you make a reservation with SPG or their own web site. If you are reserving through a Travel web site like Expidia, price line or any other don't expect to grant your request. I place my reservation with 2 months in advance and I planned carefully so I can enjoy my aniversary. However we ended up sleeping in different beds on my whole staying.

My husband and I arrived here at 11:30 pm after a 6 hr flight. The girl at the front desk seemed inexperienced & rude. After taking our name & credit card info she disappeared into the back office for several minutes. When she came back out she informed us that they had overbooked the hotel and they had a room for us at the Ohana East next door. The Ohana East is NOT a Sheraton Resort, just conveniently located next door. My husband was upset, so the night time manager came out to speak to is. He was nice enough to get in our car and show us where the parking for the Ohana East was. Unfortunately he didn't know where he was going & he sent us the wrong way on a one way alley street. I mentioned to the front desk at the Ohana East that the Sheraton had sent us here because of an overbooking & he said they had overbooked FOURTY rooms !! We booked our stay on Kayak, I suggest booking directly thru the hotel if you really want to stay here. Better yet, stay somewhere else.

I was thoroughly impressed.Clean rooms. Great beds. Next to international market (perk in the future) and central location to most of the beach area.Recommend fully and would definitely return.------I've stayed at many hotels and typically book my room solely off of star ratings. It seems like this rating system may be upside down as this hotel greatly outshone those with higher star rating.I grew up in Japan and Hawaii, but it had been years since I had been back to either. I immediately noticed at both that the people didn't seem as friendly as I remembered when I was growing up. I remembered people smiling a lot, having respect, taking care of elders, and just being "good people."I could still find a higher percentage of these people the further I got from Tokyo and Honolulu, but it was a genuine disappointment on the whole touring both.------The staff we encountered at Sheraton Princess had great customer service and didn't seem fake: they weren't only smiling for the tourists. I think when you can see them smiling and laughing when each other it's a great sign of where the true aloha spirit is coming from.I also stayed at the Marriott and Hilton; incredibly disappointed by a handful of staff members and the rooms themselves.As someone returning, the Princess was "no ka oi" for me

I enjoyed staying here, The rooms are VERY clean and the beds are sooo comfortable. The bathroom was really not in good shape, it needs some updating. However tge Hotel Staff was magnificent and they provided us with good recommendations for food, and great hiking locations! A quick easy two minute walk to the beach and centered around good shopping locations.

Hubby and I took ourselves to Hawaii for our anniversary and picked this hotel for it's location and price. We were a little concerned over some of the reviews as to the age of the place, that it was old and tired, etc., but to be across the street from the beach smack dab in the middle of Waikiki, we figured we'd give it a shot. We were only going to be there one night (off to the cruise ship the next day), so I splurged to give my husband an ocean view for our first night in Hawaii! And it was!!! We live in SE Florida and see beautiful oceans and reefs and sand and palm trees all the time, but we opened the door to the room and said OMG in unison!!! We were positively delighted!!! And we thank Justin, at the front desk, for his sensitivity to our wanting to make this a very special celebration! I can't say enough about Justin! He was everything you want someone on the front desk to be! Understanding, professional, diplomatic, caring, and really really nice, too!!! We were simply thrilled with our view!!! The lobby is gorgeous at this place, and the location is fabulous (for the price), it's exactly across the street from the big fancy hotel on the beach! And right in the middle of everything you could want!! Walk anywhere! We did a little walking, but ended up at the beach for sunset and a fancy drink. Our room was not the most updated we've ever been in, due to the age of the building, it's small compared to the new hotels. But the bed was terrific, and we're annoying oldsters who want comfy beds 'cause sleep can be elusive. I absolutely loved the bed! Average bathroom, good water pressure, clean, clean, clean. We were only staying one night, but they treated us like we were staying three weeks! We enjoyed a super breakfast the next morning (not included) but we thought it was a deal at $24.50.....bottomless buffet of good food, which we enjoyed on the patio. There's a problem with birds in these outdoor spots in Hawaii, and we got the biggest kick out of the employee whose job it is to shoo away the birds with a stick with flowing fabric on it. I'm not keen on sharing my space with birds, but we're eating outside and it's Hawaii. No biggie. We got ourselves into the vacation feel with a photo (we got a coupon from Justin) and we did the picture thing and we're glad we did because the photo on the ship was awful, and they only took one.....these guys - Gerard & Zachary at the Photo Booth, really seemed to care that we liked our pictures. He took us all around the property to various trees and backgrounds and we got ourselves our favorite picture from the trip. And he squeezed us in on his lunch break 'cause we didn't have an appointment. Across the board the folks at the Sheridan were so nice, the place is beautiful, the room although older (very 70's) was spotless and very comfortable and who cares, the view was awesome!!! The bedding was all new, plush white on white. The very best pillows anywhere!!! We were in the tower on a high floor in a corner room looking toward Diamond Head. Wow just doesn't cover it for our view!!! All these hotels have an added on fee for parking, etc., about $25, and we had to pay that, but even with that tacked on, it's still the best deal in town! It was a glorious start to our two weeks in Hawaii. You can stay on the beach for $450 a night, but this was in the $225 range, called a partial ocean view and I can't imagine anything nicer!!! I actually liked it better looking up the beach than to look directly at the beach! If you're super fussy for the to-die-for bedroom, this isn't for you, but if you want clean, good service, gorgeous view, comfortable bed, beautiful lobby, a restaurant, and a good price, we found a winner!

I stayed her for a few nights. The location is great, right in the middle of Waikiki and across the street from the beach.The lobby is open and comfortable. On the first floor, there's a large area for computer access, a sitting area to read, the pool (no hot tub), a small stage for performances, and a bar/restaurant. I didn't eat at the restaurant, but the buffet breakfast smelled wonderful! There are 2 buildings and I'm sure some had a view of the ocean. Mine did not but that was okay since I wasn't in my room very much. The room included all the standard amenities including a small fridge and 2 free bottles of water. The beds were clean but the room itself and the carpet were a bit dated. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. You need to pay the irritating $25.00 resort fee per day. It includes free parking (I didn't have a car), internet (well, internet should be free), free buffet for kids with paying adult (I had not kids) and a free photo that they choose. So, you need to book your free photo shoot 24 hours in advance. The only time they had for me was at 2:30, which wasn't convenient. But the idea is that you walk around the property with a photographer taking multiple photos for 15-30 minutes. Then, they pick which photo they will give you for free and you can buy the others. The pool is open from 8am - 7pm. If you head to the beach, they hand out fruit and water to guests 3x a day by the statue near the beach, which is a nice added benefit. They also offered lei making and other activities around the hotel during the day. There was a work out room on the 2nd floor that had a good number of cardio and weight machines. The only thing is that I asked for a late checkout for 11:30 and they deactivated my key at 11am. I had to go down to the front desk and they happily reset my key card. Otherwise, it was a very pleasant experience.

I booked this room 2 months in advance. 3 of my coworkers also book here for the same time. They received emails saying SPG switched their hotels to one of the sister properties without even asking them. They are all platinum as well as myself. I arrive at the hotel to find out that the hotel was over sold and there are no rooms available. Very unprofessional. Been sitting here for over an hour waiting. Will not stay here again.

Just completed our 3rd stays at the Sheraton Kaiulani. We loved this place because it always have a great combination of location and value. My wife and i go to Honolulu once a year and we always treated this place as our home away from home. Staff are great and super friendly. they definitely embodied the spirit of Aloha !!you guys rocks!!!

One of the most worst hotels I have ever been. I am a guy who travel around world. I usually stay more that a month per year in SPG hotels.So, I am a member of SPG gold & platium. People who work in front desk are too arrogant to their customer. Once I step in SPG line, a worker in front desk said to me ' go there! go there!. They did not even ask me like ' Are you a Spg member?'. She forced me to stand the other line. The condition of room is terrible. A disgusting black water came out from bath tub. I complained again, but, they said they want to fix it. Do I have to wait to fix the room when I stay there? So, I moved another room. However, they did not clean the room for 4 days. Morever, they double charged hotel resort fees. It was almost $200 U.S dollar. They charged $200 for my sister, and another $200 for me. Once I am back home, I called hotel manager, and complained about double chared resort fee. However, he denied, and did nothing. I am still struggle with wrong charge. WATCH OUT DOUBLE RESORT FEE.

As a platinum SPG member I was upgraded to the deluxe room with a great sea view. Rooms are small, but clean and the bed is comfortable. Bathroom needs some renovation. Position of hotel is next to the Pink lady (Royal Hawaiian) and is in the centre of the life in Honolulu. It is a big hotel, if you want romance maybe you better choose Westin.

My partner and I have just returned from Oahu and must say the hotel was wonderful. You don't need to pay for expensive beach front properties as this hotel is 2 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. The staff are so friendly and helpful and the rooms and hotel are very clean we will definitely be staying here again next year.Very enjoyable

We stayed here for 5 nights in adjoining ocean view rooms each with 2 double beds.Good location. It was an easy walk to the beach even with strollers and various water and sand toys.The lobby had been upgraded nicely. Rooms are still very dated. Gym was very ordinary. Staff were nice.

I've stayed at a lot of hotels in that area of waikiki and I gotta say this is one of the best for the price. I've also had many problems at other hotels surrounding and this the only hotel where I don't have any problems whatsoever. Awesome service, great staff, clean rooms and great food. Theres also a gym and pool! Fabulous hotel, Ive stayed here 3 times within 3 years and never had any problems. Thank you!

This is the 2nd time we've stayed at this hotel. It's reasonably priced and offers a great location which is right in the heart of Waikiki. It has free wifi, a nice pool area, friendly staff and is fine for a short Waikiki stay. It can be quite a noisey hotel - both visits we were often woken early in the morning by delivery trucks and traffic. On this latest visit, there was major construction going on in the site next to the hotel with workmen starting as early as 5am and creating a lot of noise. Not the fault of the hotel, but just a nuisance. Check-in or any enquiry at the front desk can take a while. There are usually only a few staff working at any one time and they seem to spend a long time with each guest. We were very surprised and upset that we came back to our room one day and found the maid charging her phone on our charger. She looked embarrassed and left quickly. Our room had already been cleaned earlier in the day, and what else was she up to in our room ?Overall, a good place to stay. However if you've got time to research others, you may find something a bit better for a similar price.

The hotel is a bit on the old side but the common areas have been renovated. The rooms are clean and renovated with only minor items on the old side. The hotel location is great, just a 5 minute walk to the beach and great places to eat. and shop Diamond Head is only a 1 hour walk away, 10 minutes by public bus.We had a ocean view from the 21st floor, great views!The wifi download is only 2 mbps but works well anywhere on the property. The staff were all great. Terry, 1 of the concierge staff was fantastic with recommendations for dinner, the bus for Diamond Head (very limited parking onsite) and tours (via Tommy).We very much enjoyed our stay, especially since the price was much lower than hotels directly on the beach. Had a great time, will definitely stay here again.

Spent a week at this Sheraton to attend a conference at the nearby Hale Koa.Hotel is located right off the main street that runs through Waikiki and the area is safe, clean, with plenty of restaurants and shopping, as well as a lovely beach with chairs, umbrellas to rent and surfboards that can be rented with instruction. Hotel is a bit dated, but well maintained. Check in was a breeze. The airport shuttle dropped me off at the other Sheraton property on the main street that was beach front. No problem. Less than a half mile walk between these two properties. Room was clean and well maintained. Admittedly I didn't spend much time in the room (beside sleeping), but I slept great, quiet, comfortable bedding and mattress. They offer breakfast in the lobby, I didn't take advantage of it, but its smelled great. Small gym on the second floor with several treadmills, some cardio equipment, cable machine. Pool and small bar on side of the hotel facing the street, very nice and well kept.  Overall, solid hotel, good value and within easy walking distance of all the shopping, dining highlights of waikiki. Not luxurious - but very comfortable hotel in a great location at a great price point.

Just metres from the hustle of the beachfront, the Princess Kaiulani is a great place to make yourself at home and just relax. Our room was comfortable and clean with a view over the pool and a glimpse of the ocean, and quiet enough for us to sleep with the sliding door open. The staff are excellent - warm, friendly, sassy and able to comprehend an Australian accent. As others have said, it is not the most glamorous hotel in Waikiki, but it feels good. And it is not nearly as crowded so you can actually sit down to breakfast without a half hour queue.

Is this a 5-star hotel? No. Is it clean, comfortable and in a good location? Yes. I have stayed in nicer hotels, but I have also stayed in worse. I give this hotel a solid 3 stars. It's not a luxury hotel and definitely needs updating, but you cannot beat the location and the staff is friendly and helpful. A word of caution though... There is construction going on right now next door that is more than a bit noisy, but usually stops after 5 pm. If you aren't going to be in your hotel room much (and come on... You're in Hawaii so you shouldn't be) this hotel is clean and decent.

It is a great place to stay has everything you need, you don't even need to leave the hotel with the great food and entertainment and pool!!Nice having a gym there also being able to do laundry was a plus!

Satisfactory at best. Needs to be completely overhauled or replaced. Worn out carpeting throughout. Despite "no smoking" signs there was the constant stench of cigarette smoke. Had to close sliding door to avoid smoke from nearby rooms. However, the staff was extremely pleasant and courteous.

I found the hotel to be extremely dated. I even posted on my travel blog that there is no need to look further as I had found the world's worst Sheraton. I had long held that the Sheraton Pasadena was the worst of the worst but I was wrong. The hotel is in a horrible state of disrepair the bathroom floor tile is filthy, as is the gold flecked cultured marble bathroom countertop that is about 6-8" Lower than a standard bathroom countertop. In the room and the bath the wallpaper is dated, patched, and peeling, the carpet has numerous snags and runs, and the trim of the bathroom door seems to be rotted away. Finally the room smells very moldy and there appears to be black powdery stains around the vent. In general, it seems quite dingy. This was by the way and upgraded room as I am SPG Gold.I will not stay at this hotel ever again. I honestly do not know how this hotel is even a Sheraton.

My husband, toddler and I stayed here in April 2015. The location is excellent, about one block from Waikiki Beach, loads of restaurants and shopping. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay. The lobby, courtyard and pool are very nice and were not crowded. They offered free music and hula shows every night poolside, which our toddler absolutely loved. However, the rooms are very, very outdated and worn out. We booked an ocean-view room and upon entering were extremely disappointed. We did not expect what we'd find at a luxury hotel, but it was well below the standard we've grown accustomed to at a Sheraton, or even more budget hotels. Though the room was very clean, the first thing we noticed was the musty smell. The room had almost no amenities, the furnishings were very old, chipped and scratched and there was no décor to speak of, aside from one faded painting. The wallpaper was separating at the seams. The bathroom was minute and unwelcoming. It was also next to the noisy service elevator. The ocean view of Waikiki was excellent, but could only be seen by going out on the small balcony. We decided to visit the front desk and see if we could purchase an upgraded room. The gentleman at the desk was very kind and helpful. He offered us a deluxe ocean view room at no extra cost and we took him up on the offer. The room was slightly larger, no funny smell, and in somewhat better condition. It had a wonderful view of the ocean and the Moana Surfrider, as well as the courtyard where the hotel had free nightly entertainment. We stayed in the room through the rest of the week and experienced excellent service from the staff. The food at the restaurants wasn't great but was what we expected. Though we had a nice stay, unfortunately the rooms were of such low quality that we would not stay here again, nor recommend to a friend.

Perfect location, room and hotel grounds are not the best, needs improvement.there is a resort fee that includes parking, you get 2 water bottles a day, in-room coffee was good. you can borrow beach chairs which is big plus. i gave my rating based on the location of the hotel because is centraly located, the bed are very confortable..!

I was in Honolulu for business, but still enjoy staying right in Waikiki Beach. This hotel has an incredible location. Right off the beach, and in the middle of everything. You can find tons of stores and restaurants nearby. There are also lots of beautiful walks to be had in many directions from the hotel. The hotel lobby, restaurant, and bar are all open air to the pool area and very upscale. One aspect that I loved was that parking was included in the $25 resort fee. Many other hotels in the area charge for both, $25/day resort fee AND $30/day parking. And I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful.As has been said earlier, the rooms are a bit small, old and dated. There is nothing really wrong with them and I found mine to be very clean. It was fine for me, but it's not going to impress. However, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the flat screen TV had lots of channels, the included Wifi was fast and reliable, and the room had a minifridge. Try to get a high floor with an ocean view if possible, it is amazing. I was only on the 12th floor and my view was still pretty great.I was given a discounted breakfast buffet and while not huge or elaborate, it had a lot of great options. Since the restaurant is open to the pool area, it does make for a very nice Hawaiian breakfast experience. I wouldn't pay the full $25 for it, but if you can get it included in the room, it's really nice.Overall, even with the dated rooms, this is a very nice hotel with an incredible location and I would have no problem staying here again.

My wife & I have stayed at the Princess Kaiulani twice in the past 5 years. Our most recent trip was staying 4 days (April 18-21). During this trip we were greeted by friendly baggage staff who were most informative with any questions we had. The rooms were clean and the bed was soft. Bar staff by the pool were attentive. We were located in the big tower (14th Floor) facing the Market....which is under construction. It was a bit noisy but we were getting up to enjoy the Hawaiian morning and were not in our rooms for much of the day anyways. Construction should be completed in a years time. On our departure our flight time was at 10:15pm...to our pleasant suprise the hotel provided luggage storage, towels & beach chairs for the day. To top that off we were provided a hospitality room to clean up before our flight. Thanks for the service! Randy M Windsor Ont.

We booked at the very last minute as we were turned away from another hotel due to overbooking (I suppose this is what you get when you book on a very very cheap rate, always the first to get bumped). This hotel was actually the cheapest hotel by far given we had a car and needed parking. I must say my rating is given considering the normal prices they charge, not really the last minute distressed inventory price we paid (which was exceptional for such a centrally located hotel, even if we didn't need to park). The first impression is - well, the hotel is VERY old, the mail chutes on each floor attests to its origins in the 1950s. Consequently the rooms are rather small by modern standards, even if they were updated some time in the previous decade or so - so is reasonably modern inside. It also seemed reasonably quiet, but then again maybe it's only because the hotel wasn't anywhere near full. My only complaint is that the air conditioning was either off or waaaaaaaaaaaaay too cold (the system is so old you can only control fan speed). Luckily the temperature was comfortable enough that we didn't need the air conditioning at all. Surprisingly the WiFi works wonderfully well, better than many much newer build hotels. We had a "partial ocean view room" so our balcony had the view over the pool, an outlook to the front of the magnificent Moana hotel and a bit of blue ocean beyond. Quite nice to just sit around and watch life pass by in the pool and the street below.It's a wonderfully located hotel, cross the road and you're on Waikiki Beach (which really is nothing special, especially given all the beautiful beaches we'd seen on Maui and Big Island in the week prior). Everything in Waikiki is within very short walking distance, which is just as well because the buffet looks very ordinary. I especially loved having Haagen Daas in the same complex, and Cheesecake Factory being a very short walk away ... The pool area is rather tranquil given the location, I enjoyed that it was a deep pool you could swim in, but never understood why it closes so early. It's the kind of pool you'd want to have a drink or two and a swim after dinner. There's apparently also a beach chair service on Waikiki but only during the middle of the day.Parking fee is included in the resort fee, which is great because other hotels can charge a lot more on top. The parking lot is a bit curious, only the top floor has elevator access, but it doesn't matter because the lot itself is so close and handy.I'll most definitely stay here again if the price is right, but certainly is not what you'd expect from a Sheraton (think Holiday Inn), especially not at its normal prices.

I did not stay here but across the road at the Moana Surfrider.I did however park my car there as the adjoining carpark is used by both Sheraton and Moana. Position is excellent .Right across the road from Moana and right alongside the (being reconstructed Hawaiian Village, Waikiki Beach and within walking distance of Waikiki shops restaurants hotels and car rentals). Disappointing to read the negative reviews about the accommodation as I was considering staying there next visit mainly because of the location carpark and of course the Kaimona band which play there every Friday Saturday and Sunday nights. They were the only 3 piece (guitar bass and drums) band that had a drummer and played a large variety of Hawaiian (which I consider mandatory but also 50's and 60's music which is what we baby boomers like to enjoy.

We stayed at the Sheraton and the rooms and pool were nice but the only issue is that you can hear your neighbours talking!Through the walls! This was made worse as thy were school girls who chatted and slammed doors until 2am! Other than that it was a nice hotel.

It's challenging to rate this hotel because of the large discrepancies. Some things are fabulous, like the location, customer service, check-in. The rooms are just appalling it feels that you are back in the 1940's and myself begin an SPG platinum member I was upgraded to an ocean view room and still was not nice. It is more than desperate for an upgrade and for 280usd a night you expect an amazing place especially if you are travelling to Hawaii for a holiday. The breakfast was very insipid and nothing special in all a lower than average experience a bit of a disappointment for a SHERATON!!

This is my 5th time to Waikiki and I try to stay at different hotels to try them out. I chose the Princess Kauilani because of its location and it's a Sheraton. So close to the beach and good coffee just outside. I was disappointed in its bathroom (who uses shower curtains anymore??) and lack of power, we had one outlet for two ppl, very annoying! We had an 'organic contamination' in the pool (totally not their fault!) and they were very good in directing us to another hotels pool to use if we wanted. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the food at Pikake was great, my friend loved the $5 salad. Once the upgrade of the rooms is done (not started yet.....) this hotel will be fantastic but until then......

It's challenging to rate this hotel because of the large discrepancies. Some things are fabulous, like the location, customer service, check-in, bell station, valet, breakfast areas and speedy elevators. It's these fabulous and wonderful features that tend to eclipse the most horrible feature: the rooms! This is why you'll see such a large range of ratings on here - If you don't care that the rooms are straight out of the 1950's, both in layout and furniture, there is so much else to love that you might be tempted to give this hotel 4 or 5 pts. However, the bedrooms and hallways were dirty, filthy, old and archaic. The bathrooms were old and dingy and tiny. They need more than a renovation they need to be remodeled. I called the front desk upon seeing my full ocean-front room, which I paid $40/night extra for - and just broke down and cried because it reminded me of an old, cheap hotel from the 1960's in Niagara Falls. Of course in the 1960's all the hotels were cheap-o. I mean old and dirty and ick! - right now, here at this Sheraton! Why they have not renovated the rooms is shocking. However, when I called the front desk they sent Elizabeth Rapp up to help me and she quickly whisked me to another floor and made sure everything was as neat and clean as it could be. Once I got used to the idea of having a less-than-nice room, even though the beds were fabulous and there was no noise, everything else panned out. So it's difficult to rate. Sheraton, how could you allow an amazingly-located hotel with your name on it to get run down like this? It's super nice that the open-air lobby and breakfast area has been renovated, now maybe the rooms? Their pool was a salt-water pool and not heated, but it was warm enough and the salt-water felt good. The buffet breakfast is served until 11:00 and has everything you could want. The elevators are super fast and there's a place to fill your water bottles with fresh water from the well off site. There's a place to get your pictures taken around the hotel and on the beach, as well as all open-air lobby which was just delightful. Every morning there were local artists selling their wares also in the lobby. The view from the room was stunning and the beds were as always, comfortable. There wasn't much noise and my room was very quiet. All staff in every department went always, always, always above and beyond to keep the hotel looking as best as it could and always offering to get you anything you'll want. My room was #1750 and I highly recommend it as being one of the nicer, cleaner rooms. If you want to cry when you get in there because it's old, old, old...just remember that 1750 is one of the nicer rooms and floors and even it looks old. But the chairs were comfortable and useable and I was grateful for that. My first room, 2350 ?? even the hallway was dark and dirty. The 17th floor is much better than the higher floors which need new carpet, new wallpaper - steaming the old off as it's already got about 8 layers on it. If your windows/doors shake with the wind, do not accept this because they have someone who can come up and fix it right away. If they would wipe down the safes that might help. There is just dirt and gritty, shabby old lampshades and not even a footstool or chaise lounge. There is so much great about this hotel if they'd just redo the rooms it'd be an easy 5. Unfortunately that isn't scheduled until 2017!! I guess that is the critical mass point at which the ugliness of the rooms supercedes the beauty of the rest of it. I would stay here again and ask for room 1750. That's the only way. The staff was stellar. They can only do so much with what they've got to work with and if you can close your eyes to the room, the bed is comfortable and the view of the ocean outstanding. The air conditioner works quite well, you get fresh water daily, the internet worked well. Lots to love. :-) Just don't go here to get pampered. This is not a spa hotel. At all. It was a nice memory but the rooms, they're bad. It was only the customer service team that helped me move all my things to another room and floor that saved the day. If you don't care about your room so much this hotel will be fine, however, if you need a nice room consider another hotel. The rooms are just not there. I feel like I have to write this because we expect more from Sheraton. Especially in Hawaii. :-(

We've just got incredibly rude, unhelpful manner from the front desk boy. So much different from The Marriott or Hilton that we usually stay. We've already report the case to the SPG cause we are the SPG member.If you have another choice, stay away from this hotel.

We had an amazing time in Waikiki! Thank you to the wonderful staff at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for treating us like Royalty. Our service began with a warm welcome with room upgrade, complimentary champagne, welcome drinks at the pool bar, and complimentary breakfast at Pikake Terrace. We also had a complimentary photo shoot which was perfect right after our wedding:) The location couldn't have been better - walk to restaurants, shops, and beach. We did not want to leave!

I was given a nice ocean view room on the 27th floor with complimentary breakfast coupons. The room was clean and the cleaning staff was very friendly. They even advised us on tourist spots which was really good as locals they knew a lot. The hotel staff agreed for a late afternoon checkout which helped my kids with their afternoon naps which woulnt have been possible if we were forced to checkout early. I would recommend this hotel.

I booked my stay using a deal with American Express which meant the total included a car and the hotel room for two night. The hotel is situated on the cornet of Kalakaua Ave and Kanekapolei Street right in the hearty of Waikiki. It is across the road from the Mona Surfrider and no more than a two minute walk from the beach.On arrival my status was noted and I was advised that I had been upgraded to a pool view. The staff were very polite friendly and professional and indeed this was my experience of all the staff I encountered over the two days. I was given breakfast vouchers and briefed on how the $26 a night resort fee worked. (I hate this fee) and is should be abolished by all hotels immediately.The hotel lobby was clean and functional but not particularly interesting.My room, on the second floor was clean, but there was not much else going for it. There would have been a pool view if the triffid like tree had been removed. However the most notable issue was the lack of power outlets and the use of a very large multi adapter on the floor. charging iPods cameras and iPads was challenging and this is not a hotel you would use if in Waikiki for work.the car park is self park and to the rear of the hotel. If you go directly to to the top floor there is direct access to the hotels 3rd floor.There is a self service laundry which was very handy.Breakfast was particularly underwhelming and it was just as well it was free!my schedule did not allow the use of the pool until just before I left when I discovered it was closed due to "organic contamination!" I didn't blame the hotel for this but they could have made alternative arrangements but chose not to. I did feel aggrieved at paying $53 fir parking and other than than night the resort fee provided this guest with little else.A late check out was allowed although only after some discussion and finally me pointing out that 4pm was standard. The hotel countered with "when available" but I was grateful for them sorting things out in the end.The staff were great but the hotel needs a lot of work. For a very short stay in the heart of Waikiki this is probably ideal for 1 or 2 nights but no more. I would return in the future if the price was right.Wifi was free but so slow as to render its use impossible

I have stayed here several times always a good stay and am satisfied. Glad to see some updates happening in the lobby. Yes this is an older hotel but you can't be the location. Walking distance to shops, beach, and food. Parking located at the hotel and included with resort fee.

Holy cow, we checked in had a beautiful lunch that included real orchids on the drinks. I am disabled and might need to stay in room when my husband was out so, when we were put into a room over looking the loud construction, I called down and explained my needs. They very pleasantly gave us a quiet room over looking the pool. This included peace and quiet on 6th floor and over looked the pool and music stage which has live music nightly and hula dancer performance too. The room was clean, linens amazing, so comfortable we slept 14 hrs and felt so rested we got to enjoy our stay. The hotel is currently getting some new paint and new improvements to what is already a beautiful hotel with great staff. The open air lobby is amazing also. Excellent location no rental car needed. All tours arranged in the lobby on shuttles and buses. Ask about access to hotel across the street beach side for entertainment, beach use and nice you can charge it back to your hotel. Great perk!

I stayed at the Sheraton Princess back in 2012 and had a wonderful experience. I noticed the lobby has been renovated and looks very nice. This visit in 2015 was even better that the last time. From checking in (Erin is awesome) to check out and everything in between our experience was wonderful. There is such warmth from everyone who works there. We arrived a little earlier than expected and had lunch at the Pikake Terrance. Afterwards Erin was nice enough to see if a room was available for us to check in. This allowed us a little more time on our first day of arrival to enjoy Hawaii. My sister met up with us from New York and this was my daughter’s spring break (she is 6) and she was so sad to leave. I told her that God willing we would be back soon. I would recommend the Sheraton Princess to anyone.

We arrived at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a three-night stay last month. We had stayed there many years ago, and remembered it as a nice, friendly hotel, but were completely unprepared for the wonderful treatment we received this time. When checking in, we mentioned that we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary, and the desk clerk, Mark, took it from there! Unbeknownst to us, he contacted the manager, and arranged for a surprise to greet us upon our return from lunch: a beautiful bunch of helium-filled silver balloons, a basket of fruit, snacks and wine, and a congratulatory card from the hotel. We were overwhelmed to say the least. It will be a big part of our anniversary memories, you can be sure. And there will only be one hotel for us in Honolulu from now on!

Stayed 3 nights before our cruise & 3 nights after before coming back home. Friendly staff, rooms okay for what you pay & not far from the beach if that is your thing. Bus stops handy for travel around the city etc.

Just home from our 5th stay here. Two weeks with family. Great to see improvements in Lobby. Have no complaints with booking in. Staff great and very welcoming. Welcoming drinks appreciated. Looking forward to next visit.

I spent 4 nights here in March 2015 as part of a tour. It is a beautiful hotel with much shopping, restaurants and water opportunities. There is a beach, several pools (including a great infinity pool) and a night time water light show. The breakfast buffet is outstanding.

Great stay, much Aloha, comfortable beds. friendly staff and awesome location close to just about every location easy parking nice pool and reasonable prices on eating elevators were a little slow but when your on vacation it really doesn't matter.

This is my 2nd stay at the hotel and I can only thank all the great staff there that made my stay so good. I was allowed an early check in due to my SPG gold status and was given a room on the 8th floor. Although the view was ok, I went back down to reception and asked if it was possible to be moved to a higher floor. Wow! They gave me a room on the 23rd floor with amazing views of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head.All the staff I came into contact with were kind, helpful and courteous. The only slight negative was that the rooms are due a bit of an update but they were spotlessly clean. I can only recommend a stay here (get a high floor though if possible). Look forward to coming back soon.

Hotel is brilliantly located, only a couple minutes from the shops, beach, restaurants etc. Rooms were quite basic but adequate and the food and drinks was okay although a tad expensive. The pool at the hotel is too small but the staff were very helpful.

Sheraton is a brand that is hit and miss, and this hotel is probably a miss. They are running a volume based game by dropping the prices and filling rooms. The issue with this approach is the hotel is reasonably full and actually rather noisy at nights. To the point where we had to move rooms.The lobby and restaurant area has been done up and are brand new, but jump into the lifts and the rooms and you will be quickly disappointed.The rooms are small, and old. Very Clean, and as i said good value considering the location. But the pillows were socking! (Note take your own if you can)All in all we only stayed 2 nights, great location, friendly staff but very old hotel.If you can get a cracking rate and you want a 2 / 3 star hotel then this is for you.

The rooms are in desperate need of being gutted and redone. The whole facility is showing its age. This is such a great location in the middle of everything, but appears to be neglected by its owner. The lobby areas were in OK shape.The room had dated fixtures. The bathroom had peeling paint and weird stains on the walls. The room felt dirty because of the years of grime baked into everything.

Stayed here on Friday 27th March. Checked in quite late and had a lovely night's sleep . Ate the morning buffet breakfast which was first class .....couldn't fault the fruit or omelette. The staff were very helpful and stored beach towels for after our Pearl Habour trip despite us having checked out. Will definitely return if I ever go to Honolulu.

I stayed at this hotel for two weeks while here on business. The hotel was very nice. No matter where I stay the bed and pillows are the most important feature. Here they were fantastic! You can check pour beach towels and chairs to take to the beach. They have staff deliver water and fruit to those bearing the hotel towel on the beach!

This was the last leg of my 60th birthday trip to the states having spent the previous week in Las Vegas and San Francisco and it didn't let me down. On arrival our room was not ready so we were asked to have a welcome drink in the splash bar by the pool until the check in time of 3.00pm but it was still not ready when we went back so we were upgraded into a better kingsize bedded room and from then on everything was rosey! We had a couple of minor issues when the toilet blocked and when we ran out of shower gel but within 5 minutes of reporting the problems a member of staff was there to sort it out (all the staff here were lovely). The location of the hotel is right in the centre of Waikiki handy for all the designer shops and restaurants and only meters from the golden sands of Waikiki beach. We didn't use the pool much during our week because of the heat as it was far cooler on the beach so we would collect our towel and beach chair from the pool assistants every morning and go down to the beach. So as I have already said the staff in the hotel made our stay what it was we did our own thing and really enjoyed ourselves. The room was a decent size with a coffee making machine and cups that were replenished everyday beds made and towel changes etc etc and the bed was really comfortable, so all in all if I got the chance I would definetely stay here again!

Checked in 3/30/15 on 20 year anniversary trip. After exhausting plane trip- total 18 hours with security and layovers, TV didn't work. 30 minutes of technicians work later some wiring issue. TV fixed. Did not set alarm but it went off at 4:30 am. Left note for housekeeping. No fix. Second night it went off at midnight. Limited cups, towels and other misc. Provisions have changed every day. My wife just got in the shower only to find no shower mat. Hmmm. We have given up complaining and looking forward to checkout on Friday for our Maui destination. They change $25+ mandatory fee. So far we have received 2 bottles of water each day and cumbersome internet for the time we have been in the room. That's pretty much what we'll get for our stay for that extra profit fee. They do have live music and hula dancing pool side each evening which you can enjoy from your balcony. The fee probably pays for that even though that's not what it is for. This is our third day and we have had unacceptable issues each day. Will tell our travel agent to pass this on. Very disappointed. We have never in our travels experienced such disappointment. In Hawaii of all places!.

We stayed here because the location and price. I booked online for 4 nights and I did not have an option to select two beds. When we check in, I asked for two bed room. They accommodated and gave me a free upgrade to the partial ocean view room at 26 floor. From the room, I could see the Waikiki beach. Like others, we paid the resort fee which covered the parking. When I asked them type of activities that we may be able to do on the island. No one seems like could provide good suggestion. But they answer some of my specific questions. We did not use the hotel restaurant since they are pricy. The hotel is just few minutes away from the Waikiki Beach. It is very very close. There is ABC Store by the hotel and we we went to buy many supplies. However, last day, we learned there was a Safeway grocery store about 5 minutes drive (it may be much cheaper). The bed is comfortable. We spent as much time as we could outside. So by the time we got back to the room, we were very tired. We just slept. The only complaint I have is the construction next to the hotel. If you close the door, it was quiet. However, in the morning 5AM, construction started, you can hear truck beeping sound all the time which is very annoy. We did use the pool once which has very nice setting. My daughter and wife did attend a free art class and they enjoyed it. Overall, the hotel is showing its age but it is still nice. Most of staffs were very friendly. I will stayed here again.

If your room isn't quite ready upon arrival, the Splash Bar & Bento is a great place to grab a bite and hang out next to the pool. "Flavors of Hawaii" Volcano Chicken Salad sautéed in a special marinade with lettuce, Chinese cabbage, cucumbers, bell pepper, seasonal greens tossed in oriental dressing, and garnished with papaya and crispy taro chips.
