The salad is a good mix of local vegetables and fruits. The chicken would be better grilled than sautéed to help caramelize the marinade. Rating: 4/5Kalua Pork Sandwich is smoky pulled pork served on focaccia bread with homemade BBQ dipping sauce, a trio of melted cheeses, and served with celery, carrot sticks, and ranch dipping sauce. If you like BBQ pork sandwiches, this sandwich is for you. I am more of a purist when it comes to kalua pig and like it plain or with cabbage. The BBQ sauce is overpowering. The portion is also huge so sharing would be more than adequate. Rating: 3/5Waikiki activities to do/visit within walking distance (if you don't have a rental car):* Waikiki Beach is right across Kalakaua Avenue.* Kings Village Shopping Mart is across Kaiulani Avenue. Every Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday, there is a farmer's market with fresh island fruits and local artisanal foods for purchase. Eat some while you're walking or take back to your room for a snack later.* Honolulu Zoo* You can also purchase tickets for the Waikiki Trolley with unlimited boarding privileges with four different routes and over 30 stops.Ainahau Tower has cozy rooms with balconies and all of the creature comforts of a resort hotel: comfortable beds, air conditioning, mini refrigerator, TV, in-room safe, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, ice bucket and drinking glasses, and internet access. The room itself is a little small but the balcony helps open up the space. In the afternoon/evening, live Hawaiian and contemporary music from the pool can be heard in the High Ocean View, Tower Partial Ocean View, Pool View, and Deluxe Ocean View rooms. Relax on the balcony with a drink, let the ocean breeze erase the cares of the day and listen to music, all in the comfort of your own room.Pikake Terrace has a wonderful dinner buffet with flavors that will make everyone in your party happy. Here are some items you might find on the buffet: snow crab legs with drawn butter, grilled steaks, kalua pig and cabbage, Caesar salad, ahi poke, and haupia for dessert. The culinary presentation itself, is a visual feast. The mix of local food and continental cuisine is perfect. Hopefully, your tummy will tell you when to stop. Rating: 5/5

Today at 9:24pm I had family in the store on by Haagen Dazs. I didn't want to go in and out of stores. As I waited I pulled my laptop out and checked email. Sat for 15 minutes or less. I was approached by a security and was told that the area is private property and I must leave the premise. I complied and left. The whole time I walked away I got looked at as if I'm going to wait in the area like a criminal. Family ended up looking for me and was told that I was kicked out for using my computer. Upon calling and speaking with the Guest Service Manager I explained my story. Was told a store had complained about me waiting there. The manager ask why didn't I tell the security I am waiting for family. My question is why didn't they ask instead of kicking me out. It's not my job to ask questions. If a hostile security kicks you out you do it before a cop comes and get charged with criminal trespass.My family did go to the near by business and apologize for me sitting outside and no one said they called. They informed unless we are sleeping, doing drugs, or becoming a neucence then it should not be an issue with any of the business. Moral of this story is the company does not care of their patrons and rather boot them than make money. Poor customer service. For an island known for "Aloha" none was shown. I am glad I was not staying in the hotel as u would have checked out immediately.

This hotel is aging, no wonder they will knock it down. The reception area is nice but the rooms are different. Rooms are small and everything seems to be breaking or on the verge of breaking. We found the exoskeleton of a cockroach in the dresser drawer and at least 1 cockroach in the bathroom everyday. I had to keep my luggage closed constantly. The reception staff were really nice and always tried to help us so that was the only thing good about this hotel. Great location, right in the centre of things, the beach is near but there was construction going on right next to the hotel so it was noisy in the morning from 8am. We weren't bothered and found it amusing to watch but every night just on the outside corner of the hotel was a gathering spot for a lot of blonde "street walkers". I noticed them touting a few business men.

Stayed here during the business portion of our trip. The hotel was good. I guess it just wasn't very good. We were updated to "deluxe oceanview rooms". You could see the ocean over the hotel across the street, and you could see the pool and courtyard area. But, in my room, there had been a patch made to the wall, where they just slapped the sheet rock mud on it and left it. Didn't smooth it; didn't paint it. In at least 2 of the other rooms, the air conditioning control was just On/low/high. No temperature setting. My room had a thermostat, but it never seemed to be at the temperature I set it for. The bed was very comfortable. There was a small refrigerator in the closet. The pool was not heated, and was quite cold. It is also an older pool that goes to 8 feet deep. Most of the pool was deep. The breakfast buffet was good; especially since it was included in our rate. Not sure how I'd rate it if I were paying the $24.50 for it. Service in the bar/restaurant area was not top notch. Difficult to get service at times. I'd stay again, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

I stayed 6 nights for my holiday. We visitor use autolock key system on my room, my key (door?) was broken. Once I go out, however I tried to insert a card key,I could not open it.My room was 11th floor. The front desk explained it is OK for changing to new key, but it didn't work. I talked about it everyday, they didn't anything except change to new key, so I had to go and return my room and front desk.Last day when I were in a hurry for promise with bussiness partner, a staff called security and he changed the key system of the door finally. If they paid attention to my calim, I didn't need go and return many times.If you want loose weight by going and return front desk and your room, I recommend this hotel. I was very tired for "key trouble".

We've just completed a 5 night stay at Princess Kaiulani and loved most of it. All of the staff were warm and friendly. The room was older but was spotless and normal size for a hotel room. We had an ocean view which was very pleasant. We've been to Hawaii 3 times and have stayed in this hotel every time. We're already looking forward to our next stay. The only con is the 25 dollar resort fee per day which could be factored in to the bill so it does not come as a surprise at the end of your stay.

Stayed at the p.k. Many times before. I always go in march for my birthday. I love the new lobby and pool area. It is very inviting . I can't say enough great things about this hotel.very reasonably priced. Excellent location. Friendly staff. Hard working bartender at the bento bar. Excellent poke and food . I don't believe he took a day off while we were there. Friendly, sweet pool staff . They have towels,beach chairs and fresh fruit available for you each day. Resort fee covers parking a great value. I loved our housekeeper she was so cheerful and had kind words for us every morning. This hotel has free entertainment every evening.so enjoyable. I will be bringing my granddaughter back with me this year. I can't wait to come back to my home away form home.until then,Aloha and thank you all.

Always enjoy this Hotel because of location. They have been doing a lot of 're-modeling' and doing a great job especially around the pool area. They have added amenities to their 'Resort-charge' fees. Since we were Gold SPG members - we were upgraded to the Diamond Head side of the Hotel.

The hotel room was a bit dated, but overall okay. The location is very handy. If you are going to use the bus it's even better as it is early on bus stops so you can get on them before they fill up to standing only room.The biggest downside was the breakfast.

I stayed there on a staycation last weekend and it was fantastic. I had been worried about what I'd heard about the hotel, but everything was a-okay. Sure the rooms need some TLC, but are you going to spend all day in your room? You cannot beat the location and the buffet is very delightful. The bar in the lobby is great too!

We stayed 8 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. Love the location, it is close to everything you need. Waikiki Beach is just 3 minutes walk away, you can get complimentary beach chairs and towels from the pool attendants and bring them to the beach. The pool attendants bring fresh fruits and bottled water to Waikiki Beach, near the Duke statue at noon time for hotel guest as well. There's plenty of restaurants near the hotel, we loved that it is just opposite of Cheesecake Factory, Duke's and Royal Hawaiian Centre - all the places we love. Hotel room was decent, we arrived very early in the morning and was given a temporary room for an hour to rest and refresh. We stowed our bags at the concierge and left for lunch, returned about 1pm and managed to check in. What a surprise we had when we entered the room - there were gifts from the hotel - bottle of wine, fruit and snack basket, cookies and card. We were blown away! Would love to be back for our future anniversaries =)

We've just completed a 12 night stay at Princess Kaiulani and loved every minute of it. Everyone we encountered on the staff was very warm and friendly. On check in we mentioned it was our anniversary. The next day champagne was delivered to our room. We were asked when our return flight was , and after responding that it was at 10:00pm, were offered a 2pm checkout. The room, while older, was spotless and normal size for a hotel room. Our lanai was partial ocean view but offered a straight view of the beach ( we were on the 6th floor ). We loved the beach chairs and the water/ fruit delivered to us on the beach. We've been to Hawaii 13 times and this is by far our favorite hotel. It's not super luxury, like the Moana for example, but it is also no where near the cost either. For about $150/night this hotel can't be beat. We shortened our planned 14 night trip to 12 so we could stay here and I'm glad we did. We're already looking forward to next years stay.

This hotel is in a great location a few minutes walk from Waikiki Beach and right in the middle of some of the best shopping and dining on the island. The staff was polite and always very helpful. The rooms were small, but very comfortable and clean, and offered beautiful views of both Honolulu and Waikiki Beach from the balcony. All in all I had a great experience, and if I am fortunate enough to return to Honolulu I would stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

My wife and I spent 11 nights at the Princess Kaiulani. We were celebrating our birthdays. While the Princess is an older hotel we found it to be very clean and comfortable. The staff are as nice as any we have ever met. We enjoyed the breakfast and dinners. The nightly show is always good. All in all we had a fabulous time.

Mahalo nui loa for yet another fabulous stay! Being a hapa Hawaiian with all my ohana (family) living in Hawaii, my visits to Hawaii are quite frequent and every single time i stay at the Princess Kaiulani. Staying there truly feels like coming "home" and that is because of the aloha spirit and kindness of the staff there. I have to single out Bo, Norman and Lindsay at the pool towel/chair checkout. I see them every single time and they always remember me and greet me with love. They are truly the epitome of the aloha spirit. Mahalo and see you all next time!

I got the most value out of my reservation at this hotel and was thrilled with the extra mile that the staff went to accommodate my flight delay. I am a Starwood gold member and I got the impression that they would have gone the extra mile for anyone with the ease that they assisted me. My visit to Honolulu was unfortunately for one day purely for business. When I arrived the lady who checked me in was extremely friendly and genuine when I checked in. After a long flight it was a relief since she wasn't a typical front desk robot which is how some front desk agents seem especially after a long flight.The next morning after enjoying the fireworks and parade from my balcony, I checked out at 7:45 to get to my meeting. I was ready to head to the airport at the conclusion of my meeting 90 mins later looked at my phone and my flight was delayed till 3:30. I called the hotel immediately and the individual called housekeeping, found out my room had not been cleaned yet and allowed me to check back in at no extra cost and loiter in the hotel and their facilities until I was ready to leave. When I arrived at the front desk to get my keys the original front desk agent was there. Not only did she remember I was a one day visitor but she seemed genuinely happy I was back. The property was older but very well maintained, even though it was not directly on the water my view was sufficient and it was close enough that I was able to take a quick swim and get some beach time before my morning meetings began.  I can not wait until I take my next Hawaiian vacation and I will be staying at the Princess Kaiulani without a doubt!

Great hotel.An older property but they make up for it with excellent service, comfy beds.Very convenient . Reasonable rates.Complimentary beach chairs and great happy hour.Would definitely stay here again

3 night stay 3 people ..excellent location ..across the road from Waikiki..the pool area is great and the lunch menu is tasty...the rooms suited us with interconnecting door. comfortable clean and had a great view of the beach.

my husband and I were here in February. We found the hotel to be very good. Beds were comfortable, staff was very courteous and helpful. The atmosphere is pleasant. We enjoyed the entertainment every night in the Pikake Terrace as we relaxed before going to our room. This hotel has been updated and they have done a wonderful job as this is one of the older hotels. I had been to Waikiki many years ago and stayed here. When we were planning this trip, I felt confident through the reviewers that we would enjoy our stay and we did. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet, a little pricey, but all you can eat and lots of variety. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again. Great location, too!

Waited over an hour to check in, which I hear is pretty normal at this hotel. Very dated hotel. They upgraded us to the tower which was also pretty run-down. Can't imagine what the rest of the hotel looked like. We used our air miles and paid the difference. When we checked in, they charged us a resort fee as well, which included the "free wifi", so in fact, wifi is not free.

although hotel seemed old. it is well maintained in an excellent location. your few steps away from pick up area of most tours in the waikiki area. beautiful lobby, pool was nice, we loved the customer service, buffet was so-so, lots of food options around the surrounding areas. all shopping areas are within the vicinity. would definitely return.

Our third trip to Waikiki in five years. We booked the SPK months ago asking for a room above reception and over the pool in princess tower, like we had during our last stay. Well we're near the pool, a peek-a-boo view but close to the street-very noisy. Bed very worn out and uncomfortable. We asked to be moved immediately but we were told rooms all booked and to try later. Just easier to never stay here again.

My wife and I have stayed here for 7 out of 9 tears we have come to Honolulu. we love if the staf is 5 star the resort fee is ok but with that you get parking . some places charge both we stay for 3 to 4 weeks at a time Sept. is the best time to travel the , we will be there this year and we have 4 different friends will stay here this year because we told them about the PK if you don't know what PK is stay here longer and you will P.S. we love the new work that has been done

We were only there 3 days but made the most of it. Staff was wonderful. Loved the nightly entertainment out by the pool. At check in we were given drink vouchers (no choice offered had to get the one punch with or without alcohol) Did not appreciate the $24 per room recreation fee although parking was included .The concierge was able to get us reservations to Duke's at the last minute.

I was hesitant for our stay here because of some of the so-so reviews but we were not disappointed! We just returned from our stay there from 2/26-3/6. The courtyard near the pool was lovely! Very nicely decorated and the nightly entertainment always gave us something to look forward to. We never did eat the buffet or swim in the pool. The buffet was greatly overpriced but smelled fantastic! The pool we never really have done in Hawaii anyhow. We stayed on the sixth floor overlooking the pool and were lucky enough to have a partial ocean view and could see the entertainment on the stage from our lanai, another bonus. We were very please with our comfortable king sized bed. Very comfortable!! Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning, supplying new towels and making our bed each day. We had one panic moment where we realized I took my ring off and left on the bathroom counter to apply some lotion. We were already a few miles away so we called the hotel and security quickly secured our room and let us back in when we returned. That was a comfort! Our safe also malfunctioned on our last morning there and maintenance came quickly to fix it. Parking is a major bonus and worth the resort fee, as we had a rental car. This is the best location right across from Waikiki and best place we have stayed in since being in Hawaii. We will recommend to others and will return. As a side note, my grandparents came to Hawaii 19 times and stayed at this hotel each time so I am pleased to carry on the tradition!! Thank you, Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for the great stay!!

Pool, amenities and restaurants are all very good. Restaurant had a good variety of food all prepared well. The room and the tower could use a little updating they were a little worn. Staff was very good and parking was convenient,

Stayed here for 4 nights on business. Hotel is seriously outdated with small rooms and overpriced breakfasts. Had a room on the west side facing a construction area that started at 5am. Very noisy. Room was clean, but somewhat musty smelling. I would not stay here again as even the bar service was slow and food was so-so. The only plus is its location to Waikiki beach about a block away. Other that that you may do better elsewhere. For what they charge per night you'd think things would be in better condition.

I was hopeful when we entered the lobby. Room in tower had a nice view from balcony but was very noisy. Room was clean, bed comfortable, but room outdated. Bathroom was very outdated. The tub drain was very rusty and if I would have had a child needing a bath I would not put them in that tub. The bathroom was a bad version of early 1980. Location was good.

Sort of grimy feel to the place- old, outdated carpets, very small room/bathroom. Nice tub/shower.Pool closes at 6pm, so much for that idea of a dip in the pool after my 530PM check in. Who closes a hotel at 6pm???Couldn't find controls for airconditioner in the room.Long black hair was everywhere: on bed cover, on pillow, between towels. Only 2 positions for the shower head: ridiculously high, or oddly low; doesn't adjust. Water pressure was decent.Room has fridge, coffee maker and large safe.I hear they will be closing down in the near future for upgrades. This is serisouly needed.

I am not one to post bad reviews but, I must say, this is one hotel that I would not return to. As our plane was leaving mid afternoon I requested a late check out (at our expense) and was told they did not allow that but that they provided a hospitality room for our convenience. Upon checking out we discovered you are only allowed to use the hospitality room one hour. Hotel room was TINY. The bathroom had about as much space as an airplane bathroom. Not room for two you to turn around without closing the door. The fixtures in the bathroom were so old that the finish was worn away with brass showing through. Very noisy street noises until late at night. Main restaurant WAY overpriced. Nicer places to stay within same area.The linens were nice and the bed comfortable. Great view if you request ocean front. Convenient to Waikiki beach. The bellmen and concierge services were very convenient.

This hotel was outdated but clean and a convenient location. It is right across from Waikii beach and convenient to some great restaurants. I would come here again. We were on the city side and it was not noisy.

We were upgraded to a nicer room and greeted with towel heart swans, cookies, and a handwritten card by the housekeeping staff. Later we were surprised with a bottle of champagne. Their resort fee is reasonable and includes perks that are worth more than the price. ..parking in Waikiki to midnight of the day you check out, two tasty cocktails, photo session, etc.

Had to be on Oahu for a doctors appointment. I must say being that i am an employee of the Sheraton brand, i still judge each and every hotel with an unbiased opinion. We checked in at around 11pm and their was a gentlemen who checked us in in a timely manner. He even upgraded our room to a ocean view. Was a great first impression. All though their were no elevators in thw parking garage it was ok because we found great parking spots every night. Got to.our room and was something I already expected in the sheraton brand. The room was vety clean. Alittle outdated but very nice non thw less.. bathroom was ok all though i would have liked it a little bigger.. the beda were comfy. The view was great. The highlight od my stay was the Room Attendants. I wrote a note to them requesting a few exrta amenaties and boy did they not dissapoing. Even writing mahalo for the tip on the bottom. Such respectful and wonderful treatment. The rooms were cleaned early and it was great. Thank.you for a quick and speedy check out and i would definitely stay again and recommend to all i know.. mahalo nui loa from Kauai (Sheraton Kauai Resort Employee)

My husband and I are going to Hawaii for a 2 week trip in August/September. We are SPG members and have been for a while! We booked this hotel on the starwood hotel webiste. At the time of the booking, Starwood was showing multiple deals on this hotel so we decided to pick this one! it is only a few hours after booking that we received a confirmation from the hotel saying that we were not eligible for the rate we picked and that we would be charged an extra $100 to $200US per night at check-in. This rate was apparently only for employees but the details of the rate were not disclosed at the time of the booking (and i have read all the info!). Good thing i read the reservation confirmation email! When i called, they said this was due to a website issue. Customer service was HORRIBLE! I had to call 4 times for someone to actually call me back. They would not even give us a discount. Same thing happened with 3 other bookings we had made on the starwood website (kauai, maui and big island). I have cancelled all of them! I heard good things about this hotel, however i would not take any chances and would book somewhere else! Definitely not worth the risk.

We needed a home base for the three days we were on Oahu and since this was our first trip, we decided on Waikiki. The location was absolutely ideal. My wife was seconds away from shopping and I was just a few more seconds away from being on the beach. The room was nothing spectacular, but was clean, reasonably well maintained and had a comfortable bed. Our balcony faced west and we had an oblique view of the Pacific. The lobby/pool/bar area was very nice, although we didn't spend as much time relaxing there as we would have liked.We stayed using airline miles, so I can't really speak to the value for what we got, but all in all, we'd definitely stay here again, were we to choose Waikiki.

We stayed for my husband's work, and it was well worth the stay. The service was excellent, the location was perfect. Really, no complaints. I believe the new International Marketplace is being constructed below where we were staying and that work started at 5 each morning - but really, how can I complain? We were in bed while others were hard at work at 5.

All hotels on the beach are very expensive. This one is good value and conveniently located across the road from the Moana Surfrider. Beach chairs are provided by the hotel and easy to carry a short walk to the beach. Courtyard dining is excellent. A room on a higher floor, facing Diamond Head gives excellent views. Convenient access to pulbic transportation with buses and trollys stopping in front of the hotel. Noise from traffic can get loud which can is expected when staying in the city, but can't beat the location for easy access to restaurants, shopping and beautiful beach. Nightly free Hawaiian entertainment in the lobby and dining area a bonus!

My husband and I stayed here in February for a business trip. The positives: The staff is very courteous and friendly and the location is very convenient to the beach, dining shopping. The negatives: hotel is in desperate need of a make over. The rooms are tired looking, the bed is extremely uncomfortable and at least in our case the toilet would clog after each use, we had the plumber come up a couple of times. We started just using it sparingly and using the lobby bathroom, which isn't convenient. With all of the selection of hotels in Waikiki, you can do better elsewhere. If Sheraton ever remodels, then this hotel could be worth a second look.

The hotel rooms are dated but mine was clean. The housekeeping staff was fairly attentive however there was an empty water bottle left by the elevator for four out of the five nights I stayed there. The lobby was nice. I had a horrid waiter at the non buffet restaurant. He completely ignored us and I ended up having to go to the bar to order. When I got to the bar both bar tenders had their backs to the customers and were watching TV. This is really more of a critique of that restaurant than the hotel however. There is a pool although the grounds aren't much of a resort. I don't come to Hawaii to sit at my hotel pool so this didn't bother me. The towel/beach chair staff was very friendly.My husband is gold level or whatever with SPG so we got a free continental breakfast every morning. The coffee was truly terrible but the rest of the food was fine.The price was reasonable, I loved that the hotel was on the north side of Kalakaua and not part of some massive three hotel/shopping complex. Coming in and out of the parking lot was simple for this reason.My biggest complaint was the noise from the industrial air conditioner. We had a great balcony with a bit of a view but the AC was so so loud we really had to keep the glass door closed because of this. Huge bummer since the outside is the biggest draw to Hawaii.

Awful dirty rooms .Massive construction site next door. Overflowing toilet !! Rude unco-operative reception. Unspecified or justified extra charges. Just plain nasty in every respect. If you`re not Japanese then don`t bother staying [ and no , I`m not racist either ]

We had reservation for 3 room, nice that hotel can arrange all connected room for us. Nice view overlooking the Westin Hotel. Staff are very helpful especially the tour desk. Though the pool is a bit small.

The rooms are a little dated but they are clean and the bed is extremely comfortable. The location is first class with Waikiki beach, restaurants and buses all just a short walk from the hotel.Overall given that you don't spend a heap of time in the room it was really good value.TIP: Try to book a room on the pool side of the main tower as they have just commenced building works on the other side and it was quite noisy from very early in the morning. I would book again.

This was 6th year in row staying here, love the location, always stay around 14th or 15th floor facing water and diamond head. Lots to see, from that point. Staff always friendly and they have just upgraded the lobby which looks great. This hotel is very central to everything you need

The location is primo! Directly across from the Westin Moana.... Be very careful what you book! The lowest category parking lot view rooms are horrendous! and I mean, you may as well be in Des Moines... nothing Hawaiian about them! No balcony, ancient A/C. the rooms over looking pool are decent, balcony and nice view! Beds are nice sheraton sweet sleeper... just do not book lowest rate expecting a view, or a balcony! the website of hotel does have a very good map showing location of all categories...

This place was paradise! Everything from the hotel to the location was spot on. 5 minutes from the beach and right next to the high street which has all the stores you can think of including the 15 ABC stores we came across!. Hotel was standard however the hotel management did give us a nice bottle of champagne on arrival which was nice, the tourist office inside the hotel was brilliant. If you are looking for a hotel which offers the basics and you are not looking for something to fancy then this hotel is the one to choose. The only negative this was that they didn't offer us any chance of upgrading our room because it was booked through a 3rd party which was a bit weird, also the buffet was quite expensive and recommend people to eat out. After spending $90 dollars we decided to have breakfast and dinner elsewhere. Overall one of the best States Iv visited!

After being in las vegas this was the biggest let down i've ever experienced at a hotel. After waiting a very long time to get served at reception we were finally given our rooms. The lobby, while decent looking, was packed with people. The elevator took forever and we had to wait 10 ninutes to go up to our room. This is where things took a turn for the worse. Despite us requesting multiple times and being assured (at the front desk just minutes before) our rooms were not interconnecting. This is a problem because we have 2 rooms and having them separate is a huge hassle. When we rang reception they were extremely unhelpful and suggested instead we get given free shampoo as a compensation. I thought this was a very rude comment because we had mentioned one of the problems with not having interconnecting rooms is sharing toileteries like shampoo. They made no effort to help us or arrange a room swap. Another room in our party is also on a completely separate floor, to which the responded "but they are still in the same building". I find this to be extremely rude, we book as a party and we are not even on the same floor? What a joke. The rooms are old, dirty, the balcony doors dont lock, we cannot access our wardrobe due to a desk, the safes look decades old and the rooms are TINY. We can barely open our suitcases anywhere. The balcony railings look ready to rust and break off if you touch them. Our "ocean view" consists of you leaning our the railing and looking far out to the right. The pool is tiny and has barely enough chairs for everyone and it closes at 6pm for some unknown reason. We waited for ages at the bar and were ignored and then had to wait at our table for ages for the waitress. Overall it is a huge disappointment. We were looking forward to a relaxing end of our holiday and instead are stuck with unhelpful staff and crappy rooms. I would not recommend this to anyone and the worst part is we still have many days left.

This hotel is ideally located and for a medium priced hotel has very good amenities. Some of the foyer has recently been done up and is open and fresh to walk into with lots of comfortable seats to sit in. Internet is free, free bottled water in your room every day, free cocktail per person on arrival and some other free activities to choose from. Rooms clean but a little tired, beds and pillows very comfortable with nice clean crisp linen. Our bath tap dripped and obviously had been for some time as there was a stain in the bath where it had been dripping. The little clothes line over the bath didn't work but otherwise the bathroom was clean and had lots of room around the hand basin to put at least 2 peoples toiletries. Lots of clean towels, flannels and hand towels. The ladies who clean the rooms on our floor were always very helpful and friendly. Rooms are quiet with not much noise penetrating from rooms either side or the corridor. Could hear the nightly floor show in our room but it finishes at a reasonable time.Medium sized pool with plenty of free loungers to sit/lie on. The pool is a little public as it is right in the main entrance and not exactly peaceful, placed between the main entrance, walkway to the main street and the outdoor restaurant.The hotel is just across the road from the main Waikiki beach and supplies free seats and beach towels for you to use at the beach. If you have small children there is an area of beach that has a breakwater to stop the waves close by within easy walking distance. Also water and fruit is available a couple of times a day around the pool and at the beach. Shopping is right on your doorstep, ROSS is only a block away, MACY'S half a block and if it is labels you are after their stores are all around also a great APPLE store just down the street. Cheesecake factory is half a block away. Trams to get to the mall are just across the road. Location, location this hotel certainly has it.The front of house staff where absolutely fantastic and helpful from when we first arrived to when I got sick and had to extend my stay. The front desk manager made sure we were as comfortable as possible and blocked out the same room for us for our stay and charged us the same rate as our original booking. All this made a huge difference, when you are unwell and away from home there is nothing more important than getting support from hotel staff.I have stayed at this hotel before and will do again for the service, price and location it is great value.

We just got back from our wonderful 1 week vacation in honolulu (feb 2-9) and stayed at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. Let me start off by saying there staff are wonderful!! Her name is Ween?and she works at the front desk. RIght when we arrived ween greeted us and welcome us to the hotel. Let me say that this is my 7th stay here at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.Ween made us feel really comfortable and helped us with our check in process. She was very friendly and help us also add in our points as an spg member! The check in process was fast and easy. SInce it was our wedding anniversary Ween made sure we had a nice view in our room and got us one of the nicer looking rooms. My husband and I travel to honolulu twice a year for a week and Sheraton is our top of the list. They are right in the middle of waikiki and walking distance to most of the places.There resort fee of $26 also include parking! Our next visit will be at the end of this year and we will def book this hotel again! Thank you Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for making every trip a memorable one!

overall very awesome. pool bar staff slow, but otherwise excellent. location close to the beach made everything that is Hawaii accessible. personally loved the decor of the hotel. my room was overlooking the ocean and that was the best thing to wake up to in the morning.

This was our 7th time in Waikiki but the first time we've stayed at the Princess Kaiulani. We weren't sure about it at first as not all the reviews were positive. However we found the hotel staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, the lobby very modern and it's in such a great location. Our room could use some updating but it was clean, bright and good value. We loved sitting on our lanai at night listening to the live music below. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

We came a long way from the East coast. So worth it!! My 2nd time at this Hotel (work), my wife's first. I planned this Hotel for 2 nights before heading to Kaui (2n) and then Maui (4n). Planned for my wife's Bday and Valentine's Day. We are a young married couple (low 30's, married 2 years). What that means- we are fun. :)Check in: We were welcomed by JUSTIN at check in (8pm). Young, good looking, and Extremely nice and helpful!!! A+++ for Justin. And I knew a lot about the area- but I wanted to double check my plans w the conceigere....and WOW- was Terry a bottle of positivity or what!!!! So so so nice and helpful!!! A++++, she gave us additional plans that were spot on!!!! Hotel fee: read the reviews. Stop complaining people!! Every hotel charges them. And guess what- I drove around the block for 30mins attempting to avoid the garage fee of $25- only to find out the parking for your stay is INCLUDED in your hotel fee. HAHAH- what a deal!!! Hotel fee also included a free 4x6 pic, drink voucher, Wi- FI, and a few other things. Rooms: I have read so many reviews before coming here that I just could not believe some people on here. First off, we must have spent 7 hours each day in our rooms- to only sleep. I have stayed in 100's of hotel rooms for work and OKAY this isn't my favorite room, but it still had EXACTLY what we needed. And the balcony made the room a complete success. A+ room. To do: Eat: Duke's. Great atmosphere on the water. Good crowd. Enter through a hotel. ABSOLUTE BEST food your money- RAINBOWS!! Get the loco moto. We went there a second time for lunch and I ordered the mixed plate. $7.75 and $8.00 respectively. Opposed to my 2 tacos at Dukes for $18.75. - Pearl Harbor is a must! Opens at 7am. Get there earlier and grab your tickets before the allotted tickets for the assigned time slot run out. - Hike Diamond Head! Another must. 0.8 hike. It was not that hard- anyone can do it. Wear sneakers!- bc I see so many people wear sandals. Ugh. :). $1/person fee. Or $5/car. And at the bottom get the shaved ice for $3.25. -Go to the North Shore. Along the different beaches We explored Waimea Bay (beach there). We also went over to the Waimea Park and went to the waterfall for a $16 fee. Bring a waterproof disposable camera for the waterfall. - along the drive was THE Dole main station. We stopped for a few minutes. (Overpriced pineapple IMO). - we ate at Jameson's (before Waimea). That's all...I really hope that helps!

Located just a walking distance from Waikiki beach and boulevard it was an excellent choice. The rooms were really good we had a room with limited view to the beach but we could see the pool and even listen every afternoon the live Hawaiian music that the hotel set in front of the pool area which was very nice and relaxing to hear. Recommended 100% you won't regret it. Try the coffee shop in the pathway from the pool to the boulevard I don't remember the name but the coffee there is marvellous.

We spent two nights at this hotel after flying in from Australia and before heading out to the other islands. We loved it, and would definitely stay there again. The location was great, being close to the beach, trolley and bus stops, farmers' market and restaurants. Facilities and services included a pool, two restaurants, live music and traditional dance displays, and a high quality souvenirs sales area. The whole place was light and clean with an air of luxury.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a total of 6 nights pre and post a trip to the Big Island. We have stayed at this hotel many times before and the reason we return is it's great location, it's pricing and the amazing staff. There are so many other hotels to choose from but we don't consider anywhere else as we feel it's pricing for it's location is very reasonable. Updated pool furniture and lobby area is very pleasant.

This was our third time at this hotel. I said last time I would never stay there again. After looking at other hotels, the location of this one and the resort fee covered parking as well made it worth it. We booked an upgraded room with kayak.com, that included breakfast. The room was ok, overlooking the pool, the bed was really comfortable and the linens nice. The halls were dark and musty. The place needs a makeover, but the location is great. The breakfast was one of the best we have ever had!! The omelettes were amazing!! It was your usual buffet breakfast, eggs, fruit, toast, juice etc. The usual price of the buffet was $24.50 a person, which is ridiculous. Who pays $50.00 for breakfast for 2?? Glad we had it included with our upgrade. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient. The excursions desk was very helpful. We did The North Shore surf bus at their recommendation. I'd stay there again, because of the location, the hallways and rooms need an upgrade, but the location can't be beat.

I arrived 11:00 pm and thay had the best room 29th fl looking over to Waikiki beach very quick check in thay had every thing ready got to room perfect everything whent down stairs crossed the street to abc stores there are 3 at the entrance to hotel got my favorite champhan verve clicquoit brut and Moët & Chandon and very fair price ice cold great start to trip the food at the hotel was very good great buffet in the mornings and in the evening ant the entertainment was first class hawaiian live music really good like record deal good drinks the best well as you can tell I had a great visit and plan to go back next year .

Great place to stay! The hotel in itself is a little old but very well maintained and the view was amazing. As Starwood guests we had a continental breakfast included and we were extremely grateful for the use of the hospitality room after arriving at 7am. Would definitely recommend, location is perfect.

This hotel had everything that I needed in a hotel for my last trip to Waikiki. The location was perfect, the rooms were clean, the view was amazing and the staff was very friendly. Buffet was overpriced but I have s limited diet so it wasn't the smartest option for me anyway. Splash Bar has wonderful Poke and good drinks.

The hotel was clean and nice. The walls were thin, so a crying baby woke us up multiple times each night. The pool was freezing cold and we were told that it is always that way. There is a bar near the pool, but no waiter/waitress around the pool, so if you want a drink, you have to go and get it. I noticed another reviewer commented that the bathtub would not drain. Our tub drain got slower and slower each day, but there was nothing blocking it that I could reach.

The hotel was okay, being close to the ocean, but there was a problem as some rooms were facing a construction site. The decorations were okay and they even had a gingerbread village. The staff were very friendly, and we had no problem with them. The only problem was that the drain in the bathtub wouldn't work. The wifi is free but you can choose for a better one. Another good thing was there was free printing and all the tour stops were close by. The pool is a bit old and very little people were swimming in it.

This was my third time staying at the Princess Kaiulani. Our arrival was late in the evening and we were initially put in a room which was very near the parking garage and was noisy small and very minimal in terms of accomodation.. The next morning I asked to have them review my booking which was for a pool view and the very professional and helpful person at the front desk moved us with alacrity. We made a couple of other requests csuch as a bed board for me as the beds (although very comfortable) was too soft for my back. This was provided and installed immediately. We asked for robes which were also brought immediately. Housekeepling, Pool attendants, bar staff were all lovely, accomodating and helpful. The bathrooms as many have pointed out are dated but they work fine and the location and excellent service for us certainly made up for it. We appreciated the opportunuty for a slightly later check out as well.

My wife was in Hawaii in January of 2012, so I decided to join her since it had been awhile since both of us had been there together and never to Honolulu. After and extensive search I decided stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. After all the Sheraton name is synonymous with quality. Well, it was. While the staff was very pleasant and the pool and restaurant were excellent, the overall condition of the hotel was outdated. drab and not worthy of the Sheraton name. The carpet on my floor had not been changed in ages, the furniture looked like it was second and from our balcony we could see part of the facade crumbling. We took a walk and ended up the Sheraton Waikiki which by comparison was light years better. I wrote a letter to the corporate offices and they "awarded" me 2500 SPG points and stated that they would not provide any additional compensation. I was offended that they thought that my reason for writing them was to garner points which was not even remotely true. Like those who are in charge of the supposed renovations, they just didn't get it. Which is sad because the staff and such deserve better.

Stayed here in Sept 2013 before our 5 island cruise, ideally located near the beach and shopping. Great meals on the terrace by the pool, very friendly staff and really enjoyed our stay. (had to select 2014)

the hotel was very friendly, the staff were always at hand and willing to help at any time , the food was second to none and the price of breakfast and dinner very good , the rooms were cleaned every day and drinks where always topped up there was a safe in your room which kept my mind at rest with the valuables and money we had with us.

This Sheraton hotel is ideally located around the high end of Waikiki. It has a small outdoor pool, but quite frankly, when Waikiki beach is only across the road, why would you need a pool! Nice food and breakfast. Great views from the balconies on higher floor. The front of house and reception team with kind, helpful and efficient.

I have stayed at this hotel at least 8 (8) times in 2014 and I found each visit better than the previous. The hotel is located in an excellent location in Waikiki, it is clean and the staff is exceptional. The restaurant is amazing and their chefs are second to none. Their recent holiday ginger bread exhibit of diferant city scapes was exceptional. The detail in their work was among the best I've seen in my over 30 years of business and pleasure travel - staying at hotels throughout the world - hats off to the entire team! In closing, it is evident that the managmemt team works extremely well with their team of employee's. It shows throughtout the entire hotel in every department - from the moment you are greeted to the moment you leave. This hotel has the true Aloha spirit - thank you, and I look forward to my future stays in 2015!

The Princess K was a nice place to stay. Centrally located in Waikiki it is walking distance to Diamond Head as well as the Zoo and all the high end Waikiki shops. The staff was courteous, the room was clean. There was live nightly entertainment and the buffer was decent. There were more luxurious places in the area but for the price this was a good choice.

Well I booked this hotel as we were let down on travel plans at the end of December whilst in Hawaii. I will be honest and say that I had read the reviews and wasn't holding out much hope. I will say that I was really pleasantly surprised by this hotel, from the very start I found the staff to be excellent in handling our check in - we were 3 hours early and our room was not ready but they took all our luggage gave us complimentary drinks vouchers and made us comfortable by the pool. I will address the reviews of the rooms: yes they are slightly dated and yes they could do with a bit of an overhaul but what I will also say is this : you are in Hawaii - why would you want to spend much time in your room other than sleeping/showering? there is so much to do and right on your doorstep from this hotel!! Location wise it was fantastic - literally right in the heart of waikiki, a 2 min walk to the beautiful beaches, shopping galore and food courts a 5 min walk away.Also it is worth noting that for the $26 a day resort fee (quite low by my findings) you get : Free WIFI - cost me $10 a day at the Hilton AND free parking - again $25 a day at the Hilton.Would I stay here again - absolutely!! I really enjoyed the 3 nights we had there, staff were excellent, location fabulous.8/10

The Princess Kaiulani is well situated. A short walk of less than 5 mins to the beach, shops and other points of interest such as post office. It is quiet and the food very good. The lobby business area is convenient, pleasant and a good place to meet someone.

We love the location ! The hotel is located near the Waikiki beach (across the road) and shopping malls, restaurants and other facilities. The buffet served at the café near the pool-side was reasonably priced, you could have seafood and steak and live music for $40/pax. The room we had was at the first block which was the Oldest building, hence the room was quite old (air-con was very noisy). You need to pay more for newer rooms.The only one negative thing - the hotel imposed a $26 fee/day (you get beach towels, beach chair, water and fruits everyday at Waikiki beach twice a day) - even if you don't need it.

SPG hotels are my favorite when I travel. This is the worst SPG hotel I experienced.First, I do not know that resort fee for two bottles of water, free internet, free parking and two punch worth $25 per day when you have no car? Especially as gold member entitles free internet and free water with all SPG hotels anyway. This is a big rip off..Second, any thing in this hotel is so dated and aged. It is worst than any Four Point hotel I stayed. Four Point is SPG lowest group.Third, I just stayed in Le Meridien, Papeete, a week ago. That is cheaper than this Sheraton including room, breakfast, restaurants and bar. Le Meridien has resort amenities without resort fee. Since I am gold member, free internet,free welcome drink and free water.SPG should reconsider charging resort fee for its loyal customers. Otherwise, I suggested all members consider not to stay this hotel or any SPG hotels that charge resort fee, especially this Sheraton that has no resort amenities

We've been staying at the Princess for many years now and it just seems to get better, not worse, as some of the reviews suggest. The location is the best, right in the centre of Waikiki and you can pick up beach chairs from the pool and just cart them across the street to the beach. The rooms are clean and pleasant, I guess the only dated aspect is the bathrooms which could certainly do with a renovation but they still do the trick so I guess it depends on how fussy you are. The staff are pleasant and one phone call from the room and whatever you need is there quick smart. Chambermaids do an excellent job and it's always nice to return to a spotless room in the afternoon. Wi-Fi is a bit up & down so don't depend on it for downloads. Everything else is pure heaven...

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a nice hotel. We went for a business trip/vacation during the Christmas holidays This is an older property but, location to all the activities of Waikiki are right around the corner. You go to utilize all the activities of your vacation and should only need to sleep and shower at the hotel. The beach is right across the street thru the Moana Surfrider lobby. You can get beach chairs, towels and water in your room with your resort fee and enjoy the beach of Waikiki. Restaurants are all around the area... use the Menus magazine found at the Concierge desk to find reviews. Cheaper breakfast can be found in the area if you don't wish to pay $25 for a buffet. We walked a few blocks and found eggs, bacon and pancakes for $4.95 ea. You can catch the Pink line trolley for $2 ea. and ride all around Waikiki and back for a very cheap sightseeing tour (takes about an hour). As mentioned in other reviews the property is older but, very accommodating. A microwave and small refrigerator in every room and an ABC store on every corner to stock it with soft drinks and beer. If you check out, you can leave your bags with the Bell Stand and have another full day in Hawaii before you catch a late flight home. The hotel even has a hospitality room for use for 1 hour...that is first come first serve to let you freshen up (shower) before you catch your shuttle or taxi back to the airport for the long flights back to the Mainland. Never ate in the hotel but, there were always people in the restaurant at all times of the day and especially at night. Every night there was a show of some sort with music and dancing (if your room overlooks the pool you can here it all from the balcony) and later another show in the bar area. Great local talent! Overall this is not a 5 Star hotel but like I said if you just want a place in the middle of everything and just use it to sleep and shower then the SPK is the place to do this at. Would go back next time in Hawaii.

This is not a luxury hotel but it is perfectly adequate. The rooms are clean but the furniture is aging. Our housekeeper was Zenaida and she was extremely efficient, friendly and professional. The beds are so very comfortable. Although there is a resort fee, you do get the use of beach chairs, towels, water,and fruit on the beach which is just across the street from the hotel. The location is perfect. It is across the street from Kings Square and is walking distance from numerous restaurants. The Bus to the Ala Moana mall is one block away on Kuhio street..

Upon check-in they told me that all they had available was a handicapped room (even though neither my son nor I are handicapped). This meant that I received a room with a shower made for a handicapped person. This shower was a complete mess. Water came right out of the shower and went all over the bathroom floor. This made the floor very slippery to walk on. Also, I clean vacation rentals for a living. I try not to be picky when I go on vacation to a hotel. However, there was some very obvious problems with the cleanliness of my room. Upon checking in my room there were about 10 pieces of very long hair throughout the bathroom (in the shower, on the sink, around the toilet, etc). I was grossed out to see this. I went down to the lobby and made a complaint about it. They told me that when the maid came to clean my room the next day, that they would make note of the issue and have her take care of it. That is not really an acceptable response because as a cleaner, if I had made that error - my company would call me back immediately to come clean up the hair. I waited til the next day and sure enough after my room had supposedly been cleaned - the same hairs were all in the same locations! I told them again at checkout and all they did was apologize. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times because I like its location. This was absolutely the worst experience. They are also doing construction down below to the area that used to be a marketplace. My view was of ripped up ground and construction equipment. The lobby renovations look amazing too bad everything good ends there! Definitely not a hawaiian paradise!

Hotel not bad not good, It's is in the middle.But I bought 8 nights with breakfast for 2, when I checked in they gave me tickets for the breakfast and I didn't check the number of the tickets at the time of the check in. When I have two days to left the hotel I noticed that I do not have tickets for the last day so I went to the front desk to claim for my last day breakfast and they said that they can't give me tickets. I'm sure that my only fault was not checked the tickets when I received and I don't need to be dishonest about US$ 50.00 in a travel that cost more than US$ 5,000.00. Sheraton now is in the bottom of my list.

My wife and I spent 11 days at this hotel and really had no complaints about our stay. The staff is friendly and most helpful, the pool is nice and offers nightly entertainment. The lobby area is gorgeous however the hallways and rooms are showing signs of age; worn wall and floor coverings need replacing. Also, a new paint job is sorely needed. The baloneys next to our room had pieces of concrete missing as well as rusting hand rails (these were faux baloneys not associated with any rooms but they sure looked bad). This hotel also charges a daily rate if you want to upgrade to a room with a balcony (in my 10 years of traveling here that is a first). There is a resort fee which among other things entitles you to towels and beach chairs, the hotel staff also comes by the beach and offers its guests fresh fruit and water about twice a day. The hotel is located directly across the street from the beach and is surrounded by shops and restaurants.

Stayed here for one night on our way from Toronto to Kona. Very nice lobby, but once you get past that, it's a quick downhill. The rooms have not been updated since the 1960's, and the walls are dirty, peeling and chipped. The shower has so little pressure that you have to run around to get wet. The shower head is dirty, corroded, and is just nasty. Went to have breakfast in the morning with my Starwood Platinum courtesy cards, and was turned away by the woman working the entrance, as she told me I also needed to pay $25 each for my kids...they weren't included. Great way for a Starwood property to treat a Platinum member. If you are considering a stay in Honolulu, I suggest you check out any other place available. Ugh.

I don't know what official "Star rating" this hotel is but on my experience it would barley be a 3 star. The place is old and tired. Check in and entry are very nice and staff friendly but it's all down hill from there. Lifts are old and slow with HUGE wait times in busy periods, the room was very small an while well appointed it was again tired. The bed was very comfortable and the pillow selection very good but fittings were old and the bathroom was literally as big as a cupboard. Tap fittings were old, the basin had a crack through it and the wall paper (yes wallpaper) was peeling. The pool area had again seen better days. This is was our second visit to Waikiki and we again found the value for money in relation to hotel quality appalling. The price for this hotel compared to 5 star places in Australia, or even Las Vegas leaves a lot to be desired. If you want luxury this aint it. If you want a dated, old hotel to sleeping in that's close to everything (including the HUGE construction site next door) for more money that you pay for 5 star anywhere else then this is for you.

Stayed here for a quick trip. Registration desk was very friendly, lobby was clean, and welcoming aura. Rooms a bit dated but you get what you pay for. Lots of options for breakfast from continental, hot foods and traditional Hawaiian-Asian. Good service overall. Pool is a bit sad but so what, just walk across the street and head for the ocean.Location is fantastic right off the strip, shopping, restaurants and other hotels, and beach access. Also they provide free bottled water as an amenity which is good since they're about $4 a bottle at the markets nearby and I like to stay hydrated.Would definitely stay here again. If you want to splurge a little bit go to the Westin across the street, the Sheraton Waikiki or the Royal Hawaiian. They're all a short distance from each other.

This hotel is adequate. Just don't go there expecting luxury. It is very dated. However, the actual rooms are not too bad in the beds are quite comfortable.very nice location and very nice staff. It's kind of funny, when you're in the lobby it all looks nice. But as soon as you get off the elevator, not so nice! But, perfectly adequate.

On checking in to this hotel we were told about the resort charge of 25 dollars per day this was non negotiable . Our room was on the 27th floor and we could still her the building site next door at 7am every morning when they started work . The room was clean and tidy but a bit tired as was the rest of the hotel .Breakfast was buffet style and not worth the 27 dollars they were charging.The rest of the resort was fantastic if a little bit expensive .

First--I want to rave about your associate Ping. She is so kind & gracious & very efficient.She is a gem!! The lobby & grounds are so gorgeous! Also, let's talk about location- location, you can walk anywhere & everywhere!!

Im not usually one to write a reveiw, however Ive relied on Tripadvisor previously to plan trips and activies (including this one) its only fair I contribute.To put it simply i wont be staying at this hotel again. My wife and I stayed here previously and this was our second time staying here (20 nights in total). The decor is still extremely old (we were told it had been renovated however this only applied to reception apparently). We paid for a high ocean veiw room, but we were put in a low floor and wasnt till I complained that we moved to a higher level. Unfortunately the sound of rusty balconys being scraped and painted first thing in the morning was something to get used to (the rust is so bad they must be doing this continually, in desperate need of replacing).However the biggest problem was the level of service in the pool and bar area. As I tried to purchased two drinks at the pool area bar for myself and my wife, he said he wouldnt sell them to me unless he can identify who my wife is (who was by the pool putting suncreen on my 2 kids aged 5 and 8). Ive never had this accusation (of buying drinks for minors) thrown at me before and i felt extremely embarrassed in front of other guests.Getting any table service in the pool/bar area is almost impossible. You only have to walk over the road to the Moana Surfrider bar to find out what service is meant to be like. Its not costly to attend tables and take food orders (you might even make a profit doing so) . Everyday the staff stood planted at the bar walking around only every 30 minutes or so.I wont even start on the rude moustached pool towel bloke, ill be here forever. Ive spent alot of time in Hawaii now and there are definitely better options all the way along Waikiki. Look at other alternatives.

My husband stayed at the Princess Kaiulani from Oct. 17-22, 2014. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff was very friendly. We were there as Hurricane Ana skirted past the islands. We had a beautiful room on the 21st floor with a partial ocean view. Our room had spectacular views of the ocean, the city and the mountains. We will definitely be staying there again.

I have been staying at the PK now since I was a teenager but my recent trip confirmed why we do. Helpful staff and great location, it worked for the family and I would stay again. Nothing was a problem for the staff.

The reception area is an illusion. Prior to arrival I had checked the photos and videos of the Sheraton Princess which looked fabulous. What a 'con'. All of these were dishonest advertising. On arrival at my room I noticed the ceiling beside a manhole was falling in. Pieces of plaster were lying on the dirty carpet. On entering the room I was hit by an overwhelming smell that took my breath away requiring me to medicate with ventolin. I could smell stale tobacco smoke and some sort of dead smell. The A/C was not working properly and was not cooling me or the room. This room was not clean and I would not remove my footwear. I requested another room. This room did not smell but the the room temparature never cooled off. The A/C was totally inadequate. WIFI connection kept dropping out and was totally unsatisfactory. The staff were excellent and I feel very sorry for them to have to go to work every day and pretend that everything is OK when it is clearly not. In 1930 the Hotel would have been beautiful but in 2014 it should be bulldozed. Hotel is overpriced and they should be charged with false advertising. They should have paid me to stay there. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. MY EXPERIENCE WAS TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING. I WILL NEVER GO BACK.The Hotel asked me for a 'review' but I could not do the review as it would not except a review in 'English'. How clever of them to stop me doing a review.

Yet again another great stay!!!! I had the pleasure of being greeted and checked in by Jason! He is just a perfect example that hotel staff made a huge difference in your experience. Jason is an asset to your property! Absolutely perfectThe lobby has been updated and I think the rest of the hotel willbegin the update construction soon.The dinner and breakfast Buffett was very good. I loved the prime rib and crab legs!!! Job well done

great hotel in the center of waikiki! nice gym too! sometimes a little bit loud, but this is normal for waikiki! 2 Minutes to the famous waikiki Beach! i booked this hotel many times and it was always great to stay there!

I really like this hotel and its location the only concern I had was Housekeeping seemed a little bit lazy. They seem to overlook things in the bathroom when they cleaned each day but other than that it's a nice hotel

We really liked the locations of this hotel. It was about a 2 block easy walk to the beach and also close to area shopping and restaurants. The beach area that was close to us was near the Duke statue and we enjoyed the rock barrier in the ocean that was there- it made our ocean experience feel a little less rough and felt safer. The pool area at the hotel was lovely and we enjoyed the live music in the evenings. The free towel and beach chair was a nice touch, too. We stayed in a higher room and our partial ocean-view room was breathtaking. The room was clean, but the hallways had an 'old' smell. We knew the hotel was older, but that was ok with us and we didn't mind.The staff was very nice and helpful. The bar area was nice- we did not eat in the restaurant. We would definitely stay here again.

this was booked as anniversary, on arrival room given was dirty in huge need or pint and complete refresh, complained and was given another option which was just as bad ended up not staying and had to pay huge upgrade to move to mona surfrider which is class hotel, on complaining to sheraton complaints were ignored even though head of house keeping admitted room was poor, sheets were dirty shower had damp and mould over all worst hotel i have ever seem

The International Marketplace is under construction so if you make a reservation here be sure to ask for a room that does not face the construction zone. I am in a room on the 5th floor and my main view is an open pit construction site. If I turn to the left I have a partial ocean view through 2 hotels. There is a card on my desk that states construction goes from 7am - 6pm Mon - Fri, 9am - 6pm on the weekends. Lots of noise even with the sliding door closed. In addition, the 5th floor is right above the parking structure and there are several large generators or AC units that run all night. I requested to be moved but was told there were no other rooms available. I requested ear plugs and engineering dept. sent up 2 pair. The rooms are outdated but clean. Balcony does not have a light so if you sit outside at night you are in the dark. My room has a large fray in the carpet. Not sure why it has not been fixed. Staff is very nice. Great location. Just be careful what room you are assigned. Construction runs through spring 2016.

I had a wonderful balcony view of Waikiki Beach. The room was neat and tidy. Housekeeping was quick and efficient and with minimal interruption to my stay. There were many activities available during the day and a poolside bar and lounging area. The hotel restaurant is buffet style and a bit overpriced. I'd suggest to venture out onto the main drag and grab a meal from one of the numerous other choices.

Traveling alone for the first time is nerve wracking in itself but once i got to the hotel it was perfect.The first room I had was not the best but after I explained the issue to management they were more than accommodating to change my room with no additional fee. The location was perfect to get around town either by walking or taking the bus & was one of the best vacations I've had.Would love to stay there again.

We stayed here last month with my husband and I and our little children. We were on the 28 floor. The rooms were outdated and old, but extremely clean, however there was no air conditioning in the hallways or the lift. As you could imagine we were all a bundle of sweat by the time we reached the lobby. The pool was great and found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. The restaurant on the other hand, do yourself a favor and give it a miss. They are lucky we were a family of 7 and service charge was included in bill, as they would of got nothing from me, as quiet frankly there was no service. We asked for water which after reminding them about 4 times finally arrived when we were ready to leave. The breakfast was disappointing and expensive. I will not be staying here again.

Good location, clean hotel, free wifi in lobby and offered 60mins per day free international calls. All facilities where clean and working. Very close to all attractions. Beach was across the road. Main shopping strip 2 mins walk. Price was reasonable fro ocean view with balcony.We would stay again.

GOOD:- Very central location, only across the road from the beach- Less busy than the other Sheraton (if you're choosing between the two)- Friendly staffNEEDS IMPROVEMENT:- Rooms are dated, wall art needs changing, desperately, let 1988 go already! Flat-screen TVs did help though.- Pool is too small (but when you have Waikiki beach, why would you bother with the pool?)- Less amenities than Sheraton WaikikiCOMMENTS:I did not have high expectations of this hotel, as the rooms look dated on the website. They are dated, but we found them to be clean, and I have to say I enjoyed my stay more than I was expecting. The location is a big drawcard, being only across the road from the main stretch of Waikiki beach, and very short stroll to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre. The pool service lets you take fold up beach chairs along with beach towels, and they have a water and fruit service available to Sheraton guests on Waikiki Beach itself, which is a nice touch. We had no trouble getting a chair (stay in September).On the second part of our trip we stayed at the other Sheraton (Waikiki) and we found Princess Kaiulani to be much less busy, a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Staying 11/2/2014. Room #709.This is the third stay I have with this hotel. Upon walkin . I saw this funny looking BUG. Well. I'm not afraid of the bugs . So I took a hard look at it and took a video and pics just in case.. It turned out to be a BEDBUG. To make things matter, the hotel staff acted like it a not a big deal. But it is!!! They should clean this place up.

This hotel is right in the centre of Waikiki and the perfect spot to access shops up and down the street. It is also across the road from the beach, yet you are paying about half the price than the hotels right on the beach. If like us you spend minimal time in your room, it is not worth the extra cost to be right on the beach.As with most hotels in Hawaii it could do with some updating of the rooms but they are clean and a decent size, and the hotel itself is quite large. Buffet breakfast was nice but fairly expensive for Hawaiian standards.We stayed in the hotel tower on level 12 in a room facing back towards Diamond Head, but still had a great view.The Wifi in the hotel was very good, cost included in the daily 'resort fee'Overall good priced hotel in a great location.

Very close to beach, great staff, clean, location to restaurants, good food and the best of all is the views from the high ocean tower. Doesn't get any better than this! Hotel is going to be renovated soon.

Despite the hotel is older and the rooms are outdated on some items (shower old hand held). Carpets in hall were stained and could use a paint job. The bed was very comfortable which made up for some of the lacking. Hotel was very well kept overall. But, like they say location is everything and this hotel was in the perfect location in the middle of everything. The two complaints that I do have is that if you check in late at night there is nothing available for you, bar closes at 11:00 pm and there is no restaurant. The other is construction right next door, and they started work at roughly 4am. Oh, for you smokers, there is NO smoking anywhere on the property you have to go to the street and locate a smoking station.There is a $25.00 plus tax resort fee that you pay daily, but was worth it for you get daily long distance anywhere in the world, also free beach chairs and they bring water and fresh fruit to you while at the beach. I did not eat much at the hotel for every night across the street they had great markets that sold everything, so took advantage and bought fresh fruit trays for $3.00 or 2 for $5.00 and kept in fridge. Supper was also bought there for the sold complete meals for all around $10.00. I did eat at some restaurants but found the markets more worth the money. I could go on, but mainly the question would be "would I stay here again? The answer would be YES"

Stay at this hotel frequently because of the service and location. It is an older hotel that they are renovating, but because they take care of me very well I choose to come back. It is very close to the beach and shopping. Hotel staff is very friendly. I'm a SPG platinum member and always get upgraded if there is a better room available.

This hotel is quite old and is in need of major renovations, staff were helpful and friendly,we were on the 28th floor with ocean view. Hotel location is its best asset.The rooms need a lot of attention wall paper was peeling off ,the dresser table had pieces of card board to keep the table level the draw kept on coming open.The wardrobe sliding door kept on falling off the rollers every time you open the wardrobe.There was some renovations being carried out during our stay and the had the Air con turned off in the Hallways and Lift which made it quite uncomfortable when the lift was full. Breakfast in the restaurant was average, only one four slot toasted so there was a line up to get your toast.

The hotel is an older property but well maintained. The room was comfortable with a nice bed. There is a $25 daily convenience fee that includes basic internet which worked very good. There is a nice restaurant and pool area with bar. If you become a rewards member you can get free breakfast for one day.

As frequent vacationers to Waikiki, we have stayed at numerous hotels in Waikiki. When we consider location and value, we are always drawn to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. This time we stayed in a 27th floor ocean-view king-bedded room. We loved it. Hotel staff was welcoming and helpful. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean and homey. The Wi-Fi was excellent. We especially enjoy the outdoor pool setting on the ground level. Located across the street from nearby Waikiki Beach, the hotel is also in the heart of shopping and restaurants. For us, this hotel is a favorite--and a great value.

The carpet is old, the fixtures are rusty, and if you are on the city side (as opposed to the ocean side), you are looking at a gigantic construction site of another hotel being built, and the construction noise is bothersome.

Loved our stay at Sheraton princess Kaiulani the motel was located in downtown Waikiki very close to shopping beach and restaurants. The staff on arrival were very welcoming and very helpful. the lobby was very spacious and very breezy for those afternoon Mia Tais it also over looked the pool area and great food at the restaurant. Loved shopping at Ross dress for less which was just 2 short blocks away along with all your other great shops and the cheese cake factory was just 1 block away yummo with so many other restaurants at your door step.The room was very spacious and clean even though it was dated but they have started renervating. loved the bed wish i could have taken it home with me very comfortable to sleep on. would recommend this motel to anyone that wants to be close to everything at waikiki .

The Princess is one of the best located hotels in downtown Waikiki. It is a regular stop for us when we travel between North America and Australia. A few nights at the Princess refreshes us for onward travel. The spacious breezy lobby area overlooking the pool is perfect for breakfast or pu-pus and afternoon Mai Tais. We walk to the beach every morning and in about 1-2 minutes we are on the beach. Shopping is right at your doorstep, as are clubs in the evenings.

Great location and our room had a nice view. Friendly staff through out the hotel and restaurant. Our wing of the hotel was dated, carpets were worn,the walls in the room needed to be repainted and the furnished was worn.Bathroom small and shower was adequate. Bed was comfortable.As our flight was leaving later in the day we had the use of a hospitality room to freshen up before departing Hawaii, which was much appreciated.

We are just back from Oahu and, as usual, stayed at the PK. We love the location and the friendliness of the staff. This time, we got our room and the AC wasn't working. We called and they promptly sent someone to check it. It still wasn't great so we went to see if we could switch rooms. Not only did they switch us, but gave us a high floor with a gorgeous view. Just can't say enough about how nice that was. The staff was very friendly and really worked at making us happy. Ping, Alex and the front desk crew: Shanna, Herbie and Debbie at the Splash Bar all made us feel right at home. And, Wing in room service was very friendly. A great hotel that works hard at making your vacation memorable.

Stayed for a week in June 2014 and used a Travelers cc card when checking in. Great Hotel, Great Staff around pool, restaurant, but CLUELESS STAFF AT RECEPTION. Upon Checkout, they maxed out my travelers cc card and forced me to pay for all my room charged items via another CC. Upon checking my statement, found they already charged all room charges and who knows what else (Un-Authorized items) to my card, and to date, have not received a refund. Still battling to get my money back.

OMG! My first trip to Hawaii couldnt have been more perfect than it turned out! My partner D. Judd n I celebrated our 20 yr anniversary in this beautiful place! We stayed here at the beautiful Sheraton PK from 9/24-9/30. We were not disappointed in the least. To start with Tammy, the gal who checked us in was great! When we first booked our reservation, after requesting a king bed thru Bookit, they had us with 2 double beds, Tammy caught that n gave us a room with a king bed in the tower. I would have liked a higher floor, but we got a room on the 5th floor above the pool n we were quite satisfied. After getting settled in, we got on with our trip. We enjoyed the poolside bar. Debbie, our day waitress, was so funny n just spot on keeping us takin care of. She's definitely a keeper! Now, I didnt think this Hotel was that dated, actually I felt it quite modern.
