When we asked him how we could get to the North Shore part of the island he just looked at us dumbfounded and told us to use the freeway. I asked for a map and he finally gave us a really bad photocopy of one. Concierge was neither friendly nor unfriendly – we once talked to a young woman and the 2nd time, a young man. Both were just “ok”. Really made us feel like our questions were not that important, but at least they weren’t rude.- Exterior of the hotel needs a facelift, mostly rooms not facing the street…but facing adjacent properties. You can see the deterioration of balconies/stucco and rusted railings from the outside.- Neighboring properties on both sides are under construction. This really isn’t the fault of the Sheraton PK, it’s just unfortunate. The International Marketplace is closed and won’t open again until 2016. There’s a lot of noise and construction from that side. There is also a neighboring hotel that is completely being redone, and quite a bit of noise from that as well, and an ugly view if you’re on that side. The sad part is, this actually could be a nice property if all this junk wasn’t going on and staff were trained to be consistent on friendliness and helpfulness. We loved the openness of the lobby into the pool area and getting that island breeze through there. I think after renovations are done…it will be a nice place to stay. Rooms are a little tired, however you spend most of your day away from the hotel and exploring the island, so who cares if the carpet is a little old and the bathroom tile is a little outdated. And I think if we had encountered more friendly staff than those who were rude, maybe we’d have a better overall opinion here….but since we don’t, we would not stay here again and would recommend others to do their research and find out what’s going on with the hotel you’re planning to book, or wait until the Sheraton PK is done with all its renovations.

The most dilapitated, smelly, worn out major hotel chain in Waikiki that tacks on a large resort charge which is not quoted in the price at time of reservation.As an SPG Platinum member, I didn't receive any special recognition/amenities for free because the hotel charges me for them in their omnibus "resort fee."Room was dirty (liquid under the TV and all over the dresser, clogged bath drain, no laundry bag in the closet, moldy shower tiles, and dirty carpet). Operator is rude and I stood in the "Platinumn/Gold" line for more than 15 minutes while the front desk person made a reservation for a walk-up customer.Would I stay there again? No way! I actually just cancelled my reservation for later this week.

We recently stayed here on the 2nd part of our holiday after spending a week on the Pride of America, thinking that we were heading to relaxing surroundings with high ocean views. It was very disappointing, our room was only serviced once in our 4 day stay , we had to ask for fresh towels, our room overlooked a construction site and our ocean view was if we peered over the balcony stretching our necks. Our travel had booked us high ocean views with full daily breakfast included. They did not honour the breakfast we had to pay which was extremely expensive and horrible. It really ended our 2 week holiday on a sour note. I would not recommend this place there are far better places to stay less expensive

We would not recommend this hotel. Very poor dining experience. Birds all over your table and into your food. Waiters try to control them by waving napkins at them. Our room was called a city view which turned out to be the parking garage and roof top with a view of only that.We complained to the front desk manager and he said a credit for the service tax (approximately 26.00) would be applied to our bill. Nothing came of it. So if you decide to stay here make sure you know what and where your room is.We asked for a different room and they were "totally booked". It was very strange that the couple next door to us also complained about their view and were offered a different room and a free dinner. I guess they complained better than we didCarm

First of all; Because Hawaii is known for its past royal history; I feel this hotel deserves 5 stars because; of princess Kaiulani herself. I personally feel that this hotel is being overlooked for being renovated from top to bottom. Its a nice hotel that should be like: The Four Seasons Hotel.And I stayed in the hotel in the year of 2012.Hopefully Sheraton sees the need to be considerate of the hawaiian culture; and see the need to be considerate of those who would like to have a great stay at this hotel!!!I travel in 2012 not June 2013

some of the best stuff I've ever encountered in all my travels! The hotel is beautiful and well kept it is a classic with a lot of history in the most perfect location in the heart of Waikiki. Definitely has her own a place in my heart. It is located in the center of Waikiki along the strip with easy access to just about anywhere. There is an awesome farmers market across the street held on weekends a place you must visit

We stayed here for one night as we were scheduled to depart for NY the next afternoon. It was a last minute booking via hotels.com as we hadn't planned on staying in Waikiki before flying back home. Checking in was fine, we were even given an upgrade to a 7th floor room with partial ocean view. In spite of what seemed to be constant, chronic chaos in the front desk/lobby area, the front desk staff were professional and courteous. It appears that renovations are underway, as I saw exposed wiring and freshly painted walls in the check in area and beyond. Our room was respectable, my hubby enjoyed the flat screen TV. The two beds were narrow but clean and adequate for our needs. The carpet could be cleaner, but the bathroom was clean so that was good. Complimentary water was provided in the room, and a mini fridge too, which sat atop a safe in the ample closet. Great fir keeping drinks cold for awhile :).We didn't eat here as the dining area carried a weird smell and the food looked less than inviting. So we ate at the Jimmy Buffets a few minutes walking distance away. Be prepared for a chaotic feel at the hotel entrance- there were always dozens of ppl coming back and forth with several piles of bags and suitcases lying around. A bit disorganized. However, the hotel is well located close to Waikiki Beach and all the high end shops. I would not consider staying here again unless serious renos were completed. Would recommend staying in Ko Olina outside of Waikiki, which is where we spent our first 6 nights at the JW Marriott Ihilani. If Waikiki beach and shopping isn't that big a deal to you, then stay in Ko Olina. Rent a car and do a day trip into Waikiki, which is what we did.

I wrote this review for the sheraton kaiulani site 2 days ago and they have already removed it !! We were given an upgrade to a deluxe ocean view which Ihave to day had we paid for it we would have been at the front desk complaining the room was only slightly bigger than the ocean view rooms, the lanai was smaller than those of the ocean view rooms the view was mainly of the moana hotel with the ocean showing above it and also of the swimming pool but at night the noise from the street was loud and you could hear the group playing by the pool with the lanai doors shut. Speaking of the lanai doors they were heavy to move we asked maintenance on two occassion to oil them and it was done on the second request which helped for most of our stay but not all of it as they were sticking again before we left. Can't comment on the hotel food as we only ate breakfast once as we had a complimentary ticket, the reason we didn't use it was all meals were way too expensive, you can get far more reasonable prices outside. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful the female conceige was useless the male was very good and most helpful. The pool staff were great. Housekeeping well whilst being nice and firendly one day our room didn't get made up at all, the bathroom was not cleaned except for changing out the towels, the bedroom never dusted and the lanai wasn't cleaned at all thoughout our stay. As for the room being deluxe I have visited Oahu many times and stayed in many other hotels of more moderate grade and this did not come up to their standard no pictures on the walls except for one faded small picture of shells in the bathroom!!! Yes renovations are taking place and as I understand it the hotel will now close next year for extensive renovations, hopefully this will improve the so called deluxe rooms however it will probably mean I will not be able to stay as the price will be elevated way out of my price range. Again I must stress that I wrote nearly the same review directly on the Sheraton Kaiulani site at there request and it has been taken off after just 2 days and I notice the site is now filled up with only good reviews!!

I paid extra for high ocean view and I confirmed my spg number before arriving to celebrate my birthday in Honolulu. I got a great room on the 28th floor, but the demolition next door started at 9a-5p. I tried to get another room, but was told my room was an upgrade? I stayed out of the room for three days and my resort fee was waived, but I wanted a room on the other side (like most of photos). I did enjoy the drink coupons and beach chair/towel service as well as photo shoot with fee photo card with "best shot". I rented an umbrella on the beach for the day and a surfboard for $10 an hour.I was not given credit for spg account even thought I confirmed before arriving. I was told later it was because I did not book directly with hotel. I will not return because I booked this hotel because it was part of spg program. I recommend the circle hotel because the restaurant below is awesome and same great location.

I stayed here on May 10. Although the location is great, the rooms are dirty and I got bed bug bites! The Manager that I spoke with was unhelpful and dismissive. The street side rooms are very noisy and the back side rooms are next to construction. Avoid the bed bugs and stay elsewhere.

We have just returned from our holiday on Oahu where we stayed at the Sheraton PK. The hotel is slowly being tidied up - this was happening while we were there but gave us little trouble. We had a pretty good room - sea views. The Moana Surfrider is across the road on the beach side so you have to take into account that there is a lower building in front of yours but hey, when you come from the country, a view of the ocean is something to be marvelled at. The weather was perfect so I am sure that will colour all my reviews but the Sheraton PK is in a great spot for shopping, beaching, and of course all the restaurants that are arms length away. Some people have said that for a Sheraton the PK is disappointing. It's true it's tired and we had a chest of drawers with very dodgy drawers and a fridge that on the first night woke us up. But my husband kicked it and it was fine after that. We were staying at the PK because friends and family were so for all of us it worked brilliantly. The breakfast is great. You can have a full buffet or a continental. I had the continental and it was very very nice. Most mornings though we would get something from the little coffee pod at the front of the gates and have it on the balcony of our room. One of the things I particularly liked about the layout of the hotel is that generally you pass through the pool area and that was where we would all bump into each other during the day and make our plans for the afternoon or evening. It felt very communal. Every time you stay somewhere your feelings will always be dictated by a number of things but I do think the PK is good for what it is. Regarding costs I think it's probably a fair price. One of our friends got a really good deal on flights and the hotel and stayed for a tad longer.

This hotel is very nicely located, very close to the beach and the main 'strip'.When we arrived from the U.K. after being on the go for 30+ hrs travelling we just wanted to get to bed. Unfortunately the air-con was on the blink and as making a banging noise. We tried to change rooms but they didn't have another of the same standard etc. The reception staff kept us updated of their efforts to find another room or get it fixed. To no avail and we just turned it off - being dog tired, we fell asleep anyway. By 10am next day there was an engineer working on the repairs. Great. plus we were offered free breakfast as well.It's a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Even less to the main 'strip'. Rooms and hotel is getting a bit tired but were clean and comfortable. Staff were at all times helpful and polite. The birds during meals are a pain as it's open plan to the outdoors next to the pool. A nice touch is the free chairs to go with the beach towels for use at the beach.Would we stay there again - for the value and location - Yes !!

Quite disappointing for a Sheraton hotel. Service was very average and room which was on street side was tired and noisy early in morning . Location was great. Tommy the trip adviser was the exception to the perfunctionary service - he was helpful and pleasant - a credit to the hotel.

In March I returned for my fourth visit to the Princess Kaiulani. I was very disappointed. I have always enjoyed my visits there, but this last visit was very diappointing. Our room was so so, but as rates had gone up, we could only afford a partial ocean view, which is very, very partial and more wall view. You would think because we have returned for a fourth year in a row, they would have tried to keep us happy. Also..bar service around the pool was non existant. If you wanted service, you had to jump up and down to get their attention, then do the same for another drink. There were many staff that we remember from years gone by, that were awesome. Debbie at the buffet and the pool staff (Lauren I think) were still great, but as a whole, I was very disappointed. Needless to say..this will be my fourth and last visit to PK.

I travel quite a bit for work, and have stayed at every Marriott, Hilton, and SPG property on Waikiki, and this is BY FAR, the worst! Upon arrival, you will be told not only is there not valet parking, but you must drive to the sketcky parking structure next door and park (this still costs $25/day). You can not check in, then park your car, and they did not seem eager to hold my bags for me (and I did not find the elevator in the parking stucture), so you have to haul your bags down the stairs. Not really safe or enjoyable for a female traveler.Then I checked in. The room was clean. "vintage" as a co-worker put it, but clean. Old teal carpet, old furniture, dirty drapes, and 80's patio furniture, but clean. The walls - PAPER THIN. Like the guy next door that has been clearing his throat, their TV, the "windows" sound when their computer turns on, etc. You are guaranteed to hear the hawaiian band play until midnight every night (even when it rains). Around 2:30 am, there was jackhammering and drilling (literally). I pretty much sleep through everything, but seriously?! I called down to the front desk and the lady told me others had commented on that as well. I asked if she could look into it, and just heard a click (she hung up!). Needless to say, the noise didn't go away until about 5am. No idea what it was. It's not on the beach, the pool is right on a busy street. Avoid this one at all costs.

The location of this hotel is ideal as it's just a short walk to the beach, restaurants and shops. The room was a little disappointing as the decor was quite dated and it was smaller than we expected but it was fine given the location. We had a large balcony which had a sea view and overall the stay was very pleasant. We only had breakfast once - it cost us £30 per person which is very excessive even though there was plenty of choice. Due to the high cost we did not have dinner here. Can't really complain about anything, it's a great hotel and even though we wern't initially impressed with the decor, it didn't spoil our stay here.

The good thing is that this hotel is in a great location. It is definitely older and I knew that going into it. You can walk to just about anything you want in Waikiki. The bad is that it is old. But they try to do a good job of making sure it is clean. I heard it was going to be torn down. Don't know if that is true or not. Pool area is not very impressive. We had free breakfast with our stay. We were tired of eating it by the 3rd day and couldn't wait to have something else. It was not very good. The birds were extremely annoying in the restaurant/buffet area. You can't leave your plate for a few minutes to go refill your drink without a bird lurking around your plate. One of us always had to stay nearby to keep the birds away. I think it is because they feed the birds the scrap food. They are seriously annoying. All in all, I'd say it was a very average hotel. Oh...and it is pretty noisy with the traffic on the street.

Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. We had a great ocean view and view of the pool which was nice to sit out on the balcony and look at the ocean. Yes the hotel is dated and I understand it is about to be renovated, but the room was clean and there was nothing to complain about. You get what you pay for and this hotel is relatively cheap for a reason. The pool was nice and the bar and cocktails were fantastic. The hotel is right beside the beach and the main shopping/ restaurant area. I would highly recommend this hotel and really hope once it is renovated that it is still affordable!

A very nice hotel within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. Near lots of shops & eating places. I would stay there again when in Honolulu, Hi. We would have liked to have a microwave in the room to reheat our meals.

We enjoy staying at great hotels, so staying here at the Sheraton PK was a shock to the system. By choice I would not here. With my parents traveling and being budget conscious, we caved. The Sheraton PK needs a complete retrofit. It is stuck in the 80's and frankly is a bit sad. For a number of reasons, we would not stay again and unless on a significant budget would not recommend. It 45 years old! I think our bathroom may have been original... avocado green. Stay if rooms don't mean much to you.

Part of the Sheraton and Westin hotels in Waikiki. Excellent location and very nice staff. Room need a face lift and hope to happen in the next year. Avoid rooms in the higher tower with odd numbers. Major construction so op for pool view or Diamond Head. . ..

Very disappointed will the welcome we got couldn't find our booking for two days then when found no apology or anything made us feel unwelcome didn't get the services we had paid for ie daily newspaper ect only good bits were bar staff nice and friendly and beach chairs were very good we have stayed in Sheratons all over the world don't know how they are allowed to use there name

Pros-centrally located to everything in Waikikki. Excellent concierge and bell staff. View exceeded expectations--partial ocean view on 19th floor exceeded expectations with a nearly full front ocean view.Cons-CONSTRUCTION next store started at 5am every morning, including Saturday an. Sunday and it was LOUD and woke us up each morning. Room was very dated as was most of the hotel. Pool was tiny. Lobby smelled like fish all the time because of the buffets every night.

Ok this place has seen better days. It is due for major renovations in 2015 so no point complaining. The tour desk operator Marsha was very helpful - highly recommend you book with her!!! She knows her tours!!! Located in the heart of Waikiki - best part about this place!

The location is fantastic. Just across the street from Waikiki Beach. You can walk there in a minute. If you want to be in the heart of things and close to the sands of Waikiki this is a good spot.The price is decent but the ammenaties leave a bit to be desired in the room. The hotel rooms are a bit dated. The beds and bedding are not real good. Low quality linend are like sleeping on paper. The bed has no support so it was not a great sleeping experience. The parking garage has no elevator? So be aware you will do stair climbs if you rented a car. If you are on a bit of a budget it is a good deal, but watch your bill I was overcharged for a movie I did not watch.. They fixed this upon check out. We were on second floor overlooking the pool . There is a no smoking sign on the Lania (balcony) but no other restrictions noted. We hung our towels there to dry for 5 days before I recieved a call from one of their staff who you could barely understand to remove the towels. Ok I understand, had this person been doing their job he would have told us on day 1 . or atleast put a sticker on the railing. If you are going to have someone call that represents your Hotel. make it someone personable, This person had no business calling rooms the way he spoke

we had an amazing time while staying at pk hotel ,we booked a standard room but there was a bit of noise coming from construction work, but as soon as we mentioned it to the front desk staff, they upgraded us to a pool view room, and they were very attentive and keen to make our stay pleasant which is great and the room change was done instantly and they even moved all of our stuff while we were out just told us to come back to the other room , which was very helpful. our room was cleaned daily house keeping staff were awesome ,friendly and efficient. yes the furniture is a bit dated but it was not an issue as it was very clean . the hotel has a great location ,possibly the best in waikkiki ,close to everything so why pay for more. front desk staff were also very helpful and friendly .not sure about the tourguide lady at lobby, tours seemed a bit overpriced , but if ur ok with busing or driving then the concierge was very helpful n answered all our questions, showed us all bus routes etc, the restaurant has a show by the pool everyday which was very nice. the pool staff would come to the beach with fruits n cold water which was a very nice touch,we loved our holiday at pk hotel and we would defiantly stay there again

Sure this hotel needs a bit of updating but for the price and the location I feel it met our needs perfectly! Our room was clean everyday when we returned from our outings so we were able to come back and relax before evening festivities. We had a pool/ocean view which was beautiful. I loved being right in downtown Waikiki. We did walk over and have a lot of our meals at Duke’s in the Outrigger Waikiki and of course at other downtown restaurants, as we didn’t care for one meal that we did eat at the Splash Bar.Parking is a bit price but we purchased a package that included parking so it wasn’t an extra cost to us.

Stayed in this hotel last September, we had a 5 night 6 day stay, yes the Hotel need improving but obviously this is reflected in the cost of a nights stay. The Hotel is a very close to all amenities, and there is a public car park to the side which guest can use too. The hotel had every thing we needed, for our stay, We were given a voucher for a free drink which we had around the pool. We mostly used the hotel as a base for our visit around the island. We paid a little extra to have a side view of the sea.The hotel stored our luggage on our last day as we had to check out at 12pm and our flight was not until 1130pm, so as we had a hire car we checked out earlier and had another full day in Hawaii.

Good location. Price is way to much for old hotel. The part that was the most irritating is they don't make cappuccino's there, but they have a little coffee place right out front. But they won't let you sit in the open restaurant/ lobby/ pool area with your coffee without buying their 24.00 Buffett . They tell you to go to another place to drink it and there are only a couple seats. I paid to stay there I want to sit with my special coffee at a regular table... I was not taking a table away from a paying customer...

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The first time was a much better experience. This time, the hotel seemed in dire need of a renovation. We were part of a large group, and when we arrived our rooms were not ready. We were told the rooms would be ready by early afternoon, but by 3:00, several rooms were still not ready. Many in our group felt that their rooms were not clean. On the last night there, we discovered insects in our room and requested another room. After many phone calls and visits from housekeeping, we were finally given another room. The second room was much cleaner, but still in need of updates. We travel to Oahu every 3 or 4 years. We will be looking for a new place to stay next time. Very unhappy this time around.

This hotel is old, the carpets are very stained everywhere. Our sheet had a stain, at 730am I saw a chicken bone in the corner of the hallway next to the elevator and when I told the front desk about it, they asked why I didn't pick it up. In addition, the bathroom did not have a vent for circulation when showering or when using the bathroom. Unfortunatley, mold probably surrounds the restroom. Also the shower heads are made for small people because it is chest level when the water hits. My girlfriend is 5'10" and she had to bend slightly backwards to shower. It is an old hotel. For the price we paid for, it is not worth it.

Very nice location and the chicken sandwich at the Splash Bar may be the best I ever had. The hotel needs a remodel. The rooms are a bit old but the rest of the hotel made up for it.I had a major water leak just outside my room at 4AM. The hotel staff responded quickly and professionally. The night manager Jason was very nice and compensated me for my trouble. I would stay at this hotel again.

Our trips to Honolulu have been relatively frequent and we nearly always stay here because it is so centrally located.However it has a down side. It s noisy, and tired, luckily changes are on the way this year.Our check in process has always been relatively complex. We book six months ahead and request a certain type of room but rarely do we get it. We were offered an upgraded room with extra charges but this turned out to be not as good as the room we originally requested. With the help of one good person on the desk Andrea we managed to get what we wanted.The room was quieter, the bed was very comfortable and the pillows the best.The free wifi in the room was also excellent.

We came to Waikiki from our home here on Oahu to spend the night, and play tourist. We forgot, of course, that this is Spring Break - and the hotels are full, the crowds epic. None the less, we scored a decent rate on the Princess Kaiulani, with a nice ocean view, and a lanai. All we really need. Now, the hotel is clean, the staff friendly, and the location perfect. There is no beach access from this hotel, but it is right across the street. The pool is small - no problem - but is closes WAYYYYY early (What's up with that? My kids wanted to play in the pool in the evening. NOT happy about that). Also kinda bummed about the 11:00 AM check out time ... so we'll tick off another point for that. If you are coming to visit Hawaii, these things, and the small-ish rooms probably won't mean much since you will spend most of your time on the beach or sightseeing. For our next trip to Waikiki we will probably choose a different hotel.

We stayed here for our honeymoon November of 2013, great location we did not eat at the restaurant as it seemed kind of over priced. they give a few bottles of water everyday in the room and have refill stations which is nice. car rental across the street which was convenient. easy check in and out pool was small and did not see a hot tub (also didn't look hard)

I'm currently sitting in my room of this hotel on the 24th floor and it sounds like I'm sitting in the middle of the street. The sliding glass doors don't do a good job of blocking the noise. The hotel is in a great location and the price was reasonable but it's very outdated. I hope the upcoming remodel is extensive!

We booked our stay back in September and recently I have been seeing bad reviews, so I was a little nervous about staying here. We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton Princess and were very pleased with our stay. We were on the 15th floor with ocean views and a king bed. The princess is old and a bit out of date, however the room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful, we would stay here again.

I stayed here in March 2005 (Wow! Super long time ago, but I'm just now reviewing it as an adult. Hopefully it hasn't changed). It was a great hotel with a great cleaning staff. At one point I spilled something on the comforter and called the cleaning staff to ask if they could change the bedding, and they were so nice and accommodating about it. I even talked to the lady for a while and she was really friendly. The hotel itself is just a short walk away from the beach and I stayed about a week... no complaints :)

The hotel is old but they keep it clean. The service is good. The room we stayed smelt moldy. It went so bad when we switched on the air-con. The location is very good. Very convenient. We will upgrade the room if we ever stay here.

The hotel is older but lovely. Courtyard area and lobby. Across the street from Waikiki beach. Shower with bench. Pool looked inviting. Small fridge in room. Beds comfortable great views from room walking distance to restaurants beach and activities. Close to bus stops

I've been staying at this hotel every time I go to Oahu (a few times a year) for the past 4 years. I can look past the fact that it is extremely old and outdated because of it's great location, right in the heart of Waikiki. On our last stay, at 6:00am, the mirror in our room fell off of the wall and crashed into pieces on the ground. My husband and I were dead asleep and had no idea what was going on. When security came, they seemed to think that it could not have just fallen off the wall, as if we caused it somehow. So the manager asked us if we wanted to move to another room, which we did (the AC wasn't working properly anyway and had to have maintenance come and fix it earlier in the evening). They moved us quickly to a lower room facing the International Marketplace, which, sadly, is being torn down. Needless to say, I did not get back to sleep because of the construction noise outside of my room. when we returned that night to our new room, it wasn't even made up. The security guard gave us coupons for free breakfast, which was nice of him, but I wish I could say that of the rest of the staff. When I checked out, the guest services guy didn't ask how my stay was. He charged my card, and I asked if I could get some sort of a discount as I had a terrible experience (I explained everything that happened). He waived the resort fee ($50), which hardly seemed enough to me, but I didn't make a fuss. If we had been up and about when the mirror fell, someone could have been seriously hurt, or worse. I've never had such a terrible experience in a hotel before, and I won't be returning.

We stayed 10 days in the Kaiulani Tower in March and were very happy with our stay. All hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Kaiulani Tower is older but we understand this tower will be ongoing a complete renovation in the near future. Regardless of its age, the hotel is clean and well kept. Our room overlooked Kaiulani Avenue which is the main route for tour buses to reach Koa Avenue which as a result it was generally too noisy to leave the lanai doors open and enjoy the tropical breezes. Hotel offers beach chairs and towels to its guests as well as water and fruit. We were extremely pleased to find that there were plenty of towels and chairs available no matter what time you went to the beach (which was not the case at the last hotel in Waikiki we stayed at). Hotel also has a medical clinic located on the first floor which, unfortunately, we had to make use of. We would definitely stay at the Princess Kaiulani again but this time would upgrade to a room that faces the pool

What a great choice. We chose this hotel mainly because of the price and it looked to be in a great location. What a gem!! Perfect location... across the road from Waikiki Beach and central to everything in Waikiki. If you do not want to spend the high prices to stay on the beach stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.The rooms are very big, clean and comfortable. They may seem a little old but hey they feel amazing. The staff are great and the amenities at the hotel are exactly what you need. You really do get a great accommodation for the price. Will stay here again.

we had a bad experience at this hotel. Not up to Sheraton standards. Rooms are outdated, Carpet is filthy dirty, 25years old building. During our 6 days stay housekeeping cleaned our room only twice. They charge $25.00 resort fee per day and the hotel does not have resort facilities. Only couple good things about this resort fee is they give you 2 water bottles and 60 min of phone calls if you needed. Remember to call the front dest every time you need to make a phone call. The city view rooms are very noisy because they are near tourist bus pick up hub. Concierge service was not good. No one greeted us and explained any activities or entertainment programs etc. We paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel and the experience was not even 3 star hotel experince. We are never going to stay at this hotel again.

Felt like I stayed at a production factory. Super tiny rooms, colossal crowds in reception area, pool, restaurant, elevators you name it. We stayed for a week and I wanted out after a couple days. I'm generally a very tolerate and patient person but this pace gave me a headache. The rooms were seriously outdated. Not what I have come to expect from Starwood properties.Great location if you want to be in Waikiki beach area. Beach is across the Main Street. Pool staff will sign out chairs and towels which is convenient. Staff also came to the beach to hand out water and fruit to their guests. Nice touch.

When we pulled up to the entrance to the Princess Kaiulani we were greeted by several people who helped unload the car and get our luggage to our rooms. We registered quickly and went to our rooms. It was so quick that the luggage hadn't been delivered. After a phone call the suitcases arrived about five minutes later. The room was comfortable and the temperature was easily modified. The bathroom was fine and we looked forward to the nest day. We were in the middle of all the action and in the afternoon we went to the beach after picking up beach chairs and towels which identified us as staying at the Princess Kaiulani and were presented with fresh apples and bottled water. All and all the two days we stayed at the hotel was quite enjoyable. One thing to make sure of - have your room above the 17th floor so traffic and people noise will be reduced.

spent 5 days their in March. great location convenient to everything .you can see hotel was old but service was top notch EXCEPT for travel desk gave poor recommendations thought they knew it all [especially Marsha ] put us on tours that overlapped areas and sold us all high end options. in some cases we saw where other tours were better.

we were in the hotel for a week and found it to be very good . it was clean and tidy .we had no problems at all. The staff were always very happy and nothing was a problem for them to do .The room was large and the bed was comfortable. location was good right in the hart of Waikiki.it was our 25th wedding anniversary and there was a fruit basket and bottle of Champaign in the room for us . we would go back there anytime .

we went to this hotel on a friend's recommendation and weren't disappointed. our ocean view room had a proper view of Waikiki Beach looking towards Diamond Head (which was unfortunately blocked by the Hyatt).(We also stayed in an ocean view room at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach, but you had to be standing at the balcony door to see a partial view towards Ala Moana). Staff were great, even the in room coffee and tea was OK and plentiful. It's in a great location near the international marketplace and you just cross the road (Kalakaua Ave) to a pathway that leads to the beach next to the Outrigger. In our room we could leave the balcony door open for fresh air which was a good option.

I booked my room, then read the reviews and I have to admit I was worried. The three things that are important to me in my hotel are: cleanliness, Wi-Fi connection, and a good night's rest. I got all three here, at the Sheraton. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the pillows were perfect, the linen was not tired, but at least 500 count percale, and I had Wi-Fi. The first time I checked in to drop off my bags early I had a smart and pleasant reservations clerk who took care of my needs quickly. When I returned to get me key card later in the evening, I had a cheerful but absolutely clueless clerk. I guess when the sun sets, the cranial lights go out also. I actually, like this location a lot. It is very close to Waikiki, and right across the omnipresent ABC Store, and King's Alley, where you can watch the Hawaiian Honor Guard Drill. They have a long version and a short version. It is very interesting to watch.

Yes, they are going to do a renovation, but I had a good experience staying here. The check-in and check-out process was perfectly fine, and my room was very comfortable. I was on the 23rd floor, and looked out over the Moana Surfrider to the ocean. Saw the fireworks one night over the ocean. It's a great location, right in the middle of everything in Waikiki. I was working, so didn't really have much time to enjoy the amenities, and only had breakfast there the morning before we left. But, it was good overall.

got a great rate and since its right across the street from Waikiki Beach decided to check it out. while location is great the room was from the fifties or maybe sixties and the furniture was very worn. Would have been very disappointed if I had paid normal Waikiki prices. Even the pool was dated - most of it 6-7 feet deep. Hotel is closing August 1.

My wife and I arrived at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani at our normal check-in time to be told that we needed to check back in 3 hours due to guest who hadn't checked out of the room yet. No apologies. My wife and I went on a drive around Honolulu to check out the sights. When we finally checked into our room, a horrendously foul odor hit us! We were unsure of what the smell was but upon investigating the room, nothing was clean! It was horrible to see dirty finger smudges on walls, light switches, bathroom fixtures. I immediately talked to an uninterested local bruddah with pierced ears at the front desk who told me that he'd have housekeeping stop by to freshen the room up. I informed him (let's leave his nameless, i'm sure ownership will deal with this guy) we had a constant leak above our shower, chipped walls and broken furniture. The sheets and pillows smelled like urine. He simply replied "ok" with no compensation or room moves offered. We ended up at WalMart to purchase cheap pillows, sheets, and cleaning supplies. When we arrived back, housekeeping didn't show up as promised. We ended up putting a Do Not Disturb sign on our door so that we could keep track of our bedding and belongings. We informed the front desk and concierge of our concerns but nothing was done. Heck I even posted something on twitter to grab the attention of ownership. Upon checkout, I voiced my concerns and frustrations with the Front Desk Agent. She said that she would pass the information along to her boss and took my guest comment card. No one has contacted me, offered any sort of compensation, or even thanked us for our stay. I would appreciate some sort of re-imbursement for our troubles. "IS ANYONE LISTENING TO US?"For future travelers considering this property....AVOID THIS PITFALL AT ALL COSTS!

Because I admire the Princess Kauiulani (the woman) I had high hopes for my stay this week at the hotel named for her. Sadly, for a business traveler I cannot recommend this at all. For a family, same thing - 2 thumbs down. The rates were higher than much nicer properties I've visited, the room was a bit of a wreck, and the noise was awful. The staff were very average (a few of the private vendors were friendly, but those were the only happy faces I saw). I heard they're going to be closing for renovations in the near future, and perhaps that explains the dresser drawer that wouldn't stay closed, dust around the middle of the lamps, the stains on the carpet and chairs, the short shower curtain with straight (vs curved) rod that didn't really keep the floor dry. The elevators were often overflowing so getting to/from the room proved challenging time to time, and the restaurants were expensive (there are less expensive places around the area and farmer's markets a few nights a week). A band started at 10P somewhere in the area and kept me awake until midnight each night I was there. The bed lifted in the middle so avoiding a tumble to the floor felt awkward. In spite of the higher rates, this property charges $10 per day for a microwave and $14 a day for wireless internet service in the room. Computers are available in the lobby for those who wish to use them, though printing and time online is limited. The pool looked lovely and evening bands playing near the pool sounded great. It's a close walk to the beach and found some good bargains at the nearby Kings Market, but would not stay again.

This is in need of a renovation. When we went to our suite we noticed hundreds of mosquitos inside the ceiling and along the inside of the sliding doors. We were changed to a smaller but much better room. Things all over the resort look beat up and old. The staff is very professional but the place needs to be renovated. Location is also great.

Its sad to see PK closing, but i cant wait until the doors reopen and the Princess is once again back to her beautiful self, location is the best, right in the heart of Waikiki, the beds are always comfy and rooms are very clean, the sevice is second to none, from the gals in housekeeping (Amelda & Belinda)to Darlette at reservation and the crew at front desk..and especially Marsha from the Tours & Activity Desk who goes well beyond just doing her job, she makes you feel like family, looking after our days of sightseeing and recommending the best operators for our day trips, Marsha is definately the best in the business, and she is one of the main reasons i stay at PK (my 7th visit)....it just feels right....i have recommended the PK to family and friends for their stay in Waikiki.

This was my third trip to Hawaii and I have not stayed anywhere else whilst on Oahu. Arriving on the first day was like a Hawaiian homecoming, it just felt right.I love the location and I love the building, such a great vibe filled with many lovely people all there to help. Especially Marsha who went above and beyond to ensure my mother and I had a wonderful trip, even arranging a gift basket for my birthday. We were sad to hear that the Princess was shutting down, but cannot wait to see her when she is reopened and looking as splendid and regal as she should.

One of us got sick, and we walked from our hotel to the Straub Doctors On Call Clinic on the first floor of the hotel. It was like a modern primary care doctor’s office, complete with electronic medical records, just like on the mainland. My wife received prompt, courteous care by the support staff and the doctor. A CT scan was necessary, and the clinic’s courtesy van took us to the radiology office next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. We received the same speedy professional care as at the On Call Clinic, and the radiologist's CT report was given to us along with the images on a disc so we could bring them home to our primary care doctor.

Sheraton is closing the hotel on August 1st and will remodel the entire property. The hotel is kept clean and the staff is accommodating but they are not putting any money into it. The location is good, next to the international marketplace and right in the heart of Waikiki. You can easily walk anywhere. Parking and wifi was part of the resort fee. Made this fee acceptable. Wifi speed was fast. The hotel offers hula classes, lei making and ukulele lessons in the lobby for those who want to experience a little of the Hawaiian culture. The pool area was well kept and they gave out towels and chairs for use on the beach, a nice touch.

After reading some of the previous reviews of this hotel, I was a bit dubious about staying here.Yes the Hotel is dated, but we found the Hotel to be great, the rooms were comfortable and clean, the staff were friendly enough and answered our queries, the lady on the tour desk was very helpful and pleasant. We only ate breakfast there and it was sufficent enough, with plenty of choices around the hotel for evening meals. The best thing about the Hotel is it's location. It is central to everything and a stone's throw from the beach.I would recommend our family and friends to stay. In its day Im sure the hotel would have been five stars...I have stayed in a lot worse in Australia and the Uk.

This property was not a place I would stay again. It was in a good location and had some good features, but had some issues as well. The hallways are looking very worn, the bathroom wasn't very clean....especially the wall near sink, the room itself was a bit dated, but ok. The bed was comfortable, the balcony very nice and, the lobby clean and pretty and the pool and bar area very well kept. We enjoyed a quiet room on the 27th floor. I did appreciate the beach chair and towel service that is part of the extra hotel fee. I am not sure it should include parking unless you have a car there. Employees were ok, except for the doorman named "Bill" (i think) who wasn't at all interrested in most travelers. He is just filling space...he obviously does not think he needs to do anything for a guest. I understand this Sheraton is being torn down later this summer, so perhaps the lack in some things is explained that way.

I have just arrived home from Hawaii and I stayed at the princess kaulani hotelFirstly as a Starwood member and booking thru Skoosh I got the most fantastic room overlooking diamond head and the beach for a great price considering it was peak period although some of the reviews thru Skoosh were average Overlook them as they and the hotel looked after me with professionalism and treated me like a human!Thanks guys all went well and I will be using you again for all my hotel bookings keep up the good workPaul Sydney Australia

Hotels are expensive in Honolulu. Not less so the 40 years old Sheraton Princess Ka’iulano Hotel. We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks , with a 2 day break in Kauai in between.Furnishing: The wash room is still the original equipment. Though this is still functioning good old American plumbing, is this what we should expect for a 5 star service? The same goes for the furniture in the room as a whole.Service: The maid has been knocking on the door at 7:15 AM every morning and woke us up to see whether she could clean the room. We are on vacation, for heaven’s sake, and would not wish to get up so early! When complain about it, the customer service manager just tell us to use the “do not disturb” sign next time. Well, will there be the next time? How arrogant!Safety: The electronic safe is not functioning in this room when we arrived. They promised to have it fixed within an hour. The Security person came and went and promised an engineer. This is the 3rd day and no sign of service yet.The Wifi was good in the first room we stayed at. This time it has been intermittent. The technical support person Alvin from Telcel was very helpful and patient and the problem was finally resolved. During our break in Kauai, we stayed at the brand new Marriott Courtyard resort hotel. That was a modern hotel that has met all the expectations of frequent flyers like us. What a contrast!

We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a 3-island trip to Hawaii. We primarily wanted to see Pearl Harbor.LOCATION: The location was great for everything we wanted to do, and very convenient - we had a partial ocean view of Waikiki (blocked by the hotel in front of it by a block that is actually oceanfront - the Outrigger), and could easily walk to the beach and to all of the local/nearby restaurants and stores in Waikiki tourist area. It was great, especially for a brief stay and for not having rented a car for this stint. (We signed up for a Pearl Harbor tour that picked us up at another nearby hotel that we were able to walk to easily.) Note that it is not on the beach and does not have direct beach access. It is only about a block away though if you want to walk. ROOM/HOTEL: The room was neat and servicable but very average, not high-end at all. The furniture was relatively bare-boned and the bathroom was not one I'd want in my own home, however, for our brief trip, the location mattered more, so it was fine. I would say the same about the pool - perfectly fine, but nothing luxurious.Service was responsive and they sent us a free bottle of champagne to our room because it was our honeymoon. I did not rate value because we booked it as part of a package. I would say that if you are used to a more average hotel and not a luxury one, you would be pleased with this hotel. If you are used to more luxurious accommodations, updated bathrooms, etc., then you may be disappointed. There was nothing actually wrong with the room, and the service was fine. I would recommend staying here if you care more about getting out and about than if you want to spend a lot of time at the hotel.

Stayed here for 4 days recently and had a good time. The property was clean, the staff very helpful and pleasant. It's not the newest hotel on the block but well kept.Our room was clean and tidy although rather noisy at times but that was not a major issue for us.It is a very busy hotel with lots of tour groups staying and it felt a bit crowded. Breakfast was to expensive in my opinion. We did not eat in the restaurant so we can't comment on that.Location is handy, right across the street and you are on the bach.

This is an older hotel that can use some sprucing up, but overall, we had a great stay and there are many aspects that make this hotel an excellent choice for travelers to Waikiki. It is located across the road to the beach and close to restaurants and shopping. Our room was large and bright and although somewhat dated, everything was spotlessly clean and in good working order.We ate at the breakfast buffet daily and it was excellent. Great selection, everything fresh and delicious. But what made our stay truly enjoyable was the hotel's wonderful employees. They are very attentive, helpful, polite and hard working. They all seem like they love to make guests happy, and this applies to everybody - doorman, concierge, front desk clerks, maids, waitresses. We hope to come back to this hotel again.

Loved everything about the Princess, The room was a King bed with a beautiful city view and a peek-a-boo of the ocean. Bed was very comfortable and room was net and clean. Water pressure was good and never ran out of hot water, that was nice. Service and staff very nice and friendly, helped in every way needed. pool area was great and got water and fruit service over at Waikiki beach for the hotel staff. Curb appeal was very nice with a beautiful pond with fish and flowers.

While it is true the Princess Kaiulani is aging, we were completely satisfied with our room. Sometimes older is better. There was nothing lacking in the room. Loved the balcony. Most places nowadays only have windows which will not even open. The street noise is there but itadds to the experience. Give this place a try before they renovate!

I stayed here in October of 2011. I was happy with my stay. The staff were lovely. Especially the ladies and Gents at the pool. The air con stopped working about halfway through our trip, however the concierge sent someone up within 30 minutes to fix it.When we arrived, we were early for check in, and the check in desk offered somewhere for us to get changed so we could have a swim while we waited. They also offered to mind our suitcases whilst we went for a walk.I was realistic in my approach to the hotel... the rates were really cheap, so I wasn't expecting a 5 star experience, but I wad nicely surprised by the service and quality of the room.

Upon arrival the sleazy valet was floundering over flight attendants arriving, the aged check in attendant was rude and took over 45 minutes to check us into two rooms. The Hotel is completely run down the bathroom is disgraceful poor unclean water, holes in the curtains full of stains, roaches in the bed linen! poor a/c performance. Holes in the bed linen dust and dirt and others peoples hair in the bathroom stuck to the wallpaper, absolutely foul. We paid $6k for two rooms over Xmas, never again a total dump! No room service after 10pm, so if you get in late, too bad! No kettles in the rooms only a poor coffee maker, broken safes in both rooms. For a Sheraton it was appalling. Pool closes at 6pm, and needed work. Worst Hotel i have stayed in as a frequent traveler. For Sheraton very very poor. They offer one hour free a day phone calls to any destination in the world, classed as a part of your resort fee, good luck getting a call through to Australia!!! Just try getting to talk to the hotel manager to air your concerns, good luck!

Very run down, stayed there in january and found roaches in room. Location is great but rooms are really run down. I stay there for business a few times a month and it has gotten much worse. Air conditioner doesnt always work well. Stay at the other sheraton property located a few blocks away. It is much nicer.

My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary here and were delighted with the hotel and with the people who work here. Special thanks to concierge Naomi Grace for sending chocolate-covered strawberries to our room with her kind note! The hotel is old, true, and Waikiki is very busy and often very loud. My advice is to try for a room on a high floor. Then relax and enjoy the many things the Princess Kaiulani offers -- hula lessons, lei making, chairs & towels to take to the beautiful beach right across the street. We had so much fun! All the employees do their best to make your visit special. Mahalo, Sheraton Princess!

Stayed here 2 years in a row, first for new years eve and second to get married on our 25th anniversary together. Great location across street from Ala Moana Hotel and beach in the centre of Waikiki. Great pool area. Beautiful lobby area that had a huge Christmas village with train set going through it. I believe it was mostly made out of chocolate and miniatures. Nice views from higher floors. We stayed on the 11th facing pool and 24th facing diamond head. Hotel rooms are standard but roomy and nice. Comfortable beds. When we got home my husband tracked down where they bought the pillows from and ordered the same ones. We were there last in January 2013 but this review is forcing me to put in February as that is as far back as it will allow.

This was the first hotel on a four island hop. The hotel itself was fine but a bit noisy due to being so close the main road. The room was of a decent size and clean, which was all we wanted as we wouldn't be spending much time in it. It had a fairly decent sized balcony and if you looked to the left you could see the ocean. To me the only downside to this was because the area is so built up it reminded me of Benidorm, lots of high rise hotels and plenty of sunshine. A good point is it's proximity to the main road with its many restaurants and shops and also walking distance to Waikiki beach. We managed to get in to the Cheesecake factory and had a really good meal there but as it's so popular be prepared for a wait.

We stayed for 1 night last week and were totally unimpressed by this hotel. Rooms were very average and bathrooms were not clean. Further to this the resort fee was supposed to cover WiFi internet which never worked for us. We brought it up with the front desk who told us if we wanted internet to actually work we had to pay another $14 per day! I asked what the resort fee covered if not internet and was told "the resort fee covers your free cocktail on check in". Not really a free cocktail then is it??Avoid this place. It sucks.

In just 14 sleeps, my family & I, will be having our 5th stay at this hotel. We are so comfortable and used the this place, that is is just like home , except in beautiful Waikiki! The rooms are what you see online, YES! the hotel is a little run down, however, it is always so clean(the cleaning ladies are amazing) & well maintained for what it is, that this is exceptable and if it were the standard of other sheratons on oahu, you would be paying triple what you do now!My family and I, love coming to this hotel every year, we always stay in the Kaiulani tower, in Ocean view rooms, 18 or higher! Always facing diamond head & spectacular Waikiki beach which is the best view out!Despite the fact that we always come back, and the hotel itself is a diamond in the rough, and in my opinion the BEST hotel for value in Waikiki! We do often have some trouble, We always make a request to get certain room numbers, or if possible a certain view, which we pay for & despite the fact that we are loyal customers and as i stated this will be our 5th stay, Our reservations almost always expect a few time, get muddled up, and unfortunately we have to stay in one room for a night and move to another and so on…Despite that we do love it at the Princess kaiulani, and we cannot wait to stay here again so soon & we always recommend this place to all of our friend and family! WE ARE SO SAD THAT IT WILL BE CLOSING, we know have to find a new hotel to call home in waikiki.

Must admit I was quite hesitant in booking this hotel due to a lot of negative comments.Having stayed at a few Sheratons in Hawaii during our stay I really thought Sheraton would be a lot better, its just the name but standards don't seem to be what you would think for a "Sheraton". Having read some reviews here I was absolutely shocked how picky and stupid some reviews can be. We knew this Sheraton was only a 3 star property at time of us booking. Yes this did surprise us that a Sheraton does have properties rating at only 3 star so our expectations werent overally high. Now despite this we thought its not going to be anything too special. Check in was very slow but yes its a busy time of year. We asked for a room away from noise and traffic but I don't think it happened. Our room was noisy as we were close to traffic noise. Yes this hotel is dated (like most hotels in Waikiki) and its 3 star hotel but we were told it is getting demolished in August 2014. One thing that absolutely shocked me that someone's review stated that this hotel would be "like staying in a backpackers". Oh my god, obviously whoever they are haven't travelled much or ever stayed in a real backpackers. Having stayed in many backpackers around the world this place is definitely NOT a backpackers place. Our room was clean and comfortable but in a noisy spot. Luckily shutting the door helpful a bit. The only thing was the aircon was a bit loud. After the first night our airconditioner stopped working and our room was hot when we returned from our day out. When we rang guest services we had a guy come up straight away to check it out. Within a few minutes we were told we would have to move rooms. OK, that is fine because it was definitely uncomfortable without airconditioning. Within minutes we got a call from the manager telling us that we can move to another room and someone will come up and help with our luggage. OK, you would expect to be moved if aircon wasn't working but I must say this issue was resolved so quickly that we were happy with their customer service. We were surprised just how quickly they did this as a lot of places you would have to wait and wait. I actually rang the manager at guest services and thanked them for such prompt service. Our second room was bigger and cooler which was nice but the safe didn't work. We just didn't bother with it. There was loud music till about 9.30pm each night here but that was not an issue with us. The pool area isn't as big as I thought. The food here was a bit pricey and the quality was ok but could be better for the price. We were given beach chairs and water and fruit for our days on the beach (was included in resort fee). Also this was the only hotel in our Hawaii trip where our wifi actually worked so that was relief. Ok, this hotel is dated, but the rooms were clean and comfortable and well even with our room issue the service was very good. Its in a great location so close to everything. Its not right on the beach but one street away. Actually this was better than been on the beach because at this time of year in January the crowds were crazy.

This hotel is really showing its age. The room was small and straight out of the 70's. The current rates reflect the need for updating and the amenities are not up to snuff for the area....we were told the hotel would be closing soon to be renovated so if you want to take advantage of the good rates you better act soon.

We read some of the reviews on this hotel and we were nervous of staying here. We are currently at the hotel and it's great. Our room is fantastic and the view of Waikiki is brilliant. In fact I am looking at the sea as I write this review! Staff are very helpful and the location is perfect. This hotel is worth a visit. My only grumble is the resort fee is unfair on non american guests as you don't get all the benefits.

This hotel is in a great location right in the thick of things in Waikiki, near shops, restaurants, supermarket/ABC stores, buses and of course the beach. It has great facilities, we had a pool view room so could sit on the balcony with a cold drink watching the view and listening to the nightly music before going out to dinner. The pool bar is a very pleasant place to pass some time as well. The restaurant is an outside terrace, again very pleasant, meals are buffets and the service for coffee/drinks etc can be a little uneven, they always seem to be very rushed and not have quite enough staff on. The food is fine, nothing out of the box. The pool is quite large and the hotel supplies towels and beach chairs. The rooms are very comfortable, we had a twin room each bed was a double, and the room was a good size, bright and airy with good airconditioning and a reasonable size bathroom. Room has a fridge and coffee maker, TV, hairdryer, safe, iron and ironing board, so pretty much all that you need. The hotel overall is showing its age and is a little frayed around the edges, but great location and facilities make it a good stay. Been there before and with luck will be back again!

We are here now over the Christmas holiday. Just an ok room. The whole place is in need of a makeover which I hear ishappening next year. The breakfast buffet is completely a joke at $24.95 for basically a continental breakfast with eggs. There are a lot of other places to eat breakfast for a quarter of the price, skip the restaurant here. Also the bartender and wait staff are rude. Lots of places to spend my money in Waikiki without the attitude. (and cheaper drinks elsewhere)

This hotel is quite old, needs some serious renovation. A lot of things require attention, including dirty AC filters, etc. The location is good but not great; the beach is across the street, not on the beach. I would recommend this hotel only for low rates but not for quality.

We stayed at the PK over the Christmas holiday period and were more than satisfied with everything. Yes, the hotel is in need of a refit, but that doesn't mean that the way it is now is unacceptable. Our room on the 11th floor of the tower was spacious with 2 double beds, the mattresses were comfortable and the pillows and linen of good quality. The room was clean and the airconditioner was just fine. Staff were always helpful and very willing to accommodate our requests. We first stayed at the PK 25 years ago and look forward to returning the hotel when the renovations are complete.

My husband and I are currently staying here during Christmas week while he has a short break before being deployed overseas again. This time together is very special, so we requested a partial ocean view. Our peekaboo room also happened to be above the pool and another roof (not a pretty view at all) and there is entertainment each night at the pool area ... Not mentioned to us, in which we figured out doesn't stop until 10pm! I couldn't even hear our own tv and forget about getting up in the morning for any excursions because you won't fall asleep before 10pm in our room! There are also no screen doors. You want a cool breeze..? Open the door completely. This HOTEL mimics a motel 6 but charges like a resort. You are charged a $23-25 a day... "Resort fee" which includes incredibly slow internet and 2 bottles of water. Seriously? I can get a huge bottle of water for $.99 at ABC store. It has ONE outlet in the "bed" area. We had to charge a cell phone in the bathroom. Come on! I think there is even mold in the upper rim of the bathroom sink. This hotel is so outdated it's ridiculous. I will say the staff has been nice, but please stop calling this place a resort ....it is far from it!! If you are looking for a place to rest your head and are traveling alone, with no cares about cleanliness, noise, or niceties ... Then you may not mind it here. If you are used to staying in a resort, don't like bumping elbows while moving about your room and want peace and quiet at night, this isn't your place.

This is one of the older Sheraton properties and is definitely in need of modernization. However, it is also a very good value with balcony rooms being less than $200/night. Also, there is often a promotion of getting 2 nights free when you pre-pay for 4 nights, resulting in a 6-night stay.The location is also central is walking everywhere in the central Waikiki area.

I travel for business and am a platinum member for over 10 years and stay at many properties in the lower 48 and all over the world. I am also platinum with Marriott. Bottom line, you'd be more comfortable anywhere else or at a motel 6, than staying at this property. This hotel is in such bad shape and has been needing renovations across the board for many years now. The carpets are terrible, A/C never cold enough, popcorn ceilings, outdated furnishings, terrible mattresses, dirty bathrooms, and so on. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra 20-30 dollars or even the same rate and stay somewhere else / anywhere else. Room cleanliness is a must for me and the last 3 times I've stayed here there have been multiple issues. On top of all that, platinum members are greeted nicely at the desk for check in and amenities are just water and free wifi, big deal. Checking in/out process is always a time consuming issue and checkout is even worse if you need to get to the airport on time. Plan ahead. Ask yourself if you want to stay at a nasty hotel and maybe see the ocean, or stay at any other numerous properties with the same or better view, but much cleaner and more accommodating. A lot of properties in the area now offer live entertainment for the families. By the way, if you are platinum, good luck getting late checkouts around 3pm. Very rare and not helpful at all. Sit at the hotel for 2-3 hours or sit at the airport. You choose. Not a fun trip arriving on Christmas Day from Asia!

For a Sheraton, I wasn't overly impressed. We were only here for two nights before heading to Aulani for 17 days. It gave us the chance to enjoy Waikiki beach before heading off to Ko'olina. It's not too far from anything, walking distance to the beach and shops, though the shady business/trouble comes out when it gets dark.Very dated, it looks old and smells old. Does not feel as though I am staying at a Sheraton. I don't know that I would stay here again had I another option. I do about 50-60 nights a year for business and this was just a depressed building.

This hotel is a lovely 'open air' lobby & restaurant, pool, entertainment area. The rooms are dated & "well used". It is scheduled for a complete update soon. Not directly on the water but very conveniently located. Recommended.

We chose the PK because we had one night in Oahu before heading to another property in a different part of the island. I also had fond memories of staying there when I was 8 so nostalgia really drove our decision.I am 43 now so that should give you some idea of how long the property has been around. Sadly, our room was beyond being disappointing--it was disgusting. The bathroom was not clean and had a hole in the ceiling that looked like it was letting in creepy crawlies, the hallway to get to the room was depressing and dated. But what really disturbed us is that the room overlooked the garbage cans. When we opened the lanai door to step out not only was the view unacceptable (even at a budget hotel), but the cans were open. As you can imagine, in a humid place like Oahu, the garbage cans were emitting the most disgusting smells. To make matters worse, the airco was loud and made cranking sounds. But we couldn't figure out how to turn it off--except by opening the lanai! Admittedly, if we were staying longer, we would have demanded to be moved but instead just spent our short time there out of the room. Better for the local retailers!Anyway, there are other moderate priced hotels in the area that are better for the $$ (see my other review for Hyatt Place Waikiki Beach) in my humble opinion.

Stayed at this hotel in 2008 for 4 days had a grate stay, liked to had a room with view of the ocean but was not in my budget when in Hawaii, the pool was ok but how needs a pool when you have a nice beach , the restaurant was ok but I think it need an up grade , everything was at hand when needed it food, drinks, an a view. I will stay again you had everything I liked.

This was our third visit here, an unfortunately it would appear our last, as it is closing next August for a three year refit, and upon re-opening, will probably be beyond the pocket of the average traveller.Great value for money, clean and comfortable, if somewhat dated rooms, great service and brilliant location, we have no idea where we are going to stay next year.

We stayed at the PK in the last week of November. It was our honeymoon and the hotel upgraded our Pool View Room to an Ocean View. We loved our room and the view it had over the pool and the beach. The staff were helpful and friendly.

We have stayed at this hotel 4 times now, and on each occasion have stayed in a different room category. On this occasion we took our children for their first trip to Hawaii. We received a room overlooking the pool and partial ocean with 2 double beds. There were 4 of us in the room, and we also had a rollaway as our children do not like to share a double bed, sorry I have no room photos to add, as the children are in them all.. The room was very small by the time the rollaway was added, but we made the best of it and actually had a fun time. (Why can't hotels have a king and 2 singles as a Family room or as a standard room???? ) Anyway, YES this hotel is showing its age, YES it needs updating, but if you are looking for a central location and wonderful service, this hotel is a good choice. The parking is included in the resort fee, so that also makes it a convenient choice. We hired a car from across the road in the foyer of the Hyatt Regency, and we did our grocery shopping at the Food Pantry on Kuhio, 1 street behind the hotel. The beach is just a short stroll across the road. The pool is nice and deep and offers plenty of beach chairs around it. The laundry is in the basement and it was handy to do a load of washing, they have change machines located in the laundry room. We had no complaints about any of the services (housekeeping, front desk, room service). On this visit we stayed 4 nights at this Sheraton and then checked into the Sheraton Waikiki for the next week. See my other review for the Sheraton Waikiki. We wanted our children (aged 10 & 14) to enjoy both Sheraton properties.I did visit the hotel next door to do a comparison (Holiday Inn Beachcomber) and did note the rooms are a bit larger and more renovated. The pool at the Beachcomber however is smaller and not as nice as the Sheraton. If it came down to price, these two hotels would be on my list.We look forward to returning to The Princess Kaiulani in the future.

I stayed at this hotel a couple of times but my last stay was just horrible. The rooms, restaurant, pool etc is all just getting old and not well maintained. I cannot see any changes to this hotel for the last 5 years I been staying there. During this last stay the service was slow and frankly just unfriendly. The wifi in rooms didn't work and it took days for the hotel to do something about it. The bathroom in the room is literally falling apart and the furniture is so scuffed and dated it feel like a 1 star hotel. After 3days I couldn't take it anymore and checked out yo stay at the sheraton waikiki - wow what a difference. I will not stay at princess anymore

The best description of this hotel would be something like grandma's house. Grandma's house is definitely not a trendy place, and could use a serious remodel. We actually were upgraded to a room with a great view since I am a Starwood Gold member. The bed was nice, and this was up to typical Sheraton standards. The hotel room itself was definitely dated, and there were some stains on the carpet and overall it was Well worn. It was clean. Despite some of the negatives, much like grandma's house is a place that I felt very comfortable and it was fairly welcoming. I appreciated things like the delicious pineapple samples provided 3 days a week. Some of the bell staff were quite good and helpful, too. Location is fantastic, really can't complaint at all there. Overall, we all love grandmom so we can't really hate her house.

Stayed at the princess two nights. Old and in need of upgrade. Location is perfect. There was a strange smell in the bathroom sink. View is to die for. Central to everything. Breakfast was good as was the pool bar.

I always like the PK because of its location to everything. Across the street from the Moana Hotel where we always have drinks in the evening under the Banyon Tree on the Beach. Great place for 'people-watching'.

I have no idea where all these " moaning minnies" have stayed , but it wasn't at the fabulous SPK Hotel we have been to FOUR times now. Never any problem at check in or check out, too busy having a shower ( to be nice and clean for the fabulous bar & wait people ) to worry about a bit of mould or a cracked tile in the bathroom. We have spent many happy hours at the pool & bar with all the staff making us feel welcome and at home. Hope we can save to come back before it gets pulled apart.

We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed it! Was recommended to stay in this hotel by a friend as the location was great! We booked 3 months in advance and stayed over the valentines and Presidents' Day week. We arrived early and we were told that we had been upgraded to a room which a ocean view, because we arrived early we were allowed to leave our bags at the luggage hold facility. The room was pretty good and the view from the room was amazing!! (So glad we got upgraded). We got complimentary bottles of water everyday and a gift basket on arrival which was really great as we went on day tours and didn't have to worry about buying water to take with us. The bed was really comfy and we were able to sleep really well in it each night. The bathroom looked a bit out dated but it was clean. The hotel does look a bit out dated and it was a bit pricey for a three star hotel but for the location we didn't mind it. It was close to the beach, buses to Ala Monana shopping centre and Honolulu, the markets and lots of eateries. The staff were professional and always greeted you when you entered and left the premises. Most tour buses leave from the hotel opposite (Hyatt) so it was confusing sometimes as to where we were suppose to meet but other than that it was a very enjoyable stay. Would recommend others to stay here.

The hotel was part of a package. The location is great because you in the middle of Waikiki Beach area. There is plenty to do outsideof hotel. Most of the common areas are open and no A/C. The restaurant on the first floor is good for breakfast but expensive. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Consearge has great suggestion for eating places outside of the hotel. Room wasclean and comfortable. The entire place was not as nice as othe Sheraton facilities that I have stayed at.

I have written only one other review and that was to praise a great hotel in Seattle. This hotel on the other hand is well deserving of a poor review. This hotel is tired and beat up and needs a makeover. This alone is bad enough but to add insult to injury I found several of the staff to be down right rude. The only positive thing about this place is the location but there are plenty of hotels in the area and you I would advise anyone to look elsewhere. If it weren't for the fact that we spent only two nights there before heading to kona, I would have changed hotels to avoid a totally disappointing vacation.

Booked 2 rooms for my family at this property and it did not live up to SPG standards. It is an older hotel in need of upgrades. The location itself is great as it is in the heart of Waikiki just across from the Westin Moana Surfrider so everything is within walking distance.When we arrived at the hotel the reception had a hard time finding my reservation and insisted that it might be another hotel with a similar name. Thank goodness I had the reservation number in my phone. Well he found it due to the fact he did not spell my name correctly ( even though I spelled it out and is only 3 letters long ). He then had difficulties getting my rooms arranged and the CC reader wasn't working well.We finally made it to our room and the rooms were OK. There is no thermostat to control the room temperature. It was AC on high, low or off. The satellite TV had poor reception due to the winds I guess (not that you are going to watch a lot of television when in Hawaii). The balcony is tiny with a small table and 2 chairs squeezed in. There is a small fridge in the closet and that was nice to keep some drinks cold. The rooms have no sound insulation at ALL!! Our neighbours were loud and you can hear all their conversations. They stayed up late and got up early so basically we did not get much sleep. Received a note under the door the next day saying they need a credit card to secure the second room. I went down and the front person was quite rude saying it is necessary. I don't doubt that by why was it not taken care of when I registered in the first place. Both rooms were in my name and registered as such. She could have been nicer saying they dropped the ball and could have been more apologetic.
