Anyway, at least it included some free drinks at the bar. Pool area is nothing to speak of. There was some live entertainment at night, which was nice to listen to. But do not go here thinking you'll be spending much time at the pool. I hardly saw anyone in it. And it's definitely not for kids -- only a tiny area is sectioned off as the shallow end; the rest is 6-8' deep. The rooms have had their better day...maybe about 30 years ago. They are now dingy, stained, and loud. Uncomfortable beds and paper thin walls makes for a poor night's sleep. Toiletries in the bathroom were OK. Hallways look dingy as well. Really needs a major overhaul.But at the end of the day, I think it doesn't really matter where you stay in Waikiki that much - because you probably won't be spending a ton of time in the room or in the pool area. The greatness of the area is really the beach, trying out some great restaurants (Marukame Udon around the corner is worth the wait), and walking/people-watching on the main streets. Enjoy Waikiki for what it is. It's not the quiet paradise many have in mind when traveling to Hawaii, but it's still scenic, cultural, and a lot of fun. My advice - don't spend a lot of money on your hotel here, it's just not worth it. Definitely go to Waikiki and check out the main sights of Oahu (Circle Island Tour, Pearl Harbor, Polynesian Cultural Center), but save the majority of your money and your time for one or more of the other islands. I'd stay at the SPK again for cost and convenience, but the rooms are just not up to the standards of the places I would normally stay in.

I recently stayed at the Sheraton Princess and was quite happy with my stay. The hotel was decent, not exactly luxury, but in the location of Waikiki, it was perfect. My check-in time was less than 3 minutes which was a nice surprise after reading some of the other reviews. The hotel was older, but clean and I had a beautiful view of the ocean. The hotel did try and make the stay nice. The free drink they give you at check-in was not good, and I would recommend dinning off-site. SPG members get 35% off of food purchased at any of the hotels on the beach (Moana Surfrider, Sheraton Waikiki and Royal Hawaian) I did have a couple of nice lunches on the breach front at some of those hotels. Overall, the stay was nice and I really didn't have any issues. For the price, it was great. The beds were very comfy and that was VERY good after long days on the beach! Waikiki beach is pretty crowded with a lot of culture in the area which was interesting. You really have to try the ice cream at the Market place which is only a block or so away.

Great value, fantastic location. We were upgraded which was really nice. The view from our ocean view room was amazing. The room was clean, a little old, but it we didn't spend too much time in the room anyway.

Stayed for 4 nts Feb 16th in room 1094. Remnants of previous guest/housekeeper in the bathroom and on the bed (completely unacceptable) upon check in. My first impression was yuck! Room, bathroom and hallway is old and tired as mentioned many times in reviews which reflects the lower price in this prime location. After reading all the reviews I knew what to expect, didn't plan to spend too much time in the room so the hotel served its purpose,this is 3 star at most.Booked a city view room. Other than the expected city traffic noises I found the noise level acceptable. Maybe being on the Kaiulani St side on the 10th floor corner helped avoid the loading area of the hotel.Wifi in room was reliable. Staff friendly. Resort fee is expensive if you don't need parking.

I booked this hotel for my husband and I. I read lots of reviews and spend months deciding where to stay. Finally Deciding to spend most of our money on activities on the island then the hotel it's self. The hotel was clean and the staff was very nice. The room was a bit small and the bathroom needs updating, but other then that we enjoyed our stay there. The bed was super comfortable so that made up for the rest. We had breakfast once at the hotel and were very disappointed. It was extremely over priced and these selection was terrible. So we just had our meals off the property. For the price of the room and airfare we booked I would stay again. We tend not to spend too much time in the room anyway.

I must start by saying this is my first negative review. It was simply appalling and people need to know.This is a copy of the original letter I sent to Starwood Hotels- Owner of The Sheraton.They completely agree!Dear Customer Service Representative,We were guests at The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in room 483 from 2/4 - 2/10Firstly let me say that the room was clean, well stocked, comfortable and generally the staff were pleasant and helpful. I am quite sure that after reading this feedback you will have to tend to agree, because no matter what the rate scale everyone deserves a good nights sleep. I have several short videos documenting the 24 hr loading zone noise. I am aware that this kind of activity is necessary to keep the resort stocked cleaned and functioning efficiently however the noise level in the room is simply unacceptable! The ridiculously loud beeping of trucks backing into the loading zone, which can happen anytime 24/7, even 3am on a Saturday and Sunday will awaken you abruptly. To add insult to injury there are employees and associates laughing and yelling amongst themselves. My suggestion would be, at the very least, to provide earplugs with an explanation and apology for any inconvenience. Possibly look into sound proofing the doors on to the lanai. Being unable to sleep on vacation is just flat out wrong!!We did request to be moved and I offered to pay because we could not sleep. This was basically blown off without apology or any sincere concern. Thank you for your time.Sincerely,Catherine BailieThe guest services manager sent me a courteous email but made no mention of taking any action, for the comfort of future guests, to suppress the shocking noise level.

This is not a deluxe property by any stretch of the imagination.Its a little frayed around the edges and has definite problems such as no wireless in some rooms however..it is quite clean and very friendly and much more affordable than its sister properties across the street.You definitely want a room with a sweet sleeper bed as the other option is not good.The non renovated rooms are pretty sad and tired but again kept clean by a helpful staff.

Rooms were older but housekeeping was so great! Anytime I left my room during night or day, I was never bothered by a "do you need service". Magically when I returned to my room, it was turned and stocked. I got placed in the older tower which seemed more run down. Bathroom was yellow tile with commercial toilet... Almost 1960's . Definitely needed an upgrade. It basically felt grimy even after it was cleaned. My friend had a newer room in the other tower. It was renovated but pretty long ago as well. At least the bathroom was more from the 90's. anyway, it had excellent proximity to the beach. Didn't feel as relaxing because of the grimy feel. Also filled with 90% Japanese tourists..interesting.

I am staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani with my grandson as a 6th grade graduation present. I wanted something in the center of Waikiki so there were lots of restaurants in walking distance but could not afford a beachfront hotel. This ended up being a really good option for us. It is right across the street from the beach and was very reasonably priced. We stayed in one of the cheapest rooms but it had everything we needed. The breakfast and dinner buffets are free for kids under 12 with one paid adult so a huge breakfast (which meant no need for lunch) was $24.50 for both of us. The property is well-maintained and I will stay here next year when I bring my next grandson.My only complaint is that the check-in line was way too long. I am writing this review while sitting in the lobby and there are at least 12 people in line to check-in. The other day when I checked in, we had to wait a half-hour. They should fix this.

After getting married at the Icehotel in Sweden we booked a Hawaii island hopping trip for our Honeymoon. It took us 23hrs from leaving our hotel at Heathrow to arriving at the Sheraton in Honolulu so were very tired upon arrival but check in was quick and when we mentioned we were on our honeymoon we got upgraded to a pool view room. The rooms are dated but clean and comfortable and if like us a hotel room is a base to sleep and shower whilst you explore the local area then the Sheraton is perfect. At the end of the day you get what you pay for - you're not paying 5 star prices so don't expect 5 star luxury! The breakfast buffet is good and plentiful, the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally situated to go off and explore, just a few minutes walk from the beach, shops and restaurants. We booked the Polynesian Adventure trip to Pearl Harbour and found it to be a bit rushed, we could have done with an extra hour or two to fully explore everything at Pearl Harbour. If we went back we would hire a car and do Pearl Harbour at our own pace - there is a lot to look at and take in, make sure you have some tissues as it can be quite emotional at times! On the whole we had a great stay at the Sheraton Princess, yes it could do with updating but it's clean and comfortable and we found the staff friendly.

We are locals and like this small hotel for a getaway for a couple of days. The rooms are not large, but who spends much time in their rooms? Close to lots of restaurants and attractions like the International Market Place. Great pool, and discounts for their buffet and restaurant. Also have a nice Polynesian show upstairs. And the huge gingerbread village at Christmas is awesome.

This hotel is quite deceptive from the outside. The lobby and pool areas are nice and updated, however, the rooms are NOT! I unfortunately stay at this hotel 4-5 times a month and have never ever had a decent room. Many of the rooms are extremely small (think college dorm); so much so that there is not a place to put your luggage. The bathroom is small with a pedestal sink, but no counter space for your toiletries. I have had rooms that absoluetly reeked of mold and mildew and asked for a different room. They accomodated me with an old outdated room that looked as if it had not been remodeled since the 1970's. The shower had lime green and bright yellow decaying tile. There is no water pressure in the shower (in ALL the rooms that I've stayed in), and the small detachable shower head makes it virtually impossible to shower because the trickle of the water is directed at the back wall of the shower. The a/c is a joke with only an on/off option and it barely works. The door locks are so old that I've gotten locked out of my room several times. When securlity comes to let me in, they inform me that the door is locked from the inside!!!!! I tell them "No, that I am not in the room". When I finally get inside, I look at the lock to see that the extra security lock does not stay unlocked, it bounces over and locks itself every time you open/close the door. The windows barely open, maybe about an inch. However last week, I had a room with a window that opened all the way, but there was no screen, and because I was on a lower floor, my room overlooked the roof of an adjacent building. So, anyone on the roof of the other building could have crawled into my room easily. Needless to say, I opted to keep the window closed and use the barely operable a/c. ALL of my rooms have been filthy with dust easily wiped from a/c and fan vents by me. If I can do it, why can't the housekeeping staff? The windows in the main hall on the individual floors have louvers that are always open. This seems nice with a nice breeze flowing through the hall. However, if it is really windy, your room door will rattle all night and it sounds as if someone is trying to enter your room. I NEVER EVER get a decent night's sleep here. I will be asking my company to place us at another hotel!!!!

Great location,close to every thing, not on the beach but only a short walk. Staff in reception,bar,and food service were attentive and courteous. Rooms are a bit small and dated but in a place like Waikiki who sits in the hotel. it's a lot less expensive than say the Outrigger on the beach.BUTin the Splash Bar the food menu and the food are way below an acceptable standard for a hotel of this class and management needs to address this problem. Now I am from Australia and we do have very high standards in our restaurants and maybe I need to lower my food expectations when visiting America

Nice small Hotel. Its open and tropical and feels like the Islands. Perfect Location next to the International Market, Across from Dukes and the beach with shopping all around. Check in time usually takes anywhere from 30 minutes to 1 hr. Very dissapointed in that. I dont want to travel that far at that expense and waste my time checking in. I still love the hotel but Im starting to shop for others based on the check in times.

What a wonderful place to stay! I was welcomed the very first day with a beautiful basket filled with fruits, juice and candy from Frederick Orr General Manager. I was upgraded to a wonderful Ocean Front/City view because of my Gold Starwood membership! EVERYONE..from the pool assistants to the bellman "Odair or Adair" were simply wonderful!The cleaning service was fantastic! The ladies were all so friendly! I went to a day adventure and "Marsha Southworthy" treated me like a royalty! I even was taken care of on the bus ride! She actually came and talked with me when I was leaving to see about my road trip. You really do feel like Royalty at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani! The "Polynesion Adventure Luau" was breathtaking!!!! They have performed for President Obama. Royalty yes I felt like a Princess! Perfect location to the beach! The beach service was so cool! The looks of faces when we were brought fresh fruit and water was priceless!! WOW!!! I will be back to Hawaii and I will stay here again!!! AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!

I stayed here with my husbund! Must say great location to beach only short walk to everything! The rooms are dated however the location & customer service made up for it! & really who cares when ur on holidays your out most of the day it's good value for the price you pay!!! Overall I would recommend this place for the value & the location most of all just across the road from the moana!

Visiting Hawaii for the first time we were told to say at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and I am so glad I did so close to everything, fantastic customer service from the room attendant to the reception I had the best of help from Marsha Southworth The tour consultant who help my wife and I book our day trips while staying here she explained everything to us which help us choose what would suit us We would highly recommend staying Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as if we are able to come back we would stay here again

My sister and I had an amazing time in Honolulu. The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani staff were great and helpful. I only have positive feedback for this hotel. Close to everything especially the beach! Thanks guys for the cheerful hospitality.

We were very impressed with the Princess Kaiulani. It's not on the beach, but the short walk goes by lots of stores and the reasonable service fee includes the use of beach towels, chairs and fresh pineapple at the beach and in the hotel. The location is very convenient to most of Waikiki and to the bus if you want to venture to town or to the mall. One surprise was the use of a shower and towels after check out. That was great as our flight was leaving late at night and we were able to check out of the hotel, leave our luggage, go to the beach, take a shower and clean up and go for a nice, leisurely dinner before driving to the airport. Talk about service! And the staff was exceptionally nice and helpful.

This hotel is great value for your buck. I am not sure why so many readers complain about this hotel. We found the location to be so great. Waikiki Beach is a few steps away, the international market is next door and everything is within a walking distance. We enjoyed our stay of 10 days very much. Our room 1262 had a great view of the water. What we saved on the hotel was used for our meals. Coffee maker in the room was convenient. Also the direct access from the parking lot toThe elevators were so convenient especially if you have a few things to carry. Swimming pool was conveniently located as well.

We just spent 8 nights at this hotel, from 1/30/13 to 2/7/13. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay. Reading over some of the reviews, I realize that there are obviously substantial differences in the quality of the rooms and you should be aware of this. We were initially upgraded from a standard room in the Kaiulani Wing to a pool-view room in the Princess Wing. Every night there is poolside entertainment (live music and here and there a dancer) and at first I was worried this would be too noisy. So I requested to see the Standard Room in the Kaiulani Wing where the rooms have either street or mountain views, to decide if I would not prefer that location. The Kaiulani Wing is older and the reception staff warned me that I would be getting a room that is rated lower than the Princess Wing room they gave us. The standard room in the older wing was nice enough, but the bathroom was somewhat dated and the view was not as nice as what we had, so we stayed in the Princess Wing. There is also the Ainahau Tower, the tallest of the three towers. Our room was pleasant and comfortable. It had a refrigerator, safe, hairdryer, 2 bathrobes, iron & ironing board, king size bed, 2 nightstands, dresser, desk and a chair, TV, a rattan lounge chair with a small high end table next to it, a balcony (called "lanai") and 2 chairs and a small stool on the balcony. I am pretty sensitive about the bed and the bedding and often feel that beds are too soft and bedding insufficient. Not so at Princess Kaiulani hotel. The king size bed was very comfortable and the covers comfortable and perfect. The large sliding door has both light blocking and sheer curtains that can be adjusted according to individual preference. We had good wireless reception for our laptop computer in the room. Our daily resort fee of $18/day included both the wireless internet and parking, in addition to some other small benefits like 2 waters per day. My one complaint about the room would be that there was no table for writing or eating. There was room for a table, but the hotel chose to place the lounge chair there instead. This lack of a table and 2 chairs was pretty annoying, since it was a working vacation for both of us and when one of us was using the desk, where we set up the computer, the other had no place to do any work, write, read, enjoy a beverage or eat. Without a table and 2 chairs, the only place to sit down was on the balcony or on the bed. Even low budget hotels usually have a table and 2 chairs as standard furnishings so it was disappointing that a hotel that should have been in a higher class than budget could not manage to provide such basic equipment as a table and 2 chairs in a room meant for 2. Other than that, the premises are well kept and pleasant, everything was always clean. Elevators run well and often. We didn't have much contact with the staff, except on the first day, when we were frustrated beyond belief by our simple request that they explain to us how to transport our luggage from our rented car that was parked in the parking lot to our room, by way of elevators rather than stairs, which appeared to be the only way to get out of the parking lot. Eventually we found the place where we needed to park to access the Ainahau Tower elevator from the parking lot, but it took us 1 1/2 hours from the time we checked in to the time we got our luggage in our room. We had to make several trips to reception, got locked in the emergency exit stairway (which we entered on the advice of hotel staff), had to walk 7 flights of stairs down before we were able to get out. The parking lot offers convenient parking if you plan to rent a car, but be aware that the principal way to get in and out of the parking lot is by stairs. The location is in the heart of Waikiki, directly across the Moana Surfrider, the oldest and one of the fanciest hotels in Waikiki. This location can be quite noisy - there is traffic and people noise drifting in from Kalakaua Avenue, and poolside there is entertainment and the bar also has singers and karaoke. Some of the bar guests can get noisy. However, if you close your balcony doors, about 95% of the noise is blocked out. We were on the 5th floor and had partial ocean view. If you are higher up, you will probably have better views and it may be less noisy. We had no problems with the bathroom. Good water pressure, nice non slip bottom on the tub, the shower can be used as hand-held or overhead shower. The faucets were easy to operate, and the shower had a safety bar to hold on to. We always had an extra roll of toilet paper, absolutely no problems in this area. The refrigerator was small but sufficient for some food or drinks. On the day of our arrival we received 2 vouchers for complimentary drinks at the hotel bar. When we went to use them, we learned that they were for a specific house drink, something that looked like a Mai Tai but was made with vodka. We were willing to give it a try, however, this drink was really disgusting. I poured mine into the flower pot next to my chair (because they wouldn't make me another drink while I still had an unfinished one) and my husband gave his away to the karaoke singer after he tasted mine and decided not to touch his. The karaoke singer took a sip and left the drink untouched after that. I think the drink might have been good if made with rum rather than vodka, but was really undrinkable the way it was prepared. Because of this experience at the bar, we did not go to the bar again, nor did we eat at the hotel. The breakfast buffet cost $24/person and the dinner buffet was $37/person, but I have no idea if these were good values or not. The hotel would do better to offer a complimentary beverage that tastes good rather than the stuff we received, or not to give any complimentary drinks at all. One unusual experience we had was with our safe. We placed our valuables there - cash, ATM card, credit cards - and by mistake left it open the whole day we were gone. When I discovered in the evening that the safe had been left open while we were gone, I braced myself for a substantial financial loss and hassle - yet everything was there, exactly as we left it. Needless to say, this was a pleasant surprise and says a lot about the quality of the hotel staff. The lobby has several computers available for the guests and has nice museum-style displays about Princess Kaiulani and her time period. Also of interest is the fact that located on the premises is a regular walk-in clinic, something I really appreciated because I became quite ill during the trip to Hawaii and needed to see a doctor. While I had to wait 1 1/2 hours to be seen, the treatment had me 95% back to normal the next day and saved our vacation. It was very convenient that a clinic was right there on the premises, open I believe 24/7.

This hotel is really very good. You can walk to everything from here. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are great. We ate at both their buffet and at the bar. No problems at all, yummy food at both. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful if we needed anything. Had an issue with the AC in our room and called the front desk. The maintenance man showed up in 15 minutes and had it fixed in five minutes. A record for a hotel. Just a good choice for Waikiki. Not the most plush but maybe the best all in all. They do have a resort fee but it includes parking so worth it if you have a rental car. Yummy mai tais at their bar and some really good munches!! Our second stay and I would go back anytime.

Conveniently located across the road from the beach, with easy access to shops and restaurants. The pool area was very basic and right near the foyer, bar and restaurant - in a fairly open area. But if you'd rather enjoy the lovely ocean at Waikiki Beach this won't be an issue. Most of the staff were very nice, however when I asked to use the phone down at the Concierge, the staff member told me to use the phone in my room. Getting up and down in the lift was also a bit of a hassle with all floors between 1-29 accessible in any lift, which meant long wait times. The decor of the rooms is also a bit outdated, but they are clean and efficient with housekeeping services. Do not expect a Resort type hotel, but if you're not planning to stay in your hotel much and would rather spend time in the lovely surrounds of Hawaii then this hotel is in a very convenient location.

Enjoyed a recent stay here very much. The staff are absolutely wonderful, so helpful, kindcheerful etc. Buffet expensive but very good, would however, be very nice to have asmall food outlet on the premises for casual eating...there are of course, many excellentplace to eat in the near vicinity, but nothing beats somewhere right on the premises.However, the quality of the buffet food was excellent, serving staff excellent, nice peacefulseating, and of course, the gorgeous big pool, trees and gardens...can't wait to stay again!Housekeeping staff particularly excellent.

Let me start off by saying that there are a lot of hotels in Honolulu and Waikiki that are in desperate need of updating. But I remember staying here over ten years ago and not a single thing has changed, and I'm including all the way down to the comforter and carpets. The place smells horrific too, like your grandmas house but moldier. I highly doubt the air quality would pass that of smoggy LA. The fact that Sheraton and SPG puts this hotel in the same Category 5 pricing along with the Sheraton Waikiki (which is actually on the beach) and the Moana Surfrider, a Westin (just across the street, historic, and actually on the beach as well) is pathetic. Sheraton should be ashamed of itself, its audacity.The staff is the one shining moment that has become a mainstay and salvation for all Sheraton and SPG hotels that I've stayed at in the last few years. The girl that we checked in with took her time to explain what was included in the resort fee (exactly same benefits as the sheraton waikiki) She made sure we had a nice room location since we were SPG gold members. The bartender at the pool bar was great about the free welcome drink. Overall I love the staff, they are great, and definitely earned another star for this hotel.The Room: Pathetic. The carpet, the furniture, the bedding, the chair, the safe, EVERYTHING is original to when this hotel was built. And I had to look it up. Built in 1955. There is no way its been updated since then. For the money they want you to pay I simply can not believe it. The bed was very uncomfortable, way to squishy for me, soft is not even the right word, its uneven support left me with a terrible backache. The bathroom is teeny tiny and has the original small white tile with moldy grout. The highlight of the room by far is the large balcony with great views of the ocean and Waikiki Beach. But of course forget about seeing Diamond Head because the Hyatt built its tall towers right in the way. No one travels to Waikiki just to sit in the room but this doesn't really even live up to basic expectations at this price point. And remember, if you get a room that faces the pool, thus faces the main street in Waikiki, it is going to be loud all day and night, whether it be street noise, kids playing at the pool noise, or music coming from all over. Oh yeah, and because the hotel is so old, there is no wireless internet in the room. If you're important enough they do offer a verizon mifi hotspot they will let you borrow.Overall this hotel is like most in Waikiki. That said, its old and needs to be updated. That said, for about the same price or exact same point redemption you can be across the street actually on the beach staying in an updated room since the Eisenhower administration. Don't waste your money, book early at a better spot. Sorry Sheraton, you know you need some help, so do it so you can justify the price. I stayed here probably ten years ago and payed around 100 bucks, that was fair, anymore then that is not worth it.

Stayed for 1 night. The rooms are a little dated and the room was kind of cramped, but the cleanliness was good. The staff is friendly. Self parking is good as the lot is next door. However, if you need an elevator (for stroller/handicapped) at the parking garage, it's located on the top floors (9ish I think). The location makes most things in Waikiki within walking distance, which is good since driving around and parking could get kind of cumbersome. I wouldn't mind staying here again.

A few points1. this hotel is not on the beach. it is one block away from the beach. If you do not get higher floor room, you will not see ocean2 The staff are very freindly3. This hotel is very clean but outdated. comfortable bed but very basic. It had its time of glory in the past. 4. if your room is facing the pool. be ready for nightly hawaiian musc band by the pool. It is nice but could loud if you want a peace of mind before 9 PM5. Resort fee cover one drink, parking, 2 small bolltes of water and few other small stuffs6. There is no club lounge for platinum member. You are out of your luck. You may get a contnental breakfast or 500 points. Your choice. Breakfast is basic. I did pay 10 extra dollars to get full breakfast buffet from the continental breakfast they offered me. 7. NO wireless internet. You can not use your tablet in the room. You have to go down stair. In the room, it is cable internet.8. The hotel price is cheaper then Sheraton Waikiki which is one block away right on the beach. However, the point and cash price is the same. I love SPG but I have to advise member if you are using cash and points, Try to get in Sheraton Waikiki. They are ver nice right on the beach and has club lounge for platinum member ( I took a walk down there to check it out)9. this hotel is clean which is very improtant to me.

This was our third time staying here, and we love it more each time! The front desk crew is amazing and the beach services/pool crew is great. The housekeeping staff as well as maintenance personnel were very helpful and industrious, The one and only complaint is the Splash Bar. No matter what time-day or night- we would stop in to get something to eat or drink, it was as if we were invisible. The waitresses would visit among themselves and not really pay attention to the customers. If they did take an order, they were slow to bring the orders and the drinks weren't good.

Stayed in January 2013Great location. Very close to the beach. Right beside the international market. In the middle of everything. The location would probably be one of the hotel's strongest points.Walking into the hotel, it was nice but nothing extraordinary. Staff was helpful.However I must say that the hallways going to the rooms looked really dated. They need renovations for sure. But hallways are just hallways. The room was just fine. Housekeeping did their job. The view was fantastic from the 25th floor. We could see the ocean, the mountains and the streets of Waikiki. It was terrific to wake up to this view every morning and was just great to sit there late in the afternoon.Did not try food in the hotel since it was a little pricey but there are LOTS of food options around.I would stay in this hotel again if I would come back to Waikiki.

Can't wait to get back to the Princess, we've stayed there a couple of times and we love it for the location to the beach and the nightly entertainment that they have around the pool. Just the other day I said to my husband that the one thing I'm looking most forward to is sitting by the pool with the music to listen to and a LavaFlow in hand. Did I mention that I can't wait to get back there?

well I forgot to do this we stayed september 2012and you bet we will go back it was clean the staff were so friendly it was like being at home and being waited on hand and foot. the food was really good the only thing we did not like about it was OUR STAY WAS FAR TO SHORT. but as we said before we will go back there.next time for at least 10 days

Good location and bed.........but they insisted I stay on the Kaiulani wing......which is very noisy. I had a feeling that if I had been Japanese........they would have upgraded me when I asked. I will NOT stay here again. Very poorly managed hotel.

Great location, close to everything, across the street from the ocean.All staff was helpful and showed us the Aloha spirit, which for a large hotel is saying something.Rooms were OK, clean, not fancy, but the view,price and location made up for that. We have stayed across the street at both the Outrigger and the Mauna and the PK, asour taxi driver called it, was just as nice for half the price. I highly recommend it.

We booked through price line and got to stay here for $99.00 a night. We did have to pay a resort charge of $18.95 a night. For this fee you got 2 bottles of water and internet access. You also gotcomplimentary parking which by itself is $25.00 a day.There are restaurants which offer buffets which are quite pricey.You have the beach across the 4 lane and down the street. Less than 10 minute walk. It does not take that long actually walking but rather waiting for crosswalks and traffic. Directly across the street on the side street where you enter there is a McDonalds,Taco Bell and Subway as well as an ABC store.If you plan ahead you can get transportation to here from airpoirt for about $16.00. A cab will run 40-50 dollars and shuttle service at airport will run about $30.00 for 2.Just do internet search and book ahead is the key to much lower cost transportation. There is a lot you can see without renting a car if you just plan ahead. Look for coupons for the tourist attractions and tours because the prices can be quite different for the same things.The unprepared tourist will pay top dollar for the lack of knowledge on choices. Rental car will actually save you money in the long run just in food cost alone as everything in Wakaii is grossly overpriced.There is a Walmart down the road a piece and expect to pay around 20% more than at home for most items. Beef and dairy is very expensive. I would stay here again as I experienced no problems but like I said before, do your homework or you can expect to pay a lot more than the rate I posted here.

We were heading to Maui for a conference, decided to stop over in Oahu for a few day and chose the Princes for our stay. We were very pleased with the room, view and service. The hotel is aging, but the bed is wonderful, bathroom large and staff are great.

My mother and I stayed here for a week and I was worried after reading the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. From the moment we arrived we loved every minute of our stay. We have both been to Waikiki numerous times but wanted to try somewhere new after staying at the other sheraton the past 2 years and not having such a great time. The staff at the princess are friendly, the room was nice(we were upgraded), I enjoed the pool area and we loved the casual pool bar for a cocktail and light bite. We hope to stay here on our next visit and we have recommended it to all our friends

We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The room service was great and the atmosphere was welcomingMostly though, we loved Marsha Southworth on the activities desk. She was marvellous! So helpful and kind, she even gave me cough drops when I had a sore throat! She was so friendly and very knowledgeable. An absolute pleasure to deal with!!

After ready reviews I was very skeptical of what my stay would be like. We were given a room in the Ocean Tower and it was clean, loved the bed linens European style comforters and pillows. We're disappointed we did not have room Internet but when we mentioned it we were given a wireless box for our room. The hotel charged $18 dollars a day but that included parking and Internet. This is the lowest we have paid. You can not ask for better staff, from the front desk to our housekeeper. The hotel is older but have numerous activities daily,entertainment Hawaiian style, and best of all the location is perfect,and the Hotel is clean. You get great value here just across the street from the beach without beach prices. Close to all Waikiki activities. But you miss Oahu if all you see is Waikiki.We extended our original stay of 9 days to 12. I will be coming back in May and will stay here again given the same accommodations.Thank you to the staff for a great stay.

great location. all the buses and trolleys pick up accross the street. major restaurants and the international marketplace are within 2 blocks. the hotel itself has poor entertainment. bathrooms need upgrading the view of the beach and street is fabulous, but you must stay in the tower to see the water. the service is very good.the food is excellent.

This is a nice not too fancy hotel in downtown Honolulu. It is not fancy in the rooms or hallways, but it was clean, the sheets and bed were wonderful and the staff were really pleasant and helpful. The location is great right beside the international market Across the street from the beach. The lobby restaurant so good.

Best place for everything! Night life! Lots to do party till AM! Or be lazy at the pool or walk across the street to catch some waves! Great Surfboard rental close to hotel "Big Wave Daves" Is da best, like new boards and surf lessons! The Hotel small rooms but very quiet, clean ,excellent service! all staff were very friendly! Dinners in the close farmer's Market next door + best prices for tourist stuff! and gifts! oh yea SHOPPING! Tour the island! close Pear Harbor, polynesian culture center a MUST get the FULL Package it includes a huge endless lunch and dinner and a show one you'll have never seen before!

I stayed for a week in January, and thought to myself every single day that I needed to get away from this place. The room, "an upgraded city view", was in reality facing alleyways, the back of buildings, and the top of the adjacent international market of junk. For one person, the room size was fine. For two, probably still OK. For a family of four? It would be a nightmare. Everything was very dated. I called it "Panama City, Florida, cheap, 70's style". The veneer was peeling off the furniture. The cloth chairs were stained and disgusting. The carpet was worn. The worst? The bathroom. Not just vintage ugly, but moldy, under the sink and above the shower. The shower was tiny, with a shower curtain so close to you that you hated to get in. The only redeeming thing about the room was the bed, which was comfortable in accordance with mid-range Sheraton bedding. The racket from the street, filtering up from in front of the market at night was irritating, with street performers using amplifiers to sing, cajole, and harass passers-by. Location is fine, with "beaches to the left, and retail to the right". I did not eat a single meal here. There are lots of better options. No wireless, although the wired Internet service was fine. This was a business trip, and there were quite a few of us all staying here. Their reaction was similar. I would seek alternate accommodations until they can get a substantive room refresh done.

We enjoyed our stay so much last year that we decided to come back. It's a perfect location virtually across the street from Waikiki beach. The resort fee increased but it's not bad for what you get (wi-fi, international calling, parking, water, fruit, beach chairs). We were upgraded to a pool view room which was fabulous until the door lock stopped working. It was so bad that their own staff couldn't get in and a locksmith had to come fix it. Totally destroyed a day of our vacation but the hotel did their best to make up for it. The rooms are dated and they were actually working on updating some rooms while we were there. We weren't too happy about the "updating construction" but it has to be done some time. Last year, they were working on the construction in the lobby. We are hoping to return next year but it looks like the rates are increasing. Great friendly staff!

I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a full week in Jan 2013. The hotel itself is a bit dated, but my room was clean and everything worked properly so I have no complaints about my room. Sheraton beds are incredibly comfortable and usually provide a good night sleep, and this hotel delivered. As a Starwood Platinum member I was upgraded to an ocean view corner room on a high floor which was a nice perk. The hotel has an $18 per day resort fee that is not included in the advertised price. This resort fee includes parking, internet, use of the pool/fitness center, and a couple bottles of free water each day. I was pleased that there was actually some value in the resort fee since I needed parking and internet, but everyone should know that the fee is mandatory even if you do not use the services included. The location is right in the heart of Waikiki and directly across the street from the beach. The street noise is loud in Waikiki at night and there is little you can do to escape the noise, it just goes with the location. I would consider this to be a lower to mid priced hotel in Waikiki and the service and accomodations seemed to fit the room rate. I would be happy to return to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani if priced fair.

This is a nice hotel with great location. Sitting between Kuhio and Kalakaua and right across the street from Westin, this hotel is at the center of Waikki. You can walk everywhere from the hotel. I had a pool facing room (no ocean view). The room is not luxurious, but its clean, nice and good size. Balcony facing the pool was great for relaxing. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.

Tiny, tiny, tiny. No wireless internet. Outdated bathroom fixtures. Desperately in need of remodeling. The lobby and pool area was okay, but the rooms were awful. Good location and convenient to beach.

My wife and I have had six vacations in Waikiki (she never knows where she's going on vacation every year, but if we end up in Waikiki between April 19 and 26, it will be our 7th). Every time we go, we stay at the Princess Kaiulani. There is no question about that. We always get a high ocean view room. I've been in better rooms in Atlanta, Seattle, New York, etc., but all I really care about in Waikiki is the balcony, right? The staff at the Princess Kaiulani are so friendly and obliging. My wife thinks she's in paradise when we travel to Hawaii. A huge part of that is the Princess Kaiulani experience. If I ever suggested staying anywhere else, it would touch off World War III. I'm glad in a way to hear some people say they will never stay there again, because it reduces the chances that the SPK will be booked when I want to go there.

Let me preface by saying I enjoy staying here and have stayed here for the last 4 yrs.Location is great, ground level pool and bar and coffee hut steps away.Nightly free shows on a poolside stage that you can have dinner/buffet and watch.I have stayed at top beachfront, condos and cheaper hotelsIn Waikiki and have to say the 25 dollar a day price increase makes it dificult for me to choose the PK for the next year.. Also have been a starwood member for a few years now and see no real benefit, for instance at check in went to spg line and regular line was moving spg wasnt.They also told me that they upgraded my room, they didnt... i got the room i paid for high ocean view. Have enjoyed my stays but I also know there is a better bang for the buck.Waikiki is paradise but may be time to look for new patch on paradise.J.

I stayed at this hotel for about 10 days during New Year 2013. I travel a lot and like to do all my booking in advance. That time I made my reservation in August, so it was about 4 months in advance. Since I was traveling with my friend I sent a request to the hotel asking for room with 2 Queen beds. For some reason you can't specify it during reservation process. Next day I received an email where they confirmed that got my request and it was noted. Well, as I found later 'noted' means nothing at Sheraton PK. At the time we arrived we got a room with King Size bed. Lady at the reception tried to tell me that there's no any requests. I showed her an original mail thread about it and she 'found' it but said that request depends on availability and they don't have anything available at this point. It means they just ignored my request because I can't believe that in August hotel was booked completely. I understand that mistakes happen sometimes. Usually is such situation hotel offers you free breakfast / drinks / room upgrade / free nights. Not Sheraton PK. They gave us free roll-away bed, that's it. Next day I sent a complain and received a confirmation that they got it. No one contacted me. Later after the trip I sent another feedback directly to Sheraton web-site and was ignored again.Few things you want to know in addition to my terrible management experience:1. I stayed in Ocean View room. And actually in other hotels it will be called partial ocean view room because you can't see ocean just from you window/balcony directly. It's on you left side.2. Rooms could have some renovation. It's pretty small but clean.3. Hotel charges you $18 per day for 2 bottles of water, parking and internet. But there wasn't Wi-Fi in my room.4. I liked their room service. They were really nice and did their work well.So don't expect a lot from that hotel, especially from management prospective.

Stayed here nine years ago, nothing much has changed, but the room this time was inferior to previous, but comfortable and clean. The beds are awesome. However the bathrooms are severely dated, the chrome had all but dissapeared from the fittings and it was in serious need of a revamp. The location is of course splendid, and I thought good value, although, having looked to book for this Christmas, 2013, the prices are considerably higher. The two real downsides were, the staff looked down on you if you were only a Preferred member of the loyalty scheme, and the noise outside our room in the loading bay was at times intolerable at all hours of the day and night, but we basically enjoyed ourselves. I forgot, we would have had to practically wrestle a waitress to the ground to get any attention in the pool area, well actually we never got served once in ten days.

Stayed here 12/18-21/12 - We had a room on the 29th Floor. The view was great but at night the wind howled and we could hear it all night long as well as the noise on the streets. The sliding doors are not sound proof. The bedroom was too small as well as the bathroom. The buffets looked great, however they were hardly affordable. On the positive side, the location is great, there was a beautiful display of gingerbread houses, representing all over the world. A chef appeared in the morning and explained how it was made. The children were very fasinated with it. The lobby area was beautiful, as well as the pool area. The amenities are annoying but all of the hotels have them. If there is a next time, I will be looking for a more reasonably priced hotel. After all, we really were out and about most of the days and were just there to sleep.

This hotel is great if you want to show the kids what a hotel in 1965 was like. They have "preserved " this place like an artifact. I gave them two stars because the staff was very kind and always tried to be accommodating.We stayed in two different room types. Our first room was a voluntary downgrade to the "older tower". They were oversold and willing to offer all kinds of goodies to transfer down. We lasted one night. The room reminded me of traveling in eastern Europe thirty years ago. Just plain bad!we moved back to our original reservation for the rest of our stay. The room was better, we had an ocean view, but the room was not as nice as your average embassy suite.The hotel pool is a joke. I have seen better pools at old Holiday Inns. They are not located on the beach . You have to carry your pool chair & towels about a full city block to the beach. No umbrellas provided, every few hours a guy from the hotel comes by the beach and offers to fetch you a cold water.The worst thing here is the dinner show. They claim it is "award winning" but ive seen better high school productions. they story line was impossible to follow. the price was outragous. They start the show with a ten minute presentation trying to sell you swimming suits that is so pitiful my table thought it was a comedy routine!Most of the audience was Japanese, all of the food in the showroom and hotel buffet is prepared for the Japanese tourist, they may have liked the show better if you dont try to understand what they are saying on stage.I would not stay here again.most of the guests are japanese tourist on group tours and airline flight crews.The final affront was that nothing at this plaace was cheap. I paid over three hundred dollars per room.

We stayed at this hotel before and after our cruise. The hotel was in a great location. Short walking distance to the beach, stores (many designer stores), restuarants and attractions (zoo and aquarium).The staff at check-in were friendly and helpful. So were the staff at the bell desk.The hotel offers:-Pool-Restaurant/ bar-Concierge desk-Tour desk -$18 resort fee per day includes use of the facilities, water bottle, a non-alcholic drink from the bar and one hour of long distance calls to anywhere in the world.-easy access to the beach, stores and attractions-computer terminals / with printers in the main lobby. This is complimentary to all guests. My one criticism is that the rooms/lobby were very outdated (looks like the last renovation was from the 80s).If you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room, then I would suggest this hotel.

I'm a little late with this review but here it goes.Pros - excellent location, fairly cheap, great bell hops and concierge. Pink trolley stop close bycons - "resort fee" is an absolute joke - $18ish per night!!! All I got out of it was 2 bottles of water per day = expensive water. I didn't have a car (What I really paid for was other people's children) The hookers nearby were a turn offNot sure if ill stay there again when I return thus year. Can anyone suggest a similar location and price without a resort fee

I have taken the time to read some of the reviews in here about this hotel and I find them very surprising to have people complaining about this Sheraton. First of all the hotel is not new. It is an old hotel located 100 yards from direct Waikiki Beach and within 100 feet of all the 5 star shops along the main streets. So yes, the hotel is not new and it is clearly not 5 stars. But most everyone in here have complaints about simple and small things that only a 5 star hotel would have better. And let me assure you that a 5 star hotel in Waikiki is around $600-1000 per night. This Sheraton is around $170-250 per night. HUGE DIFFERENCE. All of these competing hotels are within 100 feet of the front door to this hotel. If you truly desire to spend that kind of extra money for a hotel to get extreme luxury, then go ahead and spend the money. But if you want a 4 star hotel that has TREMENDOUS views and in really decent, clean and nice shape for being this old, then this is your hotel. Think about it! Seven days here instead of the other hotels will allow you virtually pay for your entire vacation from the savings. If I ever come to Honolulu again, I would never stay anywhere else. It simply does not make any financial sense, unless of course, you have so much money that it does not matter. I don't so this is my hotel. And a very nice one too. Check out the photos from the balcony of my room I put in here. Really nice views from this hotel.

Very disappointed in the hotel - not up to normal Sheraton Resort standards. The location is great-right in the middle of shopping, restaurants, and just across the street from the beach. The rooms are in desperate need of renovation - our closet door fell off the first day we checked in. The balcony looked over the pool and we could see part of the beach but the bars were rusted and the concrete floor was cracked so badly we were afraid to stay on it for fear the whole balcony would just fall off. By far, the best part about the hotel was the tour desk operator Marsha Southworth. She was outstanding, very patient, helpful, and made our trip everything we had hoped for.

I spent 5 nights here and it was just an average hotel. The location was good, right across the street from Waikiki beach. We had a room on the 20th floor with an ocean view which was great. You can tell this is an old hotel and could stand some new updates to the room but I didn't go there to stay in the room. It was functional and worked for us. Would I stay here again? I think so if the price was right.

Firstly likes: FANTASTIC location only steps from the beach, shops and the International Market Place, the fact that there are 3 other Starwood properties located within walking distance means lots of options for dining out that can be charged back to the room and the bed was great - fantastic night sleep. Dislikes: corridors looked like an old hospital, musty and slow elevators, stained and peeling wallpaper, faded carpet, very small bathroom with tarnished fittings (I had the same tiles in my flat in the '70's). We didn't pay for an ocean view so the standard room looked out on to adjacent rooftops and commercial waste bins. No screen to the balcony so left it closed off and air conditioner didn't have a thermostat - it was either on or off and the outlet was level with my partner's face and on the wall so he had sinus by the 2nd day? Pool was full of noisy children and there was lots of empty cups and debri around the area so spent very little time in the resort. It was within walking distance to just about everything which worked for us. Very glad we only had 2 nights as we had spent most of our time in Maui and it didn't tarnish our memories of Hawaii.

We spend two nights in this hotel centrally located in Honolulu, near Waikiki Beach. Apart from the location, which is really in the center of everything, the hotel is old and need a renovation. Our room, very small with an old bathroom, and a view over the parking. If you think to stay here, ask for the rooms with the view on the swimming pool, those are the best ones with wifi. The rooms in the tower are the oldest and without wifi. Not to come again.

After reading other reviews, I wasn't all together suprised about our experience at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. My frist impression as I got off of the elevator was I was in the wrong hotel. It smelled and looked more like a Holiday Inn/Best Western than a Sheraton. I had called prior to our stay and was told that the hotel had been renovated...not sure what was renovated, but it certainly is not the rooms or the common areas. We checked in and were given a Gold Upgrade to a nice view of the alley. If you craned your neck to the left, you could see a bit of the ocean though, so yes, it was nicer than some of the rooms...but we got to hear the garbage trucks in the alley every morning about 6 AM. Not good for catching up on some well deserved rest.The room itself was clean, but very very dated....seemed reminescent of early 80's...not an upscale category 5 resort that you would expect in a Starwood Resort Destination. The towels are what you would find in the above mentioned hotel chains, and the beds are not the trypical comfy Starwood beds...first Sheraton I have stayed in and experienced this. The elevators were often full and can take awhile to get down to the lobby during busy times...which seemed to be most of the time. Parking was convient, but we had trouble finding a spot a couple of times. Wasn't too much of an issue.We didn't eat at the restaurant, but the buffet looked nice.We didn't use the pool, but it looked like it too could use some renovation...big peeling off spots on the bottom of the poolThe best part about the pool area was the ability to borrow beach chairs...we ended doing that every day and getting away from Waikiki and exploring other areas of the island. It would be nice to be able to have more than one towel to use, but that is all you are allowed. Overall, it was OK, not great, and if you are going to spend the $ to stay here, you may want to save a few dollars and head about a block down and stay at the Holiday Inn. The location is central and walking distance to anywhere in Waikiki, but it is VERY crowded.

Yes it is old (stayed 21 years ago for honeymoon and not much is updated) but our room was clean , housekeeping excellent, check-in was efficient and we were upgraded on arrival to beach/pool view room, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast buffet was well catered and organised. Location excellent - one block back from Waikiki Beach and right next door to International Markets. Beach side service offered was great - grab a towel and beach chair from the poolside staff, set yourself up on the beach, and water and fresh fruit will be delivered to you on the beach at 11.30am and 1.30pm. Excellent gym facilities - large variety of exercise machines. Tour desk operator very helpful. Live music each night added great atmosphere - lovely to see some hula dancing. Given drink vouchers on arrival for free "Princess Punch" (Non- alchoholic) and happy hour each afternoon for half-price drinks. This is a good place to base yourself during a trip to Waikiki.

We stayed at this property over Christmas this year. The hotel is dated but the location is excellent. I was disapointed with the $18 per night resort fee that we were not informed about at the time of booking. Also the bathrooms have alot of mold in them and the maid staff constantly forget to refill tea, water, cups and coffee. Overall it was good value for the money but I think they should invest in some bleach for the bathrooms and include the resort fee when you are booking the hotel.

Have been staying at this property in the month of December for the last few years.It is in a good location. One block off the beach. The servers in Splash Bar are excellent.This year our stay was disappointing.We are SPG members and hotel did not have a record of our reservation. We had booked a special package rate and had to explain this at check-in.We had to explain everything that was offered in the package. Asked for late checkouton our final day and was told we had to pay. I enquired why when we were gold members.We were told we could have the 4pm checkout and then the associate standing at the nextcomputer said no we couldn't had to be 1pm. At the same time this associate was dealingwith an older woman who was having problems with her air conditioning. This associatedismissed her in a rude manner and then started to belittle her, in front of me, to anotherassociate behind the counter. I asked if we were getting an upgraded room which is anotherperk for gold members. Yes we were. Which seemed strange as the hotel had no record ofus being gold members.We went to our assigned room and it was everything I had not requested in my list of specialrequests in my original booking.Housekeeping was excellent for the first three days. We leave a gratuity everyday. We stopped because things changed. The closet doors looked as if a previous guest had shaken a can of coke, opened it, and let it spray all over the doors. That was never cleaned. I wiped three of the louvers and the sticky substance was easy to remove. I didn't finish the job.On the 8th day housekeeping returned to excellent. We did fill out a form in the room and left it with the front desk. Our complaints were neveracknowledged.The hotel needs to be renovated. Our bathroom was moldy around the ceiling in the shower.The taps in the tub dripped. The sink and toilet seat had cracks in them. The sink faucetsare very old. Chrome worn off to reveal brass underneath. Water leaked from base of faucets.One serious concern was the balconies beside us. The concrete was deteriorating and therebar is exposed. Public washrooms in the hotel are not cleaned very frequently. A gooey chocolate cookie was dropped outside the elevator on our floor and lumps were picked up after three days. mushed bits never cleaned.This is the tip of the iceberg. I'll stop here.

Check in wasn't very efficient but our rooms were ready. We had a high tower ocean view room. The room was a good size, very clean & a small balcony. bathroom was well equipped. Free Internet available in a comfortable lounge area. Being Xmas, there was a ginger bread city being made to the delight of children and adults alike. All staff were very helpfull.Booking tours was easy with a tour desk in the lobby. This motel is very central. Waikiki beach is 1 block away. International market place practically next door ( great for shopping ). Enjoyed our stay here and would return again.

Since I cannot have it all, I would rather pay less money for a room, and spend more money on activities during my vacation....so that being said, I think I got what I paid for. The room was ok. Yes the place was dated, but I expected that. It was close to the beach and shops. The beds were ok (I have a very soft bed at home). All of my interactions with the staff were pleasant. Room was very clean. Did it help that we tipped every day instead of leaving a tip at the end? There could have been a problem when we first checked in with the room, but it was dealt with. I did find it a bit noisy outside when we were trying to sleep the first couple of nights (Thurs and Fri) but again, what else would I expect in Waikiki? I do not remember being told about the $18/day resort fee (covers wifi, bottled water, parking...), so that was a surprise. The wifi did not reach up to the 17th floor, so I used wifi in the lobby, that was a little bit disappointing. I had to make an effort to get my money's worth of the $18 charge, which I did not, but considering I did not have any other problems, it was all ok.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and absolutely love it. While it is basic, it has everything you need and it is centrally located. It is across from the beach and while you aren't ON the beach, it is a 30 second walk across the road.

We got a great deal over the Christmas break for this hotel so it was a good deal but you get what you pay for. I expected more from a Sheraton but should have known the price was a little too goo to be true. We have been here many times before and based on the other hotels I/We stayed at before we will pick a different hotel again next trip back to Waikiki.My review out of 5 (1 not good and 5 being excellent)Location - 4. Across the street from Waikiki so a very good location with many shops and restaurants within a few minute walk.Staff 3.5. Would be a 4 based on the guy we dealt with at check in. But, we had an issue with our room and when we went down to ask for a new room the girl that helped us was quite dismisive and didn't show very much concern about our issue (our first room given to us was dirty).Room 2. The 2nd room we were given was clean and has provided a place to sleep but is about 20 years overdue for a renovation and isn't really acceptable to fly the Sheraton flag. The walls are paper thin and shake every time a neighbour closes their door. Perhaps they should re brand as a Super 8 or Travelodge. The shower was an old basic plastic insert with a semi functional shower head. Blue carpet and furniture from the 80's. The positives were the ocean view was quite good as advertised and the bed was quite comfy (looked to be an older non pillowtop bed but was much comfier than the newer model of beds at some updated Sheraton or Starwood Hotels).Elevators - 3. There were 4 elevators for the tower but seemed that only 3 were working. At times (5 pm'ish) there was a wait of 5 + minutes and 30 + people waiting to get on so that was kind of annoying.Gym - 3. Okay. Did the job.Pool - 3. Okay, but the sun doesn't hit the pool until at least 10:30 am because it is in a courtyard that is blocked by the buildings. The hotels right on Waikiki have much nicer pools.Restaurants N/A - Did not eat at the hotel.Overall a generous 3 out of 5. Hey Starwood, get this hotel to get it up to standard!!!

We spent ten nights at the Princess Kaiulani and were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is great value for the price. The room we had was not fancy, but it was clean and comfortable. The staff are all friendly. We got in late the first day and found the tv not to be working at all, but a maintenance worker came quickly when we called and the tv was replaced. It is a very busy hotel and it is true that there can be a lot of noise from the street, but it is in the heart of waikiki and the noise did not affect us at all. It is a half block to the beach and the hotel provides chairs and beach mats for guests as well as water and fruits twice a day. It takes about 3 minutes to get to the beach. The pool area is nice and there is entertainment in the evenings. During the day there are art and craft sellers in the lobby. We could stay anywhere in Waikiki we want, including beachfront hotels, but we would certainly chose to stay at The Princess again as it has everything we need .

The hotel is on Kalakauwa Ave (the main street) in Waikiki. It's just across the street from the best part of Waikiki Beach. The most desireable (and expensive) hotels are right on the beach. Princess K is across the street. Still pricey, my room was $179 a night + $18 per day resort fee + a variety of taxes. It cost about $210 a night. But the location is great.The room was a very nice size and in good condition. The king bed was extremely comfortable. Each room has a lanai which was a nice size. There were 2 chairs and a small table there. I sat out on the lanai and had coffee & breakfast each morning. It was lovely to look out on the water. There were numerous surfers and boats out, even in the early morning. We tried to sit out on the lanai in the evening. We could hear the live music 22 floors below, but it was much too windy.The room did have a small refrigerator, a coffee maker with coffee resupplied daily, and a safe. Nice to have. We brought in beverages and breakfast foods.The pool was not heated and was colder than the ocean. I tried it and it was painful (due to the cold). I asked why it wasn't heated and was told "there are only 2 heated pools in Hawaii." Whatever, for over $200 a night, it would have been nice to be able to swim, albeit December. I only saw 2 girls in the pool once. Otherwise, it was empty.We ate in the poolside restaurant once for lunch. The fare was typical: soups, salads, and sandwiches. They were fine. The pineapple ice tea was delicious.The shops in the hotel are overpriced, and unnecessary. Right next door is the International market and for the next couple of miles hundreds of lovey shops. So, shop outside the hotel.The staff was very attentive. The bellman, operators, and guest services were always very helpful and friendly. They deserve 5 stars ***** !

Convenient location in the heart of Waikiki. Rooms with pool views are great, definitely worth it. Staff is friendly and nice, starting with GM Fred. Pool is nice. Rooms are clean, not super trendy, but overall this property again gets a thumbs-up. Will return!

Stayed for three nights as part of our Cosmos tour. Room was nice and clean. Hotel is close to wiakiki and plenty of places to eat nearby. ABC stores all around to pick up snack drinks beer or wine. Would stay here again.

No doubt this is an old hotel but the location is great! Right in the heart of Waikiki with everything all around it, it is certainly well placed. Facilities are adequate, rooms are clean. Most nights we just left the balcony doors open to let in the lovely trade winds - never had to turn on the air conditioning. There are internet kiosks at the lobby area, complete with printers(free b/w prints, $1 per page for color)! This is a hotel favored by many tour groups so it can get a lil crowded at times, esp when waiting to use the lifts. Service is prompt, people are friendly .

I think I wrote a review on this property several years ago, but this is my most recent visit. Nothing fancy about the rooms, but they are perfectly acceptable and clean and I've never had a room without a balcony which is wonderful in this climate. Public areas are fairly sterile and crowded. I've never used the pool, which seems rather small. It is not on the beach, but convenient to the beach. Convenient location. You can charge to the room at the other Starwood properties in Waikiki. While there is an ABC Store directly across from the main entrance, if you are staying in the tower furthest from the reception (where I've always ended up), if you exit the hotel to the right as you leave the elevator there is a much more convenient ABC Store (and the rooms have refrigerators). Staff varies in helpfulness. I've never eaten in the hotel, but there are lots of options nearby. There are $2 shuttles to the Ala Moana Center in the area so you don't need to take a taxi. Generally when in Waikiki I stay here as it is usually a good value.

Loved this hotel! The hotel is really nice, our room was a little worn, but absolutely loved this place. We had a wonderful view over the pool and of the ocean. We sat out on our balcony and watched the show at night. The hotel is very conveniently located. They do charge a $18 resort fee, but it includes parking and water and fruit service at the beach. Got thru priceline bidding, so it was a very good value for us.

Stayed for two nights.This was our second time at this hotel & we enjoyed it just much as the first.Excellent, friendly service, Excellent location ( close walk to everywhere in Waikiki), & great value for money. High room with Ocean views, comfy bed, & free internet kiosks in the large lobby.

We returned to Waikiki and wanted to stay someplace smaller than the Sheraton Waikiki. While the Sheraton has been newly refurbished and is beautiful, it is large and busy. We have stayed there twice now. The Sheraton Princes Kaiulani is older and smaller but I felt a little friendlier. We never had to wait in line for an elevator, and while older, the hotel was clean and for the price you can not beat the PK. We would return here again. It is located right across the street from the Moana Surfrider and next door to the International Market Place. The only suggestion would be to ask for a higher floor if you don't want to hear the busy happenings on Kalakaua Avenue.

First the good. After several inquiries, was finally given a router which allowed us to have wifi in our room. Booked an ocean view room. Room did have a great ocean view.Now the bad, no wifi in room unless you go through the hoops to get it. Had to make three calls, get a case number from tech support, go downstairs to the lobby and get approval from the manager. If u don't speak English well, you would never be able to get it. Had the breakfast buffet the day after the marathon since didn't want to walk far. Probably the worst breakfast in recent memory - 1. Besides the $24.95 fee, waitress said there will be an extra charge for black tea ( in the end, it did not appear on our bill though) 2. Grilled fish from washoku section was so dry, only had one bite 3. Misoshiru tasted like it came from a powdered mix 4. Couldn't find any chopsticks - asked the waitress and she said its in the omelette bar area, not the washoku area 5. Waitresses seemed to be more interested in talking among each other rather than serving customers.

Our room had the most beautiful view from our balcony and we found the service wonderful with very friendly staff. We had one hour free phone service including overseas calls and also we had use of free computers in the main foyer everyday. the woman who was at the tour desk was exceptionly effecient at explaining what was on offer and how much. the concierge was very helpful when we had to book our ride to the airport. we did find the breakfast menu expensive so we went elsewhere to eat. this hotel was worth the money we paid and would certainly stay there again.

The rooms are small and need upgrade, especially the bathrooms. Mold is on many of the surfaces and the vent in the bathroom looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months. Rooms lacks electrical outlets and has very little work space. The air conditioning is very noisy. They charge for everything, i.e. internet, phone calls, etc. Poor choice with other quality properties around.

Stay away from this hotel (far far away). The rooms are cramped and outdated (though I will say the view from our room was fantastic). The service was about the worse I have experienced (and I am platinum at SPG (their hotel group). The staff did not seem to want to be there (with maybe once exception and he did not seem to have a handle on his job) and were not helpful. And they claim on their website "wireless high speed internet access in Guest rooms by request. This is simply not true. When I got there I called and asked about the wireless and I was informed that the "tower" did not have wireless only wired. This is a pain. I use mostly my IPAD and it cannot use wired and it is a pain to have to be at the desk. And the bottom line is they say it is available. This stay was in June and let the management know about this issue and I just checked and their website still says what I listed above. The experience was so unpleasant that I did not stay at the Starwood hotels for a while and only returned to use my points. I have to say that I have some good experiences since I have been back (at other hotels). I will never stay at this hotel. The only reason it get a 2 star instead of one is the view from the room.

So usually I take reviews with a grain of salt, Especially with hotels as people have quite a varied degree of expectations. I was thinking this place should be ok as it is a Sheraton and all but although I tried to stay positive I was pretty disappointed overall. We had a pool view room...the pool view was very average. The shower in particular was so old it was frustrating even to turn the tap on was a mission. There is no "beach service" like they offered. You just get handed a towel and told the chairs were out (even if you turned up at 7am). I guess you get what you pay for but I would be digging into those pockets for an extra $50 and treating yourself somewhere half descent. Waikiki is a beautiful place but you miss it all when you stay at the Sheraton princess....I do however highly recommend the sheraton pink palace, Sheraton Waikiki or outrigger on the beach

For my first trip to Hawaii I had high hopes. I booked here from the SPG app and got a great rate. With Platinum status I was hoping to get a suite upgrade since they were available online just a few days prior to my arrival. On checkin I was given an upgrade ocean view room on a high floor (much better room than I reserved, but not a suite). THE ROOM: The view from the balcony was pretty good, although I had not realized the hotel is not actually on the beach (my own fault for not reading the details properly). I had a view over Waikiki beach and lots of adjacent buildings (room2162). The room was a touch on the small size for a Sheraton but by no means cramped. It has a flat screen TV, a large safe and a fridge. Floor to ceiling windows face east (with slider onto a balcony with two chairs and a table). The AC was quiet and efficient (a big plus) with a digital thermostat. The bathroom was looking a little tired (about 20 yrs since the last refit if I had to guess). THE LOCATION: You cant beat the location for shops and nearby restaurants. The hotel is right across from the Westin (which is on the beach). Now for the service: on checkin I was asked if I wanted to take advantage of my Platinum late checkout. Unfortunately the latest they could check me out was 2pm. The clerk checking me in did suggest she could request another room for me to move to in the morning if I could come down at 11am. I won't bore you with the details, but this led to a series of service fiascos resulting in my losing much of my only day on the island by trying to sort things out on my room. On the plus side, I did talk with the manager on duty and explained what had happened and he was EXTREMELY accommodating (thank you). My advice, if you have a problem, bring it to the attention of the manager. This is supposed to be a category 5 Sheraton but it's more like a 3 or 4 in my opinion. Even so, the hotel offers rooms at great value and is a stone's throw from Waikiki beach. On that basis it's good value and worthy of 4 stars. NOTE: Waikiki beach area is not quiet at night. If you are a light sleeper you may want to stay somewhere else - I was kept awake all night by sirens from emergency vehicles speeding up and down the road outside. SPG Platinum tip: ask them to waive the resort fee, almost everything in it is included in your Platinum status other than breakfast.

I went into this informed and was not surprised. I knew I was not getting the nicest place in town but I cared more about price since we did not plan to spend all of our time at the hotel. The beds were comfortable (the foam pillows were great) and the shower had good water pressure. We were in a tower room with a nice view from the patio that we really did not use much. The stay at one eat at all was very nice for us. We ate dinner at the other Starwood hotels and charged to our room. The chairs they lend at the pool were very nice. We put them in the car and visited beaches at other locations on the island when we wanted a stop on our drives. If you want to stay in town the beach is a really short walk from the hotel. We went for a quick dip one afternoon and found the way quickly. The breakfast buffet was fine with a fresh eggs station and lots of fresh fruit. We booked the 35 off rate which was really great for dining since we got a discount on the restaurants as well. We had a rental car and did not mind the resort fee since we expect it was a good deal for the parking. They have mobile hotspots that you can borrow if you have internet trouble.

We didn't have a terrible time here but the hotel is dated and seems somewhat neglected. If not for being in the tower with an amazing deck and view of Waikiki Beach, it probably would have been a much worse experience. The internet would not work, the bathroom electric outlet did not work, and people were clearly smoking all over our hallway despite it being non-smoking. On the plus side, it was clean and the staff seemed friendly and helpful when we engaged them. Parking was included so that was also nice, and of course the location is great. Hard to give this hotel a strong thumbs up or down.

Yes, it probably could do with a freshen up but it was clean. Breakfasts were fine.
