Entertainment was very good and the location is a real wow factor.We had a bad start booking in when the counter staff claimed that we had not made any payments even when shown documents that we had paid in full. As we were getting nowhere, we started a loud ruckus and a manager was able to confirm that their system was mistaken. We were given some goodies in a basket as an apology.Notwithstanding the minor imperfections, we would not hesitate to stay there again.

So I'm reading a story about how much the Sheraton group have spent updating there properties in HI. Hundreds of millions. Clearly they didn't spend it here. This place has great bones and is in a prime location. It's clean, well maintained and the service is more than satisfactory. But it's just old. Update it and it's worth the money. Even the ridiculous resort fee for no spa ( not even a hot tub) un heated pool and spotty wi fi. It's a real shame. This place could be great

My wife and I have not been back to Oahu for some time and were looking forward to a memorable family Thanksgiving in Waikiki Beach. We booked the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani so we could splurge in other areas of the trip but the savings were not worth the lost sleep and additional stress. We will not stay at this property the next time we visit Oahu.The Good:Most of the staff (other than front desk) was friendly and demonstrated the Spirit of Aloha that makes Hawaii so special.Lobby, pool, and grounds are very nice.This property is centrally located and you can walk to most hot spots in Waikiki Beach.The Bad:Although check-in time is 3:00 our room was not ready until after 6:00 PM. We arrived about 3:00 PM and were told our rooms were not ready. We were not the only ones as there were several groups in the bar area waiting for their rooms as well. For our trouble we were provided one free drink each and breakfast the next day.The rooms can be extremely noisy. We had room 715. This room is next to the elevator lobby and the noise level made it very difficult to sleep (I would compare it to being next to a highway at rush hour). We were also awakened each morning by trucks beeping as they backed into the loading dock below.The front desk staff continually expressed they were sorry for the inconvenience but never took any action to correct our room problem. When we went to the front desk about moving to another room because of the noise were told that they would not know what would be available until morning and to check back then. In the morning we were told they would not know what rooms were available until the evening. When we pressed the issue they said they were full and no other room was available.

I celebrated my 40th birthday here with a friend. We received an ocean view room upgrade (overlooking the pool, 11th floor) and complimentary gift basket on the first day - a great first impression. The room was spotlessy clean, had been recently redecorated with brand new bedding. Its not the largest hotel room i have stayed in but perfectly adequate. Afterall, you don't travel halfway around the world to spend your holiday in a hotel room! The front of desk staff were very helpful when we asked them to help us confirm a trip we a local tour operator and when changing money. We didn't eat in the restaurant but we did have cocktails by the pool most days. There was pineapple tasting every day. The pool looked quite small, but it was never crowded and we always had a sun lounger. Every night at 6pm there was traditional entertainment by the poolside. We sat on our balcony with a pre-dinner drink listening to the music and watching the dancers before heading out to eat.The hotel is really well located for the beach, the International Market Place, the bus stop to Diamond Head (don't book a tour - much cheaper to do it yourself - entrance fee is only $1!), shops, restaurants and bars.The only negative point i would mention is the presence of "working ladies" on the corner by the entrance of the hotel at night. You may want to avoid this corner if you have children with you. They didn't cause any problems that i saw, but it was very obvious what they were.

Second stay here and we liked the price, inclusions, location, view, comfort and ambience of the hotel. We booked early and got a good price with breakfast included. The resort fee includes internet (albeit cable rather than wireless in the rooms) and lots of useful little extras. We booked high ocean view and the views of Waikiki are spectacular. Rooms are a bit outdated in decor but clean and beds very comfortable. Love the ambience in the lobby - friendly and comfortable spaces. A bit noisy at night but generally settles before midnight. It is in a perfect location with Waikiki Beach, shopping, restaurants and public transport on the doorstep.We will continue to stay here on our visits. Much better value than Hilton Hawaiian Village.

Had a great time at this hotel, I especially loved the location.. So close to the beach and the main strip. The hotel supplied water and fruit as well as towels and beach chairs if you sat near the Duke statue.. Very handy. Our package included breakfast, Was nice to have that included but could have changed the food every so often, got a bit tiring. But the entertainment at night by the pool made each night.. To hear it by the pool, I'm your room or walking back to your hotel made the hotel experience worthwhile.

This was my second visit to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel with my first visit in 2007. To be honest not much had changed at the hotel, the rooms may have had a little upgrade with bedding and paint but everything else was pretty much the same. In saying that you can't beat this hotel for location and price. It is so central in Waikiki it is a short walk to shopping, beach and restaurants, and bus stop. This trip was my fifth visit to Waikiki and I don't see value in the beach front hotels with the ridiculous prices they charge so this hotel is a great alternative. Service at the hotel is excellent, with free Wifi available in the lobby. Not a great hotel if you want peace and serenity as it is right in the heart of waikiki so always something happening! The hotel has great activities like pineapple carving which is lovely to come back to. We had a high ocean view room and the view was excellent. Would definitely stay here again if the price is right!

My few days in this hotel were very pleasant and staff were helpful, prompt and courteous. I only had a couple of issues. On the 2nd day I was there, my room key wouldn't work all day (at least 5 times) Security staff were very prompt and helpful and it seemed to sort itself out on the 3rd day. But the lock itself seemed faulty and nothing was done about that.. Also the day before I checked out I asked for a slightly later check-out and this was denied as they said they were full . I only wanted an hour or so delay but it seemed that they couldn't accommodate . I have a preferred guest membership but that didn;t seem to matter. And I had paid the $18 per day resort charge.Otherwise great location and perfectly acceptable hotel, reasonably priced.

We stayed for 4 nights atthe Princess and loved every minute. We booked an ocean room and were certainly not disapointed. We had a wonderful view of the beach and the ocean. I was a bit hesitant booking this hotel because of mixed reviews here, but I'm glad we stayed at the Princess. The things we loved about the Princess were - - The location - 2 minutes to the best part of Waikiki beach- The room - good bathroom, bed, spacious, quiet air-con, great balcony- Fast and efficient lift- The staff - all very friendly and helpful - finding us on the beach with complimentary water and fruit - that certainly made us feel special.- The music - Hawaiin music every afternoon, - Close to the shopping- Duke's Canoe Club across the road, plus many other restaurants within 5 minutes walk.I would stay at the Princess in an instant again.

My first thought was maybe a little expensive but after a few days in the splender of this prime located Hotel i found it very comfortable and relaxing. Rooms are well presented and had all the amenities of a quality hotel. Located one block from Waikiki Beach with all the shops and restaurants to choose from it was shear joy! I would certainly consider another trip and would advise others to at least consider this Hotel.

I will start off by saying that my for my last trip to Honolulu I stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki. I thought they might be similar, but they are not. If you are on the fence about which Sheraton to stay in Waikiki here's my opinion: if you want a luxurious hotel on the beach with great pool amenities and a very nice room then choose the Sheraton Waikiki. Otherwise, if you want to save some money but have a great location and average room then choose the Sheraton Princess.The Sheraton Princess has an awesome location. You will be right in the middle of everything (the beach, shopping, restaurants), but you will also have the noise at night until about 1am while you are trying to sleep. It's not just road noise, it includes a steel drum band, random Hawaiian music, people laughing, etc. The lobby and pool is shabby with no frills. It's obviously dated and needs an update. The pool is small and has plastic lounge furniture, but the attendants are very friendly. I am a gold starwoods member so I was upgraded to a corner deluxe tower room (Thank God!). My room (25th floor) was large with 2 windows, incredible view and dated but clean furnishings. My friends stayed in an adjacent room that was dark and had a large wall on the balcony blocking much of the view of the ocean. Also, the bathrooms need an update. There is no wifi, only a cable connection for room internet.Overall, it was an average room but the great location made up for that. I would give the room 3 stars and the location 4 stars.

It isn't a 5-star hotel - but I had a 5-star stay. The balcony view was excellent from the higher tower. To the right I looked over the Moana Hotel with the beautiful Pacific Ocean in the background. To the left I could see the Ala Wai Canal with the Golf Course in the background. In front was the beautiful Diamond Head partially blocked by several very tall hotels!

Third visit to the Princess Kaiulani, twice in two years. Location is great and even if the rooms are a little old - who wants to do much more than sleep in a hotel room in Waikiki. The staff are fantastic - I arrived at 7.45am after an overnight flight from Melbourne - the girl who booked me in did everything she could to get me into my room ASAP. She gave me access to a courtesy suite and chased me down once my room was ready. She was also very helpful in organising for a nearby room on the same floor for my daughter who was arriving the next day. The lady who cleaned our rooms learnt our routine and would usually have our rooms cleaned between our morning coffee break and meander and our return to get ready to go to the beach. The concierge arranged the rental of a Ford Mustang for a day at a ridiculously cheap price. The price and location just across the road from Waikiki beach makes up for any slight shortfall in decor. Our rooms were clean, the bed was very comfortable and sitting on the lanai reading, sipping a pineapple juice and looking at the very blue ocean what more can you ask for. Thank you for nine terrific days and we will be back.

First, the hotel staff is very friendly. This is probably the best attribute of the hotel. The location is also very central. However, the hotel is old and needing updating. My room was functional and clean, but it was dated and in desperate need of a refurbishment. The room was not very relaxing. When I first walked into my room, reminded me of a Motel 6 or Travelodge (…low budget one star property...plastic cups!!!). More concerning was the noise from neighboring rooms. My room had pass through doors to both neighboring rooms. When I went to change rooms, I was told that there were no more rooms without pass through doors available. I could hear the television all night long from one room and the partying college kids in the other. Was not a relaxing stay!!! Being a Starwood Preferred member, I feel that this hotel should be disbranded and not part of Starwood since it does not live up to the quality and reputation of Starwood properties.

First time to Honolulu and even though it was during the slow season I didnt know it was going to be so packed. The hotel started off by having my moms room ready but not ours so as soon as i saw my moms room had a poor view of the street i immediately went and requested an upgrade which luckily there was one oceanview left and i got it for only 170 more for the 4 nights! It was the best amazing view and I could look right down onto the streets and also the hotel entertainment music by the pool at night. I liked our room 1406 bc we I dont think I wouldve been enjoying waiting for the elevator to take me up to the 30th floor it was a battle enough to get down to the lobby form the 14th. The pool closed early and opened late didnt go in it one time. Its a pain to have to walk acroiss the street to get to the beach honestly I will spend more next time to be on beachfront property its just better I think. If you stay here dont forget to use the other sheratons infinity pool I went there early one morning and it was deserted it was gorgeous right on the ocean literally. One thing continuously bothered me but i am used to was the constant id checking at the bar and the one drink per person policy the whole entire time I couldnt even bring a drink 5 feet to my mother or gf if I had one already in hand for myself they had to bring you multiple drinks and it got old real quick. The bathroom was really the only part of the room id say maybe was a little outdated. the breakfast buffet is like 20 bucks or more per person but theres plenty of places to eat right around there. No loud noises, maids did a great job and were very very friendly, very helpful. I would stay here again but like I said iM going to opt to be right on the beach next time but honestly honolulu is way too crowded tourist trap for me I might try maui next time.

This hotel is located in the center of Waikiki and is walking distance to everything, the beach, shopping and restaurants. Thank goodness that there is a lot to do nearby because the rooms are very outdated for the price they are charging. We paid for an upgraded ocean view that has a partial view of the ocean. Additionally, front desk service was extremely slow! They mentioned the hotel was sold out but they only had 2 people checking staff in during their busy periods, leaving people waiting upwards of 20+ minutes just to speak to someone. We probably won't come here again as we prefer more updated hotels and quicker service.

This hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are very simple and not decorated. The bathrooms could use a refurbish, but were functional. The bed was very comfortable and we had no complaints with the view or noise. We paid for a deluxe view, but we're only on the 17th floor and at the back of the hotel. The view was OK and it was quiet. Not sure it was worth any additional money. We rented a car for the week since we were paying for parking in the resort fee. We never had an issue with getting a parking spot. I would highly recommend the additional purchase of a Garmin. Overall close to the beach and restaurants. The beach chairs and towels were a big convenience as well. Not deluxe, but completely adequate....Would not recommend the buffet. The price was was too high for the quality of food. Duke's right across the street had a daily buffet for half the price with quality food and a view that could not be beat!

This hotel is directly across the road from Waikiki beach, which is ideally located. It is close to all the major shops and restaurants in Honolulu which means that you are within walking distance to most things. The hotel itself has outstanding staff working for them. The employees at the reception desk were always helpful and very friendly. Likewise, so were the housekeeping staff and restaurant staff. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The gym was well equipped with all new equipment and there was enough equipment so that you did not need to wait to access anything in the gym. The gym, however is extremely hot. One oscillating fan on a side wall is not enough air flow in a hot gym area. The lifts were also extremely hot. My husband and I kept joking about having to get stuck in a lift if it broke down because you would dehydrate in one of them within minutes....it's that hot inside the lifts. The hotel rooms really need to be renovated. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room which was very nice of the hotel to do so but when I saw how much is actually charged for that room, I would NEVER pay those prices for the run down room. In the week we stayed at the hotel, we saw no less than 6 small cockroaches in our hotel room. The rooms were quite small and wifi access was only available in the hotel lobby. The hotel needs to advance with the times, especially in an establishment that charges a resort fee for things such as Internet access!! The hotel pool was nothing fancy either. It was a small oval pool surrounded by some chairs and very minimal shade was available. No pool floats were allowed to be used in the pool which was worrying when the pool was 8 meters deep at one end and young kids who can't swim were in the pool. The pool also closed very early. In a beach resort area, I would expect that the pool would stay open later than 6pm. The whole pool area also needs a huge face lift and the size of the pool should be increased significantly.

Not a bad hotel right across the road from Waikiki Beach and next door to the International Market Place. We stayed on a lower floor which was a little noisey partically from a number of large air conditioning units nearby and partcially from the buzz around the markets and nearby buskers. The pool seemed a little small for the size of the hotel however it was fairly quiet in the pool during our stay. Check in was seemless in fact the gentleman upgraded us to a room with a KIng Sized bed and staff were professional. My only gripe was an over efficious receptionist who would not loan me a scale at 10pm at night to weigh my bags for the flight home suggesting that I needed to bring all my suitcases down. A small tip to the porter solved my problem in a hearbeat and I was happily carrying my scale back up to my room.

Great Hotel very friendly staff helpfull,stayed 15 years ago was better than last remembered .The daily charge was really good with an hour per day of free phone calls per day and beach services great.Would certainly stay again.Recommend beach view rooms was handy having a fridge. Definitely will stay again.

The rooms are in need of an update. They remind me of a room in a 2-3 star hotel on some island in the Caribbean. The bathrooms are small. Not much room to shower without touching the shower curtain.The fitness rom was decent. The property is close to Waikiki Beach. When staying at a Sheraton, one expects certain things...didn't get it here.

Going to SPK 3rd time in March/April, for 2 weeks, but this time with children/grandchildren (6 of us going). Have booked 2 side by side rooms, but with TV's touching, as last time you could hear TV from next room when trying to sleep. We stayed last time in Princess wing, but only about 1/2 way up, as entertainment is easier to see from balcony. First time had top floor which was great for views. Staff not too friendly when checking in, but efficient. Cleaning Staff great, especially when needed more tea bags, as we don't drink coffee. Would suggest a kettle (to be available through reception) for those people who don't like coffee and have to boil water through the percolator. Am now a Starwood member. It's my daughter's birthday so looking forward to celebraring here. Got good package deal this time with breakfast included for 4, not sure if children under 18 eat free for breakfast or only at restaurant. Resort fee a bit steep as we don't need Wii, telephone or parking, but prepared to pay just to give everyone the experience of free water/fruit/towels/deckchairs on beach. Hurry up 28 March.

The last time we stayed ate the Princess Kaiulani was more than 30 years ago and other than the change in the bed, which I can say without a doubt was truly comfortable, nothing much else has changed. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the location of the hotel is quite good but if you're after a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you. Overall, if this hotel was refurbished, it would be good value for money.

A great location with a short walk to beach, dining and shopping. Room was clean and adequately furnished. Nice pool area. Staff was friendly and helpful. Easy access to island transportation. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel which fit our budget and met our needs for convenience, safety and comfort.

I've been staying every year at the Princess Kaiulani hotel in Waikiki for quite a few year's now. It's a great central location, nice pool and across the street from the beach!The rooms are nice, but depends up which tower you are assigned to, as they can very in quality, but all the rooms are nice. I would say the highest tower closest to the International Marketplace are the best. The tower along Kaiulani Street can be the noisiest from street traffic, but all in all a nice hotel with great service and amenities.

The Princess Kaiulani was a perfect location right across from The Moana Surf Rider and right next to The International Market Place. This hotel is older, but a nice stay. The service from the cleaning ladies was wonderful, they were all so very, very nice! Loved the balcony, although we had a city view it was nice to be able to get some fresh air and check out the city. Probably the only complaint I have is the cost of the breakfast buffet, $35-, my sister and I thought that was a little steep. We then became hip to doing take out for $15-, which means you fill up a plastic container. We would get an omlet, bagel, 2 pasty muffins and a fruit and we would share that and it was plenty! The only thing with take out is you can't sit in the dinning area, which was fine bec we just ate out by the pool! Overall nice older place with great location!

My family of 6 stayed at the PK for 17 days last December. We had previously stayed twice at the Sheraton Waikiki but due to its makeover and extreme price rise we looked for a cheaper alternative and came across the PK which stood out due to its combination of location and reasonable pricing. Upon arrival at the hotel we lined up in the lane which stated for 'gold SPG members' which my father was we were ushered to the desk however shortly after we're rudely asked to join the end of the line asaff our membership was not as per that express lane demanded. We then re-entered the line.up with it consisting of only one other person and after a short wait were ushered again to the front desk via the same lady. Her rudeness and short temper originally were unnecessary and UNderstandable if the line were long.. however in this situation were silly and weren't needed. We were apprehensive of staying here due to the fact we never had and had read reviews of its inferiority to such hotels we had stayed at before and After this first incident our fears appeared to be confirmed. However, we took a deep breathe and continued Onto our room which were 2 High ocean view rooms. Which I believe we're rooms 28.26 connecting. Upon arrival they were extremley clean and light and had a magnificent view comparable. Even better than that of the Sheraton beachfront WaikikI. Over the almost three weeks we stayed there we came across beautiful and caring staff which made our holiday feel more like being at home. Being there for Christmas the Christmas dining was lovely and the entertainment enjoyable. We had a few rude staff experiences during the time. However the staff which were accommodating and brilliant overturned such bad experiences for example our wonderful maid and terrific bar and pool staff. The location is ultimitley a winner... a small leisurely walk to the beach and close to all the shopping Waikiki has to offer which was convieniant as myself and my three younger sisters(13-17 years old) would go by ourselves and shop whilst our parents relxed It is safe for teenagers to be by themselves', contrary to some commentsI recommend you rent a car and explore the island yourselves, visiting for our fifth time having a car allows us each time to discover something new and wonderful from this island and with free parking included in the resort fee this saves a lot of money. As you are not needed to tip a staff member to valet park. Overall happy experience. We are returning the 4th of December this year 2012 for three weeks. So obviously a testiment to this hotel.Only 5 weeks to go! Feels like we're coming home.

I have been to Hawaii 4 times now, staying at the PK for 3 of those trips. I have always found the staff to be helpful in every way,location is the best, that is one of the main reasons i choose to stay at the PK, Marsha Southwood from the Tours & activities desk is awesome, and is one of the friendliest people in Waikiki, she alone is worth the stay, thats why i do. when checking in, we were upgraded to a room overlooking the pool, a big thank you to Darlette from reservations, you made my daughters 30th birthday even more special..on arrival to our room there was a basket of goodies, birthday cake and fresh Leis for both of us(thank you Marsha). also to hosekeeping lady Belinda, she looked after our room beautifully, she has a special touch. i am returning next year to the PK and looking forward to catching up with Marsha, Darlette and Belinda, 3 such valuable assets to your Hotel....

Great location and staff were brilliant. However, the rooms need a lot of maintenance. My airconditioner was blocked and I had to stand and lean against it to keep cool. Water leaked on the floor below it. The bath drain blocked all the time and only needed a good plunger to fix it. One side of my bed was very lumpy, so I could only sleep on right hand side. They need new mattresses. Aside from this,everything else was good.

Just wanted to say a big Mahalo for another wonderful week. I come to Hawaii about 2 to 3 times a year to visit all of my family (who all live in Mililani, Wahiawa, and Manoa) but rather than crash with relatives, i always stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani to make sure i still have a "vacation" and can easily walk across the street to the beach etc. Love this hotel so much, love the location, love the staff -- it really is my home away from home. A few people i want to single out to recognize for their kindness, aloha spirit and making our stay THAT much better by going above & beyond....Angie our amazing waitress at Splash Bar, Chase & Bob at the Big Kahuna towel check-out, Eddy in security, and last but certainly not least Calvin Taomae. Calvin might be the kindest man i've ever met and someone i consider part of my ohana "family" now. Thanks again Princess Kaiulani!!! See you soon, probably in the Spring!!

The overall hotel property is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, the rooms needed maintenance and were dirty. When you can look down behind furniture and see layers of dirt and dust, it's time for the room to be overhauled. The bathroom was clean, but desperately needed some maintenance and upgrades. The rooms needed to be painted. The view is fantastic. I found the lobby area to be super clean as well as the lobby and internet/business center area.Enjoyed our brief stay here but hope the hotel makes some upgrades soon; several other hotels in the area are newer or renovated.

Stayed there for 1 night, the room was dated, but clean and beds comfortable! We had a nice view even though we were supposed to get city view room! (Thank You!) what impressed me besides the service, was although we had to pay an amenity fee, it was less than $20 and included parking which is a bargain in waikiki! I liked that the had the pineapple tasting, fruit at the pool and welcome punches! The location is right next to International Marketplace and across from the beach. They had live Hawaiian music in the evening and although they did have a happy hour, the discount drink selection was not great, but the appetizers were substantial. I think I just found my hotel for Staycations! The rate was very good in comparison to the many other hotels in that location. Mahalo Nui Loa PK, we will be back!

I have stayed here twice with my family. Both times we found the staff very nice and helpful and the rooms very clean. We had a great view of the ocean. I will stay here again next time. Be sure to get a view of the beach. I must admit the rooms are a little bit out dated but not really anything to worry about.

Stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon, found the room to be very old, not up to date, grungy, even had mold on the shower walls. I had a discounted rate through a preferred friend rate and if I had paid full price for this room I certainly would have complained or asked for another room. They did upgrade us because it was our honeymoon so we had a good view of the ocean and DT area, and they left a bottle of champagne in the room.

Very disappointed. We were booked in here by a UK agent when we arrived after 24 hrs travelling they insisted they did not have booking and no room for us. I gave them all the paperwork but a very rude and Receptionist told me "Just listen not my problem!." They did give us a room which we had to pay for. It was nosiy dirty and the dust which I thought was all over the room turned out to be termites! I couldn't go to bed as I had to wait for the uk office to open (11 hrs behind Uk time) to speak to the Agent. They did sort it and rang back with the name of the Customer Service adviser who said they would refund our money on checkout. It was their fault but they did not apologise on checkout or offer even a free coffee. They did refund the cost of their service charge. This still cost me due to the different exchange rates and costs of using your card. Far nicer hotels to stay hopefully without termiates!

My first complaint on this hotel is: when I booked my trip I requested a smoking room. The manager he argued with me about my reservations stating that there hasn't been smoking in their hotel for 3 yrs. I said why'd it state online that you have rooms that are for smoking? He said that the hotel hasn't had smoking for 3 yrs. He told me they having smoking spaces outside the hotel for my convience. For my convience would be directly in my hotel room to smoke when I want. I do know & understand that Hawaii has a smoking ban in place for the last 3-5yrs, but hotels state they have rooms available. This manager tried to make everything a personal matter. Stating he's a smoking he knows what I'm going through blah blah. He was the rudest and the most bs manager I've ever met. He didn't handle this or any problem I had in a professional manner.My nxt complaint would have to be that I let the hotel cleaning staff into my room one day to clean. Come to find out when I returned home, I had a shirt that had been stolen by the cleaning staff. I don't know if it was a mistaken for a towel (b/c the shirt was white), or if they stole it on purpose.My final complaint would be all this information and more I have sent to the hotel through their website. I haven't heard anything and its been a month since I've been back from my trip. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. One more thing before I forget...I killed 2 bugs in the hotel before we left.

We stayed at this hotel after a 7 night Hawaii Cruise on NCL Pride of America. We stayed for two nights being 07/10/12 & 08/10/12. Our first disappointment was that apparently the booking made by our travel agent only guaranteed us "a room" but not a particular "type of room" so, although we'd request a low floor due to a dislike of lifts, and twin beds due to not being a couple, we were originally allocated a room with a King Size bed on the 16th Floor! And it took much frustration and debate with a staff member to have it changed.We found the rooms to be clean and tidy but old style - more of Australian Motel style rather than Hotel style. I begrudged the not-optional $18 fee a day. It gave us unlimited Wi-Fi, but if you had no need for Internet, you are paying $18 for two bottles of water a day. It also allegedly gave us 1 hour of international calls, however we were unable to make that work until we'd obtained instructions from the Concierge. We were also unable to use the room TV until the Concierge gave us instructions and a Channel List for that. I'm not sure why those instructions aren't kept IN the rooms.I didn't rate the hotel breakfast either. For $24.60, you can DEFINITELY find better food options elsewhere! On the plus side, the Hotel is in a very convenient location and is directly across the road from the beach. And most of the Hotel staff were very pleasant and friendly.

Traveled to Honolulu, HI for 7 days on a business trip and stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. As A SPG Platinum member I was upgraded to the Jasmine Suite on the top floor. I believe it was room number 2962. First the obvious bad about the hotel: Not on the beach, old and needing a makeover, small pool that is not private. All three negatives not a big deal to me. The good: Excellent service, outstanding bed, great water pressure, quiet, and great value for price paid. The hotel is perfect if you are in Honolulu on business. Plenty to do right around the hotel. Not a big deal to cross the street to get to the beach. Less than a 3 min walk. Gym was adequate to get a decent workout. The resort fee ($18/day) is fine as it includes parking and bottled water in the room plus some other small perks. Overall I was very happy with the hotel and would stay here in a heartbeat again. Also, the breakfast buffet was excellent. If the hotel could get a makeover it would be a top choice but the friendly staff made it all worth it.

Half way though my stay, I'm not to impressed with the service. Sitting at the pool area at night and be told I must buy a drink to sit there? I think I am paying enough to stay at the hotel and the daily fee. I felt embarrast while the server went and talked about me to fellow work mates

Stayed at this hotel in an Ocean View room with free buffet breakfast daily. Could not fault the location of this hotel! Literally steps from Waikiki beach and right next door to the Market Place. The buffet breakfast is great - especially the waffles and the beds in the rooms are AMAZING. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a lot of value for their money :) Would happily stay here again!

Made our reservations back in March & when I went online before our September trip started reading quite a few bad reviews and was very skeptical of staying at this hotel. Well, I was pleasantly suprised upon arrival at how beutiful the grounds were and how nice our rooms were. Granted it is an older hotel & not lavish, but very clean & great service. We could not find our remote & after calling down to the front desk someone was up in our room with one in about 10 minutes. Then when I came back to the room late one evening, I could not get the safe to open & within 10 minutes they had someone up to the room who got it opened for me. I could not have expected better service. And the breakfast that was included with the room was wonderful, even had an omelet station, so our breakfast held us over until dinner, which saved us quite a bit as everything is expensive in Hawaii! The location was right in the middle of everything & I had a wonderful view of the pool & surprsingly the ocean as well. Would deffinitely stay here again.

As a top tier loyalty member in three major brands, I try to manage my stays carefully. If given this option again, I would not choose it over the others in the area. Let's start with the drop off/parking situation. No valet and no permission to leave your car in the drop off circle during check in...very rude and inconvenient. During peak check in, there was nobody manning (or even WATCHING) the SPG premier line area that had three signs posted for premiers to "wait here"...while newly arriving customers kept getting helped at the other end of the counter. The manager on duty barely seemed to care ("thanks for pointing it out" but no apology), leaving the signage in place without manning the premier check-in spot and he could easily have offered to get my luggage delivered to the room rather than make me schlepp around like a goat herder between parking garage, drop off circle and check-in desks. I've stayed here several years before and was hoping that some of the $6B Sheraton rehab dollars would have been spent here... nope, not a penny from what I can see. Room counters and bathrooms are at least 30 years old and the furnnishings aren't too much more recent. Breakfast buffet...why should we leave a fine-dining size tip (which is recommended! on the check starting at 15%!!) for a self-serve buffet!!! The cold coffee is already in a jug on the table, along with the sun-warmed creamer packs, and the juices are all self-serve as is the food. The only thing the server does is put the check -- that was handed to you by the hostess before seating -- into a folio. And obtw, there is also a cashier being paid to serve the point of sale function at the front of the restaurant. How many employees does it take to justify a $25 breakfast that comes free for elite loyalists at most other Sheratons around the globe? Speaking of perks, the "resort fee" includes everything that an SPG Platinum would get for free anyway, but they can now charge you for it by using a different name. Dont ask for a late check out either...that requires management decision even though it's supposed to be an automatic perk. Every employee in a management/deputy position should stay at a real Sheraton and learn from it...I will probably cancel my upcoming reservation to stay here again unless these issues are truly addressed... the game here needs to be raised a lot more before I will return.

We booked our trip thru an agent and after reading mixed reviews I decided to give this hotel a try.. Big mistake .. First off on our first full day there we came back to our room to find that it was only cleaned half way ( no vacuuming, trash changing, toilet paper or tissue) I had to call TWICE for toilet paper and tissue because there was not enough to last us till the next day. Next night I realized my night cream was gone.. I swore the maid stole but 2 days later we get a call from the manager stating that the maid broke it, they offered to pay for it IF I decided to replace it.. Sure let me take a $20 cab ride to Longs.. No thanks! So i suggested that they credit us for it instead and they gave us free breakfast buffet coupons instead.. Which is better looking than the dinner buffet (which is better looking then the dinner buffet, Not worth the $36 per person). Then someone decided to go #2 in the pool.. so the pool was closed for a full day and a half but it grossed us out so much we did not want to go in after that.. Can you blame us!! Then I went to get us drinks in the little bar area, I went to pay for my drinks with a $100 bill and the bartender informed me she does not have change.. hmm a little hard to believe considering the bar was packed.. Is everyone paying with credit card ?!! I don't think so but whatever! So I went to get change from the front desk and was told if I want change I would need to get in the check in/check out line which had about 12 people in it.. Really! I just need change! overall was not impressed with the property and the service was not good enough to ever make me want to go back.

I agree with others regarding the facilities and rooms being dated, including the carpet and old bathrooms. If it weren't for that, my overall rating for the hotel would be better. Focusing on the positives: bed was comfortable, service was exceptional and the location is good. It's difficult to find an extraordinary deal on overpriced Waikiki Beach, so good luck. But if you can stay here for around US$150/night for a standard room with taxes and resort fee, then it's a value for Waikiki. I didn't have a negative experience here, but it just wasn't outstanding.

My corporate travel agent booked this stay and, based upon others' reviews, seemed like a good place to stay since it was convenient to my meeting. Not my experience. The bellman when I arrived pointed me to the front desk - no offer to help with luggage. Isn't that his job? The front desk staff was pleasant and my room was upgraded to a beach view. Very nice touch...except the room is next to the elevator. The room is old, the carpet is dirty and the bathroom should be gutted. There is no stopper in the sink - great opportunity to lose contact lenses. The bathroom only has a shower, which is fine, with a shower seat. So dirty it is disgusting to look at! There are no amenities in the room - no hotel directory, no local maps, not even paper on the desk, although there was a pen. Lighting is limited to two bed side lamps. As a Starwood Preferred member I am stunned at the poor environment. Cannot wait to check out tomorrow.

This hotel is in the best location in waikiki we think as was 2nd stay here in 2 yrs. We were upgraded to a ocean view which was lovely, we stayed here for 5 nites, then went to there other hotel sheraton waikiki, and this hotel is far better for the price and service and location, would definely only stay here when return, We have 2 kids aged 8 & 10 they loved the pool and while we having buffet brekie they could swim while we watching them. The hotel is close to international market place great restaurants, and macys a 3 minute walk away great shopping there, so would have dinner and then husband take kids back to room for bed and I would shop til 11PM at macys!! as is very safe to go alone, and beach just across the street and very safe 4 kids to swim low waves. Very comfy beds and great quiet a/c. Burger king and subway across the street maccas 1 block away and dennys just around the corner for great $4 brekkies. If you want a great family holiday in top spot stay here.

Old room, not very large, the cleanliness is not regular. Welcome at reception not so friendly, pool closed at 18:30 and the pool boy spend more time talking rather than taking care of customers by giving them towels. Restaurant and bar not a great time sorry Sheraton Waikiki is much nicer then there are many more people

This hotel was in a great location. Rooms were comfortable and we had gorgeous views over Waikiki beach. Breakfasts were generous and excellent. They gave you chairs to take to the beach, and even had a fruit and drink service come to you at the beach! Best of all, in the evenings there is always local musicians and dancers by the pool . This is free entertainment, and you can enjoy drinks and beautiful Hawaiin music and ambiance without having to go anywhere else for the night. We will surely go back to the Princess K again!

This hotel is our last stop of a 9D8N 3-Islands Trip(Big Island, Maui & Oahu) for our 10th Wedding Anniversary with our 2 kids(age 2 and 6). We were upgraded to a wonderful pool view and actually can see a sliver of ocean view. Didn't expect this upgrade and VERY VERY GLAD to get this upgrade because the room was JUST PERFECT!!! On top of this, What A SURPRISE to find a bucket of ice with a bottle of champagne and 2 wine glasses in the room, compliment from the G.M.!!! WOW, my husband and I were SO THRILLED that the hotel did this and made our 2 nights kick-off stay in HNL something that we will not forget!!! The room that we were given is in Princess Wing. Due to our plane flying out late from HNL to LAX, we needed to have a room that allowed us to have a late check out. Since the room that we were upgraded is a popular room, we were not granted a late check out the night before our departure even though I am a SPG Gold Plus member but were told we can switch to a room that has king size bed which will not work for 4 of us. Anyway, on the day of departure, I decided to approach the SPG member desk and spoke to the girl at the front about the possibility of getting a late check out at 4 pm. She went into the back room to check with her manager. Another SURPRISE is that she came out from the back room and told us that we were allowed to switch to another room but is a king bed and able to stay till 4 pm. THIS IS SO AWESOME!!! We are SO APPRECIATIVE & THANKFUL of how this is handled instead of just offering us a hospitality room to be used but gave us a room to stay for the 4 hours and it made a lot of difference to our plans that day as we can take it easy before heading out to our late flight out especially with a 2 years old who needed a nap in the afternoon !!! Definitely, I would come back to SPK again because this is the only hotel that we stayed thus far that willing to do above and beyond to make this wedding anniversary trip with 2 young kids such a memorable one and seamless!!!Kudos to the G.M. and the entire team in SPK!!!!!

The hotel is only a few blocks) from the famous beach. Hotel has its own well mansged outdoor pool complete with poolside bar and friendly staff. I think most of the rooms come with balcony overlooking one of the busiest streets on Waikiki beach. My room can actual see part of the beach. The dinner buffet is very good with local fish, crab legs etc. the charge is $36 pp. hotel guest pay $18 day for parking which is onsite. The hotel shows its age in some small details. But the room is clean and comfortable and within walking distance to international market, some of the best eats in south east Oahu.. The. Hotel is about 10 miles from the international airport. Have fun!!

My husband and I stay at the Princess Kaiulani ALL the time when we go to Hawaii. After reading some of the reviews here, I just had to write. This hotel is value-priced right as it is right in the middle of ALL the action in Waikiki, including being right across the street from Waikiki Beach. For about $140/night, you can be right where you need to be -- in the middle of everything that is going on in Waikiki, including being right next door to the International Marketplace. You could stay at the Royal Hawaiian, right down the street, at $400/night if you want the best, but for the rest, this the P.K. is the best. You're not in the room much anyway, so who cares about the size of the room. If you've ever gone on a cruise, you know what I mean. The room is for sleep and shower. For the price, you are right in the heart of Oahu, and this is where we put our money to stay every time we are there (over 20 times). We love the P.K. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and they aim to make the stay as nice as Apple Pie.As a matter of fact, we stayed at another hotel last year (Miramar) and it was no where near to our favorite of the Princess Kaiulani. We actually went over the the P.K. to use their pool and eat breakfast as it is one of our favorite places to say in Hawaii. We can go to so many places easily from the P.K.'s center point that we NEVER rent a car. We take tours or we take The Bus.

Stayed here with my family for 3 nights last June. This was a hotel booked by a relative of ours so we had no choice about it. The hotel is very busy with a lot of tourists and because of this, luggage takes time to be brought up to the rooms. The rooms are small and a bit old. The toilet has this loud flushing sound and the shower doesn't have constant water pressure. Beds weren't that comfortable too. There is a parking structure at the back of the hotel but the levels does get a bit confusing. Location is convenient with several fast food joints, restaurants and convenience stores across the hotel. It is also a few minutes walk from the shopping areas and very near Waikiki Beach. Overall, if I had to pay, I would rather stay at another hotel. Luckily, our relatives paid for our hotel rooms.

Our room was clean, location was great, and the staff was helpfull, everything I look for and want from a hotel. Sitting by the pool in the evening listening to the band play Hawaiian music l was very relaxing. Management: Please consider keeping the pool open till at least 8pm during the summer, closing the pool at 7pm is just a little to early.

Loved our stay here. From the robes to the view haha. The little things they do like the activities like Lei making (didn't do but great idea for some) cultural shows at night with their buffet dinners. View from 25th floor is wonderful. Location is perfect close to market place restaurants and shopping. Very clean and has thAt traditional aloha feel.

Location was great, although the pool area is not quite as private , pedestrain can see from the street. Just an ordinary oval pool. Nothing like a resort pool. No spa.Room is small o.k. AC very bad, not even cold. Bathroom is the worst, the sliding door is broken and hard to close shut. water pressure low.Housekeeping...just average. Bed was made not neatly, just throw back the blanket that is.The gym is not bad, got weights machine that is decent.Food in the restaurant is only o.k., overprice as you can eat outside cheaper.1 beach towel allowed, Really!!! Lay on the beach and wipe yourself with the sand towel.Charging $18.85 each day for RESORT FEE. (internet, 2 bottle waters,beach towels and local calls) THIS IS A RIPOFF for many hotel that say they are a resort.This hotel is very outdated, no where near a resort standard. We paid $189 a night, honestly we could have pay the same and stay at the Hilton Hawaian Village or any other better hotel.It may be farther away but there is a trolly service. $2 each ride or get a day pass to ride daily.Best advise, next time when you're there, have time, walk into any hotel you like and see for yourself. This may help next time when you going back to hawaii.

Could not a have more helpful staff. The staff at the acitivty desk are knowegable about all things hawaii. Tnis is there home and offer valable advice.This really is a home away from home. Look forward to my next visit.

This was my third stay at the Sheraton Princess and the best. As a Starwood Preferred Guest, I got a a special discount so went with a full ocean view room. What a view! The hotel gets its share of packaged tour groups and offers special pricing to keep the hotel full, so it shows some wear and tear. But, the location and price make it a good economical choice. It is located one block from Waikiki beach near the Duke statue and is next to the International Market. The parking garage is in the rear and parking is included with the resort fee. It is a full service hotel with a nice pool, restaurants, bars, nightly entertainment, a Polynesian show, fitness center and internet lounge. The rooms are compact but we spent most of the time on the lanai with the beautiful view of Waikiki beach, ocean, Diamond Head, central mountains and downtown Waikiki in view. We really liked the bedding and sleeped well every night. The hotel is on the main Waikiki road, so there is some evening noise, mainly street musicians, but it dies down around 11pm. It is very close to all the Waikiki shops, restaurants and bars. The city and tourist buses stop right in front of the hotel and there are car rental agencies across the street. The service was good and friendly.

Pros:- good price for the location-"free" parking included in the $19 resort fee-sheets were clean, crisp-bed was comfortable-A/C was coldCons:-I had placed my DIRTY hand towel on the bathroom floor since that is the worldwide signal for fresh towels. What do I see? My DIRTY hand towel back on the towel rack. SERIOUSLY!??! That totally grossed me out. Without this incident, I would have given this place 4 stars.-dated, dated, and more dated-no elevator in parking garage-1 beach towel each rule. annoying. I need 1 to lay on and 1 to dry myself!!

This was my second time to visit Hawaii.we checked in at SPK on sept 1 we arrived into our room it was supposed to be a king bed, so i went to front desk to notify staff of mixup. staff put us un another room same thing 2 double beds. by this time i was already frustrated. so i talked to the manager he gave us room 203 which was not any better the furniture was really old. i was realy disgusted by the housekeeping staff our linen was never changed for 3 days still had toothpaste on the wall from previous guests. i did not complain to staff about the way they cleaned the room by this time i was just ready for sept 4th the day we checked out of misery. i dont like to write bad reviews but i was really disgusted my previous stay was at the Ohana east much better experience than the SPK. i would not stay here again or recomend this hotel to others.

My sister and I recently stayed at the SPK while attending a funeral for a family member. I am a former "local girl" who knows her way around the island, and has seen a hawaiian beach more than once, so I didn't necessarily need a ocean view, or ocean front type property. Plus, since this was an unexpected death in the family, we were on a budget. I chose the SPK as it was close to Diamond Head Mortuary, and the relatives I was visiting near Hawaii Kai, and the price was right. Also, the resort fee ($18) included parking fee which is cheap for Waikiki. Our flight was delayed into Hawaii so we didn't check in until 1am. I had a reserved a standard double bed room. We were put in Room 315 which was just the smallest room ever. Really dinky. Room receives 2 stars. There were twin beds - who still does that? The twin bed was comfy (one star). A small table which was overcrowded with the coffee pot, brochures, and a pen. Exactly 2 towels. The room was so small that my sister and I had to sit on our twin beds to stay out of the way of each other. I couldn't believe this was a Sheraton room. I felt like our room was an afterthought. Kind of like a storeroom or closet that was converted. Or a room that the nanny or the kids would stay in. Wish the flatscreen TV worked. It took up half of the small wall. We didn't ask to move. My sister said by the time we repack everything we would be leaving hawaii anyway. The gym was okay. Overlooks the pool. No AC. There are precors and treadmills and a small selection of weights. The resort fee includes a parking space in the secured covered garage, 2 water bottles daily in your room, pool towels, and chairs to take to the beach. SPK will send over twice a day water and fruit to a certain designated area on the beach. Cool idea but we took our chairs and towels to the beach area in front of the Sheraton Moana. They have their beach bar and live music (which you can hear laying on the beach). Great location. ABC stores right across the street. Beach is across the street.

As my first trip to Waikiki, I was trying to balance budget with location. This hotel does it well. The beach is right across the street, and the International Market just a short walk up the boulevard. Most tours and shuttles have a stop here!I had a 21st floor Ocean View room, and had no complaints. I was initially apprehensive as the room had a connecting door to an adjacent room, but was pleasantly surprised at how little noise passed through, no more than I've come to expect in a room without a connecting door.The hotel has been around a while and maybe could use a facelift, but I didn't feel like it was neglected either. Internet access was reliable and speedy. The breakfast buffet was un-extraordinary, but it was convenient and a chance to start the day out well fed. I'd stay here again - and would bring friends too!

Stayed here for a week around Memorial Day. Check in was easy, parking was convenient. Our room was average size and clean. It could use a little updating.. The carpet and furniture were pretty worn. Our room had 2 queens, mini fridge and flat screen tv. Our view from the balcony was lovely, partial ocean view, and view of the shops and mountains in the distance. Tried their breakfast buffet one morning while my friend slept in and was majorly disappointed. Very overpriced and not a very good selection. Also had dinner one night at the poolside restaurant after a very exhausting day and that was just okay. The location is great, 1 block from Waikiki beach and tons of shops nearby. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall it is not a bad place to stay, I would stay here again if the price was right.

We booked an ocean view room months prior to arriving. When we checked in, we were given our "ocean view room." If you are tall and able to lean 3 feet over the edge of the balcony, then yes, this was an ocean view room. We called the front desk to complain, and they moved us to a different room, one where you could see the ocean from the room! They also were clearly embarassed by the mistake. The manager hand delivered a complimentary fruit basket and a bottle of champaigne within an hour of our rooms being changed. After this little mishap, everything was quite nice. No complaints here!The moral of the story - they made a mistake, but were more than willing to adequately fix it :) We would stay here again in a heart beat. Where else can you get an ocean view room on Waikiki for $175/night?

Rooms and hotel very old and need a revamp, no information about hotel, dining and facilities when checking in.Bed was very comfortable. Good location but that's all it has going for it and the band by the pool with hula girl was a nice way to end the night

I had been reading the reviews on Tripadviser and was getting very worried about all the bad reviews. My family travelled here from the 18/8/12 to 25/8/12 and I can tell you it was wonderful. I am very picky and the Sheraton is great, from the front desk people to the bookings desk to concierge every one is very helpful and friendly. We have two girls and they loved the pool as well as the many activities that the Sheraton provided lai making,hula lessons, making nut bracelets and hula dancing at the nightly pool entertainment were they were called up on stage to do a dance with Sammy that was a highlight for our 6 yr old. It is in such a handy location next to the International Market Place and ABC stores you couldn't ask for better. The only thing better was at the Cheesecake Factory were they sell Red Velvet Cheesecake and you will never taste anything like that ever again. All in all we had a wonderful holiday, the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is great and we will be going back again next year as it was that good.

room doors have electronic door locks that are old and worn out. Mine didn't work on arrival, didn't work after two repairs and a long wait for service and was finally replaced. Only the card didn't work so I had to be let in to my room by the guard every time I went out.Bathrooms are very dated and old.Nice TV's and WiFi though.Good classic Sheraton bedding.Location is incredible and only 1/2 block off the beach

Only had a one-night stopover at the hotel between our cruise ending and catching the plane back to Australia but the hotel more than met our requirements. Easy, friendly check-in, welcoming bell-hop service, great location. The rooms and hallway are a bit old-fashioned but the bed was HUGE and comfortable and the pillows were a dream. We got an upgrade when booking directly on the phone and had a wonderful view of Waikiki Beach and the pool area.One thing I didn't like was when we were sitting outside by the pool enjoying a drink and the band, it began to rain so we moved under cover only to be told we could not sit there unless we were having the buffet. The whole place was virtually empty, with plenty of tables available so we chose not to move, stayed and finished our drinks then moved on. I felt this was unnecessary given we were hotel guests.

Very nice hotel in a central location in Waikiki. One block off the beach. Lots of convenient shopping. Great area restaurants. Breakfast by the pool was very good. Room was very comfortable. Service is fantastic.

I was on a work/leisure trip and stay for three nights. This hotel is in the heart of Wakiki and only a minutes walk to the beach! The concierge was efficient and polite as I dropped off my bags at the lobby. Parking is round the back and its free with the resort package. The check-in queue was long but the staff was there to give out pineapples to taste - great for getting the holiday mood. There was also a ukulele class conducted which provided some entertainment. My rooms was a pool facing room (6th floor) which had some view of the beach and the sea. Good point is that the nightly entertainment stops around 10pm. Once the glass doors were closed, it essentially blocks out all the street noise. Amenities are decent for the price of the place. Beds and linen are clean and very comfortable. The bathroom is a good size too. The resort package also includes free wifi and use of deck chairs/ towels which can be brought to the beach. As mentioned earlier, this is a great location. The beach and shopping belt are at the doorstep. Did I mention that the cheesecake factory is just a two minute walk?

Ahhhh...the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani...as soon as we arrived to our second stay at this hotel in Oahu we said "it is so nice to be HOME again". Thank you to our Princess Ohana (family). The staff are amazing and really made our trip. A lot of familiar faces from our first trip 4 years ago made our stay in June 2012 even more endearing. A special thank you to Randi Okuhara for taking the time to address all the concerns we had from some trip advisor postings. She put any doubts we had out to rest and went out of her way to personally look after our accommodations. We were greeted with a wonderful hotel upgrade and woke to a breath-taking view from our lanai of diamond head and waikiki beach each morning. Pure paradise. This extra touch made our trip even more amazing. The staff at the Pikake Lounge made our hotel feel like "home away from home". Special thanks to dear people like Niolani, Debbie and many more for their attention to detail, kind words and genuine interest in our adventures. Kudos to Marsha and Tommy at the travel desk in the hotel...they deserve an A++ for their customer service and kindness. They took so much time to help us plan some wonderful and magical trips! They also helped to make not only trip 1, but trip 2 spectacular as well. We came to Oahu as strangers the first time and left as part of the Princess Ohana. The second trip was even more special than the first and I'm so glad we decided to come back to this hotel and meet up with so many familiar faces and friends. To any nay-sayers and people with above average expectations on below average pocket books...I felt that I had good value for my money and experience in Hawaii. You couldn't ask for a better location or view. I'd go back any day. Mahalo!

I extended a recent business trip to Honolulu with one night at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani in Waikiki. This hotel is in an EXCELLENT location with superior views and immediate access to shopping and dining in town. The staff is amazing here and I really enjoyed the pool area. I signed up for their 'club' and received a coupon for a free maitai at the pool bar, which was delicious. They had live entertainment in the pool area that was fun.The GOOD about the room- the VIEW. The lanai is HUGE and we had a gorgeous view of the beach and pool area. So beautiful! Pay the extra charge for a view here- completely worth it.The bed was comfortable and the room included a mini fridge and microwave.The not so good: a TINY BATHROOM and the room and hallways of this hotel are seriously outdated. Well maintained, but old. This hotel would get five stars from me with a little decor updates.The resort fee includes use of pool chairs and towels you can check out and take to the beach. They also deliver water and fresh fruit TO THE BEACH for hotel guests. WOW... MOST IMPRESSED was using the 'hospitality suite'. We had to check out HOURS before our flight left, so spent the day on the beach. They allowed us to use a room for an hour to shower and get ready for our flight before our shuttle arrived. What amazing service! Thank you Sheraton!

When our regular Waikiki Hotel was booked out recently, we networked some friends and got the local Kamaaina Rate at the PK...I had some misgivings as it is DEAD CENTER in Waikiki and Waikiki lately is BUSY.. Our room faced the pool area which had nightely entertainment but it is cut off at exactly 10:00pm at which point good glass and A/C cut off the sounds of late night Waikiki. The resort package includes parking which with some free drinks is a deal and the clue is to explore how the HIGHEST parking decks lead in to elevators in the buildings making getting in and out a snap. Some reviewers rag on about the quality of the rooms but as a world traveler I would say that it is price appropriate with Location, Location and Location...your not paying Four Seasons prices so get real. In the side lobby is a large area with many free computers that in some ingenious way is linked in to your name and room number as a password....and WIFI of course. 3G on AT&T in the area is blazing...ALL the sights and sounds of Waikiki are within a few blocks with the Red Velvet at Cheesecake factory my ladies favorite.....and of course for the sunburn set the beach is a half block..enjoy.

Wrapping up my stay today. Excellent service, kind staff, and great rooms! I originally ordered a double bed room, but they were all out. The man at the front desk, Bobby, kindly offered a complimentary bed sent up to my room. Everything was luxurious, and the only thing I would like is wifi in every room (they only have a cable in theroom, so bring your laptop. Wireless offered in lobby lounge). All rooms come with a balcony with a magnificent view.

For the first time, it's a amasing place to choice for 6 days. I like the lobby area with orchids. I have a great time in Waikiki place. If you need some information you can ask the concierge or activies desk "his french language is very good and he also a nice man. Location, price and staff, everything is perfect, doesn't matter if it's little old or the swimming pool is small for more than 200 guests. I met Ms tehani TAMA she's working at the Splash Bar and Bento and she recognice us tahitians guests. It's very important for me and my husband, it makes us better. I will choice again this hotel for my next vacation with our son and his cousin.

Booked a room a few months back. Called the night before we were suppose to check in to make sure my buddy and I got a room with 2 beds - He is a SPG Gold Member and I am an AMEX SPG Card Holder. We arrived at the hotel to a very loud, disorganized, dirty swimming pool. Proceeded to the front desk where we were told there's no room in the whole hotel with 2 beds. We cancelled the reservation and needed to find a room last miuute in Waikiki and of course paid a premium due to the last minute reservation. The lobby was so old and dated, I couldn't believe how bad behind the front desk looked. so cluttered, folders and binders everywhere. The front desk agent barely spoke English.. Japanese. Even had the room of been available we wouldn't of stayed here this place looked awful. There's no way this a category 5 hotel the Westin Moana Surfrider and the Sheraton Waikiki are both Starwood category 5 properties and are exponenitally nicer then this dump, way more modern, nice grounds, way better location. Do not stay here. This is one of the worst hotels in Waikiki, not surprised their rating on this site is so bad.

I am just finishing up a stay here. I stayed 7 nights and i loved every second of it.I must admit, i defiantly went to the beach more rather than around the pool as it was very full of screaming young children but hey, we're all here to enjoy ourselves.The perk of going to the beach was that twice a day 11am and 1.30pm we were bought a cold bottle of water and the choice of a apple/orange by the staff :) We stayed in a 2 double bed pool view room and it was delightful with the most comfy beds.Plently of room,great house keeping, fantastic gym,laundry, pool towel and beach chair hire(free).The hotel is very central of shops,restaraunts and only 1 street back from the beach.Yeah there probably is something out there a bit more modern but we had no problems what so ever. I would defiantly stay here again :)

I like staying at charming older hotel but this one is just old. If you are looking for a place to relax, this is not your hotel. This is a very busy and crowded hotel - too many Tour Group guests. Hotel room's furniture and bathroom should both be upgraded/renovated. However, the hotel is located directly from another Starwood hotel, Moana Surfrider, which is directly on the beach.

We stayed here March 2012 over 10 days. Previously we were spoiled by the Sheraton Waikiki, We were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, I must say we were pleasantly surprised!! The rom was very clean, our room was overlooking the pool we thought it would be noisy but it wasn't. Staff was very friendly and helpful, we had a problem with our room card messing up 3 times, eventually the problem was solved and the managment left us a fruit basket for the troubles, very nice thoughtful touch. Parking was great, we had rented a car and parking was included in the daily resort fee. Location wise you can't beat it, just off the main drag so there is always something to see and do in the evenings..though I am kind of tired of Mr.&Mrs Silver sitting on the street!! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel provides one of the best locations unless you are staying right on the beach. We didn't really have any problems with the hotel at all. The rooms are a bit outdated but a lot of hotels in Hawaii are like that. The beds are very comfortable though. The walls are paper thin, the last night was tough falling asleep with all the noise from above us.Also didn't have our room cleaned one of the days which was weird and bottled water wasn't brought to our room for 2 days in a row so had to call down to get some.We have a room on the 4th floor over the pool and it was a great location. We could see the performers on the stage in the evenings and hear the music from there. It was nice to sit on there and enjoy the atmosphere. The pool doesn't have many spots that you can sit in the shade if you wanted to. The pool seemed to get really busy after lunch as well. The staff at the Big Kahuna? (place to get towels) just seemed to be over staffed (3 staff to hand out towels). Seemed to stand around and talk a lot in their hut but didn't really clean the surrounding pool area. I haven't been to Hawaii in a few years so not sure if this is standard now but no tubes or air mattresses were allowed in the pool. The only thing allowed were water wings for kids and life jackets. So lots of parents that brought little tubes for their kids to push them around in were disappointed. The resort fee of $18 a day is a bit steep if you aren't using the parking service that is included in that. It does cover internet, 2 bottles of water daily, and beach service (water/fruit) brought to you at Waikiki beach twice a day which is nice when you are there. Although if you take in the pool for the day no water bottles are offered to you there.We were able to use the hospitality suite (which was nice to use)to shower after we had checked out of our room as we had a night flight.It was also nice to have entertainment at the hotel daily, also other activities throughout the day which other hotels do not have. It has a great location and has new beds in the rooms. The hotel is a bit outdated but is worth the stay if you don't mind paying the "resort" fee.

What a great location, central for everything stayed for 14 nights. We had a great room, great view. One of the things that spoilt it was someone was smoking on the floor above & the cigarette ends landed on our balcony, the smell was also unpleasant when trying to get some fresh air. Great bed/linen, slept really well. Had a couple of issues, no coffee/water left a couple of days. Can't understand there only being enough coffee to make 3 cups, surely if there are 2 people in a room it would make more sense to leave enough for 4 cups ( a cup each in the morning/night). We had the same problem that a lot of people seem to have, we arrived after a long flight & were not able to get into the room for several hours. It would have been helpful if the receptionist would have given us some idea of where we could wait, thankfully the Rock Island Cafe across the road made us feel very welcome.The 'resort fee' instructions could have been highlighted clearer, we didn't realise just what a good deal this was. Although there are instructions printed in the room it does not explain clearly about the 60 minutes free international calls.Overall, although a few 'niggly' bits, a great place to stay. Would stay again.

The agonizing part of checking in was their strict policy of 3PM check-in time. Most families arrive at the hotel from long hours flight in the morning. The room was clean but seems to be old- like your ordinary hotel. You would expect more from a "Sheraton" hotel. The bathroom is clean too but looked to be very old as there were rust on the tub and the shower seems to be broken because you have to open the water full blast before shower functions, otherwise, you only get this irritating whistle sound-like from the shower.they make up for it for their service and staff. Wifi was fast enough and their service at the beach area is excellent. I find their staff very nice and helpful greets you even if they had tons of things carried. the view and the location of the hotel is the best feature.

We stayed here just for one night last week (Aug 2012) Reception staff were very efficient, and we were able to check in when we arrived, even though it was only midday. The room (high ocean view) was on the 23rd floor (out of 29 floors), and although classified as 'ocen view' it faced Diamond Head, so to our left was the mountains and suburbs, and to our right was the ocean.Room was clean and spacious, bathroom could use some updating but overall was large enough and clean and tidy. Hotel is huge, takes a few minutes to get from the lift to the front entrance, although we discover another exit which brough us out right next to an ABC Store on the main road (Kalakaua Ave), which was very handy. We used the gym too, which was very well equipped.Interestingly, the hotel has a compulsory $18 'resort fee', which includes free parking, 2 x Mai Tai drinks, 2 x Hawaiian Punch drinks, beach towels, unlimited local calls and 60 mins of free long distance calls. So use as much of the above as possible to get your money's worth! ;)Location-wise, the hotel is next to the INternational Marketplace, and a 3min walk to the beach. Extremely handy location.

I spent my first night in Hawaii in this hotel, what a huge mistake! I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member so I booked this hotel through SPG assuming this was a sign this hotel was of a decent standard! Much to my dismay the entire hotel appears to have been swept up in some kind of time warp, walking in here is like taking a time machine back to the sixties... Worn and out of date decor abound as far as the eye can see, and sadly not even the service can compensate you as that is even worse!From the time I arrived to drop my luggage staff were overworked and offhand. My bags were stored but the line for the front desk was so huge I didn't even want to approach staff to advise that I had arrived and see if there was any possibility of an early check in. I figured this must have just been an odd busy moment for the hotel, so left with the intention of returning later in the day when things were quieter. When I returned at 630pm to check in I still had to line up and wait for at least ten minutes to see a staff member about check in. The staff were downright rude and disinterested, and I was shocked at how many extra taxes were charged in addition to the advertised room rate, paying a "Resort Tax" is appalling especially when you are only staying for one night and you don't use the pool or the car-parking at all! I was given my keys and told where to go, but no-one showed me to my room or properly explained how to get there, so I wandered around for a while before I managed to find it. The room was like stepping back in a time machine, worn and shabby furnishings and a horrible bathroom, it is plain to see this hotel in its entirety is crying out for a major refurbishment. For the price you pay versus the quality of this accommodation, it is highway robbery and an absolute joke! Not to mention the exchange rates in the hotel! The gym was a sectioned off part of what looked like the banquet hall area, and was not even air-conditioned making it a totally unpleasant place to be. The only vague positive was that the beds were comfortable...Given the price paid there are too many other fantastic options in Waikiki, I stayed at The Modern on my last night which was amazing especially by comparison. Do yourself a favor and do NOT stay here! And to the Management and Staff at The Sheraton Princess, get your act together please!

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and were so excited when the lady we booked with made a big deal about finding us a room with a view and noting on our reservation that it was our honeymoon. Upon checkin, the lady didn't once mention honeymoon, and gave us a really hard time becauae their system didn't register our credit card. She made us feel like our card was declined and there were big issues. After about 10 minutes, it worked and she blamed it on her system...thanks for the panic attack.Our bathroom was growing mold, and we were put into a room that had doors leading to other rooms..this wasn't a problem until the last night of our stay when someone was put into one of those rooms and watched what sounded like adult films at 3 am. We complained about the noise, and security did come, but it happened again shortly after. It was a horrible way to spend our last night there and I would've been very upset if we had children with us.Our free honeymoon champagne came two nights after we arrived and must've been left by.housekeeping in the morning becauae it was sitting in a bucket of water.Other than those issues, we had a great view, and the location was close to.everything. The dinner buffet was overpriced, but the cut beef was good. Unfortunately, the noise issue may cause us to.go somewhere else next year for our anniversary. If I can hear the person next to us watch tv, it makes me nervous about having any romantic moments with my husband.

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon and thought it would be ok with Sheraton name, boy were we wrong, this is the worse hotel we have ever stayed at! We checked in went to our room walked into what I would describe a budget room which was supposed to be a high floor room with a king bed and ocean view! What we got was a room with two single beds! The shower had mold, mildew and hair in the bath.
