In the wardrobe on top of a chest of draws was a dirty glass with a dirty pillow slip on top of it, the beds had sand all around the bass of the carpet and the furniture looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the 1950's. I called the front desk and said this wasnt what we booked they said we don't garantee rooms we will not change you! I was so angry and went down stairs and spoke to Chia the manager who was so rude and just told us if we don't like it book somewhere else! I cant believe a manager would say that we even offered to pay more for a better room but that was not an option. We spent the first day in Honolulu looking for a hotel to stay at for the rest of our trip. We ended up booking a room at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach the staff there were so helpful friendly and the rooms were beautiful. If your looking for a beautiful room with hawaian hospitality do not stay here at the sheraton it will ruin your holiday experience!

Since my last visit to the Princess Kaiulani the hotel has improved.The beds are still a delight, so comfortable and clean. The service, while slow to book in, was very friendly. The Concierege/Doorman is a total delight, he keeps everyone entertained no matter how early it is in the morning!Entertainment and food was first class, particularly by the pool in the evening, watching the show.As a Starwood member my room was upgraded to an Ocean View room. The view was stunning. This room was very quiet and I was able to get a good nights rest.Central to the shopping district and a short stroll to the beach. The best value on Waikiki.Highly recommended.

Cant beat the location for the price your paying, its a 3 star and has alot facilities such as bar pool restaurants, for the resort fee of 18 dollars u get free bottled water beach towels and small chairs and few other extras. We paid extra 120 dollars for ocean view with balcony which was great...The rooms defo need upgrading and the bath shower area is small but great pressure from the nozzle. But if you want a newer more updated hotel spend an extra 150 dollars a night and stay at the Moana Surf Rider across the road...There is nightly Hawaiian entertainment with singing and dancing on the stage near the pool which adds to the ambiance. Overall if you want to expereience Waikiki and not break the bank this is ur choice, spend the money you save at the high end shops they have them all in Waikiki....

great service... great food... great staff... could not have asked for a better place to stay!! you will enjoy it! we had a later flight.. they let us stay by the pool till we had to leave, then gave us a room to shower in and get ready for our flight.. also we received a complimentary bottle of champagne for our aniversary

Great trip and excellent service. Room was always cleaned quick and ar condition worked excellent. Stayed in room 720 and over looked the pool. For the price you can't beat this hotel. The only down side was the service in the bar and pool area was lacking. I would stay here again.

[To frame my review it is important to know that I was stationed on Oahu while in the Army from 1982 to 1985 and again from 1992 to 1995 and visited two other times. The point being I have been familiar with the islands for some years now and several of the hotels in the Waikiki area as well.]This was my wife’s first visit to Hawaii and we stayed here from June 3 (Sunday) till checkout on June 8th (Friday) as part of a multi-island anniversary trip. I had booked this trip through Pleasant Holidays online on the Sheraton/SPG Website. Rather than pay a heavier price for one of the other SPG hotels on the beach, I opted to save money and stay here at the Princess Kaiulani. I had read Trip Advisor reviews prior to booking and was amazed that some people complained about the location of this hotel to the beach. Again, having lived here for over 6 years I knew this was CLOSE to the beach and also adjacent to the Hyatt Regency, Kalakaua Avenue (The main street in Waikiki) and the International Market place. I knew the rooms were going to be a bit older, but again, for the money and the Sheraton name, this was fine with me. When we arrived we were upgraded one level so instead of a city view with no balcony, we were given a city view with a balcony. I didn’t even ask, we were just given it. The room was adequate, the bedding fantastic, and the only complaint about the room was the air conditioning unit which was older. That is, it and could have worked better and could have been cleaner. Again, for a prime location in the heart of Waikiki, this didn’t bother me much. As far as service, maid service was spotty for the first three days. They kept forgetting toiletries and towels. This was finally remedied during the last two days. I did read on Trip Advisor that someone complained about the glasses being dirty and yes that happened to us. With the exception of one staff member, everyone was very cheerful and helpful, bell boys, desk staff, etc. The pool staff was extremely helpful and polite. The one staff member that I had a problem with was a hostess at the restaurant. We received two complementary cocktails and I went to get them while we were at the pool. The coupons gave the name of the bar as one thing, and the sign on the bar by the pool said another. So I asked the hostess at the restaurant and she condescendingly rolled her eyes pointed towards the bar by the pool and said “at the Bar” rather rudely. Again, the rest of the staff was fine. Not only is the hotel in great spot, but they also have an area near the famous Duke Kahanamoku statue were they bring you Fruit, and water. You can also get beach chairs at no cost. I’ve also read complaints about paying the resort fee however, the free in-and-out parking alone is worth the fee and you also receive free wireless access. Again, the complaints about the hotel’s proximity to the beach and the resort fee are really unfounded, just look at the map. For the price, this is a very good bargain and I suggest that you strongly consider it when planning a Waikiki stay. Mahalo for taking time to read my review.

My wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast with a good selection of items. In addition to the traditional western foods including an omelette station and fresh fruit, there was also Japanese food choices. The poolside location of the restaurant was nice and the food was good. But, please eat what you take! Because this restaurant is open air, when guests finished their meal and left their table, a flock of pigeons would land and start picking at the leftovers. It's a terrible waste to take food at a buffet and not eat it!

This was the wosrt Sheraton Hotel we have ever stayed inn, infact the worst hotel we have ever stayed inn. First we booked a high level water view room and payed accordingly, the room we got was on the 26th floor but had city views if you lent out over the balcony and looked to the left you could just see water between the buildings. When we got there my wife was sick so we stayed in the room the first night, in this room the safe didnt work and the plumbing leaked and when the wind blew the sliding door rattled. The next morning we went to reception and asked for a room with water views we were told that this room was a water view room but after checking we were moved to the other side to the 12th floor which had water and beach views however the plumbing in this room leaked worse the plug in the bath didnt fit, the door to the bathroom didnt close the balcony was dirty the room wasnt cleaned properly daily and in the lift lobby on our floor there was a half drunk drink on the table that sat there for 4 days. Downstairs the main walkways ran through the buffet so you had to dodge people with plates and vise versa, birds regularly flew in and helped themselves to food from the buffet. The pool regularly closed early and on one occasion clossed at 5.30pm just as we were getting back to the hotel from a day trip. They say they have a beach service with chairs and water and fruit service on the beach not once did we see this service and we had to carry our own chairs to the beach which were just little fold out chairs you sat on the sand. Over all this was a disapointing place we are SPG club members and when we wrote a review for them they refused to publish it.The best thing was the bed it was comfortable. Dont stay here.

I am not one to write reviews on hotels, but i thought this might help travelers seeking a hotel in a prime location in Hololulu.Sheraton Princess Kaiulani....Our initial room was dated with a broken ac, no hot water in sink or shower, and dingy carpenting/bedspread. Tjis may sound trival, but it mattered after 14hours of travel.We were upgraded to a new room in the new tower the next morning. I was very pleased with the service and accomodation the manager made for us. We then received the master suite on our last night at the hotel.Overall, the price and location is fantastic if you want to be in the thick of the action and across the street from the beach. I recommend staying in the newer tower. If you're looking for luxury- this isn't the place for you. If you want cleanliness and a place to sleep in walking distance from the main sites in honolulu- i suggest giving it a go.

My 5-night stay at the Sheraton was mediocre at best. The outdated air conditioning system left my room perpetually toasty (it didn't help that I was on the top floor, so heat rises...), and the rusty bathroom fixtures were pretty unsightly. The gym had nice equipment, but the room was nearly unusable because it was not air conditioned. A few circulating fans were on, but it was not enough even at 5:30 in the morning. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable with a soft, plush duvet, and if you are a Starwood Preferred member then they keep the room stocked with free bottled water. The fridge was also a fairly nice size, making it convenient to store some beverages and snacks from the ABC store across the street. I paid a conference rate of $140 a night and wouldn't pay a dime more to stay here. If you're going to Waikiki, go ahead and spring for something that's a bit more expensive but will have more updates.

I have stayed at many hotels in the world including many Sheraton worldwide and this Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is just an average hotel in a crowded place like Waikiki. We got room 656 that has partial (a peek) ocean view. Most furnitures in the room are outdated and need to be replaced. However, the cleaning staffs did a great job of cleaning, but one can feel its bathroom needs to be re-done as well.The hotel locates in a convenient location across the beach and within walking distance to shopping and restaurants.Since we have outdoor activities everyday for most of our 8 days stay, we did not stay in and only use the hotel room for sleeping and shower. Not recommended for a honeymoon or romantic trip that couple tends to spend more time in the room to enjoy the interior design and all.

I stayed in room 608 for 9 nights. One the third night bug bites started showing up on my body, by the 7th night bugs were feasting on me like a banquet. I reported this to the manager and she said she would have the room checked out by their professionals . When I came back later that day to check with them they said there was nothing wrong with the room. I wanted to change rooms but my wife said it was OK. That night i received 50 bites all across my chest. These itched so bad I did not get any sleep for the last two nights. They totally denied and ignored me. They are tearing down this hotel in 2014 anyway, so stay somewhere else. The pool is tiny, Birds are allowed to fly freely thru the breakfast area and poop on the tables & food. My stay was a nightmare.

By far this is not a 3-star hotel - lobby only perhaps. I spent a lot of time in the lobby over an hour just waiting in line to check-in! Once I finally arrived in the room I was shocked to see how cramped it was and it had 30-40 year old worn furniture. The bathroom counter tops were dirty and outdated, and only 1 person could fit in the room. I've stayed at Motel 6's that were better than this hotel. Oh and they charge you $18 for a resort charge - aka 2 bottles of water and outdated internet service ---- no wi-fi. Absolutely horrible, I will definitely write a letter to the Sheraton about my experience. It had two good things, comfortable beds and a nice flat screen TV.

Highlights:- we took advantage of several of the daily free activities: Hula dancing, ukulele lessons and lei making. All of the instructors were great, especially Daniel Nakashima!- Great housekeeping. Always came back to a clean room and were given more of the delicious coffee when requested. Staff were very friendly!- Guest services acted quickly when we needed help opening a stuck suitcase and needed extra bottled water- The bartender was happy to open our bottle of wine when we realized we didn't have a corkscrew- The complimentary mai tai/person were strong and delicious- Beach service was totally radical dude -- They always found us and the cold fruit and water was a welcome relief from the Hawaiian heat!- Concierge was knowledgeable about local areas. However if you're looking to keep your activities on the budget-side, stay away from the Tour and Activities desk, as although I'm sure there are plenty of fun tours, they will cost you a pretty penny- Upon arriving, we were upgraded to a larger room without even having to ask!Minor Annoyances:- Walls are paper thin. One morning, I actually heard the person in the room next to us wake up to their alarm, and then sigh. We also heard every word of a very awkward argument. Bring earplugs. We're halfway through our stay and looking forward to continued awesomeness. Thank you Sheraton Princess Kaiulani.

I've waited some time to write this so I would be calm when I make my comments. Let me start by saying that I have stayed at some very inexpensive hotels on occasion and I don't expect perfection, but this was the shabbiest room I've ever seen. I stayed at this hotel for four nights in March in a room on the 7th floor. The hotel was apparently fully booked at the time and I was told they couldn't give me a room at the standard check-in time. I was given a hospitality room for a couple of hours until a room became available. So much for a guaranteed check in time, but not too big a deal. Of course, all hotel rooms need to be re-furbished from time to time. Sometimes the furnishings or decor of a room may be somewhat worn. That's to be expected. However, this room was a mess. Take a look at the photos. The furnishings weren't just worn, they were worn out. The room wasn't just overdue for renewal, it was years overdue. Interestingly, housekeeping was doing a good job of dusting and vacuuming. I guess there wasn't much they could do with the black mold in the bathroom and the disgusting stuff on the shower head and hose, but the tub and floor were clean. Since the photos speak for themselves I won't describe in detail the shabby condition of this room. I'm sure that they must renew their rooms at some point but I would never trust this hotel for a stay again.There are many decent hotels that give good value in Waikiki and I've stayed at several. This is not one of them.

I'll start with check in. My flight was delayed by 8 hours, so I got in with my rental car at 3am. When I drove in front of the hotel, I was told by an employee I couldn't stop there, even to check in. I had to go park around back. So I drive around back, and find it's a parkade. With the elevators locked up for the night. The only stall available was on the 4th floor, so I had to haul myself, 2 bags of luggage, and my 3 year old down 3 flights of stairs!! I was NOT happy. When I get to the front desk, I'm angry and mention it, and the desk clerk shrugs at me. Next, my husband had already been there for 2 weeks. The room only had a double bed, so he requested to upgrade to a bigger room. No go. The desk clerk informs me the hotel was not informed myself and my son were coming. They certainly were informed. When I ask for a cot for my son, I was told the room is too small for a cot, but for a fee, I can get extra pillows and linens so my son can SLEEP ON THE FLOOR!! You want me to pay for my son to sleep on the floor? What a joke. The room is right next to the elevators, so we listen to that all night. Calls to the front desk go unanswered. I went to the activities desk and asked for toddler friendly tours. The guy gives me a map, and highlights how to walk to the zoo. Thanks.Then the icing on the cake was when I went to the restaurant for dinner. I walk in, ask if there is a kids menu. Yes, I am told, there is. The waitress says she'll bring one right over. 10 mins later, no menu ( the place is mostly empty). I get up, walk to where 4 servers are standing doing nothing, and ask for the menus. One of them hands them to me. 10 mins after that, with 2 servers walking right past my table, and not even acknowledging me, my son and I leave.Don't stay here!!

Stayed with my family for two weeks.This really is a great hotel.Large room and stunning views over to Diamond Headand the ocean.the staff were very pleasant and helpful.The bar area, which is also outside,boasts live entertainment, and hula dancers.The girls and the band members made my young daughter feel so special.There was also excellent cabaret night.The concierge service was excellent with the staffarranging our trips to Pearl Harbor, and hiring a car.On a a personal note, my daughter was taken ill,and nothing was too much trouble for the reception staff.They arranged for a limo to take us to and fromHonolulu Hospital, and all the arrangements were sorted for us.All in top class hotel and service.

Ive been to Oahu several times in the past 30 years. Unfortunately I was unable to stay on the beach the last two times due to my budget. I just got back from my honeymoon and stayed at the Princess again.. I do recommend asking for the pool view though. The first time I didnt know and woke up to a horrible view of the dumpsters, I upgraded and had a great view of not only the pool, but the ocean!!! This time when I booked it, i automatically booked with pool view. Sitting out on the lanai (balcony) is a Hawaiian experience in itself especially in the evening with the little Hawaiian band downstairs... The hotel does need a "new look" its alittle dated but just the rooms and especially hallways but it still wouldnt stop me from staying there. Its very clean, spacious rooms and a very ALOHA ambiance. I recommend this hotel as the best hotel in Waikiki beach if you cannot stay right on the ocean. Also, check in was at 3;00pm, we got in super early and explained it was our honeymoon and they let us have an early check in. Staff was great as well... two thumbs up and a big A+ for ALOHA!!!! Opps one more thing.. They provide free chairs, towels, water and fruit service at a certain location on the beach that is used only for there guests. Take advantage of it!!!!

This has got to be one of the best hotels in the world for service friendliness and location. It is just back from the beach and quiet enough to get some sleep in the well appointed rooms. great viewing from the upper floors and great value! Keeps its charm without the brashness of vegas, please dont change a thing!

As a world traveller I am confident in telling you that this is just an average hotel. A perfect place for a young couple on a budget to stay if they use the hotel room in the same fashion as you would in say Vegas (only a couple hours a day) The room is small and dated but functional as a sleeping and washing only "pod" not intended to impress or put you in the mood for romance. It is conveniently located less than a minute walk from the beach (as you certainly would not want to use the pool unless you are the type to go to the tropics and swim in fresh water when you can just do that at the Holiday in Toledo... but I digress) You have to keep in mind that no matter where you go in Honolulu (especially Waikiki) it's just another American city located in very beautiful setting. Expecting to "unwind" is unreasonable with the clanking dishes of restaurants located near pools and thousands soaking up the rays on the beach. At the same time it also isn't a super party place like say Cancun, or Orlando. You want relaxing go to Maui or the big Island (even Tahiti) Lucky for me I was here on business, when I go home I will need a vacation!

This Sheraton is a good value, but only average appointments. This is one of the better priced hotels for this area of Waikiki. The rooms are clean and well maintained, but most furniture needed to be updated at least 5 years ago.While we fully understand that "check in is not until 3" is a fair policy, and we appreciated the front desk completing our paperwork upon arrival at about 1:30 PM; waiting until exactly 3:00 PM to start releasing rooms (and making everyone stand back in line to get keys) makes the process go very slowly. Since every room does not get cleaned simultaneously, releasing rooms as they are finished would make us and the front desk all have a better arrival day.The location is very central in Waikiki and beach assess is very simple. The pool and patio dining area is very straightforward, clean and comfortable. I am surprised this hotel does not have a hot tub pool.We did not eat any meals on property, even though we were there for 5 nights. We generally look for more interesting choices than hotel food.Suggestions for travelers:If you have a car, drive to the top of the parking garage. The only elevator access from parking is on the top two parking floors, on the beach side of the garage. Every other part of the garage is accessed by stairs only.Also, this hotel has the largest in-rooms safes I have seen in 20 years, since the days of key safes. We were able to leave more stuff, than usual, securely in our room.Since we had a good idea of what we were getting and picked this Sheraton for value and location; we would gladly stay here again. We would just be happier with room furniture in better shape. If we had more money, we would have stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider across the street (and on the beach).

I checked in July 3 early with Celeste at the front counter with my Gold SPG card. She looked at my card and said it was invalid, she would not honor it and to I would have to call Starwood. She advised me to come back around 3 pm when the room would be ready. I came back around 3pm to check in and it went downhill from there. The line to check in was about 20 deep so I used the Gold Preferred line. I ironically got to deal with Celeste again. She asks" how can I help you?" I said I'd like to check in and she rudely says "I know that, I checked you in earlier". She then proceeds to tell me I have to go to the end of the other line because my Gold card is invalid. She then says OK, I will take care of this and proceeds to call Starwood and right in front of me says " I have an individual with an invalid card trying to check in, will you verify the number?" Of course the number is good so about 20 mins later she proceeds to check me in. The room she gave me was awful. Smelled of mold and very outdated. Looks nothing like the pictures posted on their website. I called down for a room change and they said no problem, we will send a new room key right up. 30 mins later i call back down to see whats taking so long and they had no idea what I was talking about. About 20 mins later they gave me another room. Lastly the elevators take forever. 10 -15 mins each wait for an elevator and they are packed. Felt like I was on a subway downtown.The customer service here is awful. The friendly Hawaiian attitude that is prevalent throughout the islands is simply non-existent here. This place is dismal and unwelcoming. I travel for a living and this property does not deserve the Sheraton name. I will never stay here again and if asked by friends or family I will advise against it.

The Princess Kaiulani is not one of the newer properties in Waikiki, but offers excellent location and also an excellent value compared to the other larger properties in Waikiki. On this trip, I was upgraded to a room with a nice ocean view, but internet reception was unavilable from that room, so they moved me to a lower floor property without a view. The Front Office Manager, Mayrose, was very accomodating in moving my the following day and even provided at no charge a MiFi adapter to use during my stay so that I am getting very fast response on my Ipad, Iphone and laptop.Also, there is nitely entertainment on the lobby level. Guests can get an excellent free showof the entertainment from their balconies. If you are a traveler on a budget, it is an exceptional value. Also, if you get a rate on the internet and will be staying at the hotel for 5 days or more, there is often a promotion that Sheraton offers only directly of 25% off the entire stay, which will beat their internet rates.

From 7/4-7/11 2012 we stayed in room 302 of the Sheraton Princess, a pool view room which was an unexpected and happy upgrade from a standard view room.The hotel itself has a stellar location directly across from the Moana Surfrider and quite literally a 2 minute walk to one of the best beaches in the world. It has a gorgeous open lobby adjacent to the very nice pool with lush landscaping and a nice bar and restaurant serving buffet breakfasts and dinner. We really enjoyed the pool and pool area after a morning on the beach. Please note that all Waikiki hotels have small pools, not what you will see in other vacation destinations. That being said, this is definitely one of the nicest - and we've stayed around Waikiki in previous years.The resort fee is $18 per day and with this we got free local calls, 60 minutes long distance calls per day, 2 bottled waters daily, free wi-fi (a bit spotty at times), a free child buffet with a paying adult, and free parking. I may be missing a thing or two. The fee is mandatory, but we certainly found value in it with parking alone. Our room was very clean. I will admit I was a bit disappointed at first with the bathroom which could perhaps use an update. After the first day, however, I didn't give it another thought. The rooms are just a teeny tiny bit outdated, but nothing to bother yourself with. We (my husband, 4-year-old and I) were quite comfortable there and found there was plenty of room for us. The bed and bedding were heavenly and housekeeping did a wonderful job each day. The walls featured lovely hawaiian floral artwork, and the television was a nice sized flat screen with ample cable, including Showtime. We're not terribly picky, but do feel we have reasonable - high standards and so I'm a bit surprised by the negative commentary in other reviews. This is Hawaii people - lighten up! Don't expect a Sheraton on the islands to mirror one in LA or NY - its just totally different, but great!A very large safe was available for use in the room, as was a nice sized fridge. Both free. The east wall was all glass, with 2 open sliding doors leading out to the balcony which had 2 chairs and a table. Lovely. Please note that the odd numbered rooms in this building (pool main building) do not appear to have balconies. All others in the 3 building do appear to have them.I will admit I was a bit hesitant to book based on mixed reviews. However, after staying here I see no reason to ever stay anywhere else - and I have stayed at 5 star hotels in Waikiki before. The location is perfection, right in the middle of everything without ever feeling anything but relaxed as she is set back just a bit. While some say she could use a facelift, I completely disagree. The Sheraton Princess has charm and a true Hawaii feel - she isn't "sterile."We loved our stay and have no complaints. We will absolutely stay here again!

This hotel was terrible! It either needs a major renovation, or needs to be torn down & rebuilt. The pool is tiny, lobby & hallways are totally outdated. A very busy & bustling hotel in a great location. Lanais are a good size. A plus was that the mandatory resort fee included parking & long distance calls. Bathrooms are tiny & not many towels provided. Also, nice touch with the beach service - chairs, towels, water & fruit - makes up for lack of a good pool.

The best thing I can say about this hotel is that the lobby and pool area, with the restaurant and bar are very nice. This Sheraton is convenient enough, being on a busy row of hotels, restaurants and shops. The staff were very professional and helpful. The rooms, however, are in desperate need of updating. It was small and the "balcony" was about three foot wide - barely big enough for the little table and 2 small chairs. The bathroom was very tiny and the outlets in it did not work! The worst part was the musty smell of the room. I was afraid all my clothes would pick up the odor, so I did not even unpack for my 3 day stay, kept all my clothes in my luggage. I am sure there are better places to stay in this very busy part of Honolulu.

Myself and my husband stayed here in June for five days for part of our honeymoon, and it was the biggest disappointment. We got married in a Sheraton hotel at home in Ireland and it was fabulous and as part of the Starwood group we were expecting a lovely hotel and great service. We arrived after a very long flight and the person at the check in barely looked at us, started having a conversation with someone else before we finished checking in, ignoring any questions I had about wifi etc and basically looking annoyed he even had to deal with us. No congratulations on being there on honeymoon (though we realise the amount of people on honeymoon in Hawaii) but a welcome or hi how are you would have been lovely. Starwood Group had said we would get an upgraded on checkin, but if our room was the upgrade I wouldn't like to see the others. Positives about the room were that the bed was comfortable and clean and we had a balcony with a nice view of the town though noisy at night. The downside was the room is in really bad need of refurbishment, cupboards off their hinges, extension leads lying around the place, bath not working (despite sending someone up to fix it, it still didn't work), grubby and worst of all it had a connecting door to the room next door so we could hear everything from our neighbours. We had booked a smoking room, though only one of us smokes and only ever outside but on arrival my husband went out on the balcony, closed the bedroom door and had a cigarette. The next day there was a phonecall reminding of us of no smoking, absolutely that's fair enough, though it wasn't inside and we haven't been able to figure out how they saw this, it remains a mystery. My husband from then on went downstairs outside the hotel to have a cigarette, though he smokes few and far between. On check out the manager tried to charge us $300 for smoking in the room that morning, claiming housekeeping had seen signs of smoking. This is an absolute con. We had been out since 7 that final morning, came back at 12 and housekeeping had not even been in the room. There was no apology or backtracking on their behalf, all but one of the staff we encountered was rude and the breakfast!!!! $24,99 per person, for a below average buffet, outdoor seating, with pigeons and birds walking on all the tables and on the plates and cutlery which is disgusting. The staff here need a good lesson from starwood on customer service. We will never get another honeymoon, and they really put a dampner on our whole trip, when it can so easily be avoided. From a very disappointed honeymoon couple. We left and checked into the Royal Hawaiian, now that's where you want to stay!

For my initial post, I hadn't actually stayed here yet. I had contacted the hotel to see about upgrading our room for our honeymoon. They said they made a note of it and when we arrived we were upgraded to a balcony room (originally we apparently did not have one). It was a mountain view, but still nice to be able to sit outside in the mornings and evenings. To our surprise, they also brought up a bottle of champagne and some fruits and other goodies to congratulate us!The pineapple carving demo was fantastic. He had a long line and it was the best pineapple i've ever had. The crafters that set up are also pretty cool to check out.My husband and I developed a daily routine of heading out to the beach, coming back to the pool for happy hour (waitress Debbie was the best!), then heading in to get cleaned up and venture out for the night. We did the breakfast buffet twice, but didn't sit down there to eat. Instead we did the to go box and ate on the balcony. The first time we both paid and had our own boxes, but found that was way too much food. The next time my husband went down and just made us box that we shared. Another perk to staying here is the beach service. Each day (as long as you use the provided beach towel so they can find you) you will get water brought to you out at the beach if you lay out near the duke statue. It was very refreshing. They also had apples and oranges, which made for a great snack. The food we tried during happy hour was just ok, and breakfast wasn't bad. There are definitely better places locally though. About our room - it was small and outdated, but clean and served its purpose well enough. Our a/c never seemed to really get very cold at all and the screen was completely covered in dust so thick that no air could get through it. We ended up leaving that open and it worked a bit better, though not much. The bed was very comfortable though, as were the pillows. We didn't spend all that much time in our room, so it was fine for our needs.The gym was a great bonus for me and I used it a couple of mornings. The activities desk was very helpful as well with booking our excursions. Overall, the hotel is in a great location because it's a short walk to either end of Waikiki beach and many great restaurants and shops. The staff was extremely friendly and the pool was a great way to relax in the afternoons.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is located in the second row at Waikiki Beach and directly on the main shopping street. The rental car companies Alamo and enterprise are next door, as are many restaurants. The hotel itself however is pretty run down, especially the room. They are extremely small, very simple and could use some renovations. During our two stays in June 2012, 2 out of 4 elevators weren't working so that lines would form in front of the elevators. There is no wi-fi in the rooms, only a cable connection and Internet is slow.We thought that for such a price you should be able to expect way more.

in absolute desperate need for renovations. the rooms are hideous, although clean i've seen travelodges better decorated than this. very basic amenities. the lifts take forever with two out of four working. the extra charge per day for optionals extras would be great if they were in the room. a very dissapointing experience. think time to move across the road...

Nice location, friendly, but ineffective staff. It took over an hour to retrieve our luggage and I had to go get it myself despite the face that I'd been told four times it was on its way up. I had to ask each day for our room to be serviced. The "optional" guest service fee is actually obligatory. The fresh fruit they promised only showed up on one day. The bathroom was dated and the shower was broken. And then there's the fact that Waikiki is so overrun with tourists that it's almost uninhabitable and astonishingly expensive. Breakfast for $30 per person? I don't think so.

We stayed at the princess kaiulani in june of this year. Other than an initial mix up with our rooms(booking by our tour centre in Australia got it wrong) we found the hotel to be in an excellent location,rooms were a little out dated but clean, service was very good and the views from our balcony were amazing. We got what we paid for and asked for. You dont come to Hawaii to sit in your room and look for negatives, you come to have fun and see stuff. We were on the go the whole time we were there, the rooms were really only a place to crash at night. Overall very good value and in the middle of everything. Thanks people, we will be back.

The Hotel was nice, well located and had good amenities. To much complaining on this site! It is what it is! Great rate, great location, nice pool, beach service, free parking alone is worth the extra "resort fee", and you get other things as well for only $18 bucks PER ROOM. Sure the room is just average, like a nice value hotel, but the new beds are great, and the linens are very nice, AC works well, and the views were good in most of the rooms. Staff service was great, and the tour desk was very helpful! They even remembered our names and sent my daughter birthday cake to her room during our stay! Very nice guys, thanks! Link was nice, pool was very nice, everything was close by. May not be the best Starwood property in HNL, and it is old, but the price and value make up for everything else. If you want the Ritz, pay the price, otherwise the Princess is a great option.

I also agree, the Princess is showing signs of her age. This my third stay in 10 years.We checked into a miniature room, but following a quick call to the desk were immediately swapped to a slightly larger room by the duty Manager. Thank you Eric.The shower mount head is not adjustable, the lower mount is missing and the room itself is very dated. it was reported at 9 am this morning and at 7pm it hasn't been fixed. No handy man on a Sunday? Not good enough for $160 per day.Despite the mandatory resort fee we had to rely on the 4G SIM cards of our iPads to get onto the Internet. The erratic nature of the I house Internet and the difficulty experienced trying to just log in made it too hard to persist in trying to log in.Similar to other users, we paid a lot for our two free water bottles a day.In today's competitive business environment, do yourself a favor and find a newer, cheaper, non resort fee venue. I won't be staying here next time. The deciding factor being the responses from the owners to other comments, but yet the same issues keep coming up.

It is almost 2 years to the day since my last stay here.My how things have changed. The usual facilities continue in place. The standard of servicing the rooms has slipped. It is not as speedy or complete as it used to be. The bedside table lamps did not work. The power cables lead behind the bed so it is impossible to see if they are plugged in or even whether there is a socket. Water flow in the shower is very slow and it was impossible to get water any hotter than warm.The biggest change however is the imposition of a COMPULSORY daily 'resort charge'.This $18 + tax per day charge covers a range of items from friendly/frustrating self parking to children eating free at the buffets as well as free bottled water at a specific location at the beach. Each of the various services has its own qualifications and limitations. These things might be fine for a family on a resort holiday but they are inappropriate for an older single traveller looking for a couple of nights rest & relaxation. When presented with the list of 'services' by the receptionist I went through it item by item and found not one of them could be used by me during my brief stay. "Do you mean that even although I cannot use any of these 'services' I still have to pay for them?""Yes."At this point I felt the possible presence of the Mad Hatter perhaps lurking behind a potted palm. I looked around and there he was, directing guests to & from taxis and busses. As I walked across to the lift lobby I am sure I glimpsed a white rabbit disappearing behind a sofa.The receptionist had no discretion and suggested I speak to the Hotel Manager who happened to be present in the reception area.After a brief conversation & review of the electronic records, authorised I be excused from the charge.My conclusion is that this hotel is mostly interested in accommodating family groups on week long or longer resort holidays. The compulsory 'resort charge' is another financial punishment to the solo traveller, of any age. As hotel check in time does not commence until 3.00pm, many guests would not receive much benefit from the first days charge.

The hotel is a block from the beach and overlooks the International Market. Shopping and farmer's markets were right there. We had rooms on the 22 and 28th floors and they had great views. Staff was great (even got fruit and water from the hotel on the beach) from housekeeping, counter people, concierage, wait staff, bell people and tour people. All our questions were answered, suggestions were given and our tours picked up in front of the hotel or across the street. Our flight out wasn't until 5:00 p.m. so when we checked out in the a.m. we could leave our bags at the bell desk and spend the rest of the day at the beach before we had to leave. Food and drinks at the hotel were good. Only complaints, we had reserved all 3 rooms close to each other and 2 rooms with king beds and 1 room with 2 doubles. Got 2 rooms on the 22nd floor and 1 room on the 28th and 1 king bed and 2 rooms with 2 doubles. Two of the couples were celebrating anniversaries so 2 rooms with king beds would have been nice.Also, the resort fee of $19/night/room showed on some sites and some books as optional. It is not optional so we paid an extra $400.00 (3 rooms x 7 days) for 2 bottles of water/day. The resort fee includes free parking (we did not have cars), free internet in rooms (we did not bring laptop and there is internet in the lobby) 2 free bottles of water/day and free towels for beach (we had own towels). To be honest, since the resort fee is required the hotel should just include it when room prices are quoted.We would stay here again.

THis is a property 1 block away from Waikiki beach. You will not want to stay in other locations but here. There are some other Oahu chains that can be cheaper but can be a bit of a risk in cleaness. This Sheraton location has very comfortable beds, clean showers, clean linen and a nice swimming pool. The best part is that theuy have hawaiian shows every night . Great selection of music. The bar is open for your to have a drink out and enjoy the location. Very relaxing and affordable.

The location of this hotel is right on Waikiki. That is the best bit . The majority of guests are Japanese and tour guests.The main reception is smart, but the towers rooms are old and delapidated. The rooms smelt old and musty and the room furniture appeared to have been over painted off white and from a jumble sale. The bathroom was circa 1950 or 1960's . The bathroom had chips on the door and tiles. The sink plug holes smelt off human waste or stagnant waste .Needs a total revamp and in my opinion the rooms are not 4 or 5 star . More 2 (or 3 at a push!)Didn't eat here due to price and various better restaurants on Waikiki so can't comment . Stayed at this hotel as a tour of the islands package with our tour company. Would not stay again at this hotel . Due to state of the rooms, the bathroom - shower and sink smelt.( NB we stayed in two seperate rooms, one on arrival and seperate one on return to Waikiki and this hotel - ie both next to each other and seperate rooms and both had same problems as described).Conclusion- would not stay here again . Rooms need ugent 100% makeover . It was part of a tour we were on, hotel selected by tour provider- otherwise I would recommend other tourists stay at other Waikiki hotels that have been revamped ie Outrigger, Hilton or Hyatt

I found my stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani to be very relaxing and enjoyable. The hotel is very decent. The rooms aren’t exactly luxurious, but they’re very comfortable. My only complaints were that the pool opened late and closed early, and the shower didn't run as well as it could have. Other than that, this hotel was well worth it. Although my room wasn't facing the ocean, it had a nice view of the city and the International Market. It was nice relaxing on the balcony and listening to the music during the 9th Annual Waikiki Spam Jam. Pikake Terrace, the restaurant inside the hotel, served excellent food. I especially enjoyed the breakfast, and watching a cook preparing the omelets. The warm weather and view of the pool made breakfast and dinner feel very serene.The hotel's location is very ideal. It's surrounded by restaurants, shops, and the beach is a short walk away. The International Market is right next door, King's Village is across the street, and ABC Stores are EVERYWHERE.

We have just returned from a week at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and sit here very impressed with our stay.The location was perfect.this was our 3rd visit to Waikiki (the last being 10 years ago).We chose the Sheraton based on its location , price and facilitys and it did not dissapoint.We travelled with our 7 year old daughter and booked a High Tower and Ocean View Room.We were thrilled when we recieved our room key to find we were infact on the top floor of the tower with an amazing view of the ocean as far as the eye could see.Yes the rooms were a little run down , but really it is not advertised as a 5 star so we didnt expect 5 star facilitys .we were comfortable.The beds were amazing and the little touches such as the newspaper at the door most mornings and the bottle of champagne left for us for our wedding anniversary was just lovely as was a few bottles of water at the beach and a fresh peice of fruit delivered right to us at our beach chairs..Each day our room was cleaned and beds made etc very promptly and never were we disturbed for room cleaning if we were running a little late on getting up and out for the day.Our room was right next to the Lift shaft and really this did not make any difference to us at all even when occupancy went high over the weekend.I am a light sleeper and not once did I hear noise to a level to disturb me.What else can I say except the beach 2 mins away, shops at your door step, amazing views , lovely little pool and nightly entertainment ,and a great team working at the tour desk happy to assist and work within your budget.we are frequent overseas travellers and think that this place is very reasonably priced for what it offers.Thankyou Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for making our anniversary / family holiday just wonderful and we cant wait to come back one day soon.

Would never stay at a Sheraton again. Have stayed at many Sheratons before. On this trip stayed at The Sheraton on The Big Island have nothing but praise for that hotel. However the trip soured when arriving at our room in Waikiki. I have stayed at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani before and was expecting something similar to my first experience. The room we received was tiny very run down and basic and with tiny ants on the furniture. Not what you would expect from a 4 star property. Our room overlooked the car park which we heard constant car alarms and reversing of trucks all times during the day and night. The air con was a huge unit on the wall right beside the bed and had to be used all the time as the door to the balcony couldn't be left open due to the noisy car park. We complained about our room but were told they were fully booked and they also agreed we received not one of the better rooms. We were given a fruit basket and chocolates didn't improve our stay any, the pineapple was half wrotten.

Very nice location -- directly across from Waikiki Beach; however, of the 3 ‘towers’ that make up the Hotel, we ended up in the one that had only ethernet connection. In order to get wi-fi, we had to come down to the lobby!! We reserved a deluxe oceanview room on an upper floor. Wouldn't you know it! The highest rooms are also the rooms that are still in theStone Age!! So much for paying extra to have a balcony with a view!

This hotel is excellently placed in the centre of Waikiki. It is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, especially Tomtmy and Marsha at the tour desk. Nothing was too much trouble, and their knowledge of the area and the available tours was outstanding. Waikiki beach is across the road, there is a great pool onsite, and ample fresh towels when required. Bar staff around the pool were attentive and gave great service. I would definitely stay here again if I had the chance.

Marsha Southworth, the travel advisor at the concierge desk was brilliant. She went out of her way to arrange and advise on excursions. Worth her weight in gold.The hotel was central, clean and comfortable. The $18.00 per day surcharge for items not needed nor wanted nor used, grated.

I stayed here for a week as an add on to an organised trip of the West coast of America. Loved this hotel. I really liked the way the lobby was so open and big. The location is great, right beside everything and only a minute or two from the beach, The free wifi in the lobby was very handy. The staff were very friendly. The room was big- beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel- I'd love to be returning! Hawaii is beautiful !

Traveled with family to attend the HS graduation of the son of a Japanese exchange student we had back in 1984. The hotel was clean, comfortable and staff very friendly. We had to switch rooms upon our arrival due to a minor problem and the staff was very accommodating. The next day when we arrived back to our room we found a beautiful fruit and candy basket from the management for our inconvience. Located across the street from Waikiki Beach it was the perfect place to walk to a wide variety of shops and restaurants. The pool area was large and the girls enjoyed swimming everyday. We booked a couple tours thru an in-house travel agent Mansha Southworthy who had a vast knowledge of the area and pointed out everything that we should know. She was very knowledgable, helpful and friendly.

Mahalo to everyone at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel. I stay at the Sheraton PK about twice a year when i come to Hawaii to visit my family. All of my relatives live on Hawaii and i could stay with them for free but i always choose to stay at Sheraton PK to have some quality vacation time (as well as family time). Sheraton PK is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. I never rent a car because it's so central that we are able to walk everywhere. Friendly staff, great location, great service and i LOVE the buffet / nightly live Hawaiian music. I would also like to single out a few staff that went above and beyond the call of duty. Bo @ the Big Kahuna towel check out, Calvin who does maintenance/engineering (he helped us with our internet connection -- kindest man ever) and Ligaya who works in housekeeping. Mahalo !! See you soon!

I've stayed at the Sheraton PK quite a few times before renting a condo now and I always enjoyed the stay there. A great hotel. great service and the food is fantastic. They also have a good show to see there. Their friday and saturday buffets are great.....

Stayed in this hotel from 23-28 May to celebrate our Anniversary. The front desk was courteous and even though we booked through a tour agency, we were given an upgrade from city room (lower floor with queen bed) to a city view room (high floor with king bed and balcony). We were also pleasantly surprised with a fruit basket with a box of macademia nuts on the 2nd night of our stay ^_^.The room is clean and the bed was super comfy, however, the pillows were a little too flat. The location of this hotel is extremely convenient. We are just a street away from the beach and beside International Market Place. You will be able to find food everywhere!Even though the hallway looks a little dated, the overall experience is still wonderful. Would definitely recommend my friends to stay here!

Nice hotel with good food restaurants near by...Great walking distance for shops and the international market place.Hotel is a little dated, but a nice clean bed and shower is all you needView of the ocean is great.Quiet room and clean overall.

This hotel is not a luxury, 5 star accommodation that you would expect to be association with the Sheraton brand. It's a little tired and it's very big (which makes queueing for lifts trying). However you simply cannot beat it for location. We stayed here for our first three nights in Waikiki to get our bearings and cannot fault it. We had a high rise ocean front room which meant we had beautiful views of Waikiki beach and the world famous comfortable Sheraton sleep maker beds. The bathrooms (and whole hotel) could do with a refurbishment, but the breakfast buffet is delicious, the self serve laundromat is cheap and convenient and the staff are friendly - especially the bell hops. There are also a lot of free computers and free wi-fi in the hotel lobby. If you are coming here with the intention of sitting around the pool I wouldn't recommend it as the pool area is not that nice, but as a convenient base and a comfortable bed if you're out and about all day you can not go wrong. The biggest con for us was the massive queue on check-out and we had a flight to catch. A bus full of Japanese tourists had just arrived and instead of dealing with them as a group, they were getting checked in individually. Tip - check out the night before and just drop off your room key to avoid the stress. A great hotel as a base to explore Waikiki, probably not suited for those who want to spend a lot of time sitting around the hotel and pool.

Was annoyed that we had specifically paid for an ocean room view and the only time you saw the ocean was when you stood on the balcony .I did complain to reception as I had paid extra but was told that room 2667 was "ocean view "PROS:$18 daily charge covered parkingHad a couple of maintenance issues that were handled immediately.Great locationFree internet access in reception area.CONSHappy hour was a rip off - $0.50 discount on beer is a joke and they halve the alcohol content of cocktails.Food was very expensiveVery noisy in the streets after 7pm Wi fI did not work in our rooms . Hotel was mainly geared up for the Asian tourists .

My mom and I stayed here for 3 days and it was so much fun. We walked everywhere and just loved every minute of it. It could not have been a more friendly relaxed atmosphere. Good food, good entertainment ( we watched from our room balcony), good times. No complaints at all. Truly a perfect stay. Mahalo!

Recently spent 8 nights at this Hotel and after reading several reviews about the rooms was a bit apprehensive but found the rooms to be of ample size with comfortable bed and terrific views from verandah, what more could you ask for. Service was friendly and informative. Location was great for shopping, eating out or hanging at the beach. One gripe was the wi-fi wouldnt work in our room but you can always go down to the foyer and use the Hotel computers but who wants to be on a computer when your on Holidays anyway. All in all great Hotel, great holiday, my Wife is already planning our next trip and would have no hesisitation in staying at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani again. Mahalo.

My husband and I visited Honolulu for a week in early May. While the staff is quite friendly, and our room was clean enough, the facilities need a complete renovation. PROS:Good locationNear the beachFriendly StaffGreat BuffetWorkout FacilitiesCONS:Old rooms, decorGarage distance to rooms

Great location, is a little worn down, bit like the airport, wasn't a bad hotel you get what you pay for. Great location close to shops and the beach, pool a little small especially when really busy, our room had a nice view of the beach, down side bloody birds at breakfast, every time you left your table, they fly in and eat your food! Gotta sort that out! Had a nice stay :), oh great little coffee shop right next to hotel, for the ones that love your coffee!

Took incredibly long time to check in. Was forced to upgrade and pay extra to receive two beds which had been part of our reservation. Bartender barked at me when I went to poolside bar to order a drink, after another person had cut in front of me. Then he said he was really busy and the server would bring our drinks, which she did. This hotel is older and in serious need of renovation, especially the bathroom. Toiletries provided were cheap-soap would not even suds up. Had to buy a bar of soap @a nearby store. Last day we were there, I killed something on the dresser-don't ask..........Would not stay here again.

I was pleasantly surprised at the proximity to shopping. restaurants and the beach ( Waikiki is a very crowded beach ). The staff were friendly, beds were very comfortable, but the decor is very tired and furniture well used. I spent very little time in the room due to my conference. The food was not great and I did not enjoy sharing my table with the pidgeons!!! I would stay here again but I did think the rates were high for the room and food quality.

I forgot to put this review on, but, we stayed in May-June 2011.The location for this hotel is perfect, you don't get much better for Waikiki Beach.As some of the other reviews mention, the rooms are a little older and one day could do with an upgrade. However, most hotels in the main are of Waikiki are like this... If you can get this hotel for a good price, them you can't beat it if you are thinking about staying in Wakiki.I recommend this hotel and will stay here in the future.

The hotel is right next to the International Marketplace and is right across from the beach so the location is great. It's an older hotel but the room was basic and comfortable, had the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds (which I liked). The room had a safe and fridge and we had a balcony with an ocean view. The air conditioning was kind of loud, but we got used to it. There wasn't a real restaurant, more of a bar, a buffet and a small appetizer menu. They had very good entertainment each night - hula dancers, great Hawaiian singers - something different each night. The pool was fine but there is no hot tub. You get free towels for the beach and sand chairs (which was nice). The pool people were very friendly and were a great resource for local attractions. The best part was the location. I had stayed at the Marriott before and it was just too far. All in all I was happy with this hotel.

Stayed three nights for business travel - you get the standard room layout that most frequent travelers could sketch with their eyes closed! Positives included location, friendly staff, large fitness room, and great Hawaiian Coffee cabana on site. Negatives included the need for a room remodel, rather uninspiring food choices, and street noise at night.Overall not bad for the price

Sorry, I did not stay at this hotel, but I saw the Creation Show there. Thanks to the excellent advice from the Hawaii experts (Dusty), we decided to do the show with cocktails only. It was really entertaining and we didn't have to go all the way to PCC. This is really a good option for people with limited time and budget. Get the coupon on offer and you can't go wrong. Parking is also validated.

Stayed for a couple of days at the Sheraton PK, and honestly wished we hadn't. As many reviews have already highlighted, the hotel is run down, worn, old, and overall the worst Sheraton I can ever remember staying at. For a Sheraton brand, you expect better. During our stay, the hotel was busy. Constantly long queues at the front desk, not enough staff. The charging of a resort fee is a disgrace... we didn't have a car, and there was no wi-fi access in the rooms.If you are an SPG Platinum (or Gold).... forget staying here - zero benefits, except for "points".Never again for Sheraton PK, and will now question my SPG membership, this branded hotel is just not up to standard.

I just came back from a week-long stay in Waikiki and at the PK Sheraton. I'm very seriously confused on how to proceed with with review because so much of what went wrong with the stay could not be controlled by the hotel itself but the property alone lends itself to some problems.Facts: Right off Waikiki beach (about a 2-3 minute walk at most). We took a cab from the airport and it was ~$25 (before tip). Cab to the Ala Moana shopping center ~$9-$12(before tip). Easy access to dining, ABC Stores (Like a very expensive Walgreen's...hint to those traveling with infants...bring enough diapers to get you through at least 24 hours. We paid $14 for 10 diapers at an ABC store), There is a grocery store (Food Pantry??) located on the next block behind the hotel. There is a small, but cold, refrigerator in the room which is a huge convenience.So, the good stuff first. The staff that we dealt with were pleasant and worked efficently to solve the problems that arose (more on that later). The location is excellent for dining, shopping and the beach. The hotel has beach towels/chairs available every morning and if you hunt down the PK guy while you are on the beach they will give you free water/ fruit - just show them your room key. The pool is a very simple area but is clean and there were plenty of chairs each day in sun or shade. We were in two different rooms during our stay (more on this later) and both of them were "partial ocean view" but I don't think a full ocean view upgrade could have been much better. The first room was 1771 in the Ainahau wing and is a corner room which gave us a great view of the oceam from the balcony. The second room we were in was 956. This was wonderful as well - a pool/ocean view. Next, the average stuff. The rooms were, as many reviews have described, dated. I found them to be clean, however. Things like the wallpaper peeling a bit or an older faucet on the shower didn't bother me. If you want the most up to date property, this isn't the one you are looking for. Next, the $18/day "resort fee". This was a bit of a rip off, IMO. I suppose if we had a car the entire time, it would have been a good value because it covers parking. It also covers one hour of local or LD telephone time but who uses a regular phone anymore? It covers a host of other things that we never took advantage of. Now the less than awesome. I should preface this by saying that there was very little (if anything) that the hotel could control about most of this. They handled my complaint as best they could. I wish that I had been aware of some of this before I made reservations - I may have changed my mind about staying here.There is absolutely NO wireless in the Ainahau tower. You have to use a network cable and the internet is SLOW. I sort of/kind of got a wireless connection in the looby but could never maintain it out by the pool. This was not my understanding - I was lead to believe when I called the property that the $18/day resort fee covered the wireless. Working was very frustrating. The first night we arrived around 8pm. There was music BLARING - I thought it was coming from our neighbors. It was very loud. Unfortunately, it wasn't the neighbors; it was coming from the street. Around 1am, I finally called the front desk, exhausted. They were very polite and told me that the cops had been called, the guy was supposed to quite down at 10pm but sometimes the cops had to come shut him down. The next night it wasn't singing that kept us up but the guy with the calpsyo drums. I went to the front desk and they moved our room to an "inside" room (#956) in the same tower for the next night. This happens frequently, obviously. tThey have an apology card preprinted and have a procedure on how you are moved. The noise is better from this room but there is a lounge singer from the hotel that goes until ~11pm. (I should also note that we were traveling with our infant so we were in our room earlier than we would normally be. If this were just me and my husband, the noise probably wouldn't have bothered me so much because I wouldn't have been in my room that early.)One of the last days we were there, the pool was closed due to "organic contamination". It was poop. There was poop in the pool. Again, nothing the property could do about it but...just....there was POOP in the POOL. They handled it well, though. So that's about it. Other than the bar, I never ate or drank anything at the hotel. It was normal, over-priced hotel food from what I could tell (we'd walk past the breakfast buffet everyday). I don't think I would stay at this property again simply beacuse I don't like the fact that I was on their schedule rather than my own....with the entertainment, the lounge singer, etc... It was impossible to just watch a sunset or read a book in the evening on the balcony. However, it's not nearly as awful as other reviews have made it sound. I'm completely ambivilent about this property.

My husband and I went to Oahu this past April 2012 for our anniversary and had a very nice experience at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. The room was clean and very nice, the bed was great and the service was very good. There is an $18.00 daily service fee, but you get parking included in the fee. We had a wonderful time.

Stayed for 9 nights in April and May. Got a beautiful room overlooking the pool and the hotel opposite other Sheraton hotel (Moana Surf-rider) and you could also see some of the beach. Very nice.I hate that you pay the resort fee, come on Sheraton sort this out!The room was just slightly old fashioned but clean and reasonably well appointed. Beds very comfy. I asked for a foam pillow to support my neck and they obliged me. They provide a small number of towels (this is budget remember not luxury). Bathroom are really quite old and small. Bath is ancient!! Service was reasonable, anything we asked for we seemed to get. We chose not to eat here because having had a few drinks, and realised they were poor quality, I didn't want to risk paying a lot for bad food. Now, if you have been to Hawaii or London or Paris or Rome, you will know that the hotels are very expensive, offer tiny rooms and often are old and tired. So you have to consider this is what Hawaii offers...i went tho see a room in the Sheraton Waikiki because I would like to stay somewhere with a new bathroom, well the baths were the same!! So, stay here if you are ok to be near the beach do not plan to eat there a lot and also don't mind not having proper beach service (i.e. umbrella and lounger provided), bear in mind you can hire sun loungers anyway. Good value of money and yes I would stay again!

A little late but I stayed in December 2011. This was the last hotel my partner and I stayed in after our travels in Hawaii. My aunt and uncle stayed here 21 years ago for there honey moon and said how great is was. I can tell you now it was in the same condition now as it was 21years ago. It completely ruined the end of our trip. The room stunk and was dirty. The location is great and the view from our room was perfect, but the hotel was overly crowded 24 hours of the day, lifts were slow and the hotel was filled with nothing but tour groups from the asian region which made it difficult as all they did was push you out of the way and squeezed into the lifts.

The rumor on the local hotel circuit is that the Princess Kaiulani was to be closed for two years and undergo a renovation. There are no changes to the hotel parking which is still approx 4 floors and no elevator but the hotel is vibrant, beautiful and a favorite among Japanese tourists. The lobby area is beautiful and no matter where you look, you cannot find signs of a hotel that has been in business for many many years. The rooms are all modern with the Sheraton Sweet sleeper, mini frigs, bottles of water and coffemaker not to mention a flat panel TV. The property is nice and quiet given the age of the property. Very tasteful designs and furnishings. The beautiful thing with the property is that it is still a gem and within walking distance to the Moana Surfrider and the beach. The hotel has a killer Breakfast buffet complete with Japanese foods and an omelette bar.

Just came back from my 10days stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani! I had previously stayed at this hotel the same time last year celebrating our annyversary and my husbands birthday. This year we decided to stay again at sheraton and we were very pleased. The first few nights we were on the 11th floor of the princess wing. The room was small but very cleaned. The bed was really comfortable. All the hotel staff was very friendly from checking in to the bell boy. We were given a bottle of champagne and fruit basket from the hotel which was very nice and thoughful of them. We really enjoyed it! Thank you Sheraton and the management team! During the last few nights of our stay my husband decided to upgrade our room the the deluxe ocean view room. The staff was very accomodating and was able to get us a room on the 8th floor overlooking the moana surfrider and ocean. Overall this hotel is best all around its right next door to the international market and within steps of the beach. The daily resort fee of $18 was not bad becuase it included parking. I am already planning my next trip to hawaii and i will def stay at sheraton princess kaiulani! Best hotel for the price and location! Thank you for making our 2nd trip to hawaii memorable!

I had read some reviews on tripadvisor before we went on our trip and was a little concerned about our stay here, but my concerns were unfounded. We had a wonderful time. The staff couldn't have been nicer! They recognized us from day to day and that is always nice when you are on vacation. We didn't have an ocean view room, but that was no problem as we spent very little time in the room itself. I would definitely stay here again. The only reason I didn't give a 5 rating was check-in. It was rather slow and not because of the staff, but because there were not enough people working the desk.

We stayed for 10 nights, I had my 2 toddler boys and hubby. Kaiulani is an older property but excellent location. We booked thru Priceline and manage to have our special request due to the fact that cribs don't fit in the smaller rooms in the other wing. Had a city view on the 10th floor. The music does go on late around all of Waikiki. After all this is a happening place. You get use to the loud music. Only Sunday night there's a rest day. As an SPG member you can book for around $120 at this time of the year but I managed to bid $90. Everyone has to pay a resort fee of $18. Great location. I knew reading the reviews this property is older. They keep it clean here. King size bed was comfy. All in all this is good value on the main strip.

I have been a Gold Star SPG member for years, and with my husband (who has been Platinum for years) we have stayed at SPG hotels all over the world on many occassions. I checked into the Princess Kaiulani on May 12th as a local in Hawaii expecting the same level of service and quality I experienced there and other Hawaii Sheratons. How WRONG I was! I don't know which to complain about first- the BEDBUGS, or the smoke filled room every night, or the TV cable connection that shut off at 7 pm each night, or the surly woman at the front desk who checked me in and failed to provide a parking pass. The bell staff and cleaners were great, one of whom told me when directly asked about the bug bites that covered my ankles and legs, that indeed my wing has bedbugs!!! Truly GROSS. If I weren't such a loyal SPG member I would swear off this hotel chain forever, but because I am I know that this hotel is the rotten apple in the basket! SPG if you don't want your reputation destroyed, DUMP this hotel and let it sink to the 2 star level it actually is!Disgusted in Hawaii in May 2012

Spent One night here as part of a stopover between Sydney & Miami. We arrived at the hotel at 8am & we were given our room right away which was nice. We paid for a high room with a view & we were not disappointed. From the balcony we could see the ocean & a lot of the Honolulu skyline. This is a very large hotel with a large welcoming foyer. There always seemed to be something going on around the foyer & the free internet computers in this area were well appreciated. The location of this hotel is it's best feature. Only a minute's walk onto the sand & the markets are next door. Everything in Waikiki is within walking distance.The room was large with everything you need & the bed was super comfy.This was a very good choice of hotel that proved to be real value for money.

I love this place. Came here with my mom and two small children and they had everything I could want. I suggest paying the extra for a pool view room because there is entertainment every noght. Staff was wonderful and the rooms were very clean. they had a free activity in the lobby almost everyday and epolpe selling cool things. So close to the beach and the International Market and just a great all around time!!! I will stay here again!!!

I've stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani several times. I stayed there this past weekend. The hotel is really starting to show it's age - getting old and tired - and ready for a renovation. The rates still seem to be competitive with other nearby hotels, but you may be better served with another place along the Kalakaua strip. I'm a big fan of Starwood, but it's not likely I'll stay here again when visiting Honolulu.

This is our third stay at this amazing hotel and it just gets better. This time we stayed on the 15th floor with ocean views. The view was not as good as last year on the 20th floor but still spectacular. The staff are the friendliest and most helpfull you could find, from the bar staff, waiters, porters etc etc. The poolside show is great and it's right next door to the International Market place if you like good cheap food. Immerse yourself in the Hawaiian culture and you will enjoy your stay even more. My whole family took part in the Hula lessons and had a ball. The beach is close and there are great restaurants within a five minute walk. We are already booking for next year. The room prices are very reasonable given the great location and wonderfull atmosphere.

Stopped over in honolulu for 3 nights on the way to Vegas and then stopped here on the way home for 2. Found the rooms very clean, staff friendly and was central to all the main activities.We had an Ocean View room which over looked Waikiki Beach, definately worth the extra money.Found Concierge very helpful and when you go to book your day trips definately use the desk at the front of the hotel, they are so helpful and friendly. Rooms are starting to get a little tired, but you are not paying 5 star so don't expect too much.Would definately stay there again.

We were in Honolulu for a conference and stayed 3 nights. For the price we paid, were were very pleasently surprised. The location is very close to the beach. We enjoyed eating at the International Market next door. Our room was not a 5-start hotel, but very functional, quiet and comfortable (we could tell that the bathroom was old-but was clean). We enjoyed the small fridge in the room. The pool and activites were a very nice addition. The 9 dollar resort fee included two waters, parking, internet and fruit juice- which was all very nice. The service was also very nice. We had no problems during our stay. We will definately stay here on our next trip.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October. Celebrated our Silver Wedding during our stay. Found it it very nice but expensive! It's ideally situated to all amenities and the beach. Rooms were a decent size and maid service was very good. Staff were friendly and courteous but always appeared busy. To be honest we did get a little bored. To find decent entertainment we had to travel out. The entertainment in the hotel was OK! A good base for visiting Pearl Harbour which is amazing and also emotional. There's a resort fee too! If i were to visit Hawaii again would i stay at the Sheraton Princess? ...............Yes i would!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for out honeymoon in March 2012. Everybody was very friendly as soon as we came to the hotel. After a very tiring overnight flight from Sydney, we wanted to have a quick rest in the room, however ours wasn't ready yet. The hotel staff advised that they can offer us a cheaper room that was ready if we were desperate with mountain view and it was a bit smaller. In return they would provide free breakfast for the duration of our stay and waive the resort fee. We took the gamble and it was great! The room is a bit outdated but it was fine and had everything we needed, we saved money on the resort fee and the daily breakfast was fantastic! We did have a bit of trouble getting Wi-Fi to work in our room for a couple of days, but after that it was all fine. The location is great as it is central to everything. We will definitely be staying here again!

Spent an overnighter here and was really positvely surprised. The upgrade to a J- Suite ocen view helped of course. Breakfast buffet was excellent with a lot of variety. Property was dated but well maintained. Location is good/central. Wireless does not function in the higher tower, but the view makes up for it and my wife was happy out that!!!

Booked with points plus cash-- bargain deal. From the moment we arrived, customer service was the focus. The bellman from the shuttle to check in-- We rec'd a basic upgrade being SPG members and our bags arrived moments after going to the room without an additional charge. Other reviews noted it was outdated. Rooms were average, not outdated and comfortable. Also comfortable seating in all outside and main areas. Waikiki is a city-- over room had a slice view that was great. We could just sit on the balcony and take in the city and beautiful water view. Breakfast buffet pricey, but again the service was great. We only said prior to getting on the Pride of America Cruise but if we had to stay in Waikiki again, would not hestiate for the cost savings for being across from the beach.

We stayed in this hotel several times on our trips to Oahu. The reason we choose to stay here is because the overall value for what you get is probably the best you'll find in Waikiki. We have always stayed here as a couple but we'd stay here for business, with our children, friends or just solo.LOCATIONIt is right next to the International Marketplace and the main strip. You don't have to walk through a dark ally to get there either, it's literally just steps away.PRICEThe location alone will justify the price of this hotel which is mostly on the low side if you just get the cheapest room (under $150/night). Although they charge an $18 resort fee, the parking and in-room wi-fi internet is included which is a huge plus. Usually these services at other hotels can easily drive the cost off the wall. They also gave us two bottles of water in our room per day which is also very nice.ROOMWe usually get the cheapest room because its nice and clean. The main thing is that we are comfortable. You can say I have a phobia for bugs and reasonable on cleanliness so that should explain what I mean by comfortable. If you're looking for luxury or a view either try an expensive room or find another hotel. It will be a waste though as there are many things to do and many beautiful views outside that will keep you out of your room anyway. Don't forget to tip the cleaning lady daily!
