You don't have to, but we find our room is always so much better when we come back and we really do appreciate those who clean up after us so we want them to know that :)STAFFMost times, the staff is nice and will go out of their way to help you or greet you at the least which we really appreciate. We noticed that since we are practically local (from the Big Island) most staff everywhere in Oahu are either very, very rude or just ignores us completely -- but we're glad this hotel is the exception and treats everyone equally.PARKINGThere is an elevator in the back side of the parking garage which you probably won't find right away. Depending on where your room is you might find it easier to park near the stairs. Unless you have a good amount of heavy luggage, this shouldn't be a problem. Elevators to your room floor is available from the lobby which is only steps from the parking garage.RESTAURANTI like the food here. It is typical Hawaii restaurant food though. We never expected a difference in price either. I'm guessing most people will consider the buffets expensive but again, this is usual. We'd rather walk a short way to the Cheesecake factory which is not a buffet but is delicious and less costly. But if you can afford it, why not? The only problem I see with the restaurant is that the buffet extends across the main walkway of the hotel so it has a feel of "crossing the street" to get your food. It also is uncomfortable as a guest passing by. We do like the live music during dinner though :)Choose this hotel if you're the reasonable type that would rather spend big bucks elsewhere but have a nice overall comfortable experience.

We stayed 3 nights on the 14th floor. Room was decorated from the 70's. Old furniture and several shades of paint color. Staff not very friendly, restaurant and bar very slow with service. We waited 20 minutes to get a drink order. Free internet, but NO Wi-Fi in the tower. You must use the plug in cable for internet service. Location is good, but would not stay in this hotel again.

I payed for a high Ocean view room and the view was fabulous. I had read some of the reviews before I left and was a bit concerned about the hotel but it turned out very well. Loved the location so handy to everything and they provided beach chairs and towels for taking down to the beach and came down with water and fruit to a certain location on the beach twice a day as well. There was a resort fee of $18 a day but that included free parking, internet both in the room and computers to use in lobby and free long distance calls of 60 min a day. Had the best coffee in the room I have ever had and also had a small fridge which was very handy. The room itself was tired so don't expect it to be fancy. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept very clean but if you want your room to be perfect this is not the place for you. Also this hotel has rooms that overlook a parking garage so if you pay the lowest rate you may get a room with a very poor view. I felt I got good value for the money I paid and would stay there again.

Honeymoon part 2. Part 1 was maui (awesome!!). Arrived at hotel a bit stressed due to heavy big city Honolulu traffic. Got to hotel, difficult to find parking structure. Ok we have 2 suitcases & 2 carryon. Theres No flippin elevator from parking structure??!!! In the huge parking structure there's only one and it's on the very top floor (5 I think), so screw u if there's only parking on level 3. Screw u handicap person u have to either roll down several floors or up to elevator. We didn't know where it was at the time so we took the stairs down. About level2 I lost the larger suitcase which took a spill down the entire flight. Did I mention it's those steps that are spaced far apart and not very angled? Broke my dang Honolulu cookies all up. Finally made it in and was upgraded to a partial ocean view for honeymoon. Very partial. Hard to believe it was an upgrade since the bathroom was filthy and the drain was clogged. Gross. At least the bed was soft. Go somewhere less congested unless u came to Oahu to shop.

Spent my Spring break time with the family at the Sheraton Princess Honolulu. And, this was one of the best place I have ever stayed at. Apart from its great location, this hotel has everything one can ask for. Customer service agents were very welcoming. My kids and Wife enjoyed this place and had the best Spring break fun. Thanks for making our trip an awesome one...

A big Alooooha, all! :-) I just returned back from a fantastic 10-day stay in Waikiki. My first ever stay at the Princess Kaiulani was a very nice experience. The hotel property is older, but a good value and, most importantly, the best location in town. The staff are all friendly and attentive. Rooms are a bit outdated though. I got a basic room with the back view (which I didn't really mind, because in my experience, the street view always comes with a big price - the street noise :-) and I used my room basically only to take a shower and get my 4-hrs overnight sleep). The Pikake restaurant is great (you must try their buffets, both breakfast and dinner - worth your money; my favourite was the dinner, of course, while you can enjoy a nice cocktail with the live entertainment next to the lovely pool). If I could suggest one area for improvement, that would be the internet service. I'm not sure whether that was just my bad luck, the bad timing, or my bad karma :-) , but I almost never had a smooth connection either in my room or in the hotel lobby. I was constantly cut off, had to try re-connecting every 2-3 minutes (that was annoying!) and the last 4 days, it was almost impossible to get through at any time (for that time, I was using the public internet access as places like outside cafés and restaurants).I must mention one person who totally stood out from the rest - that is the Tour & Activity/Concierge, Marsha. Her desk is right at the entrance to the property. Inspite of the ever-long line ups of people crowding at her desk, Marsha is an always friendly and smiling hard-working professional who is at any time ready to listen to you and give you her professional advice and direction. She is very patient, and she physically stands up and walks you around showing you practically what she tells you. I have booked a few activities using Marsha's help. Marsha is very knowledgeable about everything local; she is also a sophisticated world traveler herself (she's been on both sides), and she can related to all tourists' questions and concerns. She listens and helps. Once again, Marsha, a big mahalo to you for your help! :-) . Marsha and the rest of her hard-working colleagues made my stay a very comfortable experience at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. Aloha oe.. until we meet again.I will definitely come back, stay at this hotel again, and recommend it to my family, friends and colleagues.

I have just arrived back to Australia from my stay in Hawaii. The Sheraton Princess certainly was amazing. I work in a resort so when I travel I have high standards, and this hotel exceeded my expectations. We had an ocean and pool view room and it was clean and spacious, being able to sit on your private balcony and listen to the music below made you more relaxed while being in Hawaii. It was very pleasing to receive a lovely fruit basket on arrival. Paying the resort fee was also very helpful, we had to make some international calls and being able to do this it saved us a lot of money. The comfort of the bedding made for a restful sleep each night.I would like to thank Naomi at Concierge she needs to be commanded for her friendly personality and knowledge of the area its lovely to have good service. Tommy and Marsha at the Tour Desk were fantastic they also gave us great advice when we booked our tours with them. When I travel back to Hawaii I definitely know where I will be staying, it certainly contributed in making our Hawaiian holiday memorable.Jordan and Olivia

I recently stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and overall, it was ok. I was only in town for 2 nights, so it was fine. I've stayed in Waikiki many times before at other places but got a great room/car deal with this hotel, so I decided to try it. A couple of things: I had a 'high ocean view' room on the 28th floor (29 being the highest floor) and I'd say those views should be categorized as 'partial ocean views', at best. The room was fine, relatively clean, had a mini-fridge, and it's an older hotel. The $18 daily resort fee was ok because it covered parking, which is at least $25/day anywhere else, beach service (chairs, water, fruit, etc.), bottled water in room, and internet. They said it included wi-fi but I could never find a signal on my iphone OR my laptop, so I had to use the wire. The hotel is centrally located and easy walking to anywhere in Waikiki. My advice, if you want an ocean view, pay extra and stay in an OCEANFRONT hotel. If you don't have a car, the daily resort fee isn't worth it, in my opinion. If you're planning to stay any length of time, you might want to try a privately owned apt - they are all over and very affordable. For short stays, this Sheraton is fine...I only wish they were a little more 'consistent' about their amenity descriptions.

This was just super we can only say that this was a very nice hotel , service with water and fruit on the beach twice a day, we even had a room for an hour to get a shower before our late night flight home , we had a wonderful buffet with crabs and prime beef very goodwill be backUlla and Klaus

I recently stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel for 7 days. My husband and I are frequent Waikiki visitors and have stayed at a variety of hotels from upscale to low-budget types. I was quite pleased with my overall experience. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. I usually make my accommodation decisions based on the bedding. I was not disappointed. Great linens and comfy mattress. The room itself was clean. The air conditioniing could use a little updating. The a/c did not have a thermostat, so you had to choose between constant cool air or chance opening the balcony door. We were on a lower floor facing Kaiulani Ave., which just happens to be the gateway to the ever busy Kuhio Ave and between the late night owls, the delivery trucks, the shuttle busses....you probably couldn't sleep with the balcony door open. My advice, opt for one of the other 2 towers (3 towers in total). In the end, you couldn't beat the location. You are steps away from the Waikiki hotspots - The Beach, International Market Place, The Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre, Restaurants (if you are on a budget-Subway and Burger King are right across the street). If you have ever been to Waikiki, you walk to get where you want to go and usually you end up walking more than you realize. So its nice to be in the centre of it all. I would recommend the hotel to those who are looking for a clean, comfy, budget friendly stay. Yes there are pigeons pool side and quite often joining you at the table, but that's Hawaii. When you begin to get annoyed remind yourself that you are in Hawaii! Should you get a chance, you have to walk to the Round Table behind the hotel. Best pizza ever!

I just returned from a week stay at the Sheraton Princess Waikiki and was pleasantly surprised with the accommodation. I had been reading the reviews on trip advisor and was expecting an old, run down hotel - with a wonderful location. While the location was wonderful -I did not find the hotel to be old or run down at all. We stayed in the Ainahau Tower with a high ocean view and it was a clean, modern, comfortable room. The balcony was to die for and the views were amazing! I felt comfortable walking around the room in my bare feet and also thought that Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning the room daily. The staff at the pool, the front desk, the bell desk, the concierge, and the banquet departments were top notch. I dropped some money off the balcony and I had two staff members helping me look for it for over 30 minutes! It meant a lot that they took the time to do this for me. The beach is a 3 minute walk, the International Market is right next door, and there are a lot of shopping options and restaurants very close by. The price was great and I would definitely stay here again and recommend the Sheraton Princess Waikiki to anyone traveling to Honolulu!

I travel a fair bit to conferences,often held at Sheraton hotels, so I had certain expectations of what a Sheraton room would have in it. I must admit I was a bit disappointed.Now, we did book online at a discounted price but still ... The room was quite small, which was surprising. All night we heard what my partner thought was planes roaring overhead (which turned out to be the service elevators going up and down all night), as well as the ice machine clunking away on the other side of the wall. Also the bathtub was very shallow, which I suppose is irrelevant if you only shower. The bed itself was comfy enough, so that was the upside. But I was counting on working in my room for a few hours each night on a project, and the room just didn't lend itself to it.The staff and service was good, so I had no complaints there, but I would be very careful about my room choice if I were to return.

We stayed here two years ago and what a difference two years make. The property is very tired and desperately needs a reno. The first room we were checked into was awful. I think the fixtures in the bathroom were original. The leg on the sink was coming off. On a good note, the front desk agent, Jennifer was great in putting us in a different wing. But we did have to pay an upcharge, but I was willing to so we didn't have to stay in the original room.The housekeeping was just ok. I don't think there was a lot of attention to detail but it was clean. The servers around the pool were great, very friendly, cheery and were excellent. they took the time to chat with you and were very customer service oriented. However the cleanliness around the pool was not great. We found chairs one morning and it was disgusting the amount of sunflower seed shells that were around the loungers. You would expect things like that to be cleaned up on the night cleaning or morning clean. When I went to arrange a late check out, it seemed I really inconveniencing the front desk. I did pay for the extra charge (which I was happy too) but I was made to feel I was being a bother. Having said that, Keoni did help me with my check out in the end and he was wonderful. You can't beat the location, but it does need a serious upgrade.

Everything in the hotel felt shabby and old- ones step away from being gross. The rooms looked like a bad Motel 6 for the 90's - they were dusty and musty. The open air breakfast area was nearly infested by pigeons, and you could see their poop on the tops of the umbrellas. The 5 floor parking garage had no elevator. I could go on, but everything big and small added up to being very depressing. For the price, I only expected clean and comfortable - like a Hilton Garden or Marriott Courtyard. This hotel is not up to those standards. I stay at a lot of Sheraton's and understand some are older and haven't been renovated recently. But this was the worst I've stayed in. I have to give credit to the staff who were all very pleasant and helpful. But if Starwood has any control over properties, they should take action.

we stayed at the princess kaiulani on our first trip to hawaii,beautiful place , across the road from beach, central to every where, food great, had trouble with internet in our room but rang lobby & they sent staff up to take a look but unable to fix so hotel offer us room upgrade the ever next day, would stay again, pool was great to sit and have a relaxing drink of a night

This hotel was fantastic. Right next to the International Market and any and everything else. The view from our balcony was just amazing. The city view straight ahead, the ocean to our left and the mountains to right. Steel drums playing below every evening was a nice touch also. Loved the location of the bar, adjacent to the pool, with entertainment every night.

Alhooooooha!The Sheraton PK was an amazing stay! We booked our trip through COSTCO. (highly recommend this as well as the Sheraton PK!) This was our first trip to Hawaii and the Sheraton PK added to the great memories we will cherish. We were located on the 6th floor pool view, with a peak of an ocean view. Our room was always clean and well kept. The breakfast was always a plenty. (kids 12 and under eat free w/ paying adult) The Hawaiian bands each night were always very pleasant to listen to. Being in the middle of the shopping district was also perfect for evenings out, although it does get crowded. The staff was always pleasant and helpful, and very professional. The kids loved making their own leis and bracelets, what great activities. The short walk to Waikiki Beach wasn't an issue at all. I would recommend saving your money to stay here instead of a ocean front hotel. Your money can be spent on exploring this beautiful island! it was nice that we could use sand chairs and towels from the hotel to bring to the beach. Save your luggage space and leave your towels at home! (we forgot ours and thought we'd be purchasing some, so it was a nice surprise) We couldn't really come up with any negatives about the Sheraton PK, but if I could change one thing it would be to leave the pool open for night swims (pool closes at 6pm) It would have been fun to let the kids swim while listening to the bands at night. Btw, the pool was also very clean. Each morning we would watch them clean the pool and wipe down all the lounge chairs. If you are a runner...run from the PK to the Diamond Head head entrance it's a great run! (approx 6ish miles out and back)The hills can get you, but the view at the top will have you forgetting the strain to get there. It's breath taking! Can't beat a morning run like this! The hotel has running/walking routes printed at the desk. Their gym is also very well kept if you decide to use it instead. I would highly recommend the Sheraton PK, and would stay there again tomorrow. Shoot, I would take up residency if I could! Enjoy your trip to paradise!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: Sheraton princess Hotel is literally accross street to get to Waikiki beach. THE International Market, restaurants (Burger King, Subway), convenience shops (ABC) are all adjacent to you . Free wifi in whole of hotel premises inc room. Simple pre fab cabinets. Big Balcony with view of beach but semi obstructed (depending on room)- perfect to dry wet clothes . Room rather small but same size as all resorts in Waikiki- still perfect size for us family of 4(2 queen beds). Rather thin walls, otherwise all is clean and comfy. Excellent beds. Used balcony to put out some luggages to create more room. Good clean restroom-old fittings but nevertheless very clean and works well. Bordered on east by the new Modern Hyatt 5 star, south by Westin Moana. Sizable round pool. FREEBIES: Free Parking (other hotels charge $20 per night), Complementary couple of bottles of water everyday, Able to borrow scale to weigh luggages, free use of security vault in room. No complains on service FOR THE PRICE, WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THE PLACE.

The only reason I give this hotel even 1 star is because of the location. It is walking distance to Waikiki beach, international market, and shopping. Other than that, there is really nothing really good about this hotel. I did not know they have 2 different towers - one that is really old with small, dingy rooms. The other tower is "newer" with "nicer" rooms.Checked in on a Thursday evening and went to our room in the "older" tower. Horrified. Room was small, saw termite wings on our bed, and oh my word, the bathroom left me speechless. Sink was a standalone sink with no countertop. They have a thing to put your toothbrush and other small toiletries that looks like something from a jail cell. The toilet leaked everytime we flushed it. And yes, the you had to flush the toilet using your feet (like public bathroom toilets).We complained to the manager the next morning and was moved to a "better" room at the "newer tower" but was told that we had to $40 extra per day for this "upgrade." The new room was definitely bigger and we had a partial ocean view. The bathroom sink had a counter top and appeared to be much cleaner. However, we find coachroaches in our room. As such, we slept with our lights on for the remaining 4 nights in fear that more coachroaches would appear if we turn off our lights. Stay away!!!

Aloha-This was my first trip to Hawaii and I made the most of it by traveling with a group of 30 teens and other chaperons to the island. The check in for the most part was good, with such a large group. Had a room that looked out towards the pool and a little of the beach but it was very comfortable even with a roll-a-way in the room. Night time, we could sit out and listen to the music being played from the pool area which made you feel like you were at the show. Made friends real fast with our Housekeeper, Esther, she was great. She made sure that we had lots of towels and water each day, foam pillows since I am an asthmatic and parties in our room had long hair so extra shampoo and conditioner were there each and every day without asking.There is a refrigerator in the room and I would recommend that you make good use of it to stock up on juices, milk, or even lunch meat from the local Safeway since the local restaurants are expensive. The location was great, short walk across the street to the beach, next door to the International Market Place, which has a food court, shops, and a mail center that stays open late just in case you want to ship any of your goodies home before the trip ends. Each and every staff member that we came in contact with were friendly and made us feel at home. The kids said that the gym was a great place to let off energy and they were abple to work out either late in the evening after our return from outings or early in the morning before leaving on the next adventure.They also have a washer and dryer in the basement for doing clothes, so you can pack lighter than what you might think(I would bring your own wash powder from home, the hotel's is pricey)No meals are included here so we had to eat out each day-$$$$$$ that was spent. Also, they do not offer free wi-fi either-$14.00 per day unless you have some special package, this you might want to check into if you need to use a computer.If I had to do it over again, yes I would go back to the Shearton PK since it was really just a sleeping room for us because of all the wonderful things that the island has to offerMahalo and enjoy your trip if you stay at this location

Check in was not pleasant. The full amount is taken from your credit card upfront without warning. The mandatory 12$ daily charge is a waste of money and should not be compulsory. Complimentary drink is not alcoholic. The room is good in size but very smelly to the point of having to sleep with scented candle and deoderise the room each time we entered. The toilet keeps running throughout the night and needs constant attention. The walls are paper thin and we were knocked on for noise.. For speaking! The front desk staff will not make you feel like the Hawaiian experience you would expect. This is my second stay and I will not go back.

The PK is in a fantastic position it is next to the international markets,major shops are literally just a few hundred metres away in any direction the beach is across the road if you want access to honolulu this hotel is in a great position. I do have to say first impression was pretty good But unfortunately be careful as it appears they over book and you only find out when you get there and after a 12+ hour journey from brisbane via Sydney the last thing you want to here is you are not staying in the hotel you booked . When questioned as to why the response was basically so sorry that's the way it is . The great thing to come out of it we got to experience the Moana Surfrider hotel across the road and directly on the beach. the attitude and check in service at the moana was second to none glad we had the opportunity to stay there for a night before we went on the cruise. After the cruise we returned to the PK for 6 days .For a sheraton it needs a bit of TLC There was a big spiders web in the main foyer the whole 6 days of our stay only a small thing but annoying as other sheratons we have stayed at were imaculate . Don't be put off by this the rooms were well kept and serviced by very friendly and pleasant staff All in all a nice place to stay.

We have stayed at Princess Kaiulani many times and were fortunate to be able to go to Waikiki in January. We paid for high ocean view room and ended up in a room on the 15th floor with a view of the parking lot!!! Was not thrilled with that but it was during the time the Pro Bowl was going on and we were booked for 9 nights and I pretty much have decided that rooms booked for 1-3 nights get the better rooms. In the end, small matter, just being in Waikiki was treat enough and we will will return in 2013 for our 45th anniversary if major renovations haven't started. Hopefully a small portion of the $18. resort fee can be used to buy some fabric softener for the bath towels.......WOW! Like drying off with razor blades. Has no one else noticed this? Oh and we will NOT be going during a major event again.

Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is far one of the best hotels to stay when in Honolulu, Hawaii. It's across the street from the beach, has great views from the high ocean view rooms and the staff is friendly and eager to help you. Two years in a row staying here and plan to stay there next year. Hotel is clean, the rates are fair and the atmosphere is relaxing. The air conditioner keep our room temp perfect. The only down side is the bar (but it was also the same problem with all the bars we visited) they had weak drinks but still charge alot for them. My wife and I recommed this hotel 100%.

Beautiful, most enjoyable hotel to stay. Only one grizzle the air con was far too old and far too noisey. We had the choice of leaving it off and being hot or putting up with feeling as though we were still on the airplane.A big thank you to the maids who handed in two items of clothing we left behind.It was great to pick these up 5 days later after we had been over to Maui.Very impressed with this. Thank you again.

If your looking for a great place to stay that is close to everything that you want within walking distance of Waikiki Beach, then this is the hotel. It is an older style, but clean with friendly staff. It does not have the over priced rates of the other hotels across the road but is in a great location. We had a pool view room on the 5th floor, my wife and I and our 4 year old really only used it to sleep and store all our bargain shopping, if you choose to go, then you would be crazy to want to stay in your room there is so much to do all day and night, every night. Parking is included with the hotel service fee, it worked well for us as we hired a car from Alamo from the airport for the 2 weeks were there, you need to hire a car to see the Island properly.The Cheese Cake Factory is only a 3 minute walk down the road and has great food, remember the serving sizes are larger than in Australia and on average for the 3 of us for either lunch or dinner it would cost around $50 to $60 including tips and DUKES across the road has good buffet type meals cheap.. Go to the Aloha stadium Markets for all your tourist type stuff it's huge, the international markets next to the hotel is o.k but you have to get an idea of prices. ABC stores are everywhere in Waikiki, they sell everything from alcohol to toothpaste and pretty good prices. The Round Table Bar just down from the hotel do great pizza as well. We went to a luau at Paradise Cove, it was a great night, next time we go back we might try the Polynesian Cultural Centre. It is allot more expensive than Paradise Cove and allot further away towards the North Shore.Ala Moana shopping complex is a must for everything and has a great food court. Macy's believe it or not was great for bargains and has pretty much every brand name that you could imagine, there is one just down the road from the PK Hotel. My wife could not get enough of Wall Mart, she loved it for all the little ones toys, so much cheaper than home.When staying at the PK you can pretty much just duck out for a wander or a quick shop and then just go back, it is that close to all that you need. A great place to stay and highly recommend it to anyone. Last tip.... Get onto "YOUTUBE" it has clips of all the places you might want to go, and gives you a feel for the experience. Aloha and have a great trip...........

This hotel was in a good location and had many good points but we were not impressed with paper cups for coffee and tea. I know it's only a small thing but for a Sheraton Hotel we thought it just wasn't good enough. It would be simple enough for a person (not the cleaning ladies as they are hard working and do a good job) to come into the rooms just to change the cups and refill the tea and coffee plus add regular black tea and not just herbal tea for those who want it.

Just returned from our 4th stay at the PK. Another fine trip. We had a high ocean view room that was very clean and comfortable. All the staff we encountered were wonderful. The mai tais are awesome! Location cannot be beat. We enjoyed the poolside entertainment,too. We hope to return, but with the impending renovations the price may not be right for us in the future.

We recently spent a week at the Princess Kaiulani. We chose it based on the history of this place. We found almost all of the staff to be absolutely remarkable. It is amazing to me how they chat with you, remember your name and never miss addressing you with pleasantries while still doing a fantastic job at their respective duties. I tried hard to remember all of their names but I am not even partially good at it. I do remember a wonderful waitress at Splash named Michelle. The gentleman that runs the front entrance and luggage was absolutely professional without seeming cold or distant. He welcomed us like family.The front desk was the only weak spot as they were professional but missed the warmth that we found with absolutely everyone else in this amazing place. It is right beside the International Marketplace, across from King's Village and a crosswalk from Waikiki beach. We will definitely go back as will others we met there.

This hotel is just fine if you need a place that has a great location, easy walking distance to everything and a clean, not luxury, room. The staff is helpful, the pool area fun for kids and food is fine. The pool bar is great - nice bartenders and very helpful if you have questions about what to do - especailly Shanna, who gave us a ton of good places to visit. It was just a stopover for me - staying with a friend - but pretty enjoyable and I would go back.

Don't get me started on this hotel!!! First of all we had a day booked there before our Cruise of the Islands on the Pride of America.....we were told that we did not have rooms......there were 3 rooms booked by our travel agent in September 2011.....we were bumped to another hotel after a 10 hour flight and left to our own devices to get our luggage to the other hotel......when we returned from our cruise we had a further 5 nights booked at this hotel......when we went to check in we were told that one of our couples had requested that they be in a different wing than the rest of us!!!! Written on our voucher was 3 double rooms in close proximity!!! It took ages for them to change it for us......they would not tell us what floor we were on which I thought was very strange.......we had paid for a high ocean view and I was trying to make sure that we were getting what we had paid for - and if I heard 'so sorry about that' one more time!!!!! The rooms were adequate but very noisy at night......I was extremely upset with the treatment we received from the reception staff......the lovely lady cleaning our rooms was a breath of fresh air in an otherwise bad experience......position of the hotel is very good.....close to everything.......wish things could have been different........

The lobby of the Hotel is the best part of the hotel. The place goes down hill from there. The rooms are on the small size and need major upgrading. The walls are so thin you hear your neighbors talking.The staff was great to deal with and they tried to make our stay pleasent. The location is great but the outside noise from the trucks everyday at 5:00 AM was not fun. This should be considered a three star hotel.

My family and I go to Hawaii quite often and always stay here. It's not super luxurious but it is pretty darn close. For families, it's perfect! Right across from Waikiki, great pool area, evening entertainment, good restaurant (although you'd find better outside of hotel). Close to all including the marketplace, which is next door, ice cream, pizza, etc. There's an ABC store in front where you can buy anything and everything - all day/night. Also, close to some pretty good restaurants. Can't wait to get back.......

I used to stay here when they had the one building facing the pool and no tower yet. I have watched it grow up and evolve. This is not a luxury property. That is across the street and called the Moana and is about $250-300 more per night. The PK is a great tourist hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. The beach is across the street....Kalakaua. You want beach front....$300 more a night. Save your money and spend 3 extra minutes to get to the beach. The pricing is fair. The rooms are better than adequate. However, try not to eat or drink here. Pretty spendy for this venue. There are numerous establishments within a block or less from the hotel. IMP aka International Market Place is right next door to the hotel. All of your souvineer type of shopping can be done here and there are several ethnic fast food places there too. The facility is getting a little tired, but the pricing is fair and the location is perfect.

The PK is not a 4-star hotel - - but I rated my stay as 4-stars because of the location and the rate. Some of the desk clerks can be a little difficult to deal with but for the 1st time of all of my stays at this hotel - my male check-in clerk was fantastic. Usually they make you wait until 3pm (check-in time) for a room. But this time he gave me a room immediately (1pm). I was shocked because I have stayed here many times and will stay many more time mainly because of the location. Their beds and bed linens are fantastic - - but it stops there !!! My room was over the outside/inside parking lot - - which meant car noises and car lights at night. The room had a balcony - but on the 5th floor the balconies have a half cement wall instead of the see-through iron railing as on other floors. I was on a non-smoking floor and yet my balcony had cigarette butts which could have been left by the former occupants or from someone throwing them out of their balcony from the floors above. Really don't understand why such a high resort fees - - much more than other hotels that I have visited. Sorry that they took out the dedicated computer in the lobby to issue your airline boarding passes.

We go to Hawaii almost every year, and we always stay at the Sherton Priness. We have never had any problems with this hotel. It is in a perfect location, and we are within walking distance of everything. We have been staying here for about five times, and we love this location, the hotel, and the service. The last year we went was July 2010, and we will probably go again in 2012.

We had 5 nights in the SPK in February 2012 after seeing a 50% off sale in a newspaper article. After reading a number of reviews on Trip Advisor, we didn't expect too much to be honest so we were pleasantly surprised. Maybe the hotel isn’t the newest in the area but at the price it was excellent value. The bed was very comfortable, it was spotless and the location was great. We upgraded to High Ocean View rooms and even then it was only $150 per night. From the balcony of our room we could look up Kalakaua Avenue and our friends had a room right on the corner and had great views of Waikiki beach. At night the sounds of street music wafting up was very enjoyable. I imagine if you got rooms at the back it wouldn't be as enjoyable but we had no complaints. Our friends scored a corner room which gave them a great view of Waikiki.The only downside was that the sliding door on to the balcony did let some street noise in at night.

I would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect. Beach across the street, shopping is right on the way out of the lobby and the bar had THE BEST Mai Tais! There is so much to do in Waikiki you are hardly in the room anyways. If you are looking for luxry-this is not the place, but its comfortable and clean.

The hotel is in a fantastic location however, staff are extremely haughty and rude particularly reception staff. Upon check out we're were treated as complete idiots as the hotel charged us twice for the resort fee, when we disputed the second charge we were treated like dirt by the clerk Celeste, who is certainly not an asset to the hotel. The rooms are tiny, bathroom very small and the lifts slow. The hallways are in dire need of a coat of paint, overall a very shabby effort by Sheraton and would not stay here again.

This is the most disappointing stay I have ever had at a hotel--particularly a Sheraton. We checked in late, had no bell service so we had to lug our bags from the parking garage. We check in go up to our room and discover someone else in it. We go back down and get another room. There we get first hand experience at how thin the walls are. We get another room that is the smallest room I had ever seen, my AAA agent agreed. Our king bed had turned into a double. There was literally only a foot of space to walk at the end of the bed. No space for toiletries in the bathroom. This was not worth the price we paid. Our AAA agent got us another room, much bigger. But I would not recommend this hotel ever. The staff is friendly, but only marginally interested in making things better (we received two drink vouchers and a breakfast voucher for our trouble, a nice gesture). We left our leis in one room refrigerator when we changed and we capped the front desk as they said to do if we forgot them. We left a message at lost and found and they were not given back to us even though we called within an hour of changing rooms. The rooms are worn and badly needing of updating. Our last room had peeling wall paper, torn carpet, badly peeling/dinged furniture, and if you look too closely at anything in the bathroom you'll see fixtures that are miscolored from rust, mildew, or mold.You will note most of the good reviews are from the slightly more expensive rooms that come with a balcony. Those rooms are an okay size. The cheaper rooms are where we started and were upgraded to the better. I would also like to note that our bathtub in our last room was clogged when we got there. They have clear maintenance issues and I would only expect this hotel to get worse than better.

We stayed at the PK two years ago on the recommendation of our Travel Agent. This time we asked to be booked at the PK. We requested a room facing the pool but got a room at the back of the hotel. As they were totally booked they couldn't make the change at check-in. After we spent a night in the room we didn't bother to follow-up on a room change. The furnishing are older but in good repair. The bathroom is dated with a pedistal sink. Had a 32" flat screen TV. The bed was excellant and the linens we're crisp and of a high quality. We had 4 pillows for our King size bed, 2 that were firmer and 2 softer. Housekeeping staff was wonderful, would leave us extra bottled water, extra towels,didn't need to ask each day. They always asked about our day and genuinely cared that we were enjoying our stay. The only negative thing is the resort fee. If you had a car and used the parking it would be a good deal. The water and fruit at the beach was OK but definately not worth the $12.00 per day they charged. The PK is very conveniently located across from the beach and near lots of good restaurants and shopping. Should we return to Wakiki, would probably stay at the PK again.

We stayed at the hotel for two nights - and that was plenty. The hotel looks nice from the outside and is in a convenient location, but the rooms are small and outdated. We were surprised at the bathroom - very small, no fan, some obvious mold, and the worst - ants! We called the front desk about them, they didn't seem surprised at all and sent someone up with ant killer. Killed some ants, but the room stank for the rest of the stay. Additionally, the ants were back the next day. The only really positive thing I can say is that the bedding was fairly comfortable.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is located next to the International Market, not far from the beach, and close to the middle of Waikiki. We stayed here two nights instead of our usual choices.The room was tiny compared to our usual places. We were in a 'city view' room on the forth floor, with a view of the street. Very noisy.The room was comfortable but small. Clean but dated.The staff were very friendly and helpful. We got this room on Priceline, but after adding the mandatory $18 per day resort fee (which does include decent internet and parking) it really wasn't much of a bargain.For our tastes (we prefer quieter and the side of Waikiki closer to the zoo) we're unlikely to stay here again.

We booked the high ocean view room and found it to be ok even after reading the reviews of the hotel on here first, but don't think it was worth the extra $500 NZ we paid.The location of the hotel was very close to the beach and shops, we were on the 25th floor but it was still quite noisy so I can understand other peoples complaints, we still managed to get woken up by noise from the road.The pool area is ok not very big but clean.Our problem was the bar and wait staff, we have never encountered such a slow and unfriendly service anywhere let alone in the good ol US, the home of service and "tips".On one occasion I ordered a draft beer, after waiting for 15 minutes and seeing other people being served who had ordered after me, I cancelled it and it still hadn't been poured ONE BEER.I also sat at the bar for ten minutes waiting to be served while the bar person served everyone who just walked up and the waitress's, I could understand it if the bar area was packed but I was the only one sitting there.We were there for a week and sat round the pool most days and was only asked if we would like anything once in all that time.I don't think we would ever go back there!!!!!!!!!.

We used the Princess K. as a place to sleep. Most of our days were spent out and about on the island (not in Waikiki). We picked an economical place. The room was nothing fancy, third floor with a view of the parking lot. Every morning at 5am we awoke to the sound of the backup alarm on the trucks. The location on Waikiki is perfect for getting around. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff that we had contact with were very helpful with good attitudes. We had a rental car and laptop. Used the room safe. All was included in the daily resort fee. We knew what to expect and were not disappointed.

Pluses:Very central on the Waikiki strip. Close to the beach, shops and 'International Market'.Arranged a discounted rate car hire from adjacent Europa.Beautiful views from higher sea facing floors, for a relatively small premium.Well equipped and maintained gym, incl free weights, cables and cardio equipment, open 24/7.Local calls AND 1 hour of international calls anywhere to landlines and mobiles anywhere in the world are free!Minuses:Only able to connect laptop from room view cable. Only able to connect handheld phone device from lobby for up to 45m per day.'Free drink' was a non alcoholic, no choice or upgrade with payment was allowed.Mature lady at front desk was deficient at listening, requiring most things to be repeated.Local entertainment near the pool could use vocal training and finishing earlier. For that matter almost all Hawaiin singers could use vocal training...Breakfast charged for separately, and choice mean't it wasn't worth itOld style of decor and finishings, but well maintained and clean.

We usually like Sheratons, but this one has alot to be desired! After 3 wonderful weeks in Hawaii and being used to sunsets, sunrises, views, serenity, it was a shock to our system here! The hotel seems to cater to the business people. The location of our room was on a side street. It was terribly noisy all night long. We had no view on our "antique" deck and had to drink morning coffee out of paper cups.....at a Sheraton??! Please! We had the use of a "free" beach chair and towel, but after looking all over the beach, we found out we must pick them up at the pool and drag them to the beach ourselves and if you are in the right spot at the right time, you also get a "free" water and apple. Our last morning we were awoken at 4a by a street fight right under our deck. We were happy to leave and were then hit with another charge....$12/day for all the "free stuff", I guess!

My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess K. during her birthday and our anniversary. Five days of sun, surf, and guided tours was severely tarnished by our poor choice of hotel. While the Princess K. still looks grand when you enter the lobby, the rooms were anything but. The tiniest room we ever saw awaited us. The room looked ancient, from circa 1960. No renovation has yet been done. But the worst part of the room was that it faced a dumpster. Being on the third floor we were awakened everyday at 5am. as the they removed/replaced the dumpster. The 18 dollar surcharge was a ripoff. Just pure profit for the hotel. If you value your vacation, stay away from the Princess!!!

I cannot understand the negative reviews of the hotel. For the price, it is a good choice near beach and Waikiki activities. One cannot expect luxury hotel amenities at low rates. The hotel is older, but clean and updated. Front desk staff are very professional and helpful. We had no issues with the wireless and TV, as complained about on this site.

I was in town on business. Typically, I stay at Hilton properties by thought I'd stray to the Sheraton, having had a positive experience with a Sheraton in Maui. Big mistake....I will never again stay at the Sheraton Princess. The rooms were old and musty....the service was miserable...everything about the hotel felt cheap. Whether on my dime or the company's, I won't return.
Stayed just one night. Simple, clean, good hotel. It's not on the beach, but twice a day pool attendants bring fruit and water to hotel guests who are in a nearby area on the beach.

This was our second visit in the last two years to the Kaiulani and I wasn't dissappointed the second time. We had requested the same room as last year and were pleasantly surprised to find that we got it, thanks Randi! The room was clean thanks to Nely who wrote us a nice little letter, as was the lobby and pool. The weather was not cooperating but the staff kept all the water mopped up. Uncle Nate made leis and bracelets with the kids while the rain and wind blew. When the sun finally came out we really enjoyed sitting around the pool and walking the short walk to the beach. My youngest really enjoyed feeding the beautiful fish in the ponds around the hotel with Art. All in all we all had a great time.

well i have read the reviews of some people and I cannot believe that one review was all about how they had a problem with the tv channels. If that was all there problem was then they should have stayed at home!!! we had an absolutely awesome time!!!! the room service was very good the waitresses were lovely and the bar people (herb and rick and the girls!!) were absolutely wonderful. I had the best time ever!!! I am coming back in 2014 as long as the hotel is still there in its present form. I am really missing u guys

Comfy beds, pillows too soft though. Good modern TV. Great to get front view looking at pool however need doors closed for the noise. $12.00 resort fee gives you access to internet if you take lap top. Free parking for a car (most charge 25.00 a day) Car rental across the road at hyatt regency. Pool towels given with a courtesy card. Favorite with Japanese tourists.close to most things.

I have stayed here previously with my family of five booking 2 rooms 5 years ago. Back then it was showing signs of wear and need an update as it was like being in a timewarp out of the 70's. I gave it a good review as staff and others things werr not too bad.This is our second visit over late December 2011 to early January 2012 again taking my family of 5 as well as bringing our friends along as well. We booked 3 high ocean view rooms.... yeh sure these rooms faced away towards the city, if you walked out onto the balcony and leaned over the railing you could see the ocean. These rooms should be classed as high city view rooms.Checking in to hotel we requested rooms on a certain side which were completely ignored from hotel staff who were very condescending to the point where they were rude.We had just come from the Westin Maui and the desk staff were fantastic, although they had to deal with the so called gold SPG members expecting everything for free.I went back a number a few times of the next 4 days but just gave up, I got friendlier service from parking police.We were there for our 25th wedding anniversary, plus my friends and mine 50th. We got a bottle of wine but she received nothing which was disappointing.The rooms have been updated but are still ordinary when compared to other SPG hotels, the location is good.I doubt very much I would stay here again after dealing with rude staff at this hotel, not just one but numerous.Our stay at the Westin Maui voucher we gave them we were exempt from the resort fee of $25 per room per day, but here at Princess Kaiulani they charged us regardless for this stupid charge and said we had to pay it...... This is just gouging tourists.

Stayed here for 1 week, March 2012, for a conference held at Sheraton Waikiki (Royal Hawaiian). Location is perfect on Kalakaua, right in the middle of everything! Great room overlooking the pool, flat panel tv, good linens, decent bathroom, fridge, safe, balcony for $145/night + $12 resort fee daily. The property is older, so the Sheraton Waikiki has a lot more "wow" factor, but you pay pay pay for that! The princess has the BEST gym with brand new equipment, overlooking the pool. Self-parking is complimentary!!! WiFi is included!!! You get coupons for non-alcoholic Princess Punch from the bar, and 2 bottles of water in your room daily!! It was raining, pouring and thunderstorms our last day and the Bell desk had loaner umbrellas free of charge. We also ennoyed the Creation Luau show, the dancers are amazing and the food was good. You cannot beat the value of the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, the essence of Hawaiian vacation!

I have so many things to say about this place I am not sure where to start. I will start with the warnings everyone else mentions there is an $18 a night resort fee which includes extras like internet but they do not give you any directions how to get wireless internet to work for free, the code is printed on the card telling you about the $18 fee but not directions. I think the reason they do not give the instructions is to get you to buy the $15/day internet plan that is offered by them. The TV is also a scam, we were unlucky enough to have two days of pouring rain, more will be said about that later but, we could not figure out how to get Non pay TV. The PAY screen loads when you turn the TV on but nowhere is there instructions how to get regular cable TV which is offered. I feel its a scam not to tell people how to use the TV. If people want to buy movies and TV shows fine, but also tell them how to watch the local news or weather. Here is how in case anyone else wants to know: push the channel down or up button on the remote to get regular TV. Even when we finally figured it out we were stumped by the fact some channels worked sometimes and other times those same channels were unavailable all you had to do was change the channel then try to go back and what you were just watching had become unavailable.We had a couple of days of bad weather which is fine something we can not control but our balcony was flooded there doesn't seem to be drainage. On top of this the carpet got soaked in our room as in "squishy to walk on soaked" not just damp and it was a large area. By the time we checked out a not pleasant musty smell was very evident.Now on to some general annoyances why does the pool close at 6pm? It's right in the middle of the courtyard, why not keep it open after people come back from the beach maybe some people don't like swimming in the sun. Not sure what the reason they can't have it open into the evening? The towel policy is also a pain.As for issues with our room its proximity to the elevator shaft for the staff elevator made it impossible to sleep-in it's obviously not insulated and they would start using it at 6am waking us up which sucks when you are on vacation. There were a couple of things that the hotel did fix promptly when made aware. Most of the lights didn't work in our room so they sent up an electrician to fix. The safe was also locked when we checked in and there was no directions on how to use it they did send someone to unlock it and he told us how to use it. A couple of small annoyances relating to the bathroom. The room had a sliding door for the bathroom and it was difficult to open and close that seems to be something that could be fixed pretty easily, the balcony door was hard to open and close also for that matter. There is no hook in the bathroom to hang clothes which seems like a no brainer since people will be changing from wet beach clothes to dry stuff in there and hook would be nice.The staff was generally friendly although the check in agent was not. I also had a difficult time getting a drink at the poolside bar was there twice for 10-15 minutes and the waitress ignored me both times. The bellmen were great and the cleaners were always very friendly.I had stayed at this hotel a few years ago and really liked it but this experience changed my mind. I am even questioning my participating in the SPG program why bother if you are paying for hotels of this poor quality.

i would give the hotel a 3 if my room didnt have mold on the walls all my clothes smelled like mold after we left. we got two double beds when asked for a king more than once. the hotel didnt have a wine opener! i had to bring all my wine down to the bartender to open for me. beers and food was pricey. their happy hour was 50 cents off the drinks. thats not happy! most hotels are old in this city but ones needs some tlc. towels were VERY starchy and water pressure was minimal. my shower also screeched at me every time i used it. however staff was very friendly.

We chose this hotel based on it's location, right in the heart of Waikiki. Check in was fast and they upgraded us for free to a pool view room. I believe this is the oldest wing of the hotel but we had no problems with our room. The room was clean and it had a small lanai that over looked the pool. We had requested 1 king bed but non were available, so we had to settle for 2 doubles. The beds and bedding were very comfortable and the best feature of the room. We actually really enjoyed having our own beds to relax in after long days in the sun!! Sure the hotel is old, but it's very well kept and I didn't see any signs for the horror stories that some people in previous reviews have stated. We rented a car for our entire trip, so the resort fee of $12 per day was actually a good deal since it included parking. I do believe the resort fee has been increased to $18 per day, still not bad if you have a car. I believe the majority of the bad reviews for this hotel come from people with unrealistic expectations. People have to remember that this is a 3 star hotel. For the price we paid, we were very satisfied with our stay. I know this hotel is not considered a budget property, but if you shop around a bit you should be able to get a good rate like we did. I would recommend this hotel to first time visitors or people on a bit of a budget. The hotel's location can't be beat and it's a lot nicer than some of the other moderate hotels we have stayed at for around the same price range.

As a repeat visitor to Waikiki, the Sheraton Princess was a new accommodation experience for me. All major hotels were booked upon our arrival a day early, so we stayed at a "familiar" hotel down the block. We requested early check in, and left our bags and headed to enjoy the sun. On our original booking we had requested 2 double beds, and this had been confirmed in the morning. Alas when we returned at 3pm, our room contained a single king. Michelle, our Front Desk agent suggested a rollaway, as a temporary fix, to which I replied "No". Brian, the Front Desk Manager, met with me, and with Michelle's assistance they ended up giving us 2 single rooms for the price of 1 room. We were both most impressed with the professional way this mistake was rectified. My friend was put in a smaller room, adjacent to an elevator shaft, which was quite noisy. Understanding the Hotels capacity, we gain asked when a room became available away from the unending noise, would a room switch be possible, again to our delight, the Front Desk crew made this move seamless, while my friend was out- thank you!The Hotel is very centrally located to the main shopping strip, and very handy to the beach. For both of us, the gym facility is very important, the new equipment, and state of the art cardio equipment was fantastic. I might add, there is a $12 a day resort fee, which includes 2 Bottles of water, coffee, free internet, beach towels, gym, fruit at the beach, and other goodies, that upon review SAVED us a lot of money.The rooms in the old wing were rather dated, but very clean, and our housekeeper, Belinda was a joy! All said and done, I enjoyed my stay, and both of agreed we will return in the future. Well done, Sheraton Princess team!

Upgraded my room upon arrival I was told it would be 250.00 total.A few hours later I saw tax had been added on a separate transaction on my credit card.it was even the card I secured the room with...Also stay away from the food at th Creation polynesion dinner show.Opt for just the show.we had the deluxe package at 116.00 per person food was horrible.

Room 379 is a smelly room with wiew and smell of the huge garbage bins in front.The COZY ROOM WITH CITY WIEW consist of 5 parking floors of the Ohana hotel on the right, 4 floors of parking in front and 10 floors of the rear of the main building on the left side.The advertised price is false and misleading as they charge you an extorsion fee that is called resort fee on top of your daily cost.Enjoy

The hotel is located across the street from the beach in the middle of Waikiki. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Most of staff are long-term employees. The $13 take-out buffet breakfast box was well worth it.Unlike most other Waikiki hotels, the ambiance around the pool was very relaxed and quite. The early evening entertainment was upbeat in a good Hawaiian way.The hotel is centrally located and everything you need is within walking distance.

For location this hotel is well situated. However given its size it is starting to show it's age in the quality of the rooms. Also checkin and check out processes seem to be arduous as they do not seem to have sufficient front desk staff at these busy times. Luggage delivery and handling is brought with problems, most recent stay opting to collect our luggage since it had not been delivered and was still at the hotel entrance. Rooms do have balcony, and the air conditioning switched off when the door is open. Unfortunately my room had it reversed; the air conditioning only worked when the door was open. it is time for a serious renovation, although I understand the very high floors have newer rooms.

Just returned from Honolulu and had a wonderful time staying at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. It is right in the heart of Waikiki and though I was staying on the 24th floor, it can still be slightly noisy. Parking was free, which was a huge and unexpected plus. The service was as good as any place I've ever stayed. A gentleman at the front desk, Keoni, was especially exceptional. He was phenomenal at suggesting locals eats, places to visit (away from the tourists), and was just downright friendly. The rooms could use so updating, but the service, location, and views make this a top-notch establishment!

I recently spent a night at this hotel with my parents. When I checked in I asked if I could pay for an upgrade to a suite so that I could have my own room. There were none available apparently. The receptionist said she had already "upgraded" us to a nicer room. It turns out she put us on a smoking floor which reaked of stale cigarettes - strongly. I havent been in a hotel with smoking floors in years and I feel we should have been asked our preference. We made the best of the situation as we didn't want to deal with the ill managed check-in lines again. The room fixtures were quite dated and the wallpaper was starting to peal from the walls. Also my mother was told she could have two queen beds when she made the reservation and apparently the hotel only has rooms with two doubles. Also she was told that parking was free and as it turned out we had to pay 18$ for the resort fee. The fee also included high speed Internet with an Ethernet cable - we all use iPhones and iPads so we couldn't access it, how about some wi-fi in the rooms?This location is very close to the beach and the pool looked very nice. Due to the terrible room and service I would stay elsewhere next time I return to Waikiki.

We stayed here in late March 2011 for a week after a whistlestop tour of San F., Las Veg, Grand Canyon etc, it was meant to be a relaxing end to our holiday and it certainly turned out that way. We were on the end of the 16th floor and had a view of a portion of Waikiki Beach from our balcony. The hotel is ideal for exploring Waikiki Beach, taking a long walk to Diamond Head or to go shopping. With our stay I was entitled to 30 mins free internet per day down in the lobby area, all I had to do was pay 100 dollars deposit or give Credit Card details. Whilst we were in Hawaii we visited Pearl Harbour, went Whale watching and had a full day at the polynesian Cultural Centre. The staff in the reception area were only too willing to assist in booking these attractions.

Stayed here for 4 nights and Loved It. Our room was on the 9th floor and had what they called a partial Ocean View, but it was an Awesome view. The room was just a bit small, but with all the other positives it as perfect. We received two bottles of water The hotel was a very short walk to the beach and centrally located to all the other nice hotels on the beach. The price was right and we will definately stay here again!

We visited the Sheraton Princess in November 2011 for our Honeymoon. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. The location was excellent close to the beach the international markets and all other amenities. The staff were always willing to assist and the housekeeping staff were so friendly and efficient with servicing the rooms. We actually enjoyed our daily chats with our regular housekeeper. Our room was spacious enough and very clean. The pool and surrounding areas were beautiful. Would not hesitate to stay again!!

I would really like to thank the Hotel for the fruit basket upon arrival; the two bottles of water daily; the towels for the beach/pool and the daily newspapers -- I could not have been happier.My room with the view of the swimming pool - the pook-a-boo view of the ocean from the lanie; nightly Hawaiian music overlooking the pool -- what more could one ask for - an absolute delight!What a great treat! Thank you! I would love to return but understand that there are renovations and closures in the future for this propertyl Why, in the middle of Waikiki, would you close the facility? Everyone I talked to was very upset!. It is an amazing place to stay, right in the middle of Waikiki! Yes, the hotel needs some updating but DON'T close it, DON'T tear down the Princess Wing! There are folks I meet that have been coming year after year for many years, just update this wing and the other tower, The hotel is s-o full of history, it would be a shame to lose it!. . Please let me and others know if and when we can again book and be able to enjoy everything that the "Princess" has to offer.Thank you again!,

I stayed here because some of my family were staying at the more expensive hotel across the road and I wanted something a bit cheaper. My room was fine, it was plenty big enough and the bed was very comfortable. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The woman who cleaned my room was lovely and went out of her way to assist me during my stay. On two occassions I received a gift basket with fresh fruit, chocolates etc...which was a nice surprise. It may have been because they were doing some renovations on my floor but it was a nice touch. The renovations didn't bother me as I was out and about during the day anyway. The location is great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting something close to the action at a reasonable price. The resort fee seems to be everywhere in Honolulu so you just have to accept it...at least I got bottled water and internet usage!

Thanks Sheraton pk had a wonderful time in your hotel everyone was really helpful and we had a great room on the 9th Floor.It was our 28th Wedding Anniversary while we were there and they presented us with a Beautiful basket of fruit and chocolates as well as champage and a card.Thanks to you all we had a wonderfull time,especially when we had a delay due to Air Australia going bust we had to stay another night and the manager gave us a reduced upgraded room which really helped us out.Def would recommend

we are headed back to oahu in two weeks for our 9th time,. we always stayed at the spk but this year they instituted a $18 per day resort fee, what a rip off, so needless to say we are not staying there this year. hotel was ok, nothing to write hime about. i have always said as long as you get a clean room what does it matter where its at, afterall if your going to hawaii your going to see it not the inside of a high priced luxury suite, if you are you shouldnt be going to hawaii.

This hotel is amazing value for money! You can have a room for four people for around $150 just across from the beach. Rooms are average and hotel is dating but the location is absolutely stellar, literally across the road from the beach... we thought it was about a block back so we were really pleased. As others have said the beds are quite small, we didn't find it an issue but we don't mind being cuddled up. Little fridge was great for storing drinks and snacks and the safe was really large and fit laptop plus more. View form our 14th floor partial ocean view was absolutely beautiful. We were right beside the lift but didn't find it an issue as the lift just sounded like a gust of wind. The hotel is quite noisy but anywhere in Waikiki is bound to be so we didn't complain. Gym is nice and large with brand new equipment and is open 24 hours so we had a blast!Location really couldn't be better, close to restaurants, shops, beach, bus stop and everything else you could want. Some staff were nonchalant but never rude - this was compensated by other staff who were really friendly. The cleaning lady in particular was always smiling and friendly so we enjoyed her aloha spirit. A tip - you can definitely do things cheaper and with more flexibility by doing tours without the use of the hotel tour desk. If you need help ask the concierge or better - do it yourself!

Stayed at Princess Kaiulani during Pro Bowl week -- hotel was very busy. Rooms are decent - outdated but clean and comfortable. We were on a lower floor - so not an amazing view. Requested early maid service - was told "no" twice. (always have to be impressed with good customer service !!!) but on day of checkout - the maid banging on the door at 9am. Staff is pretty friendly and nice. Was great to have 2 bottles of water included in our "resort" fee. This hotel is central Waikiki - easy walk anywhere !! Speaking of walking - always pretty interesting to see how many prostitutes are on this block - especially during the Pro Bowl weekend ! I would recommend this hotel for location !!!!!!!!

Our first stay at this hotel. We are family of three.We arrived very late due to flight delays and was dreading any issues upon check in. Been there, done that so I always send one member up to the room first to check before moving in. Check in was quick and we were happy with the room. Double beds are a little small for a couple. Wish they had queens with sofa bed. Had a complimentary fruit basket delivered to our room the first morning which was really nice.We were in a low pool side room. A little noisy at night but that didn't bother us - just a warning if you want peace and quiet. Got a chance to see rooms in older wing - no balcony and small. Really not recommended - if I ended up in this wing, I would have left the hotel. Stay in newer side! Small fridge and a good sized in-room safe.Staff were really nice. Only one day where we had to ask for towels and they were prompt.Pluses - resort fee was well worth it. It incl Internet, parking, international calling...and we used them all. Mind you, they did boost the resort fee prior to our arrival but honoured the fee that was posted at the time I initially booked. Can't beat the location - not beachfront but not beachfront price either. Right in the middle of the strip so eat and shop till you drop. Hotel appetizers are really good. California pizza, cheesecake factory, prince hotel buffet, lulu's are all great for food. Right across the street from King's Village so go see the changing of the guards if you can. They are really good.Husband loved the beds - said it was the most comfortable bed ever. I found them OK. Guess it depends. The gym was well equipped for hotel gym - not a whole lot of free weights but enough to get a good workout. Swimming pool was freezing so not heated. Only went swimming when weather was really nice otherwise too cold. Pool guys and gal were great - delivered fruit and water to the beach. Chairs and towels can be signed out daily. No stores in this particular hotel but lots in the Sheraton beachside hotels. Coco cove was the best place to pick up stuff - beach toys, snacks... Go to Costco if you can to stock up.

My friend and I stayed at the Princess Kaiulani. The staff were very friendly and professional and the lobby and pool area were beautiful. We chatted with staff, explored Waikiki and napped by the pool. When we went up to our room the room itself was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was definitely dated and in need of renovation. The room was "High Ocean View" which meant that when we were out on the balcony and stuck our head over the rail we could see the ocean.Being so close to the international market place, there was some noise and music until late, but it was island music and added to the ambiance.

I stayed here for two nights in January 2011. It was beautifully furnished and centrally located, just a few blocks from the beach. Quiet at night, very clean rooms and everything you'd expect from a Sheraton! Will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and will stay here again!

We stayed here Feb 1-2. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. But was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Our room a high ocean view was very clean & the bed was the most comfortable we had during our stay in Hawaii. Yes we were facing the pool, and they had a band playing at night, but it was Hawaiian music which we enjoyed & did not bother us while we slept. The only complaint that I have is that the concierge services were not available after 6pm (at least on the day we were there). So we ended up having to call an 800# to book a trip to the USS Arizona. Overall this was a great place to stay and I would recommend it.

me and my fiance stayed at the sheraton last year for our 11 year anniversary and enjoyed ever minute of it. The location was perfect and the staff was pleasant and helpful. I'm actually doing research now on another trip for this year! So much to see on the island and would love to see more. Wish me luck

I had a great time in Hawaii and I loved the hotel and would definitely recommend it. Melvin greeted us and was very friendly during our entire stay. Staff were very friendly once we started chatting to them. We had high ocean views which I loved waking up to. Would definitely recommend and am hoping to return here again.

I stayed at the Princess Kaiulani for three nights. The hotel has a great location, right in the middle of Waikiki beach attractions. The room was large, had a great view. The fixtures in the bathroom were a little old, but not unexpected given the price I paid. The water from the sink faucet had a slightly funny smell, so I brushed my teeth using the free bottled water that came with my roomThe problem came when I wanted to sleep. EVERY night, there is loud live music coming from a bar adjacent to the hotel. The music went on until after 1am EVERY night I was there. Then, each morning there were numerous car alarms going off in the parking desk also adjacent to the hotel. I was on the 15th floor, and db Meter app on my iPhone registered the sound levels at about 80db during the live music and 75db during the car alarm symphony. I am usually a deep sleeper, but these were enough to wake me up (and keep me awake).There are several towers, and I got the Hawaiian resident (Kamaaina) rate. So, they probably put me in the worst tower. But keep this in mind if you are a light sleeper.

We stayed at the princess for two nights before heading to Maui. We had exceptional service by the front desk who provided tooth brushes, razors, deodorant and slippers when our luggage decided to spend an extra night in San Francisco. The bell staff helped us with the United Baggage staff and expedited the eventual delivery of our bags.We were pleased to receive an upgrade and enjoyed the room amenities as well as the view.Room was clean, bed was very comfortable and the noise level from the street below was a non-factor. We did not eat at the hotel but found tasty and affordable fare close by.We would stay here again.

My brother and I recently stayed at the Princess Kaiulani. Our trip was made far more enjoyable by the wonderful and professional service we received at the Princess. Every single employee was eager to serve and we were always greeted with a smile and an Aloha. I will definitely refer the Princess to any family, friends or acquaintances that may be traveling to Waikiki. The service combined with the pricing made the Princess the absolute best value for the dollar. I have but a single suggestion, it is minor, but would have slightly improved our stay. Your cable/satellite service is antiquated. We had no channel guide. Other than that a remarkable experience. We will see you again. Thank you, Sincerely, Gary and Glen Haney

when we arrinved we were told that the people in our room did not check out. They eventually (20 minutes) found us a room. it was dirty and the air didn't work. We complained the next day an were moved to a slightly better room. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. This hotel is in desperate need of a remodel.

At least the bed linens were clean and the bed was comfortable. Most everything else was kind of gross. The hallways from the elevator to our room were rank smelling. We did not use the pool or spa. The hotel bar - excellent ahi in the bar by the pool one night. We enjoyed the location so close to Waikiki Beach and the activity. We would NOT recommend this place to friends or family unless they were on a tight budget. We would NOT stay here again.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. Since he is a starwood member we used points to stay at this hotel. Checkin was very quick, very friendly staff. My issue was a very dated room..only a bed ....no chairs to sit in. The room looked like it needed a good cleaning. The mirror over the dresser was covered in dust. Hot water seemed to be an issue any time of the day!! Our hotel was located next to an elevator. ugh! We did ask about an upgrade at checkin no availability. Granted we did not spend a lot of time in the hotel room but I expected a much nicer room. The dinner buffet was overated ....my husband loved the prime rib and crab legs. But since I do not eat either it was a little disappointing.

After discovering many places had discontinued their "free breakfast program," the family and I based our hotel pick based on the deals. A bit more pricey in our book, but we didn't want to stay in another run-down place like my parents did last month. This hotel has a spacious lobby and beautiful garden with a mini-waterfall, plus it's right next to the international market place!We arrived around 10pm in mid-December 2011 and while there was only one other group before us, service was on the slow side. Yes, there was only one person at the desk, but it felt like she didn't know what services were provided at the hotel, and couldn't answer questions about parking. We had better luck with the valet attendant. But at least she served us with a greeting, smile and flowers?! Maybe she was new to the job? Well, I let my husband deal with the paperwork while the rest of us waited, looking at hotel's chocolate display of Waikiki. Quite impressive in detail if you don't look too closely, hehee~We stayed on the top floor (29th I believe) in the back corner with a partial view of the ocean (more like seeing the ocean between two taller buildings... but at least we got to see beautiful rainbows every morning). The room itself was spacious enough for the 4 people in 2 queen beds; we only used the rooms to sleep and shower so not a big deal for us. And there was ample room in the dresser and closet to unpack our clothes in and store our luggage. However the bathroom seems poorly constructed... the door bangs the toilet which makes it hard to go into the tub/shower (without hugging against the toilet or sink), and compared to the rest of the room, very outdated. Nothing "luxurious" about the bathroom with its dirty cream tiles and rusty plumbing, and scratchy towels. Luckily I brought extra flip-flops to shower in... and to just walk around in the bathroom.Because the marketplace is so close, you can often here the late-night craziness; must be louder as you're closer to the lobby/ground.
