It's very close to 1) Duke's Statue and where you can rent boards and learn to surf 2) International Market Place if shopping and browsing is your thing. There's a coffee bar by the other pedestrian entrance and there's also a HopOnHopOff stall there, too. It's smack in the middle of Waikiki and you can pretty much walk easily and explore the shops from any direction at this location. Valet is included in the $12 resort fee which also included welcome drinks, pool service and beach chairs and towels. The street says 1 way, but you can get to the hotel from both directions. It's right on the corner across the Hyatt.ROOMS: We were assigned to a City view room which meant views of other buildings, but you can spy a sliver of the ocean in between the buildings that may block the view. They have other rooms which have Ocean view and I imagine that would be gorgeous. We had 2 double beds, although I requested 1 Queen bed. It was ok, the hubby and I had our own beds for the night which was a laugh really. The bathroom was a lot more spacious than another hotel we tried. The room and bathroom felt dated, but it wasn't too shabby. The linens were fresh Hotel collection type and pillows lovely and soft.There was a flatscreen TV, fridge, iron, hairdryer. Didn't notice any noise and didn't stay in the room much except to change clothes and sleep. It's convenient going to/coming from the beach coz we didn't have to lug around much stuff with us and we could easily return stuff to the room when shopping gets heavy. SERVICE: Everyone was friendly here except maybe the waitress at the Splash bar. She wasn't the cheerful type and could smile more, but other than that everyone was nice. The valet guy was definitely nice. He greeted us and chatted and I wish I noted his name coz he was memorable. We ate at the splash bar while waiting for our ride, but otherwise preferred to eat elsewhere. The food wasn't bad though. We liked the Kalua sliders, the taro bun was different and the bbq sauce pretty good.AMENITIES: There was a pool, I'm not sure if there was a gym, but we didn't use either. OVERALL: I might stay here again if the price is right. Otherwise, I would try other places or stick to my fave no frills secret hotel. :-)

Overall not a bad hotel for the price you pay. The best thing about the hotel is the location in Waikiki and price wise we paid around $150/night and for that price I can't complain too much. However just like other reviewers have mentioned you do feel the old age of the hotel in the furniture and bathroom faucets etc ...

We enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean view and it looked out towards Diamond Head. Definitely worth the little extra money! Room was fine, clean and the way it should be. This was a great deal at $150 or so when considering the location and the prices of other hotels I the area. Don't eat here, resist and explore the options. See my reviews.

The hotel is ideally situated opposite the beach as it has a very small pool and the children's area is small and deep ! It is in the centre of noisy Waikiki and although on the 27th floor the rooms were very noisy as there wasn't any double glazing and the wind was very strong being so high up that you couldn't make full use of the small balcony. Public rooms were lovely and clean and modern but the bedroom and bathroom were a different matter, they were small and dowdy and definitely in need of a refurbishment. Do not expect to have a lie in on holiday at this hotel as we were woken every morning at 8.20am by either the cleaner or housekeeping trying to get into the room and it didn't matter how many times we told them to come back later, every morning it was the same. Takeaway buffet breafast is okay and costs $13.50 although a buffet breakfast at Dukes a few minutes up the road is great value for $14 where you can eat as much as you like. Food Pantry just round the corner is a great supermarket where you can buy nearly everything so it is handy that there is a fridge in the room. International market next door has a Food Mall where you can buy and take it away or eat at their tables and chairs. It is very good quality food and very good value as Honolulu is more expensive than mainland America.
not so cute, pics make it look better. The only thing going for it is the location. Its very dated and run down, in prime need of a remodel.

Me and my wife went to Hawaii for honeymoon and stayed here. The hotel is pretty old. Rooms are not spacious. We took ocean view room, but we realized there other hotel which block the ocean view, so you get only partial ocean view.

Having visited Honolulu six years ago, we decided to try a different hotel to the one we stayed at in 2005 - Princess Kaiulani. However, after much web searching and comparing facilities, location and price we ended up back at the now-named Sheraton Princess Kaiulani We had no regrets. Being beach lovers we enjoyed the close proximity to the famous Waikiki Beach. The staff were as pleasant as in the past. The rooms were clean and very comfortable but we missed having a balcony (we were in the second tower). Highlights - hiring a Mustang convertible and travelling to the Waikele Outlets for shopping and then to the northerm beaches to see the "big' surf (see the Concierge at the hotel, they can get you a good discount on hiring a car) and a sail on a catamaran along the coast. Only downturn was the $12.00 a night resort fee - being international visitors we appreciated the towels and sand chairs and the cold water and fruit delivered to the beach; but had no use for phone calls to the mainland; the wireless internet (who wants to be in internet contact while on holiday) nor did we use the parking as we only hired a car on one day. Perhaps the management could consider a reduced resort fee for international visitors. We did notice the special area for the Starwood members halfway along the queue - then it was a breeze checking in.

The location of this hotel is truly great, but being my first time in Hawaii, I went up to the 8th level of the smaller tower, and my heart just sank when I walked in the room. I think I had greater expectations. It was tiny, double bed, next door to the lifts so it sounded like a plane was taking off every half minute. No balcony, no view.....just a bed. I complained immediately saying that it reminded me of a nursing home room. At first, the staff told me there was 'nothing they could do' but when I told them that I wouldn't go back into the room, the Guest Relations Manager came out. Apparently there was only 1 room available in the entire hotel....(not even the option for me to pay extra for an upgrade). The room was on the 3rd level. Slightly bigger, but couldn't wait to get out of the room. So when booking, be careful that you specify what you want: View, balcony etc, otherwise you may end up in the 4 walls we got. Sort of put a dampener to my Hawaii holiday....We were fortunate enough to be stranded by Qantas, and we were in a hotel 24 levels up ...Ocean views...

Came back for our eight wedding anniversary with our daughter. We enjoyed this hotel the first time and except for some updating, nothing has changed. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating and the room was clean, The things I love most about this hotel is that the location is so central that beach, shopping and restaurants are just steps from the front door. Miss it already.

We agree...previous comments made us think twice, but we were pleasantly surprised. The $12/night resort fee is a great deal, includes self parking, wired internet, use of in room safe, etc.Yes, room does show some age, ie/ bathroom door had so many coats of paint on it that it couldn't shut completely, but at least it was fresher paint! Fridge worked great, TV was flat screen and ocean view from 24th floor was great.If you are a gold or platinum starwood member...do check in at the far left end of check in as you have priority, we didnt see until up to counter. The self parking was great...pulled into front to get luggage help, then went around back and parked. Many hotels charge as much as $35.00 a night just for parking.Last thing...maid service was 5/5 as they did everything we asked for with a moderate tip...extra towels, balcony cleaned and pillow requests.About a 4 minute walk to beach, and within 10 minutes from alot of eating, drinking and shopping options.Would we stay for 10-14 nights, maybe not. But for 2-7 nights, why not? A great value with good service and comfort.

We stayed for a week on the 18th floor with good views the room was starting to get a little tired the furniture needed updating. Cleanliness was fine and the cleaners very helpful who brought me some extra milk for the coffee. Superb location for the beach and shopping. I would stay here again.

After reading some of the negative reviews on this hotel, I was worried what I would be walking into. My worries were cast away as I walked into the Lobby area. Designed and decorated so nicely. The Desk staff were very pleasant and helpful as I checked in and throughout my stay. The room was nice, clean, and very quite! My housekeeper for the week was so pleasant and friendly, really great to see her smile in the mornings! All in all, this is a great hotel and I highly advise considering to stay here for your vacation. For the price and location, you cannot go wrong!

We just stayed 10 nights. Busy but not hectic hotel close to all restaurants/amentities. Staff friendly and efficient - no request was a drama. Resort fee of $12 was worth every cent. Rooms comfortable and clean. Daily service - no noisy air conditioning. Even though this hotel is in right in the heart of Waikik - the noise does not carry to your room.
This place is super nice, has comfy beds, and Bliss bath products! :) The food we had there was good; nothing "special"-wraps & fruit. The beach is close. Lots to do in this touristy area.

Nice, large hotel, with all amenities. Good buffet breakfast, small pool, good for hanging out. Close walk to beach, they have towel service at the beach as well. When I was there, end of October, was $120 a night, great price. Right in the middle of all the shopping and craziness of Waikiki, lots of places to eat close by. Lobby is open air, and really nice. Hallways and rooms are a little dated, and small. Bed is very comfortable. Great location.

Was pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Princess. Maybe i was put off by so many negative reviews. As Starwood members we recieved an upgrade to the Deluxe Ocean View Rooms and we were impressed. Yes, the Hotel needs a few touch-ups but i found it clean and pleasant. It offers great value for money and its location is superb. It has a large pool and the $12 resort fee adds even more value to your stay.I also stayed here in '96 and would visit again.Mahalo Princess

I just had the best experience at the PK Sheraton..!!..I stayed there for 9 nights and I have not a bad thing to say..!!...Front desk at check in and check out was very good and fast...Location is the best...the room was clean and comfortable..the gym was awesome..the $12 resort fee is totally worth it with the wi fi and fruit and water service on the beach twice daily...and great towels and beach chairs for use too...!!!...I have no idea what these other people have to complain about...My stay was the best...Big thank you to the PK Sheraton...PS..I wish i got the guy's name at the front desk who was very friendly and helped me out with the A/C in our room...but everyone that worked there that we encountered at this hotel was awesome!!!

We enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani (10/14/11-10/24/11)....The Pros - very close to downtown shops, Beach and the International Marketplace. Enjoyed the local talent that was featured at the Pikake Terrace which is poolside. Also, they bring in local folks to sell their wares in the lobby. No one was pushy, rather enjoyed looking and not being pressured to buy. The room was very clean, the carpet was vacuumed daily, the towels plenty and plush and the room was very quiet when the windows were closed. Really no con(s), just personal observations, which were that the most of the staff did not go out of their way to speak to us and seemed to cater to the many Japanese tourists that stayed at the hotel. The front desk staff was not overly friendly and it seemed to me that when approached with questions, we were bothering them. There is many things to do and see at this hotel. I would stay again at this hotel.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is located in the heart of Waikiki and perfect for visitors who don't plan on renting a car for your entire stay. Be sure to check out "Creation", the show is amazing!!! They teach you about Polynesian history, it goes way beyond just Hawaiian history. The food is average but the show is very compelling. Be sure to request a room in the new tower, we stayed on the 6th floor of the old tower and were woken up at 6am every morning, even on Saturday, to work trucks :(

I was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews, but maybe they are high strung or I am easy going Canadian.. Anyways, we told Kim the manager that it was our special anniversary, and we were upgraded to a pool/partial ocean view room (thank you again Kim). We opened the door and were instantly wowed.. Nice king bed, clean linens, (yes the carpets were a little dated, but they weren't gross, and its not like my wife was to be giving birth off them or anything. The front staff were always friendly. After a nice walk, returned to our room to find a bottle of champagne (thanks again). The hotel is perfectly located, close to all the action. The pool is very clean. I liked that you can ask for beach chairs at the towel stand (if you are a bigger guy/girl, ask for a bigger chair, as I crushed the first one). You can always switch your dirty/wet beach towel for a fresh one anytime. We really loved the free pineapple every monday/wed/saturday. Rooms on the East wing dont have any views but rooms were nice (bro in law stayed in 486). Everyone has an opinion I guess, but our experience was top drawer and we would not hesitate to stay again..

I was shocked at how out of date this hotel was! The rooms and public spaces were in rough shape with visible signs of age everywhere. The restaurants in the hotel were insanely expensive ($25 for breakfast?!) and there was no option for coffee or a morning snack. We were in a high ocean view room that overlooks the pool and evening lounge. The noise at all hours of the day and night was incredible. The lounge hosts a band and singer until 10pm every night that is ridiculously loud (we were on the 24th floor and could hear every word) so I would not recommend this hotel if you have young children who need to go to bed earlier than 10.

We were on a family vacation and chose this hotel because of its location, what a mistake. Rooms are outdated, filthy and roach infested!!!! Poor customer service from front desk personnel. Not friendly at all, especially a gentleman named Keoni. My son who stayed in adjoining room had a leaky ceiling from the A/C. THEY FIXED THE PROBLEM BY PUTTING A GARBAGE CAN UNDERNEATH THE LEAK. Did nothing to move them to another room!!! What a joke, Sheraton your reputation is being ruined by this hotel, sell it soon before your reputation becomes tarnished!!!!

I stayed here because our flight was cancelled. The airlines paid for the hotel and if I paid I would have been furious. The hotel is in serious need of renovation!!! I've stayed at numerous Starwood hotels in the past and this is the first time I've been disappointed. The bathrooms look like a throwback to the 70's compled with titles bubbling up on the floor. There are not enough power outlets so even the TV and other electronics are plugged in to a power bar. Not a power strip but, power bar.The positive is that the staff is really great and tried to make the best of the situation but, seriously why does the Starwood put their employees in a situation where the need to defend the condition of the property?

We stayed 6 nights at the Princess Kaiulani and loved it ,it is close to everything , 3 ABC stores were you can buy everything including wine and beer etc , 2 minutes to beach ,just great . .We did not eat at the hotel there were so many choices on the door stop ..As Australians the 60minutes a day free international calls was amazing ,We will certainly stay there again real value for money

We just came back from week stay in Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. BEST location in waikiki. Right next to International Market Place, not even block away from Waikiki Beach!! With $12.95 per day, you get parking (in / out privilege), bottle water, internet connection to room and others and I think it is really cheap compare to other hotels in area. But I give 4 star for the few of the fact... First, the room needs serious, serious update. All the furniture is dated, except TV. Bath tub did not flow water well... Concierge did not know much of things in area. We ask some ice cream / frozen yogurt / soft serve place and she said there is only Häagen-Dazs in the area and did not want to look deeper.... when there is quite number of ice cream / frozen yogurt / soft serve within few blocks... oh, well.... but except her, all the staffs are very nice and helpful.

We loved this hotel we had an ocean view room, the view was beautiful. The hotel is in a fantastic position it is close to everything the beach is just across the road. We would definately stay there again.

we liked this hotel so much we ended up extending our stay. we had an ocean view top floor corner room. pros: very quiet, beautiful scenery, although the building is a bit old the hotel was clean. also room was clean and furniture is classic. close to everything, across the street from the waikiki beach. entertainment at night every night by the pool. except for the incident with the security guy on the phone, and the girl at the front desk on that same day, every other person was incredibly nice and helpful to us. great customer service.cons: the carpet needs updating, which from what we heard they are working on that. the bathroom floor needs a good scrub with clorox. no room service for lunch, only breakfast and dinner. on our first morning we woke up with a loud banging my husband called to front desk, and sat in the balcony the banging continuing, i'm half way asleep the phone rings and a man says with a tone of attack, my guy just came upstairs and knocked but you didnt open the door and he said there is no bangining noise! meanwhile i can still here as i'm talking to him i said oh i'm sorry i mustlve not heard it because the sound is so loud i couldnt distinguish the difference between the two. he cut me off and said well he said there is no banging noise! very annoyed and irritated, i said there is i can still here it, he said again my guy said there isnt. i finally said i'm sorry this conversation is not going anywhere i need to speak to someone else. he said fine and hung up on me. few min. later a woman calls (the manager), not sure what had happened between the two of them because she didnt sound very friendly and maybe i didnt sound friendly either since i was still half awake and a bit cranky from the other conversation. but she did acknowlege that they were doing some updating in other room and if we liked we could change rooms. when we went down stairs to get the other room keys to check out the rooms, the girl at the front desk once found out what was going on was very unfriendly and border line rude, my husband was showing appreciation and she kept acting snobish. because of all this, had we no prepaid for our room we would have left the hotel. but i'm glad we didnt because eventhough the choices were not as nice as our current room, the second person that we talked to at the front desk was incredibly helpful, she was what customer service is, kind and compassionate. and in( the end she asked the manager to come out to finalize things (the same woman that had called me) and we decided to stick to. that was the only day we heard noises and the rest of our stay was very easy and smooth.thank you for helping us have a good stay.we will stay here again.

Sheraton Princess has a great location just across the street from the beach and tons of shops just outside the hotel. Service was good as well. The dining room attendant even remembered our name and room number from day to day.....but the hotel is very tired and outdated. Not Sheraton quality and severely needs a facelift. Rooms were very clean and the beds were nice, but everything else is old and it shows. For the price I paid, it was a decent value and I wasnt there to spend time in my room. Id stay again but if your looking to be impressed this isnt the place.

My girlfriend and I left our husbands and kids at home for 6 nights. We visited Hawaii to enjoy the shopping, sightseeing and relaxation. The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani has aged since my last visit, which was 19 years ago.... so it was to be expected. As our flight arrived early, 5 hours before check-in, of course our room was not ready. We inquired as to an upgrade, we were offered an ocean view room for an extra $10.00 per night - which was available immediatley - well worth the money when you are tired. The room was comfortable and we had a great view overlooking the Sheraton Waikiki and the ocean. Our room overlooked the International Market. Sitting on the balcony at night was entertainment enough. The compulsory resort fee included 60 minutes of international calls per day, WOW, car parking and bottled water, and other things. The pool was relaxing and we had no trouble getting 2 pool chairs. The location is outstanding, Subway/Burger King/KFC directly over the road, drug store/supermarket/Ihop in the street at the rear of the hotel, Cheesecake Factory on the main street at the front of the hotel. Macys next to the International Market and all great shopping at your doorstep.On our first day we were advised the shuttle to Waikele Outlets was fully booked. Taxis were approximately $75 each way, so we hired a car. I had never driven outside of Australia before, so this was an adventure. If you do hire a car, make sure you purchase the proper fold-out map, because the small photocopy version the hotel gives you or written directions may not help if there is roadworks and you are directed away from your journey. We also drove to Pearl Harbour, this also saved us time and money, because it is free entry.We were advised that this hotel will be closing in the next 18 months, and 2 of the towers demolished for renovation work. I will enjoy returning to the new hotel when it re-opens.

We're returned guests because of great convenience location, across street from the famous beach, close to city attractions. Room is outdated but had everything we needed. Beds are very comfortable.  The biggest concern with this place is the service at the time. We’d like to see the front desk staffs greeted the guests courteously and professionally when check in or check out. Our relatives who are living in Waikiki left us a bag of gifts at Bell desk with my name and phone number on it. I called to claim at the same day, staffs repeatedly said nothing was found, I checked again next day early morning. Finally the manager located the gifts after more than 2 hours searching. We planned to have a short walk on the beach in the morning but had to rush to the airport. so there was no time to rectify the situation. Please need to train your front staffs to be the best in the lodging industry with honesty, professional, and hospitality while delivering the highest value to the guests. Other than that, we’re happy to stay.

Not right on the beach, but across the street. Staff was very accomodating. The manager gave us free Kuhio leis when we asked where we could buy some.Nightly free entertainment was top qualityfrom hotel lobby. High Tower rooms give excellent view down Kalakua Avenue toward diamond Head and of the surfers off Kuhio Beach. The lobby is gorgeous and we were well pleased with our accomodations. Each meal in the hotel restaurants were very good and good quantity. Breakfast Buffet is was over the top with nothing left out. Easy to get out of downtown if you want to tour the island. Summer time noise off Waikiki was a little loud, but to be expected given the location.

We decided to go on our honeymoon in October seeing as it would be a lower season - we stayed at thhe Princess Kaiulani during our stay in Waikiki and it was a great hotel.Location was awesome, the staff was friendly and helpful and the manager even gave us complimentary champagne in our room. The view was awesome - we had a view of the beach, the city and the international marketplace. We really enjoyed the Big Kahuna beach services (you get served fresh fruit and cold bottled water at a certain section of Waikiki beach if you're staying at the sheraton) and the pool was great too.The buffet looked delicious but we didnt want to spend $35 bucks for a buffet that I knew I couldn't eat (not a huge eater) and the breakfast buffet was almost the same price (rip off!) but overall the hotel was perfect and I would stay there again.

There are several Starwood (ie: Westin, Sheraton) properties in Waikiki. This one is NOT beachside, but is only a short block away. Great location in Central Waikiki. The hotel is dated ( I argue it gives it a bit of character), but still wear and tear is visible. Highlights:-Pool. Well maintained, with towel service. Some of the beach chairs are lightly damaged, such as missing a few straps that hold it together and allow you to lay down. Twice daily beach service where they will walk over fruit and water to a designated beach location.-Daily cultural shows in the lobby area -Parking and internet included in the modest resort fee. (BIG bonus!)-Friendly staff throughout the hotel; no problems storing luggage after checkout for a late evening flight back to the mainland. -Breakfast and Dinner buffet - decent variety of hot and cold foods - with indoor and outdoor dining. Reasonable prices.-Rooms were comfortable, but the shower facilities are rather dated. Felt more like a 2-star hotel. Carpets had wear on them, but nothing intolerable.-Bathroom ammenities are very basic (soap, shampoo, not toothbrush, mouthwash, etc.)Overall, the hotel was a solid 3-star based on service, comfort and quality. Generally this hotel is cheper than the other hotels in the Starwood collection, and the level of comfort is reflected in that lower price. That said, it is absolutely comfortable and I would not hesitate staying here again.

We booked a mini-vacation through priceline. It was the first time at a Sheraton hotel.The rooms were very small and no view. But the quality of the room was excellent. Had everything we needed in and and besides we were only there to sleep. The hotel is beautiful and the service was excellent. Every night there was no need to go out for entertainment. They had just great entertainment there. Right across from the Moana hotel, you can get your beach gear and walk across to swim at Waikiki. Loved it!

The hallway leading to our room looked a little disheveled, in need of some repairs, but it was clean. The room itself was clean, comfortable, and served our purpose! I was very happy with our stay here, and would definitely stay again. Staff was friendly and helpful.
We like the location of the hotel, that it is relatively in the center of anything, close to everything, is not stuffy or too expensive! Good size rooms in the Tower, 19th floor.

As some of the reviews mentioned the hotel rooms are a bit outdated. However, this is reflected in the price, and I still find it a great value for travelers like us that wanted to save on accommodation. Other than that, everything was perfect. Our room on the 29th floor was clean and had a sizable balcony with awesome views to the mountains the volcano and the ocean. I particularly liked the open air lobby and restaurant, it had a nice atmosphere. It is not on the beach but right across the road from the beach on one of the main shopping streets. Beautiful Waikiki beach is a couple of minutes walk and there are also a lot of entertainment venues around. The staff was very nice (but all locals seemed very nice on Oahu) and they were very helpful with trip arrangements. Overall we very much enjoyed our 10 days in this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat.

I took my oldest son to Hawaii for his sixteenth birthday in 2002, my youngest son and I stayed their before and after a cruise in 2007 and I am bringing my husband their the end of October 2011 to celebrate our marriage. I have enjoyed each and every stay at PK and look forward to doing it again. The staff have always been very accomadating and pleasant and the food is very good and we slept very comfortable every night. I have no complaints, on our first stay we requested a room change and it was done with no hassles or questions, on our second stay we had a wonderful Jr. Suite that gave oceanviews and my son enjoyed sitting on the lanai and watching the sun set. Waikiki beach is across the street, shopping next door and many restaurant to please any palate. We also enjoyed street performers and a parade all from our room. The PK is affordable, accessible to food, shopping, the beach and many attractions, what more do you want? Love the PK so much that I am going back for a fourth time!!! Tracey Penn, MA

After staying elsewhere along Waikiki Beach last year on my annual trip to Honolulu, I am happy to be staying at the Princess Kaiulani once again. This is an older hotel, and there are rooms that are showing some wear, but I like this location and proximity to the beach. Something new has been added since my last time here. I had to pay for parking everyday and also pay for internet service by the day. Now, there is a daily resort charge of $12 plus tax, which gives you self parking, internet access in the room, two bottles of water, and a couple of other things that I don't really need or use. Two ABC stores are very handy, for breakfast items and sandwiches to go. I always stock up so I have my milk and cereal and yogurt in the morning. The mini-fridge has plenty of room for small items.

Very bad parking, hard to locate entrance. Charge is $25.00 per day, unless you pay $12.00 for a parking pass at check-in. NO HELP WITH LUGGAGE at check in or out. . Only view from the room was of the parking deck and the service entrance.

I was lucky enough to stay here for 5 days recently.it is an older hotel but very comfortable,unfortunately the air-conditioning worked well during day but was too warm at night even when left on the high setting.The hotel has evening entertainment each night.The food in the poolside restaurant was reasonably priced and tasty. The pool is nice with plenty of shady areas and free water pool side.there is very easy access to the beach,the international Market and waling distance to lots of shops and restaurants.I was quite disappointed that even though I stayed for 5 days they could not provide storage for some of my luggage as I was going on inter island flights.would enjoy staying here agin hopefully the air-conditioning on another room would be more effective.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel from September 4th to September 9th and were completely happy with our stay. The check in was fast and efficient. We had originally booked a mountain view room, and at the time of booking, requested a honeymoon upgrade. We were upgraded to a pool view room on the fifth floor. The room also happened to be a corner unit so we had views of the mountain, pool and we had a partial view of the ocean between the two buildings in front of us. The room itself was a good size, and was clean. The beds were also very comfortable. The cleaning lady did a great job of cleaning the room every day.The location was excellent, right across the street from the beach and close to all the restaurants, shops and all the action.The service was great, every person we encountered was friendly and very helpful. The lady at the concierge desk helped us book a rental car from Budget, and helped us with the bus routes.There was a $12/day resort fee, which included: parking, wi-fi internet access, 60 minutes of international long distance calls each day, unlimited local calls, two bottles of water per day, 2 complimentary non-alcoholic drinks per day.One of the other perks of this hotel is that they give you beach-side service at Waikiki Beach. Including the beach towels, they also give you a choice of getting a beach chair at no additional cost. If you stay within the designated area on the beach, they will give out two bottles of water to you within certain hours of the day.I can't comment on the pool, bar, fitness room, or restaurant as we didn't use it.This hotel is not the newest hotel and not the fanciest but we did our research and knew what to expect and this hotel met all our expectations. If you want luxury, don't stay at this hotel. This was an amazing value for the price we paid, and we would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.

My wife and I have stayed here 4 out of the 5 times we have visited Waikiki. I must say, I am a bit perplexed by some of the negative reviews we have read. This is a great hotel...it is by no means a Ritz Carlton and their rates reflect that! The location is one block away from the beach, right in the center of the action. The beds and pillows are amazing, it was the best week of sleep we had since the last time we stayed here. The rooms are clean, but actual coffee mugs and robes would be nice. The splash bar by the pool provides the best service we get on Waikiki. Every server there is great and very friendly, especially Angie, she has remembered us every year we have returned. I must also give kudos to Jun, who also did a good job taking care of us and did a very good job keeping his cool with a "difficult" customer in the bar area. All in all, it's a great place to stay, everyone is friendly from the front desk to the servers in the bar to the housekeepers. We hear that the place is due for a renovation...we really hope they keep the same staff in place and keep it a nice place to visit.

Stayed here in February as part of a tour. I thought it was in a great location, just a walk across the road to Waikiki beach. It was in a great central location, the room was clean and comfortable and the A/C was quiet. Poolside bar and entertainment good.

Aloha! It's been awhile since I stayed at this property - last visit Feb/09. The reason I'm writing this now is because I am already plotting my return to the islands. When I recently started planning the next trip with my travel buddy we both agreed we wanted to stay at PK. Last time I went by myself an had such a great trip. I really enjoyed my time at the PK. I've stayed elsewhere in Waikiki but so far PK has always been my favourite. The location is excellent and the staff were wonderful. My rooms were older/modestly decorated but always clean, the beds comfortable, my floor was quiet and my views have ranged from decent to incredible. Hope to stay at PK again soon. Mahalo!

We stayed at the PK for our honeymoon in September 2010. We got a good deal so price was ok for us, but I don't think it was worth the listed fares. Location is excellent, close to everything, pool is nice, hotel is dated (although it was undergoing renovations, so that might have changed). Everything was clean, room was fine, although we could hear noise from the adjoining room which was not great when you're trying to sleep after a 12 hr flight and the neighboor is blasting the tv! We did not eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. For the right price, we would stay there again, location made it worth it.
We are just back from a stay in this hotel. Room was excellent, very clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Great atmosphere and location. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed here on our honeymoon after 4 stunning days in Maui. General location of the hotel was great. However, hotel was so dated, is crying out for its rennovation. Food at the hotel was terrible. Don't waste your money on the breakfast, no value for money and food quality very average. Bar happy hour was good, although service lacked around the pool at times.

My wife and I stayed at The Sheraton July 2011 before we went to Maui the next day. The location is 1 block from the beach, and right in the middle of everything. They have all the basics, the hotel was clean, staff was friendly, location was great. This is NOT a five star hotel as reflected in the price, but it's a great value. The breakfast buffet was expensive but it was good.If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is NOT your hotel, but if you want to be in the middle of everything and don't have a car, this is your hotel.

We arrived after staying at another hotel on the same street. That property ranks 58 while this one is 55. However, I am quite confused why this property is ranked so low on the list. It is a standard Sheraton hotel with standard amenities and service. The resort fee is only $12 which is quite reasonable and it covers one car parking. We did not have an ocean view room, but for the price we paid, the pool view (on the lower building) is good enough. Waikiki hotels are full of foreign tourists, and the service staff might act quite differently than a continental hotel. Well, that's Waikiki, but definitely not Hawaii.

IF you are doing what I did preparing for a trip to Waikiki and fumbling through the hundreds of reviews about all the hotels you can stop. This has a prime location and offers all the feel of a Haiwain stay. I looked at rates and location and read reviews about almost every hotel in Waikiki and crossed my fingers when I booked this one. When we arrived we were not disappointed.Big open air lobby, Live Hawain music, firendly staff and you could feel the buzz in the air. All I can say is our trip was awesome because of the centeral location the and the ease of going to shopping or the beach it all just made the trip unforgetable. At night we sat on our balcony and watched a live hawain band at the pool stage with hula dancers. In the morning we had an open air pool side breakfast and then litteraly step into shopping or a less than 2 minute walk to the beach - really it was that convienent. The staff was very helpful and we were able to book events and be picked up for tours right there. This hotle also has a show stage that is currently doing a really neat cultural presentation called "Creation" - my daughter loved it. All i can say is if you cant decide on a hotel and arent sure if this one is for you - stop - I would stay here again and again - it was perfect for us and I am sure it would be for you.

This property is old, outdated, and is in need of updating and renovation. Our room had old furniture, old/stained carpet, the bed seemed to be the only good thing. Location is very good however and our balcony view was awesome. Quite dissapointing for a Sheraton.

Good location and cheap rooms available. That's about all this tired property has going for it. I did receive a room upgrade as SPG Platinum but still had to pay a lousy resort fee for things are ordinarily free or unnecessary (e.g., telephone calls...please, most everyone has a cell phone). Outdated decor in rooms and common areas. Not dirty or anything...just blah. Parents traveling with small children or young adults with limited $$ would probably like this place.

I went with my two teenage sons to a surf trip and wanted a hotel that gave me assistance in the event of an accident. It is a big hotel but a bit old-fashioned swimming pool, rooms and even TV are quite old. Breakfast honest and excellent staff. Check in / out fast and the "baggage hold" works well to enjoy the last day.

The GOOD ...... the hotels location and the conceierge's helpful recomendations for dinner, and our BIG spaceious high room requested to avoid street noise.The BAD........This hotel charges for car parking and this is a charge I object to most of all. ALL Hotel parking should be complimentary they want you to stay there..., dont they?? I would rather pay for a better hotel that give this as an inclusive service. DICK TURPIN (English Highwayman) had the decency to wear a mask when he robbed you!!!Also cheap melamine MFI type furniture, old and tired looking but hey!!, who spends all their time in a hotel room when in Oahu Hawaii?? PRINCESS Kaiulani.........well she is there in essence hanging on the wall in a picture!.... so I took my own princess and she thoroughly enjoyed herself and this hotel provided everything we needed ......its not the Ritz but it did the job.Overall it was a neutral stay, nothing to Rant about and nothing to Write home about.

Right across from beach you will find the best of Waikiki is at your door step. Will definitely be back! The room was a good size and service staff amazingly friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed the food and live entertainment also. Every request was catered for. Love the extras you get as part of $12 daily add ons too.

After reading the other TA reviews, we were a little apprehensive when we arrived at the hotel. Overall, we think the hotel is clean, with very friendly staff, and the room well appointed. We agree it is not a recently modeled hotel, but it is very functional. We stayed on the 22nd floor and were fortunate enough to have a front corner room, with a great view of the ocean.Check the room size before you book (I found the lowest rate is for the room with 230 sq ft, whereas for another $20 (your mileage may vary), we have the use of a 280 sq.ft. room. Not huge, but comfortable enough. The bed was very comfortable, and the amenities were what I would expect from a Starwood property. It's location is perfect, and we were able to walk to many attractions close by, including the Waikiki Aquarium and Zoo.The food (we had lunch & dinner buffet) were good, portions large. The staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful. Examples: Once our friend requested papaya during dinner buffet (not amongst the fruit served), and our waiter went to the kitchen and brought back a whole papaya. Another was me inquiring how to get out of the garage to catch a very early flight when the security gates were locked. The security guard patiently walked me through the steps, as well as the options that are available.The only issue we had with the Princess Kaiulani was the LONG check-in process. We arrived at 1:30pm and saw 6 front desk personnel, with 8 parties ahead of us. You would think it would be a breeze. Unfortunately, 3 of them were dedicated to Starwood Elite guests, and they were helping 2 parties. When they were done, they did paperwork. Of the remaining 3, one was dedicated to arriving guests from Japanese tour groups; who escorted them from the back of the line to her monitor, and afterwards went to the office in the back. The other 2 front desk personnel were available to help the rest of us. One appears to be in training, so there was actually only one available service agent. It took us an hour to get checked in. I don't know where the front desk manager was. Many hotel personnel passed by, and no one redirected the idling staff to help. I just think it is an extremely inefficient & ineffective operation. I do have to say the agent who helped us was very helpful despite her workload.All in all, we would stay there again. We just hope they have greatly improved their check-in process by then.

We stayed in this hotel 6 yeras ago and loved it. Now it is very tired and aging quickly. We stayed on the 24th floor with an ocean view. The view was very nice. However, we could see many balconies above and below that were falling to pieces. Also had an attitude problem with the girl that checked us in. Unbelievable really as were spent over $1,000 on 4 days accomodation. The room service people were excellent and friendly. As were the tourist desk people. The front desk personnel, and the Pikake Terrace staff left a bit to be desired. We won't be rushing back to this "tired old lady".

When we pulled up to the hotel we were very worried. The hotel is very dated and looks tired. We entered the elevator and my wife was ready to leave. Then we got to the room and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was a good size, clean with a good size balcony. It was an upgrade partial ocean view. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The value for what you get in Waikiki is very good. You are next to a lot of restaurants and shopping from luxury to markets. You are half a block from a great beach and there are people out until all hours of the night. It's very safe if you stay on the street between you and the Moana surf rider. Good luck!

We found our whole experience at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani a memorable one. From our booking reservation to our departure the Hotel and its excellent staff were exceptional in all areas. We stayed for 15 nights in a room on the 10Th floor of the Princess wing and had a great time.We certainly would recommend anyone who is looking for value service and location to stay at this Hotel we will certainly be returning. Our stay was from Aug 2 to Aug 16 2011

We originally reserved the standard room but I got nervous so we asked about upgrading when we checked in. Boy, is their plan easy to understand. It is $10 per level above the basic room. We went for the City View for an additional $20 per night and was it worth it! Yummy towels and bedding and a view of Diamond Head from our lanai. As a bonus, we could look through the buildings and got an Ocean View from our bed! We didn't see Waikaki Beach but it was amazing seeing the surf coming in from our bed. We had an initial problem with the door lock but our (future) maid was amazing...calling security and offering us a seat...Security and Maintenance were quick and helpful. Can't say enough about the graciousness of all staff that we encountered. We didn't (couldn't ) see the beach area -- seemed a bit confusing - but location was great. The only off note was when we splurged for the buffet, the restaurant was huge with only 4 other tables taken but we were seated right next to another person. It would have been nice to have been given some extra privacy. Other than that weird staffing issue??, it was a very enjoyable stay. Bonus: they have 20 minutes of free internet access in the lobby. I didn't discover this until our last day. Utilize it!

After holidaying in California and Las Vegas it was great to head off and relax in Hawaii. Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is central to everything in Hawaii including shopping, restaurants and the beach. Rooms are on the small side and very basic and I am glad that we asked for a balcony and water views to compensate. Pool very busy but well maintained. Rooms serviced daily. An extra cost on top was $12.50 per day which allowed free internet access and also 60 minutes of international / local calls daily. Overall a nice motel, would stay again.

This was my 5th visit to Waikiki so already had a good idea about the hotel (especially location which is great) I had initially intended to stay at a hotel ON the beach, but as I couldn't book until quite late, the prices had gone through the roof and the PK (as it is known locally) had a far better price suited to my budget.I still wanted something 'nice' as it would be my Girlfriends first visit. The hotel is in two sections, the main building where the lobby and facilities are and a separate tower (but still feels like its in the same building as the elevator is under the same roof.....When we arrived after 26 hours of travelling from the UK, we just wanted to check in and get to the room, so we did just that. The first thing that hit me was the smell of stale tobacco upon leaving the elevator on the 21st floor but luckily our room (2169) did not smell of tobacco.... If I am honest I was a little disappointed by the room at first, but I guess that is because i have seen better in Waikiki.... but it was still clean and quiet which is the most important to me.The bed was HUGE and VERY comfy. Shower OK, not great but did the job.As part of the hotel 'resort fee' of $12.00 per day (which I had forgotten about !) we got two small bottle of water per day FREE PARKING (self) very rare in Waikiki, 60mins of LONG DISTANCE calls per day (awesome!!) High Speed (wired) internet. Othere things too but these were the most relevant to us.The fire alarm went off at 5 am during our stay and there were people in the lobby asking what was going on and lots of confusion - I thought an explanation/apology by way of a note under the door would have been good but not a big deal.We had a voucher for for a half price breakfast if bought with a full price one - we had breakfast once in the hotel and weren't very impressed - I suggest Dukes (see elsewhere on TA) it has a great buffet for a lower price.Pool was ok, quite a lot of kids at times but not too bad and always got a lounger ok, there is also a bar near the pool, but we took our own drinks to the pool on the few occasions we used the pool (not sure if permitted, but never saw any signs) Overall a very good hotel and I would certainly recommend you check it out

I was a bit hesitant to stay here given the mixed reviews, it seems everyone's stay was either great or really bad. I had a great time, the room was clean, great view, friendly staff, and a fantastic location!! This hotel is right in the middle of it all, the beach is across the street, International Market Place and lots of shopping right next door, and for dining there was everything you could imagine, from Denny's around the corner on Kuhio, to Koa just down Koa ave, and a buffet right there in the hotel- there was something for all tastes and budgets in each direction. We used the beach chairs that were provided, but we didn't know that the fresh fruit and water service was only provided at certain times and in certain locations, it would have been better if they would have mentioned that when we checked out the chairs and towels, but we figure next time then, and yes, I would stay here again. Mahalo Nui Loa for a wonderful time :)

My fiancee and I are staying at the Sheraton in Maui in September (for 7 nights), where we are getting married and then spending 6 nights at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. I am a little concerned reading some of the reviews. We've booked a high ocean view room, so I hope we're not dissapointed. Don't know what the resort fee is all about, I'm assuming that all this is included in the cost that I've already paid the travel company! I can see the location is obviously great, but some of the other comments do make me wonder about the overall experience. I'll be sure to give an update when we get back from our wedding/honeymoon!

Stayed her with my partner for 3 nights, very comfortable and clean room with new beds and fresh linen.2 complementary bottles of water per day and free in room wi-fi was great, also free parking at the hotel which is great if u rent a car as parking in Waikiki can be quiet expensive. Staff at the hotel were very helpful in sorting out our rental car and things to do and places to see.The pool area was not quiet as nice as some other hotels but still clean and useable.This hotel was in a great location in the center Waikiki, Close to the beach and markets and most restraunts

This hotel is in the midst of everything representing honolulu. All your shopping needs, the best restaurants. The best of all Waikiki beach is opposite. The entrance is not obvious on the main street which is great. You hear no street noise in your room. Check in is always fast and efficient. Alot of airline staff stay here also because of the proximity to everything. Love the Cheese Cake Factory & Dukes Bar & Grill. The market place is right next door for all your gift shopping. Great tours can be booked in the hotel lobby. The bar also has a great happy hour. The restaurant does a great buffet for breakfast and dinner. Nothing about this hotel is overly expensive. With great views from the rooms, either mountain or beach views.

We booked this as part of a package through a travel company as a holiday, so imagine oue surprise when we found that the hotel charges a resort fee. You may not be suprised by this, but the fact that the trip is a holiday, booked as a holiday, paid for as a hoilday, where else but a resort would you expect to go. The list of amenities you get for the 12.57 dollars per room, per day, include such delights as 2 free soft drinks per stay, (i.e. 1 per week), 2 bottles of water a day, local calls, 1 hr international calls, free child (under 12) per audlt eating @ circa 40 dollars each, free parking and a space on the beach half a mile away.Now, as I'm on holiday, I don't know anyone local to call, my family is with me, so I don't need to call home, my laptop is at home, so I don't need the internet, my car is also at home, the pool is just outside reception, so why walk half a mile for the same service? which leaves the free drink and 2 bottles of water, I can get one & litres of water across the road for 1 dollar, so 12.57 dollaars for the water is a little steep.Also, if you book a standard room, watch out. The view is a multistorey carpark, just what you want after 10000 miles. An up grade will cost another 20 dollars per night, per room.So be careful, expect to pay out on arrival, it cost me £500 with the up grade a & resort charge before I'd even unpacked.

The Sheraton Princess Kailani, also known in Hawaii as the 'Princess K"..... what a fabulous ttime we had. We stayed for several nights as we toured the Islands, and were very impressed. We visited the Princess K about 15 years ago when we were on our Honeymoon. Although we stayed at another place 15 years ago, we made nightly juants over to the Princess for their nightly "outdoor" entertainment. Our stay was comfy, beds were "heaven", views spectacular, food-scrumptous! The nightly Hula Dance, Fire-dance in the ballroom is outstanding to say the least.The swimming pool is simply the best. Shopping close by. In the heart of the entire city, surrounded by everything you'd want to do on your Honolulu vacation. Waikiki is 3 minutes from the Hotel. Clean, the lobby is lovely, shops galore, and A+ in our book. You won't be disappointed staying in this lovely hotel. We have traveled to Honolulu seven times. This hotel is a future visit for us for sure.

Family was walked here from Sheraton Waikiki which was overbooked. I won't rehash the details but you can check Sheraton Waikiki for my review. We were given two rooms on the 26th floor next to each other. Rooms are dated but functional. Two double beds in each room. Desk, LCD TV, safe, minifridge and coffeemaker. Nice to have the fridge and the coffee provided was quite good. Had to leave note for housekeeping for more creamer as they had only provided two each day. Bathroom had the standard one sink, toilet and tub all in one room with one door. One plus of the hotel is the rooms were well insulated. Did not hear our kids next door and we were concerned but it turns out it was the sound insulation. Having said that our room faced the International Marketplace and everynight we could hear the street performers. The first night is was fine since it ended by 11 pm but the second night we realized we were going to be listening to the same set of songs every night. I can't say it bothered our sleep since the music was done by the time we went to bed.Self parking was fine(no valet parking) and we always had parking at the top floors. What a lot guest did not seem to realize was that if you park on the bottom three floors you had to take the stairs down to the lobby. But if you followed the signs to the disabled parking to the top two floors and to the left of the main parking structure the spaces were next to the elevators that we could take directly to our rooms. By the way there were both regular parking and disabled parking spaces in this area and it always had empty spaces. Resort fee is $12 which is much lower than what seems to the standard $20 at most places. It covers self-parking and wired internet. Each cost $15 seperatedly so it is a no brainer to pay the resort fee if you are using either and in our case we used both. No wireless in this hotel so no facebook for my wife iPad which does not have 3G. She had to use my laptop or iPhone. Across the street is an ABC store and a Burger King which was good for breakfast and snacks. Tried the Pikake Terrace for their dinner buffet for $34.50 and felt it was good value and would recommend. Selection is limited and but they have snow crab clusters and prime rib and both were good. Only thing unusual is that the food is in two areas seperated by a wide hallway that hotel guest use to get to the elevators. I had noticed earlier people crossing the hallway with plates of food. For breakfast it is $21.50 but they have a takeout breakfast for $10 where they give you a takeout container what you can fill up with whatever you want. I noticed a lot of people carrying it up the elevator during my morning Burger King run. Talked to an elderly gentlemen and he said he fills it up and serves as breakfast for him and his wife. Aside from the Pikake Terrace there was really no other place for food in the hotel but it is centrally located and we did get some great inexpensive meals at the food court in the International Marketplace. Pool is nothing special. A small oval pool. Not crowded and okay for small kids. Our kids showed no interest in it. Overall I would consider coming back since I think considering the room rates on the web it is a good value.

We stayed at the Princess Kaiulani for a week, the lobby was very nice and the staff were friendly when checking in. We stayed on the 18th floor the room was fairly big, with a king bed, however we were very disappointed with the standard of the room, it was extremely basic and the decor was well below standard. The rooms are in desperate need of re-decorating and modernising. We also got a rude awaking with the fire alarm it went off twice at 5am it was a false alarm however nobody explainned it was a false alarm, we phoned down to the lobby to ask what was happening but there was no answer. Overall the hotel was ok, the location was really handy minutes from the beach, just a shame about the standard of the room.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for eight days, and the service was impeccable. It is located a block away from Waikiki Beach, and opposite a larger, much more expensive hotel where you can go have a drink at night if you want to visit other venues. Our hotel was by the International Market, and you could walk to all the boutiques, bars, etc. Very, very nice. Clean rooms, friendly service. Very, very nice! Would definitely recommend it!

One of the shabbiest rooms I've seen in a Sheraton... and I'm a huge fan of Starwood properties generally. The 'sofa' in the Deluxe Ocean View room was a joke. A couple stuffed cushions. The room smelled and the balcony was barely big enough to stand on. I was only here for one night, but if I had stayed here on vacation I would have checked out and gone somewhere else. It's cheap though... but you get what you pay for.

The Hotel is in a great location, across the main street from the Moana Surfrider and a nice stretch of Waikiki Beach. The views from my room are terrific, facing east and looking at Diamond Head. The room itself is average at best. Fairly clean, with carpet starting to tear and the facilities in mediocre repair. It's a Starwood property, so that really drove me to stay there. I'm not sure I would again, with so many great properties to choose from in the area. This property has not yet been a part of the massive Sheraton renovation that started a few years back. Pros: Location, can charge to your room at all of the 4 Starwood hotels in a 2 block radius, views from balcony.Cons: Rooms are mediocre, need to walk through the smelly buffet to get to your elevator bank (one wasn't working the whole trip,) no wifi in rooms.

Room is dirty,leaking from ceiling,did not do anything about it,instead,showed grim faces whenever they hear a complaint.some employees in the registration area are not friendly,especially the guy named Keoni,he had angry voice when I said I wanted to pay but my family member was still in the room waiting for somebody to open the safe,because it was locked out.I'm sure the other Sheraton in the other area are nicer,even the Japanese waitresses in thePikake restaurant are rude.there were 15 of us who ate there and one got up to go to the bathroom,one of the japanese waitress chase him as if we will run away from the bill,wherein fact our room numbers and names were listed and 14 of us were still eating.

I was here on business and brought my wife with me this time. The Sheraton is a very nice hotel. The location is excellent...across from Duke's Canoe Club, which is right on Waikiki Beach. We liked this hotel because it is centrally located on Waikiki and within walking distance of everything in Waikiki. The breakfast special is only $10 but it is in a "to go" box. All you can get in the supplied box is $10.00 and my wife crammed it full. It is a great deal for breakfast! The evening entertainment is ususally pretty good with local musicians on hand for a good show. I am going back in December 2011 and June 2012 and have requested our company travel agent to book me at the Sheraton again. My wife is looking forward to staying here again, as am I.

We booked here as part of our destination wedding/honeymoon. After spending 8 days at a resort on the north shore this was a rude awakening. The first room we were given was on the second floor with a view of a concrete wall. After asking to upgrade we were informed that the hotel was booked, but were able to move to a room on a higher floor. The view was better but the room was even smaller. Not only was the entire hotel desperately in need of renovation, both rooms we were in had BUGS! they looked like tiny ants of some sort. Disgusting. The only think this hotel has going for it is the location. It's not on the beach but it's in the middle of everything making it easy to walk all over Waikiki.

I have been reading the reviews about this hotel and am feeling rather disappointed at what I am reading, we have been saving for this holiday for over two years for my husbands 50th birthday, we will be arriving at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani on the 7th September, we have been working really hard to save the money for this holiday and we want it to be a special holiday we are going to las Vegas, San Francisco and then to Hawaii. I hope when I return back home I will be writing a good review, please don't let us down. Susan Ibbetson

We stayed here to utilize our SPG points and was very underwhelmed by the hotel. The rooms are very small and looks like it hasn't been updated since the 80s. The sheets were clean but overall, it is not a hotel you can spend time at - just a place to sleep and explore the rest of the island. The only convenience is that it is walking distance to the beach and the parking is affordable. The self-parking was only $12, including in the resort fee which was nice since other hotels in the area charge up to $30 a night.

It will be my first trip to Hawaii with my boyfriend. He hasn't been to Hawaii either.We are staying in October 2011, and I will be celebrating my 40th birthday in Hawaii!!!! We picked this hotel because it looked nice, we like the Sheraton name and it is close to the beach. We are so excited to stay here! I have read many good & bad reviews about this hotel and am not too worried. We won't be spending a lot of time in the room, as we want to see and do everything possible! I am planning on asking for an upgrade when we check in-does not hurt to ask. I will update my review when we are finished w/our trip. I can only imanage that it WILL be the trip of a LIFETIME!!!!!!!

Unfriendly staff. Substanddard cleanliness. The hotel amenites are a joke. While on the beach we received one apple & a bottle of water; no fresh or chilled towels.The dinner buffet had two edible items the unlimited crab & prime rib which were cold..For a hotel that is capible of having over 1,000 guest the pool is too small and always over crowded. If you drink anything other than Mai tia's...you will be very disappointed. I ordered a margurita which was all ice and no alcohol for the price of $16.75..I will never ever stay there again. The highlight of may stay was the breakfast bufffet, the food was warm and good. However, it was a vacation I really didn't want to wake at 6:00am.

"A great big thankyou to all concerned at the Sheraton Princess Kauilani for making our holiday a rememorable one"Scenes from the room was fab.The upgrade was appreciated the food pack was a lovely gesture upon arrival and the amenities were plentifulPool was nice and not crowded.Food was outstanding in the restaurant and bar. We will return after the renovations next year...SEE YOU THEN!!!!!!

The location of the hotel was good but they put us in a tower that was really crappy. Rooms were small, smelled like smoke but the worst part was the elevators weren't working. I was with a group and some of us were on the 11th floor! Everyone in the tower had to use the service elevator where there were long lines. It was ridiculous! When we asked to move our room they said the hotel was completely full. We ended up having the company we were working for move us to a different hotel. Normally I'm not a complainer as long as I have a decent place to stay but this was a little over the top.

Booked a night for August 6, 2011 and got a room on the 9th floor. This hotel is in bad need of a makeover.Parking lot is crowded and they have no elevators to take you to the hotel lobby. The interior is dated especially in the elevator lobbies, hallways and rooms. The pool was filthy (debris floating) and if you have small children, the designated roped area in the pool is quite small to play comfortably. I called guest services at 9:45pm for a box of tissue... guest service agent, "we'll send it right up Mr. S_________". 10:30pm comes and still no tissue. I finally went to sleep as we had a early checkout planned.Bottom line....be prepared to get what you pay for. Dirty run down hotel with poor guest service. I read previous reviews from other vacationers here that had received poor customer service. You would expect a shabby hotel to be on their A Game to make up for areas that lack. Well you knwo what they say right? For every complaint, there are 9 others that do not say anything. In my honest opinion...I would not spend your hard earned $$$$ here. Pay a little more and enjoy your vacation in Waikiki.

I read the reviews and was prepared for slightly dated/shabby rooms, but I didn't expect the entire hotel to so tired looking. I got a great deal, so wasn't expecting 5 star accommodations, but I expected more from a Sheraton property. There were water stains on the ceiling, visible grime on lamp shades, and LOTS of wear and tear on the furniture. The in-room Sheraton infomercial about their billion dollar renovations are insulting when you are sitting in a room that hasn't had a renovation since the late 80's. My other complaint was that when I checked my bags to wait for my room, they would not take my laptop bag. I had to spend 2 hours lugging that around which is how I discovered the lovely patio across the street. I thought that this might be common practice in Honolulu, but my friends who stayed at the other Sheraton said that they had no problem checking all of their bags. I travel with my laptop for business and pleasure, so I will remember this for future trips. Bottom line, if you are going to be out and about all day and are just looking for a place to sleep this could be your hotel. Don't stay here if you are expecting a normal Sheraton experience - you will be very disappointed.

We haven't gone yet, but we will be there in three weeks! My husband and I got married last year but couldn't afford a honeymoon right away. We booked a week at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for a combo belated honeymoon/one year anniversary vacation and we are very excited! Based on other reviews, we know the decor isn't the most up to date, but for the price and being so close to the beach, who cares? We're more interested in comfort than style anyway.We booked a standard room that probably doesn't have a balcony, but put in a request for an upgrade, which would be a great way to kick off the honeymoon. It will be interesting to see what (if anything) happens with that.I'm hoping the staff will be able to make some great suggestions for activities and dining, as my husband and I would like to celebrate with a romantic dinner somewhere. I'll update after the trip and let everyone know how it went.

stayed here last week, friendly efficient check in, was moved to a superior room after termites were found in room, REALLY busy hotel, the lobby was packed every morning, staff friendly saw CREATION, the in house show, FAAAANTASTIC!!! really relaxing place, abc store over the road so plenty of supplies, would recommend to anyone and would stay again... mahalo

I stayed here for two nights on a side trip from the Big Island. The price was right, and after reading the reviews, I pretty much new what to expect. The hotel itself was fine - it's right smack in the middle of a city block, so the layout was a little confusing at first, but it was fine. The rooms were in serious need of an update. The room was a good size, but everything was outdated. The bathroom was straight out of 1975 with yellow tiles and dated fixtures. It most certainly could have used a good bleaching, what with the mildewy walls and the rust ring around the toilet. The room also faced the parking garage and the garbage area, which was great for listening to that 2am garbage pickup. All in all, the hotel was fine if you're just looking to crash. It's right in the middle of Waikiki beach, and everything is within walking distance, which was a nice plus. But other than that, it was just average at best.

We stayed here as part of a package deal for a University Of Southern California vs Hawaii football game ( of course we were there for USC Trojans whoohoo). The staff hotel was most welcoming of the trojan fans and had signs everywhere welcoming the fans. The hotel was a decent price, it was no 5 star hotel, but for the price we paid it was just right.Pro's:It was a decent hotel with decent rooms for a decent price. Right in the walking distance to all the big major hotels, the park, restuarants, and of course the beautiful beach ( about 2-5 minute walk). They had nightly entertainment of dancers and singers right byt the pool/bar/buffet so you didnt have to go far. on the second floor was the poynesian dinner and show which is a bit pricey but the show was def worth the price and is a must see ( plus hotel guest get a discount which was a bonus) they have a very good excursions and tours desk and they were very friendly in helping us find the right stuff, we did not need a car because of the close walking distance and all tours we booked had transportation. Over all the staff was friendly, the rooms were a little older but decent and beds were comfortable. If we returned to Oahu we would want to try a bigger resort howeverr this definately would be on our list if we needed a budget friendly yet nice place to stay again.Cons:Since it is right in the spot were it the busiest and most crowded it was loud ( but hey your in hawaii right have fun). The pool was rather small and the buffet was pricey but not all that great. The Hyatt is right across the street and was their employees were on strike and protesting ( I know this wasnt in Sheratons hand but it was so annonying and non relaxing to here yelling and loud drums at 430am in the morning). If it is a busy season and you cant check out late but your flight is later in the day they do allow for you to have a room for one hour to freshen up at a first come first serve, however the down side to it was when we got the room for an hour it was dirty, used towels bed not made, you can tell the people just left which was not pleasant at all. The food at the Polynesian Creation show wasnt that great ( but the show itself was so awesome Id still recommend going to it). House keeping was always late cleaning our room, so after a long morning of doing fun things we just wanted to come back and relax in our room and twice our room wasnt ready or cleaned. The first time we said it was ok just give us fresh towels, and toilet paper ( we were so tired we didnt want to wait and just wanted to rest) so she checked in as if she "cleaned" the room. it happened again a second time but when we complained they did make sure our room was always cleaned on time.Over all it was a great experience, the flaws and cons were just mild things, so i would recommend staying here if your looking for a cheaper hotel but one that is decent looking, friendly, and close to the beach and attractions.

I had a week in the Princess Kaiulani and what can I say. It was not a pleasant experience. The hotel itself is tired and weary, the staff behind the counter as unhelpful as it is possible to be. Continental drift moves quicker than the hotel staff here. On the day we were leaving our minibus was late. Following the tour directors advice I asked the gentleman on reception, Tuesday 20th July at 4.30 am, to call to see where the driver was. The receptionists attitude absolutely stunk. He said words to the effect of don't worry about it, they will be here soon and wandered off. Ten minutes later the driver arrived apparently having been sat around the corner. That attitude absolutely stunk and was typical of the hotel. The meals are overpriced and poor quality. For breakfast we ended up going to Duke's every morning.

This was a family (two parents, one toddler) vacation and the hotel met all of our needs. The staff was extremely professional and friendly. The room was very clean and was always promptly made up. The hotel is at a great location - across the street from the beach, close to all amenities. The hotel and room could use a little updating but overall we had a great stay and would definitely return.

Just getting settled in, a bit disappointed that this hotel is NOT Beach Front, my mistaken booking... But still how could you not enjoy Hawaii, a wonderful destination and visit.There was a refrigerator in our room, walking distance from many Waikiki activities and restaurants. Everyone should visit Pearl Harbor !

The Sheraton PK (as the locals call it) is a bit tired, but if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki and not pay top dollar, this is a good place to stay. While the hotel itself could use a good facelift, our room was clean and the staff was very friendly. As it was, we were so busy that we were not in the room much at all. We did a lot of driving and had a rental car and the Sheraton PK has a good parking structure which is extremely convenient, but best of all, the parking was FREE!!!!! I don't know if that's standard or if it's because we are part of the rewards program, but free parking in prime real estate in Hawaii is unheard of -- even for hotel guests. Location is great because you walk right past the pool and you've got all the shopping and restaurants you could want. However, if you're looking for a relaxing, laid back Hawaiian vacation, this isn't the location for you. There's a lot of people and navigating Kauakala street (I think that's the name of the main avenue) is challenging at night with all of the crowds. But if you're looking for nightlife and a lot of activity, it's perfect!

I stayed at this hotel when I met my boyfriend in Hawaii after I had travelled round mainland USA, and he flew overnight from Australia.We arrived at the hotel, exhausted, only to be told our room would not be ready for another 3 hours (despite me having emailed to say we were arriving early-when I say early, I mean 12noon). Apart from that, this was the only real glitch in our stay.The rooms are comfortable (a little dated-but lots of thing in Hawaii are like 80s flashbacks!!) but the housekeeping were a little unreliable-every day there was something that was forgotten, but we didn't make a fuss-there are too many other things to see and do in Hawaii that it didn't matter to us!The buffet breakfast was good, I especially loved the omelets cooked while you wait!! But BEWARE of the pidgeons!!! They attack even if you leave the table for a second...in our 10 day stay, we saw many many people make the mistake of leaving their table unattended, and the birds descend!!!Overall we found the staff very pleasant and cheerful, and we also loved that they brought you fruit and water on the beach at certain times of the day-perfect in the sun!!!
The hotel is fine, but it is hard to beat the location! Really close to the beach, stores and great food!

We booked a trip for Aug. So I'll update more then. But what about microwaves for leftovers or my baby's milk? She drinks warm milk in the morning and before bedtime. How about leftover expensive food for the next time your hungry? I called the hotel and they say they charge $10 a day for a microwave depending on availability. We'll be there 8 days, no way I'm paying 80 bucks. That's more than a brand new microwave from Walmart

We were staying at Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa and it was not a nice place at all. After calling expedia, we had our hotel changed to here. I was pleasantly surprised! Very friendly at the front desk, we had no lines or crowds, even though it was 7am, they provided us with our room early!! We got up to our room and the key wouldnt work. I was a bit stressed because he had an excursion to meet up for in 30 minutes. I kindly explained it & not only were they working hard to get us in our room, they decided to upgrade us for free for our inconvience! Who does that anymore without someone totally losing it before they do?? They were old school like that and it was so greatly appreciated!! The pool was warm and nice, friendly staff, loved how clean and nice the place was! Only reason for 4 stars and not 3 is simply based on the buffet. The birds are insane and extremely aggressive! The hostess was trying so hard to make them go away but the bus boys were not quick enough getting the food off the table. My husband and I had to go to the buffet in shifts so the birds didnt get into our food....others were not so lucky!

We planned our trip a month in advance! 9 days at the Sheraton Princess Kiulani... a birthday present from my boyfriend and a prelude to a marriage proposal........our first major trip together. We were told we would have a "city view" in the Princess Kiulani wing with wireless internet and a BALCONY to sit on at night and view the city lights (we thought).. We arrived after a 14 hour flight from Florida and no sleep since 2 am (add 6 hrs). only to be escorted to the ROOM FROM HELL! It was like an old Motel 6. The room was old, small and very outdated, the a/c didn't work and the 3rd floor balcony was right over the very LARGE TRASH CONTAINER WHICH SMELLED LIKE A SEWER!!! Forget being outside at all!
