Oh, and the view was of the parking garage. Oh and then the sliding door immediately stuck open and maintenance had to be called. My boyfriend was SOOOOO embarrassed as he had planned a beautiful vacation for us and spent a huge sum of money on the trip.Well, he called down to the desk....... which I have to say the staff was very nice...... but the only room they supposedly had open was in the same wing, with the same view, same very outdated style, only on the 11th floor. He was told they could get us another room the next day (which turned out to be nicer and larger with a balcony over the pool) for $20 more per night!!! The old "bait and switch" routine..Once we were in the new room on the 7th floor, which was larger, nicer decor, comfortable, had a pool view and a partial view of the ocean and surfers, we had a wonderful stay, but we couldn't believe they would even suggest anyone stay in the first room we had! What a terrible way to treat guests staying 9 days in your hotel! And it's not like we had just walked in looking for a room for the night! We had an agent book us a month ahead!!!Would also tell everyone to plan on eating offsight. Breakfast is ONLY buffet style for about $29 per person. We asked for just 2 cups of coffee "to go" one morning and they asked for the full amount. Of course we objected and ended up spending $6 just for coffee. FYI: There's a coffee stand on the main street just in front of the hotel past the pool that has great coffee a lot cheaper.......... with a place to sit so you can people watch. And there's a McDonald's two blocks away and a Burger King just across the side street...... plus beautiful pool patio restaurants across the street on the beach with some awesome buffetts for the same money.The hotel is located centrally to all that is happening in Waikiki. The nightly poolside Hawaiian music and hula dancers are relaxing to watch from your balcony if you happen to face the pool (which I suggest). FYI: There are many street artists and musicians and even a street preacher on the main street in front of the shops which are in front of the hotel until 11pm that are very noisy from the crowds cheering, Plan on staying up til they stop their activities. But be sure to check them out!Finally, the wireless internet connection was terrible. I bought a new Ipad just for this trip as we wanted to research condos (we're hoping to retire there in 3 years) and had to go to McDonald's to use it. The good news: your added "daily hotel fee" includes parking. Also there are 3 ABC stores within one hundred ft of the hotel. For those of you who donm't know, those are NOT liquor stores although they do carry some great rum! You can get everything there: souveniers, snacks, fruit, sandwiches, sushi, cokes, t-shirts, sarongs, etc. Save your receipts!!! at $100 you get a freebie!The bad news: the "fruits and water" they say they say they serve you twice a day in front of the DUKE at Kuhio Beach is only an apple and bottled water. They come find you (as you have a striped pool towel to identify you). They only found us once. Their advertising makes it sound like there's a "spread" awaiting you. There is not so eat before you go.OH, I must mention this. There is a great ukelele teacher that gives free lessons in the lobby each week.. He and his group also play by the pool at night one night a week. Look for him. NOt only does he teach you to play, he has some very interesting stories about the Hawaiian people AND he can tell you where and what the locals eat. Also the hula lessons in the lobby are fun. Be sure to join in or at least watch!All in all, we had a good time, BUT, we would probably NOT stay at this hotel againunless they GUARANTEED our room........... which we were told they don't do until you arrive. Luckily, the next week we spent in Maui and our beach condo was delightful................. and .................. FYI ..................I said "YES" !

We have JUST BOOKED 6 nights at the Princess for SEPTEMBER, and have also a 3 night stay at the ASTON both we are told MAY provide an UPGRADE on arrival depending on availability? I will update on our return and see if this is a SALES PITCH or FACT ...stay tuned .... AUSTRALIA

Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. If you are going to Waikiki on a vacation stay at one of the other Starwood resorts (if you prefer Starwood hotels like we do). You will be glad you did. Starting with the check in, the woman checking in seemed bothered she had to help us. I asked to give her my SPG number and she seemed inconvenienced, and then made a comment that I wasn’t even a platinum member. Should that matter?The hotel is VERY outdated. I know that Starwood has been re-doing tons of hotels across the globe (they mention it frequently on the SPG channel on the TV), but I have no idea how the Sheraton Princess missed the list. I would think it would be at the top of the list. The rooms were outdated, almost no décor what-so-ever. The AC was TERRIBLE. We sweated every night all through the night. The thermostat is a “knob” and you can’t control the temperature or anything. We didn’t ask to move because the hotel was so outdated we assumed they were all the same in every room. The hotel is noisy overall too. We had to sleep with the TV on all night long to try to drown out the sounds. You can hear a lot in the surrounding rooms both adjacent and above. The “activities” coordinator was useless. We tried to see her before breakfast she was talking to someone which was fine so we got our food and went to try again. She was still talking to the same person when we came back, and had multiple groups of people waiting around her. They appeared to be chit-chatting more than talking about activities. We didn’t want to wait around for her, and only had a simple question so we called from our room. She wouldn’t answer our question, told us to come down to the lobby to see her and that she was very busy. Well we weren’t about to try that again and we walked across the street to the Westin where we were helped professionally. They helped us in about 1 minute and we were on our way.I guess if there is any positive to this hotel, it is the location. Though it is not on the beach, it is across the street. It is close to many stores, restaurants etc which makes it nice. I would say it is centrally located. We spent as much time as possible away from the hotel. We spent our time at the beautiful Sheraton Waikiki (5 minute walk) and the Moana Surfrider Westin (directly across the street) which is a phenomenal hotel. You can charge everything to your room there so we enjoyed a nice resort hotel since we were not staying at one. I wish our breakfast vouchers were vailid at the sister hotels like they were in Maui!If you are visiting the area on a vacation, I don’t think you will enjoy this hotel. The price may be a little cheaper, but you get what you pay for. Hopefully Starwood sinks some money into this hotel and brings it up to the standard people expect from Sheraton hotels.

The hotel was very clean. They accommodated us in every way. We stayed at Sheraton Princess for 6 nights on the top floor (29th) in a Oceanview room. Our trip was wonderful not to mention during the trip my fiancé proposed to me on the beach which was priceless. Because we got engaged, the hotel sent about two bottles of wine and a bottle of champagne during our visit. We would come up to the room and our champagne would be nice and chilled for us enjoy. The hotels pool/bar area was relaxing. There is someone at the towel desk at all times. The night entertainment was very tranquil. The hotel accommodated us with each room service order. A few things I would have a minor negative feedback on was the service of the waitress at the outdoors hotel restaurant. She really took her time to serve us. The second would be that the hotel doesn't have a Jacuzzi or whirlpool. The third would be that the hotel is slightly outdated but still comfortable. Its not 4 star but a great hotel to stay in to relax for a bit and then be out and about. The travel desk was very helpful with accommodating our trip wishes. The beds were really comfo compared to many other hotels we have stayed in. We definitely plan to stay at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani on our next visit. It was a memorable experience!!

Second time staying here. Location is one of the best. Our room was in need of an update but we got a terrific rate for our stay so we lived with it.(only 2 nights)Would have enjoyed having the pool open later. (8 am-7pm). It was fine for the money we spent but in the future we will look around for other options.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani (SPK) for our family vacation to Oahu. The swimming pool was OK, nothing to write home about, but who cares when Waikiki beach is pretty much right across the street.Our room was small and outdated. I don't think the room has been re-designed since the 70's. The bathroom was small, clean, but looked like a gas station bathroom.The location of the hotel was awesome! Near to a lot of restaurants and ABC stores to stock up on supplies. Would I stay here again? Sure, but I would need to make sure that we stay in a room that has been recently re-designed....

We stayed here on the 16th floor for 5 days after spending 9 days in Maui. The beds were comfortable with cozy plush comforters to relax in. We had a partial ocean view from our lanai and the rest of the view was of the International Market Place practically right below us with the beautiful tree canopy covering it.It's close enough to walk to the beach or walk to shopping, only downfall was that it was also close enough to hear garbage trucks backing up every morning 16 floors down.

(I had to select a date - but that is incorrect) We actually stayed at this hotel in November 2009 for 14 days. Staying in this hotel made our first trip to Honolulu even better. From the comfortable mattress, to the pillows that I just felt so soft to lay on, to the entertainment of a night time down near the bar, the wonderful cocktails and friendly staff - the list could really go on. The location of this hotel was just amazing, the beach was just across the road, markets around the corner....walking distance to everything. This hotel is within budget and really there is nothing to complain about, we had a fantastic time!! I just fell in love with Honolulu - and I plan to go back very soon. The people are just so friendly :)

We stayed at the Princess Kaiulani for 8 days and had a high ocean view. The view was awesome. With a lanai it was nice to sit outside and take in the view. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The maids were friendly but we had a hard time speaking to some that didn’t understand English. Compared to other hotels, the daily hotel fee was a good price for everything it included. The gym was useful for working out while on vacation. The pool was nice and had plenty of chairs. Having Waikiki Beach right across the street was great. The hotel offers free towel & chair use at the beach which was fantastic. Parking at the hotel was never a problem. The hotel is in a great spot to walk to shops, eat and souvenir hunt. We stayed on the 12th floor so the traffic noise that many people complain about was not a problem. Overall it was a good choice and we would stay at the Princess Kaiulani again.

We stayed here two years ago and loved every minute ,I was a little worried after reading some reviews but was pleasantly surprised by how lovely all the staff were ,we stayed on the 6 th floor facing the pool with a partial ocean view , the room was lovely and clean , the bed was like sleeping on a cloud ,everything was great ,the only sad thing for us was that we,re coming back in October and tried to book but couldn't get a room on the Sheraton website , site says no rooms available :o( had to look elsewhere , I would highly recommend the princess and would definitely stay again .

After a road trip in USA, we spent one week in Hawaii (2 days in Oahu and 5 days in Kauai)Basically, we chose this hotel because:1.-Sheraton brand2.-Location3.-PriceHowever, when we arrived around 2pm we started to get a little bit disappointed:1.-After parking the car in the entrance to go to do the check-in, one of the bell men that was in the entrance, came to the front desk to tell me to go to park the car...I told him: Can you wait 2 minutes: I have to do the check-in! And obviously, he left and I left the car in the entrance (without blocking anything obviously: the car did not bother)Honestly, I don't expect that from a Sheraton hotel!...Anyways...let's continue with check-in...2.-Room was not ready (it was 2:15pm): check-in time is 3pm...I'm a SPG member but we didn't get any special treatment....So, we decided to had lunch in the swimming pool. We had lunch twice and it was fine: we had a 30% discount in found (not beverage)The room: we booked a city view room and is what we got. We were in the 15th floor overlooking to the west side of the city...View were OK however from the 15th floor we could hear the noise from the air conditioning machines and fans from the street level.Everything inside the room looked old. Inside the rooms there isn't WIFI coverage (only in the loby), you have a cable connection. The bathroom OK but old.Being located in the heart of Waikiki, the rooms should be soundproofed. At night we could hear the noise from the street. And remember, we were on floor 15With the resort fee you get free parking (to be considered if you rent a car to visit the island), internet, pool towel, 2 bottles of water...and maybe something else that I don't remember.Elevators sometimes overbooked...Location: the hotel is located in Waikiki beach so you're in the middle of all the attraction and everything is in walking distance. Other Starwood hotels are located within a walking distance (The westin is in front)We didn't have breakfast as I was a little bit expensive (like other hotels if not included in rate), so we went to a Starbucks that is near the hotel.I think that it is not a place to go if you want to relax...However for the price paid and its location, is fine.

I must admit that we were concerned after reading some of the reviews, but please put your mind to rest. This hotel is a class act. We reserved an Ocean View room, and while the room might have been a bit smaller than we anticipated, the room was very clean, very comfortable, and very well appointed. The view was breathtaking. To our left was the ocean, ahead was the city, and to our left were the beautiful mountains. What more could you ask for? The staff were very accomodating and saw to our every need without hesitation. The food was excellent, and we especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet. I honestly cannot think of one staff member who was not smiling, friendly, and helpful in every way. Even though this is an older hotel, it is well maintained and kept very clean. The location couldn't be better. You are right across the street from the beach, and right in the middle of shopping, and a non-stop party when the sun goes down. Honestly, I had never considered going to Hawaii before, and probably would'nt be there yet except for our son's wedding. Thanks to the wonderful staff and management of the Princess Kaiulani, I would gladly return. Maholo nui loa my friends! You will always be fondly remembered whenever I think of Hawaii!

we booked an oceanview no smoking room on the higher floors had had an awesome view. Booked through hotel.com and gave us a great package where we booked for four days but just paid for three. It included free breakfast for two. There breakfast is fantastic as is not just some small continental breakfast that barely fills you p but a large buffet breakfast consisting of at least five different tables ful of a large variety of breakfast treats.The staff of the hotel are all very friendly and efficient and made the whole visit one that will be happy to repeat again and again.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in June. Having chosen the hotel due to the "Sheraton" branding we expected a certain level of quality. The location is really first class with views of Waikiki beach and in the centre of all the action.We found the check in staff very rude when checking in and out, we were the only people at the desk both times but got the feeling they had better things to do rather than serving guests. The bell guys we found very pleasant and the tour organiser Tommy was a very helpful and polite chap who helped us no end.The room was ok, nothing special, we have stayed in better quality Motels in the USA, so not really the standard we were expecting from a Sheraton. The bed was ok no complaints there, the bathroom was basic and very dated.The hotel has a compulsory $12 a day resort fee; this we felt was a complete rip off. It included "High speed Internet access"! This is not Wi-Fi it is a cable on the desk in the room, no good if you have an IPhone or HTC like we did. You also get 2 bottles of water a day (which we never used) and free towels at the pool. So basically we paid $12 a day for towels which are included free at most other hotels I have stayed at.My advice would be if you are just looking for a room and get a good rate this hotel is ok, if you are looking for something a bit special and want to avoid the $12 resort fee choose one of the many other hotels in and around this one.

So my wife and I went here on a vacation/ friends wedding. We decided on this hotel because it was close to the beach and was next door to the hotel the wedding was at. Come to find out it is in one of the best locations in Waikiki. We were very happy with this place because of its close location to everything and that it was cheap. With that in mind we were able to check out several of the rooms because most of the wedding visitors stayed there. If you are looking for a nicer room at this place try to stay in a room in the center tower of far left from the front desk. Our room was to the right of the front desk and like some reviews, it is old. The rooms were dated and the bathrooms looked like an 80's dormroom bathroom. However everything was clean and the beds were very comfortable. We paid around $130 a night and stayed 6 nights. We stayed one night at a hotel across the street (because that was where the wedding was at) and paid $280. It was very nice. But saving $150 a night times 6 nights we were able to go shark cage diving, pearl harbor, catamarans, surfing, and fine dining. We are the kind people who are hardly ever in our room on vacation so we didn't care what it looked like. So if you are picky about having a flat screen, nice furniture, and an updated bathroom then I would pick somewhere else. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. This place is close to shops but doesn't really have any in the hotel, which is nice because only the hotel guests are wondering through the property. They had two or three tables from local artists set up every night by the pool.

Friends and I stayed here before heading out on a cruise. For this kind of money per night, there are better places to stay in Honolulu that are close to the beach. There is also a resort fee that is charged each day for Internet and other things. Looked like 1970's Holiday Inn decor, but the room I had did have a nice sized frig and the bed was good (but not Westin good). However, the other rooms my party stayed in did not have a frig, so be careful when booking if you need one. Not the cleanest place either. Would stay here again if I got a really good deal online or through one of the bidding sites.
Rooms are terrible! We were in Hawaii to get married, everything was lovely apart fromThe extremely dated hotel rooms! The bathroom looked years old! Very very disappointing!

This hotel was recommended to us by a friend due to its location – which is very good, smack bang in the busiest part of Waikiki. But there are 10-15 hotels in a three block radius that offer the same great central location and I’m sure a better quality stay.When we first arrived the hotel looked fine, although I’ve never seen a lobby this busy before. I assumed it was simply because it was check-in time. Unfortunately I was wrong. It’s always busy with hordes of people trampling this way and that, or queuing for the reception or elevator which adds up to create a bustling and what can only be describes as unrelaxing atmosphere.After waiting for 20 mins to check-in my partner and I went up to our High Ocean Room only to discover we didn’t have much of an ocean view and unbelievably two single beds on opposite sides of the small room. Not the romantic getaway we had in mind.After complaining we were switched to a room on the opposite side of the hallway. This time it did have the king sized bed I had requested when booking and a slightly better ocean view. The rest of the room though was still very disappointing. The balcony was small and cramped, the railings rusty and the chair and miniature table looked like they had weathered more than their fair shares of Hawaiian storms.The bathroom was also cramped and in desperate need of an update, which goes for almost every aspect of the hotel.To top off our disappointment the lobby, which also acted as the buffet dinner area (very strange indeed), was filled with an unappetising stench every night from 5pm onwards as the food sat out for the busy foot traffic to admire and well, hold their breath. We never did work out which dish made this smell, as needless to say we didn’t sample the food - but thanks to the hotels location there are plenty of restaurants to chose from near-by.If I could book my holiday again, I don’t think it would be a surprise to you I would not stay at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. Instead I would most definitely spend the extra $200-300 dollars it would have cost me for the entire week to stay at one of the many other hotels near by.

Even though we got a good rate at the hotel, it was not worth it. The hotel is old and outdated. The service was poor. The first room we got had a shower that didn't work. Upon asking for a second room, we were then put in a disabled room even though we are not disabled. The elevators took a very long time. And to top it off, there was a false fire alarm one night at midnight. While the false alarm may not have been the hotel's fault, they were unable to turn it off for almost 10 minutes after notifying the guests that it was a false alarm! Even though the location is great, I would not stay in this hotel again.

Got an excellent rate online for an upper level ocean view. Nice room, clean, good amenities including a refridgerator. Very comfortable beds. Very much worth the price I paid. Staff was helpful and very nice. This hotel is located toward the end of the strip of Waikiki hotels, across from the Moana Surfrider and so it's not quite at busy as other parts of the strip. Great location to get in and out of the city easily, with parking right next door. Nice pool area, music poolside at night. Would stay here again!

I stayed at the Sheraton Pricess Kaiulani in early June for 5 nights and while the rate offered on the SPG site was unbeatable, the room I was given (maybe because of the low rate I received) were not up to the standard of other Sheraton properties that I have stayed at. While the beds were comfortable and the room was quite clean, the room decor was dated and the bathrooms just ridiculous - old fashioned and looked like the shelves were built from chipboard. The air conditioning was a complete mystery in the room, hidden behind a wooden screen and probably dating from the 1970's - two knobs with not labels so I didn't know if I was turning up the heat or the cooling.The common areas were nice and in keeping with the local Hawaiian fashion, and the location can't be beat. Staff were also very pleasant. There is a $13 daily resort fee that covers internet usage, access to towels for the pool or beach, two bottles of water per day, parking, etc.I would stay again if I were to get the same good rate from the SPG website.

We stayed at this hotel for two weeks. Couldn't be in a better location!!! Rooms very clean just a little out of date. But who goes to Hawaii to stay in their room!!! The guys at the pool were brilliant, concierge very helpful. Would definitely stay again. :)

Good value for money, good amenities and well positioned. Located across the road from Waikiki Beach. Good views of Waikiki in upper floors. Rooms need revamping bit clean and comfortable. Street noise a bit loud but settles by midnight. Service in the poolside restaurant appalling, but like the atmosphere of the hotel.

I'm a Platinum member and have been offered oceanfront rooms at other Starwood properties in Honolulu. I've chosen to return to this hotel because of great customer service, specifically from Ms. Chie Homma, Guest Service Manager.June will be my 4th visit to this hotel mainly due to Ms. Homma's gracious and kind attitude and how she listens to my special requests. Thank you to her and many other staff members who make me feel very welcome.

We planned a family trip to Hawaii to see where my parents meet. We were looking for a place to stay on Oahu for a few night before we got on our cruise around Hawaii. We figured Shertaton is always decent but boy were we surprised. When we got to the hotel the horrible service started right away. Whether we were asking for pool towels that got thrown across the counter at us or just checking in, we were sure to walk away disappointed and annoyed. I could have overlooked the bad service if the rooms were worth writing home about...they weren't. We felt like we were back in college with a metal sink in the bathroom and a public restroom kind of toilette that you have to press the lever to flush. The furniture took us back to the 80's. If I had known I would have stayed across the street at the Westin which was amazing, beautiful and had wonderful service. The hotel fulfilled a function but it left a bad taste in our mouth for the start of our trip. The only redeeming quality was the location which was close to great restaurants, shopping and an amazing coffee stand just around the corner in the market. If you are thinking about saving a few bucks, rethink it when you consider staying here.

We stayed in the Princess Kaiulani wing on the 5th floor overlooking the parking garage, the room was very clean, hadn't been redecorated since about 1950 but still very comfortable. The only problem was the trucks that arrived every night about midnight with deliveries and woke you. .We would stay there again but we would ask for a room away from the carpark as the price was so reasonable and we spent most of our time out of the hotel

We stayed at this hotel for one week.Had and excellent stay and will be back here. Whilst the accommodation is a little more expensive than others it was well worth it. We had a room on the 18th floor with a view of the beach. Very nice pool and large in comparison to other hotels. Nightly entertainment in the Pikake Terrace bar near the pool was really good.The hotel also provides the beach chairs to guests.The hotel is in a central location close to shops the markets and the beach. We recommend the High Ocean view rooms which were really good.

What a fantastic place to stay, we have been to Honoloulu 3 times and this was by far the best place we stayed at. Our room had the best view, deluxe ocean view, and deluxe it was. Our kids loved it as it was there first time to Hawaii, i would recommend this place to anyone, great location, great breakfast and free fresh pineapple in the afternoons, close to everything you need. Loved it

What a fantastic place to stay, we have been to Honoloulu 3 times and this was by far the best place we stayed at. Our room had the best view, deluxe ocean view, and deluxe it was. Our kids loved it as it was there first time to Hawaii, i would recommend this place to anyone, great location, great breakfast and free fresh pineapple in the afternoons, close to everything you need. Loved it

Stayed 8 nights2 rooms #901 & #903carpets look like they have never been cleaned lots of dark stains Had roaches in both rooms, Randi was very nice she moved us to diff rooms #1669 & # 1647 for last 3 nights of our stay.This rooms where nice BUT the problems are that there is LOT of street noise & u can hear everything from ur next door room, people were loud next to our rooms.Randi heled us as much as she can the bottom line how does Sheraton put their brand name on this GARBAGE property I have no idea.STAY AWAY from this hotel, spend few more $ and stay at diff hotelBecause of the hotel we had the worse vacation ever could not sleep most of the nights.
Great Location! Great for what you pay for. Excellent for families.

Mahalo, Mahalo, Mahalo, My wife my two daughter (16 & 19) and myself have just had the holiday of a lifetime. We just spent two weeks visiting California and Las Vegas and then stopped over in Hawaii for (5) nights on the way home. It was the highlight of our trip, The staff at this hotel were the friendliest and most helpfull we have encountered. We had a room on the 20th floor with a walk out balcony and amazing ocean views over Waikiki. The room was well maintained and kept very clean on a daily basis. It had plenty of room for (4) of us, plenty of mirrors for the girls. The food and the entertainment were also wonderfull. The overall atmosphere of theis Hotel is warm and friendly with something always going on, even in the lobby there was always something to watch and learn. We will definately be back as soon as possible. The Hawaiian spirit is awesome . Thanks again ,Mahalo and Aloha ...The Berry Family

we stayed here in aug 2008 for our honey moon, we had dinner in the restuarant which was excellent, such a good variety of food in a buffet style, on the second floor is a hawaii show that we went to see this was very fun to watch and highly recommended. the room was comfortable and air con was loverly , the rooms were quite and clean. in the foyer was a man who offered excursions which i booked a few from and the coaches collected us from thehotel which was great. the hotel is about one street from the beach also very close to lots of restaurants and a cheesecake factory!!! ( highly recommended for anyone who loves pudding!!) they had some computers in the foyer where you could go on the internet fir free which was handy. all in all a perfect honeymoon, couldnt have asked for more

We booked our Hawaii holidays with Sheraton Princess Kaiulani as part of our package tour with AA.com on the 2nd week of May 2011. The location is great, right in the heart of Honolulu and Waikiki beach, walking distance to the restaurant, fastfood, shopping center and covenient stores for all your needs. Our room on the 7th floor (732) had sun all day until last minutes in the evening and the balcony had an amazing partial ocean view that oversaw the pool below. At night you can hear tropical music playing below by the pool and the entertainment from the busy Waikiki strip. Hotel room and area is clean and spotless. Fresh towel is available at the pool side and beach chair if you want to spent time at Waikiki beach. The staff was always friendly, helpful and and the US$12.50 resort fee per day is inclusive of internet access (24 hours) and phone calls. We checked out 8 hours before our flight back to Toronto. The staff kept our baggages on the courtesy storage and offer the courtesy room while waiting for our pick-up to the airport. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return again when we visit Honolulu. To Sheraton Princess Kaiulani -- "MAHALO NUIA LOA"

OK...really though, I have to clarify that when in Hawaii you are not there for the hotel room! You are there for the amazing natural beauty and history that this indescribable land has to offer. So here goes the review:Location: RIGHT ACROSS from world famous Waikiki beach. Right in the middle of all the action. City views on one side and the ocean on the other. Convenient to restaurants, shopping malls and anything else you would ever need.Pool: eeeeeehhhhh....not terrible...but I prefer the beach anyway for swimming and lounging. But the pool provided plenty of shade if needed, lounge chairs towels. My only issue was that it is nestled in the middle of the hotel's buildings and felt somewhat confined. Rooms: So I was fortunate enough to be up on the 25th floor. It is a preferred room and you will pay more but I had a beautiful view or the city, mountains and the oceans. You most likely will NOT see diamond head because of where the hotel is located and the juxtaposition of the surrounding hotels...but double check if that is on you list of wants. As for the room itself...it was a little dated in terms of the carpet, tile in the bathroom and the 80's art work on the wall. There was a flat-screen TV, fridge and coffee maker with YUMMY Kona coffee. And the bed when I needed a good night sleep after hiking and surfing and being in the sun all day was oh so comfy!Food: There is a buffet option for BLD. I only ate breakfast there one morning and it was very good...and the food for the other meals always looked and smelled appetizing. If I remember correctly it was around $20 per meal...but the hotel might offer a deal so again, double check. Most mornings there is a small coffee/bagel stand right off of the pool area that worked for me.Overall, the rooms are very reasonably priced for what you get.

How Starwood allows this hotel to be a part of its Starwood network is unreal. I am a Platinum Guest with Starwood which means I am the best of the best when it comes to frequent travelers in the Starwood chain and my "upgraded" room and service was absolutely awful. I cant imagine what the rooms look like for non upgrades. The hotel has a great location across from the beach so if you are looking for CHEAP NEAR THE BEACH this place has it, but it is run down and dirty and the services they provide are ridiculous. I couldnt even buy a cup of coffee in the hotel unless I paid for the entire buffet breakfast. Internet is hard wired in the room and even then it didnt work. Towels and bathrooms stink, carpets are old. What more can I say. If you need cheap near the beach, this is your place, but if you want a nice place to stay then bypass this one.ALSO DON'T BE MISLED BY THE LOW PRICES, THEY WHACK YOU WITH A DAILY RESORT FEE WHEN YOU CHECK IN WHICH IS IRONIC SINCE THIS IS DEFINITELY NOT A RESORT!!!

Having returned from the Princess Kaiulani Hotel on the 30th May, we’d like to thank all the staff, they were very helpful on our late arrival due to a 4 hour delay in San Francisco. They new in advance that it was my wife's birthday and had wished her a happy birthday and upgraded our room. Our room was spotless, the decor was new with a large king-sized bed and the room had a large flat screen TV. Bathroom was acceptable had clean towels provided everyday. Belinda the housekeeper was very friendly and cleaned the room everyday, we'd like to say a big thank you to her also. Our room 732 was on the 7th floor and had an amazing view of the ocean and pool. Advantage of the high level floor was that the balcony had sun all day until last thing in the evening.The hotel area was spotless and clean, fresh towels available at the pool everyday, although we didn't make much use of the pool what with having the ocean a stone's throw away from the hotel. The hotel was also in a great location, 2 minutes from the local stores and eating places and restaurant looked good. Staff were also very helpful in the hotel and always happy to answer any questions that we had and on one particular occasion about the history of the Princess Kaiulani’s father as he was Scottish.Used the tour operator that was in the hotel and would recommend this, good value for money. Local bus service very good and for $2.50 you can see most of the island.

We recently stayed 4 nights here and were pleased. Our room faced west with mountain view and were pretty outdated. Did not feel like a Sheraton quality, but we did get a good rate. They also were nice at check-in and found us a room right away. The parking was easy and convenient and included in the $13/day resort fee. This also included 2 water bottles, which was convenient. There was a small fridge in room where we kept other juices, beers, etc. Free wi-fi in room also included in resort fee. The Kaiulani's location is fantastic -- right in the heart of Waikiki and a close walk to everything. The pool area was nice and seemed to get quite a bit of sun, unlike some properties, where the pools end up in the shade half the time. Pleasantly surprised with this stay, but don't get too excited about the tired rooms, though the hotel maids are thorough and good about replacing towels. We had an issue with water leaking out of the shower onto the bathroom floor, so just used towels to clean up. Not a huge deal.

My daughter and I arrived around 1:30pm and they had a room available for us, but it only had one king size bed, which we had asked for two double beds. The front desk check and found that they could move us the next day, and not to unpack, and in the morning let them know when they could move us. We let them know we were going to adventure out for the day and when we came back our new keys were waiting at the front desk and the room had our luggage waiting for us. The room was always clean, the view was amazing, the employees were always friendly, and I highly recommend the Splash Bar, the food and drinks were great and one of the employees named Angie was the best server we ever had.

My husband and I travelled with another family couple to Oahu for a couples getaway. We all stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel. This hotel has a great location on Waikiki, across from the Ala Moana Surfrider and 1 block from Waikiki beach. The location is great as the International Marketplace is a few stores down the street and the hotel itself is surrounded by stores. We had a partial ocean view balcony room that oversaw the pool below. At night you can hear tropical music playing below from the hotel's restaurant by the pool and the entertainment from the busy Waikiki strip and International Marketplace. It was really breezy during our stay so there was no need for A/C. The room was very compact and not the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. I felt they were a little outdated and should be replaced although they didnt disturb our sleep that much. The room decors along with the beddings and furniture are also outdated. They really need a new modern makeover or even fresh paint cuz the room felt as if you were more so in Motel 6 than a Sheraton hotel? The tv was ok, kinda blurry on some channels at times but we barely used it only to check the weather/news. Bathroom is very compact and no counter space at all, but room and bathroom was always clean thanks to housekeeping. Staff was always friendly upon check in and check out, had no problems. We all checked in early, our room wasnt ready and they even offered to have the Bellhop hold our luggages so we can have some lunch and come back. That was nice. The lobby was always very clean and beautiful. It really represented Princess Kaiulani well as her pretty paintings were displayed everywhere and I enjoyed looking/reading all the history the hotel had to offer. There's even a activities desk downstairs if anyone was interested in booking Luaus, Parasailing, jet ski, etc. Daily there would be local vendors in the lobby that sold unique gifts and crafts for purchase so that was interesting to me. We never went to the pool as we were on the beach everyday but the pool was pretty small. And the restaurant downstairs had a nice breakfast buffet although its a little overpriced so note: get the breakfast buffet to go its cheaper $10! haha Best things I liked about the hotel was they gave you beach towels and beach chairs to take with you to the beach so that was a big plus for us! Also i forget, but at certain times of the day the hotel had waiters that came to the beach at a certain location, and you can place drink orders with them. (although we never made it) And it was extremely helpful that we got two free Hawaiian water bottles to take with us to the beach everyday, so we hardly bought water bottles. Thanks (note:These perks are what you get for paying a daily $14 resort charge) The only thing I disliked about the hotel was using the hotel's Internet and printer in the lobby, although its was free to use for 15-20 mins? a day, you must pay attention that its only within a 24hrs period eventhough you did not use all the minutes they give you. Since I didnt know that I was charged and extra $5. And the only reason we ever used their computers was cuz our free wi-fi in our room was always way too slow. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and we love the location its at. We plan to return to this hotel on our next trip to Waikiki.

We stayed at the sheraton princess kaiulani for 10 nights. Pros... Location was perfect right across street from the beach in the middle of everything in wakiki. Staff was very friendly and accomadating. Computers in lobby a plus we printed our boarding passes before our departing flight, parking being included in $12.95/day fee as well as use of towels and 2 bottles of waters a day. Lots of activities in lobby at all times during the day. Cons... Pool closing at 7p.m, not hot tub, pigeons on tables in lobby while eating, Cons we stayed on the city side rooms were so run down, we had a refridgerator but no microwave, TV was tiny and had to be 15 yrs old, carpets had stains, vents was filled with dust/mold it looks like it hadn't been cleaned in years, curtains dirty and ripped, shower curtain was placed wrong so evertime we took a shower we were fighting with the shower curtain, housekeeping would knock very early before 8 to clean room. The price was right we got what we paid for but will be looking for a different hotel when we go back to wakiki.

Hotel is on the main drag in Honolulu, good location. Entrance is around the side, had to walk through pan handlers and worse to get it. Hotel looks like last renovation was during the Carter Administration. Smells funky when you walk in. Been sitting at the lounge, where we were told to sit... still no service.With so many other options do youseelf a favor, pick another one.

My boyfriend had never been to Hawaii and I have. I wanted to be right in the center of Waikiki so that we had a plenty of entertainment and didn't have to travel far. i thought it would be a good introduction for him. The hotel is SO CLOSE to the beach. Only a block away. The mall was a short walk and the Intl Market is right next to the hotel. Here was what was disappointing: the hotel and rooms are terribly outdated. There were stains in our carpet, the lights in the bathroom were florescent as well as outdated and small. I felt that it was was very cheap, if not cheap looking. Our room faced the garage but if we wanted a view, we'd have to pay an extra $50.00 per night. We were there for 7 nights. Not interested in that. We were hearing a swoosh sound at night and morning and would wake us up at night and finally concluded it was the elevators. This surprised us as we didn't feel like we were THAT close to them. The pool closed at 7:00pm which was a downer and there is no hot tub. The "nightlife entertainment" was silly at best. The hotel hired ukelele players singing Niel Diamond and John Denver songs in the lobby at night. The crowd was over 60 or full of families. What interest is this for young couples? The hotel had closed the pool at 5:00pm one evening, much to our disappointment, and hired elderly ladies dressed in neon colored bodysuits to do a small performance in the pool. It was very silly as it seems they were imitating dying swans dancing to instrumental music!!!! We'd rather have the pool to ourselves. The good things: they provide a service that allows you to take towels from the pool area to the beach and they come twice in the day to find you on the beach and give you fresh fruit and water. The buffet breakfast was fresh and plentiful. You can get a box and pay only $10.00 for takeaway. There were daily activities in the lobby like pineapple carving, making your own lais, jewelry and photography sellers and so on. This would be a great hotel for families and older folks who are interested in a place to sleep with attractions nearby not for a one of a kind experience, and definitely not for couples looking for a romantic getaway.

Me and my Husband stayed at Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 6 days. We were here celebrating our 5 yr anniversary and his birthday. Had a wonderful experience at this hotel! It was in a perfect location right next to the international market and right in the heart of waikiki. We were on the 9th floor in the main wing. Our room was a little small and the bathroom was a little out dated. Our room view was out looking the parking lot. Wasnt a very pleasant view. We called down to the front desk to see if we could have a room with a balcony. When we book our flight and hotel through expedia it showed that the standard room came with a balcony. Since it was both our first time in hawaii we didnt know what to expect. Having a balcony would have been nice but it wasnt that big of a deal. Kim at the front desk said it would cost us $40 a night just to upgrade so we didnt bother. We came to hawaii to go out and not stay in our hotel room. My husband and I would go down to the splash bar to get a few drinks during happy hour. It was really nice and relaxing. All the staff were friendly! We are already planning another trip to hawaii in dec for my birthday and will def consider staying at this hotel again.!

I recently stayed at this hotel and really enjoyed it. It is such good value for money, its in an excellent location and the staff were very friendly and willing to help with anything. I had a pool view room which was great, I loved sitting on the lanai at night listening to the music and I also had a pretty good view of the ocean which I didn't expect! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to others!

I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for seven nights. After reading all the reviews of this hotel I wasn't expecting much. I couldn't of been happier with hotel and their staff. Everyone was very nice and helpful with anything I asked. The room was nice and clean, it had a refrigerator, iron, balcony and the maid came everyday. The location can't be beat, you are right in the middle of everything, the beach, restaurants, shopping and nightlife. I went on several excursions and they picked me up at the hotel or across the street. The shuttle to the airport was only $9.00 and left every half hour. Parking was included in the resort fee as was Internet access in my room. I never ate at the hotel because it is way to expensive, but Dukes is practically right across the street. I plan to go back with my wife and another couple, I am going to stay at this hotel again without a doubt..

I will never stay at this hotel again. I've been staying here since I was a little kid, but haven't been for the past 4 years. Wow, how it has changed in 4 years. Besides the 144 sq ft of a box they put us in, the service is horrible. The people at this hotel treated us like [...] the whole time we stayed here. We had a waitress who was extremely rude who told us they have a 1 drink minimum to sit in the bar area. 1 drink minimum?!?! Maybe it was the way we looked? This is a 2 star hotel at best, who charges a minimum drink order just to sit in the bar/lounge area. Ridiculous! Then, on our last night here, we woke up several times to the drunk guy in the next room pounding and kicking the walls and door. Security was called a couple times and they did come up, but it didn't really help. Then when we tried to get a late checkout because drunko next door kept us up all night, they have no record of it and are only willing to extend it 1 hour. I am very upset with the service we've received here and how this place has gone downhill. It needs a major upgrade and renovation, which probably hasn't been done since the Reagan administration. The only thing it really has going is the central location. Overall? If you like second class treatment, the late 80's non intentional nostalgic look of a hotel, a cheap hotel with a good location across from the beach then this is it. Just don't eat at the restaurant or get anything but a beer from the bar. Of the over 20 restaurants we ate at in Waikiki on our trip, this was the only one that had bland food and watered down drinks. Take my advice, check out the other hotels in the area with similar pricing.

Well the final leg of the trip and in Honolulu for 6 nights. Mid morning flight from Maui to Oahu & wow shock horror - allowed to check in at 12.20 p.m. - top marks Sheraton !!! - It is a big hotel so I guess there is always rooms available.Allocated room on the 7th floor in the main building, (not the newer tower) with pool view & partial ocean view, not bad really for $125 a night in Waikiki beach. Okay sized room, a tad dated & worm but well looked after & very clean. Bed was very comfortable as Sheraton beds normally are. Blackout blinds so no light at 6 a.m. - good marksBathroom was a bit old but very clean & useable. Plenty of towels & soaps. Fridge in room & coffee makers with 2 lots of coffee which was replaced every day. Resort fee was a steal at $12, which included free parking for the duration in the multistorey car park next to the hotel ( a relief really not to be driving around hunting for a space) 2 x 500 ml bottles of water, replaced every day without fail & 20 minutes of internet time on the computers in the lobby. Overall very good value. There was also a fitness room if you wanted to use it, it seemed ok. Maid service in the morning tended to start at 9 so Do not disturb Sign night before if you are a slow riser. Did not have breakfast at the hotel as it was not included in rate but there are lots of ABC stores & coffee shops nearby. The location of the hotel is fab, opposite The White Lady Sheraton & very near to all the shops & restaurants. Ideal. Pool area was fine, a little busy sometimes & it is very near the street but acceptable. Pool towels were large & great for the beach.Would recommend to stay again. Beware at night of the parallel street - Kuhio Avenue, it is a bit colorful, lots of ladies of the night wandering around, a bit imitidiating.Ate at CheeseCake Factory & California Pizza Kitchen twice - (please come to the UK) and also at Room Without a Key - okay if you like Asian style also ate at Lulus - good bar area in open are surroundings !!! Loved Teddies Bigger Burgers too..........

We stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of our 2 week Hawaii vacation. To start things seemed to go well, porters and desk staff were friendly and the room was pretty reasonable. Sadly from there on in the service slipped, staff service was mixed, nothing major but a number of the staff didn't seem bothered and therefore failed to provide a friendly, helpful service. We also found that the free wifi service didn't seem to make up to the 3rd floor.. we also stood for 5 minutes waiting to see if we could get served at the bar before giving up. At the time there were 3 people at the bar.. with us and 1 other person waiting to get served. The nail in the coffin was the price paid for the breakfast and the quality of the food. It was frankly pretty shabby and to put in context we paid less for 2 main meals, 2 drinks and a desert at the Cheesecake factory over the road than for the breakfast!

It is difficult to put into words how dated, tattered and musty this hotel is. I am a Starwoods member, and frankly, it was a huge let down to stay here after stays at other properties. My partner and I are staying here tonight -- thankfully for only one night -- as we have a flight out in the morning. This entire hotel needs to be torn down -- which in fact is going to happen in 2013. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those sensitive to noise, mold or mildew. We booked a "deluxe ocean view" room initially, only to find that it was a small, sad room with a very small bathroom. We could live with that, but soon we realized that the walls were paper thin and we could hear singing and conversations in the adjoining room, which was a deal-breaker. Down we went to stand in line again and ask for a change of room, which the front desk manager was NOT happy to accommodate. He finally gave us a key to a room higher up on the 25th floor, assuring us that did not have any adjoining room and that it also had an ocean view. But when we moved all our luggage up to the new room,we discovered it had no ocean view whatsoever, and furthermore it also had an adjoining room. Down we went again, had to wait once again in an even larger line, and only to hear that the front desk manager did not have anything else to offer, defending the move as having "Iocean view status" -- whatever that meant!. I told him there was no ocean view which I had paid extra for -- but he became mute and could not offer anything else, at which point a hotel guest service manager came out. She said she was so sorry and was upgrading us to the largest suite in the hotel, but we had to wait until after 8 to have access. When we did finally get into the suite, we found to be huge, basically a full apartment, but riddled with mold and mildew, and very dated. It did have a very large ocean view -- but this was somehow unappealing as the lanai in front must have leaked water at some point into the living room, as it reeked of mildew so strongly that I could hardly breathe. As I have severe mold allergies, my eyes started burning, but as it is late at night, I think we will be forced to simply o open every door and window to get air in to combat the mold situation as best as we can. Very upsetting, and a health issue -- but I have given up trying to secure a better room for the night. Cannot wait to leave!

First I just want to add that I stayed same time as the guy below my review (spam jam) and yes, the pigeons attacked my breakfast too. I don't know if this is usual, but it pissed me off. I was already in a bad mood since the breakfast was all nasty to begin with, plus the "pastries" were 7-11 donuts. And to top it off, I couldn't even go in line to get an omelet because nobody gave me a "plate cover" so that would mean risking my $25 already-nasty buffet to be scavenged at again.I lived in Honolulu before and been through the hotel a few times so I chose it because of:1) Great location in Waikiki2) Pretty cheap ($115/night)3) Resort "feel" despite not being beachfront4) Free Wifi (included in resort fee)Complaints: 1) Parking-I called to inquire for guests since I read online it was included in the service fee and the woman told me rudely "you pay $25/day in the parking lot on your way out". Upon checking-in I find out it's included. I almost parked 10 minutes away and drag my suitcase to save on that damn parking!2)Concierge clearly wasn't interested in her job3) buffet breakfast- I was in a rush and had no choice but if you got time just cross to Duke's for a $14 buffet which is delicious and oceanfront4) We requested a courtesy room since our flight was late at night and she offered a "late check-out" till noon. Thanks. 5) We were on our fake honeymoon and they didn't even offer an upgrade!!(Sheraton-don't bother making a note in my file I'm not attempting that trick again...)Positives: 1) Parking included in mandatory resort fee2) They lent us an umbrella during the 4 hr monsoon3) Always music playing by pool so it creates a nice entrance/exit to Kalakaua4) Housekeeping did a great job, thanks Bella

I only had a very brief stay at this hotel. I arrived late and fell into a comfy bed.The room was very nice and quiet, despite Spam Jam taking place nearby.The following morning we went to breakfast and wondered why the waitress had left 2 food covers on our table. When we asked her to remove them she said "Oh they're for the pigeons"The pigeons?? What did she mean. We soon found out. The restaurant was by the pool and was absolutely crawling with pigeons. As soon as a guest moved from their table they descended, ripping apart the scraps. This was a bit of a problem as it was a buffet breakfast and we had to get up. We went to get food in shifts, the other person defending our table from the flying vermin. Even if we had used the food covers I wouldn't be happy with the pigeons walking all over the tables and potentially peeing and pooing.Periodically a staff member would come out and bang banana leaves on the tables to scare them away, or throw a bucket of ice at them. This worked - for a couple of minutes and then they returned.I commented to the waitress that they were a problem and she told me "Yes, we feed them in the morning so they really shouldn't come back"Hmmmmm, to me if you feed a scavenger that just means they know where to get food. I don't think they are so discerning to think they have been fed today and won't return until tomorrow!!

I spent 10 days at this hotel. I found my High Oceanview room excellent. The view was wonderful (facing Diamond Head and the ocean). The room was spotless with the standard furnishings, wonderful quiet A.C. and a lovely welcoming fruit basket delivered by a nice staff member. The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful. Every other day I'd planned a tour and the front entry man made sure he watched for my tour group / pick-up shuttle. He was awesome. When you arrive, they tag your bags with your room number and they deliver them so you don't have to juggle them during your check-in which was fast and easy. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the main street and beach. There is an abundance of cafe's, snack bars, fast food places and a ABC variety store right across the street. The only negative's I experienced was the traffic flow inside the hotel and the very pricy buffet meals. They have a main aisle to the elevators (4) but you are "herded" into a narrow walk-through due to some of the buffet food tables being on both sides and local artisians with display tables in the same area. Makes it very crowded and frustrating to get through. The buffet meals are costly ($65+ per person for dinner) but the foods offered are really top-notch. It was way out of my price range so I ate out. A really neat thing they offer is an option to not have housekeeping for up to 2 days in a row. On the days I was out on tours, I had housekeeping but not on the days I was in the hotel. Each time I declined, I received a $5 certificate you can use in any place in the hotel. I saved mine and splurged on a room service breakfast on my last day. I understand the hotel was to be closed for reno's shortly after my stay. I hope it has re-opened as it's truly a good value.

this hotel is directly across the street from the beach. It is in the center of the strip. Skip the buffet restaurant to expensive. However for breakfast you can take a styrofoam to go container for $10.00 and fill it up. My family and I chose Denny's around the corner. Don't worry if you forgot anything an ABC store (similair to a Walgreens) is next door. the rooms are fine beds comfy not to big all rooms I beleive have a terrace. Non-smoking hotel. Clean hotel and my children got to feed and pet the fish. The had pinapple cutting demos in which they hand out slices. However the bartender and waitreses will always give you some with your order. My only problem was the pool started at 3 feet but more like four feet, most kids were stuck on the steps. Happy hour by the pool is from 3:30-5:30 1/2 priced drinks and $5.00 yummy appetizers. Staff was very nice rooms were comfy. But the location is the best either way you walk there is a lot to do. A few doors down is the international market. None of the Hotels in Wiakiki are that nice, none of them have pools that are really spectacluar.(except the Sheraton on the beach) which you are not allowed to use. This sheraton hotel is nice, clean and in one of the best locations. Meanwhile in Hawaii do the side trips they do take most of the day. Pearl Harbor was great they have built it up they now have an airplane museum and a submarine and battleship. Polynesian Culture center long day but very good and the submarine ride. We had a lot of fun in Hawaii

The hotel met our expectations. We knew it was in a fantastic location however it is not one of the nicest rooms we've stayed in. It is OK and had a lot to offer for the price. We would stay here again! The kids loved it. The resort fee includes good values such as free parking, daily use of beach chairs, free internet etc . . .
We were on the 14th floor overlooking the pool..wonderful wonderful view of the ocean..The elevators are noisy..but we had a wonderful time and I know we will be back..Thank u for a wonderful stay

Our staycation here was wonderful, my husband and I was on our anniversary with our children and it was great.... Considering payin $120/night for a standard rm it was perfect the view was great especially at night when the lights are on and the entertainment is playing "Nice". And the best part was when we decided to go for a stroll all we had to do was pass the pool and the strip was there. The $10 takeout breakfast was so "ONO" so worth it. I highly recommended this hotel and plan on staying there again on my next staycation.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. One of our friends that we were traveling with recommended this hotel as he had stayed there before. Be had booked a flight and hotel package. The package listed the room as a "Standard Room" which we were okay with since we really didn't plan on spending much time in the room. When we got there we were actually dismayed. We were told our rooms were in the Kaiulani wing. We asked if that was the main tower and were told no. We asked if we could move the main tower and were told no as they didn't have any rooms available. We decided to give the room a try. When we walked in the room I was shocked and my partner was more so. I now knew what all the reveiws were talking about. This room was in no way a Sheraton "Standard". The bed itself was surprisingly nice. However, it was the bathroom that really turned us off. The chrome on the legs of the sink were chipping, there were yellowing stains on the tub, the mat was peeling up, hard water stains covered the shower head, the floor tile was cracking due to age. There was no way we could be comfortable there for 6 nights! I do have to say it was clean, but it was run down and not taken care of at all. I have stayed in Travel Motels on the highway in better shape then that room. We went back to the front desk and talked to the manager and told them our complaint. They were gracious about it, but they were not able to accomodate us that night, but were able to move us the next night. An inconvenience, but worth it. They moved our luggage while we were out during the day and gave us new rooms. They considered this an upgrade (and didn't charge us), which from the room we were at before, it was like we walked into a luxury room. But the truth is, it was more along the lines of what a Sheraton "Standard" room should be. The view was amazing from the new room. The bathroom while still outdated, was much nicer. When we return to Hawaii we will stay somewhere else as we could most likely get a nicer place for the same amount or slightly more.

The Sheraton has been announcing renovations and changes to its hotels, and some things did improve, but it is still a decent place at best. It has a good location in Waikiki, assuming you do want to stay in this very touristy area. The rooms are small, somewhat outdated, with a good balcony that does not have a very good view as you are one block back from the beach. The beds are small but actually very good. The worst problem for me was the pool hours, closing usually at 7 PM, which is too early and makes it quite inconvenient. They also have a concierge that is not very helpful, plus a tour reservations desk that is impossible to use as the lines are very long and service very slow. Again, decent place, but plenty of better options in the nearby area.

We were treated exceptionally by the staff here. Especially by one of the front desk men, Bobby. He made our stay at the Princess Kaiulani a very memorable one. Bobby was great at directing us towards local restaurants and shopping areas. He treated us as very special guests and we can't wait to see him again on our next visit. We live in Maui and went to Oahu for a few days to celebrate a special birthday. I am very pleased with our stay at this hotel.
Great staff and location and nice feel to pool area-- but room unbelievably tiny and tatty for a hotel bearing Sheraton brand

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel, my family and I had an Ocean View on the 10th floor in the Princess tower. The Atmosphere was great but it could use a referb.Pros:Nice poolNice bar areaFriendly StaffNice view and BalconyGreat Location (2 min walk to the beach)In the mornings people would sell beautiful Hawaiian things in the lobby At night they would play Hawaiian music (loved it!)Cons:The rooms were a little dated (Not much of a problem)Breakfast wasn't very cheap (Ate at Denny's)No Hot TubDespite the cons I really recommend going to this hotel! It really had the Hawaiian spirit!

I just got back from my one year wedding anniversary with my husband. We went for a week, and I am not going to lie- when i was reading some of the reviews before we left I was a little timid as to how this trip and this hotel was going to come about. That being said- everything was perfect from the customer service to the bartender at the pool and the towel service guy! They even gave us a free bottle of champagne because it was our 1 year! Everyone was vey friendly and helped us out in every way. This hotel is in a perfect location as well, right in the middle of everything. Alot of people say that it is reallly loud at this hotel, our room was on the 18th floor with a pool view and a high ocean view and we could see the street as well, i was never woken up by loud noises or anything. My husband and LOVE wakiki beach and we will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, as a matter of fact we are already planning a new trip! Keep in mind that this isnt the trendiest or the luxorious of all the hotels on wakiki but for the price that we paid it was perfect! Thanks to everyone that made our stay fantastic! MAHALO!

We stayed at the hotel for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean view room on the 10th floor. Our Lanai also overlooked the pool area, it was nice to be able to watch the evening entertainment from it.Yes as others have previously said the decor in the rooms and the bathroom could do with a makeover. This did not impact on our stay what so ever though. The pool area was lovely and I really liked the open feel to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 12pm and as our room was available we were able to get checked in right away. This was most welcome as we were on the 2nd day of a long journey from the UK to Hawaii.The grounds of the hotel are pretty. The hotel is centrally located for everyrhing. The walk to the beach took about 3 minutes.We ate snacks on the terrace by the pool and had a few beverages during happy hour. Very good quality food. Wine was $4 a glass during happy hour.Travelling with kids it was useful to have a coin op laundry in the basement.I could not find any fault with this hotel and would happily recommend it to other travellers.

I wish it was little less expensive. This is probably my most expensive stay but the ambience, cleanliness, facilities were nothing remarkable. No one can do anything about it I guess as Hawaii I expensive. Pros: walking distance from beachCons: expensive, not so classy.

The pros:Room was clean (a bit dated, as others have noted, but how much time are you spending in your hotel room in Hawaii?)Beds were really comfortableThe location, if you want Waikiki in all its glory, can't be beatThe cons:Noise was the big one for me. They had some kind of show/singing most evenings down by the pool. If your room faces this side, you can hear it loud and clear---no investment in soundproof glass or anything. In addition, some of the street dancers like to hang out right outside the hotel, so you can hear their music loud and clear also. This combo made the balcony significantly less pleasant for me at night.Internet---I got it for free through my conference deal, but they were charging others outrageous rates.All in all, I was happy with everything given the price I paid (a block rate), but will opt for something a bit more subdued next time.

This hotel is wonderful! The lobby is beautiful and welcoming with activities almost always going on. The pool is beautiful and the outdoor restaurant is open and welcoming with great food and entertainment. If you aren't a big breakfast eater, I recommend getting the breakfast to go for $10. You can fill up a to go box (at the buffet) and it is so worth it! We had a room with deluxe ocean view on the 10th floor in the Princess tower. The beds were sooo comfortable and clean. The lanai was a good size and we had a great view! I highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again when I go back!!

Our first visit was terrific we had an end unit room I believe it was on 10th Flr. great view of a portion of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head from our lanai. Room was nice clean and quiet.This trip I tried to get the same room but it was not available so we settled on a room centrally located on the 9th Flr. which also had a decent view of the ocean, was clean but not quiet . Our neighbors were younger folk who as it it turned out were a little forgetful and left there alarm set to ring at very odd hours and then have wake calls very early in the mornings all of which could be clearly heard in our room not to mention the late night conversations. I guess our headboards must have been adjacent to theirs and the walls paper thin. The beds them selves were quite comfortable.Please do not get me wrong I still believe this is a lovely Hotel and a good value, we just had some bad luck, that being said the good value as I understand it is going to be short lived as we were told by employees that the Princess is slated to be demolished in 2013 and replaced with a Hotel/Time Share. A shame for sure, hopefully they retain the name for the future building.

Hotel was definitely dated and the bathroom very much needed an update. However, considering just how much time is spent in the room it was just fine. Bed was comfortable, pleanty of storage space and the fridge was nice to keep cold drinks available. Balcony is small but adequate. Location is great, very central. Beach across the street, international market place next door, restaurants, bars, shops all within five to 10 minute liesurely walk. Activities available daily in the lobby, learn to hula, cut up at pineapple, etc. Private vendors display their wares just off pool area daily. Just down the street on Kalakua Ave, is a show that I would highly recommend for everyone to see. The Magic of Polynesia is a little pricy but you won't regret spending the money. Best dinner theater I have been to in a while. The illusionist is absolutely amazing.

I was traveling alone, and after having read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I just wrote to the hotel directly and asked for a female-friendly room and not to be stuck in some dingy corridor. Randi wrote to me many times assuring me of their service, sent chocolates as a welcome, and checked-in on email a couple of times to make sure I was doing ok. Yes, the hotel is old, but the location couldn't be better -- close to the beach and great shopping too. I loved my four nights at this hotel! Maybe my longtime SPG membership helped, but they really made me feel welcome.

I stayed for 9 nights with a 15 and 11 year old. We had a view of a parking lot which was not bad at all. The room was a perfect size for the 4 people that went. I loved the pool and the entertainment. The staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk people helped me find a place to order pizza from :). the fitness center was nice. the beds were nice. It was clean. The only thing I didnt like was at night I wanted to watch the entertainment from a table, but they would not let me unless I ordered a drink. But I loved the Kona coffee in the morning.
You can find almost anything close to this hotel. This hotel is very average, but I think it's nice to be average for most of time you end up in a bad hotel...

Stayed here last month with my son & room was decent with a view of the pool - which is a bit cold. I requested 2 beds but when checking in only a king was available so a rollaway was sent up-disappointing! Room was outdated but for the price paid was OK. Then I booked a last minute package for my husband for the following week for 5 nights. The room we were placed in was miniscual next to the elevator with a view of the parking structure. I was so embarressed when picking my husband up to bring him to this room-we hardly fit in this bed, the tv was so small-everything was awful. I begged the desk clerk for another room but was told for $40 the following night I could upgrade. so I paid the $160 for the 4 remaining nights & used up all my points. The package purchased was not cheap & I can't believe the room we were put in-was totally unfair as we always stay in Starwood resorts. I would never recommend the Sheraton Kailani to anyone.

We are here right now 3/28-4/7/2011 staying in room 1031 a corner room in the princess wing. Room is just the right size for the 2 of us. No lanai but a partial view of diamondhead. For the price you cannot beat this place. Clean comfortable room with all the amenities. People who write bad reviews must stay at 5 star hotels because this place is awesome. You cannot get closer to the action of Waikiki. A walk across the street to the beach and right next door to the international marketplace. No problems with the resort fee which includes self parking. 2 bottles of water a day and in room wireless internet. Staff very friendly and helpful. Water and fruit service at the beach 2 times a day and they will even let you borrow towels and chairs to take. Yes you can hear traffic from the street but we just closed the windows and all was good. For anyone considering this place do not hesitate it has everthing you need for a great price. Thank You Princess Kaiulani for a wonderful vacation

My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani Hotel in Honolulu last spring. We stayed nine days and nights as it was out tenth wedding anniversary. We found the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel to be worth every penny. It was near the beach, clean, comfortable and near the main part of Waikiki Beach. There is also an ABC Store just across the street and are plenty of places close by where one can have a romantic breakfast or late night meal. We also liked the fact that it has a work out facility that is better than most found in hotels and stands next door to the International Market Place. At the IMP, we bought probably half or more of our souvenirs. Excellent place to go for gifts or for that aloha shirt or two or 25 you want to take home. The hotel also has a pool that is lots of fun, where they give you free towels and where you can sun yourself and read, free from sand and the walk to the beach. My wife and I plan to stay here again some day. The only downer was that we originally were near the elevators in a small room, so I would advise talking with the hotel before you go to make sure you are not getting that room. Otherwise, you will find it hard to sleep as the elevators are noisy and unrelenting. We went to the front desk and spend $30 a night to upgrade, but it was worth it. The room we ended up with overlooked the pool and had a great view from about six stories up. The nightly entertainment was also good, for the people who went to the open air lounge area. Very nice indeed.

I am a regular Sheraton customer. I appreciate the high quality of service and standards typically found at their hotels. My stay at the Princess Kaiulani was a disappointment. In fact, I checked out after one night and moved to a nearby hotel and was much happier. First, I will start with the positives. All of the employees were friendly and helpful. For example, when I requested a quiet room, they quickly moved me away from the International Market. The hotel is clean and only a short walk from the beach. I did not eat at the Sheraton, so I cannot comment on the restaurants.That being said, the hotel is in need of a major renovation. It feels like a large apartment building constructed in the 1960s. My room felt sparse and unwelcoming. Even the bed wasn't as comfortable as I'm used to at a Sheraton. One of my favorite hotels is the Sheraton at Poipu Beach on Kauai, which was also built a long time ago but which has be redone and now feels quite luxurious. The Sheraton Kauilani still feels dated and low end. The pool is quite small and unattractive--yet they charge a $12/day resort fee to use it and use hotel towels. You can find similar hotels nearby for more reasonable rates--and even nicer hotels for lower rates--I did and was much happier after making the move. Not a bad hotel, but not worth the price.

Endless ukulele music and steel drum music into the night, sirens and all kinds of other racket from Kalakaua Blvd. I was on the 25th floor, and it sounds like I'm on the 3rd floor. Thank goodness I was horribly jetlagged and armed with allergy pills. Room is o-kay, old like other reviewers say. When a cheese popcorn kernel from a previous patron popped out from behind the desk, the cleaning staff didn't touch it but cleaned out the trash cans. Maybe they thought I would eat it?

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is a wonderful hotel. I couldn't have picked a better hotel. My wife and I arrived on March 28th to a wonderful Aloha Greeting by the bellman. The check-in process was quick and smooth by a smiling employee that also provided helpful information on directions to Walmart. We requested and received the room type and floor that we wanted. The hotel is very clean. Our room was very clean and cozy and the bed is soft and comfortable. The pool is nice and relaxing, just wished it stayed open later. The night time entertainment is wonderful but wished they played more Hawaiian music and songs, The hotel staff is helpful and has been wonderful at the few request we have asked. The location is perfect as your in the middle of everything and your close to everything which saves you time when getting out and about. The beach is directly across the street from the hotel and your less than 5 minutes before your in the water swimming. The restaurant is nice with a variety of foods. The only bad thing I can say is that I hate to leave the Sheraton Princess on April 7th to go home. To all the staff at the Sheraton I want to Thank-You for making our trip wonderful.

hotel was great ! the location was perfect. hotel right next to international market and near all the shops! pool was nice and relaxing. enjoyed the outdoor dining with nightley entertainment. room was great and view was beautiful!
