My husband and I enjoyed our stay here. The room was clean & comfortable. The location is great. It's a short walk to the beach. There are many shops and restaurants close to the hotel. We did not rent a car, but there are a couple trolley stops nearby. The trolley is cheaper than a taxi & a fun way to see the city. If you need a taxi, there are usually a couple in front of the hotel all the time.

Our family just returned from a one week stay at The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. We reserved two adjoining rooms which were both available when we arrived at 9 PM. If you have 2 children and need the space to get along, may I advise adjoining rooms!Before travelling to Honolulu I reasearched several hotels and it always came down to, price , location , and hotel services.This hotel is in one block from Waikiki beach a 3 min walking trip . Just around the corner to your right , from the hotel pool is The International Market . The buffets at the hotel are good if you can eat alot. My kids don't eat that much, but my wife and I had great breakfasts and our dinner buffets of steaks and crab legs were more than fullfilling.There were no noise issues. The pool was clean.Mention goes out to Kim in the restaurant for great service , Calvin and all the Bellmen , Rosa and the housekeeping team.

As part of two couples, we booked online, not knowing what really to expect. Our rooms were exactly as presented on their online site! We were shocked at how large our room was and we were lucky to have an ajoining room to our friends! We faced the pool on the 3rd floor, and enjoyed the entertainment every night! This was all of ours first time in Hawaii and we did not know what to expect in terms of location! It was perfect, no more than a 2 minute walk to the beach, and surrounded by shops, international market, restaurants, and lively street entertainers...which were fun! We will definetley be going back to Honolulu, and Princess Kaiulani! It was super clean, bright, and no complaints about service. Everything they advertised... they did, from beach service, bell service, activities center, internet and even a courtesy room to use on our last day of trip, so we could shower and clean up before flying out on a late flight! Thank you Princess Kaiulani everything was superb even throughout the Tsunami scare...your staff was professional competent and kept us at ease!!!

We stayed for one night here before my boyfriend's parent's timeshare opened, and were just looking for a quick place in Waikiki to see the sunset and relax. The hotel itself is a bit aged, although it was fairly clean -- the room was located right by the elevator, which isn't a good idea - we heard it ALL night! If you stay here, make sure to not be located anywhere near the elevator. The bed was comfortable enough, and the sheets were nice and clean. We were supposed to be let into our room early, but weren't allowed to check in until after 4pm. Hmmm....good cheap place for one night in transit, but don't expect too much!

I found this hotel the best! a girlfirend and I spent a week there and there wasn't anything about it we did not enjoy, the room was extremely clean, beds soft, pillows and towels abundantly provided. Room faced Diamond Head and low enough that we could here the nightly Hawaiian music from the pool are.......we Loved it! Room service was wonderful, "Wing" delivered meals promptly and the such flair and service, we loved him! My friend still talks of him...... and I've talked another co-worker into accompanying me again this year, I can hardly wait! Aloha!

My husband and I booked a last minute "Spring Break" Trip to Hawaii and since the plane tickets were not cheap, it seemed the Princess Kaiulani was the best bang for the buck. It was! Although not on the beach, we were only steps away from Waikiki. The room was very clean and there was a refrigerator, which was fantastic for the two of us (we could buy milk and have cereal for breakfast). Our balcony offered a view of Waikiki and the mountains and was a great place to spend out evenings. You are right across the street from both the Pink and White Lady, which both have beach-side bars where we spent our nights. We also rented a car, and with the $12 resort fee, we were able to park for less than half the price of any other hotel in Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again! However, I would recommend bringing earplugs as it is on a busy street and the street performers do make it hard to sleep without them.

The location was wonderful, close to everything. The bed, sheet and pillows were nice, and the room was quiet. The bath room and shower were very small. The biggest problem was the internet in the room I had you could only get on the internet early in the morning and it was slow. Even after talking to the help desk it would still just kick me off in the evenings. It did work a little better in the lobby. The staff were friendly and helpful but didn't always know the answers to questions.

Across the street from Waikiki beach. They provide towels and beach chairs and deliver water and fruit to you between 10 am - 2pm. Nice pool and entertainment at night. Very pleasant staff even though they took a strike authorization vote while there. All shopping just outside the hotel and lots of good restaurants close. We were in the tower on 23rd floor with partial ocean view. Nice view but on the east side it is very noisy as the buildings act as a funnel for all the street noise. Better with balcony doors closed. They have a $12.50 extra resort charge daily that gives you the beach service, daily free long distance calls, Internet , 2 bottles of water per day. The Internet is not wireless so was useless for my IPad. apple have a store just down the street so you can use their free wireless there.Spent 8 nights here and loved this location - would return here for sureRbattis March 2011

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for 4 nights in February and was a little disappointed as our expectations did not meet. This is a much older hotel comparing to the rest of the Sheraton hotels. We did not even bother to turn on the ancient TV in our room, and had to keep the balcony door open for a couple nights to avoid the extremely noisy and old AC. When we first arrive, we asked the hotel staff for recommendations on restaurants in walking distant and was suggested to the more expensive places that we thought was not worth recommended. During our 5 days stay, we paid $15 each day for resort fees, and the housekeeper forgot to provide us the 2 bottle of water as promised twice. Since we did not rent a car, we did not use the parking permit at all (which also included in the resort fees) in the first 4 days. However, the hotel made us paid extra for parking our two mopeds we rented for one day at the tiny little spot with at least 5 more mopeds/ motocycles, and it was in fact just the extra space for handicaped parking. I was complaining to the front desk but was promtly said the manager would not waive the parking fees. We checked out the buffet at the hotel and not recommended it. The hotel does not provide airport shuttle which I am not so sure if it was a common thing among Waikiki hotels.On a positive note, the room was spacious and clean and has a nice balcony where you can people watching and enjoying the view from up high. The hotel provides some live entertainment by the pool at night and beach services for free for hotel guests although we did not take advantage of these offers. The location was great - just one block from the beach and all the fun shops in Waikiki. We also loved the food court inside the International Market Place right next to the hotel, where you can find good food at great prices.Overall, I feel like with the price we paid, we should have had a much better experience. I would recommend to look for different hotels in the same area which is what we will do when planning for our next trip.

We booked a "High end Ocean view room"-they gave us a regular room, that you had to stretch your neck around the patio to see the ocean, it was on the 22nd floor,(high end are 25 and higher as stated by their website) -it had coffee stains on the walls, red dotted stains on the floor and cigarette stains on the table(its supposed to be non-smoking) and it smelt- I called the front desk-... waited "on hold" for 15mins finnally someone came back I said we paid for a nice room this is disgusting and its our 10 year anniversary as well- after another 10 mins on hold they moved us to the 28th floor and what looked like the room we booked. People at the hotel were not friendly at all. Pool was nice although we were told we couldnt move our chairs to face the sun. and the Gym was really nice probably the best part of the hotel, when we checked out they wouldnt give us our starwood points because we booked through a third party.It is an old hotel that needs a good clean or updating. The buffet is also WAY over priced at 21$ PP for breakfast?! and 41$ PP for dinner-no thanks-itsstill just a buffet!

We had been travelling all over NZ and Fiji and ended our honeymoon in Hawaii. We stayed at SPK and it was great! When we checked in they said we didn't get a room with a balcony but we weren't too concerned....we didn't come to hawaii to see it from our window. But the room was lovely! Very clean and the king size bed was fabulous! We had a little bar fridge too. I had mentioned prior to coming that we were on our honeymoon and there was a chilled bottle of champange and glasses waiting in our room. We were able to check in early and check out late. There was a "Resort Charge" ($12 US)on top of the room rate ($99 US)but that was not a big deal, we got free wifi in the room, parking and complimentary non-alcoholic cocktails. Hawaii is a fairly expensive place to visit so a room at the Sheraton for just over $100/night was pretty good. At the pool you can get beach towels, and beach chairs to take to the beach which is a short walk across the road.

I have to say that I was very sceptical going into this, because of some reviews that I had read on this website. The minute that I got there, my mind was set at ease. We stayed on the second floor with a pool view. The room was very clean, (cleaned daily) thankyou Nely and one other lady that I didnt get her name. The beds were comfy and the room was very quiet! We stayed a week at this hotel and both kids said they would rather go back here than go to Disneyland! There was plenty to see and do right there in the lobby! Uncle Nate helped us make beautiful lei's, we missed the hula lessons but the pineapple carving demonstration was refreshing in the middle of a hot day, not to mention the local artists showing their talents off. Great souveniers made right in front of you. We loved that the location of this hotel was right in the middle of everything and a one minute walk to the beach. They have beach chairs to take down to the beach and towels so that you dont have to pack up sandy wet towels. Everyone that we came in contact with was very helpful. Especially during an unfortunate tsunami alert. Staff helped put us at ease, when we thought the worste! For the price that you pay for this hotel it is without a doubt the best place to stay in Waikiki. There is a 13$ resort fee per day but it included free parking for our rental car, as well as 60 minutes of free long distance calling per day! That came in very handy to call family that was worried about the tsunami. Also, because our flight home left late at night we could store our luggage in a secure room and we also used a hospitality room to shower and change before our flight. I couldnt have asked for a better place to stay!

After reading some reviews, I was a little worried what we would find. What we found was great, prompt service, very clean rooms, excellent staff from entering the hotel to leaving. Yes, the hotel rooms are a little tired, but clean, are you there to sit in your room? Had a problem with bathroom, maintenance was very prompt and moving to another room of same view was not a problem. Free internet and free safes in the room, which they just started, 2 bottles of water every day, so the resort fee isn't out of line. Great beds!

I have to say that this is a mixed review of Sheraton Princess Kaiulani hotel.Service: There is no valet parking. Actually there isn't any bell desk either. So don't expect anybody to help you with the bags or park your car for you. You can park yourself at the parking garage in the back of the hotel. Internet + Parking is approximately 20 bucks a day. So in terms of service I have to say that there is none.The location of this hotel can't be beat. Right across you have the Moana Surfrider and Hyatt Waikiki is next door. Both of these neighbors would charge significantly more money than Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. So if you like to be centrally located but not paying top bucks, this is the hotel for you.The room...what can I say. It is extremely, extremely small. We got the top floor ocean view room which is the most expensive room they have, and we couldn't walk in the room after we put all our luggages. It really was ridiculously small. I live in New York City so I am very used to small room and trust me, the rooms here are EXTREMELY small. It is pretty clean and the maintenance does a good job at keeping things clean in this hotel.The hotel can use more of a facelift. It feels a little bit run-down. The gym is nice it has all the essentials that you will need.Basically if you do not like paying too much for hotel rooms, but still like to be in the center of the roudy Waikiki, this is your hotel. You'll just need to make sure that you do not mind parking the car yourself, and small rooms don't bother you.

After a horrible experience at the Kuhio Banyon, we checked in to the Sheraton Princess. The staff were wonderful and gave us a corner room. The view was spectacular and everything about the hotel was first rate. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it. The location is perfect for day and evening activities.

My husband and I are taking a trip to stay in Oahu with our 13 year old son, after spending a week on the big island. We are looking forward to taking our son to Pearl Harbor and going the "The Duck" tour, he was unfortunately too young the last time we were on Oahu. We will be here in April 15-19th. We didn't stay in this hotel last time, but when we were here we really liked the location of the hotel, and you can't beat the great pricing for such a place. Looking forward to a fun trip, and will post a full review after our stay!!!

This was my thrid stay at the Sheraton PK. You couldn't ask for a better location in the middle of it all. Beach, restaurants, shops, the international marketplace, trolley pick-up - all ridiculously close. Their one pool is ok but closes pretty early since the outdoor show starts around dinner time. If you get a room facing the pool - you can see the singers from your balcony. Oh yeah, the balconies are all covered in bird poop. On this last visit, we saw a roach on the wall. I freaked, packed us up and asked for another room. The hotel was nice about it and moved us to a different room/floor after they offered to spray the room and I said no. Where there is one roach... there is usally a lot more. Other than the roach ordeal, it was a nice stay.If cost is a factor, this is a good hotel for the price.

A co-worker suggested this hotel because she stayed here before. Close to the beach and in the heart of waikiki. It is the 1st time for my "future" husband and a "2nd" for me, in visiting the Hawaiian Islands. Hope this is a memorable one! R112 - Congratulations! I hope your belated honeymoon was worth the wait. We wanted the ocean view as well but it was pricey. I hope the prime location of the hotel makes up for that.Review to follow after the honeymoon :)
it's an older hotel but kept well. Great price for beach front hotel. One of the best location.

After reading some of the reviews on here I was seriously considering cancelling my reservation and booking somewhere else. But I decided to stick with it. After all, you shouldn't be spending too much time in your room anyway. Im very pleased with my choice. Upon arrival we received a free upgrade. Which I had called to see if I could pay for anyway. The room was everything you would expect for the price. And then some. Very clean and comfortable. The beds are extremely comfortable. And you can't beat the location. Also, we decided to rent a car for a couple of days. And it was nice to have parking included in the resort fee. As well as wifi internet. Thanks princess kaiulani for a great experience. I would definitely return.

We are going on a belated honeymoon (got married summer of 2010) and we booked here for Spring break. I hope it's good - the pictures look nice. I really wanted an ocean view room because I love the ocean and it is our honeymoon, but it was a bit out of our price range...seems like there is tonnes to do though!

This hotel was loccated 3-4 min walk to the beach. They provided beach towels and chairs. They had a service where they brought fresh fruit and drinks for their guests on the beach. The hotel was right on the main street parallel to the ocean. There were plenty of restaurants and shops. In fact it was a very busy street. this hotel had did not have a resort feel, but more like a city hotel. The pool was average. But Location of the hotel was great. very close to buses which could get you around Honolulu quite easily. The rooms were average in size and decor. It was definately not plush and luxurious. The hotel decor is pretty outdated so no bells and whistles. It had a small balcony where we kept all our luggage since the room would be too crowded with our luggage. We did have a lot of luggage!

Fantastic hotel, location is the best in town, right in the centre of Waikiki. The Hotel is very large which means a lot of noise, buy it is not as bad as you would expect. The staff were great, hotel very clean and lots of amenities.Would definitely stay again and recommend to everyone.

It is not be the most beautiful hotel... it is a little bit dated... the rooms are a bit small BUT... the location is GOLD! and the price is a bargain (not worth spending SPG points here!). Since I used the Hotel mainly for sleeping and storing stuff... it would be pointless to pay double the money for a more luxurious hotel nearby. You can't beat the value you get for your buck.The staff is also very very helpful and friendly. Being a SPG Gold member, I benefited from the special line at the front desk often.The concierge desk was also very very helpful! TY very much for all your help in making reservations to activities and restaurants. Once, they even dialed a long distance cell phone so I could find my wife again! That saved us a LOT of aggravation. (I gave them 25$ tip for that move alone)The food is good at the pikake terrace buffet BUT lots of cheaper options 2 min away by foot (KOA's avenue dine-in and take-out or Blue water ocean counter at International Market food court... absolutly amazing sea food at cheap prices!)I would return here any time. Actually, I already locked-in my reservation for next year just in case I can afford the air fare once again.At one point, I had trouble sleeping because the AC in our room was not running at 100% efficiency and their blankets are so thick and heavy. I woke up several times because of nigth sweats. They provided me with a fan and a thin blanket and I was confortable to sleep again. So long as the offer solutions, I won`t complain.

We had a very nice stay at the Princess Kaiulani. It's two blocks from the beach and very close to downtown shopping and public transit. Two slight complaints that I have are as follows: Our 'high ocean view', which I paid extra for, only has a half-view of the ocean if you go on the deck and lean out. The other complaint is that I found a cockroach in one of our bedside drawers. I told the desk about it, we didn't want to move rooms or anything - too much hassle. They said they'd notify housekeeping, but we were still very cautious about bringing luggage home, etc. At least there were no bedbugs. Despite the night noise from Honolulu, this was a very nice hotel.

We booked this hotel after staying at other Sheraton hotels expecting the same standard, huge mistake. we arrived late night and was given a room that should not even be on the market to sell, room was unclean, broken cupboards, broken sink, rusty tub, disgusting stains on the walls.inch thick dust we refused to sleep in this room, after about 30 mins of complaining to 3 different people at the front desk, we were given another room, same floor but in no better shape than the first. I had requested the room to be dusted properly as i have allergies. The room looked like it had not been dusted for months, the AC unit was caked with dust and right beside the bed, if the unit was turned on, it would have blowen right in our face. Several times we were told that we were booked for this category, therefore could not be given a upgrade unless we paid more. By this time i was furious , as we did not pay to stay in a room that was filthy and in unacceptable condition, if we were given this room for free, we would still not have stayed there.We requested the guest service manager to come and take a look at the condition of the rooms they were selling, he did come up and apologized but could not offer us another room until the following morning. We were moved to another unit in the morning, which was better. This property is in need of huge upgrade, it does no justice to the Sheraton brand. I work in the travel and tourism industry and would not recommend this place to anyone unless some changes are made, this hotel has great potential due to its location . I visit Hawaii often and this was very disappointing stay

We were very pleased with this resort. We were there for our 25th anniversary and they offered a vow renewal on Feb. 14 (our day) by the pool for any guests to participate. After that, they took us to an area for chocolate covered strawberries & champagne. I know that some may have had bad experiences with places in the past. As others have mentioned, the room furnishings were some what "dated"...we didn't come 5,000 miles to sit in a hotel room and they were not in shabby or non functioning condition. The beds were great, room clean and staff was first rate. Location #1 for value and the fact you get beach chairs to take and then get service of water & fruit on the beach makes it perfect. We were poolside and could sit on the lanai and listen to the band in the evening if wanted. You have many choices in this area. Consider this place in your group. I don't think you will be disappointed.

Very large hotel - over 1100 rooms. Notwithstanding, was well orgainsed, clean, tidy, well decorated, and a pleasure to stay at. Good location in central Waikiki.I thought restaurant was pricey - for the odd occasion it's fine, but good food is available elsewhere at much lower prices.You get charged an additional resort fee of $12 per day. It's not clear upfront that you get charged this anyway. I made the mistake of declining it, believing it to be optional, and therefore not making use of all the benefits provided (1 hours long distance calls, wi fi internet access etc)

We stayed at the Princess for 4 nights in Feb. They had just switched to charging a resort fee (about $12.50 a day), but that included our parking (which had been $25 a day). We had an ocean-view room which we felt was well worth the $155 per night. Any problems we had were quickly and efficiently handled by staff. The pool and bar were very nice and access to the beach was close. There are certainly more upscale resorts in Waikiki, but for our money, this was more than adequate.

The hotel was very nice, very clean, and had many ammenities like a restaurant, bar, pool, rentals, and more that we probably don't even know about. I personally thought the beds and pillows were VERY comfortable. It is in the very busy Waikiki area, so it was loud all the time. We did have a nice stay. The beach is about a 2 block walk. This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki-so there is ample shopping within walking distance in every direction.If you are planning on doing a lot of bus tours for things-it is nice because the Hyatt is right across the street, where a majority of the buses pick you up for them.

This Trip was my daughters 16th birthday present a trip to Hawaii and what a wonderful time we had. The hotel staff was very accommodating from the front desk to room service. We stayed in a room that over looked the pool and were able to enjoy the pool entertainment when we were in our room. The location was convenient to everything she wanted to do from a 1 block walk to the beach for surf lesson to a strip full of areas to shop and we went to everyone of them, The hotel food was delicious and we were only a short walking distance from other restaurants on the island. I would stay at the Princess Kaiulani again the next time we visit Hawaii. Thanks

We stay 6 nights from 01/24 til 01/30.The hotel is very well located in the heart of Waikiki beach. Our rom was in the 23th floor facing the International Market and we had a Lanai with great ocean view to enjoy the sunset. Our tv was a 32" flat screen and the A/C worked very well.The resort fee (daily usd 12+ tax) include free parking with in/out privilege, wired internet access on rooms and wireless on lobby, 2 bottle of water per day and 60min free long distance calls. The resort fee was great to us due to expensive parking rates in the neighborhood. We parked our car everyday in the same place, topfloor of the parking garage building, near the elevator, so it was easy to reach the car. The room service failed to deliver the water on a couple of days, no big deal. We call to Indiana and to BRAZIL every single day and nothing was charged as well. We wad a minifridge that kept our water and beer cooled :)My wife had a breakfast in the pool one day, was like usd 27 tip included. A lite pricey.BTW, by the pool you can grab some towels and beach chairs but need to return until 6M. If you go to the waikiki beach, be sure to stay at Duke's statue area, the Hotel provide free water and fruits during the day to guests at this area (Cant remeber the exact time).I have no complains about the hotel, its the best value for the price. If you have a car its even better.

We had rooms on the Kaiulani Ave side of the Princess Wing. While the rooms were old they were very clean and had a pleasant outlook, but the noise was unbelievable. It was like trying to sleep in the middle of a road. The staff were lovely, but only double-glazing the sliding doors could help.

There is mold everywhere in this hotel. They give you back rooms facing a wall or parking garage with no view. They charge for everything. Parking if it is available is $25 per night. I strongly do not recommend this hotel.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani was in some senses just what we needed, but at the same time, a little lacking. It was perfectly situated--right in the heart of Waikiki and across the street from the beach and two of the oldest and most iconic hotels in Hawaii. And given that, it was a great value for the money. And the bed was super comfortable. That said, the hotel was far from modern--the rooms clearly have not been redone in several years. Fridge was a small dorm room fridge with no mini-bar, room service shuts down at 9:30 and the bathroom clearly needs an upgrade. As it turned out, we didn't spend a ton of time at our hotel anyway, and as I mentioned, it was $100 cheaper per night than the beachfront hotels across the street. If you're looking for a modern vibe with a good bar, etc. this is not the place. However, if you don't care so much about a NICE hotel and instead just want a decent hotel that is central to everything, this will more than do.

I booked this room through Priceline and when I saw what hotel we got and read the reviews I was nervous! I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the rooms are outdated and small, but if you are spending a ton of time in your hotel room in Hawaii....seems like a wasted trip. Anyway, the room was old, but clean and the housekeeping staff was great. They even had fun with my daughter's teddy bear - making hats and clothes out of wash cloths and writing notes. My daughter looked forward to seeing what they would do with her bear every night. Other staff that we encountered were very friendly also. The kids enjoyed making leis in the lobby and feeding the fish.Compared to other Hawaii hotels, the resort fee of $12.50 was minimal and to have it include parking was a steal. It also included wireless internet in our room, daily water, beach towels and chairs, water and fruit at the beach. You can also print your boarding passes in the lobby for free. The location is excellent, right across the street from the beach and right on the main street, next to international marketplace. Sure there was some street noise, but I'm not really sure you can escape that in Waikiki. Overall, our stay at this hotel was a great experience.

Me and my girlfriend Stayed at the Sheraton Princess January 27th to February 6th the overall stay was average. The hotel is older and the rooms are a little outdated. The housekeeping do a wonderful job of cleaning the room. Like i said the rooms are a little outdated so that's why the rooms may not feel clean. The staff is really great and they helped me and my girlfriend out on pretty much everything we asked for except I am on a restricted diet so i can not have certain foods but i prepared ahead of time to pack my special meal replacement shake and the bar would not mix it in the blender the hotel did not reach the needs that i expected. I am on vacation and kind of expected that something like that would not be a problem but i was informed to go buy a blender. The coffee place right beside the hotel blended it without a problem and was happy to do so. The housekeepers did an amazing job and they were all very welcoming and every morning showed appreciation. The first morning when i woke up i went downstairs to get a bowl of oatmeal and i was informed that i had to pay $26.99 for a buffet even though all i wanted was some oatmeal which I found a bit odd. The location is perfect its located right on the main strip right by the pink hotel just steps away from the beach and all the best shopping and a ABC store for any of our needs. The fitness room is basic but it does the trick. Since the hotel is on the main strip the noise is a bit loud if you try to get to bed early but after 11 it calms down quite a bit. I did not spend alot of time in the hotel because I like to spend the majority of my time on the beach and exploring the island and its many sights and activities. Overall the hotel is you get what you pay for its not a 4 or 5 star hotel but it did the trick we got a excellent deal on the hotel and airfare so it was a success. If i went back I personally wouldn't stay there again but i was happy with the stay for the budget i had.

Stayed 5 nights here 2/8 to 2/13; rooms were average and the views were incredible. Pool was not so great with the depths going from 3ft to 8ft which left very little area just to stand in. The view of Diamond Head and the beach was awesome!

My best friend & I stayed at the Sheraton Princess 2/6-2/11. We had a wonderful time & the hotel location was a key! I normally don't write reviews but since I read some negative reviews when I booked this trip & was a bit concerned, I wanted to come back & write a positive review! :) Staff was super friendly- Bo & Chase at the pool area was super nice & greeted us daily & we chatted with them daily. We also got a free beach chair & towels to take to the beach & Chase also found us 2 days on the beach and brought us water & fruits! That was nice, I wish they found us every day we were on the beach but oh wells! It was nice service though. Hotel is close to all the bars & clubs so it was nice to be able to walk back to the hotel after a night out! It was also nice that the hotel has a computer so you can check your emails (fee is already part of the daily resort fee), and you can also print your boarding pass for free. Lastly, I forgot to sign in my name when I returned the beach towels on my last day. I was worrying a bit that I might get charged a super high fee even though I returned it but the hotel person was super friendly & said no worries with a smile :) staff is super friendly! Now hopefully I do not see a charge on my credit card since they did not take my name. :)Only gripes were that the Wifi's only worked first couple days & stopped working toward end of the trip & room-keeper didn't replenish our room with water bottles daily. It only happened 2 or 3 nights out of the 5 nights we stayed. Lastly, room was a bit small & we only got a queen bed even though we requested two beds & I have Starwood preferred card. All in all, any of the negatives weren't that big of a deal. :) Just know that you're not paying four or five star quality hotel so just be warned in advance, if you want a luxury hotel, you'll need to pay the extra and stay elsewhere. This place was perfect & fulfilled our purpose of coming to Hawaii. :)

Don't let the exterior and the name Sheraton fool you. This is one of the worst hotels on the boulevard. The rooms are very small and dated. (The size of a big Closet) The paint and carpets are dirty and stained. The locals have nick names for the hotel and none of them are good. The two groups the hotel targets are Asians & industry workers who need to spend the night in town. The Atmosphere was like a motel rather than aHawaiian resort hotel. The staff main concern is the Asian travelers, you will not be served unit you ask. I was told by an employee that the Asian economy is good and that's there main target group. There's only one place to eat and it looked bad and overpriced 59.95 per person for a little buffet (no seafood) on lawn chairs. If you can find another hotel for same rate stay their you'll thank me. But if you’re forced to stay there you'll properly spend all your time at other hotels like we did.

I have visited Oahu several times and this has been the best location so far! I liked being in the middle of everything with such a short walk to the beach. Our room balcony gave us a view of Diamond Head and the beach! We could watch the sun light up the city each morning! The service from the staff was great and we did not have any problems. It was nice to have bottled water in the room every day. The room was clean and very comfortable. Parking was easy. There are many food options nearby so I did not eat at the hotel. It was nice to have free internet in the lobby when needed. It really is a fantastic location with great service. I would come again! (Soon, I hope!!!)

We stayed for 7 nights in a corner room on the 25th floor, which gave us a great view of the ocean when sitting on the balcony. Renting a car, I thought the resort fee ($12) was a steal because it included parking. All staffs were friendly and helpful when needed.As for the room, the bed was clean/comfortable. Room itself was outdated (3-star seems appropriate), and we had some issues with the bath drain, as I read on other reviews. Perhaps they don't have the time or reason to renovate because rooms fill up anyways?The other unfortunate parts were that their in-room safe was extra charge despite the resort fee, and that there was no wi-fi. Otherwise, this hotel was great.

We spent eight days at the Princess Kaiulani and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We went through a Hawaiian Airline package and would have been relegated to a room overlooking a parking lot, except that when I asked about our room on check in and found out about the parking lot, I asked for an upgrade overlooking the pool (I had read about this from another TA reviewer). It was an additional $20 per night, but well worth it. We were put in the original wing overlooking the pool on the 7th floor with a view of pool, Kalakaua Avenue, Moana Surfrider Hotel and ocean. Incredibly, we have a painting of the Moana Surfrider over our mantel at home that we've had for years and now this was our exact view. The room was comfortable and clean. My only complaint was the bathroom door that is a super heavy wood pocket door that made a lot of noise when pushing it open or closed (not good during night); I think a plantation shutter type bi-fold door would be so inexpensive and look nice so I don't understand why Sheraton wouldn't make an easy upgrade to something like this.Other than that the room was perfect. Restaurant options were good and we lunched there once, but had so much fun heading out every night to try different places. And, this is the best part of this hotel....the location is fantastic right across from the beach and the heart of Waikiki.Staff at the front desk, bar and restaurant and concierge were all friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Princess for 10 days over late January into early February. Check in was easy, staff was very friendly. The lobby was very outdated but still welcoming. We stayed in the tower with a partial ocean view on the 26th floor. The elevators were a little slow, but overall didn't really seem to bother us too much. The view was completely gorgeous and we enjoyed watching the sunset over Waikiki each night. We did not eat at the hotel so can't really comment on the food. The house keepers were great and never missed a night and always did a fantastic job. The daily service charge of 12.50 didn't seem so bad considering that it included parking, internet and also daily water in the room. For the price we paid, we got a lot of 'bang' for the buck. Having said all of this.... there were a few hotels across the street along the beach that were very updated and very nice. If I had the extra money, I probably would have preferred to stay in one of them. But, with what I had the stay was great. And no matter what hotel you stay in everything seems crowded. I visited pools where the rooms were $400/night and the guests still had to get up early for lounge chairs and wait for bar service. All in all, yes I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.. (unless of course my friend had just hit the lottery and money was of no question :)

The hotel was very comfortable. Although it is older, I found it to be quite nice except for their swimming pool which was 72 degrees. It was freezing cold and I was not able to swim in it. The staff at the towel stand seemed to think 72 degrees was "fine".To travel all that way and not be able to use the pool was a disappointing. Other than that I found the hotel to be good value for the price. The beds were especially comfortable.

This rating is for the Kaiulani Wing of the hotel only. I've stayed at this Sheraton Hotel previously several years ago. At that time they were promising millions of $$$ in renovations. This time I was expecting better rooms in the Kaiulani Wing (where the cheapest prices put you). Don't get me wrong, the Hotel is in an absolutely great location. Instead, I was greeted with the exact type of room with 20-30 year old bathroom fixtures, IKEA styled desk-shelves-drawer combo and a 26" CRT (Tube type) TV. It faces the back of the hotel where, all late night long (2PM and after), you hear the trash compactor running or being exchanged and delivery trucks backing up to the loading docks.Due to the Northeast storm, I had to extend my stay an additional 2 days where I would have had to move to a different room. The other room was on a lower floor but the same wing and the same side of the building. Luckily, I had the fortune of getting a sharp Front Desk Customer Service person (Sharen) who talked her Supervisor into not having me pack and move.Read the fine print - they also hit you with a $12/day "Resort Fee" which gives you 2 bottles of water, parking, free internet, and a special place with some services on Waikiki Beach. Your SPG (Sheraton) card will not get you any points if you book through a 3rd party (Orbitz, Travelocity, etc.).My recommendation - if you stay, don't go for the cheaper rooms, get an ocean view room and upgrade to the nicer 2 wings of the Hotel or try another hotel.

Just got back from our stay at the Princess Kaiulani Sheraton. We paid for a partail ocean view. One problem was that the partail view was not easy to see. You had to lean out over the balcony to see the ocean. The rooms have not been redone since the 70's. The wall paper was pealing, the faucets were rusting, and the decor is not up to the Starwood hotel level. The good things about the hotel was the staff. Very pleasant. Overall I would suggest going with something like a courtyard. At least there you expect the what you pay for.

I would like to start this review by saying that the location of this hotel is awesome. However, I wish there were a few things that could be improved... Let's begin...I booked a hotel room at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani for three nights in January 2011. The hotel is situated right in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach and right next to the International Marketplace. Upon check-in, I requested a quiet room as I have read in previous reviews that a few rooms tend to draw in noise, etc... I was quickly shot down with a quip, "This is Honolulu, everywhere you stay is going to be loud." I was a little taken back by that. I received a key and ended up in a room next to the elevator shaft. The room I was given, was in fact, noisy -- not because of street vendors or cars, but because of the elevators constantly running. I initially thought I could live with it, but alas, had to go back downstairs to request a new room. This is EXACTLY what I was hoping to prevent in the first place. A nicer, front desk staff member (Jennifer) helped and was able to locate a better room further away from the elevator shaft. Awesome! Upon returning from that evenings activities, Randi, an awesome Sheraton staff member left a very nice card and a small concession. What a great surprise and a perfect example of customer care by Randi. (Thanks, dude!)The rest of my stay there was very relaxing. The resort fees are water bottle inclusive and I had to request water twice. Other than that, staying at the Sheraton was pretty transparent. Did I mention that the location of the hotel was convenient? A simple walk across the street through the Westin Surfrider takes you straight into the Waikiki Beach. Towels are provided at the pool area. The pool staff were laid back, but attentive. It can get quite crowded during the day, so get to the pool as early as you can. Overall, I thought my stay was more than decent and if you're trying to decide wether or not to stay here, do it! It's a no-frills hotel with a great location. The room I was in needed a bit of updating (can we say 80's time warp?), but nevertheless comfortable and it did it's job. Except for the initial check-in staff member, the staff were very nice and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.Mahalo for reading!

Service was very good, reception were very willing to help. we arrived at 9am, they gave a temporary suite for a couple of hours to have a shower etc. Our room was ready at 12.30pm which was great.We were upgraded to a pool view which was lovely and the beds were very comfortable. Bathroom dated. Maids were wonderful and left water bottles daily.Location is in the heart of Waikiki. Across the road is the beach. The hotel have a fruit and water service at a designated spot on the beach which is very handy.Kids had fun at the pool and we parents enjoyed happy hour drinking cocktails and eating delicious snacks.Buffet Breakfast was divine especially the omelets made by the chef in front of you and to your specifications.The foyer/reception is a busy place where activities are held in the morning such as lei making and pineapple carvings and hula lessons,We came with another family who also enjoyed the hotel. It is in a great location and the price is very reasonable. The rooms were clean, a little outdated but overall the hotel is charming and staff friendly . I would recommend this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights 17 - 27.1. Very good location right in the center of Honolulu, close to the beach. We stayed at Deluxe Ocean View room. Nice and tidy room, great and big bed. All room are very noisy and we had to use earplugs...:( WiFi connections is not available :((Great disadvantage is overpriced and poor quality of food and beverages. I recommend other close and great restaurants (Shore Bird in Outrigger Hotel, Japaneese restaurant is over the street).
w've been to hawaii 12 time in the last 14 years and i've stayed at many a location and this is the best value anywhere. Everthing is close to the hotel.

We stayed at the Princess Kaiulani for nine nights, Jan. 13-22, 2011. It was amazing. Right after we checked in and went to our room, the housekeeper checked in on us to make sure everything was ok and to see if we needed anything. But the place is awesome. I was very nervous after reading some of the other reviews but all of my fears were completely unfounded. Yes it is an older hotel, yes the walls are a little thin. But we didn't have any problems. We got a room overlooking the pool and there is a stage in the pool area that has an evening show with local musicians. We could see and hear the entire show from our balcony, it was great. Also, the hotel provides towels to take to the beach so that's one less thing to pack.

Waikiki Hawaii is simply a wonderful place to visit. We met many Japanese,Australians & Canadians during our stay . We booked on the internet via the Sheraton site. The location of Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is very central but at the same time it is noisy.We stayed at this hotel from Jan 14 to 23rd. Check in was quick.Jhiwa at front desk was very good & gave us a room in the Princess Wing -Room 922. The daily resort charge of $12.67 is not optional but they provide you with 20 mins.internet ,parking,2 bottles water & 2 free drinks per stay.If you use all that then its worth.I complained to the manager regarding 2 days we did not get water service on the beach where they bring water for you.She was only apologetic. I think She should have credited our account to make up for the ineffeciency.All in all this hotel needs updating,room carpets,bathrooms,elevators etc.Next time would look for a quieter Hotel.

My husband and I have stayed at the Princess every year for the last five. We have stayed at many other hotels in Waikiki, but love the Princess the most. Each time our visit gets longer because we leave thinking we wish we had a couple more days. Every year before our trip I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and I am horrified. I think to myself that it must have gone down hill and we are going to be stuck in a rotten room for 10 days. Then I get there and it is the same wonderful Princess it always is. I really don't understand these complaints --these have never been my experiences. Sure, it's not brand new, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. In fact, my husband has not had a good night sleep since we got home because he misses his PK bed!In the past it could be a bit nosy, mostly because of the awful drummer on the street below. Well, to my sheer delight the drummer is gone! (Drums are not a solo instrument!) He has been replaced by some dancers. This alone was a highlight of our trip.Yes, the Princess was as great as always. Same delightful staff. Same Aunties working in housekeeping. The bands are some of the best in Waikiki. The nightly entertainment is so excellent. Consider yourself lucky to hear Kapena DeLima who plays in the lobby. He has the most amazing voice in the world. I did catch his family across the street at the Moana & Royal. Do they ever play at the Princess anymore? Maybe I missed them. The lemony Mai Tai at the Pikaki Terrace or poolside is a great change from the overly sweet pineapple ones so common at many places. Each one is beautifully garnished. Every meal we ate was great and affordable.I have one concern: The Princess is slated for renovation. Will I still be able to afford to stay here? Will the wonderful staff still work here? I hope so because I would like to come here every year for the rest of my life.I LOVE the PK and my PK Ohana!

I've read a lot of blogs in all hotels in Waikiki and the budget that we have I ended up booking in Sheraton Princess. Averaged $130 per night and stayed for 5 days. They upgraded us when we check-in - for additional $12.50 a day you're be getting unlimited internet, 2 drinks and a free parking space! That the only thing that i'm afraid of paying for $25 a day parking fee that's why i am reluctant to rent a car...I'm thanking that they upgrade us and it's so convenient to have a car in Oahu, we've just come and go whatever and whenever we want.Very convenient! Center of night life. At the corner you have burger king & Farmers market.At the side you have international market place further more you have bunch of fine dining restaurants e.g. Cheesecake and the other side you have the Waikiki beach...The noise that people complaining from previous review, i think it depends. We're 19th floor we can still here the noise but we can still sleep good cuz probably we're tired at night and used to live in Bay area noise :) but it's acceptable. No harm done. I believed there two towers, you should request the to put you in the higher tower.Room not so magnificent, like others mentioned , kinda old but hey we know what we're getting and this is not a 5 star hotel. I may say it is a decent room. we're in the city view but i still can see the waikiki beach.

My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani from Jan 14-18 while I was in town for a job interview. We got a good deal ($99/night)) and despite mixed reviews we decided to give it a go because of its excellent location. The location (right across the street from the beach, middle of waikiki, walking distance to great food) was by far the best thing about this hotel. The lobby/pool area was very nice as well. Our room had a nice view of the parking garage behind the hotel but I kind of expected that having gone through priceline. First off the wallpaper was stained and peeling off the walls and we found a roach in our room the first night (and ya, I know, it Hawaii and its kind of hard to completely stop the insects but its still gross). I called and complained about the roach and they promptly sent someone up with a can of raid and sprayed it all around the room.Next, when you check in they inform you about a "resort fee" costing $12.50/day thats supposed to cover water bottles in your room, water and fruit at a specified area on the beach, beach towels, chairs, and one or two other things I can't remember. We didn't get any water bottles until our 3rd day there. We asked about 4 people at the hotel where to get the fruit and water at the beach and only one guy knew where it was. We spent 2 days on the beach in the "designated area" and saw nobody delivering the promised cold fruit and H20. To their credit they were happy to refund our resort fee when we checked out. The bed was average, sheets were good, the pillows were plastic and uncomfortable and the carpet wasn't super clean. One thing to note is rooms do not have individual thermostats so if you like your hotel rooms super cold like me then this might be a concern. The bathroom was nice and clean with ample hot water but the drain was a little slow. Despite the many problems we encountered the staff was nice and helpful throughout our stay. Overall I'd say we got a good deal on a mediocre hotel in the heart of waikiki and we got what we paid for.

I stayed in the Tower location years ago and was pleased. This time I was placed in another wing that was older with AC not working. They moved me but the next room in the same wing was not much better. Then moved to the Tower. The Tower is the best. The coin laundry services in a good location and were available at the time I used them. The computers for use were very dirty. Suggest spending a little more for a better hotel.

(+) Rooms are good and clean. Central location in Wakikiki (but not at the beach). Staff was friendly both on phone and in person.(-) I had problems with the hotel: (1) my booking was not in their system on arrival and I got checked in only at a higher rate, even I had a printed confirmation - next Sunday morning at 9am, waking me of course, I got a call that they found it (2) everytime there was a waiting line for speaking to the front desk (3) got a call/letter to contact reception because of "problems with credit card" (went there, solved it) next day I had another call/letter why I did not not come to reception (4) there are local taxes and service fees (12$/d) added to the quoted price (5) I paid for having two bottles of water in my room every day but never got them (2 out of 6 days I did, both after I complained). Seems to be quite understaffed and mismanaged.Would appreciate to have a management response.

Even it's a member of Sheraton group, the campaigned room was terrible. I never want to remember the room as well as a whole wing. I doubt when it was built and their thought they just leave it as it is old.

Old, worn and poor front desk staff. The hotel charges a "resort fee" which includes internet, parking, two bottles of water, kids eat free, welcome juice, etc. BUT, you have to ensure they deliver on it. Twice they didn't give me the welcome juice and daily bottles of water. ******DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU ARE SPG GOLD OR PLATINUM******If you're SPG Platinum, you will receive nothing more than the welcome "gift" because they charge your for internet (in resort charge). They said I had an upgraded room from a "city view" to a parking garage view of the air next door shopping market.

stayed here for 8 nights, given a double bedroom on the 7th floor.all in all good experience, the resort charge i think was worth it, breakfast, free phone calls etcc. only problem i was not able to connect to the wifi via my iphone.

Stayed here with my husband for part of our honeymoon. We received an apparent discounted rate. I could not imagine paying what they claimed was full price. The place really wasn't that bad, I just wouldn't pay top dollar. The room was clean and it had a mini fridge which was nice and a balcony. We stayed here at the beginning and end of our trip. When we checked in the second time they upgraded us to a high ocean view room. I actually think that the city view room was nicer, just without the ocean view. The staff was fine, they didn't care that it was our honeymoon so don't expect any extras to be thrown in for that. The hotel could use an update, mainly in the rooms. The lobby was very nice. The rooms as I mentioned were clean, I just felt an update was needed. I used to not understand why people complained about updates, but now I understand. Also, parking is expensive. We didn't use their parking. We parked in the parking garage around the corner for much less. I think it was called Kings Village. The area was very convenient. Waikiki Beach was a block away and shops and restaurants are right outside the hotel. When I made the reservations on the phone, the agent told me that complimentary breakfast was included every morning. When we got there the front desk told us that this was not true. I called customer service from the room and the customer service agent contacted the hotel manager. They agreed to give us a complimentary buffet breakfast for the first morning only. It normally costs around $20/person. It was good and plentiful, but I wish that they could have followed though with what the agent promised. I would probably stay here again. However, if I had more money to spend I might look elsewhere.

I returned to this hotel with my two teeanage children 25 years after staying here for my wedding. What a disappointment, from beginning to end. I paid for the room in advance, to get the best price, so we were pretty much stuck once we got there. Here's the story: We checked in late at night, went to our room, and went straight to bed. When we woke up, we found small spider-like bugs crawling on the walls, the furniture, the floors, and inside the drawers. When I went to the front desk to report it, I had to wait for the desk person to go get the manager. While waiting, I heard a couple next to me at the desk check into the hotel, be told that their room was ready and that they could go directly to their room. When the manager came out to the front desk, I described the bugs to him, and he asked if I wanted housekeeping to come spray the bugs. I told him that I wanted a different room. He told me that he would look for a different room, but since check-in time was 3:00 p.m., and it was only 9:00 a.m., no rooms were ready, so we would need to pack our suitcases, leave them with the bellman, and then move them to a new room after 3:00 (despite having heard the couple next to me be given their room immediately). After I went back to my room to pack, the manager called the room and told me that a housekeeping staff member was coming to my room to confirm that the bugs were there. WHAT?!! The housekeeping person looked at the bugs, and said "hmmm -- I will call the manager." I asked the housekeeping person if they could please make sure our new room did not have bugs. His response was that it is a tropical climate, so they could not assure me that the new room would not have bugs. We were moved to an identical room, albeit on a higher floor (and thankfully, no bugs), but with no compensation whatsoever for the unpleasant experience and the inconvenience of moving. On the first day that the sun was out during our stay, the pool desk ran out of beach chairs for guest use, the usage charge for which is included in the daily fee charged by the hotel. When I asked the restaurant staff one morning to reheat my coffee drink in their microwave, they refused, and told me they don't reheat anything for guests in their microwaves. (?!) On the only afternoon we went to the pool bar, after sitting at the table for 10 minutes without having a server come to our table, I went to the bar to place my order. A server asked why I was standing at the bar, I told her I wanted to order a drink, and she told me that I needed to find a table and someone would be out to get my order. I told her I had already been waiting 10 minutes at a table. Her response was that I must not be sitting in her section, and she would find the appropriate server. After another 5 minutes, a server came to our table to take our order, and waited another 10 minutes to bring our drinks. On the day we checked out, I asked if we could use a hospitality room to shower and change before going to the airport at 8:00 p.m. The desk person said we could, and that we needed to give them about 30 minutes' notice before we needed the room. At 5:45 p.m., I went to the desk to request to use the hospitality suite. The desk person (different from the one in the morning), told me that both of their hospitality suites were in use, that they were issued on a first come-first served basis, that they did not take names for use of the rooms, that the earliest either of the rooms would be available would be 6:30 p.m., and that I needed to wait, at the counter, to watch for someone to return a key to one of the hospitality rooms. I waited until 6:35, saw someone return a key, and went immediately to the desk person to whom the key had been returned to tell him that I was waiting for the room. He said no problem -- that they needed about 5 minutes to get the room cleaned and stocked with new towels. After about 10 minutes, he brought me the key, and told me we were limited to one hour in the room. When we got to the room, there were no clean towels, there were dirty towels on the floor, and the bathroom had not been cleaned. We immediately called housekeeping (6:45 p.m.) to request clean towels, shower amenities (shampoo, soap), and a hairdryer. At 7:15, the towels and amenities were delivered, and at 7:40, the front desk called to remind us that our one hour was up. Yikes -- we will not be back.

With "Sheraton" in its name, one would expect an exemplary experience. The hotel, however, fell short on a number of occasions. On the fourth day of our five-day stay, the maid forgot to clean our room, and the bathtub was plugged up. After a busy day we were requested to remove ourselves to the lobby for 15-20 minutes while the maid cleaned our room at 10:30 pm. Finally, the hotel parking situation is a myriad of detours. Apparently, there are two parking structures - one affixed tlo the hotel and the other adjacent to the hotel. In order to access the fourth floor parking facility, we had to exit the elevator on the third floor, to access the fifth floor we had to exit on the fourth floor.There were no directional signs. Finally, a bus boy offered to escort us to our car. In doing so, we found a couple huffing and puffing up the auto entrance ramps to gain access to their car. And, the events reservation desk was not staffed at peak times.

Great location in central Waikiki about two minutes from the beach, however staying here also gets you access to the Private Beach at Sheratons other property in Waikiki, including deck chairs etc etc. Our only negative was that as it is such a big hotel it is very busy and bustling, with waits for breakfast, lifts, reception etc etc. Good Beds, decent rooms with Air Con and flat screens and staff are friendly.

I have read in previous reviews that this hotel will undergo a significant renovation in the near future. It does need it as the rooms are a little outdated. But they are comfortable and clean (except for the previous occupant's hair in the sink and bathtub; this is a huge annoyance to me, thus the "2" for cleanliness.) The balcony was WAY cleaner than the one I had at the Moana Surfrider where we stayed earlier in the trip. The location is great! You are not right on the beach but close enough. As far as I know, they don't have any beach chairs or umbrellas but you can get your own or a mat and enjoy Waikiki Beach right across the street. Two thumbs up and a shout out to the servers in the bar. They turned a simple drink into a really enjoyable experience. And it's really a nice place to sit and enjoy a drink, even if you're not on the beach. The pool area looked really nice though we didn't spend any time there. It looks like the sun is lost behind the Hyatt for part of the morning, at least during the winter months. Wish they could have done something about the pigeons in the restaurant during breakfast. Yuck. One even landed on our table while we were sitting there. We could not get on the internet in either of our rooms. You pay a daily resort fee which includes internet so we did feel like we were not getting what we paid for. The only thing that really irked me (and still does) is that we couldn't get a print-out of our bill. They apparently don't put them under your door early on your last day like 99% of the hotels in North America. I called and asked if they could mail one to us and was told they don't do that either. We didn't want to stand in line (which looked pretty significant at check out on December 31) so the only alternative was to receive the bill by email. It's now 48 hours later and I have not received the bill. I honestly expected to receive the email before I even left Hawaii.

During my first stay I had a room on the lower floor, which was nice and tidy, rather renovated, but when I came back 3 weeks later, I got a room on the top floors - definitely not renovated. It was ok, but especially the bathroom needs some refurbishing.The location is great, next to Waikiki Beach, next to the shopping areas. If you booked a certain rate, even the parking is included! Pay attention on that!!! Unfortunately there was no free wi-fi neither in the lobby nor in the room, which is rather seldom on Hawaii. However there are 5 computers which can be used by everyone. But some sites are blocked and they're very slow...

Ther Service was AWESOME, location is GREAT, Price was Even better. When we checked in we were given a room with a queen bed and asked for a King.. contacted front desk and within seconds we were transfered to a king size room. The room is a bit smaller but the location is GREAT and the price we got, I cant complain. I think they have the coldest bottle beer in town.. Would stay again in a heart beat.. Its great if your on a budget and you dont stay in your rooms much anyways.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani sounds like a great hotel but when you check in it's pretty obvious that they treat those that book through Expedia and probably other websites like second-class citizens. Everyone in Hawaii was amazing except for the staff at the front desk at the Sheraton. From the people who pick you up from the car rental to everyone you meet, afterall it's Hawaii and you come to expect this friendliness from paradise. Upon checking into my room at the Sheraton, I was given 2 double beds on the 2nd floor of the hotel. My reservation was for a King Bed. It didn't occur to me that the front desk did not say something like "We have you in two double beds in our Standard Escape", in which I would have explained that was not what I wanted. Instead, I went upto my room only to find 2 double beds. When I went to change this the "supervisor" had me sit off to the side and told me Expedia told them 2 double beds which was incorrect. In the end, he practically threw two new keys and although I got the King Bed I ordered it was not professional or hospitable at all. Later I realized I was in a non smoking room but obviously that was falling on deaf ears.  Overall, the place is in a noisy location with street performers all night. The resort fee offers some value if you need internet or parking and includes 2 bottles of drinking water. But with the front desk treating people like garbage I'd never stay here again and neither should you.

stay at this hotel 4 times a month for the past year for work (we had a contract w/hotel for a year...so many complaints my work broke the contract) the rooms are very outdated and very loud. Our view is of a brick wall or a parking lot. The walls are very thin and the bathroom is very old.... hot water is a luxury at this hotel. Sleep is hard to come by b/c you can hear everything and if you are by the elevator even worse. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else...We complained so much about this hotel our company moved us. PS...termites are at this hotel and hotel was suppose to be tore down but they decided to try to renovate (NOT A SHERATON HOTEL)

A nice hotel in a good location, not even a full block off Waikiki beach, this hotel has too many things going for it to not be updated. Unfortunately, it is badly in need of refurbishing. And not just a simple updating, like a fresh coat of paint. I mean, they need to gut it and re-do every surface. The shower is pathetic, with rust on the light fixtures. And what passes for a balcony has barely enough space for one person to stand on, much less it and enjoy. Also, I paid for a "deluxe ocean view room". And while you could see the ocean over the building across the street if you stood on your toes and careened your neck, it is not by any standard that I would call deluxe or ocean view. Mind you, one can technically see water. But only above and beyond the other buildings blocking the view. Also, while there is "free" wireless internet and parking ... they come only with the required "resort fee", the wireless connection is slow and constantly dropping signal. I don't want to sound just negative. The staff is very nice, and the place clean. But this location has way too many things going for it to not better develop itself and be the best that it can. With some refurbishing and tweaking, they could probably do a lot more business.

The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani is located in a superb location just across from Waikikibeach and close to the shops along the main strip. The room is on the large side with a partial ocean view with an accessible balcony. The bathroom is a bit dated but otherwise is clean . Everyone at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful and the US$12.50 resort fee per day is inclusive of internet access and phone calls. Apart from the noise from the buskers in the night time I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and would definitely return again when I visit Honolulu.

This is the worse hotel I have eveer stayed. The four of us, my wife and my son and his girl friend, suffered for a whole week. It was excacly like the guests below just descibe: Old , dusty, and virtually no airconditioning. I had to ask for a fan to survive. After spending one hour begging, one warm hearted receiptionst Michele [many thanks to her help] thaked to the the Manager, Mr. Okazaki Yoshiya, who kindly changed our room -- that was two hours after we checked in. In any event, the hotel is too old and run-down for the price. Our many thanks to Michele and the Manager, but the hotel did suck. Never will I stay in this hotel. By the way, it is not cheap.

We were booked her as part of a package tour before and after our cruise. The hotel was fantastic, the staff were excellent. Our rooms were spotless, overlooking the pool and Waikiki beach. It is located right in the heart of Honolulu and Waikiki beach.I will definately go there again and recomend it to anyone.Mahalo, x

My husband and i stayed several nights and although I sent 2 notes to the hotel requesting a tower room because of the mold in the older building, we were placed in the older part. Upon arriving in our room, the mold and dust affected us immediately, and the vent was covered in dust, the wooded screen covered with mold. We went back to the desk to ask for a different room. We were told none were available that night, but we could be moved the next day - of course, the room was more expensive even though the 'view' was the same. We didn't ask, but should we have been compensated for having to stay in a mold filled room instead of have to may more for the room we should have had in the first place? we used to love the feel of this hotel, but this trip opened our eyes.

Prior to checking in we had stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Waikiki, where we unfortunately could not stay any longer as they were fully booked. Moving away from the beach was of course a letdown, but my initial impression of the Princess Kaiulani was positive as the receptionist greeting me was much nicer to look at than the hotel itself, to put it that way. Not only that, but after confirming with her manager, she kindly upgraded us to an ocean view due to our gold SPG status. Now to the negatives:1. It turns out the ocean room was actually a "partial ocean view" room, which is a big difference. The only way you could see the ocean was by going out on the balcony, stretching your head out like a giraffe and look to the left. In my opinion, if you can't see the ocean from inside your room, don't call it an ocean view room.2. At night you will suffer from horrible island pling plong music just outside your room, which on some nights continues until midnight. It is not the easiest environment to get your baby to sleep.3. The walls are paper thin. We could hear everything going on at the other end of the wall, and I assume they could as well. It was not a problem the first night when my parents-in-law stayed in the neighboring room, but after they left we felt we could not even watch TV in the evening as it would disturb the people next door (not that we would overpower the island music).4. The rooms are terribly old and seem ready for historic preservation. They have been equipped with small plasma TVs, but otherwise the rooms appear not to have been renovated since the beginning of time. The standard has sunk so low that Japanese school classes are using the hotel as a dormitory during trips to Hawaii. 5. The breakfast is a real downer compared to the food at the Sheraton Waikiki. The food is completely uninspired, not even the many pigeons flying around and sitting on the tables seem eager to eat it. With all the plush hotels around, you have to be a rather dumb pigeon to pick this hotel to dine at. Some of the waitresses are quite friendly though.6. I had a package arrive, but was not notified about this. Fortunately I asked if any mail had arrived when checking out, and was then told that a package had arrived two days earlier. No apology was given.7. The parking lot is extremely old and looks ready to crumble. Make sure to have your life insurance policy ready prior to entering.On a final note, if you are in Oahu, pay the extra bucks and stay on the beach. There is a small pool on the property that is absolutely depressing. If it is not better looked after than the rest of the hotel, the water probably has not been changed since the early 1970s. To end on a positive note, the misery of the hotel made is somewhat easier to leave Hawaii. At least at home I can fall asleep without having to listen to island music until midnight every night.

The Princess Kaiulani is actually a decent hotel, considering the price difference between the Surfrider or the Royal Hawaiian. However, it was not spectacular.The dinner buffet was charming. They had hibachi steak and crab and a very nice salad bar. The chi chis were not very strong though. We got a 35% discount because I'm an SPG gold member, so that was cool. The dinner entertainment was authentically Hawaiian with hula dancers and music. The pool is pretty big too.We were not upgraded to a better room, so we got stuck with one of the lower floor rooms that had very loud bathroom doors. They kept me awake all night. Also, there's no valet parking. The bell desk was quite helpful and quick. They have an SPG Platinum and Gold counter for checkin and checkout, but it was always closed!I may come back to this hotel if they can offer me an upgrade. Otherwise, I'll probably stick with the Surfrider across the street.

We stayed here on a one night stop over and although the room on the whole wasn't bad, with the exception of a need for an update, the bathroom was disgusting. The tub was not 3* it was closer to a 1*. The location was excellent. I wasn't impressed with the added $12 resort fee. This may have been okay if we were staying longer, but they really should incorporate it into their original price.

I was at Sheraton kaiulani from Feb 19th to Feb 25th 2009 so this is a long overdue review.The good points:-Very good location close to bus lines, one/2 blocks to Waikiki Beach and market and lots of different restaurants nearby,- free internet though you need to wait for your turn-Spacious rooms , clean bathroom and I found the bed very comfortable and loved it..small lanai and a refrigerator -Evening free program which is quite nice for a drink next to the pool and do some people watching- room seemed clean and i had a little bit of ocean view however, was told will not have any-Great king size bed, and i liked the flat tv-People to hold luggage after check out and bell people nice- Ratio of price+ location as to my budget and the deal i got was reasonable..The negatives:-My room ( was on the 10th floor i am not sure but i think it was on Kauani or something like that tower, same tower where they have the Creation program)...very noisy till 10 evening then early at 5.30 the garbage truck would wake me up..solution i used earplugs..but still some noise could be heard..and i had asked specially for a quiet room non smoking( it was smoking lol )-The toilet; although careful with the usage of paper etc yet the last day the water was all over the bathroom, as was checking out did not bother and just let them know while returning the key but was not a good last moment event ..gladly it happened only with water in itService people are kind of so so, nothing special, no special customer service ...They charged me $2 for a toll free call, and when i protested the lady just said they know it is toll free but that was the way ...Anyway, overall it was good value as to my budget, but if i will stay there again for a second time, not sure ....will prefer to be on the beach may be more boutique hotel type with warmer atmosphere tip:-You don't have to be a guest to take advantage of free evening shows,-Lots of buses close to the hotel , near the circle which can take you to almost every touristic place with a 2.50 fare-ask the bellman will give you a list of all the buses and routes for visiting different touristic places if u do not want to rent a car( i did not and was totally fine)..very helpful and straight forward.Hope this will help...

On a recent business trip to Honolulu (which was a tremendous hardship, I assure you), we stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani, which is just a few blocks from the beach. The rooms themselves are actually roomy and well appointed. Mine overlooked the pool, which was beautiful. Music is played poolside every night until about ten. This is absolutely audible while you are inside the room - I was singing along. It didn't bother me at all - I liked it, and the hotel was otherwise quite quiet. It might get to some people, though.Our business paid the extra "resort fee" for our rooms, which should have included two bottles of water daily, as well as a few other amenities. Not ONCE did we get any of those amenities without going down and asking for them. In fact, the biggest problem I noted was that the staff just didn't seem to care how anyone's trip would go. The hotel was pretty full the entire time we were there, and it seemed to be a case of, "We know they will come even if we don't bother to make their stay too comfortable." We had to ask multiple times for them to actually activate the resort fee while we were there (actually - they took the charge, they just didn't want to fulfill it). The poolside dining is just gorgeous. The food is nothing exciting, and the price of the buffet is horrifying considering the type of food served. Our waitresses were extremely nice, though. The hotel is in a great location - you can walk to just about anything. There's even a Burger King that serves spam sandwiches right across the street! There are also about ten million and two ABC stores within a fifty foot radius, with everything from Hawaii mementos to toothpaste and booze for sale. And the hotel is super clean and well appointed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants something nice and clean and centrally located, but isn't afraid to force the issue to get their money's worth.

This hotel is not right on the water but it in an excellent location in the heart of Waikiki. My husband and I stayed for three days in October and were able to get an very good rate compared to what the hotels right on the water were charging. We requested a high ocean view room and had a wonderful view of Waikiki and we could ALMOST see Diamond Head. The room decor and bathroom were dated but very clean and everything functioned just fine. It sounds like the hotel is scheduled to be completely renovated soon and I hope that does not mean the room prices will skyrocket. As it stands, it is a good value for the price.
