So, unless you work the system, you are paying $75 a day for parking and internet for a mouldy room, internet and parking, and wasting a bunch of your starpoints.I heard from hotel staff that Starwood knows that this hotel is crap, and they plan to tear it down in a year or so. I think it is apalling that they will still milk guests by making us stay in crappy-smelly rooms to leach a few more dollars out of a worn out building.

Got a room at this hotel, by bidding for it on Priceline, for $55.-!!! But when I parked my car there, it was a whopping $25.- for overnight. (This is the discounted hotel guest rate, regular rate is $40.-). Paying almost more for the 'lodging' of my car than for myself, my expectations of the room were a little lowered. (Did I have so sleep in the Garage myself?) But at check-in, I was offered a late check-out (as a SPG Gold Member, even though I did not book through the SPG website.) and got a room with a view. (upgrade!). Thank You! Although the room is a little outdated, it was clean and comfortable. The same goes for the bathroom. But then again, you're in Hawaii and don't spend much time in your room anyway. The hotel offers free Internet access in the lobby (Link@Sheraton). Furthermore, there are several food outlets on property and there is a small pool. The Location of the hotel is the best, right in the middle of Waikiki, with the beach across the street. Food, shopping and nightlife are all next door. All in all, if you can get a good deal at this hotel, take it. And if you don't plan to drive around the island, don't bring a car.

just got back from a 3 day stay at this hotel and loved pretty much everything about it. was clean and fantastically located. we had front facing view of ocean and the pool area. the room was clean and relaxing. the food prices seemed high, but there are many many other places to eat just outside the hotel. my only real complaints are the price of parking 25 dollars per day, which seems to be standard in the area. it really is possible to get by without renting a car at all I think. we saw the wiki wiki buses running all over the place. and why have that lovely beautiful pool all lit up and the perfect weather and then close it at 6 pm every night?

While on the Big Island, my husband and I began to second guess our hotel reservation in Waikiki. Therefore, I changed our reservation to the Sheraton Princess, thinking that since it's a brand name hotel, it has to be a good one. WRONG!The lobby is absolutely beautiful. Now if only they would have used some of that money to modernize the rooms a little, it would be a great hotel.Upon check in, we were given a City View room. When we went up to our room, I immediately turned around and went back down to the lobby and asked to be moved. The room was horrible. It looked like something out of a bad 70's movie. Dirt and grime.We were moved to the Waikiki City View in the Tower and same thing. I called down to the desk and told them we were checking out. They didn't seem to have a problem with that, and even gave us back our deposit. I guess this happens a lot!I would not recommend staying here. If you want a hotel that in right in the middle of the hustle and bustle, I would pay more. There are a lot of great hotels a little farther away from everything.P.S. We went directly to Hotel Renew and stayed there for the last 3 days of our honeymoon.

Me and my wife had recently been to honolulu. We stayed there 2 days before the cruise and 3 days after the cruise. I am a hotel person and my wife is an outdoor person so for her hotel is a place to come back to shower and sleep. Specially in Hawaii when there are so many things to do outside you go to agree to that.We were once on the 8th floor and the second time on the 5th floor with partial ocean and city view. Clean room flat Screen TV and decent shower. No doubt the hotel needs rennovation from its old decotr its still clean and neat all the way.We bid the price throught priceline and we got a great dealand the hotel is just 3 mins or say 2 mins walk to waikki beach and food is available right outside the hotel almost 24 hours burger king subway and right behind the international market place a fun place to shop.The only thing expensive is the parking $ 25 for 24 hours. So make sure you get the best deal on the hotel as you will end up paying 25 on any hotel in waikkiki. THERE IS NO FREE OR CHEAP PARKING IN WAIKIKKI.have fune there are loads of things to do in Honolulu so I had to go with my wifes thinking this time.CheersALOHAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

First time travelling with my 9mth old and wife so this experience was a bit different, but second time to Honolulu. Stayed in the tall tower on 16th floor with ocean view and i must say it was a great view with sun on the deck from 9am to 2-3pm. One king sized bed and a crib leaves little room left in the room but was manageable. Overall the room was clean but a bit dated. dripping faucets in the the bathroom and a motion sensor activated AC so when sleeping it can get rather hot in the room. Live entertainment everynight betweeen 6-9 approx. could cleary hear from room was loud at times when trying to put the liitle one down.There is a buffet style restaurant and a bar style food menu. Never ate at the buffet was 30$ per person but had the food at the bar and was approx 14$ per plate. Both are open concept with seating outdoors. The buffet breakfast is also expensive but you can opt for the take out breakfast for 10$ and they give you a container to load up what you want easily feeds 2 people.Pool was a little on the small side but with the beach is only a short walk away so didnt bother with it. All shopping and restaurants are easily within walking distance. Overall i would rate this a 7.5 out of 10. Reason being that if it wasnt for the employee rate that we had we would not of stayed there.
staff are friendly and accomodating... the hotel is just walking distance to the beach, downtown outlets, souvenir stores, fine restaurants, and convenience store...

Great location. Good service. Nice lobby and pool. Rooms however need a lot of work. They have spent money renovating the lobby but forgot the rooms, at least the one we were in. The first room we were given was next to the elevator and it was so noisy we felt we were still on the plane. We asked for a different room which we got right away and it was fine but they are definitely needing some work, especially the bathrooms. The location can't be beat though.

My wife and I stayed for one night following our cruise. I was very dissappointed with the hotel. The rooms are old and the plumbing is not up to date, the sink in the bathroom has no "stopper" to hold water in the sink, so when shaving, I just let the water run.The air conditioning was not working very well, so we opened the patio door to get some air when we went to bed, but a band playing somewhere below, we were on the 22nd floor, kept us awake till very late. The pillows on the bed look nice, but when you lay your head on them they go down like you just let the air out, they become flat where you head is on the pillow and the pillow curlsup on the ends. Since I have a neck problem and use two pillows all the time, the two pillows there were not equivalent to one normal pillow. I could not sleep, so I ended getting up at 3:30 Am and going outside the hotel and found some coffee at a 24 hour Burger King across the street. The comforter on the bed is also extremely "lumpy".WIFI is $14 a day, which is sort of expensive, since many hotels now have free WIFI in the rooms.The location of the hotel is good, but I will not stay there again.

I have to say that I was a little hesitant in booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews. I asked for a high ocean view room facing Diamond Head and that is what we got. All of the staff that we met were friendly and helpful. The rooms were just fine, and we didn’t feel that the hotel was dated at all. The location is perfect.

Stayed here Oct 28-31, 2009. The hotel is dingy, dirty and smells very moldy. The first room we checked into had a broken A/C. The tech guy who came to look at it said it would take several days before they got around to fixing it so we moved. This place is simply ready to be re-done. The bathroom was filthy and beaten up, with water coming out of the tap smelling like strong sulpher. We also could hear our neighbors really clearly and the people above us walking around. The front desk and associated staff were very friendly and helpful. I would not stay here again. I've stayed in MUCH nicer places in this area.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a Deluxe High Ocean View Room on the 16th floor. We did have wonderful views of the ocean and city. However, even though we were up so high, we could hear the music from the lounge area every night from 6:30-11pm. The singing was nice, but it was difficult when we wanted to go to sleep. It was VERY loud, even with earplugs in. The way the courtyard is shaped makes the sound echo up to all of the rooms. The service by the hotel staff was very good. The front desk staff were attentive, gave an easy check in and check out, and even the travel booking lady was helpful when we wanted to book a one-day tour. The cleaning staff were also very good and efficiently cleaned everything daily.The rooms are very dated, but functional and useful. The bathroom tile was worn, had cracks, and the walls had little cracks, but nothing horrible. We had a private balcony, flat-screen tv, and a refrigerator, which was nice. The bed was ok in comfortability. The walls are very thin, however, so any talking by the neighbors can be heard easily. On our last night, a loud group of people checked in next door and were laughing and screaming. I called guest services to complain, and within 2 minutes, a security guard came and knocked on our neighbor's door to tell them to quiet down. Very efficient hotel staff. The pool was big, there were 4 computers for internet access in the lobby, and the location was excellent. We were right across the street from the beach, and there were stores and shops all around.

Stayed for 7 days. Perfect location,one block to beach,one block to major bus route, major restaurants and stores close by. Clean rooms. Some complain about nightly noise from poolside entertainment, we couldn't hear anything,but who stays in their hotel room when you have so much to do. By the time we got back to the hotel,the music had stopped.

The staff were super friendly and we were upgraded when we arrived. I am not sure if there was a difference because the room was still very plain. It was a bit cramped but OK. The rooms were a bit old, but still clean. The location was great, pool was great and the staff were all very friendly.........Would probably stay again.

I was in Hawaii for a few days conference mid week so I decided to make it a full 10-day vacation by tacking on a vacation on either end of my business trip. Although our business conference was in the Hyatt next door, I decided to book the Sheraton as I am a platinum member at Starwood. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by courteous bellman who quickly unloaded our bags and led us to reception. Upon arrival at reception had a short wait before we got to the front desk. They had a "standard deluxe room with ocean view' assigned for me despite being a platinum member and being entitled to a suite or "best room in the house". I asked the lady at reception for an upgrade and she delightfully offered one to me starting the 2nd day of our stay. So for the first night in the 'standard deluxe room', let me just stay that it fell short of our expectations. PROs- Clean room, standard amenities- Service by pool is pretty good and the food is also good. They have happy hour daily from 3:30-5:30.- Location is excellent only 1 block from the Waikiki beach with plenty of good restaurants nearby.- Room Service is excellent and very quickCONs- Small, somewhat cramped room- Sub-par bathroom - Bathroom amenities are as cheap as they come - Bathroom is somewhat cramped, very small - Only 1 sink - Shower is sultra basic white plastic style - I would expect this at a comfort inn not at Sheraton Hawaii - do not expect anything luxiours in the bathroom - I hate to knitpick but the grout between the titles was not properly cleaned-> Ocean facing is great, but at night they have a live band and if you have a family with small kids, expect a room that is not 100% silent. Even though we were on the 8th floor we could clearly hear the music in our room- THE POOL: It's not very big or impressing, basic round oval. The kids section is exceptionally small and they only allow arm band floats no full floats.-

This was our second stay at this hotel and I still have no complaints. The location is wonderful, right across the street from the beach and in the heart of it all. We stayed in a high ocean view room which in my opinion is worth the extra money for. The room overlooked the pool as well as having the wonderful view of waikiki beach from our balcony. It also had a very comfortable king bed.There are lots of activites at the hotel - hula dancing, pinapple tasting etc. A traditional hawaiian band also plays by the pool at night which is a great way to unwind over a drink at the end of the day. The pool has plenty of sunbeds to relax in and there is also a poolside bar (serving food as well).Our future trips to Hawaii will always include the Sheraton Princess.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. It was a great location and beautiful hotel overall. There is a restaurant on premises and nighthly shows that are free with a bar. During the day there is a pool with wait staff and a 3 minute walk to the beach. There are convenience stores as well as a subway sandwich shop right across the street for a quick bite to eat.They also have a desk where you can book excursions and they are very accomodating in every aspect of planning your vacation. I would definitely stay here again.

we have been to hawaii 6 times and stayed at the spk the last two times. rooms are clean and nice and quiet. staff is very friendly and bend over backwards for you. In 2008 we went for our 40th anniversary and renewed our vows on magic island. Our travel company was supposed to meet us at the airport with leus and they didnt i called them and they said they would deliver to the hotel for us. they didnt i explained our woes to the desk clerk when i went to get them and they werent there and she went in back and came out with two very nice ones. our day wasnt ruined. also they have compouters in the lobby with high speed internet for free and another one you can bring up your flights with and print boarding passes for free. always a band playing on stage by the pool and wonderful food. is real close to everything and across the street from waikiki beach. couldnt get and closer to the sights and night life and there is a lot of night life.

We stayed at this hotel because we found great rates ($85/night) and figured since it was part of Starwood it would be nice..boy were we suprised! we were given a smoking room when we did not request one and the walls were super thin we could hear the room next to us ;( After complaining we were able to be upgraded for points to a semi nicer room. We would have left the hotel but it was already paid for and non-refundable.

From the moment you enter the beauitful open lobby of the hotel, you are engulfed in Hawaiian culture and atmosphere. Everyone from the bellstand, front desk, restaurant staff, and maids work to ensure you have a wonderful time. Centrally located, all key sites are conveniently located. The pool is the BEST. Wind is no problem, as the pool is surrounded by beautiful landscaping and structures. The rooms are luxurious, and you feel you've entered paradise as you sit on the lanai outside the room. One of my favorite morning activities is sitting on the balcony, and sipping Kona Coffee while reading the morning paper (delivered free to each room). Can hardly wait to go back!
Room is kind of old however no complaints for the price you pay for. Best of all you could charge your charges from Westin & Sheraton Waikiki to your room.
The fire alarm went off all night and I had no sleep, and no compensation for horrible stay

My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess. We prepaid through Orbitz. Knowing that this hotel was in the center of Waikiki, I was looking forward to being here. Unfortunately we found the hotel to not be up to the standards that are normally associated with Sheratons. The room was very small, and the bathroom is extremely outdated. The tub/shower needs to be replaced, as well as the sink. There was no counter and no hot water in the shower! The rug is worn out and the balcony could use some paint and tile. We paid for an upgrade, so we did get a free buffet breakfast and a partial ocean view, which was nice. The bed was also very comfy. The TV is old style and there was no room/hotel info in the room at all. I would not stay here again. I figured by paying for the upgrade, we would be given a decent room. I was wrong.

The Sheraton is centrally located on Kalakaua Avenue (the main drag) and within walking distance to everything we wanted in Waikiki. The staff, although clearly busy all the time, were friendly, helpful and accommodating. Perks such as left luggage and hospitality rooms were all a part of the package, and the package was jammed full of features. Our room was large, airy and comfortable, and faced the pool. There was free Internet, thoughtfully limited to 15 mins per visit. Honestly, if anyone needs the Internet more than 15 mins while on holidays, then perhaps they should just bring a laptop. As well as the Internet, free newspapers are provided, plus comfortable chairs to read them in. The pool is large, warm, surrounded by lounge chairs, and the beach towels are free for guests. An outdoor shower ensures that you can wash the sand from your toes before heading up to your room. Happy hour brings cocktails to your lounge chair, encouraging the indulgences. There's much more at the Sheraton, but I'll end here and say two thumbs up.My husband was on conference and I was at the pool. Really, life could not be sweeter!We also visited Pearl Harbor, and took TheBus. If I had to change anything about our trip, I'd say look for a shuttle to get you there, or consider banding together to hire a cab. TheBus took about 90 mins, which was something which we hadn't factored into our plans, and with limited free time in Paradise, who wants to spend 3 hrs on a bus?

The staff goes above and beyond in service and friendliness. Our ocean view was fabulous and priced right. Nice room. The entertainment was fabulous. I have been to Hawaii several times and I always stay here because of the terrific location, food, entertainment, and service. Waikiki Beach across the street, now how can it get any better than that? I highly recommend it. I've never been disappointed.

Spent 5 nights here after spending 3 nights at the Sheraton Waikiki. Compared to the Sheraton Waikiki this hotel is in drastic need of an update. We stayed in the Princess wing of the hotel with a city view. Upon entering the room, I felt I was back in the mid '80's. The room was rather small but did have a nice sized balcony. There was no Sweet Sleeper bed but it did have a nice floral print bedspread circa 1985 :) The TV was the exact same TV I had in college, all 20" of it. The bathroom was of decent size but the tiles and fixtures are out of date. On the plus side, the room was pretty clean and towels and linens were changed daily.The pool area is rather small for a large size hotel but the deep end is 8ft which is rare these days. They do have an excellent fitness center with modern equipment. The lobby is rather old looking and off to the side is the computer/business area with free internet.I'm guessing with the recent renovation of the Sheraton Waikiki just down the street, the owners are looking to sell the Kaiulani before a renovation takes place.

I just got back from a 1 week trip to Hawaii and I stayed at the Princess for the entire duration. The hotel is excellent, nice rooms, very clean and well maintained. The bath rooms were decent size nothing luxurious. The lobby looks a little old but nothing to complain. The hotel staff very friendly and I got upgraded to Full Ocean View for a small charge and it was totally worth it. Also we spent very little time in the room that the size or amenities in the room did not matter too much.The location is great and I would definitely stay there again. Strongly recommend a full ocean view room if possible.

We stayed in hotel for 11 nites. Hotel has great entertainment,pool, bars/restaurants etc. We loved it - housekeeping staff was fantastic. The only thing that was bad is that we had ants in our room most of the time - when we spoke to hotel management they advised us that its their ant season and not much can be done. I found that very strange - we would have 100+ ants every day. Staff at the bar was sometimes a bit rude - I guess when they deal with so many tourists every day they get a bit over it. Our room had no view - we had a standard room that looked at the airconditioning vent but room was clean at all times and refilled with coffee and tea every day.We would def stay here again but since the hotel was high in price we will check out other hotels before rebook in this hotel again. We are due back in 2 months and will def be visiting Princess kaiulani for nite entertainment and drinks.

Wallpaper peeling from the wall, dirty clothing and shoes left by the previous guests, bathroom was rarely cleaned ( including hair sticking to the shower walls and toothpaste stains that remained for days.) Complaints worked for a day or two but then the cleaning became non-existent again. The bathroom faucets were rusting through the paint that had been applied over the fixtures. The room was supposed to be ADA compliant but the shower head (hand unit) was placed at atleast 5 feet high and the controls were placed on the other side of the shower from the bench at least 5 feet away. How is a person in a wheelchair or unable to stand in the shower supposed to reach these?The internet service in the rooms was prone to not working. There were long lines for the 4 computers in the business center. They also didn't work well and would often not connect to many websites such as yahoo and facebook. The bathrooms off the pool also had not seen proper cleaning. The chairs and chaise loungers had not been scrubbed down in quite some time. You could see the dirt build-up on them. It looked as if the entire hotel had been neglected of basic care for years.I took pictures of all of this. I also brought it to the attention of Sheraton (local management and coporate offices) and was blown off. I was a loyal customer of Sheraton but now longer. Worst service I have ever received. I'll take Motel 6 over them anyday. At least I would get a clean room and better amenities in this case at a third of the price.

Let me start with all the good things. I arrive at around 10am from Japan so we were really tired. The front desk agent gave us an early check in and we paid for an upgrade with Breakfast and internet which was very reasonable $45.00 per night. The breakfast was very good. Omelets, fruits, breads, pancakes, french toast, juices. It was enough to keep you up until late afternoon. Plus it was served until 11am so you can sleep all morning. The beach was 5 minutes away. You could walk basically everywhere in the Waikiki Area, however, we rented a car to go to Pearl Harbor. There was a happy hour and music everyday in the pool area which was really nice. And there is a show "A polinesyan journey" right in the hotel. The show was O K. Overall I would comeback. My only complaint is that I called room service to bring me 2 empty glasses of champagne for a bottle I bought and they were not able to bring them to the room because that "was not their job" and housekeeping couldnt do it either. A second complaint is all the birds walking on the tables during breakfast and eating from plates while people were in the buffet. Management should find a solution to keep the birds away from the dining area.  The room was clean, towels were in good conditions and the internet service was pretty fast and good but you have to pay for it.

At hotel 4 nights- traveled with pre teen,spouse,senior citizenPros-Nice hotel,clean,fairly up to date. Great free coffee service in a.m. Nice evening turndown service. Most staff were polite and helpful. Really cool arts/crafts vendors in a.m. Valet and concierge staff nice. Front desk mostly polite.Cons- # 1- ASK to be in a QUIET room if music bothers you! We asked to be moved because of loud music from the Internatl Marketplace. I understand there is a lot going on,but it was hard to sleep with music blaring until 1 a.m.,then wake up at 5 for a 6 :00 shuttle/tour pick up. The music problem was NOT the hotel music- that was nice and done by 9:30. We were irritated when informed that a quieter room was considered an upgrade. So.... in order to have a quiet night of slumber I have to pay more??? I can tolerate a lot,but that was out of line in my opinion. We were moved to the 6th floor. MUCH BETTER!!!!

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights after visiting the Big Island. We were both a little worried after reading other reviews, but upon arriving we were SOOOO surprised. You have to remember that this is not a "5 star" hotel......if you want that then you should stay at a "5 star" like the Royal Hawaiian or a Ritz type property. I will start with the positives........We stayed in room #1256 in the newer tower......try to avoid rooms in the Princess tower as it is very old and MUCH smaller balconys.*Front desk staff was great. We are Starwood Preferred Guests (gold) so we got to go to the Preferred Guest line. We were originally assigned a corner king room but it was a smoking room so we were then given the option for a partial ocean view but it was 2 double beds. We took that and we were very pleased. WHAT A VIEW!!!! *Great location, right next to the Internation Market Place. The Westin Moana Surfrider and the Outrigger Waikiki are directly across the street. If you have already done the island before and you just want to hang out in the Waikiki area the is no need for a car. *Plenty of restaurants around ie. Cheesecake Factory, Duke's, Cheeseburger in Paradise, Subway, Roundtable Pizza (be careful of the bartender named Robert.....), KFC, Burger King, Senor Frogs, Hawaiian Cookie Co. (you gota check this place out), P.F. Changs.*Very clean room, you just need to remember that the turnover at resort/vacation destination hotels is very high. Maid service was wonderful (eventhough we didn't use it). The maid staff was very friendly also.*Awesome balcony.......a table and 2 chairs and there is plenty of room.*Wonderfully comfy bed. Down comforter. *Fridge and safe in room.Now the negatives............none of them were really a big deal and they would not stop us from staying here again. Really it just prevented me from giving this property 5 stars.*The room is not spacious. A little cramped, but you are in Hawaii, how long are you really in your room?*Very crowded pool, should be bigger for the size of the hotel.*Although we only had 1 drink during happy hour (I believe it was 3pm-5pm) we did walk through both the breakfast ($19.95) and dinner ($29.95) buffets and for the selection of food didn't seem worth the $.*You can not charge the coffee to your room at the coffee bar at the pool.*Terrible shower head....especially if you are over 5 ft. 5 inches and the shower wouldn't drain.*If you have a car (we didn't) they charge $20 a day to park.O.K. here is some additional "general" information........Happy Hours and area restaurants, bare with me, this info is what I remember but may not be %100 accurate. You will at least have a general idea.*P.F. Changs- 3pm-6pm 1/2 priced select appetizers and some drinks are discounted, just check.*Top of Waikiki- 4 or 5pm-7pm $4 martinis.....try the 1st one on the menu, it's ginger and awesome. Select appetizers, sweet potato chips, some sort of chicken and a few others.*Senor Frogs pours a mean drink.....just remember that it's a tourist trap but worth checking out.Duke's-$14.95 breakfast buffet......AWESOME 7:30am-10:30am Made to order omeletes, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, eggs benedict, biscuts and gravy, rice, toast and bagles, pancakes or waffles, french toast and fresh fruit.Duke's bar-wings, waffle fries, quesadillas, burgers, pizza and great calamari......you gota check it out!! The bar staff is awesome too!*Big Kahuna-3pm-6pm 1/2 price appetizers and drink specials. We also ate breakfast there. Great!! $8.95 for 2 eggs, ham, bacon, sausage and either rice of hashbrowns.The Shack-don't bother unless the 20's scene is your thing. Drinks are weak and the zuchinni we had was way greasy.*Don't bother to go to Moose Magilacuties(sp?).....BAD drinks and service.All in all our visit was great!!! We would definately stay here again!! One last tip, we went and checked out a room and the Westin across the street to see if it was worth 16,000 Starwood pts. ( when we booked at the Sheraton PK it was 7000 pts. and was raised to 10,000) We asked to see a standard room. It was nice but VERY small and dark with no ocean view. Not worth it to us. We tried to also check out the Sheraton Waikiki but it was super busy and just way too big. Just try the Sheraton PK.....you won't be sorry!!

Great location, our room had partial ocean view overlooking the swimming pool. I would rate rooms 2-3 stars, small but clean and for the price we were very happy. Very busy hotel with thin walls so that we could clearly hear our daughters in the next room. Staff helpful

We stayed here for 7 nights with our young daughter 8 mos. The hotel is in a great location, across from the beach & in the middle of lots of shops in Waikiki. They have great Hawaiian entertainment nightly. Down side is that the rooms are very old and outdated and rather small. No valet parking, parking is self park and is $20.00 a day which is the standard rate in Waikiki. Another negative is that it was very noisy at night in our room with the street noise/music even though we were on the 24th floor.

I read the most recent reviews for the Sheraton Kaiulani and I have the say that they were about right. To love or hate the hotel will depend a lot of what do you expect your vacation to be. Let me start by saying that we got a terrific rate of $98 booked directly from the hotel site, with AAA discount (they did ask for my AAA card at check in). No resort fees but you pay $20 for self parking. It is a pretty good deal for Waikiki, especially for the location so close to the beach and to the "action."Check in was very easy, everybody was very friendly and polite. I was upgraded to a room with a view of the swimming pool. The room was not as small as I thought, but it was sure in dire need for a renovation (the door seemed to have been forced). The room was a prime seat for the performance they have at the pool (singers, hula demos etc.). The problem is that we had two kids exhausted from the flight that needed to sleep early, impossible with show. So I asked the receptionist to change rooms. She was very helpful, but she mentioned that rooms facing other sides could be worse in terms of noise because of the particular location (in particular, rooms facing the international market tend to suffer most from noise, as they always have something going on there). She said that rooms facing the pool would be the quietest after the end of the show (by 9pm, which was true). However, she offered to move us to another room that was available at the same building, also facing the pool, and left me a key so both my wife and I could see it before we decide to move. The other room was actually better, the music from the pool was still loud, but it was quiet right after 9pm, as promised. Plus, the new room was in a little better condition and we actually had a bit of an ocean view (actually the view is obstructed by the Moana Surfrider right in front of the Sheraton PK, but you are able to see a little bit of the ocean at the left side of the Moana. It was actually quite nice.We had a car rental, so we paid $20 for parking. The parking is a 5 store structure without elevator adjacent to the hotel. Some reviewers mentioned that the layout of the staircase is kind of weird. Make sure you learn which stairway will lead you the closest to the hotel - if you find it, you won't have any problem. They have coin-operated laundry at the basement - very convenient, we used it twice. Free computers on the lobby was also very useful (limited to 15 minutes of use). They also have stands selling souvenirs, and tons of (free) activity during the day.Location is great, just steps from the beach park - the Moana Surfrider is just across the street on Kalakaua - the beach is to the left of the Moana. There plenty of shops and ABC stores surrounding the hotel. The International Market is on the same block, just a couple of steps from the hotel. The place is very lively, and where a lot of "action" is located. Lots of interesting street performers (like those you see in Santa Monica's promenade). On the minus side, there are plenty of "professional ladies" walking through the area around 9pm, so if that bothers you, you may want to reconsider the location. I thought that, all things considered, the hotel was a tremendous value, although I am not sure if I would stay there again, especially considering that we did most of our sightseeing and beachcombing outside the Waikiki area.

don't get a room near the lifts, had the noise factor most of the night with lifts going up and down with a gushing wind sound coming from them !!but overall only really slept in the rooms which were out dated and a bit small bathrooms but then again one of the cheapest places on the main strip, so didn't really expect too much. Lots of kids at the pool so head for the beach for relaxation. Plenty of places to eat around this hotel so enjoyed the walk in the evening sourcing them out.Had a beautiful romantic dinner across the road at the Moana (westin) and if had the money would have stayed there for the duration of our holiday. But our stay at the sheraton for the price was overall ok, got an up grade to a deluxe room and had a laugh to ourselves about the 2 beds in the room, so much for a romantic getaway ??? recommend this place for families and the elderly.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were vacationing with friends who have been to Hawaii before. They chose the Princess Kaiulani because of staff discount privileges. All in all, it's exactly how everyone else describes it: an older hotel that's rather dated looking. The hotel and our room was clean and tidy however, and nothing was broken or in disrepair (except for the ice machine on our floor, which forced us to go to the next floor every time we wanted ice). The location is very central and it's a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Other than that, nothing really stood out about the hotel, either good or bad. I was continually annoyed at how two computer stations in the lobby were missing (one was gone, the other marked "out of order"). And for whatever reason, the cleaning staff is really chintzy about replacing our tea bags--I called once to complain after not receiving any refills for days. The bags showed up promptly, then not again for the rest of our stay. Equally chintzy is the lack of replacement of our tiny bars of soap and shampoo. And I was a bit surprised to find that they don't drop off complimentary newspapers, like many other hotels I've stayed. The economy must be hurting.For whatever reason, the hotel pool closes very early. There's nothing like a refreshing dip in the pool after dinner, when it's nice and cool. But guess what? The pool closes at 7 p.m.! I guess it's so that pool patrons don't disturb the show going on, but almost no one was watching the show anyway. The alternative is hiking to the beach at dusk. For some reason, having salty sea water splash your face in the dark is not entirely pleasant. We dined at the hotel restaurant once for the dinner buffet and once for the breakfast buffet. Standard fare, but again they took the food away way too early (9 p.m. for dinner and 10 a.m. for breakfast). Compared to Vegas, the "city that never sleeps", Honolulu must be the city where you're encouraged to go to sleep.

Pros: Across the street from Waikiki Beach; a few steps away from the International Market Place; 10 min walking distance from "Luxury Row" - high end shopping i.e Coach, Louis Vitton etc. and a lot of great bars in the area as well.. The hotel concierge booked all our tours the day we arrived; great customer service and we even got a bottle of champagne and an upgrade to beach view because it was our anniversary. Finally the hotel offers free lei making classes and other enjoyable relaxing entertainmentCons: the buffet is expensive and not that great - I think it was almost $30 but if you get the "to go" box its $10 and you can fill it up with the food you are going to eat.. ; the pool was closed one of the days we were there because of "bacteria"; there are usually a handful of prostitutes just "hanging out" near the hotel at night.. Finally there is quite a bit of street noise and the rooms are not "sound proof"

After 5 nights at Sheraton Waikiki I thought that Princess Kaiulani would be a disappointment but I was surprised to see that they had BIGGER room & bathroom. The atmosphere still had the ohana touch in it. Its not directly beside the beach side but the beach is right accross the street. The hotel view to chose from is either city or beach view. This time we took on the city view. The hotel is good access to the bus stop. Among the 3 Starwoods we staid at in Waikiki, Princess Kaiulani was definitly my favorite.

I stayed over 40 nights in the Princess Kaiulani Hotel in April, May and June of 2009 for business. My overall opinion of the hotel - it's a pretty good value for the price. It's not a new hotel, so don't expect much from the interior. But, Waikiki and Oahu is great, so you shouldn't be in your hotel too much anyway. Think of this hotel as more of a home base. If all you want to do is stay at your hotel, then the PK would not impress you. Pro's:- You're within 100 yards of the Ocean, just across the street. Great value.- There are three other 5- and 6-star Starwood hotels within 5 minutes walk (Moana Surfrider, Sheraton Waikiki, Royal Hawaiian). You can relax at any of these hotels and charge food/drinks to your room at the PK (Princess Kaiulani). Pay for the cheaper room here and hang out at the others...they're incredible.- Most of the hotel personnel are very sweet.- Right on the strip. Much fun watching the street performers and people watching.- Lots of neat free activities on weekends - crafts, painting, hula dancing, pineapple carving.- bands play every night by the pool until 9:30pm, then a solo acoustic guy by the bar until 11pm'ishCon's:- If you are a light sleeper, do NOT stay in an odd numbered room in the tower. The street vendors, particularly the steel drum player, will keep you up until 11pm. (keep in mind, I was on business and had to be up early)- It's a kinda old, tired hotel. Don't expect too much in the interior- The buffet is not worth the $40-$45. Average food. Suggestions:1. Ask for a even numbered room in the tower. Great views of the ocean and quiet.2. Stay here, hang out at the other Starwood resorts. If you have the money, upgrade to Sheraton Waikiki. If you have even more money, go to Moana Surfrider.3. Food is a little more expensive in Waikiki. I was on a cheap per diem, so my recommendation for food would be: - Cheescake Factory. It has mainland prices, not hawaii prices. It's very busy, so you might have to take it to go. No problem, eat at the tables near the beach and watch the sunset. Why not? - Duke's - this is probably the most happening spot for happy hour. Ate fish tacos and watched whales breaching in the ocean. - ummm...that's about it. Nothing great going on in Waikiki for food.Things to do:- Surf. Surf, surf, surf. Surf! It is the easiest break possibly anywhere in the world, but still fun for advanced surfers (I'm intermediate)- Hike to the top of Diamond Head (yes, it's about a 4 mile hike to there and back from the hotel)- Take a catamaran around the corner of Diamond Head- Rent a car and go see the North Shore, sunset beach, Waimea Bay. See the turtles on the beach, basking in the sun.

The room was very cheap in appearance. The hotel service was limited to non-existent. There is no room service, and only the most limited of ammenities. The manager was unkind and not very accomodating. The price of garage parking was about $20 a night, which is ridiculous. The location is alright. There are plenty of shops and restaurants which thankfully stay open on the weekends late into the night. The bed was nice and comfortable. I found the experience of staying there to be embarrasing and a great dissappointment. I would recommend going to another Hotel.

I was a little concerned when booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this site but I decieded to book it anyway. We opted for the high ocean view room and were not disappointed they put us above the noise from the International Markets right up on the 28th floor.So the place is old but its clean and tidy, well cared for and we had a great time staying there and will stay when we return to Hawaii. Yes the A/C was not ice cold because the cleaners turn them up every day so I just turned them down again. The staff were all pleasant and courteous and manaemant were surprised we stayed 9 days and sent us a couple of gift baskets, but unless you are going to stay on another Island the location is perfect.Across the road from the beach with so much in walking distance, next door to the International Markets across the road from The Cheesecake Factory, The Rock Island Cafe and so much more. A short walk to the Zoo and A must see is their "Creations" show we skipped the dinner package and just had the drinks option, we even had a photo opportunity with the cast afterwards.Make sure you grab a meal at the food court great value and something very different try it all, I can sum up by saying we didn't expect or pay for five star but demanded much better than back packer accomodation we got the standard I expect when travelling oversea's.

This stay was the last 4 days on a two week Hawaii honeymoon - so we were attracted to a more affordable room for the end of an amazing (and expensive) three weeks in our lives. We combined starwood points with cash to bring the nightly room cost down to $60. I was nervous that the rooms would be very tacky, or we would hussled around like classic package tourists. Not only did those fears not happen - we had a great time in this hotel - thanks in large part to an amazing staff that went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. And the room was simple and white - but not tacky. In one of my customer service interactions, I went to the front desk to get change for using the guest laundry facilities. I mentioned that my newlywed wife had a cold and asked where could I get her some tea. The front desk clerk asked me to wait a moment. She left and personally brought back a cup of hot water, teas, honey packets, and lemons - rather than referring me to the restaurant, etc. The hotel general manager also heard that we were on our honeymoon and sent us champagne - not only on our first night, but also on our last! All in all, the staff in this hotel exhibited a true genuineness of spirit that transcended the box hotel expectations.The dinner buffet was good (including all you can eat yummy crab legs). The evening poolside Hawaiian music was REALLY good. The hotel is popular with Japanese wedding parties, which made for fun people watching. It's a good location, AC works, fridge in the room, and comfortable pillows. Great value and a great stay!

we got a great rate for this hotel thorugh hotwire and were very pleased! Good location across the street from Waikiki beach, nice pool, good drinks at the pool deck bar. great way to spend our last day in Oahu. Location was better than the Embassy Suites we stayed at the beginning of our trip.The buffet at night was also very good. Very accomodating for our late night return flight, gave us the "aloha Suite" so we could shower, etc.I recommend this hotel. I would give it 3+ stars.

Big hotel, busy (lots of flight crews), but not crazy. Arrived mid-afternoon, and room was not ready yet. Had a room on the 26th floor in the Ainahau Tower with great ocean view...couldn't quite see Diamond Head. Rooms are older and tired, but clean enough and bed was comfortable. Computers in the lobby for internet access. Ms. O'Hare at the concierge desk was fantastic (thank you!). Location is pretty good....beach is just across the road, and many quality stores and restaurants are nearby (i.e. NOT the International Market). Overall, for the price, this hotel is a good deal.

This is a great place to stay if you want to be in a big hotel on the beach and have access to all of the shops and restaurants. For the price I expected the room to be a little more spacious and the bathroom was old and needed a renovation. Paying for the internet access in the room was a bit annoying, seems as though the Sheraton should be providing that.A few other tidbits: There are vendors in the lobby every day that sell local products, the pool is nice but lots of children so if you wanted peace and quiet you wouldn't find it at the pool (but Waikiki is probably not the place for peace and quiet anyway), the hotel across the street is gorgeous so we enjoyed our lower price hotel and drinking and dining with the glorious ocean view at the hotel across the street, the fitness center was very nice with lots of equipment and a large room

The Sheraton Kaiulani is close to everything,beach,shops and restaurants.We stayed on the 28th floor and overlooked the main street,International markets and a partial view of the beach and the rates were quite reasonable.The room was clean and comfortable with a balcony which we relaxed and had a few drinks while watching a street parade below.The staff were friendly and the pool was great.Would definately recommend this hotel but maybe ask for a room on the opposite side to have a better view of beach and also look over the pool.

We stayed at the Sheraton Princess in Honolulu for our honeymoon, booked as part of a package deal through an online travel site. The good stuff: Fantastic Location - we are able to walk everywhere from the hotel. In the mornings nipped onto Waikiki beach for a nice swim, before the blazing sun, due to the close proximity, we were able to come change at the hotel and head out for relaxing brunch. Loved the complimentary flowers at reception to tuck behind the ear. The not so good stuff: Price of meals at the restaurant were exceptionally high. The room was fairly small, and the bathroom could have used more cleaning. The mini balcony faced onto a parking lot, when we asked how much extra to get upgraded to a better room, though the price quoted of $20 per night was reasonable, none of the rooms had an unobstructed view of the ocean, which was dissappointing, especially so because this was our honeymoon. Overall would recommend hotel for non-special occasions. Good for peole with kids, because of its central location and close proximity to Waikiki beach.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for seven nights from 11th-18th June 2009 and overall we have no complaints whatsoever about it.Our stay was the third and final leg of a three centre holiday ( following San Francisco and Las Vegas) and we actually are not aware of what we exactly paid as the cost would be included within the full holiday package price.Therefore I cannot speak with regards to value for money but only as to how we found this hotel.Having read and contributed to Tripadviser for some years now, I am now convinced that the UK traveller and the US traveller apply a different set of standards to their hotel. The Sheraton PK is in line with British standards a very good 3 star hotel if not a 4 star hotel.Our room was very good. It was light; adequately furnished and had a huge bed that was so so comfortable. An absolute delight to sleep in!The flat screen TV ( hardly used as no BBC world news channel); the tea/coffee making facilitieds and the bathroom provison were all aceptable.Our balcony had a partial ocean view and looked down onto the International market. It was good to watch the sunset from the balcony; with a view of the ocean and listening to the sounds of the entertainers below whilst enjoying a cold beer or glass of wine that you have kept chilled in the room fridge. We did not hear our neighbours at all during the stay and simply cannot underatand the other reports of this being a problem.The location of the hotel is excellent. The beach is a short stroll away- only a few minutesk; acess to all the shops and resturants all within easy reach; and the ABC store on the doorstep for the aforementioned beer & wine.The hotel lobby is comfortable with a number of activities taking place each day which contributed to the Hawaiin feel of the hotel. The availabliity of hotel towels was very good as these could also be taken to the beach with no limit on the number.The pool area was fine although I did not swim in the pool during our stay.We also did not eat in the hotel at any time as we felt the cost was over priced and we found nearby places to eat offered far better value for money.There may be better hotels - such as those on the ocean beach front - but I am certain that you will pay a far higher price for your stay.I would have no problems recommending the Sharaton PK.

I am a member of SPG reward club. I had a choice between the Sheraton Waikiki or the Princess Kaiulani for our Hawaii vacation. I had stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki back in the early 70's with my girlfriends so I knew what a large, contemporary very busy hotel it was back then. After reading the Sheraton Waikiki postings on travel advisor with construction noise complaints, etc., my husband and I selected the Princess Kaiulani. We made an excellent choice! Our room was on the 5th floor facing the pool. It was very clean, comfortable and relaxing. Our pillow-top bed was great! We were also able to enjoy our balcony in the evenings and listen to the free evening entertainment. The Princess has a great location - close to the beach, center of Waikiki, numerous restaurants and convenient access to public transportation. The concierge, front desk, housekeeping and other Staff were always helpful with our questions/concerns. They even had onsite activities and I made a beautiful orchid lei. Also, we were quite impressed with the history of Princess Kaiulani and all the photos, historical info, etc., that the Sheraton displayed. I definitely would recommend this hotel and would return for another stay.

We have been dreaming of going to Hawaii for a long time however, the high cost has always been an issue. After finding a great deal on airfare, I searched for countless hours on the internet for just the right hotel. We are part of the Starwood Program & decided on The Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. This hotel is located "In The Heart of It All!" It is across the street from the beach, within walking distance to endless places to eat, has great evening entertainment & food, and was very clean. This hotel was very clean and had all the basics that you would need for your vacation. We really didn't spend that much time in the hotel because, its Hawaii! (Who stays in the hotel all day?) The staff was very accomodating & nice and when we go back, we will surely go to this hotel again.

My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani from June 1st to 7th. After 5 nights a group of partiers moved in next door to our room. We were on a non smoking floor. The balconies are very close and the guys having a party next door were out smoking on the balcony despite it was not allowed even on balconies.It was early Saturday evening and the smoke just flowed in into our room. Normally we would sit on the balcony and enjoy a drink before going out to dinner but we couldn't stand the smoke and had to leave a couple hours earlier than we would have liked. My wife couldn't even dry her hair after the shower. It was our last night in the hotel before leaving the next evening. We went to the front desk to let them know we were disrupted by the smoking and had to leave the room. The Manager on duty Ben really couldn't have cared less. He told us "the hotel is not liable for it's other guests." I told him we really were not happy and maybe since we were inconvenienced he could allow us a 2 hour late check out the next morning which is only 1 pm anyway. He said sure but he would charge us for it. I never met such an arrogant and rude manager in any hotel I have stayed. This Ben manager guy was so rude he actually ruined our evening more than the smokers. He simply didn't care. Just the worst customer service I have ever seen. How this guy becomes a manager at a Sheraton I don't know. It is too bad because we really enjoyed Waikiki so much and the Sheraton Princess was such a negative. The hotel is actually in a good location. The rooms are very dated and worn. The facilities are poor and the pool is disgusting to swim in. We didn't eat at the restaurants but they didn't look too appealing and heard from other guest the food was the worst they had in a long time and some of the most expensive in Waikiki. We will be going back to Waikiki every year but will avoid the Sheraton Princess for sure. it just is not up to the standards of other hotels we have stayed at and there are too many good ones in Waikiki to waste time with here no matter what price you pay. There is a reason it appears cheap.

I went here for a Christmas vacation with my extended family... This hotel was so nice! The rooms were standard. The staff was nice and so were the shuttles to and from the airport. The coolest thing about this hotel (apart from the short walk to the beach and shopping) was the Koi fish ponds downstairs. lol.

We stayed at the PK on two occasions recently as pit stops to the US and back home to Australia. We chose it because of the location and rate compared to others in the area. Here are the positives we experienced:Great location in downtown Waikiki if you want to stay where the action isWe had a fantastic ocean view from room 1960 and from 2060 on our return trip.Really comfy king bedFriendly enough and efficient staffThere were a couple of free computers to surf the net and check emails in the foyer area available for guests for 15 minutes a pop. Always a queue of course but better than nothing.And the negatives:Walls must be made of cardboard. We could easily hear our neighbours next door on both our stays. The first time we put down to bad luck. The second time we had booked for 5 nights but moved to another hotel after the first night. It wasn’t just bad luck. Management did not penalize us for departing early and the receptionist mentioned the connecting doors might be a factor in the noise. We could still hear the people next door talking until 1.30am.Our toilet blocked and overflowed. It was fixed very promptly though.This hotel seems to have more plumbing noises than the average hotel. Night time is when they are more obvious of course when we are wanting to sleep.When we were having breakfast pigeons were trying gallantly to land anywhere they could get a free meal. Staff were trying to guard peoples tables if they left their seats for a few minutes. I really didn’t feel like breakfast after that.Outdated tired looking rooms and bathrooms.$20 per night parking. Though this seems to be the norm in Hawaii.$10 per 24 hours for internet in your room if you have your own laptop. Though again this seems to be the norm at least in Hawaii.If it wasn't for the noise factor we would probably stay there again because of the rate (I would just avoid breakfast with the pigeons) I haven't noticed other reviewers complaining about the thin walls so maybe we had unusually bad luck. The receptionist did concede that people staying in the old tower do complain but people in the new tower (us) didn't usually.

Typical Sheraton. Great location, nice, friendly people. Lobby full of activity everyday. Rooms were decent size, king bed, sofa bed pull out, coffee table, desk, etc. nice lanai overlooking pool with live entertainment every night! Ask for a room over the pool! Rooms were a little dated but still nice. The only draw back was the service by the pool was slow at best. Other than that, we would recommend definitely for the money. Not on the beach, but a great location across from the Moana Surfrider.

Overall, I think that this is a good value for Waikiki. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are old and dated. However, our room was clean, and the bed was nice. The location is excellent -- although the steel drums do make a lot of noise outside (ask for a high up room if you can). We spent a bunch of time at the Sheraton Waikiki across the street -- they have an excellent bar right on the beach with live music from 12-3 daily, I believe. I would also recommend the Mai Tai cat -- they do sailings right from the beach and it was a lot of fun (there are several cats that leave from the beach; I am not sure that it matters which one you use). We also found the concierge to be extremely helpful -- but it can get really busy in the lobby, so you may have to wait. Lastly, note that parking is $20/day. Overall, this hotel is a good value in a good location, and so-so rooms. I would go back, though, but note that this is not the hotel to stay in if you spend a lot of time on your room and want something really nice.

My girlfriend and I were looking for a cheap place in Waikiki with a view. In that regard, this hotel was perfect. We were extremely pleased overall since we knew going in that it's not a chic, renovated hotel. We knew we'd be mostly out and around Waikiki and only use the hotel room sparingly. So if you're going to Hawaii to enjoy Hawaii, and don't mind 1980s feeling everything haha, I highly recommend this hotel.Room:We had a High Ocean View room that we got for only $10 a night more than a standard room. Soooooo worth it. View was outstanding. Not as good as the rooms closer to the ocean, but it meant we were away from people being to the north side of the building... and some on here have complained about noise which wasn't a problem for my girlfriend and I. We were going to sleep at 9pm Hawaii time and didn't find the noise a problem at all. The bed was super comfy and big. TV was a nice flat screen with normal cable that came in handy a few nights before bed when we were bored. Balcony was ugly, as in hideous, but you're looking at the ocean and not the ground in front of you. I knew the prices of the Hilton across from us, and laughed every time I thought what they were paying for essentially the same experience. All furniture from like, 1974. Clean. AC works well and kept me cool at night.Location: Excellent spot, as it's literally across one street to the beach. Saw like, two hookers because someone mentioned it on here and my girlfriend was LOOKING for them haha. But it's central Waikiki and much closer to the beach than many other hotels in this price range!Food:Didn't try the food because it's expensive. Tried drinks at the poolside lounge, which was nice. Service there wasn't so great, but the drinks were tasty and I'm chalking up the bad service to a bad day for our server.Services:Concierge was brilliant. Went there something like 4 times throughout our trip with questions and they were EXTREMELY helpful. Very, very happy with their service. Maids were good. Internet system was horrid. Two computers for the entire hotel when we were there. Good computer over by the concierge for flight bookings/look ups. Normal email checking was basically an impossibility. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone who compulsively checks their email every day and still would want to in Hawaii.Synopsis:Overall the hotel is no frills, nothing fancy. But it's right there across from the beach and if you don't mind sacrificing trendy new furniture for older style, ugly furniture, you'll get a view that's worth the exchange. I wanted to wake up and know I'm in Hawaii because I had never been; not be in some city-view room where I couldn't tell if I'm still in Vancouver because all I could see are buildings!!! My girlfriend didn't want to spend a lot since she's been to Hawaii 5 times already. Good balance of cheapness, comfort and view.

Let's start with the positives. As a Platinum SPG member we got an upgrade to a suite on the 28th floor with wonderful views. The hotel is across the street from the Ala Moana Westin also a Starwood property so we enjoyed their amazing public spaces and hung out on the beach. The staff was nice and friendly. We received Starwood points. We were thrilled to only be staying one night. We had a flat screen LG tv in our suite. I have no idea what the general rooms have. The sheets and towels were clean!Here are the negatives. The place was built in the 70's and is in deep need of refurbishment. Carpets are worn and easily at least 10 years old. The hallways and public spaces are dreadful. The breakfast buffet is $23.95 a complete joke given it's set up is mostly for the hordes of budget tourist groups from Japan that the hotel books. There are also a bunch of airline crews that overnight at this property. The pool is ultra small with cheapo pool furniture. Pool waiters are few and far between. The drinks and food are almost as much as across the street at the sister property so you might as well spend your money over there. The dinner buffet was $39.50, again completely overpriced, especially in relation to the other restaurants in the area.There are two dinner shows offered at the property. We didn't even consider them given the food we saw being served at the buffets.We also met some people who were staying on a package bought online from one of the most famous hotel bidding sights. They paid well less than $100/night. Our rate was $109 and that's as much as I felt comfortable paying.The location of the hotel is great, even though it's across the street from the beach. I would wonder when if ever Sheraton/SPG will demand the owners shut down and remodel. My guess is they never will as the hotel is simply going after the budget set of travelers, cheapo tour groups or SPG members who book without realizing how dated this property is. We stayed on a Friday night and the pool/bar area had entertainment until around 10 pm so there is a noise factor even up on the 28th floor that will drown out your tv. We left a generous tip for the housekeeper because we felt sorry she had to work in such a dump and because we're guessing the tourist groups don't tip very well. We bought a bottle of wine and after coming back to enjoy it in the room found there were no wine glasses or cork screw and hence no mini bar....it's the wrong clientele. When I called the front desk to ask for wine glasses and a cork screw they laughed and said room service doesn't open until 5 pm and on top of that they never bring cork screws to the room. They had me take the elevator down to the pool bar to cork the wine and pick up two wine glasses. The bartender was very nice and no they did not try to charge a corking fee. She had obviously corked a number of room's wine bottles previously. If you're looking for a budget hotel and don't care about ambience or the rooms and public spaces, then this is your place. Our bathroom did not have the typical Sheraton double headed shower system or curved shower curtains. It did have a colored jetted tub from the 70's with sliding glass doors and a broken temperature adjust knob. Literally nothing was updated except maybe the pergo floors in the bedroom area. I'm guessing they used to be carpeted. I wouldn't pay anything more than the $109 we paid per night, otherwise I'd feel we got taken. This property is advertised as a 3 Star property so I would hate to see what is considered a 2 Star or 1 Star property. I would rate it a two star property.

We spent a week at the Princess Ka'iulani and found the hotel to be clean, run by very nice staff, nicely decorated. The hotel honors the late Princess Ka'iulani with many paintings and displays. It was our first time staying at Waikiki and found the noise and throngs of people a bit overwhelming after 2 previous weeks in remote locations on other islands. After a nearly sleepless night the first night on the 4th floor above the hotel driveway and the Kings village, we went to the front desk and asked to know our options for moving to a quieter room. They allowed us to view a couple of rooms and we chose one on the 8th floor above the pool. We had a partial ocean view that was lovely and could hear the music from the stage down below. The crafters and free activities in the lobby were wonderful and they brought a total Hawaiian feel to the place. We loved the band and hula dancers who performed most nights! If you get a chance to see the DaLima family perform, they are amazing!We were close to many shops and the beach. We found the bus system pretty easy to use as well.The next time we visit , I think i would probably chose a hotel that is not in such a busy location. The Princess Kaiulani is a nice hotel and we got great value for our money.

We stayed here for one night en route to mainland USA. I chose the hotel for several reasons - SPG member, a good rate for a guaranteed Waikiki Beach view, location for my partner's first time to Honolulu.Couldn't fault the staff, all very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in straight away just before midday after a very delayed flight from Sydney. We had a high floor (28?) with a fantastic view over Waikiki Beach. The bed, linen and tv were first class, the rest of the room very ordinary and dated but clean. The railings on our lanai were extremely rusted - a bit hesistant to actually stand on the lanai at all - and the door to the lanai did not close properly so we had whistling wind the whole time (only here for the night so didn't complain). We had a non smoking room (which included no smoking on the lanai) on a non smoking floor but our neighbour obviously couldn't read. I did mention it to the receptionist on check-out and they sent housekeeping up to check. Can anyone tell me why a smoker would book a room in this section of a hotel and completely disregard both the rules and the comfort of other guests? We witnessed a guest at the Coconut Waikiki doing exactly the same and it is a completely 100% non smoking hotel - I hope he copped the $200 cleaning fee.

The hotel is in a great location if you are interested in the beach or if you want to be close to the International Marketplace and King's Village. However, it is a place I would recommend if you are interested in just a room and not so interested in much else. It was EXTREMELY busy. Many times it would take 5 -10 minutes just to get an elevator.The hotel staff was kind, but gave us a smoking room instead of non-smoking. While they fixed this issue in about twenty minutes; the new room was not very clean. The room was very simple but cute and with a nice view. However, there was quite a bit of dust and the bathroom was really gross. I went to the corner ABC shop (would recommend) and bought something to clean the bathroom myself (hair on many surfaces).The pool looked nice but it was very busy and normally the hotel in general was LOUD.My husband and I went to the International Marketplace and it was very interesting. Many vendors were willing to negotiate prices and I bought a jewelry box for $20 that we had seen at King's Village for $130!

We had a week at the SPK. The beds are the smallest Queen sized beds you will find and after a while are a bit hard on the body. Our room overlooked the pool so that was quite good. The rooms have all you need for a family holiday too, fridge, TV, bath, aircon. Check in was very easy too.I hunted around for ages and ages for a decent price on the net, and we ended up paying $ 120 / night. I now hear that the hotel had better offers when booking over the phone direct!!!! Never mind.The location of the hotel is very central. If you dont want to pay for one of the hotels overlooking the beach then this is probably your best option. The pool is nice, although the water is bloody cold for some reason!!!! The hotel puts on poolside entertainment daily which is good fun.All in all the SPK is good value, although they could have done a package deal with breakfast which would have been a lot better for us, but you cant have it all.Parking is $20 a day which is quite expensive, but there is no other local option available.Also the local ladies of the night do like to congregate around the area, so you may need to show some caution when out and about at night!!!!!

I picked this place because it had a special on Starwood Preferred Guest. As a Platunim SPG member I expected something. Typically a Sheraton will upgrade you to a suite and provide a gift from the manager. Nothing.Except a room overlooking the parking garage. OK. Here's the real scoop from a seasoned traveler:- Rooms are adequate for the generic public.- Things are clean and the balconies are nice in that they jut out of the building.- The place shows it's age. This is an understatement. I expected Jack Lord (Hawaii Five-0) to knock on the door. Yeah. Mid-70's with late 80's/early 90's rehabbed hotel furniture.- For the price, (149/night) I'd rather have splurged for something a little more fun.

Have stayed here several times over the past few years. It's really showing its age, but it is cheap and centrally located. Being part of the hareaton chain is an advantage as you can charge meals etc at Royal Hawaiian, Moana Surfrider, Sheraton Waikiki back to the PK.Seems to be very popular with Japanese tour groups, which makes checking in a headache if you're unfortunate enough to coincide with one of those groups!If you're looking for a budget hotel that's centrally located the PK is definitely worth considering at discounted prices. NOT worth rack rates though! Bear in mind it is noisy, even on the higher floors, particularly in the Ainahou Tower facing the International Marketplace.There are plans for a major redevelopment, but this appears quite some way off. http://www.graysbeach.com/PrincessKaiulani/intro for info about this.

The rooms here are clean, though a little old - could use a facelift. The hotel lists the bed options as King or 2 Doubles. The double beds are full sized at best, not doubles! The furniture is quite crowded in the small rooms. We did have a balcony with a view of Waikiki beach to the right. Being on a corner and 22 floors up, it was windy 100% of the time - not just the usual trade winds, but loud, serious winds day and night. We got a great room rate via Travelzoo.com but the hotel surprised us with a number of charges we hadn't thought about. The parking in their own garage is $20 a day for guests. The in-room internet charge is $4 for 2 hours, or $13 for the day. The safe has a note on it stating that it costs $3.25 a day for use, though we weren't billed for it at the end of our stay. The restaurant buffet is $40 per person for dinner and $22 per person for breakfast. Staff was friendly and helpful when directing us to local restaurants that weren't on Waikiki's "miracle mile". All in all, the hotel was probably in line with all the other hotels in Waikiki trying to wring every last dime out of the tourists on the island.

I stayed for 7 nights and the beds were very clean and so comfy. Best nights sleeping in a long time. Location was great. Right aside of the International Market Place and right across the road from the beach. Great value for price paid. I was upgraded to a City view room which to my delight also was a partial view of the ocean. There are all kinds of shopping available in walking distance. Both high and low end shopping. Bus lines and trolly just a block. Free entertainment every night by the pool. Pool was never too crowded and was cleaned daily. All the staff treated me very well. The room was kept really clean. Beach is right across the street. Access the beach from the hotel across the street. I didn't eat there but the food looked great. Free internet access from lobby area. Nice flat screen TV in room as well as coffee maker and small refrig. I would highly recommend staying here if you do not want to pay high prices and still was close access to shopping, beach, and night life. Great value for the price. There are many very reasonable eating place within walking distance. If you are hungry for pizza, try the Rock Island Cafe across the street from hotel. Great pizza. The hotel is not new but it was very clean and had a wonderful staff taking care of everyone. I would highly recommend this hotel to save money on your trip.

Arrived for a short unwinding break before a cruise and for a few days stay post cruise. Our first session was in the older part of the building , pleasant but noisy. Double glazing would have cut the noise level down considerably especially from the main street just a few yards away. Noise from within was just as intrusive with a remarkable amount from adjoining rooms. As for the polystyren beakers supplied with the coffee machine, definately third world. On the plus side the staff , especially at the reception desk were pleasant,polite and helpful. Overal I would say good but could be a lot better

We stayed in total for five nights here. The first two nights (prior to cruise) were in the main but older wing overlooking the pool and with a view of the sea; the final three nights in the newer wing overlooking the international market with other rooftops. The rooms were comfortable and perfectly adequate but I was surprised how noisy it was. Obviously I would expect a fair amount of noise from being in the heart of a busy Waikiki beach area but I would have expected some adequate double glazing to cut out most of the noise at least and I was also suprised how much noise could be heard from adjoining rooms ie television and loud conversation etc. However on the plus side the front of house staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful.

Right in the heart of Waikiki, this older hotel may have seen been better days, but we had no complaints. The staff was helpful and friendly, especially with arranging for a hospitality room for an hour so we could shower before our late flight. The poolside entertainer on a Saturday night was very talented and entertaining.

Pros: NICE location, across the street from the beach and International Market is just right next door, room is quiet, bed is very comfortable, customer service is good and fast, the pool is beautiful.Cons: The pillow is too soft (at least for us), room is kind of small, guest parking is $20 per day, TV is the old CRT model.Overall good value, I did get a discounted rate so no complain there.

This hotel is across the street from Waikiki beach and next to the International Market Place. It was reasonable prices and a nice quite place to stay. We picked a room with a Diamond view and partial beach view. It is a bit older, but that being said they maintain it well. The room service (for the 4th meal) was incredible. I loved the spaghetti. I can't wait to go back and stay at this hotel. It is so close to everything and the staff is truly amazing and helps you plan things and book them for you. Oh and there is also a Cheese Cake Factory close by to walk to. Yummy

We stayed in the older part of the hotel facing King's Village. Service is very good. Check-in was fast. Maybe because we arrived around 8pm-ish. Concierge is very helpful. Phone calls in room are a bit expensive costing $1.50 a call. We booked the hotel with priceline and got a deal for $85 USD a night. Rooms have paper thin walls. We got a fruit basket the following morning from the hotel manager. That was very nice of him. The basket included an orange, 2 apples, half a pineapple, half a papaya, a kiwi, red grapes and a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts. Not sure if beds were that clean. I got 2 flea bites on my leg and my boyfriend got one. Hotel is very central. It's pretty much in the middle of the main Waikiki strip. It's 1 block away from a place called Blazin' Steaks. We ate there 3 times. $6 for 8 oz steak, 2 large scoops of rice and salad. Can also choose from chicken or fish. Good deal!! Hotel is a bit old. We had an old school CRT TV, but an oldie is a goodie. Lots of great channels. Nice balcony. I would give the carpet a 3/5 for cleanliness. That was all very random. Overall I had a great time at this hotel. The bar/lounge is not bad. We had a nice bartender and Fridays are karaoke nights with 1 local who is a regular and a horrible singer.

My wife and I stayed in the older wing of the PK. The room was rather quite small though came with a queen size bed. Biggest complaint was the musty smell we had to endure which came from the century old air conditioner. My in-laws, staying down the hallway from us had their filter changed because of a similar problem. This was definitely the factor that led to me catching a cold, which is odd when it's +27C outside.Location is alright. Not on Waikiki beach, but a short walk away. Close to bus stops for easy access to the rest of the city. The hotel has free internet in the lobby, but of course has wireless access for a pricey fee. Not a big deal, since you don't come to Hawaii to surf the internet but rather the waves! Pool was ok...My closing thought, is that it's an average hotel, but if you insist on staying there, ask for a room in the newer renovated part of the hotel. Staying at the PK is like taking a trip back in time to the 1970's - 80's.

After taking the virtual tour on-line it was like we were at home when we arrived at the hotel. Easy check-in, very pleasant and helpful. We were at the Princess eleven days.Our waitress (Debbie) at the pool area was awesome. She was just like a part of our family. The food was really good and large portions. Drinks were reasonable.Pool area was alway clean and set for the guests. Loved the entertainment each day around the pool area.The buffett dinner was excellent and the entertainmnent during dinner was impressive.The rooms were always clean. Great view from our room on the 8th floor. We could see the ocean - Diamond Head - pool area and everyone on the streets. Liked the activities that were offered in the lobby area during the day.Being close to the beach - shops - Internatioanl Market was great. The Princess even suggested a place to get my hair cut while I was there.Check-out was easy. Having a computer in the lobby to let you print out boarding passes was a real plus.We are really glad that AlohaVacations.com had us stay at the Princess. Would stay there agian! Thanks for the great memories!!!!!!

We were really worried about this hotel because we got such a cheap deal, but the room was great and the view was amazing!
